164	u.s. army staff sergeant don nicholas, a vietnam war veteran and former marine rifleman, is currently serving on the front lines in afghanistan despite approaching his 60th birthday, which will lead to his retirement due to age restrictions. despite this, nicholas is determined to re-enlist to continue serving his country and keeps fighting to keep young soldiers from harm. having served for 16 years across three wars, nicholas, a ohio-based podiatrist, joined the army in 2004 as a psychological-operations unit member and has been deployed to afghanistan twice since. he feels a call to duty, not from an obsession with war, but wanting to save lives and protect young soldiers from the battlefield. however, pentagon regulations mandate his retirement in july. he is currently trying to receive a commission in the army medical branch to extend his military career.
165	nigerian president goodluck jonathan spoke about the ongoing efforts to rescue over 200 schoolgirls abducted by militants, acknowledging that officials don't know their whereabouts. he criticized the parents for not fully cooperating with police in identifying the missing girls. protesters gathered in london, washington, los angeles, and other cities, demanding the girls' safe return using the #bringbackourgirls campaign. u.s. secretary of state john kerry urged nigeria's government to intensify efforts to find the girls, who were kidnapped by the islamist militant group boko haram in late april. the group, which opposes western education for women, especially targets schools in northeastern nigeria. over 220 girls remain missing after at least 53 escaped or were freed. protests and global campaigns continue to pressure nigerian authorities to act.
166	a group of customers and co-workers at a raleigh, north carolina bruegger's bagels surprised their long-time employee, shirley ratliff, with a christmas gift she would never forget. shirley, who had been walking several miles every day to get to work and has been working at the shop since 2006, had tried to save money for a car but faced financial setbacks due to a previous cervical cancer diagnosis. customers, moved by her dedication and long commuting journey, formed a "shirley's fan club" and pooled their resources to purchase a 1992 buick lesabre for her as a gift. the group, including loyal customer david burton, presented the car and a gasoline card to shirley in front of fellow customers and co-workers. overwhelmed by the gesture, shirley expressed her gratitude, stating that this was the best christmas present she had ever received. the group's efforts to ease shirley's burden and make her daily commute more manageable left her feeling seen, appreciated, and grateful.
167	a photo taken in september 2010 in afghanistan showed a u.s. marine corps scout sniper team posing in front of a nazi ss flag. the marines confirmed the incident and stated that it had been addressed internally. however, former marines and advocacy groups were outraged, calling for a full investigation. the marines investigated and found that the use of the ss symbol was not racially motivated but meant to identify the team as scout snipers. the marines involved are no longer with the unit they were assigned to at the time. the military religious freedom foundation, an advocacy group, has reportedly sent a letter to the head of the marine corps and defense secretary leon panetta demanding action. the ss was the police and military force of the nazi party, known for its involvement in war crimes and the extermination of millions of jews and other undesirables. the marines are currently investigating another incident where marines urinated on taliban corpses.
168	michel escoto, a miami man, attempted to drown his 21-year-old wife wendy trapaga in a jacuzzi to collect her $1 million life insurance policy, but the plan failed when he couldn't keep her head underwater. the plan eventually turned into a murder as escoto choked and beat trapaga to death with a tire iron outside a warehouse. in the murder trial, prosecutors described escoto as a manipulative schemer who kept several ex-girlfriends and pressured trapaga into a rushed courthouse wedding while persuading her to get a life insurance policy. the star witness for the prosecution was escoto's ex-girlfriend, yolanda cerrillo, who claimed she helped plan and carry out the murder. cerrillo described the details of the plan, including grinding up painkillers to knock trapaga out and practicing how to drown her. jurors are currently deliberating on escoto's first-degree murder charge, who is facing life in prison. escoto represented himself for most of the trial but allowed stand-by counsel terry lenamon to deliver the defense's closing arguments. lenamon attacked the prosecution's case, describing it as exaggerated and over-dramatized. cerrillo is currently facing a $44 million wrongful death lawsuit in a civil case.
169	ashers, a bakery in northern ireland run by devout presbyterian couple colin and karen mcarthur and their son daniel, found themselves at the center of a controversy after refusing to bake a cake with the slogan "support gay marriage" and images of sesame street puppets bert and ernie for a municipal event. the order was rejected based on the mcarthurs' christian faith, leading to a barrage of abuse on social media and a potential prosecution by the equality commission of northern ireland (ecni) under the 2006 equality act. the mcarthurs, who have received support from thousands of people across the globe, maintain that they are not discriminating against gay people but rather rejecting the endorsement of gay marriage. the ecni has also threatened a printing company in the past for refusing to publish a gay magazine, sparking debates about the role of religious beliefs and discrimination in the equality legislation.
170	arsenal broke their pattern of losing to top-four rivals with a 2-0 win over manchester city, a result that could be a turning point in their stuttering season. arsene wenger implemented successful tactics with arsenal showing discipline and concentration, killing the game, and effectively using francis coquelin as a midfield enforcer. arsenal were less focused on possession and instead focused on counter-attacks, with olivier giroud as a target for long balls from goalkeeper david ospina. the team's efficiency in the counter-attacks resulted in two goals despite having just 35% of possession.
171	in september 2012, cocktail waitress shauna tiaffay was found dead at her las vegas home with severe head injuries. initially, police believed it was a botched burglary, but soon after, they charged her estranged husband, george tiaffay, with her murder. police allege that tiaffay hired his longtime friend and vagrant, noel 'greyhound' stevens, to carry out the attack. stevens was arrested after someone reported him for killing a woman for $600. investigators found several of shauna's clothes and a replica key to her apartment at stevens' campsites, as well as evidence of their communication through phone records and surveillance footage. both tiaffay and stevens are facing charges, including conspiracy to commit murder and robbery with a deadly weapon.
172	camille paglia, a professor and author, wrote an op-ed for time criticizing college women for their naivety towards men's potential for evil, citing the recent abduction of hannah graham as an example. she argues that the focus on campus sexual assault is overblown and that that the true danger is ancient sex crimes, such as abduction and murder. paglia believes that women's modern freedoms require personal responsibility for vigilance and self-defense, and that man's violent instincts cannot be tamed with college initiatives or well-meaning speeches. she criticizes educators for sanitizing history and leading women to believe that man's sexual desires can be controlled. paglia is known for her controversial views and has previously argued that human nature has an inherently dangerous aspect, especially with regards to sexuality.
173	trade minister and former hsbc chairman lord green faced intense scrutiny last night after an email revealed that he was warned about money laundering at hsbc in 2005. the email from hsbc's former compliance chief, david bagley, alleged that staff in the mexican subsidiary forged documents to deceive local regulators about the division's anti-money laundering measures. labour leader ed miliband demanded that lord green appear in the house of lords to answer questions, but the urgency question was rejected by the lords speaker. labour sources vowed to try again, with baroness royall writing to her opposite number, lord strathclyde, insisting that lord green attend. the scandal involves hsbc's links to drug gangs, terrorist organisations, and banks linked to terrorism, as well as breaches of us sanctions. the us senate probe found that hsbc's inability to prevent money laundering was so concern that regulators ordered it to strengthen its controls in 2010. labour accused lord green, who left hsbc in 2006 and now advises chancellor george osborne on banking, of having "serious questions to answer." miliband also called out the conflicting standards between the recessing house of commons and the still-sitting house of lords, urging lord green to answer questions there. the downing street source confirmed that cameron is supporting lord green and there is no intention for him to resign as a trade minister.
174	ben hooper, a 35-year-old father, is set to swim 2,000 miles across the atlantic ocean from dakar, senegal to natal, northern brazil, in under two months starting on november 1, 2015. he will swim for 12 hours a day in two six-hour blocks and sleep aboard a boat overnight. hooper, who gave up his psychology study to take up the challenge, hopes to consume up to 12,000 calories per day and face temperatures of around 20-30 degrees and currents of 1-7 knots. he will wear a special suit to protect himself from the sun and potential hazards such as jellyfish and sharks. the entire journey will be streamed online, making it the first transparent ocean swim documented in history. hooper has been training for over a year and will be raising money for three charities: sos children, maggie’s cancer care centre, and addaction. his journey may be the first to be made into a documentary. other swimmers, including benoît lecomte, have previously claimed to have swum the atlantic ocean, but hooper emphasizes the transparency of his swim through live streaming.
175	a stray cat in varna, bulgaria, has caused a stir in the black sea resort town due to its emerald-green color. locals assumed the cat was a victim of animal cruelty and started a facebook group calling for vandals to be punished. however, it has been revealed that the cat gets its green hue from sleeping on an abandoned heap of synthetic green paint. the royal society for the prevention of cruelty to animals (rspca) warned against dyeing or painting animals for cosmetic reasons as it could have "potentially fatal consequences." a video of the cat playing with a ginger cat has been circulating on social media, highlighting the contrast in their coats.
176	daniel traub, a photographer based in brooklyn, new york, grew up in north philadelphia alongside his artist mother who transformed vacant lots into art parks. after working 10 years in china documenting economic divides, traub returned to north philadelphia, drawn to its complexity and hidden richness. he spent years photographing the area using a large-format camera, focusing on local churches and black communities. while his personal connection to the neighborhood stemmed from his mother's renewal project, he was less interested in making a social statement and instead sought to explore the place itself. traub's book, "north philadelphia," showcases the resilience and possibility of this marginalized community. his work has been featured on social media through @cnnphotos on twitter. the project reflected his fascination with the dualities of neglect and potential in the area. traub's multicultural heritage fueled his curiosity about north philadelphia's african-american and hispanic populations, but he focused on documenting the experiences of the largely african-american communities where his mother's projects took root. his previous project in china had examined the contradictions between newly prosperous cities and the workers' poverty. upon his return to the u.s., he planned to explore economic divides stateside, but he ultimately settled on north philadelphia where he felt a personal connection.
177	a 37-year-old female patient accused roy anthony jones, 30, of raping her at virginia hospital center in arlington on january 13. jones, a ct scan technician, was charged with sexually assaulting the victim in the hospital's imaging center. hospital spokeswoman maryanne booster confirmed jones has been fired. he is being held without bond at the arlington county detention facility, awaiting arraignment this week. the victim reported the assault after returning to the emergency room. arlington police arrested jones yesterday, and dna evidence was used to make the identification. jones has a history of misdemeanor charges. hospital staff cooperated fully with the investigation.
178	protestors in cairo clashed with egyptian security forces on tuesday, leading to dozens of arrests and widespread criticism. two small demonstrations took place, one against military trials of civilians and another in memory of a man killed by police last year. activists reported that riot police used excessive force, including beatings and tear gas, to disperse the crowds. prominent youth activists were among those arrested and chose to turn themselves in as a sign of solidarity. the new protest law, which requires organizers to seek permission from authorities before gathering, was implemented the previous day, leading to concerns about further crackdowns on dissent. activists vowed to continue protesting despite the new law, citing the sacrifices made for the right to free speech and assembly. several female detainees were reportedly mistreated and dumped in the desert upon release.
179	a 12-year-old boy named jordan green from harrogate, north yorks, took his own life by hanging himself at home. his mother, heidi green, discovered his body at their mid-terrace house in duncan street on wednesday, march 23, at 9:20 am. tributes have been pouring in from jordan's classmates, who have set up facebook memory pages in his honor. jordan was an only child, and his father lives elsewhere in harrogate. he was a passionate art lover and also enjoyed horses. counseling and a special tribute room have been arranged at harrogate high school, where jordan was a year 7 student. an investigation into jordan's death has been launched by north yorkshire police, who confirmed that it is not being treated as suspicious. anyone in need of confidential support on suicide matters can contact the samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit their local branch.
180	shona sibary recalls an incident from her childhood when her father favored her best friend, marnie, during a running race, leading to shona's feelings of anger and jealousy. her father's attention towards her friends continued throughout her childhood and adolescence, making her uncomfortable as he belittled her and made her the butt of his jokes, resulting in her friends siding with him. when shona was 18, her father began openly flirting with one of her friends, which led to the end of their friendship. later, shona discovered that they had slept together, and despite their apologies, she felt deeply betrayed and couldn't forgive them. now, as a mother of teenage daughters herself, shona is more aware of how her own husband behaves around her daughters' friends and is relieved that he pays little attention to them. she cautions against the advice given in a tatler article encouraging teenage girls to flirt with their friends' fathers, emphasizing the importance of preserving the bond between female friends.
181	liverpool aims to improve their record of only two wins in 14 matches against arsenal when they host the gunners at anfield on sunday. both teams have faced pressure early in the season, with liverpool missing key strikers luis suarez and daniel sturridge. arsenal has had mixed results, but have historically performed well at anfield. the two teams have shared some dramatic encounters, with arsenal winning three out of their last four visits to anfield, including the famous 4-4 draw in 2009. fans are eagerly anticipating this premier league clash, with a liverpool win being the most likely outcome according to sports analysts bloomberg sports.
182	the texas rangers announced on tuesday that they will raise the height of railings at rangers ballpark in arlington following the fatal fall of a 39-year-old fan who died trying to catch a ball during a july 7 game. despite current railings exceeding code, the team plans to increase rail heights to the highest standard in the us. interim measures include new signs reminding fans not to lean on the rails and warning announcements prior to games. the decision comes after the death of shannon stone, a firefighter and rangers fan, who fell about 20 feet and succumbed to head injuries. another fan survived a fall in 2010 from a similar height. the rangers' ceo, nolan ryan, emphasized ensuring fan safety as a top priority.
183	deputy prime minister nick clegg and his wife miriam faced a dispute over paying for thousands of pounds worth of food and drinks bills at their official residence, chevening, in kent. the dispute arose from private entertaining events where clegg refused to pay, leading to protests from edward barham, vice-chairman of the chevening trust. the disagreement resulted in taxpayers covering part of the bill, with clegg paying the majority. both clegg and his wife have been using chevening, which has 115 rooms, for free when conducting official business, but are required to pay for private events. the precise amounts paid by the taxpayer and clegg have not been disclosed. the dispute came to light after a formal complaint by barham to lord privy seal andrew lansley, and was widely reported in the media. clegg has since insisted he paid his bills in full.
184	young girls dakota rose and venus palermo have gained internet fame for resembling living dolls, with dakota being particularly popular in asia due to her barbie-inspired style. in most of their videos, they remain silent while providing step-by-step tutorials on fashion, beauty, and hairstyling. some critics worry about the potential negative impacts of emphasizing physical appearance at a young age and the possibility of encouraging the sexualization of children. both girls remain committed to their look, with dakota's mother approving of her preference for frilly clothes. the trend for doll-like features has been ongoing in asia for over a decade, with some women going to great lengths to transform themselves. critics have expressed concern regarding the potential influence on young girls and the potential for encouraging unrealistic beauty standards.
185	president barack obama paid a brief visit to his grandfather's grave at the national memorial cemetery of the pacific during his hawaii vacation on january 2, 2014. the visit lasted only four minutes, and was followed by a private tour of the honolulu zoo for obama and his daughters malia and sasha. the first family was driven from their vacation home for the cemetery visit, which took 30 minutes according to the white house pool report. second world war veteran stanley dunham, who helped raise obama, is buried at the cemetery. previously, obama was seen playing golf with new zealand prime minister john key at a military base on oahu. obama generally plays golf with close friends and advisors, but key is now one of the few foreign leaders to have played with him. the two leaders were joined by key's teenage son and obama's personal aide for the round. media access to obama's golf outings is usually restricted, but reporters and photographers were allowed to briefly watch the leaders play. obama has played eight rounds of golf during his hawaii vacation.
186	nine-year-old caoimhe preshur, a schoolgirl from oldham, saved a 10-year-old boy named thomas from drowning in a freezing canal in sheffield during a canal boating holiday. she heard thomas' screams and immediately jumped into the cold water, holding him above water until family members arrived. her quick thoughts and good swimming skills prevented thomas from drowning. caoimhe's mother, abi bown, was proud of her and ensured both children were warmed up. school officials praised her bravery and caoimhe herself remained humble, saying she was only concentrating on preventing the boy from drowning. thomas later thanked caoimhe for saving his life.
187	an unemployed man named shane spong, 26, refused to turn off a light for his bed-bound mother and instead asked his brother craig to come over to his house to do it. when craig arrived, the two brothers got into a heated argument over shane's lazy lifestyle, leading to a physical altercation. during the confrontation, shane picked up a kitchen knife and assaulted his brother, causing him a cut on the head. shane claimed he acted in self-defense but was charged with assault causing actual bodily harm. the court heard that shane spent much of his time online and lived an anti-social lifestyle. judge christopher critchlow expressed astonishment over the incident and handed down a suspended sentence, warning shane to avoid further fights with his brother.
188	british jeweler stuart hughes has created a new ultra-luxurious product: a £5 million (~$8 million) iphone 4 encrusted with over 600 diamonds. the handmade bezel holds approximately 500 flawless diamonds totaling over 100 carats, with an additional 53 diamonds featuring on the back. the main navigation button is made of platinum and houses a single cut 7.4 carat pink diamond. only two of these exclusive designs will be produced, ensuring buyers' exclusivity at expensive events.
189	in calais, france, authorities cleared a migrant camp by force, leaving over a thousand people homeless and determined to reach britain. the camp, which had existed for months, was destroyed in less than two hours, with migrants and their possessions being driven back with shields and batons. the authorities claimed the action was necessary due to an outbreak of scabies, but the migrants saw it as an attempt to end the controversy surrounding their presence. despite the destruction of their camp, the migrants expressed their determination to continue their journey to britain, seeing it as their last hope for a new life. the cycle of arrests, deportations, and harsh conditions had failed to stop the immigration merry-go-round, and calais was expected to once again become a magnet for those seeking to reach the uk. charities and support groups provided food, water, and shelter for the displaced, but the migrants' resolve remained strong, and they were already making plans to return to the area.
190	everton's romelu lukaku put in a stand-out performance in the europa league, scoring a hat-trick in a 4-1 win over young boys, as everton took a commanding lead in the europa league tie. lukaku's commitment to the toffees was highlighted by everton boss roberto martinez, who played down recent comments from the striker about wanting to play for a 'top club' again. martinez praised lukaku, who was quoted last week expressing a desire to return to a top club, for his love and commitment to everton. despite struggles in the premier league, everton have flourished in europe and overturned an early goal to secure a comfortable victory. defender john stones was sent off, but everton's tactical awareness and resilience shone through, as they looked poised for a strong finish to the competition. young boys' uli forte claimed two of everton's goals should have been disallowed for offside and expressed disappointment at losing control of the game. everton midfielder james mccarthy went off injured during the game, but martinez dismissed suggestions that the injury was caused by the artificial pitch.
191	thousands of gravestones of british and canadian soldiers who died in the liberation of france during world war ii, including those at the cemeteries in bayeux, cinthaux, and ranville, are in need of repair or replacement ahead of the 70th anniversary of d-day. the distinctive white limestone headstones have not been replaced since the end of the war and are now in poor condition, making it impossible to read the soldier's name, regiment insignia, date of death, age, and religion. the queen is expected to attend the commemorations in france next year, and many of the headstones will be destroyed and replaced with marble-like ones from italy. the work is being carried out by french and belgian companies, and the commonwealth war graves commission is responsible for over 3,000 cemeteries in france, with the british government providing most of its budget. the first village to be liberated from the nazis on d-day was ranville, which was freed by the british 13th parachute battalion.
192	pamela young, the mother of a man with asperger's syndrome who was killed with a single punch, criticized the "soft touch" justice system after the court of appeal upheld the four-year sentence for lewis gill, the 21-year-old attacker. young's son, andrew young, died from injuries sustained in an unprovoked attack in bournemouth last november. gill, who has a past criminal record and is a trained boxer, was initially given a four-year term for manslaughter, but the attorney general referred the sentence to the court of appeal due to public concern over its leniency. three senior judges rejected this challenge and maintained that the sentence was reasonable. young expressed disappointment and outrage over the decision, stressing that justice had not been served in her son's case. the incident received widespread media attention and sparked public anger, leading the justice secretary, chris grayling, to announce a full review of manslaughter sentencing guidelines.
193	emotional eating is a common issue where individuals turn to comfort food for emotional reasons, with up to 70% of people engaging in it to some extent. approximately 90% of diets fail due to the return of emotional eating habits. the roots of emotional eating often date back to childhood, where food may have been used as a way to cope with emotional upset or stress. dr. pam spurr suggests becoming aware of emotional eating triggers and developing mindfulness to help overcome this pattern. her book, "the emotional eater's diet," offers strategies for managing emotional eating by focusing on the present moment, avoiding unhealthy snacks, and planning alternate responses to stress. the first step to conquering emotional eating is acknowledging its presence and taking a one-day-at-a-time approach to change. avoid autopilot eating and practice mindful eating by appreciating the moment and savoring each bite.
194	tory ministers maria miller and chris grayling are considering decriminalizing tv licence fee evasion, making it a civil matter instead of a criminal offense. around 180,000 cases related to non-payment end up before magistrates each year, with 155,000 people fined and 70 sent to prison. backbench mps are also supporting decriminalization through the deregulation bill. the bbc is likely to resist this change due to the funding cuts they have already faced and the fear of increased evasion leading to financial losses. chris grayling believes non-payment should be treated like parking tickets and has gained the support of 101 mps. however, culture secretary maria miller may prefer to wait for the upcoming negotiations over the bbc's charter review. a bbc spokesman warns that changing the law could lead to higher evasion and significant financial losses.
195	the police federation chairman, steve white, criticized the government's claims that crime is falling, stating that many crimes go unreported because victims feel nothing will be done. he also condemned the head of the police watchdog for suggesting that police may prioritize more serious offenses over less serious ones. white, who represents over 130,000 rank-and-file officers, highlighted his personal experience when his daughter was a victim of crime and did not report it due to a lack of faith in the police response. the watchdog responded by calling white's comments "regrettably intemperate and wholly misconceived," but agreed that the police need to work smarter due to budget cuts. the ongoing budget cuts have led to over 30,000 officer and staff losses and further job losses are expected. the police watchdog also criticized forces for using outdated methods to deal with modern-day crimes and failing to investigate crimes properly, particularly in larger cities.
196	abu hamza, a radical cleric found guilty on terror charges by a new york federal jury, is likely to spend the rest of his life in a high-security prison. however, stopping high-profile extremist preachers is not enough, as challenging extremist narratives, ideas, and propaganda is necessary to prevent the next generation of extremist preachers from emerging. during the 1980s and early 1990s, extremist preachers like abu hamza played a significant role in recruiting and propagating al-qaeda's worldview to young muslims in europe and north america. though many key extremist preachers have been arrested or deported, extremist narratives continue to be disseminated. to tackle extremism, universities and colleges must not host extremist preachers without a challenge, prisoners need mentoring and support, and online extremism must be countered with counter-arguments. arresting key individuals or shutting down extremist websites are not long-term solutions. extreme islamism relies on a simplistic framework, portraying a west versus islam or muslim versus non-muslim conflict. debunking this framework and revealing the selective nature of extremist arguments is crucial. young people will lose interest in extremism when it becomes unfashionable, but offering alternative narratives and promoting national and regional identity are necessary for this to occur.
197	england international goalkeeper jack butland is joining championship side derby county on loan from stoke city to gain more playing time, following an injury to derby's regular number one, lee grant. butland has found limited opportunities at stoke with asmir begovic as the first-choice keeper. he is expected to make his derby debut against blackpool on tuesday, with derby manager steve mcclaren expressing enthusiasm for butland's arrival and appreciating stoke's cooperation in the deal. meanwhile, stoke teammate andy wilkinson is moving to millwall on a 93-day loan, with recalls for both players after the first month.
198	in this cnn article, maria cardona emphasizes the significance of president barack obama's 2013 budget for the latino community, focusing on income equality, job creation, and environmental protections. the budget's call for greater income equality, particularly in taxes, and its focus on key elements of the american jobs act, resonates with the community. additionally, the renewed push for the dream act and the commitment to expanding clean energy jobs aligns with latino priorities. despite historically high unemployment rates and a shift in concerns towards environmental issues, obama's budget reflects the interconnectedness of a healthy economy and environment, contrasting republican views that regulations are job killers. the article highlights the growing opportunities in the clean energy sector and its potential impact on latino communities, particularly in construction and entrepreneurship. overall, cardona argues that obama's budget stands out as a reminder of the importance of prioritizing public health, jobs, and environmental sustainability in the face of political debates and polarizing opinions.
199	anders behring breivik, the norwegian mass shooter, expressed joy and shouted "woo-hoo" as he carried out the utoya island massacre last year, witnesses testified at his trial on may 9, 2012. survivors recalled their panic and attempts to hide during the rampage. ms. tonje brenna, a labor party youth member, described seeking shelter and attempting to save injured victims. witnesses also testified that breivik disguised himself as a policeman to deceive his victims. the trial continues with the key issue being breivik's mental state. he faces up to 21 years in prison if found sane, or compulsory psychiatric care if deemed insane. the trial is expected to last until the end of june.
200	maria sharapova advanced to the french open semifinals for the third time, setting up a showdown against petra kvitova. sharapova, the world no. 2 and three-time major champion, defeated kaia kanepi in straight sets, while kvitova overcame qualifier yaroslava shvedova in three sets. both players have one grand slam title each, with sharapova winning at wimbledon and the us open, while kvitova claimed her only major at wimbledon last year against sharapova in the final. sharapova broke kanepi seven times and admitted she was a tough opponent, while kanepi said she couldn't keep up with sharapova's power. in the other semifinal, samantha stosur, the no. 6 seed, will face sara errani, the no. 21 seed. neither player has won a major title, and this will be their first meeting at a grand slam event.
201	a group of muslim american and christian leaders, including cardinal theodore mccarrick and bishop john bryson chane, visited iran from january 23 to 29 at the invitation of president mahmoud ahmadinejad to foster interfaith ties and ask for the release of american hikers shane bauer and josh fattal. the delegation's efforts were described as helpful and important by iranian authorities, who have indicated the hikers will be released on humanitarian grounds. bauer, fattal, and a third hiker, sarah shourd, were arrested in july 2009 and accused of espionage. they have maintained their innocence and are serving time in tehran's evin prison. the leaders also met with family members of iranians held in the united states and discussed improving efforts to secure their freedom. previous efforts to secure the hikers' release included letters to ahmadinejad and a public appeal from boxing legend muhammad ali.
202	martin gilbert, a 48-year-old burglar from newcastle, was arrested and put back in prison just six months after publicly apologizing for his past crimes and promising to turn over a new leaf. in june 2021, gilbert met one of his victims, christine bell, who he had burgled twice, and expressed remorse, vowing never to offend again. however, despite his apology, gilbert re-offended, stealing jewellery and valuables from five houses and a church, with some victims being in their 80s. he was caught on cctv, and in november and december 2021, he committed six burglaries. in court this week, gilbert pleaded guilty to the offenses and acknowledged that he is a repetitive burglar, and a jail term is inevitable. he was previously jailed for three and a half years in 2011 for a burglary spree, where he stole over £30,000 worth of items, mostly from elderly people's bungalows during the day. christine bell, who was introduced to gilbert during a restorative justice program, expressed disappointment in his actions. gilbert's sentencing is scheduled for later this month, and the judge warned him that more time behind bars is inevitable.
203	warren jeffs, a polygamist sect leader, was convicted of sexually assaulting two underage girls in texas and faced sentencing. during the trial's sentencing phase, his nephew brent jeffs testified that his uncle had sexually abused him when he was five years old. three jurors reportedly tears as they listened to brent's emotional testimony. jeffs was not charged with abusing his nephew, but they reached a settlement in a 2003 lawsuit. texas ranger jesse valdez and former flds member ezra draper also testified about documents seized during a 2008 raid on a church ranch and witnesses being summoned to jeffs' office for lectures. prosecutors warned the jury to expect more damning evidence including the fact that jeffs had 78 wives, some of whom were underage. jeffs represented himself during the trial but walked out of the sentencing in protest and was holding underage church members as "wives." shocking pictures emerged of jeffs kissing an underage girl. the sentencing hearing included testimony from utah psychologist larry beall, who described jeffs' grooming of the underage girls. jeffs asked to be taken back to jail but was instead placed in a room near the court and allowed to return whenever he chose. prosecutors plan to call witnesses and introduce evidence showing jeffs committed a slew of crimes not mentioned during his trial, including more sexual assaults and polygamist marriages involving underage girls.
204	mexican authorities have dismantled a drug trafficking operation after discovering around 50 kilos of cannabis hidden in the crowns of straw hats destined for chicago. the drugs were concealed with coffee grounds and cinnamon to avoid detection by sniffer dogs. the tip-off about the operation led police to a courier warehouse in tlaquepaque, jalisco, where they found four boxes containing 100 packages of cannabis. the investigation is ongoing to identify the sender and recipient of the drugs.
205	israeli soldiers who returned from the gaza strip have made accusations in a newspaper that they were given orders to treat the area as a free-fire zone during the military campaign, "operation cast lead," which resulted in the deaths of around 1,300 palestinians. lt. gen. gabi ashkenazi, the israeli chief of staff, dismissed these claims and defended the israeli defense forces as a moral army during a speech on february 1, 2009. some soldiers interviewed by haaretz reportedly expressed confusion about rules of engagement and described incidents of palestinians being shot in their homes. the israeli military has launched an investigation into the soldiers' allegations. some israeli human rights groups have called for an independent investigative body to examine the military's actions during the campaign in light of the distressing accounts from soldiers and palestinians. prime minister ehud barak and mark regev, the israeli government spokesman, have defended the army's moral conduct. the soldiers' accusations were passed on to ashkenazi by danny zamir, the head of the pre-military program at oranim academic college.
206	two south florida law enforcement officers are under investigation after cell phone footage showed them mistreating arrestees. in the first incident, fort lauderdale police officer victor ramirez was recorded pushing and slapping a homeless man, bruce laclair, during an arrest for trespassing. ramirez is on leave and an investigation is ongoing. in the second incident, broward sheriff's deputy christopher johnson was caught dragging a mentally ill woman, whose shirt rode up during the struggle, through the courthouse by her leg restraints. johnson is on restricted duty and an investigation is underway. the treatment of both arrestees has been criticized as excessive and inappropriate by witnesses and advocates.
207	a melbourne woman, phoebe handsjuk, who fell to her death from a garbage chute in 2010 was in a state similar to sleepwalking due to alcohol and sleeping pills, according to a coroner's report. handsjuk, 24, who lived with her partner, an tony hampel, 44, in a luxury st kilda road unit complex, had a history of depression, suicidal thoughts, and alcohol abuse. on the night of her death, she had taken stilnox and consumed alcohol. coroner peter white determined that handsjuk was not in a suicidal state but was in an unconscious or confused state when she climbed into the garbage chute. he explained that she had likely put a bag of rubbish in the chute first before climbing in, suffering a severe injury to her lower right leg as a result. white also noted that her body had shown signs of a struggle, but there was no evidence of foul play. white recommended reducing the dosage of stilnox for female patients and making it only available in 5mg tablets in australia. handsjuk's family had previously rejected the suicide finding, with her grandfather suggesting she was killed by someone. her family described her as sensitive, caring, compassionate, artistically gifted, and quick-tempered on a tribute website. her partner, antony hampel, said he hoped the investigation would allow handsjuk to rest in peace.
208	cnn reports that businesses do not necessarily need commercial office spaces, warehouses, or factory facilities to succeed. in fact, many successful businesses, including grammy award-winning musicians outkast and tech giants apple, google, and microsoft, began as home-based operations. additionally, culinary star paula deen initiated her media empire by preparing bag lunches in her own kitchen. other notable examples of homegrown businesses can be found in the article.
209	boca juniors are interested in signing dani osvaldo from southampton, who is currently on loan at inter milan. osvaldo has scored six goals in 13 games with inter. southampton paid £12.6million for him in 2013, but he spent part of last season on loan at juventus, and inter have an option to make the deal permanent after this loan. osvaldo expressed his desire to leave southampton earlier this season and boca's interest could lead to an auction for his services. osvaldo's last goal came in inter's defeat against roma, with inter currently sitting 11th in the serie a table.
210	the great barrier reef in australia is under threat due to the approval of dredging and dumping of three million cubic metres of spoil at the abbot point coal port by the great barrier reef marine park authority, according to a former high-ranking officer. jon day, who used to be the director of conservation and biodiversity at the authority, expressed concern about the decision, stating that it goes against the long-term protection and conservation of the reef's values. critics argue that alternatives, such as dumping on land or extending port trestles, were not properly considered. the world heritage committee, which may declare the reef a "danger" next year, has criticized the decision. federal environment minister greg hunt, who approved the dumping, believes tougher environmental conditions were put in place to ensure safety. however, there are doubts among experts regarding the safety and impact of the decision on the already declining reef.
211	in the second debate of the closely contested new hampshire senate race, democratic incumbent jeanne shaheen accused republican challenger scott brown of "fear-mongering" on issues such as ebola, isis, and more. brown countered that his concerns were "rational fears" shared by the majority of americans. a cnn/orc international poll showed the race to be a dead heat, with shaheen holding a narrow lead of 49% to brown's 47%. the debate focused on various topics, including the ebola threat, the handling of the border crisis, and economic issues. shaheen criticized brown for trying to nationalize the debate and linking her to president obama, whose approval rating in new hampshire is at 39%. brown, meanwhile, accused shaheen of being out of touch with voters on key issues, particularly border security and the economy. shaheen accused brown of being a political opportunist and pandering to corporate interests, while brown accused her of being weak on immigration and not doing enough to secure the border. the candidates also sparred over foreign policy, with shaheen defending obama's handling of isis and brown accusing him of weak leadership. the debate ended with a deadlock, with both candidates trying to appeal to undecided voters and independent-minded new hampshire voters.
212	texas a&m university demolished the west side of kyle field stadium using explosives on sunday, november 27, to make way for a renovation project. the university aims to add an additional 2,500 seats to the 100,000-capacity stadium, with plans to include new suites, premium areas, the hall of champions, and an upgraded media area in the renovation, which is estimated to cost around $450 million. thousands of spectators gathered at a nearby parking lot to watch the demolition, which saw one of the stands collapse from inside the stadium after the explosives were detonated. construction is scheduled to be completed in time for the start of the 2015 football season. the aggies played their last home match of the season against louisiana state university on november 27, and their last home game of the season will be against west virginia on december 29 in memphis.
213	owasso city councillor chris kelley donated his kidney to a stranger, paul kropp, whom he had only met a few times. kropp, who was in renal failure and facing a wait of up to four years for a deceased donor, was saved by kelley's donation after his wife's social media post about his need for a living donor reached kelley, who felt an inexplicable urge to help. kelley, a spiritual man, made the selfless decision to donate his kidney despite potential risks, and the surgery was a success. both men are recovering and have developed a deep friendship. the city council praised kelley's act of selflessness and encouraged everyone to prioritize their health by getting regular check-ups.
214	thailand's economy, already dealing with political unrest, is experiencing a more significant impact as violent protests continue. finance minister korn chatikavanij estimates the protests have taken between 0.3% and 0.5% off thailand's gross domestic product (gdp) this year, with the potential to shave off up to 2% if they persist. violence during protests has resulted in deaths and critical injuries, prompting travel warnings from several governments and decreased tourism. the typically bustling bangkok area, home to over 10 million people and 1,700 shops and 10 hotels that are losing an estimated $6 million a day, has been significantly affected. while the economy is predicted to grow at least 4.5%, foreign investors have lost confidence due to the ongoing protests, resulting in a net sell-off of $714 million in the past week. business outside the immediate protest areas remains relatively unaffected.
215	stephanie houghton, a defender for arsenal ladies and the english national team, has become a sensation in women's football with her goal-scoring record at the olympics. despite earning only £16,000 a year and sharing a house with three girls, houghton remains focused on her sport rather than envying the lifestyles of her higher-paid male counterparts. after scoring the winning goal against brazil in front of a record audience of 70,000, houghton's following on twitter has surged to over 20,000, making her the new poster girl for women's football. the former shop assistant from county durham grew up idolizing male footballers and dreamed of playing professionally. her success at the olympics and meeting david beckham have been surprising and exciting for her, but she remains grounded and focused on her football career. houghton was the only girl on her primary school football team and was discovered by a talent scout at a sunderland fc coaching camp at the age of nine. she joined the academy and went on to play for leeds united and arsenal. her mother and family have been unwaveringly supportive of her career choice.
216	liverpool's raheem sterling scored twice, including in an unfamiliar center-forward role, as liverpool advanced to the capital one cup semi-finals with a win over bournemouth. despite being just 20 years old and discussing a new contract worth £70,000 per week, sterling has been receiving criticism and manager brendan rodgers praised his young star, comparing him to alexis sanchez. sterling had his hair shaven off and wore a headband, looking particularly young. bournemouth, currently leading the championship, put up a tough fight, with liverpool dominating possession and creating many chances. lazar markovic added the other goal for liverpool, while dejan lovren picked up a groan injury. bournemouth manager eddie howe was left disappointed by a phantom whistle that led to markovic's goal, with tommy elphick stopping in response, allowing liverpool to capitalize.
217	michael palin, a monty python star and travel documentary presenter, has expressed opposition to the planned opening of a costa coffee in the picturesque seaside resort of southwold, suffolk. palin, who has a personal connection to southwold as he fell in love with the town there and his parents retired there, feels that the town's unique harmony and distinctive character should be protected, fearing that the presence of a big chain like costa could lead to the loss of independent businesses and a change in character. the town, known for its upmarket holidaymakers and architectural beauty, has been used as a setting for numerous films and television programs, including the british drama "upstairs, downstairs." palin's comments follow a recent loss by campaigners to keep costa out of the high street. the town, which has a long literary history with writers such as george orwell and julie myerson, has been described as a "sleepy, slightly self-satisfied seaside town."
218	a 21-year-old university of north georgia student, kelsey rose salie, allegedly stole a six-year-old's ipad from chestatee elementary school in gainesville, georgia, where she was working as an unpaid intern. salie reportedly sold the device through her boyfriend's facebook account for $200 to buy christmas presents. the theft was discovered when the child's parents were contacted by the buyer, and the device was returned after salie's boyfriend realized it had been stolen. salie was arrested for misdemeanor theft and released on bond. she reportedly told authorities that she took the ipad from the child's backpack to get money for christmas gifts and used her boyfriend's account because he had more friends. the incident will be referred to a student conduct process and salie will not be suspended, but possible punishments range from a verbal warning to expulsion. jeniffer caracciolo, spokeswoman for forsyth county schools, and kate maine, director of university relations for the university of north georgia, expressed disappointment and regret regarding the situation, which is the first reported problem with interns from the university.
219	this article explores the world of men who have long-term relationships with realistic silicone love dolls, which can cost up to £1,000. the men were photographed by benita marcussen, who gained their trust over a year through online forums. some men keep their dolls as their sole companion, while others are married and keep them hidden from their families. the dolls vary in use, from collectors who have multiple dolls to those who see them as a replacement for lost loved ones or as sex toys. the article also touches on the manufacturing process of the dolls, which can take up to 80 hours and cost thousands of pounds. the men discussed in the article maintain that they are not under the illusion that the dolls are real women but value the companionship they provide. however, they often keep their relationships secret due to societal stigma. the dolls can be fragile and require careful handling, and owners may send them back to the factory for repairs.
220	president barack obama commemorated the 60th anniversary of the end of the korean war at the korean war veterans memorial in washington d.c. on saturday, paying tribute to the forgotten veterans and their families. he laid a wreath and spoke to around 5,000 veterans and family members. the war, which claimed over 36,000 american lives and left more than 103,000 wounded, ended with an armistice agreement in 1953, leaving the peninsula divided and tensions high. obama expressed commitment to finding the remains of missing veterans and giving their families closure. in contrast, north korea observed "victory day" with a military parade. obama praised the war as a victory, highlighting the contrast between the prosperity of south korea and the repression and poverty of north korea. obama was joined by secretary of defense chuck hagel, a vietnam war veteran, and representatives from both south korea and the us. obama and hagel emphasized the importance of supporting and caring for veterans.
221	jade jacobs-brooks, a 20-year-old woman from harlow, essex, has never officially existed due to not having a birth certificate. she was born in alicante, spain, in 1991 while her parents were on holiday but was never given a birth certificate by the spanish hospital. as a result, she hasn't been able to drive, travel abroad, vote, open a bank account, get a job, or even pick up a parcel from the post office. her lack of identification caused numerous problems as she grew older, including being unable to work or apply for university funding. despite writing to the queen and government for help, jade and her family received no response, and it took a four-and-a-half-year campaign by international law firm allen and overy to finally secure her a spanish birth certificate. jade is elated about the new possibilities this will open up for her and is looking forward to going on holiday and getting a real tan.
222	the bushfires in south australia and victoria have devastated native wildlife, leaving many injured and orphaned animals in need of care. the international fund for animal welfare (ifaw) is currently appealing for cotton pouches to help keep joeys warm and safe. vets and wildlife carers use these pouches to transport and care for injured animals year-round. the pouches are particularly important for the many joeys who have been separated from their mothers and require extra warmth and care. kangaroos, wallabies, possums, and other species have also been severely affected by the fires, with some suffering from scorched paws and legs. ifaw asks that pouches be sent to their sydney office and encourages international donors to support local initiatives instead. the pattern for sewing pouches can be found on the ifaw website, and there are five different sizes available. cotton pouches are also used to care for other injured native wildlife like possums and wombats.
223	the u.s. and south korean troops have begun a 10-day military exercise called "ulchi freedom guardian" around seoul, involving approximately 530,000 troops from south korea, the u.s., and seven other countries. the annual defense-oriented exercise includes computer-aided simulations, following heightened tensions with north korea, which has not been notified but has been informed. the korean war ended with an armistice, leaving the peninsula divided by the world's most fortified border. north korea, known for its secrecy and economic struggles, has tested nuclear weapons in 2006 and 2009, and tensions have recently escalated with border clashes and artillery duels. last week, south korea returned fire after northern gunners shot three rounds close to its maritime border, causing no casualties.
224	a trainee pilot and his instructor had a miraculous escape after their tucano trainer plane crashed-landed at raf linton-on-ouse in north yorkshire on january 9, 2013. the undercarriage failed to deploy during their approach to the runway, resulting in the plane suffering serious damage and coming to rest on grass. both men walked away unharmed, but the incident caused the runway to be closed and an investigation into the cause of the crash was launched. the tucano aircraft, which is driven by a propeller powered by a jet engine, is operated by the oldest flying training school in the world and is at least 20 years old. prince william has previously flown a tucano training aircraft from the airbase, and training was suspended following the incident, with the tucano fleet potentially grounded until further notice.
225	alex hales is set to be alastair cook's new opening partner for england's royal london series against india after being named in the 15-man squad. hales, who is in great form in county cricket and t20, will need to displace ian bell to secure the top spot. hales has been called up to the odi squad due to his impressive t20 performances for england. the squad, which will be missing stuart broad due to a long-term knee injury, also includes james anderson, despite speculation that he might need a rest after england's test series victory over india. hales became the first englishman to score an international t20 century against sri lanka.
226	a scottish daffodil farmer, mark clark, is expected to lose £300,000 due to an early blooming of his crops, which arrived at the same time as those in england. severe winter weather caused english crops to be two weeks late, while scottish crops were ready a week early, resulting in a market overflowing with flowers and plummeting prices. clark has struggled to recruit enough local workers due to the back-breaking nature of the job, despite high unemployment in scotland, and currently has only 100 of the 500 workers needed to harvest the crops. the weather conditions have brought the scottish and english picking seasons together, causing a saturated market and further financial losses for clark. his main competitors in lincolnshire and cornwall were delayed by cold weather, but even if the market weren't flooded, clark wouldn't have enough pickers due to most still being in the southern regions.
227	new year's day is expected to see a record number of gift returns, with more presents exchanged than any other day, according to a report by business analysts lcp consulting. around 29 million unwanted presents are being returned from online shops this year, worth an estimated £600 million. many returns will be made in person due to quicker refunds and the allure of sales. the trend of impulse buying during holidays like cyber monday contributes to the high number of gifts being returned. departments facing the highest return rates include high fashion. retailers are under pressure to be more efficient in handling returns to remain competitive. major shopping centers are opening long hours on new year's day, while some smaller shops remain closed. the average gift cost is around £20. the trend of returning gifts creates additional pressure for retailers to manage their refund process. some people may prefer to avoid the shops and the crowds, opting instead to enjoy the holiday at home.
228	ho chi minh city in vietnam attracts thousands of travelers for its colonial architecture, bustling river, and famous cuisine, but a new addition to its culinary scene is the opening of the first mcdonald's, which served over 400,000 people in its first month. the franchise is led by henry nguyen, the prime minister's son-in-law and a former teenager who worked at mcdonald's in the us. the grand opening on february 8 saw long lines and 22,500 customers in the first day, and the restaurant has sold over 61,980 big macs in its first 30 days. for many vietnamese, dining at mcdonald's is considered a treat due to the relatively high cost compared to the average wage. western food and drink companies, such as starbucks and kfc, have also entered vietnam following the relaxing of investment restrictions in 2013.
229	wisconsin governor scott walker is forming a new political organization and has hired veteran republican strategist rick wiley as his potential campaign manager for a possible 2016 presidential run. walker has been considering a bid for some time and has been actively building a political operation, reaching out to potential staffers and meeting with republican national committee members. wiley, who has previously worked on numerous presidential campaigns and advised walker during his gubernatorial races, is a native of the midwest and was once an advisor for the wisconsin republican party. he currently works at mercury llc, where chris christie's chief political strategist michael duhaime also works. walker has demonstrated political toughness in wisconsin, but some have suggested he needs to bring on advisers with more national experience to have a viable chances of winning the gop nomination.
230	search and rescue efforts were ongoing in the democratic republic of congo on sunday for approximately 100 people missing after a boat named the mv mobek sank on the congo river near maluku, part of the capital city of kinshasa, on friday night. the vessel was carrying several tons of merchandise and went down after hitting an obstacle, leaving at least nine people dead. maluku mayor papy epiana informed the united nations radio that the authorities do not have a copy of the ship's manifest, but believe around 100 people are unaccounted for, while over 200 survivors have been located. nine bodies have been recovered since the incident occurred. cnn reported this story with contributions from elwyn lopez in atlanta and greg botelho.
231	nine long-lost episodes of the british science fiction series "doctor who," featuring patrick troughton as the second doctor, have been discovered in a nigerian storage room after being traced from bbc records. the episodes, "the enemy of the world" and "the web of fear," were among 11 programs found at a television relay station and will be available for purchase on itunes and later on dvd. the discovery is especially exciting as only one episode of "the enemy of the world" had previously been found, leaving five episodes missing. the newly discovered episodes introduce alistair lethbridge-stewart, who later became known as the brigadier. despite the exciting find, 27 doctor who stories are still missing or have incomplete episodes. the discovered episodes include action-packed stories with elements of espionage and the supernatural, and features guest appearances from deborah watling and frazer hines, who played companions victoria and jamie, respectively. the episodes were shown at a special bbc event to celebrate the show's 50th anniversary on november 23.
232	america's largest reservoir, lake mead on the colorado river, is projected to reach its lowest level since it was filled nearly 80 years ago this week, at about 1,080 feet above sea level. the shrinking lake, a man-made lake formed by the hoover dam in 1937, has been losing water for over a decade due to drought and is currently at about 40 percent capacity. despite this, regional chief terry fulp of the us bureau of reclamation announced there will be no water restrictions for 40 million people across the southwest. lake mead, which stores about 10.2 million acre-feet of water, has lost around four trillion gallons of water in the past 14 years and is managed in conjunction with lake powell, another reservoir upstream. officials have negotiated plans for delivery cuts to nevada and arizona if the lake level drops below 1,075 feet elevation, but this isn't expected in the next year or two. boaters and swimmers have dealt with marina closures and longer treks to enjoy waterside activities as the lake's levels continue to decline.
233	a police dog named spartacus, a 3-year-old belgian malinois, died of heat stroke after being left in a patrol car parked outside his handler's home in woodstock, georgia. the handler, a nine-year veteran with the woodstock police department, is currently on administrative leave with pay while an internal investigation is underway. spartacus had worked as a k-9 handler for seven years and was cross-trained in drug detection, tracking, and apprehension. the cause of death was determined to be heat stroke, but it is unclear how long the car had been parked at the handler's house or why it was there. a memorial service for spartacus will be announced at a later date.
234	the royal institute of british architects (riba) stirling prize shortlist includes the library of birmingham with its harry potter-style rotunda and willy wonka glass lift, london's the shard, manchester school of art, liverpool's everyman theatre, and the london school of economics saw swee hock student centre. judges praised revolutionary designs, such as thelibrary of birmingham's landmark status and the shard's significant addition to the london skyline, compared to a gothic cathedral spire. they were also impressed with thelondon aquatics centre'sconceptually flawless interior and liverpool's everyman theatre's use of recycled brick to retain old ambience. the riba stirling prize winner will be announced on october 16.
235	duchess, a 43-year-old blind asian elephant at paignton zoo in devon, underwent the world's largest cataract operation to regain sight in her remaining eye. the three-hour procedure, performed by consultant ophthalmologist jim carter and assistant john lewis, was carried out while duchess was under anesthesia by david burton and jo jago. duchess, who has been struggling to distinguish between light and dark, showed signs of recovery after the operation, with zoo staff reporting that she was up and about and making usual bellowing sounds. the elephant, who was put on oxygen tanks during the surgery due to the cataract in her left eye, has had groundbreaking surgery before, including the first ever eye removal due to glaucoma in 2011. duchess has been in good spirits despite being on her own since her long-time companion, gay, was euthanized in 2010. the zoo's primary concern is duchess's welfare and quality of life as elephants have a keen sense of smell and terrific hearing.
236	iraq's government announced on friday that it will file a lawsuit against five blackwater security guards, now known as xe, who were cleared of manslaughter charges in the 2007 killing of 17 iraqi civilians in baghdad. the iraqi government has also asked the u.s. justice department to appeal a federal judge's dismissal of the charges, calling it "murder" and a disregard for iraqi blood. the judge, ricardo urbina, found that the prosecution wrongly used statements obtained under threat of job loss during a state department investigation of the shootings, a violation of the defendants' fifth amendment rights. the judge's ruling dismissed all charges against the five guards, and their lawyers expressed relief at the decision. the shootings occurred when the guards were guarding a state department convoy in western baghdad, with the guards claiming they came under attack and iraqi authorities calling the gunfire unprovoked and indiscriminate. a sixth guard involved in the shootings, jeremy ridgeway, pleaded guilty to voluntary manslaughter and attempted manslaughter in 2008.
237	a ferrari 458 spider worth £200,000 was trapped on watergate bay in cornwall on wednesday, january 23, 2014. concerns arose that the vehicle had been recklessly driven onto the beach, but it was later confirmed that it was being used in a fashion shoot for the official ferrari magazine. the car became stuck due to its wheels getting embedded in sand grooves left by the tractor that delivered it to the beach. ferrari confirmed the incident, stating that no point was the 458 spider driven onto the beach and it was safely towed off with a tractor. the car, which boasts a top speed of 200mph and a 4.5-litre v8 engine, was loaned to the magazine by the carrs ferrari dealership in exeter. watergate bay, a private beach owned by the watergate bay hotel, gave ferrari permission to use it for the photo shoot.
238	rory mcilroy won the australian open on sunday, denying countryman adam scott the chance to complete a domestic triple crown by shooting a final round of 66 for an 18-under total. mcilroy, who has had a frustrating year with both on-course struggles and off-course issues, started the day four shots behind scott but capitalized on the latter's late lapses to claim his only title of 2013. us masters champion scott, who led after the first round with a course record 62, struggled with his putter and finished a shot behind mcilrori. john senden took third place and secured one of three spots for the 2014 british open championship qualifying. charl schwartzel won the alfred dunhill championship on the european tour for the second straight year, finishing four shots clear of richard finch.
239	the u.s. navy has temporarily halted its procedure requiring incoming female recruits to cut their hair so that it only reaches the lower edge of the uniform collar upon entering boot camp. this change is part of a trial, and recruits entering the program for the first three months of 2023 will be allowed to keep their long hair with stricter grooming regulations, such as keeping it in a bun and ensuring no portion exceeds two inches from the scalp. the navy explained that this move aims to standardize training and education across military services and facilitate proper grooming standards with longer hair. the navy received complaints that short haircuts did not adequately prepare women for service, where longer hair is allowed. meanwhile, male recruits continue to be required to have their heads shaved upon arrival, and there are suggestions that this requirement might also change.
240	stonehenge, located in england, is an ancient neolithic monument with a new $44 million visitor center and landscaping project to reconnect it with its original terrain. the new center, which officially opens on december 18, includes a modern pavilion, a virtual exhibition, and a reconstructed neolithic man's head. the delays in the project have given archaeologists time to update interpretations of the monument's origins. controversies surrounding the use of the neolithic man's bones and the ability to touch the stones remain. despite some reservations, the new center aims to help visitors connect with the ancient landscape and the surrounding historical significance. stonehenge, near salisbury, england, charges admission starting from february 1, 2014, with timed tickets required.
241	ryanair, a budget airline, was named the second worst global brand for simplicity of use in a survey by siegel+gale's 2014 simplicity index. customers cited poorly designed website and poor customer service as their main grievances. despite these findings, ceo michael o'leary defended the airline, arguing that its rising traffic and profits indicate success. the travel sector overall didn't fare well in the industry ranking for simplicity, with hotels ranking highest and air travel brands and booking agents placing 13th and 15th, respectively. uber, gopro, and airbnb were identified as top disruptors to traditional travel brands.
242	a new study conducted by scientists at loyola university chicago stritch school of medicine found that men who have survived cancer and burned more than 12,600 kilojoules or 3,011 calories a week through exercise had nearly halved their risk of death. this study supports previous research that suggests physical activity significantly prolongs the lives of cancer survivors. the researchers analyzed data from 1,021 men with an average age of 71 who had been diagnosed with cancer and found that those burning more than 3,011 calories a week were 48% less likely to die than those who exercised little and expended less than 2,100 kilojoules (502 calories) a week. earlier studies indicated that highly active cancer survivors were 38% less likely to die from cancer and 48% less likely to die of cardiovascular disease after their cancer treatment.
243	in a shocking hit-and-run incident on the m6 motorway in birmingham, recovery worker mark wootton, 40, was miraculously alive but suffered a broken back after being hit by a lorry while assisting a stranded motorist. terence poolman, 69, of shifnal, admitted causing serious injury by dangerous driving and was sentenced to eight months in jail and a two-year driving ban. poolman, who was driving a low loader towing a dumper truck, veered off the road and struck wootton, who was between the vehicles at the time. the judge expressed amazement that both wootton and the stricken vehicle were not hit directly. wootton, who was on the floor "screaming in agony," has been unable to return to work since the incident and faces an uncertain future regarding his ability to continue as an emergency recovery driver. the lorry was traced through a branded catering van that was following it at the time, and the police were able to identify poolman through this lead. poolman's lawyer stated that he had no explanation for the incident and had undergone a medical assessment that did not reveal any issues. wootton remains in pain and unsure of his future employment prospects.
244	china's experimental spacecraft, currently circling the moon on an eight-day mission, has captured stunning images of the earth and moon. the mission is a precursor to china's first unmanned return trip to the lunar surface in 2017, making china the third nation to attempt such a mission. the spacecraft, named chang'e, will re-enter earth's atmosphere at high speeds before landing in inner mongolia. the mission aims to gather experimental data and validate re-entry technologies for future manned lunar missions. china's space program, a source of national pride, has already achieved manned space travel independently and is developing a more permanent space station, tiangong 2. china's military-backed space program has sent astronauts into space since 2003 and plans to send a manned mission to the moon at a later date. the long march 3c rocket carrying the experimental lunar orbiter launched from xichang satellite launch center on october 24, 2014.
245	in april 2012, durham university's oriental museum was the target of a high-value burglary, during which thieves made off with an 18th century jade bowl and a dehua porcelain figurine worth £1.8m. two men, lee wildman and adrian stanton, have denied taking part in the raid but have admitted to conspiracy to burgle. the pair claimed they were recruited from the west midlands to help unnamed figures in the north east, and were asked to grab old chinese artefacts from the museum. however, security staff checked their bags, preventing them from carrying out the theft. the prosecution argued that cctv footage showed the men testing museum cabinet locks in preparation for the raid. wildman claimed he offered to provide stolen cars to the gang for a fee, but declined to name any of the individuals involved. both stolen items were later recovered, and were from the qing dynasty. a hearing is ongoing to determine the roles of wildman and stanton in the burglary.
246	two activists, nikole ardeno and emanuel velez, both 30, have been charged with severely beating their former roommate and fellow anti-violence campaigner, joshua magraff, in washington, pennsylvania. the attack occurred hours after a protest they led together. magraff had gone to the apartment they all shared to collect his belongings after moving out. ardeno and velez accused magraff of burglary and claimed he was breaking in to the apartment at the police station before the attack. magraff is in critical condition at upmc mercy hospital in pittsburgh. the anti-violence group the defendants belong to, the pennsylvania-based "stop the violence" campaign, condemns violence and has distanced itself from the incident. ardeno and velez are facing charges of aggravated assault, conspiracy, simple assault, and disorderly conduct at a preliminary hearing on november 10. ardeno is still in jail, while velez has posted bail and could not be reached for comment.
247	the united states deported the first wave of central american children, including kids as young as 18 months, to honduras, el salvador, and guatemala on monday. the move came as record numbers of minors, mainly from these three countries, have crossed the border, sparking a heated debate over how to handle the influx. the deportees were among a group of immigrants housed in a new mexico emergency detention facility, intended to hold around 700 women and children. the deportation process is likely to accelerate, with more flights expected. homeland security secretary jeh johnson visited the facility and reassured the detainees that "our border is not open to illegal immigration." the children and their mothers expressed distress over their journey, which involved paying smugglers and enduring cramped and unsanitary conditions in detention centers. over 52,000 children were detained at the border in the eight months to june 15, and the obama administration projects that over 150,000 children could flee the three countries next year without intervention. the crisis has intensified as a result of gang violence and incursions from mexican drug cartels in central america. central american leaders have called on the united states to address the root causes and collaborate to curb migration.
248	a national geographic channel study revealed that over 36% of americans believe in the existence of alien spaceships, with 10% claiming to have seen one. nearly 80 million americans hold this belief, and approximately 79% suspect the white house is concealing information about extraterrestrial life. in the event of an alien encounter, 22% would try to befriend them, 15% would run away, and 13% would lock their doors. only 2% of americans would attempt to harm the alien. up to 10% of americans have reported seeing something strange in the skies, and 55% believe in the existence of men in black-style agents who suppress ufo reports. the survey, commissioned for national geographic's upcoming series "chasing ufos," also found that 65% think barack obama would better handle an alien invasion over mitt romney, while 21% would call for help from the hulk, batman, or spider-man in a fictional scenario. overall, 17% had no belief in ufos, 36% were convinced, and 48% were undecided.
249	the cuban government has announced a new policy allowing its athletes, including boxers and baseball players, to compete and earn money professionally abroad. this shift aims to boost the competitiveness of cuban national teams while benefiting the state through taxation. however, several obstacles remain, such as the us embargo on cuba and the government's control over which athletes can travel and seek contracts. some athletes, like the late boxer teofilo stevenson, have chosen to remain loyal to cuba and forego lucrative opportunities for personal reasons. the policy's impact on the number of cuban athletes joining foreign leagues, particularly major league baseball, remains uncertain. the move comes after cuba opened its boxers to semipro leagues and following travel reforms in cuban sports.
