250	a study published in the new england journal of medicine identified a new type of virus, named the 'heartland virus,' which caused illness in two missouri farmers. both patients were initially diagnosed with bacterial infections but did not respond to antibiotics. the virus is a new species within the phlebovirus family, which includes over 70 members, many of which are insect-borne. the farmers were bitten by amblyomma americanum, or lone star ticks, and the virus' closest relative is a tick-borne phlebovirus called severe fever with thrombocytopenia syndrome (sfts) virus. the cdc recommends using repellents with 20% deet and avoiding wooded areas or high grass to prevent tick bites. the two farmers are believed to be the only known cases of the virus, but more studies are needed to learn more about its transmission and risk factors.
251	a massive landslide at knipe point in north yorkshire, england, has brought homes dangerously close to the cliff edge, with residents blaming frozen food manufacturer mccain for the latest slip due to leaks from a burst pipe. the community has been dealing with landslides since 2008, resulting in the bulldozing of three homes before they fell into the woodland below. the latest slip occurred on monday, bringing artist kane cunningham's home within four feet of the cliff edge. the scene has been linked to leaks from a yorkshire water pipe used to discharge effluent from mccain's oven chip and frozen food factory, with tests revealing oil and grease in the water issuing from the cliff face. the residents had previously obtained a consultant report linking the instability of the cliff to the leaks. mccain employs around a thousand people in the area and has always played an active role in the community, and they have asked geological experts to assess the report's contents before commenting further.
252	scotland yard has identified three men believed to be involved in a racist incident against a black man on a paris metro train, where chelsea football fans allegedly pushed him off the train and chanted racist songs. the three men have not been arrested, and the metropolitan police are liaising with french authorities. five people have been suspended from chelsea following the incident, and the club has promised to ban for life anyone found guilty. chelsea manager jose mourinho expressed his disgust and shame over the incident. british transport police are also seeking a gang of men, believed to be chelsea fans, for racist chanting at london st pancras station. meanwhile, russell brand, a millionaire comedian and west ham fan, commented on the incident, but not in defense of the racist behavior. he criticized the recent £5 billion television rights deal in football for garnering wealth for itself instead of sharing it with fans. west ham fans responded to the chelsea incident with a humorous video welcoming a black man on board a train, and brand found it funny.
253	tropical storm fay, which has already made landfall in florida twice and in cuba, brought historic flooding to east-central florida on wednesday, with potential for 30 inches of rain in some areas. the storm was just off the coast of central florida, about 35 miles southeast of daytona beach, and was expected to make a fourth landfall in northern florida on thursday. storm tides of up to 3 feet above normal and isolated tornadoes were possible. residents in port st. lucie reported streets flooded up to people's knees, and hundreds of homes were flooded there. one death was reported in highlands county from carbon monoxide fumes. governor charlie crist requested an emergency declaration from president bush due to the continued threat of flooding and tornadoes. the storm forced nasa to close for a second day and moved several ships and aircraft in anticipation of its arrival. widespread power outages and rescues were reported in st. lucie county.
254	locals in praia da luz, portugal, have expressed anger towards scotland yard's reinvestigation of madeleine mccann's disappearance by spraying road signs with graffiti that reads 'stop mccann circus.' four arguidos, or persons of interest, were recently questioned as part of the investigation. some residents believe these individuals are innocent and are concerned about the impact of the probe on the tourist trade. british and portuguese police searched three sites in praia da luz in june without finding any evidence. a former scotland yard commander urged police to search an abandoned well near the apartment where madeleine vanished, as it could potentially hold evidence related to the case. the well, hidden on scrubland used as a campsite by roma gipsies, could have been used to dispose of evidence from petty crimes.
255	thousands of scottish football fans transformed london's trafalgar square into a sea of blue and white before their team's 3-2 defeat against england at wembley stadium. the celebration began early as fans arrived carrying crates of alcohol, despite the council's alcohol ban. the square was soon filled with inflatable swords, saltire flags, and ginger wigs, creating a "blistering cauldron of scottish jingoism." despite the excitement, scotland lost the match, but fans remained in high spirits, singing and partying in the streets. tensions were high before the match with some fans displaying political messages and campaigns for devolution. the event attracted a large police presence to ensure trouble-free proceedings, resulting in only a few arrests and minor injuries. the oldest international fixture in the world, england vs scotland, has seen 110 meetings with england winning 45 and scotland 41.
256	a 42-year-old rwandan national, jean leonard teganya, wanted for war crimes related to the rwandan genocide in the 1990s was arrested at the maine-canada border by u.s. border patrol. teganya was in the houlton, maine, area near the border and was detained on august 3 for violation of entry without inspection. the patrol discovered acanadian warrant for his arrest in their database and turned him over to u.s. immigration and customs enforcement (ice). teganya's lawyer was unaware of his client's detention. the rwandan genocide resulted in up to one million deaths between april and july 1994 during the rwandan civil war. meanwhile, two leaders of cambodia's former khmer rouge regime, khieu samphan and nuon chea, have been sentenced to life in prison for crimes against humanity during the 1970s genocide that claimed as many as two million lives. the trial, which began in november 2011 and ended in october 2013, had over 100,000 attendees. both men were found guilty of extermination involving murder, political persecution, and other inhumane acts, including forced transfer, enforced disappearances, and attacks against human dignity.
257	tens of thousands of people have been displaced from their homes due to the increased alert status of the mayon volcano in the philippines, which is known for being the country's most active volcano. the alert status was raised to level 4 on sunday, signaling a potential hazardous explosive eruption within days. local authorities have set up evacuation camps for over 44,000 residents, but some have refused to leave, disregarding warnings from officials. the philippine institute of volcanology and seismology detected 1,942 volcanic earthquakes and reported an ash cloud reaching 500 meters into the air. mayon, located in albay province, has erupted 49 times since 1616, with devastating consequences, including the death of over 1,200 people in 1814. the philippines, situated in the ring of fire, is prone to volcanic eruptions and earthquakes.
258	businessman carl weininger, 60, bought the world's most expensive dessert, worth £22,000, as a pick-me-up after his three-year relationship ended. the chocolate-laced pudding, styled like a faberge egg, was shared with other guests at the aviators' ball at heathrow terminal five's sofitel hotel. the dessert, made at lindeth howe country house hotel in windermere, was filled with expensive ingredients such as gold, champagne caviar, and a diamond. weininger, from rugby, warwickshire, admitted that he's not a big chocolate lover but was excited about the response from the women who tasted it. the dessert, named "frozen haute chocolate," broke the previous world record of £12,000 set by new york's serendipity restaurant.
259	ariel castro's daughter, emily castro, who is currently serving a 25-year sentence in an indiana prison for slashing her baby's throat, revealed in a jailhouse interview that she went to school with amanda berry. this means that castro used his daughters to get to know two of the three women he is accused of kidnapping, raping, and holding captive in his house for ten years. emily castro, 25, spoke out for the first time about her father, calling him a "monster" for using his daughters as a way to gain access to his alleged victims. amanda and another victim, gina dejesus, attended wilbur wright elementary school with emily. emily's sister arlene was best friends with gina, and her brother anthony believes their father targeted gina because of her relationship with arlene. emily also shared that her father kept the upstairs of his house blocked off from her after the girls were kidnapped, making excuses to keep her away from them. cleveland police officer barbara johnson was one of the first officers to enter the house and rescue michelle knight. she described the harrowing experience of finding knight and how michelle clung to her, begging not to be let go. another officer described a sense of evil in the house upon entering it. emily castro's mother moved the family out of the house in 1996 due to the years of brutal beatings she endured.
260	this cnn article highlights the long-standing tradition of negative campaigning in american politics, from the early days of the republic to the 2008 election. critics have used misleading and inaccurate attacks on everything from foreign and domestic policy to private character and personal behavior. however, the 2008 campaign is notable for its all-time lows in the use of factually inaccurate political appeals. both democrats and republicans have engaged in such tactics, with outside groups being the biggest perpetrators. these organizations feel free to run emotional and inaccurate content designed to manipulate voter fears and anxieties. voters need to protect themselves from political manipulation by using non-partisan fact-checking websites, watching candidate debates, studying policy claims, and paying attention to how the candidates speak. the 2008 election is unusual in having many significant issues on the agenda and stark differences between the parties, making it essential for voters to focus on facts rather than misinformation. despite the large budgets devoted to ads, voters must decipher competing charges and counter-charges amid considerable noise from all sides.
261	in the summer of 2013, a new pastry trend took the us by storm: the cronut, a croissant-doughnut hybrid created by dominique ansel bakery in new york. the cronut caused a craze with people queueing outside the bakery to get their hands on the flaky, fried treat. in response, british bakers adapted the recipe and created the greggsnut and now, waitrose has entered the game with its version named yumdough. yumdough is a hybrid of a yum yum (a flakier take on a doughnut) and a doughnut, topped with sugar icing and various fillings. it will be sold in 40 waitrose branches for £1.49, with an introductory offer of 25% off. the cronut was made from thin layers of croissant dough that are deep-fried, rolled in sugar and filled with vanilla cream, while the creator dominique ansel emphasized the complexity of making a cronut. british bakers have since come up with their versions, including the greggsnut, available in berry or caramel-pecan flavors, made using a similar method. the yumdough is the latest addition to the doughnut-blend craze in the uk.
262	a 21-year-old student, ashleigh cox, was swept up in a deadly avalanche at tibble fork reservoir in american fork county, utah, on february 8, 2014. she was snow-shoeing and tubing with friends when they accidentally triggered an avalanche. emergency responders closest to the scene were not dispatched, causing a delay in reaching cox and depriving her of precious minutes of oxygen. dispatchers failed to send the nearest team, lone peak paramedics and firefighters, who were ready to go but didn't receive a call. cox was found face down in three feet of water, and though bystanders administered cpr, she was taken off life support the next day. lone peak district fire chief brad freeman called the incident "unacceptable" and is investigating further. the utah valley dispatch special service district is conducting a review of the incident. cox spent three months of the previous year in romania as part of a study abroad program.
263	cardiff city council is considering reducing bin and black bag collections to once a month as part of plans to reduce waste and meet recycling targets, despite outrage from residents and criticism from communities and local government secretary eric pickles. the proposals could set a precedent for other local authorities and include introducing smaller bins, charging for waste disposal, and limiting the number of visits to waste and recycling centers. the consultation document also suggests that recycling will be collected weekly to meet the council's recycling targets, and that households may be fined for putting the wrong items in recycling bins. the council aims to save £125 million over the next three years and is consulting on various options to reduce waste, including reducing the size of wheelie bins and limiting the use of black bin bags.
264	presidents felipe calderon of mexico, alvaro uribe of colombia, alvaro colom of guatemala, and martin torrijos of panama will meet in panama to discuss the issue of violence and drug-trafficking, which has become a major threat to the region. the summit comes at a particularly troubled time for these governments, especially mexico, which saw a record number of drug-related killings last year, and has been characterized as a civil war by former u.s. house speaker newt gingrich. other countries such as colombia, panama, and guatemala have also been affected by the violence and bloodshed. the united states, with its high drug consumption and proximity, is seen as a key player in the problem and should be more involved in finding a solution. the instability could have serious implications for homeland security in the united states as well. mexican president calderon has met with president-elect barack obama in washington to discuss security issues and the importance of a secure mexico for u.s. security.
265	according to a poll conducted by qvc, the scene from the 1987 film "dirty dancing" where patrick swayze's character, johnny castle, lifts jennifer grey's character, baby houseman, in the dance "i've had the time of my life," was voted the most iconic movie dance moment of all time by brits, receiving 25% of the votes. the classic gene kelly routine from "singin' in the rain" received 23% of the votes, while men preferred this dance moment over "dirty dancing" with 28% of their votes. the most attempted dance moment was revealed to be the "stayin' alive" dance from "saturday night fever," with 33% of the respondents trying to replicate the moves. the survey also showed that 41% of the participants felt despair over their dancing abilities, with 57% of men being among them. the poll of 1,000 brits was carried out to mark the launch of a new dance craze and fitness dvd, zalza, created by flavia cacace and russell grant, who also star in the zalza dvd. flavia cacace, 34, commented on her love for dance and her motivation to inspire the nation to try new dance moves. dance was identified as the nation's favorite weight loss method, preferred by 26% of the respondents, and 40% of women listed it as their preferred exercise method, followed by working out at home with a dvd (25%). playing sports was the least popular exercise method (9%).
266	cnn's "cnn heroes: an all-star tribute," which airs on thanksgiving night, features musical performances by christina aguilera, alicia keys, and john legend, as well as recognition of the top 10 cnn heroes of 2008. the 2008 cnn hero of the year, liz mccartney, who helps hurricane katrina survivors rebuild their homes, was announced at a taping attended by over 2,000 people at the kodak theatre in hollywood. the telecast, which airs at 9 p.m. et/pt on cnn and its global networks, also includes presentations by celebrities such as cameron diaz, salma hayek, and john krasinski. aguilera performed her hit single "beautiful," while legend's powerful "if you're out there" and keys' "superwoman" echoed the spirit of the cnn heroes campaign. the top 10 cnn heroes, chosen from over 3,700 nominations, received $25,000 each. the program was executive produced by emmy and peabody award-winning producer-director joel gallen.
267	manchester united maintained their seven-point lead at the top of the english premier league with a 4-0 win over wigan, as robin van persie and javier hernandez each scored twice. hernandez opened and closed the scoring, with van persie netting the second and 19th goal of the season for united. manchester city stayed in second place with a 3-0 win over stoke, but sergio aguero suffered a hamstring injury and will be out for about two weeks. tottenham hotspur went a point clear of chelsea with a 3-1 victory over reading, while fulham and west ham also secured wins. arsenal were held to a 1-1 draw at southampton, losing ground in the race for a champions league place. aston villa salvaged a 2-2 draw at swansea, and goals from dimitar berbatov and chris baird gave fulham a 2-1 win over west bromwich albion in the early kickoff.
268	the rivers nursery orchard in sawbridgeworth, hertfordshire, founded in 1725, is renowned for its fruit breeding excellence, with john rivers and his descendant thomas rivers developing numerous fruit varieties, including the conference pear. however, the once-magnificent 300-acre orchard has been reduced to under five acres due to development in 1985 and is now maintained by local volunteers. the decline of home-grown fruit production in britain has led to a loss of interest in traditional apple varieties, with sales falling by 6.3% over the past year. the market dominance of large-scale producers and foreign apples, such as gala and braeburn, has contributed to the decline of native british breeds. to revive the market, english apples and pears encourages immigrants and unconventional apple uses like indian lamb dhansak and polish apple cake. former assistant chairman of the rivers nursery site and orchard group, joseph fitzgerald, emphasizes the loss of connection to the landscape and local produce with the disappearance of orchards. the volunteers at the rivers nursery orchard preserve and grow 70 varieties of fruit, including egremont russet, orleans reinette, and pitmaston pineapples. the orchard's restoration has encouraged the return of woodpeckers, beetles, and other insects. to prevent further losses, community orchards, apple days, and sales of heritage fruit trees are on the rise, but it is crucial for consumers to choose to eat more traditional british apple varieties instead of imported ones.
269	a self-help author and speaker, james arthur ray, is on trial for reckless manslaughter in the deaths of three people during a sweat lodge ceremony at his retreat in sedona, arizona, in 2009. the ceremony, which was meant as a "rebirthing" experience, resulted in the deaths of kirby brown, james shore, and lizbeth marie neuman, as well as illnesses for at least 15 other participants. prosecutors claim ray was reckless in his conduct of the ceremony, heating the sweat lodge to dangerously high temperatures and ignoring signs of distress among participants. defense attorneys maintain the deaths were tragic accidents and that ray took precautions to ensure the safety of participants, including having a nurse and cpr-trained personnel on hand, and making fluids available. all three deaths were ruled accidental, but a grand jury indicted ray the following day based on evidence provided by medical examiners that the deaths were caused by hyperthermia due to prolonged exposure to the heat in the sweat lodge. ray had conducted the spiritual warrior retreat for six years, at a cost of around $10,000 per participant, and the sweat lodge, which was designed to accommodate up to 75 people, was 5 feet tall and 23 feet wide with a pit in the center where heated rocks were placed. prosecutors claim ray psychologically pressured participants to remain in the lodge despite their distress, while defense attorneys dispute this. the trial is set to begin on tuesday.
270	a pod of killer whales attacked a group of dolphins in nanaimo departure bay, canada, shocking tourists who initially thought they were just watching playful interactions between the two species. the attack was actually a rare and deadly hunt by the biggs killer whales, known for their feeding on other mammals. dozens of dolphins raced to safety as the orcas isolated and surrounded their prey, and after a few minutes, two dolphins were killed and eaten. the attack is believed to be a result of the increasing populations of harbor seals, white-sided dolphins, and biggs killer whales in the area. experts see this as a necessary balancing of marine mammals in the ecosystem.
271	the oregon supreme court has ruled that a 12-year-old boy at the center of a long-running custody dispute should have a say in whether he undergoes circumcision as part of his father's effort to convert him to judaism. the court sent the case back to the trial court to determine the child's attitude towards the procedure, as the father argues it's necessary for his faith, while the mother objects due to her son's objections and the medical risks involved. the court noted that the dispute, which has been ongoing due to the parents living in different states, is a private matter but necessary for a determination on the custody issue. the parents had no initial reaction to the decision. (case: james boldt v. lia boldt, s054714)
272	a memphis woman, rose fayne, has been charged with elder abuse and neglect after her mother, 77-year-old betty cleveland, was found with severe injuries at their home in the 3700 block of joslyn, tennessee. cleveland's legs were reportedly so neglected they had rotted from the inside out, and she later died in the hospital. a hospice worker who had been called to assist fayne in caring for her mother alerted authorities when they saw her condition. neighbors expressed shock and disbelief at the allegations, as they had not suspected any issues with the mother-daughter duo living in the area. fayne was released on a $30,000 bond, while her brother, rodney cleveland, also remains in custody.
273	prime minister david cameron is preparing to take proposals for eu reform to a european summit, demanding the return of powers from brussels amid new evidence of the costly impact of eu regulations on the uk. a report by the open europe think-tank revealed that the top 100 eu regulations cost the uk more than £27 billion a year, with estimated costs outweighing benefits in 24 cases. the five most costly regulations include banking rules, climate and energy legislation, the working time directive, the temporary agency workers directive, and the energy performance of buildings directive. business leaders have condemned rules on working hours, agency workers, environmental and food labelling, and 20 weeks' maternity leave on full pay. analyst vincenzo scarpetta expressed confusion over policymakers imposing costs on the economy that outweigh the benefits of regulation.
274	gelada baboons, known for their sociable nature and distinct chest patches, reside in ethiopia's simien mountain range. these primates, which are not actual baboons, rise before dawn to climb the highest vantage points to bask in the sunshine. photographer simone sbaraglia documented their daily routine, capturing images of them during morning and sunset hours, enjoying the beautiful backdrop of the mountains. geladas' diet primarily consists of grass, and their large foraging grounds are provided by the mountains' heights. the photographer spent several days following the group to gain their trust and capture stunning images.
275	a funeral home in chicago, illinois, named carter funeral chapels, was shut down after police discovered bodies in various states of preparation and a back door off its hinges. grieving families have been demanding answers about their loved ones' remains, including julia bailey, who wants her father's ashes. two caretakers were found inside the building, while a third was arrested on an outstanding warrant. the owner, henry carter, was issued a violation notice for improper care of human remains and lacking proper facilities. he denies any wrongdoing and claims the investigation found no non-compliant issues. authorities are investigating the discovered bones to determine if they are human, and the cook county medical examiner and illinois department of health are also involved. the funeral home had a history of legal issues, including a lawsuit for failing to provide an itemized service list and a suspended funeral director license for carter.
276	j.r. martinez, an actor and iraq war veteran, is the spokesperson for operation finally home, a nonprofit organization that provides free custom-built homes for injured veterans. the organization was founded by dan wallrath, a cnn hero and veteran himself. in an interview with cnn's sonya hamasaki, martinez discussed his involvement with the organization, how it helps wounded veterans by providing mortgage-free homes, and the emotional impact of the home presentations. martinez is also currently appearing on "dancing with the stars" and continues motivational speaking. he considers his mother, wounded soldiers, and dan wallrath as his personal heroes.
277	in recent weeks, objectionable materials, including nude photos, have appeared in the iphone application store, leading to questions about apple's ability to regulate content. a photo-sharing app called "beautymeter" was removed from the store after a nude image of a young woman, believed to be 15, was discovered. another app, "hottest girl," was also pulled for showing a topless woman. apple stated that it would not distribute inappropriate content, such as pornography. funnymals, the developer of beautymeter, agreed with the decision and claimed its policies prohibit such content. apple and funnymals did not respond to requests for comment. previously, an app called "tweetie" and a nine inch nails application were pulled for offensive content. apple's approval process is kept secret, frustrating developers, and some have accused the company of inconsistent decisions. while apple approves 96% of submitted apps, it now includes controls for users to block specific types of content and comes with age-appropriateness labels. google's android market does not require apps to go through a screening process, allowing the community to flag objectionable content. apple has stated that it is doing its best to exclude pornography and offensive material from the store to maintain its family-friendly image.
278	schalke advanced to the champions league semifinals with a 2-1 win over inter milan, securing a 7-3 aggregate score. raul gonzalez scored the opening goal before inter equalized through thiago motta from a corner. schalke's benedikt hoewedes headed the winner with nine minutes remaining, with raul providing the assist. schalke coach ralf rangnick praised the team's effort and organization, and they will host manchester united in the first leg of the semifinals on april 26.
279	donald trump has expressed his opposition to a proposed 11-turbine offshore wind farm near his £750million scottish golf course, vowing to spend "whatever is necessary" to stop the project. the scottish government approved the scheme, which could generate up to 100mw of power and provide energy for nearly half of aberdeen's homes, despite trump's claims that it will spoil scenic coastal views and harm tourism. the wind farm, which will lie 1.25-2.8 miles off the coast, is being put together by vattenfall wind power and aberdeen renewable energy group (areg), and the decision relies on aberdeenshire council approving a cable and substation development to bring the power onshore. trump compared the wind farm approval to the release of the lockerbie bomber and called it a "purely political decision" made by scottish first minister alex salmond. the scottish government has claimed that the wind farm represents a huge opportunity for scotland, with the potential to generate over £7 billion for the economy and support up to 28,000 direct and indirect jobs by 2020.
280	the mayor of charlotte, north carolina, patrick cannon, was arrested and accused of accepting over $48,000 in bribes from undercover fbi agents posing as businessmen who wanted to do work in the city. cannon, a 47-year-old democrat who rose from the city's public housing projects to become a successful businessman and politician, faces federal theft and bribery charges. the investigation began in august 2010 and cannon was elected mayor in november 2013. he was released on $25,000 unsecured bond but faces up to 50 years in prison and over $1 million in fines if convicted on all charges. the investigation is ongoing and more details of the allegations against cannon have emerged, including his solicitation of over $1 million in additional bribes, and his close relationship with republican governor pat mccrory.
281	a man in albury, australia had a miserable christmas day when he became stranded on his jetski in the middle of lake hume after its engine broke down. he spent 12 hours shivering in the cold until he was rescued by lake hume coast guard on boxing day. the man's friends reported him missing after he didn't return from the 4.5km ride, and victoria police urged people to stay with their vessels and use personal location beacons for water safety. the jetskier is in good spirits after the ordeal.
282	thousands of people have been evacuated from their homes in munich due to the discovery of a 550lb allied bomb from world war ii. the bomb, which is believed to have been dropped in 1944 or 1945, was found beneath ground at the site of the former schwabinger 7 nightclub. experts cannot defuse the bomb due to its complex chemical fuse, so they plan to surround it with sand and carry out a controlled explosion. approximately 2,500 unexploded bombs are estimated to still be buried in munich. the bomb, which cannot be definitively identified as american or british, is believed to be a remnant of the 2.8 million tons of bombs dropped on germany during the war, which resulted in the deaths of 543,000 german civilians and 60,000 british civilians. due to the potential danger, a large area has been cordoned off and 2,500 people have been evacuated. this is a common problem in germany, where new undetonated bombs are discovered frequently. experts believe that the safety mechanisms in the triggers are wearing away over time, making some bombs more dangerous to handle. in 2010, three bomb disposal experts were killed in göttingen while attempting to defuse an american bomb.
283	the northeastern quadrant of the united states has experienced the coldest weather in about 20 years, with dangerously low temperatures in the midwest and wild weather on the coast. this extreme weather is a normal occurrence in the midlatitudes where cold and warm air cannot easily mix, resulting in the jet stream, a fast air current separating warm and cold air. however, the jet stream can undulate and form high and low-pressure systems, leading to temperature contrasts and severe weather events. the current weather situation is more extreme due to a distorted jet stream bringing polar air farther south than usual. while this cold snap does not contradict the fact of global warming, some scientists argue that weakened temperature contrasts due to warming could cause more frequent and intense winter storms. the relationship between long-term climate changes and short-term extreme weather events is still a topic of ongoing research and debate.
284	in the 19th century, egyptologists frequently removed mummies' wrappings without consideration for the damage caused. modern researchers at the british museum have used advanced technology, including a dual-energy ct scanner and 3d modeling software, to virtually undress and examine eight mummies from their collection without disturbing them physically. one of the standout discoveries was about tamut, a priestess and temple singer who lived around 900 bc. the ct scans revealed her age, cause of death, and details about the amulets covering her body. researchers were also surprised to find that a mummy previously believed to be female was actually male and suffered from extensive dental issues and a botched embalming job. the man's remains provided valuable insights into the struggles embalmers faced during the embalming process.
285	japanese researchers discovered that consuming large amounts of rice, which is a high glycemic index (gi) food, improves sleep quality. in contrast, pasta and noodles, which are also starchy foods but have a lower gi, may hinder sleep. the study analyzed data from 1,848 factory workers in japan and found that those with higher rice and gi intake scored better on sleep quality assessments, particularly in terms of sleep duration. the researchers suggest this may be due to the effects of tryptophan, an amino acid linked to melatonin, a sleep-inducing hormone. eating a high-gi diet, especially one rich in rice, may contribute to good sleep.
286	cnn.com staff has been impressed by vice's transparent approached to journalism through their broadband television network, vbs.tv. in april 2009, vice visited iran to document the country's film culture, which was thriving despite numerous rules and taboos. the journalists visited an acting school where students learned to act in accordance with islamic republic laws, refraining from physical contact and kissing on screen. the actors were expressive and emotional, reminiscent of silent film actors. the journalist pondered about how they would react to contemporary artists like lady gaga.
287	liverpool city council is planning to remove most of its bus lanes following a study that found they were not effective. only four bus lanes may be saved for operation at specific times. mayor joe anderson aims to improve traffic flow and has cited strong opposition from motorists, who have accused the local authority of using bus lanes as a cash cow. an investigation in 2012 revealed over £3.7 million in fines for motorists who inadvertently entered bus lanes. the city now plans to address traffic disruptions caused by illegally parked cars and consider introducing more cycle lanes.
288	vladimir luxuria, the first transgender mp in europe, was arrested at the winter olympics in sochi for carrying a "it's ok to be gay" banner. she was taken into custody after posing for a photograph at the olympic site holding a rainbow umbrella and fan. luxuria, who had not undergone a sex change, was referring to russia's controversial law that criminalizes the promotion of homosexuality. her arrest was reportedly aggressive and brutal, and she was freed after diplomatic intervention by the italian government. luxuria was in russia to interview members of the italian olympic team and had planned to protest against the law by wearing drag to a hockey match attended by vladimir putin. she has been a vocal critic of the law, which equates homosexuality with pedophilia and prohibits its promotion in the presence of children. italian politicians expressed support for luxuria and criticized putin's regime for its hypocrisy.
289	deviantart user meridith viguet, or oceanstarlet, created a tongue-in-cheek tutorial on deviantart called "disney girls tutorial," which critiques disney's notion of princess beauty. she pokes fun at the fact that disney princesses often have unrealistic bodies, facial features, and age defying qualities. in the tutorial, oceanstarlet guides viewers through drawing disney princesses and explains their distinctive features, such as toothpick thin bodies, agelessness, and bulbous eyes. she also covers eurocentric and "exotic" princesses, noting the differences between the two. despite the critique, the tutorial also provides detailed instructions on how to draw these unrealistic princesses accurately.
290	tanya vasileva, a carer from bulgaria, won the right to inherit gertrude stanley's flat in london following a court battle against a tv heir hunter. vasileva had looked after stanley, a holocaust survivor who fled vienna before the start of world war ii and had no known relatives, since 2005. the court heard that stanley, who had a sizeable fortune, had promised the flat to vasileva in return for her selfless care. despite her promise, genealogist peter birchwood claimed vasileva was a "trespasser" and should be evicted and paid £50,000 for her rent-free occupation. however, judge mark raeside qc ruled that stanley's promise to vasileva was legitimate, awarding her £20,000 from the estate and dismissing birchwood's financial claim against her. vasileva, who had cared for stanley part-time while also holding down two jobs, spent six months in the flat before being asked to leave to make way for the estate. stanley, an accomplished pianist, and vasileva had formed a close friendship, with vasileva helping her clear her cluttered home and taking her to appointments. stanford died in december 2009 at the age of 89.
291	india is experiencing a major obesity epidemic among its middle classes, with millions becoming morbidly obese due to the growing influence of western fast food. wealthy young indians are leaving traditional cuisine behind in favor of restaurants like mcdonald's, pizza hut, and kfc, which is fueling a £7bn market expected to double by 2016. obesity-related health issues, such as diabetes, are already a significant concern in india, with 50 million sufferers and an anticipated increase to 100 million. the first mcdonald's in india opened in 1996, and international fast food chains and indian imitators show no signs of slowing down, continuing to expand in cities and towns across the country. traditional street food vendors, which once offered healthier options, are adapting by selling western junk food. children are increasingly turning to these unhealthy options due to the desire for trendy, branded foods. obesity affects primarily the middle and upper classes, with two-thirds of indians still living below the poverty line. middle class children's sedentary lifestyles, fueled by academic pressure and overprotective parents, contribute to the obesity crisis. the proliferation of western fast food has led to a boom in plus-size clothing stores, reflecting india's growing obesity problem.
292	an escaped convict, nicholas overton, carried out a series of robberies after being given day release from prison for a work placement. overton, 35, had been serving an 18-year sentence at hmp thorn cross in warrington, cheshire, for a string of gunpoint robberies in 2006. he was allowed out on august 23, 2013, as part of a prison "back to work" scheme to work at the chester branch of photo printing firm max spielman. overton pleaded guilty to three robberies and asked for six other raids to be considered at chester crown court on october 28, 2013. he had previously received an 18-year sentence at sheffield crown court in 2006 for 23 armed robberies and was described as a "significant risk" to the public. overton, who had previous convictions for theft, deception, possessing heroin, perverting the course of justice, burglary, and a knifepoint robbery, had served time in the 321 inmate thorn cross open jail, where prisoners have their own room keys. he was recaptured in a dawn swoop on a house in crewe after being at large for 28 days. police described overton as a "dangerous individual" and commended their efforts in apprehending him. a prison service spokesperson stated that release on temporary license is used to prepare prisoners for their eventual release from custody, and they were examining the circumstances of the case to identify any lessons that could be learned.
293	everton fans who attended the premier league match against west brom on monday night had a unique experience as they were invited to be part of the new "creed" film starring sylvester stallone. tony bellew, a lifelong everton supporter and boxer, arranged for a film crew to capture scenes inside goodison park during half-time. a message on the big screens invited supporters to stay seated and make noise to create an atmosphere for the film. stallone, who claims to be an everton fan, reprises his role as rocky balboa to train creed junior for a significant fight. the film crew captured the atmosphere inside the stadium to be featured in the "rocky" film. bellew, who plays pretty boy porter, asked fans to stay in their seats at half-time to create noise and help build a great atmosphere for the scene. over 30,000 evertonians stayed in their seats, creating a raucous atmosphere that will be showcased in the film. despite the frustration of a 0-0 draw against west brom, this opportunity to be part of a hollywood production may provide some consolation for the fans.
294	the australian youth climate coalition (aycc) removed a controversial billboard entry from their competition after criticism that it compared coal mining to paedophilia. the proposed image featured a child with wrinkly hands covering her mouth, with the caption "don't let the coal lobby get their dirty hands on our future." critics accused the group of unfairly targeting coal miners, and liberal backbencher george christensen labeled them "enviro-nutbags." aycc held the billboard competition on facebook to display at brisbane airport during the g20 leaders' summit next month. another suggested design read "our future is at stake." prime minister tony abbott has previously stated that climate change will not be a focus at the g20 meeting. us president barack obama and russian leader vladimir putin are among the expected attendees. some commentators described the controversy as "faux outrage."
295	a jury in ohio has recommended the death penalty for richard beasley, a self-styled street preacher, for killing three down-and-out men who were lured by bogus craigslist job offers. beasley's mother testified about his rough childhood that included physical and sexual abuse, but the jury disregarded her pleas for leniency. family members of the victims embraced each other after the recommendation was announced, and beasley remained expressionless with his head bowed. beasley was found guilty of teaming up with a teenager in 2011 to rob men who answered to fake farmhand job ads in southeast ohio. three men were killed, and a fourth was wounded. beasley's co-defendant, who was 16 at the time, was sentenced to life in prison without parole last year. beasley's defense team argued that the jury should consider the co-defendant's life sentence as a factor in deciding beasley's punishment, but the prosecution disagreeed. the jury heard testimony from witnesses, including beasley's mother, who described his troubled childhood, and a psychologist who testified about his depression, alcohol abuse, low self-esteem, and feeling of isolation. the victims were identified as ralph geiger, david pauley, and timothy kern. the surviving victim, scott davis, testified that he heard the click of a gun and managed to escape. beasley, who was paroled from prison in ohio in 2004 after serving several years on a burglary conviction in texas, testified that davis had pulled a gun on him in retaliation for his cooperation with police in a motorcycle gang investigation.
296	the national portrait gallery in london is presenting an exhibition called "the great war in portraits," which combines rare photos and artworks to document the human tragedy and participants of world war i. the exhibition includes images of soldiers, nurses, and other individuals, such as maria bochkareva, a russian female soldier, and edith cavell, a british nurse executed by the germans. other artworks depict the experiences of disfigured soldiers and their treatment, including eric kennington's "the gassed" and henry tonks' "soldiers with facial wounds." additionally, the exhibition features portraits of notable figures like kulbir thapa, the first nepalese recipient of the victoria cross, and shahamad khan, a punjabi muslim who also received the uk's highest military honor. the exhibition provides a humanizing perspective on the war, which was responsible for the deaths of millions, through the images and stories of those who experienced it. "the great war in portraits" is open from february at the national portrait gallery.
297	us media giant viacom has agreed to buy channel 5 from richard desmond's northern & shell for £450 million, making it the first time a us broadcaster control one of the uk's five free-to-air channels. channel 5, which broadcasts popular shows like big brother and neighbours, was launched in 1997 and has seen significant growth since desmond's acquisition in 2010. the broadcaster, which also includes 5*, 5 usa and +1 variants, reaches 42 million viewers every month. viacom, which owns nickelodeon and comedy central, sees the deal as an opportunity to expand its global reach and offer new opportunities for channel 5's future. desmond was looking for £700 million but the sale marks a significant profit on the £103.5 million he paid in 2010. viacom ceo philippe dauman stated that the acquisition would accelerate viacom's strategy in the uk and provide exciting opportunities for channel 5's future growth.
298	in tucson, arizona, a bag believed to belong to arizona shooting suspect jared loughner contains ammunition that matches the type used in the mass shooting on saturday, according to the pima county sheriff's department. the bag, which was discovered on thursday, has been transferred to the fbi for further analysis. loughner's father, randy, recalled that his son was carrying a black bag the morning of the shooting and had an argument with him over it just hours before the attack. the bag was found near the loughners' home, and police are currently testing it for dna, fingerprints, and other potential evidence linking it to loughner. law enforcement sources report that among the items discovered in the bag were several boxes of 9mm ammunition and receipts. loughner is believed to have spent the night before the shooting at a motel 6, and investigators have recovered a credit card from him. he appeared in a phoenix federal courtroom on monday to formally hear the charges against him, which include two counts of murder, two counts of attempted murder, and one count of attempting to kill a member of congress. he is now in federal custody. police say loughner had previous contacts with law enforcement, but none that would have indicated the potential for violent behavior. no evidence has been found that mental health professionals were contacted by loughner in response to concerns about his behavior. the pima county community college has released records detailing loughner's past odd and disruptive behavior on campus. the next scheduled federal hearing in the case is expected to be on january 24, 2011, in phoenix. all federal judges in arizona have recused themselves from hearing the case. judge larry burns of the u.s. district court for southern california has been designated to preside. loughner was stopped by an officer for running a red light at 7:30 a.m. on the morning of the shooting and was given a verbal warning before being released. 299	a man claimed on live msnbc television that malaysia airlines flight mh17 was shot down by howard stern's farts during the network's coverage of the tragic crash. the caller, who identified himself as staff sergeant michael boyd from the u.s. embassy in ukraine, deadpanned that the explosion that killed 295 people was caused by a blast of wind from stern's backside. msnbc anchor krystal ball didn't realize she was being pranked and asked for more information. this isn't the first time the same howard stern fan has disrupted live television during major news events. in 2013, he pranked kcal-tv in los angeles during its coverage of the manhunt for rogue lapd officer christopher dorner. he posed as a spokesman for the california department of fish and game and claimed that a regular guest on stern's radio show, "ronnie the limo driver," had been in a shootout with dorner. the caller continued to deceive the anchor until he revealed the prank, and the station hung up on him. msnbc billed the interview as an "eyewitness exclusive."
300	in a groundbreaking discovery, scientists have revised 200 million years of geologic history in the western united states by identifying multiple hidden tectonic plates deep within the earth's mantle. this new finding challenges the previously accepted theory that north america's mountainous west was formed by the movement of the undersea farallon plate. using seismic tomography and powerful computers, a research group at ludwig maximilian university in munich and the british columbia geological survey discovered several plates, including the angayucham and mezcalera plates, which they believe existed beneath long-vanished seas and played a role in forming the mountainous ridges of the western u.s. the plates, which are colder and denser than the surrounding mantle rock, were hidden because of the need for powerful computers and advanced seismic monitoring equipment, both of which have only been available in the last decade. the study was published in the journal nature.
301	a swedish man, mikael halvarsson, had his rape conviction overturned after an appeal court heard that the assault may have been a result of "sexsomnia," a sleep disorder where people engage in sexual behavior while asleep and have no memory of it. halvarsson, who was accused of assaulting a woman in april, had no recollection of the incident and was still asleep when police arrived. previous testimony from a girlfriend and halvarsson's mother about his disturbed sleeping patterns and past attempts to have sex while they were sleeping, respectively, were also presented in court. expert testimony from dr. kingman strohl, a professor of medicine and director of research at the sleep center at case medical center in cleveland, confirmed that sexsomnia is a medical diagnosis and that those affected are usually confused and scared upon learning about their actions. the condition is rare.
302	according to a map created by the us government's climate team using data from rutgers snow lab and noaa satellite images, there have been more white christmases (more snow-covered days during the week of christmas) in the us between 1990 and 2013 compared to 1966 to 1989. however, this trend only applies to certain areas, as indicated by the blue colors on the map where snow-covered days have increased up to 25%, and brown colors where they have decreased up to 25%. the overall increase in snow extent during the holiday week has been modest, but it varies greatly from place to place. according to the rutgers snow lab, northern hemisphere snow cover is declining significantly at the end of the cold season, which could have implications for global warming and a potential feed-back effect. the scientists emphasize that looking at a particular winter week for snow extent changes is not a meaningful indicator of long-term climate change and suggest focusing on monthly or seasonal averages instead.
303	christine svenningsen, a multimillionaire mother-of-seven who gave up two chinese children she adopted and tried to exclude them from her late husband's will, is now suing her ex-husband's gardening company for $3 million, claiming they overcharged her for services worth $5 million. svenningsen employed her ex-husband, john chiarella, and his brother's firm, ultimate services, to maintain her luxury island homes, cars, and boats. she accused them of providing shoddy work, neglecting to prepare her assets for the winter months, and refusing to return her property. svenningsen previously faced controversy when she put up her adopted chinese daughter, emily, for re-adoption in 2004 and attempted to exclude her from her estate. svenningsen and chiarella were married from 2010 to 2014 and divorced after she discovered he was having an affair. ultimate services denied the meritless claims in the lawsuit. svenningsen, who inherited millions from her late husband, is a prominent property owner in the thimble islands off long island sound with a reported net worth of $36 million. her properties have been featured on a&e's reality show "love prison" and are for sale for a combined $6 million.
304	an elderly woman named kathleen gummer, 76, had to wait 18 hours in the a&e department of queen elizabeth hospital in woolwich, south london, after being admitted with suspected heart failure. her daughter, jacky ware, called for medical help when her mother became unwell and was rushed to the hospital. the initial assessment and wait for a doctor were reasonable, but no bed could be found in any ward for her. she was left on a stretcher without a pillow and had to endure the wait in agony. the hospital apologized for the long wait and admitted that some beds were unavailable due to a norovirus outbreak and severe weather conditions. ms. ware expressed concerns about the proposed closure of lewisham's a&e, fearing that the increased demand on woolwich hospital would make the situation worse. the hospital spokesperson confirmed that some patients had to wait longer than usual, but admitted patients were cared for in a&e as if they were in a ward.
305	a woman named melissa arroja, who was wearing a yellow dress, had an altercation with roosters nrl player mitchell pearce at the beach haus nightspot in kings cross on saturday night. arroja took to social media to express her frustrations, saying that her yellow dress "attracts nothing but drama... and footy players." she later declined to make a formal statement to police and the investigation was dropped. pearce denied any wrongdoing through his lawyer and appeared unfazed during training, despite the ongoing investigation and an $500 infringement notice for failing to leave a licensed premises and a 48-hour ban from kings cross. the incident caused confusion for the nsw blues rugby team, as pearce's place in the origin team was uncertain.
306	during monday night's protests in ferguson following the grand jury's decision not to indict officer darren wilson for the shooting of michael brown, the flood christian church, attended by michael brown's father and family, was one of over a dozen buildings burned to the ground. pastor carlton lee, a vocal advocate for the brown family, believes that white supremacists rather than protesters were responsible for the destruction. the church, located three miles away from the protests in a remote section of country club hills, has been a non-denominational church since february 2013. rev. lee suspects his church was targeted because of his public support for the brown family and claims he has received 71 death threats. he had officiated at their wedding and had recently baptized michael brown sr., his wife, and their children. michael brown jr., who was supposed to attend the baptism, was remembered as a "big jokester." the building was once an automotive shop and rev. lee said they would rebuild.
307	firefighters are being used as makeshift ambulances due to overstretched nhs and ambulance services, increasing the risk to public safety. this practice has become more common as hospitals struggle to cope with high patient numbers, leading to long waiting times and diversion of resources. in some cases, ambulances are queuing outside hospitals, preventing them from responding to new emergency calls. an elderly woman spent 16 hours waiting to be treated in an overstretched a&e department before her family gave up, and an 88-year-old woman waited over seven hours for care after falling and breaking her nose. fire brigades union general secretary matt wrack criticized the situation, stating that it puts public safety at risk due to government cuts in both the nhs and fire and rescue services. it was reported that firefighters in york attended an elderly woman's fall instead of paramedics due to ambulance unavailability. the department of health stated that fire crews have been stabilizing patients on-site for years but denied that fire engines are being diverted as makeshift ambulances.
308	giorgio armani is planning to open a £100 million luxury hotel in london's admiralty arch, a grade i listed building overlooking trafalgar square and buckingham palace. the arch, currently in disrepair and housing dilapidated offices, is set to offer between 80 to 100 guestrooms, royal and presidential suites, and public areas including a restaurant, bar, and shops selling armani's luxury goods. armani himself is rumored to be designing every aspect of the hotel, from bespoke furnishings to the menus. the deal is at an advanced stage but depends on westminster council granting planning permission, a process that could take at least six months. prime investors capital, the developers, have not confirmed an operator for the hotel, and armani has denied any involvement. the project is in the early planning stages, and the government is consulting on security implications due to the arch's location overlooking whitehall and its proximity to buckingham palace.
309	rio ferdinand, a qpr defender, expressed his love for reality tv shows like "gogglebox" and "the fried chicken shop," but stated he has no intention of appearing on them himself. he added that he's been asked about joining "strictly come dancing" and "i'm a celebrity," but denied any interest due to his dislike of spiders, rats, and snakes. ferdinand did mention his past experience with tv, sharing that in 2006 he starred in "rio's world cup wind-ups," where he pulled pranks on england teammates. after retiring, he plans to focus on comedy and potentially creating more pranks.
310	kit symons, the caretaker manager of fulham, is in contention for the permanent manager's job after guiding the team to four wins from seven matches since taking over from felix magath. symons is facing charlton on friday, and a win could lift fulham out of the relegation zone. dan burn, a new signing, scored a last-minute equalizer against rotherham and expressed the importance of maintaining momentum for fulham. kit symons will check on the fitness of tim hoogland, while scott parker will make his return to the starting line-up against his former team. charlton will be without suspended midfielder yoni buyens and have doubts over johann berg gudmundsson and igor vetokele's availability. symons faces a tough challenge as bob peeters of charlton noted the stark contrast between magath's struggling team and the in-form side symons now leads.
311	according to recently released court documents, criminal suspects claimed toronto mayor rob ford attempted to purchase a damaging video of him months before a crack cocaine video was made public. the documents, obtained from ontario crown counsel arieelle elbaz, reveal conversations where men discussed receiving a $5,000 offer and a car from ford for the video. the mayor, who was not the focus of the investigation named project traveller and has not been charged with a crime, was indirectly mentioned in the conversations. the conversations did not offer specifics about the content of the video but allegations of ford using crack cocaine surfaced earlier this year in the media. in may 2013, the toronto star and gawker.com published stories claiming to have seen a video showing ford smoking crack. ford initially denied the allegations and refused to resign despite increasing pressure. in november 2013, ford finally admitted to smoking crack cocaine and vowed "outright war" on the city council after they transferred most of his duties to the deputy mayor. toronto authorities claim intercepted phone conversations mention ford in relation to drug deals. ford was helping clean up a city park on the day in question without his cell phone, leading to speculation that it may have been taken or left behind. the toronto mayor's television show was later canceled.
312	a man identified as james blanning threatened two banks in aspen, colorado with bombs wrapped as christmas presents and demanded tens of thousands of dollars. he left two unexploded bombs in an alley before allegedly committing suicide later that day. the bombs contained improvised incendiary devices with gasoline, cell phone actuators, and anti-tamper devices. blanning had previous criminal convictions and had a history of making threats. the bomb scare forced the evacuation of a 16-block area on new year's eve, causing significant financial losses for businesses in the area. blanning was found dead in his car with at least a rifle and possibly other weapons. authorities believe he acted alone. the threats in his note referred to the iraq war and president bush as "rove's and chaney's monkey." business owners reported substantial financial losses due to the scare.
313	max witkowski, a 23-year-old university student, died after jumping out of a window on the morning of an exam. the reason behind his actions remains a mystery, and an inquest heard that he had no obvious reasons for taking his life. his girlfriend, joanne davies, described him as a happy and calm person with no known personal problems or struggles in the weeks leading up to his death. witkowski had been in a relationship with davies and had kissed her goodbye before leaving for his exam. in a note he wrote before his death, he reassured his family and girlfriend that they were not to blame. a psychotic episode was also considered as a possible explanation for his death by the coroner, who recorded an open verdict.
314	four large castles in scotland, including orchardton hall in dumfries and galloway, ethie castle in angus, lickleyhead castle near aberdeen, and elsie castle in angus, with prices ranging from £1.35 million to £1.65 million, would not be affected by labour's proposed "mansion tax" due to their relatively low prices. these properties have between 7 and 17 bedrooms and offer unique features, such as walled gardens, tennis courts, and stunning views. in contrast, a two-bedroom, fifth-floor flat in london's knightsbridge, priced at £2.1 million, would be subject to the tax. the discrepancy between property prices in scotland and london has led to criticism from labour mps, with some expressing concern over the fairness of exempting large properties in scotland while affecting ordinary homes in london. labour's proposed mansion tax would levy an annual charge on properties valued above £2 million, with homes worth between £2 million and £3 million facing an annual bill of £3,000. despite the lower number of affected properties in scotland (approximately 0.3% of the uk total), critics argue that the tax would disproportionately hit london and the south east.
315	the author expresses their lack of trust towards the police due to personal experiences of being unfairly treated and perceived racial profiling. they compare the trayvon martin case to past incidents, such as rodney king and amadou diallo, and criticize the police handling of the investigation. the author argues that the police department's actions in initially withholding 911 tapes from the public and failing to properly investigate suggest racial bias and a cover-up. the author also criticizes the "stand your ground" law for allowing zimmerman to assert self-defense despite being the shooter and having a history of questionable 911 calls. the author concludes by expressing the fear and frustration within the black community when dealing with the police and the lack of closure and justice for victims and their families.
316	isis militants have destroyed the tomb of biblical character jonah (younis) in mosul, iraq, which was revered by muslims and christians alike. the fundamentalists previously filmed themselves damaging tombstones and graves in mosul, and in the latest attack, an isis operative set up a camera awaiting the massive explosion. the tomb was completely demolished moments after the detonation. isis believes giving special veneration to tombs and relics goes against the teachings of islam. the destruction of the tomb is the latest in a series of attacks on religious sites in mosul and tal afar. over 50 bodies have been discovered in hillah, south of baghdad, most of which were men between the ages of 25 and 40, and appeared to have been killed a few days earlier before being dumped in a remote area. the grisade discoveries have raised concerns of possible sectarian killing amidst the battle against the sunni insurgency. isis, which controlling parts of northern and western iraq, has been attacking historical sites as part of their terror campaign.
317	a jury deadlocked on jodie arias' sentence for the murder of her ex-boyfriend, travis alexander, with jury foreman william zervakos describing the decision-making process as emotional and tense. difficult testimony included accounts from alexander's relatives, leading zervakos to sympathize with arias despite her inconsistent stories. arias' lengthy trial testimony and the jury's 13-hour debate over the penalty phase were factors in their inability to reach a unanimous decision. a retrial for the penalty phase is scheduled for july 18. despite emotional scenes in the courtroom, arias remained composed on the stand during her trial, which included testimony about her and alexander's romantic relationship, religious conversion, and lies. arias, who had met alexander at a business convention in 2006, testified that he forced her into anal sex after baptizing her into the mormon faith. the case has attracted widespread media attention due to its graphic nature and lengthy presentation of testimony and evidence.
318	tracy morgan, a comedian and former "30 rock" star, has been transferred from the hospital to a rehabilitation facility to continue recovering from broken leg and broken ribs sustained in a june 7 auto accident in new jersey. wal-mart truck driver kevin roper, who is charged with death by auto and assault by auto in the crash, is currently in jail. roper was alleged to have been driving for over 13 hours, exceeding federal regulations, before colliding with morgan's limousine on the new jersey turnpike. morgan's friend, james mcnair, 62, was killed in the accident, and morgan's assistant, jeffrey millea, and another man were also seriously injured. federal investigators have reported that the truck driver was speeding at the time of the crash, which occurred on a section of the turnpike with reduced speed limit due to construction. roper's legal representative could not be reached for comment on the hours he worked before the incident. morgan's friend ardie fuqua, also in the limousine, remains in critical condition in the hospital.
319	the u.s. navy has christened the uss gerald ford, the costliest and most technologically advanced aircraft carrier ever built, which is expected to cost over $13 billion and be commissioned in 2016. the 1,106-foot warship will be able to launch 220 airstrikes per day, hold 4,000 sailors and marines, and be virtually invisible to enemy radar. it utilizes electromagnetic force to propel jets off the deck and employs software-controlled systems. the ford is the first in a new generation of aircraft carriers, with three more expected to be built, but delays and cost overruns have raised concerns. the crowd at the christening ceremony included former president gerald ford's daughter and former vice president dick cheney.
320	with approximately two million people departing for their summer holidays this weekend, those remaining in the uk face gloomy weather as the heatwave ends. the met office has issued yellow rain warnings for the south east and north, predicting thunder and storms that could lead to localized flooding. the recent hot and dry weather has caused water levels to recede, but approaching storms will bring rain to the parched land. temperatures had reached up to 33.5°c (92°f) in the previous weeks, but the forecast now indicates mostly cloudy conditions for the weekend. there have been ten flood alerts in place around the uk, with the potential for localized disruption to travel due to surface water flooding. the environment agency had downgraded seven earlier warnings. thundery showers are expected to cross the channel from france, bringing misery to the south before spreading northwards, potentially resulting in major downpours. the unsettled weather comes after the hottest july in 16 years, which led to remarkable results for fruit growers despite initially feared damage from a sodden spring.
321	in the great bear rainforest of british columbia, canada, a rare white mother bear and her eight-month-old cub were captured in a series of photographs learning how to fish. the mother bear, a subspecies of the black bear known as a 'kermode' or 'spirit bear,' brought her little one to the nearby river to teach it crucial survival skills. although the cub went home empty-handed, the mother was successful in catching a large salmon for their meal. with a population of fewer than 1,000, these bears are considered extremely rare, making this sighting the third recorded time a white mother bear and cub have been spotted together. photographer kyle breckenridge, 43, journeyed an hour and a half by paddle boat to witness the unique experience and captured the precious moments as the mother bear passed on her hunting skills to her young cub.
322	a man named rajedmiah miah, posing as a good samaritan, helped a drunk 18-year-old girl get into a taxi after she became separated from her friends during her birthday celebration in newcastle. however, instead of taking her home, he took her to his house, raped her, and locked the bedroom door. the incident left the girl emotionally devastated, and she fears the memory of her 18th birthday will haunt her for the rest of her life. miah pleaded guilty to rape and was sentenced to six years in prison and a lifetime on the sex offender register. the police are urging victims to come forward and report any similar incidents.
323	real madrid star striker cristiano ronaldo is expected to be out for the next three weeks due to a hamstring injury he suffered in the madrid derby against atletico madrid. the portuguese captain played despite an injury against lyon and also missed time due to a thigh injury in real's 7-0 victory over malaga. ronaldo will miss portugal's friendly games against chile and finland, as well as real madrid's next la liga game against sporting gijon and the first leg of the champions league quarterfinal against tottenham. in la liga action, villarreal moved up to third place with a 1-0 win over athletic bilbao, while valencia suffered its third consecutive defeat, losing 1-0 to sevilla, who boosted their hopes of qualifying for europe with a victory. espanyol suffered a seventh defeat in nine games as malaga moved off the bottom with a win over the team, while hercules dropped to last place after a loss to osasuna. racing santander and levante also won to move further away from the relegation zone.
324	two electricians have developed the world's first portable wind turbine phone charger, named trinity, which enables users to charge their devices using wind power. the turbine, which folds into a cylinder and unfolds into a vertical turbine, comes with a 15,watt generator and a 15,000 mah battery. to use, users need to pull out the aluminum legs and arrange them into a tripod or flat surface, enabling the blades to catch the wind and spin, generating power. a usb device can then be charged by plugging it into the base of the turbine. the legs can be folded back in and the blades closed automatically to close the device. the trinity turbine, which can charge a phone four to six times before needing to be recharged, is currently being funded through a kickstarter project and is expected to be commercially available by the start of next year.
325	an elderly couple escaped from their burning boat on the river ouse estuary in east yorkshire after it caught fire and quickly sank. the incident occurred around 8am and the scene was watched by nick and linda hitchen from their home. the royal national lifeboat institution (rnli) rescued the man and woman from a dinghy attached to the rear of the 36ft "moonraker" boat. the fire was so intense that the entire top of the boat melted before it sank in less than an hour. the boat had reported engine trouble before it caught fire and the cause is unknown. humber rescue warned that the heat and potential explosion hazards forced them to keep a safe distance and transfer the couple to the rescue boat. no injuries were reported. fire engines and onlookers arrived at the scene, but the boat was already a total loss. humber rescue emphasized the importance of checking safety and communication equipment before setting out on a journey. the boat was carrying a gas cylinder and 125 liters of diesel fuel when it caught fire, but it was evacuated before the firefighters arrived. the rnli and humber rescue collaborated on the rescue operation.
326	in a photograph taken just four days before reeva steenkamp's death, oscar pistorius and his girlfriend appear happy and in love while snuggling on the sofa. friends described them as south africa's golden couple. pistorius' best friend, christo menelaou, took the picture and shared that pistorius was tickling steenkamp and they were both lovers and real friends. four days later, steenkamp was dead and pistorius was in court accused of murder, claiming he shot her in error, believing a burglar had entered their home. pistorius' brother, carl, appeared in court on the same day charged with killing a woman with his 4x4 in a road accident in 2008. carl's culpable homicide charge was initially dropped but was reinstated this year. pistorius' coach, ampie louw, revealed that the paralympian will not return to the track for the rest of the year as he focuses on his court case. pistorius is accused of premeditated murder for the death of his model girlfriend, who was shot dead at his pretoria home. he is scheduled to be back in court on june 4 and is likely to stand trial before the end of 2013.
327	bulmers, a cider brand owned by heineken, made a marketing blunder by using a picture of methodist clergyman hugh price-hughes, who devoted his life to helping alcoholics and was a teetotaler, in an advertisement. the company thought they had found a photo of rev. j. bulmer, who had provided funds to start the business over a century ago. however, the mistake was discovered after heineken spent tens of thousands on the campaign, and the advertising standards authority (asa) received a complaint. the company removed the advertisements and posters after the asa ruled against them. this error occurred shortly after the asa dismissed another complaint regarding a bulmers television advertisement that implied the success of social occasions depends on alcohol consumption. the spokesperson for heineken expressed sorrow for the mistake and made a donation to the church where price-hughes served as a minister in the 1870s.
328	in the finals of "the great british bake off," viewers were shocked when mary berry announced that frances quinn won, despite her cakes having "style over substance" and tasting less impressive than those of the other finalists, ruby and kimberley. the article questions the validity of quinn's victory, suggesting that there might be other, more deserving bakers in the uk. meanwhile, the author expresses doubt in paul hollywood's judgment after his marital infidelity and criticizes the portrayal of contestants' personalities by the production team. the article concludes with a reflection on how the show's popularity lies in its emphasis on substance, but frances' win seems to undermine that.
329	a young mother, joanna bull, died after her car collided with a slow-moving hgv on the m40 near bicester, leaving her five-week-old baby, ruby, unharmed. witnesses were unable to explain why joanna's car, a peugeot 406 estate, did not attempt to stop or avoid the lorry. the inquest heard that joanna may have fallen asleep at the wheel, suffered a medical episode, been distracted, or lost concentration. the accident occurred as joanna was traveling to visit her mother with her husband and newborn child. ruby was rescued by other motorists and taken to a hospital as a precaution but was not injured. the cause of joanna's death was multiple blunt injuries, and there was no evidence of alcohol, drugs, or mechanical failure involved. the family paid tribute to joanna, describing her as a "vibrant, beautiful, and caring" person. the verdict was recorded as accidental death.
330	steven gerrard is set to relive the painful memories of liverpool's failed premier league title challenge and england's disappointing world cup performance during a meeting. the slip that led to chelsea's win over liverpool on april 27 was a deciding factor in their defeat, and gerrard has suffered the "worst three months of his life" since then. he admits that revisiting the events will be difficult but is not shy away from addressing the difficult subjects, acknowledging that it was a cruel experience. however, he remains determined to move on and use the disappointment to drive him on, as liverpool prepares for the new season with renewed focus. gerrard has been a key player for liverpool, providing thirteen goals and creating fifteen more, and has formed a close bond with manager brendan rodgers. the captain's performances since returning from injury in january have been exemplary, and rodgers has singled him out as the team's "quarterback" for the upcoming season. gerrard also retired from international football after the world cup, citing the difficulty of being away from family as a factor in his decision. liverpool has made several new signings to strengthen the team, including adam lallana, lazar markovic, and dejan lovren, and will need to cope without the talismanic luis suarez, who moved to barcelona. gerrard remains confident in the team's ability to challenge for the title and has urged his teammates to focus on their goals and not just make up the numbers.
