497	britain's aid funding to india came under criticism again as india successfully entered mars' orbit, becoming the first asian country to reach the red planet. india, a major defense spender and having its own aid program, received £1.1 billion from britain over four years. britain's overall aid spending is rising by 30% this year, but defense and other areas have seen cuts due to budget deficit. critics question why india spends on space when many of its people live in poverty. india's mars orbiter mission, costing £45 million, successfully entered mars' orbit on wednesday, making history. india's pm narendra modi hailed the achievement, but critics called it a "delusional quest for superpower status." russia plans a manned spacecraft to the moon by 2030.
498	hermione norris, a british tv actress known for her roles in "cold feet" and "spooks," revealed in a recent interview that she now shops at asda's budget range due to the decreased pay in british television. norris, who earned £75,000 per episode for the final series of "cold feet" in 2003, said times have changed and british television pay is much lower now. in contrast to her previous statement about shopping at waitrose, she now values living in the uk and working in british drama over high fees in america. norris first gained prominence in "cold feet" in 1997 and has since worked consistently on shows such as "wire in the blood," "kingdom," and "spooks." she is currently set to appear in two new bbc one dramas, "crimson field" and "in the club." norris has spoken about the challenges of balancing work and family life and the myth of women being able to have it all.
499	valeria lukyanova, a human barbie known for her doll-like appearance, was attacked and hospitalized outside her home in odessa, ukraine on halloween night. she claimed two men suddenly appeared and assaulted her, causing injuries to her head and jaw, without attempting to rob her. lukyanova has been subjected to anonymous threats for the past two years and insists she has undergone only breast augmentation surgery, despite rumors of additional plastic surgeries. she has recently expressed a desire to change her image from ukrainian barbie to amazon woman, admiring the strong female warriors from greek mythology and hoping to star in a movie with british actor callum blue.
500	the ongoing debate in the u.s. congress over the gop's attempt to repeal the affordable care act (aca) and the naacp's response to mitt romney's proposal to eliminate a "nonessential" obamacare program highlights the deep divide in america over healthcare. in contrast, brazil has a long-standing commitment to universal healthcare as a fundamental human right, with everyone expected to contribute. the sistema único de saúde (sus) is funded through various taxes at different government levels and is decentralized, involving state and municipal governments in policy-making. brazil's healthcare system has improved life expectancy significantly but faces challenges, including insufficient funding, access to care in challenging areas, and shortages of healthcare personnel and infrastructure. brazil's commitment to healthcare as a shared responsibility is rooted in its history of social and political activism and has gained popular support. the u.s. could learn from brazil's approach by putting aside differences over the aca and viewing it as a shared responsibility and human right. despite sus's challenges, it serves as an example of the importance of ensuring a robust healthcare system for its citizens.
501	arsenal were leading the premier league table last year, but have since fallen 13 points behind chelsea. fans believe the addition of alexis sanchez was not enough to challenge for the title, and arsenal needs to add a "spine" to the team - a world-class goalkeeper, centerback, defensive midfielder, and a top-level striker. arsenal's fans' song mocks their rivals tottenham for selling gareth bale to real madrid and signing mesut ozil while they did. bale's direct playing style and ability to score goals is reminiscent of thierry henry at arsenal, making him an attractive option for fans. despite criticism from real madrid fans, bale's style of play addresses arsenal's issues of shooting and overplaying in the box, making him an ideal candidate to fill a key position in the team.
502	in a new study, researchers from the max planck institute for human cognitive and brain sciences found that infants as young as seven months can subconsciously recognize fear in someone's eyes by looking at the whites of the eyes, or sclerae, in just 50 milliseconds. the study, published in the journal proceedings of the national academy of sciences, involved eeg tests on 24 and 22 babies, during which they were shown images of fearful or happy eyes for 50 milliseconds each. the results showed that the babies' brains reacted more strongly to fearful eyes than happy ones. the study suggests that humans' prominent sclerae evolved as a communication aid, with directions linked to emotional states. this ability to quickly recognize emotions from eyes is a vital foundation for the development of social interactive skills in humans.
503	eddie williams, a former alabama university football player, admitted to having an affair with his former high school athletic director, karissa wesley, when he was a senior in high school. the relationship was discovered after a former student reported hearing them having sex and a hand-written letter from another former student, andre allen, was discovered, alleging that williams smoked marijuana and drank alcohol with wesley on multiple occasions. despite initial denials, williams later confessed to the affair. wesley has also denied the allegations and is currently in a relationship with the school's football and basketball coach. williams was kicked out of alabama university earlier this year after being arrested for a series of robberies and possession of a firearm. he is currently awaiting trial. the school district found the relationship between wesley and williams to be in violation of its supervisor-subordinate relationship policy, and superintendent bill husfelt is recommending her termination. williams was considered the top player in florida when he joined alabama university.
504	prosecutors in indiana have dropped charges against kristine bunch, whose murder conviction in the 1995 death of her three-year-old son, tony, was overturned. the indiana court of appeals ordered a new trial for bunch in march, finding that evidence used to convict her was outdated, weak, and wrongly withheld from the defense. bunch was released on bond in august after spending 16 years in prison. prosecutors plan to refile charges as their investigation is still open. the original trial heard that bunch poured kerosene in her son's bedroom and living room before setting the mobile home on fire. however, new evidence, including tests showing that tony died from carbon monxide poisoning and not burns, cast doubt on the original conviction. bunch was jubilant upon her release and looks forward to doing everyday things like shopping, eating out, and using the internet, which she had never seen before. she plans to go to law school and work in criminal law to help wrongfully convicted inmates.
505	women's tennis experienced a significant 40-year journey of self-empowerment and financial growth, transforming from a tour with total prize money of $309,000 in 1971 to projected $107 million in 2022. the wta's "strong is beautiful" campaign and high-profile players like serena williams have helped the sport attract lucrative sponsorships and global appeal. the pioneering nine women, including billie jean king, battled for equality despite struggling with limited opportunities and meager earnings. their fight led to the formation of the women's tennis association (wta) in 1973, which marked its 40th anniversary with a "40 love" commemorative campaign. the global circuit now covers tournaments in asia, australia, new zealand, and europe, attracting record crowds and revenue. current top players like victoria azarenka and serena williams have earned seven-figure incomes, surpassing their male counterparts like roger federer and novak djokovic. the wta's emphasis on prolonging careers and maintaining player health has extended average career lengths from 12 to 15 years, keeping marquee players at the top longer. despite the success, finding a new main sponsor to replace sony, which ended its partnership in 2012, remains a pressing business goal.
506	ralph ellis recaps the latest football news, focusing on several key players and their performances over the weekend. luise suarez is the odds-on favorite for pfa player of the year due to his impressive goal-scoring feats and disciplinary record. john terry, who has played every minute for chelsea except for england games, was surprisingly left out of the shortlist. southampton'sluke shaw had a tough game against marc albrighton of aston villa and gave away a yellow card for a foul. man utd striker javier hernandez, despite arriving late to tackle the game at goodison park, failed to make an impact with just one blocked shot. joel ward, a £400,000 transfer from portsmouth to crystal palace two years ago, has played every minute in various positions since tony pulis took over, impressively keeping matt jarvis quiet at west ham. stoke city's jon walters sits on the bench after serving a three-match ban, playing only five minutes against cardiff and making an impact with a hit on the bar and two chances for teammates. arsenal's mesut ozil had a disappointing game at hull but showed glimpses of his creativity. liverpool's joe allen, despite being small at 5ft 6in, held his own against bigger opponents and had ten tackles and two shots during his debut game against norwich. ian holloway's signing of stefan maierhofer, a former wolverhampton flop, has had an impact at millwall. watford's strategy of signing players from their owners' other teams, granada and udinese, hasn't led to success but provides excitement for fans, with spanish winger albert riera making his mark with a goal on his debut for the team. burton albion striker billy kee, who was once valued at £1million by former boss paul peschisolido, has been a valuable addition to the team, scoring 37 goals during his
507	didier deschamps, the french national soccer team coach, has filed a civil lawsuit against samir nasri's girlfriend, anara atanes, after she publicly criticized him for omitting nasri from the world cup squad. atanes, an english-born singer, made a foul-mouthed rant on twitter, and although she later apologized, deschamps will be taking legal action. nasri, who was also left out of the 2010 world cup squad, is considering his future with the national team. the french football federation released a statement condemning atanes' remarks and supporting deschamps. atanes had tweeted that she did not intend to offend the french people, only the football management. nasri, a midfielder for manchester city, was surprising omission from the 23-man squad and seven on standby, and he acknowledged that he was aware of his exclusion before it was announced. patrice evra, a former france captain, expressed his surprise at nasri's absence. deschamps defended his decision, stating that nasri was not an ideal squad player due to his lack of performance with france and his unhappiness when being a substitute. nasri trained with his manchester city teammates on their post-season trip to abu dhabi.
508	isis militants are reportedly responsible for the execution of over 300 members of the sunni albu nimr tribe, including women and children, according to iraq's ministry of human rights. the killings took place over the weekend near the town of hit and marks an unusual escalation of violence against civilians by the militant group. albu nimr tribesmen have been fighting against isis, but have expressed frustration with the lack of support from the iraqi government and international coalition members. the albu nimr, who number in the tens of thousands, are prepared to take back the town of hit from isis control. the tribe has a history of resistance against oppressive regimes, including under former iraqi dictator saddam hussein. the u.s. state department condemned the attacks and expressed support for the iraqi forces fighting against isis. u.s. advisers are working to improve the capabilities of the iraqi army and the iraqis are pushing back against isis with a series of offensives throughout the country.
509	a retired tennessee attorney, jon setzer, 74, was killed and his wife, marion setzer, 72, was critically injured when a bomb exploded at their home in lebanon on monday, february 10, 2014. the note with the bomb was discovered inside their home, but the contents and motive behind the attack are still under investigation. the tbi and atf are working together to determine how the parcel was delivered to the house and if setzer had any disputes over his career as a bankruptcy lawyer. the setzers were described as dedicated professionals and community members who had lost their son in a tragic dog attack years ago. an $8,000 reward has been offered for information leading to a conviction in the case. the explosion shattered their well-built home and left the community shaken. no public disciplinary actions were found against setzer in court system and bar association records.
510	georgia davis, a 19-year-old british woman, is being kept in the hospital for at least six months to lose weight and get a gastric band fitted due to obesity-related health issues. she currently weighs 52 stone (312 lbs) and has shed three stones in a week on a strict diet. davis had been ordering up to eight kebabs with two large bottles of coke from a local takeaway each week, amassing a bill of £5,000 annually. she had also been sneaking junk food deliveries past her parents. davis fell ill and had to be cut out of her house in aberdare, south wales, last week. her orders for junk food from tesco and asda were discovered by her parents. she suffered from complications including diabetes, kidney failure, spine, joint, and skin problems. davis, who had gained weight after moving back in with her parents to care for her sick father, was targeted by cyberbullies on facebook. her best friend jade tarrant revealed that davis had lost weight when she lived with her but gained it back when she returned to care for her father. davis is currently receiving treatment and her clinical condition is stable.
511	a six-year-old boy accidentally shot and killed a 12-year-old girl at a birthday party in delta junction, alaska, with a pellet gun. the incident occurred when the boy, who did not know the gun was loaded, discharged it by mistake, causing a fatal injury to marina rybak in the neck. the pellet gun was owned by a relative and given to the boy without adult supervision. it is unclear if criminal charges will be filed.
512	american idol finalists kree harrison and candice glover gave powerful ballad performances at the nokia theater in los angeles on wednesday. afterward, they talked with judge keith urban about vulnerability, staying confident, and their emotions leading up to the coin flip that decided who would perform first in the finals. both women admitted they initially struggled with emotional songs but learned to connect with the lyrics and show their vulnerability on stage. during the coin flip, harrison whispered to glover to ask which position she preferred, demonstrating selflessness. despite the looming results show, they remained supportive and spent the night before the finale watching tv together.
513	dr. sally norton, an nhs consultant specializing in weight loss and upper gastrointestinal surgery, expressed concern over the high number of obese individuals who are also undernourished. she highlighted the issue in the us, where many people consume a diet consisting of pizza, fries, crisps (chips), pasta, rice, biscuits, and cakes, which provides a large amount of calories but few nutrients. she criticized the hospital environment, which offers sugary and fatty snacks and drinks, and the lack of nutrition training for doctors, who are encouraged to treat diseases related to poor nutrition with expensive drugs rather than healthier food. norton emphasized the importance of nutrition as medicine, and how the hippocratic oath, which encourages physicians to "let food be thy medicine," still holds true in the 21st century. she noted that malnutrition is a common issue in the uk, and while not at starvation levels, many individuals lack sufficient calories, protein, vitamins, and minerals. she urged individuals to focus on consuming real, fresh, whole foods and to pay attention to the nutrient content of their diets. norton also cited several studies that demonstrate the positive impact of healthy eating on various health conditions, including heart disease, diabetes, mental health, stroke, and cancer. she ended by quoting thomas edison, who believed that doctors of the future would cure and prevent diseases with nutrition.
514	eden hazard jokingly questioned chelsea team-mate diego costa's age, suggesting he looks older than his stated 25 years. costa impressed on his premier league debut at burnley, scoring the equalizer in a 3-1 win, and chelsea also welcomed cesc fabregas, filipe luis, didier drogba, and thibaut courtois to the team. hazard praised the new signings and praised manager jose mourinho's hunger to win, calling him a "very good man." hazard, belgium's talisman during their quarter-final run in the world cup, jokingly named french fries, beer, chocolate, and himself as the best things about his homeland. the first weekly winner of fantasy football was an exeter fan who benefited from having two hull defenders on his team.
515	bonnie raitt, a legendary rock musician with a career spanning over four decades, reflected on her enduring passion for music before her first full-scale concert in seven years. raitt took a break from her music career to deal with personal losses and issues, but the passion for performing became too strong to ignore. her latest album, "slipstream," which includes cover songs and reached billboard's top 10, has been well-received by fans. known for her interpretations of other songwriters' output, raitt shared her process of searching for the perfect tunes to cover, including her recent rendition of gerry rafferty's "right down the line." raitt remains humble and jokes about her age while consistently putting the spotlight on her band and encouraging political activism. she's currently involved in raising awareness about nuclear power concerns through musicians united for safe energy (muse), and advocates for music education for children to enhance their overall development.
516	mandy shepherd, a 27-year-old woman with mitochondrial disease, died by natural causes after collapsing in the bath. she had been mocked and attacked in the street due to her slurred speech and muscle weakness, which led people to falsely assume she was a drug addict. despite this, she continued to volunteer at a youth center and refused to let the bullies discourage her. she was diagnosed with mitochondrial disease at the age of 13 and spent her life dealing with various symptoms including poor growth, hearing and visual impairments, and muscle weakness. in the latter stages of her life, she struggled with getting in and out of the bath. her mother described her as brave, stubborn, independent, and friendly, and she died due to a cardiac arrest caused by her illness. an inquest in preston ruled that she died as a result of natural causes, specifically mitochondrial cytopathy with kearns-sayre syndrome.
517	rafael nadal, the reigning u.s. open champion and world no. 2, announced on monday that he will miss this year's u.s. open due to a right wrist injury. nadal injured his wrist after wimbledon and withdrew from the masters events in toronto and cincinnati. fans were disappointed with the news, as nadal is known for his love for the u.s. open and his past successes at the tournament. nadal has a history of injuries, with his knees and back being the biggest culprits in the past. his absence means roger federer will be the new second seed, and with federer having a strong summer, his chances of winning a record-extending 18th major have improved. juan martin del potro, the 2009 u.s. open champion, also withdrew with a wrist injury. the tournament begins next monday.
518	paula deen, who faced backlash last year after admitting she had used the n-word, is attempting to rebuild her career with a digital cooking network. her son jamie's questionable tweet of kissing an older african-american woman named "jellyroll" jones, an employee accused of being forced to dress in an aunt jemima-style costume in paula's restaurant, has reignited accusations of racism. the food network reportedly cancelled jamie's cooking show amid the controversy. paula returned to tv herself with the launch of her digital cooking and entertainment network. the network, to be available on tablets, phones, and home computers, is part of a comeback strategy following her deal with an investment firm. however, a speaking tour and the launch of the network have been met with criticism and disappointment from fans.
519	a navy seal team from pennsylvania, identified as petty officer 1st class nicolas d. checque of monroeville, was killed during a daring rescue mission in afghanistan to free an american doctor, dr. dilip joseph, from taliban militants last week. checque, 28, was a member of seal team six and died of combat-related injuries. his friends and former teachers remember him as a driven individual with a strong belief in serving his country. president barack obama called checque a heroic and dedicated soldier. the mission, which involved us and afghan forces, was ordered when intelligence showed that dr. joseph was in imminent danger of injury or death. the other two captives were freed several hours before the mission to rescue dr. joseph. checque was awarded a bronze star and several other military accolades during his 10-year military career. the pentagon has not specified whether checque was on the mission to kill osama bin laden last year.
520	in gaza, bakir bidwan and his family, along with thousands of other gazans, are seeking safety as the conflict between israel and gaza militants enters its 10th day. bidwan and his large family, consisting of eleven people, had to leave their home due to warnings of impending bombings in the neighborhoods of shujayya and zeitoun. israeli military automated calls and leaflets had warned of upcoming attacks on these areas. growing tension and danger have forced people to search for safety, with many evacuating their homes and seeking shelter in united nations-run schools or other temporary havens. markets are closed, signs of conflict visible, and civilians like um mohamed run errands while leaving family members behind. many expressed their anger towards israel, blaming them for the situation, as gazans express frustration with the limited exits, including the rafah border crossing with egypt and import restrictions from israel. medical teams continue to work in dangerous conditions amidst the chaos, with refugees seeking refuge in schools like the u.n.-run one bidwan and his family have now taken shelter in.
521	a judge in clearwater, florida dismissed several potential jurors in the casey anthony murder trial due to discussions about the case in the jury room during the second day of selection. at least a dozen potential jurors admitted to talking about the case, which led to their dismissal. the judge asked potential jurors about any conversations regarding the case and if it went beyond just a reference to it. the jury selection process continues with groups of 50 being questioned, and they need to find 12 jurors and eight alternates. there have been concerns about anthony receiving a fair trial due to intense media coverage surrounding the case, leading to the move to clearwater to draw from a less influenced jury pool. the trial, scheduled to start may 17, will take place in orlando's orange county courthouse, and jurors will be transported there once selected. potential jurors have been asked about financial hardships and their views on the death penalty, among other things. casey anthony faces seven charges, including capital murder in the death of her 2-year-old daughter, caylee.
522	skid row in los angeles, described as the last stop at the bottom of the world by its residents, is a notorious area known for its high population of homeless individuals, drug dealers, and pimps. australian documentary filmmaker shanks rajendran faced hostility during his attempts to film the area, with some mistaking him for an undercover cop. with the help of local resident lavell putman, rajendran was able to gain access to the lives of skid row residents, revealing their struggles with addiction and survival. the documentary, titled "los scandalous," shows the prevalence of drug use and deals, with many dealers coming from outside the area to exploit the weak. the police rarely interfere, acting only as peacekeepers. the documentary also features interviews with a pimp and his prostitute, who speak about their experiences on the streets. despite his involvement in the project, putman was eventually arrested for robbery and assault after filming stopped. rajendran aims to shine a light on the reality of skid row, which he describes as a harsh and unforgiving place.
523	lindsay lohan, who has a history of drunken driving convictions, probation violations, and a shoplifting charge, expressed regret for her past mistakes but predicted that she will win an oscar in the future during an interview with jay leno. she is currently facing legal troubles, including a 120-day jail sentence for a probation violation and a trial for allegedly stealing a necklace. lohan, who is scheduled to play john gotti's wife in a movie, said her latest legal setback was a wake-up call and that she intends to take responsibility for her actions. she has previously admitted to a drug addiction and has spent eight months in substance abuse rehab. despite her challenges, lohan remains optimistic and hopes to be winning an oscar when she turns 30.
524	the broadway hotel in blackpool was criticized by a retired couple, tony jenkinson and his wife jan, for unsanitary conditions during their one-night stay. the hotel charged them £100 extra as part of a "no bad review policy," leading to negative publicity and a controversy. images reveal the hotel's dirty rooms with peeling walls, stained carpets, and worn socks left in drawers. the hotel, ranked 858 out of 894 places to stay in blackpool, has faced complaints about mouldy bedrooms and staff drinking alcohol while serving breakfast. blackpool council has spoken with the hotel and asked them to remove their unfair trading practice, and the couple is expecting a refund.
525	geoffrey canada, a former student from the south bronx, laments the persistent failure of the us public education system, particularly for poor children, in living up to its potential and providing opportunities for academic success and the american dream. he emphasizes the need for large-scale reform, drawing on scientific research to inspire innovation and improvements. canada suggests extending the school year, prioritizing early childhood education, and incorporating better health care and wrap-around services to help children succeed. he also highlights the importance of evaluating and assessing students' progress in real time and allocating sufficient financial resources to research and development. canada calls on americans to recognize the crisis in the education system and advocate for dramatic reform.
526	according to routehappy's new statistics, the number of flights with wi-fi access is increasing, with a 24% chance for international flights and 66% chance for domestic us flights. the connection quality and speed are also improving. nordic airlines, such as icelandair and norwegian, lead the connectivity charge, offering wi-fi on over 80% of their flights. delta is the leading us airline, providing wi-fi on over 3,500 daily flights. other international airlines, including etihad airways, singapore airlines, lufthansa, and iberia, offer wi-fi on a lesser percentage of their flights.
527	a vaccine against meningitis b, which causes hundreds of deaths annually in the uk, mostly among under-5s, has been approved by european experts but may not be available on the nhs before the end of the year. the vaccine, called bexsero, is the first to prevent the leading cause of life-threatening bacterial meningitis in the uk. the joint committee on vaccination and immunisation (jcvi) must decide whether the jab will be part of the nhs routine immunisation programme, and it is expected to be given as routine jabs for babies from age two months. the government is urged to introduce the vaccine into the immunisation schedule as soon as possible to save lives and spare families from suffering. bexsero will be available privately in the 'middle of the year' when supplies are released by makers novartis. no price has been set yet. the vaccine produces antibodies against at least 73% of 1,000 meningitis b strains found in europe. despite eu approval, a swift decision from the uk authorities is needed to save lives.
528	dr. brent hall, the watauga county medical examiner in north carolina, resigned after failing to notify police about carbon monoxide (co) killing an elderly couple, daryl and shirley jenkins, in april. in june, an 11-year-old boy, jeffrey williams, also died in the same room (225) at the best western plus blue ridge plaza hotel due to co poisoning. although toxicology reports confirmed the jenkins' deaths were due to co, boone police didn't receive this information for ten days, during which time other guests, including jeffrey and his mother, stayed in the room. dr. hall had the report on his desk but didn't prioritize it, and he suddenly resigned without addressing the case. three deaths in total occurred in room 225 due to co, and authorities are continuing to investigate the incident.
529	hugo lloris, the tottenham goalkeeper, is discussing the importance of mental strength and confidence in helping spurs compete with the premier league's top teams. he believes that progression for the team requires overcoming psychological blocks and achieving success in big games against rivals like arsenal. lloris has been a standout player for spurs since joining in 2012 but has recognized the club's struggles in the past few years. following a disappointing start to the season, he emphasizes the need for the team to improve and believes that mauricio pochettino, their new manager, has the right attitude and leadership skills to help them rise to the top. lloris also acknowledges that results, particularly against top-four rivals, carry more weight in determining the team's success. he shared his memories of first watching pochettino play for psg and bordeaux and is optimistic about the team's progress under the argentine manager. despite signing a five-year deal, lloris admits that his future with the team may be contingent on spurs' ability to qualify for the champions league. he remains focused on his work and the team's goals while offering support for the get to know cancer campaign, which aims to raise awareness of cancer and promote early diagnosis among tottenham fans.
530	in a video published by luke garratt on march 1, 2014, alexander the meerkat at whitehouse farm centre in morpeth, northumberland, is tickled, resulting in him making a laugh-like sound. meerkats, which are indigenous to africa and part of the mongoose family, are known for their vocalizations, and all seem to enjoy being tickled, bringing amusement to visitors. alexander is an adult-sized meerkat known for his vocal expressions and upright posture, which they use to scan their desert habitats for predators. they have a varied diet consisting of lizards, birds, insects, and fruit. meerkats are social creatures that make noise and have unique personalities, often demanding more tickling when it stops.
531	justin bieber was arrested in miami on january 23, 2014, for drag racing a rented yellow lamborghini against friend and rapper khalil sharieff in a red ferrari, at about 4am. footage from home surveillance cameras shows the police following bieber's car just seconds after the race. bieber was charged with driving under the influence, driving with an expired license, resisting arrest, and drag racing. however, the miami-dade county state attorney's office stated that no charges had been dropped yet and that there was no update on the case. the incident came after reports that bieber had egged his neighbor's house, which was later found to be untrue. the singer jetted out of miami after his arrest and was later photographed in panama with model chantel jeffries. friends claimed that bieber smokes "a ton" of marijuana daily, takes prescription drugs, and spends £5,000 a week on marijuana. his father, jeremy, was also reportedly present during the incident and helped clear the street for the race. it was speculated that only his on-again, off-again girlfriend selena gomez had the power to curb his behavior.
532	amanda leve, a 16-year-old tomboy from philadelphia, wanted to join archbishop ryan high school's wrestling team. however, the catholic school denied her application due to its beliefs against girls participating in contact sports. amanda, who has been practicing brazilian jiu-jitsu, boxing, and muay thai for several years, competes in various competitions across the united states, often against male opponents. she has already surpassed divisions in her weight classes and aspires to participate in octagon cage fighting by the age of 18. amanda's father shared that the school has not given a definite decision but the wrestling season will end before the archbishops' meeting in april.
533	in the early 20th century, lysol, an antiseptic soap, was marketed as a popular and effective form of contraception despite its ineffectiveness and risks. ads during this time featured quotes from 'expert european doctors' endorsing lysol as safe and gentle for use as a contraceptive, even going as far as using euphemisms like 'marriage hygiene.' however, lysol was not an effective contraceptive and could cause vaginal burns, inflammation, and even death. advertisers continued to encourage its use due to the illegality of contraception and abortion during that era. by 1933, a study revealed that nearly half of the women who used lysol as a form of birth control ended up pregnant. despite the dangerous side effects, the use of lysol as a contraceptive persisted until the introduction of the oral contraceptive pill in 1960. the practice of using lysol for contraception is now considered a relic of the past and comes with warnings on the label.
534	in march 2013, birds eye and taco bell acknowledged that their beef products in the uk contained horsemeat after tests revealed the presence of horse dna in chili con carne from belgium and taco bell's ground beef taco filling. the products, including birds eye's traditional spaghetti bolognese and beef lasagne, and taco bell's taco filling, have been withdrawn from sale. other companies affected by the horsemeat scandal include ikea, catering supplier brakes, findus, nestle, tesco, asda, burger king, whitbread, and schools and hospitals. the scandal led to calls for more stringent regulations to restore consumer confidence in the food industry. mcdonald's confirmed its products did not contain horsemeat, and sales of frozen burgers and ready meals had decreased by 43% and 13%, respectively. seeds butchers in preston, uk, gained attention with a humorous sign, "only fools eat horses," which has boosted sales.
535	members of two brooklyn gangs, the very crispy gangsters and the rockstarz, used facebook to boast about their violent actions, leading to nearly 50 arrests in connection to three murders and 12 shootings over the past three years. the gangs terrorized parts of the east new york community, with at least one shooting taking place near martin luther king jr. park. three individuals have been killed, including a 17-year-old member of the very crispy gangsters and a 17-year-old rockstarz associate. bragging posts on facebook helped investigators draw a virtual map of their activities, resulting in the identification and arrest of 41 suspects, while eight remain at large. the gangs showed no regard for innocent bystanders, and at least four people, including a police officer and a 10-year-old boy, were injured in the shootings. one suspect was overheard threatening witnesses during a recorded call.
536	a helicopter pilot died and two others were severely injured when two police helicopters collided during a landing at berlin's olympic stadium on thursday. several other people were also injured with moderate or slight injuries. the cause of the crash, which occurred around 10:15 a.m. local time (5:15 a.m. et), is still unknown, according to federal police spokesman meik gauer. it is believed that the rotors of the two helicopters struck each other during the landing.
537	a severe heatwave in southern australia has resulted in hundreds of bushfires, thousands of lightning storms, and extreme conditions at the australian open, where players and ball boys have collapsed due to the heat. temperatures have exceeded 40°c in many areas, and some places have reached up to 45°c and above, causing melting water bottles and parasols providing little relief. several players and spectators have experienced hallucinations, fainting, and heat exhaustion. the heat also sparked numerous bushfires, leaving a 49-year-old woman hospitalized with burns and smoke inhalation after her home was destroyed. fire bans are in place in victoria and south australia, and relief is unlikely until the end of the week. victoria and adelaide are experiencing prolonged highs of up to 45°c, with melbourne and adelaide facing record-breaking temperatures of 46°c and 45°c, respectively. thunderstorms have also contributed to the devastating conditions, causing more bushfires and significant property damage. this week is predicted to be the hottest on record for adelaide, and fire services are bracing for extreme conditions, with victoria and western australia experiencing bushfires. the national weather bureau recently launched a new heatwave forecast service and defined a heatwave as three or more days of unusually high maximum and minimum temperatures in any area. heatwaves are australia's leading cause of natural hazard-related deaths, claiming more lives than any other natural hazard over the past 200 years. severe and extreme heatwaves pose significant health risks, particularly for the elderly.
538	during the england vs. italy match, wayne rooney took a corner for england with a chance to equalize. however, his effort was lackluster and went out for a goalkick without touching any players. rooney, known for his success with corners for manchester united and england, missed horribly this time, disappointing teammates and fans alike. an embarrassing moment for rooney, england's number 10. meanwhile, in a separate incident during liverpool's title fight against chelsea, espas took a short corner which was eventually led to chelsea's second goal, handing manchester city the title initiative. although rooney's corner kick seemed more embarrassing, england fans should be thankful it didn't lead to a goal that could have ended their group stage match.
539	lord justice scott baker, who conducted a review of the extradition treaty between the uk and the us, admitted he had not met or spoken to gary mckinnon, a british man with asperger's syndrome facing hacking charges in the us. instead, he visited the us to speak with american prosecutors, despite criticism that the treaty is biased in favor of the us and requires stronger evidence for the extradition of its citizens. critics also criticized lord justice scott baker for not consulting british citizens affected by the treaty, such as gary mckinnon, david birmingham, and babar ahmad. the review, which did not look at individual cases but at extradition in general, received criticism from senior coalition politicians and was seen as a "whitewash" by mckinnon's mother.
540	amie smith, 23, pleaded guilty to causing unnecessary suffering to her staffordshire bull terrier, rocky, at newcastle magistrates' court. the emaciated body of rocky was discovered in smith's home, surrounded by rubbish and faeces, with ribs protruding and an empty water bowl. tins of dog food with dents on them suggested that the starving animal had chewed on them. smith, who has mental health issues and a history of domestic violence, asked a friend to take care of rocky while she went away for six weeks. the rspca inspector reported an overpowering smell and an extremely cluttered kitchen. magistrates adjourned sentencing until later this month for report preparation.
541	the uss guardian, a u.s. navy minesweeper, has been grounded on tubbahata reef in the sulu sea since january 17. crews plan to cut up the hull of the 1,312-ton vessel into three parts after identifying strong points for lifting. weather is the main concern, as good weather is needed for six consecutive days to begin the cutting and lifting process. salvage teams have already removed the ship's superstructure and are taking care to remove parts containing oil and fuel residue to minimize damage to the environmentally sensitive unesco world heritage site, which is home to over 850 fish species, 350 coral species, and various marine life. the reef is estimated to have been damaged by about 4,000 square meters. the navy is responsible for cleaning up the debris and restoring the reef as much as possible, while an investigation into the cause of the grounding is ongoing. navy officials have reported that the location of the reef was mistakenly placed nine miles off on the digital navigation charts used by the navy.
542	the house at 2207 seymour street in cleveland, where kidnapping victim gina dejesus was held captive for a decade, is being demolished and bulldozed to disappear. the city hopes to make the property disappear, with google already having removed it from its street view feature. the land bank, which seized the house and donated it, has not revealed plans for the land beneath it. dejesus and her parents will be present to witness the demolition. ariel castro, the former school bus driver who pleaded guilty to kidnapping, rape, and assault, was sentenced to life in prison without parole in july. neighbors are relieved to see the house go, with some worried about scavengers trying to sell rubble as 'murderabilia'. dejesus made a public appearance on stage with rapper nelly, while michelle knight stepped out to thank neighbors.
543	the magna carta, a foundational document of british democracy, was sealed under a 2,000-year-old yew tree at ankerwycke in 1215. to preserve the tree's genetics, saplings have been planted in edinburgh's botanic gardens as part of a conservation project. known for its historical significance, the ankerwycke yew has been threatened by diseases, climate change, and development. it has a girth of 26ft and is situated near runnymede, where the signing of the magna carta is believed to have taken place. the tree is a part of the estate of richard de montfichet, one of the 25 barons who witnessed the event. experts are losing ancient yews due to various reasons, and efforts are being made to conserve every single one. the tree, along with magna carta manuscripts, is being celebrated during the 800th anniversary of the signing of the document. the ankerwycke yew was named among britain's 50 greatest trees in 2002. saplings from other significant yew trees, including one from william wordsworth's poem, have been added to the hedge.
544	a coroner ruled that a young mother, christine harrison, who tragically lost her life in a car accident in march 2013, might have survived if the police had acted differently following an earlier accident at the same spot. the earlier incident, which occurred at around 4:30 am, involved a man whose car aquaplaned on standing water and left the road, but no signs were erected to warn motorists of the hazard. the police attended the scene but decided not to close the road or leave warning signs, citing lack of resources and protocol. less than an hour later, christine harrison was traveling along the same road in a car being driven by an uninsured and unlicensed driver when the vehicle hit the same patch of standing water, causing the driver to lose control, and the car veered off the road. christine, who was not wearing a seatbelt, was killed in the collision. the coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death but expressed concerns about the police officer's decision-making process and recommended a review of training to ensure risk is managed appropriately. the police spokesperson confirmed that a local review had been carried out, and recommendations were made. christine's family was extended condolences by both the police and the officers involved in the inquest.
545	chelsea manager jose mourinho declined to sign luke shaw from southampton due to the teenager's reportedly exorbitant wage demands, which mourinho believed would have negatively affected the team's stability and dressing room dynamics. shaw, who is now at manchester united, reportedly earns around £120,000 a week. mourinho argued that such a salary for a 19-year-old would have created unrest among the chelsea squad, especially considering that more experienced players like filipe luis, diego costa, cesc fabregas, and didier drogba were signed for lesser fees.
546	the father of sandy hook elementary school shooter adam lanza, peter lanza, claimed his body last week. lanza shot and killed his mother before carrying out the december 14 mass shooting, which left 26 people, including 20 children and six staff members, dead. there is no known criminal record for lanza, and a relative reportedly told investigators that he had a form of autism, although this has not been confirmed. geneticists are currently studying lanza's dna at the university of connecticut health center, and results are not expected for several weeks. peter lanza released a statement expressing grief and asking why the tragedy occurred. the community of newtown has asked that no further donations be made in the wake of the shooting.
547	downton abbey's laura carmichael, who plays lady edith, revealed the make-up secrets used by the show's make-up artist magi vaughan to create a natural look for the actresses despite the need for a glamorous appearance on set. in a tutorial led by make-up artist lisa eldridge, they recreated lady edith's look from series three using widely available products. in the era portrayed (1920-21), most women didn't wear make-up. laura and her co-stars often asked for more lip or blush but were restricted as it wasn't period-appropriate. magi used an airbrush to achieve a realistic, natural look, but lisa opted to use l'oreal infallible foundation, laura mercier secret camouflage concealer, and chanel loose powder for a similar effect. daniell sandler's watercolour blush cherub provided a subtle rosy glow, while stila in the know eyeshadow palette was used for the eyes, followed by rimmel brow this way powder and mascara (chanel brown and clear). the look finished with lipstick queen medieval for a natural, subtle lip stain.
548	shadow chancellor ed balls was spotted jogging in north london with a disguise, wearing a beanie, spectacles, fluorescent gloves, and lycra tights, despite being known for his fitness and love for cooking. balls, who has previously prepared large meals for the labour party, described his signature dish as a 14-hour pulled pork barbecue. the labour front-bencher was unrecognizable during his run, sparking speculation about his identity.
549	in this article, nimko ali, a survivor of female genital mutilation (fgm) shares her harrowing experience of undergoing the procedure in somalia at the age of seven. though illegal in the uk since 1985, fgm continues to be a widespread issue, particularly among the ethnic african community, with an estimated 66,000 women in the uk dealing with the after-effects and over 20,000 young girls at risk. nimko's teacher dismissed her story as a cultural issue instead of acknowledging it as gender-based violence. to raise awareness and put an end to this practice, nimko, alongside fellow fgm survivors leyla hussain and sainab abdi, founded the charity daughters of eve in 2005. the uk home secretary, theresa may, has also pledged tougher rules to prevent fgm, but it remains a challenge to protect girls from this harmful tradition, with no successful convictions in the uk since its illegality.
550	french president francois hollande announced his separation from valerie trierweiler, his long-time partner and former first lady, 15 days after news of his affair with actress julie gayet broke. the announcement ends trierweiler's tenure as first lady, causing her to lose her office, staff, and numerous perks including chauffeur-driven limousines and homes across france. trierweiler is currently in india on a "humanitarian" visit, and had refused to sign a separation agreement with hollande. reports suggest that she may attempt to humiliate hollande for dumping her just one-and-a-half years into his term of office. hollande has acknowledged painful moments in his relationship with trierweiler, who is a journalist for magazine paris match, but had claimed the affair was a private matter. hollande's popularity has been low due to his country's high unemployment rate and cost of living, and the news of his affair has further embarrassed him. trierweiler was viewed as a loose cannon and a loose end for hollande, and he is now set to concentrate on his relationship with gayet. the affair was exposed by french closer magazine, which published photographs of hollande sneaking into gayet's apartment and trying to disguise his identity. trierweiler had first checked into a paris hospital for emotional shock after the affair was made public, and was later reported to have caused damage to elysee palace property worth £2.5 million. a new opinion poll confirmed that trierweiler was the most unpopular first lady in recent french history, with only 8% of respondents backing her as a popular first lady. the affair caused embarrassment to hollande due to trierweiler's strong links with france's most intrusive popular magazines, which she used to bolster her career. hollande's advisers had suggested that he should remain a bachelor president to avoid further scandal, and he had gone to visit the pope in rome but refused to comment publicly about
551	emmanuel adebayor scored two headers, one in each half, and real madrid took advantage of peter crouch's red card to defeat 10-man tottenham 4-0 in the first leg of their champions league quarterfinal. real madrid manager jose mourinho is trying to win the champions league title with three different clubs, and he is on track to achieve that goal after this comfortable win. adebayor's headers came from corners by mesut ozil and marcelo, respectively. crouch was sent off in the 15th minute for a second yellow card after committing a sliding tackle on marcelo. real madrid added two more goals through angel di maria's curled shot and cristiano ronaldo's weak effort that went through the goalkeeper. adebayor came close to a hat-trick with a header, but was denied by the goalkeeper. the result puts real madrid in a strong position in the semifinals, with a potential match against rivals barcelona awaiting.
552	in a new study, scientists have discovered that new caledonian crows, known for their tool use and problem-solving skills, exhibit a tendency to be left or right beaked when holding tools. researchers believe this preference allows the birds to keep the tip of the stick in view of the opposite eye, enhancing their dexterity. these crows have a wide field of vision, which helps them use one eye to focus on the tool tip and target. new caledonian crows have previously surprised scientists with their ability to use sticks to extract larvae from burrows and retrieve food out of reach. they are considered one of the cleverest birds, with a reasoning ability rivaling that of a seven-year-old human. these crows can perform complex tasks, such as using multiple tools in sequence, and have been observed using road traffic to crack nuts in urban areas.
553	"contagion," directed by steven soderbergh, is a star-studded thriller about a global pandemic that spreads from chicago to various continents, featuring gwyneth paltrow, matt damon, laurence fishburne, kate winslet, marion cotillard, jude law, and jennifer ehle. the film showcases soderbergh's expertise in mapping out complex systems, as it follows the outbreak's impact on the cdc, who, and everyday people. unlike traditional disaster movies, "contagion" maintains a cool analytical tone and focuses on the progression of the epidemic and the imperfect human response. heroes and villains emerge, and morality becomes ambiguous in the face of the crisis. featuring top-notch technique and impressive performances, "contagion" is a thought-provoking examination of privilege and power in the context of a global disaster. however, it falls short of matches the visceral impact of grittier films like george romero's zombie movies.
554	rhys thomas, a former wales and scarlets prop, is undergoing surgery on tuesday in preparation for a heart transplant. thomas, 32, retired from rugby in 2012 after suffering a heart attack during a gym session at scarlets' ground. he underwent a quadruple heart bypass operation at the time. thomas began his career at newport gwent dragons, making his debut in 2003, and earned seven caps for wales. he missed several months of the 2007-2008 season due to a mild heart attack but returned to play for scarlets until 2009. his former teammates, including scott williams and joe bearman, have wished him well on social media.
555	old navy is launching new styles of jean pants, including "skinny" and "boyfriend" jeans, for their children's line, sparking controversy among some parents and psychologists. they argue that the terminology may encourage children to focus on their weight and grow up too fast, while old navy defends the styles as playful and mirroring adult designs. some children's clothing companies don't use the term "boyfriend jeans," but old navy has no plans to change their campaign. parents' opinions are divided, with some thinking the style is inappropriate and others claiming their children don't pay attention to the advertisements.
556	in a highly critical report, hm inspectorate of prisons (hmip) condemned the violence and dangerous conditions at young offender institution (yoi) glen parva in leicestershire. inmates were found to be dealing "legal highs" and charging "rent" for cells, while levels of bullying directly linked to spikes in assaults against prisoners and staff, self-harm, and suicides. the prison, which holds young adults aged between 18 and 21, had two young men kill themselves in 2013, with no significant improvement since then. inspectors also found evidence of unofficial punishments, excessive use of force, and offensive language. chief inspector of prisons nick hardwick described glen parva as "a concerning institution" and called for urgent progress on reviews into holding young adults in prisons. frances crook, chief executive of the howard league for penal reform, criticized short prison sentences and remand as being at the core of the problem. the report comes following a series of dismal figures on the rise in deaths in custody and on-the-run inmates, according to the ministry of justice.
557	the taiwan tower, designed by tokyo-based architect sou fujimoto, is planned to be a surreal 1,000ft tall building in taichung, taiwan. the triangular-shaped superstructure will feature a labyrinth of steel beams allowing natural light and creating a semi-outdoor space. the roof garden, inspired by the taiwanese banyan tree, will float in the sky and incorporate vegetation from the country. the building aims for green credentials, using renewable energy systems, rainwater harvesting, and solar panels. expected to cost 6.59bn taiwanese dollars and complete by 2017, the structure will serve as a landmark for taichung, providing stunning views and revenue for the city. mayor jason hu likened the tower to the sun with the city's districts as planets.
558	airlines have become more retail-savvy in recent years, offering a range of products and services to passengers beyond the basics. airlinessuch as airbaltic have been trailblazers in this area, experimenting with offering odd and quirky items, as well as more traditional offerings like gourmet food and locally sourced goods. meanwhile, traditional in-flight retailers like skymall have had to adapt to increased competition and changing customer preferences, putting greater emphasis on unique and entertaining products to capture passengers' attention. some of the most successful items include sports paraphernalia, pet products, and novelty items that go viral on social media.
559	russia's female prisoners are described as being subjected to concentration camp-like conditions in a new book, with as many as 30 women sharing one room and having to use only two toilets among 300 inmates. prisoners also recounted being punished for soiling their bed sheets with menstrual blood and being denied access to water and showers. the authors of the book, a group of st. petersburg sociologists, aim to analyze gender differences in russian penal colonies and debunk the notion that female prisoners are more compassionate towards each other than male prisoners. the authors found that female inmates are often exploited, humiliated, and harassed. the book documents the experiences of women before and after their imprisonment. according to official statistics, there are currently 714,000 prisoners in russia, with 59,000 of them being women.
560	stoke city is interested in signing fulham midfielder steve sidwell, who will be out of contract this summer. sidwell, 31, has also attracted interest from west ham manager sam allardyce, but stoke manager mark hughes is keen to bring him to the britannia stadium. hughes managed sidwell during his season as fulham boss in 2010-11 and sees him as a valuable addition. fulham manager felix magath is preparing for a summer of changes and may be forced to let sidwell go as he is out of contract. magath has ordered underperforming players in for extra training sessions to help decide who to keep in the championship, while owner shahid khan has expressed a desire to invest heavily in the club to ensure a quick return to the premier league.
561	israel, with a large population and limited space, is turning to vertical cemeteries as a solution due to a lack of room for traditional burials below ground. architect tuvia sagiv and his partner uri ponger are behind 30 planned structures for yarkon cemetery outside tel aviv, each 70 feet tall. these "high burial buildings" are kosher, as each body rests on earth connected to the ground through dirt-filled pipes. some orthodox jews are not pleased, but sagiv argues that his structures are in line with ancient jewish practices. the structures have landscaping and provide a connection between the living and the dead. the chevra kadisha will discuss these structures further with the israeli ministry of religious services, who believe they will provide a solution to israel's burial space problem for the next two decades. vertical cemeteries have been used in densely populated areas with limited land, such as china, japan, egypt, and new orleans. the world's tallest vertical cemetery, the memorial necropole ecumenica in santos, brazil, is 32 stories high. a new vertical cemetery in india, the moksha tower building, will be even taller and have different sections for the major religions practiced in mumbai.
562	three u.s. marines were shot dead by an afghan worker on a military base in helmand province, southern afghanistan, making it the third rogue attack in four days. earlier in the day, an afghan police commander opened fire on special forces soldiers, killing three and injuring one. both incidents involved afghans turning their guns on u.s. troops and do not reflect the overall situation in afghanistan, according to nato. these attacks, known as "green-on-blue," have seriously eroded trust between nato troops and afghan security forces, with 26 such incidents resulting in 34 fatalities since january 2012. however, nato spokesman brigadier-general gunter katz stated that the killings by afghan workers would not be included in the reported tally. nato has taken measures to increase security, including joint investigation teams and placing armed guards near troop gathering areas. the incidents are mostly due to personal disagreements or combat stress rather than successful insurgent infiltration of security forces. afghanistan has experienced an increase in violence, with at least six civilians and eight coalition troops killed in separate attacks throughout the week.
563	welsh castles, including caerphilly, laugharne, kidwelly, and st davids bishop's palace, have been captured from unique angles through drone footage. these medieval fortifications feature elaborate water defenses and were built for battles but later adapted for parties. caerphilly castle has the most elaborate water defenses in britain, and laugharne castle inspired poet dylan thomas. st davids bishop's palace was designed for banquets, and drone footage provides a historic perspective rarely seen by visitors. the welsh government used drones to showcase wales' heritage sites from a new angle to inspire exploration. kidwelly castle showcases the latest thinking in castle design with concentric walls, and caerphilly castle is one of the largest medieval fortifications in europe.
564	clive palmer, the controversial australian businessman and former politician, has announced that john bjelke-petersen, the son of long-time queensland premier sir joh bjelke-petersen, will lead the palmer united party (pup) in queensland for the upcoming state election. bjelke-petersen had previously run for the pup in the 2013 federal election in the seat of maranoa and received over 13% of the primary vote. the appointment comes as the pup has been experiencing internal wrangling and defections, including the resignation of its two queensland mps, alex douglas and carl judge, who cited concerns over candidate selection. palmer is hoping that bjelke-petersen's appointment will help turn around the party's fortunes in queensland. sir joh bjelke-petersen, queensland's longest-serving premier, was known for his controversial politics and corruption scandals, including the jailing of state ministers and the police commissioner after the fitzgerald inquiry into police corruption. bjelke-petersen left the liberal national party in 2013 due to a perceived lack of support for regional queensland. palmer had previously worked as the campaign director of the national party when sir joh was returned as queensland premier in 1983 and 1986.
565	south sudan's government regained control of the remote town of pibor on monday from fighters of the rival lou nuer tribe, according to the nation's information minister, barnaba benjamin. thousands of residents who fled the area due to ethnic tensions over grazing lands and water rights have started returning. the united nations (un) sent peacekeepers to the area last week and the south sudan army deployed 4,000 reinforcements. doctors without borders (msf) is still trying to reach some of its staff and aid workers who fled, and is concerned about the safety of the displaced populations. the town of pibor, which is home to the murle tribe, was secured, but the situation remains tense with approximately 100,000 people displaced. at least 50,000 have fled the violence in the area since last year. un secretary-general ban ki-moon urged the groups to work with the government to find solutions, and south sudan's vice president, riek machar, is also leading an initiative to bridge the differences. the violence in jonglei state is the latest in a series of conflicts to hit south sudan, which gained independence from sudan in july 2011.
566	mark noble, a midfielder for west ham united, is considering representing the republic of ireland at international level after being overlooked by england manager roy hodgson. noble, who was born in london but qualifies for ireland through his paternal grandparents, has been pursued by ireland manager martin o'neill since he took over last november. o'neill wants to bring noble into the irish squad for euro 2016 qualifying to add depth to his midfield options. noble was named west ham's player of the year last season and was expected to be included in england's squad for recent friendlies, but instead jack colback and fabian delph were selected. noble has played for england at youth levels, including representing the under-21 team and captaining them to the european championships final in 2009, but a switch to ireland would require him to obtain a passport. o'neill is confident he can convince noble to play for ireland and he would provide a strong central midfield partnership with james mccarthy if he pledges allegiance to the irish team. noble, who has scored 33 goals in 287 appearances for west ham, also attracted interest from sunderland and newcastle this summer. england captain wayne rooney was named in the recent england squad.
567	a teenage gunman, identified as jaylen fryberg, opened fire in a crowded cafeteria at marysville-pilchuck high school in washington state last friday, killing one student, zoe galasso, and wounding four others. witnesses described a calm and calculating fryberg, who pulled out a .40-caliber handgun from a backpack before shooting. the victims were not random as fryberg had close relationships with some of them. a brave teacher, megan silberberger, intervened and confronted fryberg, preventing further harm. witnesses reported that she grabbed his arm and disarmed him during the confrontation. silberberger has asked for privacy and thanked everyone for their support. the wounded students, including two girls and two boys, are in hospitals in critical or serious conditions, with some related to fryberg. the victims and their families held private discussions during a gathering at the school on sunday, mourning and discussing ways to move forward. the investigation is ongoing, but a law enforcement source revealed that fryberg may have experienced trouble reloading his gun due to trembling hands during the confrontation with silberberg. the gun used in the shooting was traced back to fryberg's father. fryberg had recently attended a school dance and was named the freshman class homecoming prince. his actions came as a shock to classmates and peers, who described him as a happy and popular student. the motive for the shooting is still unclear.
568	prime minister david cameron is set to deploy british intelligence, spy planes, drones, and special forces to mali to assist france in finding and dismantling the al qaeda network behind the algerian hostage crisis. the uk is also considering offering support by refueling french fighter aircraft and training malian troops. cameron called the ideology behind the terror attacks a "poisonous thinking" that requires a "generational struggle" to defeat. the prime minister's decision comes after at least 37 foreign hostages, including britons paul morgan, kenneth whiteside, garry barlow, and carlos estrada, were killed during the attack at the in amenas gas facility. cameron expressed condolences to the families of the victims and promised to bring the deceased home for identification as soon as possible. he acknowledged the challenges algeria faced in dealing with over 30 terrorists and praised their resolve in undertaking the rescue attempt. labor leader ed miliband denounced the attack as "pre-meditated, cold-blooded murder" and a new threat to the west, urging a "decisive and coordinated international response." cameron also promised to put counter-terrorism at the top of the g8 agenda during the uk's chairmanship this year.
569	a canadian fitness studio, twisted grip dance and fitness in duncan, british columbia, has added "little spinners" pole dancing classes for children aged 5-12 to their timetable, following demand from adult clients. the instructor, kristy craig, emphasizes that the classes focus on fitness and the gymnastic aspects of pole dancing, denying that children are taught "sexual moves." however, child psychologist derek swain expressed concern that this could increase the likelihood of children entering the sex industry in later life and that the association with stripping and the sex industry should not be ignored. some criticized a bolton fitness studio last year for offering similar classes and sharing images online.
570	typhoon fitow, which brought gusts of up to 74 mph to okinawa, japan on saturday, has prompted china's maritime authorities to issue the highest warning for storm tides and waves. the typhoon is forecasted to make landfall between fujian and zhejiang provinces on monday, and local authorities have been urged to prepare by reinforcing harbor facilities and repairing sea walls. fitow previously hit okinawa with winds up to 120 kph.
571	a long-haul bus can carry as many passengers as a domestic airline flight, yet safety regulations and oversight for buses, particularly for drivers, lag behind those for airlines. according to deborah hersman, chairman of the national transportation safety board, hours-of-service violations and tired drivers are common issues in the motor coach industry. the recent grounding of the boeing 787 dreamliner and fatal bus crashes have brought attention to the need for stricter regulations and penalties for bus companies. despite these concerns, authorities continue to let companies operate even after citations for violations. with approximately 700 million passengers annually, the motor coach industry, which has experienced several fatal accidents in recent years, needs greater focus from regulators, according to the american bus association. only 20 percent of trucks and buses undergo inspections, and 7 percent of drivers are pulled off the road due to hours-of-service violations or other issues. the motor carrier safety administration defends its practices and states that federal and state inspectors conduct millions of inspections each year, pulling out-of-service vehicles and drivers with serious safety violations. however, hersman believes that more needs to be done to address the rampant violation of federal safety rules within the industry.
572	the 2013 miss america pageant came to a close in atlantic city, with nina davuluri of new york being crowned the winner, making history as the first woman of indian descent to win the title. several contestants stood out for various reasons, including the most auspicious name (miss alabama, chandler champion), the weirdest intro joke (miss district of columbia, bindhu pamarthi), and the most shameless plug (miss tennessee, shelby thompson). some contestants also showed great personality, such as miss missouri shelby ringdahl's use of "butt glue" and miss kansas theresa vail's tattooed army sergeant background. overall, the pageant featured many memorable moments, from the most awkward utterance by pat pruitt to the strangest tradition of the shoe parade. despite the challenges and pressure, all contestants exhibited determination and grace.
573	forty-five united nations peacekeepers from fiji, who were seized by the al-nusra front, an al-qaeda affiliate, in the golan heights buffer zone between syria and israeli-occupied territory, have been safely released and are in good condition, the united nations reported on thursday. negotiations for their release were facilitated by various parties at different levels. the peacekeepers were handed over to the united nations disengagement observer force (undof) and subsequently transported to the undof command center in the israeli-occupied golan heights. the un secretary-general, ban ki-moon, expressed gratitude for the efforts to secure their release and demanded that all parties respect the undof's mandate, freedom of movement, and the safety and security of its personnel. fiji's prime minister, voreqe bainimarama, praised the peacekeepers as heroes and commended their restraint and discipline during the capture. the troops will be debriefed and given a period of rest before returning to their duties.
574	a two-year-old girl named destiny henry-khan was severely injured in a dog attack at a park in birmingham, england while playing on a roundabout. the large brown cross-breed dog leapt over a fence and bit destiny's face, causing a u-shaped wound from her mouth to her cheek. the toddler underwent a two-hour plastic surgery operation and may have permanent nerve damage and facial scarring. the dog has not been found, and police are conducting door-to-door enquiries to trace the animal and its owner. the attack left destiny petrified of dogs, despite having owned one herself. the incident occurred while her mother was christmas shopping, and she was being supervised by friends at the time. family friend hannah warrilow witnessed the attack and bravely fought off the dog before taking destiny to the hospital. the incident has left destiny's mother, lauren henry, fearing for the safety of other children in the area, urging for the dog to be caught quickly.
575	in the latest lancôme fragrance advert, julia roberts, who is 44 but looks much younger, glows as the brand's ambassador. in a white gown, she moves gracefully through a crowded party while the new fragrance, "la vie est belle," is displayed under chandelier lights. roberts joined lancôme in 2010 and this is her first fragrance campaign with the french beauty company, following a banned advertisement in 2011 due to digitally retouched images. the perfume, composed of 63 subtle ingredients, was created by three master perfumers and has fruity notes of blackcurrant and pear, with tones of tonka bean, praline, patchouli, and vanilla. roberts emphasized the importance of wearing a nice scent to make her feel more confident. the bottle of the perfume has no branding on it.
576	paul desousa, a 27-year-old westchester county police officer, was hailed as a hero after rescuing a teenage boy from an out-of-control car during a snowstorm on friday. desousa was treating the boy to a ride when an infiniti lost control and headed towards them. he quickly pushed the boy onto the hood of his squad car, but was struck himself and sustained minor back and neck injuries. the driver, an unnamed woman, was most likely going the speed limit but may have been going too fast for the hazardous conditions. the investigation is ongoing and the woman was not charged with any wrongdoing. desousa, who joined the department a year ago after serving in iraq and afghanistan, is being praised for his bravery.
577	an 85-year-old man died less than 48 hours after being evacuated from merok park care home in surrey due to concerns for residents' safety. the man, who is survived by a widow, a son, two daughters, seven grandchildren, and two great-grandchildren, was moved to warrengate nursing home in a chaotic evacuation process. residents were reportedly carried from their beds in nightclothes and belongings were moved in bin liners. the care home, owned by mauritian businessman soodressen cooppen and his wife maleenee, has been described as a 'dump' by families and was previously criticized for failing to keep proper records. the death has led to calls for an investigation into the care home owners and concerns about the conditions in other homes they own. another home, grantley court in sutton, was also evacuated due to similar issues. zeenat mehboob rajan, director of claremont care services which owns warrengate, said moving elderly people could cause premature death and the man may have died sooner if he hadn't been moved. the man's family and other residents have complained about the sudden evacuation and lack of information provided by the authorities. it is believed that staff at merok park were working up to 60 hours per week and had not received relevant training. the care quality commission (cqc) carried out a comprehensive inspection of merok park on november 28 and december 1 and decided that the care facility had to close immediately due to unsanitary conditions and residents being forced to wash in cold water by untrained staff. surrey police assisted with the closure and removing residents. merok park was given a clean bill of health by the cqc in january despite numerous complaints going back years. the cooppens, who live in a £2million house in cheam, own a third care home, faygate house in sutton, which was also criticized by the inspectorate earlier this year.
578	in september 2014, human rights attorney amal alamuddin, who had married actor george clooney, changed her professional name to amal clooney. this decision sparked controversy and criticism from some, with some people accusing her of being anti-feminist or anti-progressive for taking on her husband's name. critics argued that it was a regressive step for a strong, career-driven woman to do so, and that it set a bad example for other women. however, others defended amal's decision as a personal choice that did not negate her accomplishments or independence. the debate highlights the ongoing tension around women's names and identity, and the unfair pressure placed on women who reach high levels of success to serve as symbols of feminist progress. ultimately, amal's name change does not determine her worth as a person or her feminist credentials.
579	a cookbook titled "the horsemeat cookbook" by chris windle was published following the horsemeat scandal, offering recipes for dishes like "pastissada de cavalo" and "pot-au-feu de cheval." the book highlights the nutritional benefits of horsemeat, which is lower in fat than beef and rich in iron and vitamin b12. the cookbook includes horsemeat jokes and is aimed at the gift book market and those interested in cooking with this alternative meat source. despite its light-hearted tone, some may view the publication as attempting to profit from the scandal. the cookbook, published by random house, is available for £8.99.
