580	during the festive season, many people may be concerned about their caloric intake and looking forward to getting back in shape in the new year. to help with seasonal damage control, a london cocktail bar, shrub & shutter in brixton, has introduced "salad cocktails," which include vegetables and healthful ingredients like vitamin c, fiber, and minerals while still containing sufficient gin for merry-making. top bartender dave tregenza designed these innovative drinks using the house gin, whitley neill, and they will be available to order starting january 1. three salad cocktail recipes are provided below for home mixologists: the pickled beets, curd, nam gin, and sorry we're all out of waldorfs. these savory cocktails come garnished with various salads or toppings and include ingredients like pickled beets, coriander, and celery-infused gin, as well as unique bitters and shrubs. the shrub & shutter aims to continue the trend of savory cocktails with these salad cocktails.
581	an archaeological site in turkey, known as carchemish, which was excavated by lawrence of arabia over 100 years ago and is now a significant historical site, is set to open as a tourist attraction despite being near isis territory. the site, which lies on the turkish-syrian border, was once a battleground for various ancient civilizations such as the babylonians and egyptians, but is now contested by isis, the assad regime, and the free syrian army. previously unreachable due to its dangerous location, the site was rediscovered in the 19th century and excavated by lawrence of arabia before the first world war. italian archaeologists are currently excavating the site, which is just 20 meters from the border. despite the nearby conflict, turkish authorities assure that tourists will not be in danger, and hope to open up the area for visitors by next spring. the site contains significant historical artifacts, including a roman statue, intricate basalt reliefs, and small statues, some of which were found under the floorboards of lawrence of arabia's house on the site. visitors will be able to see these relics, as well as lawrence's letter to his mother, when the site opens. the area has a long and complex history, and professor nicolo marchetti, the leader of the dig team, sees the site as a powerful symbol.
582	a missouri man, cornealious "mike" anderson, who was released from jail six months ago after it was discovered that he had served 13 years of a robbery sentence due to a clerical error, was arrested and charged with second-degree robbery for allegedly snatching a woman's purse in st. louis. anderson's attorney insists that he was at a birthday party the whole night with 40 people and could not have committed the robbery. the victim identified him as the assailant on two separate occasions, but anderson's family and attorney maintain his innocence and suggest that his past record and notoriety from the earlier release swayed the responding police officer to make an incorrect identification. anderson was previously sentenced to 13 years in prison for an armed robbery in 2000. despite a solid alibi and lack of victim description matching the suspect's appearance, the judge ruled that anderson would receive credit for the entirety of the time he should have been in prison rather than parole.
583	in oxford, england, police arrested 13 men on suspicion of running a modern-day slavery ring involved in the sexual exploitation of dozens of vulnerable girls, some as young as 11. the girls were groomed, drugged, and raped over a six-year period. social services had previously come into contact with all the victims, which prompted calls for an inquiry. the investigation, known as operation bullfinch, revealed that the gang allegedly used social networking sites to swap information about victims and transport them to other parts of the country for sex. the amounts of money involved are suspected to be in the thousands. detective superintendent rob mason confirmed that the girls were considered very vulnerable, and that some had gone missing and disclosed the abuse upon their return. the identities of the suspects and victims were not released, and no information was given about their ethnicity or whether they had been in foster care or care homes when the abuse occurred. some local councilors raised concerns about children's services in the area and called for an investigation if the girls were not given the right protection.
584	a youtube blogger, taylor adele smith, has created a sarcastic video titled "five ways to fake a thigh gap" to highlight the absurdity of the trend. the video provides five humorous methods to achieve the look, including using a soccer ball or walking like a crab, without the need for diet or exercise. smith aims to help women confront and overcome their body image insecurities, emphasizing that thigh gaps are natural and a matter of hip structure. plus-size model robyn lawley also recently spoke out against the thigh gap trend, expressing concern over the negative comments and use of thin ideals for weight loss motivation.
585	a racing pigeon named henry, owned by fred lock from leeds, went missing during a race from france to yorkshire, uk, in may 2012. four weeks later, he was found in good health on eleuthera island in the bahamas. kate barley, a phd student in fisheries conservation on the island, discovered henry and was able to contact lock through a ring on the bird's leg. it is unknown how henry reached the bahamas, but it is believed he may have stowed away on a ship. henry is now living with kate and her fiance, jason kincaid, and has become a local celebrity. it is unclear if henry will return to the uk when kate leaves the bahamas in september.
586	lucy francis maloney, a dog artist from saint paul, minnesota, creates miniature replicas of deceased dogs as comforting mementos for grieving pet owners. she started this unique business in 1997, inspired by her own family's lost yorkshire terrier, old ted. maloney uses various materials like yarn, chicken wire, alpaca, cashmere, and even real dog hair to create her lifelike models. by combining glass eyes and fine detailing, she has produced thousands of these miniatures, earning her requests from clients around the world. prices range from $200 to $2,000, and she has even attracted the attention of celebrities like martha stewart, seeking her services. for those still mourning the loss of their beloved pets, lucy's 3d replicas offer a deeper level of comfort than flat photographs. currently, she is working on an urgent request from a soldier about to depart for a tour in afghanistan, wanting a miniature of his deceased dog to take with him.
587	on may 29, 1985, antonio conti and his daughter giusy attended the european cup final between juventus and liverpool at heysel stadium in brussels. however, instead of a celebratory experience, it turned into a tragic night of mayhem and death. conti recounted waking up among dead people and realizing that his daughter had also perished in the chaotic scene. the heysel stadium disaster was one of three european stadium tragedies in the 1980s that resulted in nearly 200 deaths. the incidents included the bradford city stadium fire in may 1985 and the hillsborough disaster in 1989. professor john foot, author of "calcio," describes the heysel disaster as a story of "incompetence, violence, cover-up, shame, and lies." rosalina vannini gonnelli, who lost her husband in the tragedy and whose daughter was injured, expressed frustration over the lack of interest and accountability from various institutions and individuals, including uefa, authorities, and the football clubs. francesco caremani wrote "the truths of heysel – chronicle of a tragedy foretold" to give a voice to the victims and their families. the heysel stadium disaster involved inadequate facilities, poor ticketing arrangements, and negligent policing. thousands of fans were crammed into a worn-down sector z with flimsy wire fencing and minimal police presence. a charge of liverpool fans ensued, resulting in the crush and the deaths of 39 people. while juventus won the final, many felt that uefa and the belgian authorities bore significant responsibility for the disaster. concerns regarding stadium organization and safety in italy still remain as italy has not seemed to have effectively addressed the lessons learned from the disaster as extensively as england did. caremani, who saw the improvements in english football stadiums and was inspired by the taylor report
588	robert f. kennedy jr. criticized fox news for dividing the country and causing harm to political collaboration during an interview at the deer valley celebrity skifest in park city, utah. he also opposed the practice of fracking due to health risks and land pollution. kennedy's late wife's family has hired an investigation firm to look into the circumstances surrounding her suicide death, raising potential questions about kennedy's involvement and possibly leading to an unlawful death lawsuit. kennedy attended the event with his girlfriend, cheryl hines, and mingled with other celebrities such as neil patrick harris, gavin rossdale, and larry david.
589	the national institute for health and care excellence (nice) is urging gps to prescribe the £3 pill nalmefene to up to 600,000 adults in england who consume three glasses of wine or more a day, according to new guidelines. these individuals, classified as "mild alcoholics," may not consider themselves heavy drinkers but could be eligible under nice's guidelines, which suggest women who drink more than two glasses of wine a day and men over four pints could be eligible. the nhs's safe drinking limits are 2 to 3 units a day for women and 3 to 4 for men. the pill, nalmefene, works by reducing the amount of dopamine released in the brain, helping adults enjoy one or two drinks and then stop without needing more. it is recommended for a maximum of six months alongside counselling sessions such as alcoholics anonymous. the guidance is provisional and could cost the nhs over £150 million if all eligible individuals were to take the pill. alcohol is known to increase the risk of many cancers, liver disease, and raises blood pressure, causing stroke and heart disease. trials have shown the pill can reduce average alcohol consumption from nine units to three units a day and the number of heavy drinking days from 18 to eight. side effects of the pill include sickness, dizziness, headaches, and sleeping problems.
590	the us house approved a compromise bill on thursday, providing $165 billion to fund military operations in iraq and afghanistan through early 2009. the bill includes domestic priorities such as unemployment assistance for the jobless and an expansion of the g.i. bill for veterans. the legislation passed with bipartisan support, including an additional 13 weeks of unemployment benefits and a new g.i. bill to pay for full scholarships for u.s. troops. the bill puts no restrictions on war funding and includes $2 billion for disaster relief. ant-war protesters interrupted the vote with minor disturbances before being removed. the bills will now be combined and sent to the senate for approval.
591	a 48-year-old man from brooklyn was arrested at john f. kennedy international airport by port authority police on wednesday for attempting to bring a concealed .22-caliber semi-automatic handgun through security, with parts of the gun packed in his carry-on luggage that included a playstation 2, a tripod, and other belongings, along with the video game "nicktoons: attack of the toybots." ramirez was en route to mexico city, marking the latest in a record-breaking year for firearm discoveries at tsa checkpoints, with 2,100 guns seized so far. passengers caught attempting to bring guns on planes may face criminal charges and fines of up to $11,000. the incident is just one of many unusual items tsa agents have discovered in passengers' luggage throughout the year.
592	in phoenix, arizona, the hotly debated sb 1070 immigration law has resulted in tension between various communities, leading to the departure of tens of thousands of illegal immigrants. a mexican hot dog vendor shares her concerns about discrimination towards immigrants, while some whites support the law. the judge's recent decision to strike down certain parts of the law has caused controversy, with many groups expressing their opinions. the vendor, along with other immigrants, faces fear and uncertainty in their daily lives due to the perceived animosity towards them from some law enforcement officials and residents. the ongoing debate has resulted in heightened racial tensions, with generalizations and stereotypes perpetuating the divide. the woman vendor prefers to judge individuals based on their actions rather than their ethnicity, setting an example for empathetic and understanding interactions in the community. the situation in phoenix highlights the complexities of the immigration issue in the united states and the potential consequences of polarizing laws and prejudices.
593	qpr manager harry redknapp is interested in loaning west ham forward mauro zarate to address his team's striker shortage. zarate, who joined west ham from velez sarsfield in the summer, has struggled to secure a spot in the hammers squad, making only seven league appearances this season. redknapp believes the argentine can provide a creative spark as a "clever no.10," having previously managed him at birmingham. no deal has been completed yet, but redknapp is looking to add additional firepower to qpr's attack, as they currently rely heavily on charlie austin for goals. with qpr 15th in the table and just two points above the relegation zone, redknapp is hopeful for a good home performance against swansea on new year's day, citing their strong form at loftus road.
594	a study published in the lancet medical journal found no significant link between a mother's vitamin d levels during pregnancy and her child's bone health at the age of 10. contrary to current nhs guidance, scientists suggest that vitamin d levels in pregnant women do not affect their babies' bone health. however, some groups of women, including those with limited sunlight exposure, obese women, and those of certain ethnic origins, are at higher risk of low vitamin d levels and should continue taking supplements. vitamin d regulates the amount of calcium in the body, which helps keep bones and teeth healthy, and low levels have been associated with bone-related problems and diseases such as rickets and osteoporosis. healthcare professionals should encourage at-risk women to maintain adequate vitamin d during pregnancy and throughout their lives, while further research is needed on the potential benefits, harms, and optimal dosing of vitamin d supplementation.
595	high school sweethearts chris collins and his girlfriend, rachael, had an unforgettable experience during their schoolies celebrations on the gold coast. collins surprised the crowds by proposing to rachael after his choreographed dance routine. dressed in a suit, he executed impressive dance moves, then dropped to one knee and proposed using a microphone and his grandmother's diamonds for the ring. rachael, taken aback yet delighted, happily said yes as the cheering graduates surrounded the couple. elsewhere, 10 male schoolies were arrested for various charges, including public nuisance, street offenses, and drug-related incidents, and 11 students received liquor infringement notices.
596	the keystone xl pipeline, which aims to carry crude oil from canada to the us gulf coast, is facing a six to nine-month review process for a new route in nebraska due to environmental concerns. transcanada, the pipeline's proposer, is seeking approval for a new route east of the initially proposed one, which went over an environmentally sensitive aquifer. the state department has not yet received a new permit application for the proposed alternate route. once transcanada submits a final proposal to the nebraska department of environmental quality, it will take 30 to 60 days for review and drafting a supplemental impact statement. republican leaders are pressuring president obama to approve the project amidst concerns about energy independence and job creation, while opponents worry about potential environmental risks and the pipeline's impact on global markets.
597	a dashboard camera video from russia captured the moment a truck swerved to avoid an oncoming vehicle, flipped over, and unloaded its live cargo of cows onto the road. the footage shows the cows getting up after a few seconds, and has received over three million hits on youtube. some commentators have questioned the authenticity of the video. drivers in russia use dashboard cameras more frequently due to terrible driving conditions and high crime rates, resulting in an increase in shocking traffic incident footage emerging from the country. other footage includes jaywalking horses, low-flying fighter jets, errant lorry wheels, and crazed gun-firing pedestrians. in one such clip, a couple riding a quad bike flipped their vehicle while travelling at night, leaving them stranded in the middle of the road.
598	atletico madrid is determined to keep their key players, including thibaut courtois, diego costa, koke, and filipe luis, despite interest from other clubs. courtois, who is on loan from chelsea, expressed his desire to stay but the decision is largely out of atletico's hands. atletico's ceo, miguel angel gil marin, has stated that the club will only sell costa if he asks to leave and they have the financial means to keep their players due to their success in the champions league. koke and filipe luis are also attracting interest from the premier league, but their loyalty to the team and coach diego simeone could keep them at atletico. simeone has indicated that the team will take a break during the world cup and return to defend their la liga title.
599	the european commission is providing £1,000 in taxpayer funds to thousands of unemployed europeans, aged 18 to 30, to travel to and secure jobs in the uk under the 'your first eures job' scheme. critics argue this scheme is controversial given the high unemployment rate among young britons, which is over 1 million. the scheme, currently being piloted in spain, aims to match jobseekers with suitable jobs and will be expanded across the eu. the eu aims to help employers access workforce they cannot find locally, but critics fear an influx of young unemployed europeans from countries with high unemployment like spain and greece. prime minister david cameron has previously expressed concern about the free movement of workers from eu countries to the uk. the uk has 2.53 million unemployed persons, including nearly one million jobless young adults, and long-term youth unemployment has been steadily increasing. tim aker from the get britain out campaign expressed concern about the taxpayer funding and undercutting british workers. the department for work and pensions stated that the scheme also applies to young british citizens moving to other eu countries.
600	a golden coach, named britannia, built by australian man jim frecklington as a gift for the queen's 80th birthday in 2006, was the center of a political controversy after it remained idle in a suburban sydney workshop for almost a decade. the coach, which cost millions and contained historical items, was meant to be a successor to the australian state coach frecklington had built in 1988 for queen elizabeth ii. however, the second coach was delayed numerous times and became a white elephant amidst accusations of misuse of taxpayer dollars. the coach, which features items from various historic sites and significant objects, was eventually shipped to the uk and plans are being made for its use by the royal family. the coach was funded in part by a taxpayer-funded grant from a former conservative australian prime minister. frecklington, a former royal household employee, claimed the coach would be delivered for the queen's diamond jubilee in 2012 or the birth of prince george in 2013. the coach's delayed delivery and its status as a private initiative rather than a royal commission caused debate in the australian parliament.
601	angel di maria, a argentine winger for real madrid, had a remarkable year on the pitch, helping the team win the champions league, and was named man-of-the-match in the final. however, his personal life off the field was even more inspiring. his wife, jorgelina cardoso, had faced pregnancy complications the previous year, and their daughter, mia, was born three months premature. di maria missed a crucial champions league game to be with his wife, and his daughter spent two months in intensive care before being allowed to go home. after mia's recovery, di maria returned to football, but found himself on the bench due to real's signing of gareth bale. di maria has described his daughter's battle for survival as the 'game of his life.' he dedicated his goal against switzerland in the world cup to his family and proudly wears a shirt with 'papa 7' on the back for his daughter. the year before, real boss carlo ancelotti had requested di maria's signing, but the wages offered were low, and the club's reluctance to increase them led to di maria's transfer to manchester united for £59.7 million. di maria is known for his long, wiry physique and endurance on the field. he is versatile and able to play various positions. his father, miguel, quit football due to a knee injury and delivered coal to make ends meet. angel's mother, diana, took him to training sessions by bicycle, and the family's stamina runs in their blood. mia, who celebrates her first birthday this year, has inspired di maria with her determination to survive against all odds. di maria's transfer from real madrid to manchester united is controversial and unpopular with fans, but if he produces moments like the champions league-winning assist for bale, he will be welcomed as a valuable addition to the team.
602	disney has filed three patents for drone technology that could revolutionize its theme park shows by allowing larger-than-life marionette puppets to fly through the sky. one patent describes an aerial display system for forming floating pixel displays similar to fireworks. another patent details using drones to control and position flexible projection screens. a third patent suggests using drones to move the legs and arms of blimp-sized disney character string puppets. disney is advocating for the us government to allow commercial use of drones and hopes to use them to simulate flight for marionettes and create large-scale structures. however, a partygoer at a tech event was injured by a drone, highlighting safety concerns.
603	a turkish airlines plane crashed near amsterdam's schiphol airport on wednesday, killing nine people and injuring over 60. the boeing 737-800 fell vertically into a muddy field, indicating it lacked sufficient forward speed before impact. dutch investigators are currently probing the cause of the crash, which is believed to be unrelated to engine failure, and expect to release preliminary findings next week. the pilot, captain hasan tahsin arisan, and three boeing employees were among the fatalities. union hava-is accused turkish airlines management of negligence and called for their resignation, citing a history of maintenance issues with the aircraft. turkish airlines maintained that it strictly adhered to maintenance procedures and denied any wrongdoing.
604	a new jersey woman, kisha curtis, 29, was denied a pre-trial intervention program for allegedly throwing her emaciated pit bull puppy named patrick down a garbage chute, leaving him for dead in 2011. the decision likely sends her trial forward as she had previously rejected a plea deal offering 18 months in prison. patrick, who weighed only 19lbs when found and suffered emotional and physical trauma, has since made a full recovery and now weights 50lbs, living happily with a veterinary facility administrator. if curtis had been accepted into the pre-trial intervention program, her record would have been cleared upon completion and her case resolved early, reserved for first-time offenders. the associated humane societies have filed a civil suit for ownership of patrick while hospital staffers document his progress on their website and receive extensive support from people around the world. kisha curtis faces neglect and abandonment charges for failing to provide food and water to the dog and leaving him tied outside her newark apartment for over a week, leading to his discovery in the trash. the charges carry a maximum sentence of 18 months in jail and a $10,000 fine, as well as two abandonment charges with up to six months in jail and a $1,000 fine. curtis maintains she left patrick in a hallway but did not abuse him. patrick's remarkable recovery has captivated the world and gained considerable attention through media coverage and support from thousands of well-wishers. born from the horrifying trauma, the hospital has chronicled his progress on their website and facebook page, drawing fans from around the world. while still nervous around strangers, patrick thrives in his new home and demonstrates immense love and trust, becoming a beloved mascot and symbol of resilience.
605	quentin bryce, the governor-general of australia, has made history by becoming the first representative of the monarchy to publicly support australia becoming a republic. in a speech, she expressed her hope that one day, an australian-born person may become the nation's first head of state. the comments have reignited the impassioned debate about australia's ties with britain and come just months before the upcoming visit of the duke and duchess of cambridge. supporters of the monarchy criticized bryce's comments, arguing it was inappropriate for someone representing the queen to take such a stance. pro-republicans, on the other hand, hailed it as a "historic declaration." bryce, who retires next month after five years in the job, is an outspoken advocate of women's rights and has been at odds with prime minister tony abbott on two major constitutional issues. abbott is a staunch monarchist and has largely kept the issue off the political radar in recent years. while the role of the governor-general is largely ceremonial, they perform the same constitutional role as the monarch in the united kingdom. bryce's remarks were met with silence from buckingham palace, who stated that it was a matter for the people of australia to decide.
606	ibrahim hassan al-asiri, a 28-year-old saudi national believed to be living in yemen for the past three years, is a wanted explosives and poison expert suspected of creating bombs sent to synagogues in chicago with the intent of detonating them. he is known to be an al-qaeda bomb maker and is linked to the december 2009 attempted underwear bomb attack on a us flight, which used the explosive compound, petn. al-asiri had a regular upbringing but became radicalized following the death of his brother in a car accident in 2000. his brother, abdullah, also died after detonating a bomb meant for saudi prince muhammad bin nayef in 2009, an attempt that failed to kill the target. ibrahim and abdullah grew up in a pious family in the al-jazira district of riyadh, but both later became involved with extremist groups and were eventually listed as saudi arabia's most wanted men.
607	scientists aim to diagnose the condition of joseph merrick, also known as the elephant man, by analyzing dna from his skeleton, which has been preserved at the royal london hospital since his death in 1890. researchers plan to identify any gene alterations that may have caused his disfigurement, which included thickened skin, abnormal bone growth, and difficulty speaking. merrick was once believed to have elephantiasis, but it is now suspected he suffered from proteus syndrome. born in leicester in 1862, merrick's appearance began changing in childhood, and he was eventually rejected by his family and forced to live on the streets. he became a human curiosity in a traveling sideshow until he was discovered by surgeon frederick treves, who invited him to live at the london hospital and became his advocate. merrick's story has continued to fascinate audiences, with notable portrayals by john hurt in the 1980 film "the elephant man" and brad cooper on broadway. the research team, led by professor richard trembath of queen mary university of london, aims to preserve merrick's skeleton while extracting sufficient dna for testing.
608	harriet harman and her husband jack dromey, both former labour politicians, faced renewed scrutiny over their ties to the paedophile information exchange (pie) after a letter from a pie supporter, containing £50 for the defense of three members facing prosecution, was discovered with harman's initials on it. harman and dromey have denied having any contact with pie or supporting its cause, but the letter, which arrived three years after they claimed they had defeated the group, contains a handwritten note asking to discuss the matter. pie was granted affiliate status in the national council for civil liberties (nccl), which harman was legal officer of, for several years, and dromey was a leading figure in the organization during the same time period. dromey has also been accused of contributing to an nccl handbook that promoted contact information for pie and of advocating for lowering the age of consent to 14, but he denies these accusations. several labour figures expressed concern and disquiet over the continued allegations, which they describe as damaging to the party.
609	mardi gras celebrations in new orleans are in full swing, with over 50 floats participating in the 2015 parades which commenced on january 31 and will conclude on fat tuesday, february 17. spectators from around the world have been drawn to the city for the festivities. decorations are bigger and better than ever, with teams spending months constructing colossal displays, such as a giant pink stiletto by krewe of muses and a large zebra by mystic stripers society. the parades, which include go-go girls, bagpiping troupes, and other performers, are a major attraction and a significant contributor to new orleans' $6 billion tourism economy. however, incidents such as shootings and altercations during the parades can occur due to alcohol and overcrowding.
610	a mother who has experienced 13 miscarriages, including the loss of twin boys at 18 weeks, is seeking to adopt a little girl and has put her wedding ring up for sale to help fund the adoption. the couple, zaundia and enoch klingbeil from fargo, north dakota, have a son, elias, who is 11 years old. they have been attempting to have another child since then, but have faced numerous miscarriages. the little girl they intend to adopt, named elise, is expected to have expensive medical issues and the couple needs to raise around $8,000 for adoption fees and travel. moved by their story, the community and local businesses have rallied around the family and have so far donated over $8,000, allowing the mother to keep her wedding ring for now.
611	a 26-year-old mother-of-two, aimee willett, from sittingbourne, kent, who was diagnosed with inoperable cancer this year and given a prognosis of unlikely survival until 2016, was determined to fulfill her dream of getting married to her fiancé, michael bond. though they thought they could not afford their dream wedding, a fundraising appeal touched the hearts of numerous well-wishers who donated thousands of pounds and services to make this happen. wedding vendors such as planners, florists, car companies, professional photographers, venue owners and cake makers all reached out to donate to the event. aimee has booked her dream wedding at westenhanger castle in hythe, kent, with rings from the remi collection, chair covers and decorations from cinderella's dream wedding and event in sevenoaks, and a generous anonymous donation of £25,000 raised the overall fund beyond £31,000. aimee, a former waitress, expressed her overwhelming gratitude and said she hoped her story would encourage women to get screened for cervical cancer and lower the national smear test age. she also planned to give her family the "best christmas ever" as part of her bucket list by taking them to lapland uk.
612	a study led by professor yagesh bhambhani at the university of alberta in canada has found that using hands-free devices while driving can increase the risk of making hazardous errors, such as crossing a center line, speeding, or failing to indicate before changing lanes. the researchers found that brain activity and heart rate also increased while using hands-free phones compared to driving without any telecommunications device. despite the increase in sales of hands-free kits after it became illegal to use handheld phones while driving in the uk, the study suggests that they may not be as safe as previously thought. drivers could still face penalties for using hands-free devices if police deem them to be distracted and not in control of their vehicles.
613	the article discusses the importance of cultural training for soldiers in the us army, particularly in the context of recent wars in iraq and afghanistan. soldiers undergo rigorous physical training, but lack sufficient understanding of the cultures they will encounter in foreign lands, which can lead to misunderstandings and dangerous situations. the article emphasizes that in the 21st century, the us is at war with ideals as much as with foreign armies, and cultural awareness is crucial for effective military operations. the army has learned from its experiences in iraq and afghanistan and is now working to regionally align brigades with the six unified command zones to create units better equipped to operate in specific regions. this will involve establishing language and cultural proficiency programs to prepare troops for the people and cultures they will encounter. soldiers currently receive only limited cultural training before deployment, and some soldiers recalled receiving no training before being deployed to iraq in 2003. thearticle discusses some cultural norms that can be offensive in various countries, such as the thumbs-up sign in egypt and showing the soles of your feet in iraq. the training will be tailored to the needs and requests of nations hosting us troops and will transfer knowledge to counterparts to bring them to a proficiency level where they can help in the future. the article also mentions that the us army is facing budget cuts and the question of who will pay for this cultural training. despite this, the army sees this as a more efficient way to train troops and has made it a top priority in its army 2020 objectives.
614	manchester united's return to the top of english football is deemed an "inevitability," with louis van gaal bringing the title to old trafford in the near future. however, barcelona's lionel messi, who is speculated to be available in the transfer market, may not join united due to uefa's financial fair play regulations. manchester city and chelsea could afford messi but face restrictions under these regulations. united's financial capabilities, as demonstrated by their major signings in 2014, give them the edge to make substantial deals, despite needing champions league football to finance such investments. southampton, who recently defeated manchester united, are not expected to pose a long-term threat to united's dominance in english football, as uefa ensures that manchester united cannot experience a prolonged period of mediocrity.
615	a tory health minister, jane ellison, has admitted for the first time that prime minister david cameron is preventing the introduction of plain cigarette packaging, despite growing pressure from health campaigners. ellison, who promised draft regulations by the end of april, now says she's just waiting for approval from the prime minister. six hundred clinicians have urged the government to publish the plans in an open letter, while labour claims cameron is being influenced by his election strategist, lynton crosby, who has represented tobacco firms in the past. smoking-related diseases remain the leading cause of preventable deaths in the uk, killing over 100,000 people annually. supporters argue plain packaging would help reduce the attraction of cigarettes to teenagers, but some tory colleagues worry about the impact on small businesses like newsagents. ellison believes plain packaging would have a positive impact on public health. labour's shadow public health minister, luciana berger, has called on cameron to bring forward the regulations and accused him of caving into vested interests. a no. 10 spokesperson denied any attempt was being made to block the measure.
616	a three-week-old girl, eliza delacruz, is missing after a shooting at her home in long beach, california, which left her mother and two others critically wounded. the infant, who weighs 10lbs, was not in her crib when police arrived at the scene on saturday at 6pm. authorities have launched an urgent manhunt for a suspect believed to have taken the child away. the three shooting victims are currently in a stable condition in the hospital. an investigation is ongoing, but no leads have been reported. anyone with information is asked to contact the lapd at 565-435-6711.
617	a blind kitten named quirky, who was rescued from being thrown away with the trash and discovered near a local tip in san juan island, washington, has become a social media sensation with nearly 15,000 facebook likes and hundreds of youtube videos. quirky, who is filmed trying to groom himself but ends up licking the air due to his blindness, was initially taken to a vet who considered euthanization due to his condition and a head wound, but was saved by frank and vicky giannangelo, who fell in love with him and took him back to their home in new mexico. despite his blindness, quirky navigates well and has become a viral hit, with vicky emphasizing that blind kittens make wonderful pets.
618	a model village created by great-grandmother pat bullman and her late husband oliver in their garden in wicken, cambridgeshire, over a period of 50 years, has been restored by volunteers beverley lorking and tony middleton after it fell into disrepair following pat's husband's death in 2012. the volunteers used their skills asformer toolmakers to bring back the village's former glory with new buildings, including a farmshop, blue and white flower shop, fire station, pub, and windmill. new pavements, footpaths, picnic benches, and vehicles, such as a miniature oxo van and diggers, have been added. the village now boasts a river, paddocks of animals, and dozens of farm buildings. community support came in the form of donations of wood, paint, and other items. pat bullman expressed her gratitude to the volunteers for helping her save this memorial to her late husband and restore the cheerfulness of the village that attracted visitors for decades.
619	rodell sanders, a former chicago gang leader who was wrongly convicted of a brutal gang murder in 1994, spent 20 years in prison after allegedly being framed by corrupt police officers. while incarcerated, sanders taught himself the law and filed court documents that led to a new trial. he studied for up to 12 hours a day, isolating himself from visitors and friends to focus on his legal education. he claimed that police detectives cropped a photo of him to make him look thinner and that a key witness was coerced into testifying against him with a plea deal. sanders was eventually acquitted in 2021, and is currently pursuing a federal lawsuit against the police officers and town of chicago heights for civil rights violations. he had previously rejected a plea deal that would have had him serving about 23 years in prison.
620	sweden's new prime minister stefan lofven announced at a conference that sweden will recognize palestine as a sovereign state, making it the 131st country to do so. lofven stated that the israeli-palestinian conflict can only be resolved through a two-state solution requiring mutual recognition and a will to co-exist peacefully. jewish groups criticized the move as a "token gesture" and a violation of eu principles to recognize states based on negotiations. palestinian officials praised the decision and called on other eu countries to follow. the israeli-palestinian conflict dates back to the 1967 six day war, where israel occupied the west bank and gaza strip, with palestinians seeking an independent, sovereign state in the area. previous swedish governments did not recognize palestine's statehood, but the palestinians have gained recognition from about 100 countries and the un as a non-member observer state.
621	a 55-year-old woman named pamela jackson, also known as cris or crissie, from chester-le-street, county durham, has been reported missing since march 2, 2023. she was last seen at her home and was reported missing on thursday. officers have revealed that they have started a murder investigation after a man, adrian muir, 50, from halifax, west yorkshire, was charged in connection with her death. muir is expected to appear before magistrates in consett, county durham. jackson is described as petite, slim, with long black hair, and usually wears vintage-style clothing with rings and costume jewellery. she does not drive and has no recent activity on her mobile phone or facebook page. detectives have been searching for her since saturday and have over 40 officers and specialist staff working on the case. jackson has two other sons, andrew and christopher. the investigation is ongoing, and no comments are being accepted on the article at the moment.
622	rhode island tv reporter julie tremmel was fired from wjar-tv after doing a handstand during a lighthearted report about america's got talent auditions. tremmel became a viral internet sensation in 2013 when her unintentionally comical bear survival report gained widespread attention. some staff members at the station reportedly disapproved of her antics, with veteran investigative reporter jim taricani calling her reports a "smudge on our station's reputation." tremmel's handstand report received mixed reactions on social media, with some supporters creating a "bring julie tremmel back to nbc 10" petition and a "support news reporter julie tremmel" facebook page. the station has not commented on why tremmel's handstand report led to her dismissal. tremmel gained initial fame in 2013 with her "how to survive a bear attack" report, which received coverage from numerous media outlets and inspired parodies.
623	a talented former head boy and star pupil named adam dixon, 18, from halifax, west yorkshire, died after taking mdma (ecstasy) with two friends at leeds metropolitan university at the beginning of a new term. the youngsters listened to music and danced before going to bed around 1am. one of the friends discovered adam was unwell around 4:30am and called an ambulance. paramedics and the security guard performed cpr, but adam was pronounced dead at 5:42am. dr. richard shepherd conducted the post-mortem examination and determined that the drug had caused an irregular heartbeat, leading to his death. adam's parents urged young people to abstain from taking drugs, and mr. dixon reminded them that using ecstasy is a dangerous game, "like playing russian roulette." adam was the head boy at hipperholme and lightcliffe high school, where he excelled in academics, sports, and helping his mother in her childcare business. he was also a musician and actively involved in fundraising for the meningitis trust after losing a friend to the disease. the coroner recorded a cause of death as a consequence of non-dependent drug abuse.
624	philip hughes, a talented australian cricketer, passed away at the young age of 25 after being struck by a ball during a practice session. kyly clarke, wife of hughes' best friend michael clarke, paid an emotional tribute to him on instagram, expressing her deep sorrow and fond memories. australian cricket captain michael clarke, along with hughes' father, brother, and fellow cricketers, will serve as pallbearers at the funeral. the service will be attended by sporting greats, politicians, and thousands of mourners at hughes' old alma mater, macksville high school. a guard of honor from australian cricketers and a private wake at the macksville ex-services club are also part of the arrangements. the #putyourbatsout campaign, where cricket bats are placed outside homes and schools in his honor, has been widely embraced across australia, with many remembering the cricketer as a son, brother, and friend.
625	nawal masaad, a 26-year-old university student from north london, and amal el-wahabi, a 27-year-old mother of two from northwest london, have been charged with terrorism offenses related to attempting to smuggle €20,000 in cash to syria. masaad was arrested at heathrow airport with the money wrapped in clingfilm and denied funding terrorism in court. she maintains her innocence and claims she was traveling to istanbul, turkey, not syria. both women pleaded not guilty and are on conditional bail until their july trial. el-wahabi's address is protected under a contempt of court order. this is the first time british women have been charged with terrorism offenses related to the conflict. masaad, who wore heavy makeup and aviator sunglasses to court, smiled as she left the building.
626	hubert fournier, lyon's coach, has criticized paris saint-germain striker zlatan ibrahimovic for insulting referees in english or italian during games. ibrahimovic, who has won league titles with multiple clubs, including psg, juventus, and barcelona, is known for his fiery behavior towards officials. the game between lyon and psg on sunday could be a turning point in the season, with psg looking to climb into first place if they win. ibrahimovic is returning to form after an injury-hit season, and lyon will be without their top-scorer alexandre lacazette due to a hamstring injury and key center half milan bisevac due to a season-ending knee injury. fournier has warned his players to keep their composure and avoid insulting the officials, while ibrahimovic has a history of provoking opponents. psg is on a six-game win streak, while lyon's team is made up mostly of homegrown players.
627	the robinson funeral home in easley, south carolina, is undergoing its fourth expansion and will be the first in the town to feature a starbucks coffee shop. chris robinson, general manager and vice president, shares that his ancestor was forward-thinking by operating a funeral home in a separate building instead of a converted home. starbucks is providing training and equipment, with no visible signage outside, and the coffee area will have a separate entrance for the public. the funeral home expects to open the coffee shop in august, aiming to provide a respite for mourners and the community. starbucks recognized the demand in the area and is supportive of the endeavor, with the coffee shop meeting a need for those intimidated by funeral homes as well. the funeral home will continue offering its own coffee option. the expansion comes after a significant violation was discovered during a recent undercover funeral home sting operation. (source: cnn affiliate wspa)
628	jason statham, known for his masculine roles in films like "the fast and the furious," was voted as britain's "manliest man" in a national survey, beating footballer david beckham, actors gerard butler and ray winstone, and others, including tom hardy and idris elba. statham received 24% of the votes in the survey. the competition, organized by men's fitness magazine and men's cancer charity orchid, in partnership with male grooming brand the bluebeards revenge, encourages men to enter themselves or nominate a man in their life to win the title of britain's manliest man. the winner will receive a year's modeling contract and a chance to appear in men's fitness magazine, while also promoting awareness for testicular cancer. the survey results come ahead of the ongoing competition where men can enter themselves or nominate a man in their life to win the title. over 43,000 men in the uk are diagnosed every year with testicular, prostate, and penile cancer. the competition aims to encourage men to be more aware of the early signs and symptoms of the disease.
629	in a study published in the journal psychological science, researchers from san diego state university and columbia business school found that individuals in positions of power have more monotonous and louder voices compared to those in lower-power roles. these vocal cues are perceived by listeners who can accurately identify powerful people based on their voices. the study was inspired by former uk prime minister margaret thatcher, who underwent voice coaching to project a more authoritative persona. the researchers recorded college students reading passages and assigned them roles with varying levels of power, then compared the acoustics of their voices. they found that powerful individuals exhibited more pronounced vocal changes, such as going up in pitch and speaking more loudly and monotonously, compared to those in lower-power roles. listeners, unaware of the experiment, were able to accurately identify the power level of the speakers based on their voices. the findings suggest that vocal cues play a significant role in determining the outcome of interactions between individuals with differing levels of power.
630	john shearen, a florida resident, was arrested on his 51st birthday for allegedly possessing nearly 1,000,000 images and videos of child pornography. he was identified by the florida department of law enforcement (fdle) while they were monitoring child pornography websites and found him downloading more content at his home. agents seized up to 1 million files stored on several computers and external hard drives, which were being transferred to dvds. shearen has been charged with 40 counts of distribution and possession of child pornography, but authorities expect this number to rise as the investigation continues. they described him as the "no. 1 person that can distribute child pornography throughout the world." some neighboring residents expressed relief upon hearing of his arrest. the fdle found children's underwear in his home and are investigating to determine if any children had been involved.
631	a 19-year-old woman named jessica chambers from batesville, mississippi, died on sunday after her car was engulfed in a fire near a rural road in courtland, mississippi. the district attorney, john champion, revealed on friday that investigators are looking into the possibility that someone was in the car with chambers before the fire. he did not disclose why they believe she wasn't alone prior to the incident. the rewards for information about the case have grown to $11,000, and investigators have obtained warrants to access chambers' phone records. they believe that the phone will hold the key to the investigation as it may provide critical leads. chambers' funeral will be held on saturday in batesville. investigators are currently treating the incident as an arson, and signs of an accelerant were found at the scene. the atf is assisting with the investigation. chambers' older sister, amanda prince, stated that she received a call from chambers at a gas station before her death, where she mentioned that she would be home shortly after cleaning her car. employees at the gas station mentioned that chambers seemed normal during her visit. the community is eager for details about the investigation, with a facebook page titled "justice for jessica" gaining over 97,000 likes. the investigation is ongoing.
632	a gunman identified as bradford baumet, 36, stormed into las dominicanas m & m hair salon in florida on thursday, october 2012, shooting dead three women - one of whom was five months pregnant - and leaving another injured. the gunman's ex-girlfriend, marcia santiago, was critically wounded in the attack. baumet then shot himself dead at a friend's house nearby. cctv footage from a nearby metro pcs store showed baumet calmly walking to the salon and running away less than a minute later, after the shootings. police linked baumet to the death of roberto colon, 28, whose car he had stolen and was driving on the day of the shootings. colon was found dead in his home on friday. officers said baumet had a history of violence and arrests for domestic assault, felony assault, stalking, burglary, and drug possession. the wounded victim was taken to hospital in serious condition. both the victim and the salon owner had recently filed domestic violence injunctions against baumet. baumet had been in police custody just days before the shootings for allegedly operating a vehicle with a suspended license. he previously served probation for stalking and burglary charges, as well as a domestic violence injunction in broward county. the attack was the second time in three weeks that a man had targeted his former girlfriend at a central florida workplace and shot multiple people before taking his own life.
633	stéphane malka, a french architect and former graffiti artist, has transformed 23 homeless shelters into pods attached to the side of marseille's railroad station. the pods, called a-kamp47, are safe for now due to a french rule that prohibits taking people off the streets during winter months. malka's design, inspired by the city's gun violence problem, was erected in 12 hours and includes thermal blankets and storage space. the pods, which can house up to 47 people, are part of a series of similar projects for malka's book, le petit pari(s), coming out next year. malka intended for the pods to increase visibility of the housing crisis and inspire architects to focus on community-minded projects. however, the pods have mostly been used by young travelers rather than locals. despite this, malka hopes the structures will inspire change within the housing system, given the increasing number of climate and political refugees.
634	an internal air force review revealed that security forces at malmstrom air force base in montana failed to effectively respond to a simulated hostile takeover of a nuclear missile silo during a drill last summer. the security team's inability to regain control of the captured nuclear weapon caused the base to fail its broader safety and security inspection. the document obtained through a freedom of information act request cited insufficient training and leadership culture as the underlying causes of the issue. the failure was one of several setbacks for the nuclear missile corps revealed over the past year, which included leadership and training lapses, breakdowns in discipline, and morale problems. defense secretary chuck hagel ordered two parallel nuclear reviews to address these concerns. the air force declined to provide further details about the exercise scenario or response tactics, stating that it could compromise security. the corrective measures included arranging for recapture exercises and more closely tracking lessons learned. the inspection failure occurred during an evaluation designed to ensure the proper control of nuclear weapons. security forces are responsible for various protective roles on the air force's three nuclear missile bases, including along roads used to transport missiles and warheads, at weapons storage facilities, and at launch silos and control centers.
635	great tits, birds that peck open milk bottles for cream, are the last surviving animals exhibiting one of the earliest known examples of culture in animals aside from humans. scientists at the university of oxford and lund university have discovered that not only do great tits pass down traditions through generations, but they also adapt to fit the local area. this is the first evidence of cultural conformity, a key factor in the development of complex culture among humans, found in any wild animals besides primates. female great tits are more skilled at remembering food cache locations and retrieving them, even pilfering from males, according to a study in behavioral ecology and sociobiology. great tits have learned to open puzzle boxes from observing each other in the wild and pass on these learned behaviors through generations. the birds conform to local traditions when they move between populations, allowing each population to maintain its unique customs despite migration. this finding challenges previous beliefs that conformist behavior was only seen in primates. the puzzle-solving experiments conducted in wytham wood in oxford revealed that birds favored the method they learned from innovator birds in their area, and even birds that had migrated between populations adopted local traditions rather than their own. these findings may explain why raiding milk bottles by pecking through the foil tops, a behavior first noticed in the 1920s in the uk, persisted for so long. the experiments suggest that birds can learn through observation and create arbitrary local cultural traditions, even though these traditions have no survival benefits, they may persist over years.
636	kate middleton attended the annual diplomatic reception at buckingham palace, the largest gathering the monarch holds each year. for the first time since her wedding in 2011, she wore a dazzling tiara, believed to be loaned to her by the queen from the collection of princess margaret. the delicate diamond tiara, made from a dismantled necklace gifted to the queen mother, is adorned with pearls and dates back to the 1930s. kate wore an alexander mcqueen evening gown and looked regal with her long hair styled to show off the tiara. this was a "three-line whip" event for william and kate, as they usually avoid attending state banquets. the reception allows members of the royal family to meet and greet the 172 foreign missions accredited to the court of st. james's in london.
637	raheem sterling was sent off in england's draw with ecuador, missing the final warm-up game against honduras. the liverpool forward made a reckless challenge on antonio valencia, sparking a late brawl. valencia reacted aggressively due to fears of injuries after teammate secondo castillo nearly missed out on the world cup due to injury. both players were shown red cards, with england manager roy hodgson expressing disappointment over the incidents.
638	federal agents, equipped with body armor and breathing apparatus, raided the home of kevin curtis in corinth, mississippi, after he was charged with sending letters laced with the poison ricin to president barack obama and senator roger wicker. curtis is also an elvis impersonator. the heavily-armed agents took extreme precautions due to the potential danger of contamination. curtis is believed to have sent the poisoned letters just one day after the boston bombings. he had previously sent letters to wicker and had been identified as a potential threat because of the frequency of his correspondence. curtis is accused of writing about a conspiracy to sell body parts on the black market and had spoken of issues with a cleaning business. the raid and the alleged ricin plot have left the country on a high state of alert. the letters intercepted at a mail screening facility in maryland contained the same message, 'to see a wrong and not expose it, is to become a silent partner to its continuance.' and the signature 'i am kc and i approve this message.' the findings of the field tests are not definitive and further analysis is being conducted at an accredited laboratory. more letters may still be received as the investigation continues and there is no indication of a connection to the boston bombings.
639	members of iraq's yazidi minority have carried out revenge attacks on sunni muslim villagers in sinjar, leaving at least 21 people dead and 17 missing. the yazidis, whose ancient religion is a blend of zoroastrianism, christianity, and islam, suffered greatly during islamic state's (isis) offensive last year, with hundreds killed, thousands captured, and raped. now, as some yazidis return to their homes, they have uncovered mass graves and accused sunni villagers of helping isis commit atrocities against the yazidi community. arabs in the affected villages claim that heavily armed yazidi groups have raided their villages, while the identity of the yazidi assailants remains unclear. these violent reprisals highlight the deep divisions between communities that had coexisted for decades and the risk of further violence as other groups displaced by isis, such as shi'ite turkmens, shabak, christians, and kakais, return home. the attacks also underscore the challenges facing iraq as it attempts to recover from isis's brutal rule.
640	a spanish man, 25, was ordered by a judge to leave his parents' home in malaga and find a job after he took them to court for stopping his monthly allowance of $588. the judge ruled that the man, who was studying law but not making progress, should make an effort to find employment within 30 days. the family court also ordered the parents to pay them $292 per month for food expenses for the next two years and take over the son's car repayments. the situation at home had become tense with physical and verbal altercations between the son and his parents. in spain, it is common for young adults to live with their parents well into their 30s due to high youth unemployment, with 4.6 million unemployed and 1.3 million homes having no one in work.
641	tory peer lord ashcroft shared a risqué image of a naked woman with a seagull covering her modesty on his twitter feed, causing some confusion as to whether it was a pigeon as he captioned it. in a follow-up post, he stated that he was in a good mood and clarified that it was indeed a seagull in the image. ashcroft, who was the deputy chairman of the conservative party from 2005 to 2010, has since continued to conduct political polling and was knighted in 2000 and became a member of the house of lords. he has not yet commented on the incident when contacted by mailonline.
642	president barack obama announced on friday that ash carter is his nominee to replace outgoing defense secretary chuck hagel. carter, a national security veteran with over 30 years of experience, expressed his honor and privilege at being nominated. hagel, who was scheduled to attend the ceremony, decided not to attend to focus on carter and his appointment. carter, a decorated official and former deputy defense secretary, has a long list of academic achievements and has been unanimously confirmed by the senate before. republican and democratic lawmakers have expressed support for his nomination.
643	a united airlines flight from honolulu to guam was forced to make an emergency landing on midway island on friday due to an electrical odor on board, according to the federal aviation administration (faa). the boeing 777 plane, carrying 335 passengers and 13 crew members, experienced electrical issues that caused the failure of radar and other systems, according to a passenger. the incident was described as an odor in the cabin by united spokeswoman mary clark, but some passengers reported smoke in the cockpit. passengers spent seven hours on midway island before a replacement aircraft took them back to hawaii. united is investigating the plane, which the spokeswoman described as one of the most sophisticated in aviation. in the meantime, passengers criticized the airline for letting the flight depart despite the reported issue before it was diverted. passengers were told of the odor in the cockpit before takeoff but some left the plane while others, including a family of 25 people, decided to stay. a video showed passengers fanning themselves with paper inside the cabin after the landing and later traveling to a gymnasium on the island where they slept on the floor. the passengers finally reached guam on a replacement flight on saturday. the faa described the odor aboard the plane as an "electrical smell" in the cabin or cockpit.
644	burnley have signed steven reid, a free agent and former blackburn defender, on a one-year deal for the forthcoming premier league season. the 33-year-old veteran, who previously played for west bromwich albion, has 185 top-flight appearances under his belt. manager sean dyche was impressed with reid's professionalism, having played alongside him at millwall, and sees his experience as beneficial for the team's pursuit of premier league safety. reid made his professional debut with millwall before joining blackburn in 2003, spending seven years there before loan spells at qpr and west brom, and eventually signing for west brom in 2010. burnley are currently in a busy summer transfer window, already securing deals for five players, including reid, michael kightly, matt gilks, marvin sordell, and matt taylor. reid began his career with millwall.
645	the u.s. commission on international religious freedom (uscirf) released a report on tuesday detailing ongoing "severe abuses" against religious minorities in iraq, including christians, chaldo-assyrians, sabean-mandaeans, and yazidis. the commission called for the u.s. state department to designate iraq as a "country of particular concern," allowing for policy responses such as public condemnations and potential sanctions. the smaller religious groups lack protection and have faced disproportionate attacks, with christians, mandaeans, and yazidis seriously threatened with extinction. the commission also urged the incoming biden administration to ensure safe and fair provincial elections, prioritize preventing religious abuse, and address the displaced persons and refugee problem. the iraqi constitution gives islam preferred status, potentially justifying religious discrimination against non-muslims. uscirf cited examples of anti-christian violence in mosul and election intimidation in nineveh province.
646	the annual mipim property conference in cannes, france, attracts investors, developers, and government officials from around the world. this year, over 235 local council representatives from the united kingdom attended, sparking criticism as a "taxpayer-funded jolly." the event, which runs from tuesday to friday, included champagne receptions on yachts, lavish business lunches, and late-night partying. officials from some councils, such as leicester and leicestershire enterprise partnership, derby, derbyshire, nottingham and nottinghamshire, sheffield city council, and sheffield city region, sent large delegations. the total cost to the taxpayer for manchester's attendance was reported to be £50,000, with the return in private sector support claimed to be five times higher. some critics argue that the conference is a waste of taxpayer money, particularly amid rising taxes and budget cuts. despite the controversy, attendees continued to enjoy the sun, sea views, and networking opportunities.
647	a spanish politician, angel carromero, was sentenced to four years in prison in cuba for reckless driving resulting in the death of two cuban dissidents, oswaldo paya and harold cepero, in july. paya was a prominent activist challenging the cuban government, and his death prompted an outpouring of grief and questioning of the circumstances surrounding the crash. paya's widow, ofelia acevedo, accused the government of targeting paya for his opposition work and believed the crash was deliberate. the spanish embassy in cuba declined to comment on the sentencing. carromero's traveling companions, including swedish politician aron modig, also survived the crash but had no recollection of how it occurred.
648	hundreds of jobs are under threat at three bae systems shipyards in the uk, with some estimates suggesting over 1,000 jobs may be lost. the future of the yards has been uncertain for months, as the completion of two aircraft carriers has raised concerns about a lack of new work. union leaders met with defence chiefs to discuss the potential job losses and the future of the industry. the company is expected to announce the cuts as early as the next day. the govan and scotstoun yards in scotland are politically sensitive ahead of next year's scottish independence referendum. the type 26 global combat ship could keep work going at the yards, but it is not yet clear which base will build the vessel. scotland's finance secretary and union leaders are seeking clarification on the situation. the labour party's shadow defence secretary expressed concern over the potential impact on the workforce and the future of shipbuilding and the uk's defense. bae systems began a review of its defense work 18 months ago.
649	a new report from the national institute for health and clinical excellence (nice) criticizes insensitive treatment of women who experience miscarriages in the uk's national health service (nhs). women are often left to wait in wards where they can hear others giving birth, and are dealt with by insensitive doctors, nurses, and receptionists. nice urges hospitals to provide more "pregnancy assessment services," offer pregnancy tests in routine appointments, and offer care outside of regular business hours. they also recommend second scans to confirm a fetal demise and new guidelines for treating ectopic pregnancies, which can be confusing for doctors and lead to unnecessary abortions. the report also suggests measures to ensure patients are treated with dignity and respect during this distressing time. around one in five pregnancies end in miscarriage, and around one in five women in england experience miscarriage each year. the report includes recommendations from the birth trauma association and gynaecology specialist professor mary ann lumsden. health minister dan poulter has acknowledged the need for improved care for pregnant women.
650	a new television advert for beagle street life insurance has drawn criticism from parents for its disturbing content. the advert features a monster urinating on a customer in a bath before transforming into a cuddly creature. the commercial was broadcast during daytime and early evening hours, leading to over 50 complaints to the advertising standards agency (asa). the advert was shown on various channels, including during family-friendly programming. many parents reported that their children were frightened by the ad and had nightmares, causing concerns about its suitability for daytime viewing. beagle street claims the campaign is aimed at engaging with a new generation of customers who don't have or understand life insurance and is a "cheeky dig" at traditional insurance methods. however, some viewers found the advert offensive and inappropriate for children and called for it to be banned. the asa has received 55 complaints and is currently investigating the matter.
651	lawrence wilkerson, former chief of staff to colin powell, accused the republican party and one of mitt romney's top aides, john sununu, of racism over sununu's comment that powell endorsed president obama due to their shared race. wilkerson appeared on ed schultz's msnbc show and boldly stated that "my party is full of racists." the dispute follows sununu's remarks suggesting that powell's endorsement was not based on policy issues but skin color. this controversy comes amid increasing polarization along racial lines in the 2012 presidential race, with obama's support among white voters dwindling compared to 2008. the washington post tracking poll revealed that obama's share among white voters had dropped from 43% to 37%, leaving him 23 points behind romney in this demographic. obama and sununu dismissed the racially charged comment, but the controversy sparked outrage within the democratic camp just hours before a new poll showed a widening black-white divide in the highly contested election.
652	ben treuhaft, a 66-year-old pensioner and pianist, has set up a tent on portobello beach in edinburgh after being kicked out of his house by his wife. his mother, jessica mitford, was one of the mitford sisters, known for their scandalous lifestyles in british society during the 1930s. two of jessica's sisters, unity and diana, were fascists who met with adolf hitler and married fascist leaders. ben, a trained piano tuner, has faced an eviction notice from edinburgh city council due to breaching management rules against camping within one mile of a public road. he has vowed to fight the eviction and plans to replace his old piano with a larger one, making it harder for the council to remove. despite facing eviction, ben remains hopeful and wants the community's support to keep playing the piano on the beach for the public. ben has an intriguing family history, with his mother being one of the infamous mitford sisters.
653	britain is experiencing a surge in the construction of wind turbines, making it the third-highest wind power generator in europe with 8.4 gigawatts of capacity. this trend is attributed to the planned cut in subsidies for onshore wind energy, scheduled for april. over 1,200 turbines are set to be built this year, with an additional 7,843 having approval but yet to be constructed. the uk wind power generated by the 4,369 operational turbines is sufficient to power over 4.6 million homes. the government aims to quadruple wind capacity by 2020 and attract significant investment, but clear political support is necessary. meanwhile, small-scale wind turbines and wind farms increased by 50% last year, with some contested due to their visual impact. a 115ft wind turbine in devon was recently destroyed by high winds, raising concerns about the sustainability and cost-effectiveness of the industry.
654	juncture's £2million bid to secure manchester united's patrice evra is ongoing despite louis van gaal's desire to keep him, with the french left-back's wife allegedly pushing for a move. juventus will offer evra a two-year deal worth £55,000-a-week after tax. manchester united are also considering signing juventus midfielder arturo vidal for around £37m, but are currently far from reaching an agreement. meanwhile, united have made tentative enquiries about wolfsburg's ricardo rodriguez as an alternative to evra, with liverpool also considered a suitor for the swiss international defender.
655	patrick stewart, known for his roles in "star trek: the next generation" and other productions, has been knighted by queen elizabeth ii in the new year honors list for services to drama. ross brawn, the formula 1 racing team boss, will receive an officer of the order of the british empire (obe) for his contributions to the sport. jenson button, a formula 1 racing driver who races with brawn's team, will receive a member of the order of the british empire (mbe). british designers amanda wakeley, cath kidston, and luella bartley, and restaurateurs rose gray and ruth rogers, also made the list for their accomplishments in their respective fields. the honors, awarded twice a year, recognize service and achievement and are considered a significant honor for british citizens, with a knighthood being the highest title, making the recipient a "sir" or "dame."
656	a bank manager, debra cox, and her mother, carol collier, have been sentenced to four years and 15 months in prison, respectively, for defrauding cox's friends and family of £200,000. cox had secretly applied for personal loans and mortgages in the names of her in-laws and transferred the funds into collier's account. the pair used the money to fund their 'happy life' with luxurious holidays. cox was dismissed from her job at hsbc for gross misconduct in 2010, after which her ex-husband reported suspicious transactions on his family's accounts. hsbc reimbursed the victims of the fraud, which occurred between october 2006 and june 2010. cox's defense argued that she was trying to buy her way to a happy life, while collier's defense stated that she was unaware of the fraud and was only a willing recipient of the money.
657	entrepreneur rob law, who turned down by investors on dragon's den in 2006, faced a legal dispute after a rival company, pms international, began marketing a children's ride-on suitcase, the kiddee case, with a similar design to his successful trunki suitcase. the appeal court ruled that the kiddee case's "softer and more rounded" shape differed significantly from the trunki's "sleek and stylised" design, and that the possibility of parental confusion was slight. law, who employs over 50 people and enjoys a turnover of over £7 million a year, was disappointed as the decision effectively opens up the european market to the discount competitor. law, a former northumbria university student, was inspired to design the trunki after visiting a toy shop and won the 1998 materials design award. the trunki, which can be ridden like a toy and sells in 97 countries, won a top prize at the national business awards in 2012. pms argued that the trunki's design rights were invalidated by publicity from the 1998 award ceremony, but the court ruled that the differences in shape, decoration, and color meant that the confusion risk was minimal.
658	rufus hound, a comedian and bbc radio 4 presenter, has come under criticism after making controversial comments towards british prime minister david cameron and health secretary jeremy hunt in a blog post. in the post, titled "david and jeremy want your kids to die (unless you’re rich)," hound accused the politicians of wanting to privatize the national health service (nhs) and sell it off to wealthy donors, implying they don't care about the health of the average person. the comments drew outcry from politicians, with tory mp rob wilson labeling the remarks as "disgusting and crass." hound's blog post came shortly after he announced his candidacy for the european parliament elections on a platform of opposing nhs privatization. his comments did not sit well with the public, and despite criticism on social media, hound refused to apologize. hound's comments were not made on behalf of the bbc, as he is a freelancer and not an employee, and his personal views on his blog are not the corporation's responsibility, according to a bbc spokesman. cameron's son ivan, who suffered from cerebral palsy and a rare form of epilepsy, died at the age of six in 2009, and cameron has publicly expressed his gratitude to nhs staff for his son's care.
