659	edvard snowden, the american intelligence leaker currently residing in russia, has revealed that he has received threats against his life. in an interview with a german tv channel, he claimed that unnamed us government officials have expressed a desire to kill him. these threats come after a buzzfeed article quoting anonymous sources from the pentagon and the nsa stating that they would like to see snowden dead or harmed. snowden, who is wanted on treason charges for leaking classified information about us and british surveillance programs, has ruled out returning to the us due to the belief that he would not receive a fair trial. he has been living in moscow under the protection of the russian federal security service (fsb) since last summer. the interview was kept secret and snowden's lawyer has also expressed concerns for his safety. the us president, barack obama, has spoken about the need to protect civil liberties while also pledging to end spying on friendly heads of state. additionally, an unnamed army source suggested snowden could be "poked" on his way back from a supermarket and administered with poison.
660	a report by the commons defence select committee has raised major concerns over the shortfall of specialist troops in britain's armed forces, leaving them vulnerable. key trades including bomb disposal experts, interrogators, and electronic warfare operators are experiencing vacancies. the army is reported to have a shortage of 700 intelligence officers and more than 40% of posts in some medical specialisms are unfilled. under-staffed "operational pinch points" have increased in the royal navy and army, leading to a shortage of around 1,600 troops. the ministry of defence (mod) has reduced the size of the armed forces by 30,000 since 2010 to save £4.7 billion and eliminate a £38 billion equipment overspend. military officers and mps have recommended the uk government offer financial incentives to retain experienced personnel in crucial roles. shortages are occurring at a time when the rate of personnel volunteering to leave the forces is above average. the mod is hoping to fill vacancies by increasing the size of the territorial army but commanders warn that capability gaps could remain. shadow defence secretary vernon coaker expressed concern over the shortfall of trained personnel for critical operational requirements, including specialized roles in engineering, technical and medical expertise. the mod has already implemented financial incentives, specialist pay, and recruitment bonuses to manage pinch-points. those made redundant can also apply to transfer into specialist trades. the ministry maintains confidence in its ability to meet all strategic defense priorities with the right personnel and skill sets.
661	a 90-year-old world war ii veteran, andy nowicki, and his wife, who have lived in a subsidized housing complex in newington, connecticut for 20 years, have been given a eviction notice due to his smoking habit, despite efforts to comply with the complex's new no-smoking policy. the veteran, who started smoking during the war and suffers from mobility issues, is urging the housing authority for an exception due to his age, disability, and war record. the housing authority, however, is unwilling to make an exception, citing health and safety concerns, and the matter is set for a hearing on september 3. the mayor and a state senator have intervened to find a compromise, but no agreement has been reached yet.
662	the gaza-israel border is the scene of a two-week-old conflict between israel and hamas militants, with international journalists facing significant restrictions in accessing the palestinian territory. dozens of international journalists have been prevented from entering gaza due to israeli media restrictions, forcing them to report from a hill near the border. egyptian borders are also closed to journalists. israeli authorities have accused hamas of exploiting civilian casualties for international sympathy, and allowing journalists in would provide a more thorough picture of the military operation. in contrast, during israel's 2006 war against hezbollah militants in lebanon, reporters were allowed to broadcast from israeli artillery positions. however, israel has changed tactics this time and prevented international reporters from being embedded with the military to avoid interference in military operations. the israeli government has faced criticism from press freedom groups and the un for the media restrictions. both israeli and hamas have launched videos on youtube, with the israeli military sharing documentation of its actions and hamas releasing graphic footage and attacks on rival fatah. journalists based inside gaza have controlled the images broadcast, and very few images of hamas fighters or rockets being fired into israel have been seen by the outside world. the line between winning and losing in war can be influenced by public relations, making it essential for journalists to find a balance in the story. however, their ability to do so is hampered when they cannot cover all the angles.
663	a hijacking attempt was thwarted on a plane in xinjiang, china, ten minutes after takeoff between hotan and urumqi. six suspected uyghur hijackers tried to take control of the plane through violence, but were subdued by passengers and crew members, resulting in minor injuries for all parties involved. the suspects were taken into custody and the plane returned to hotan. operations at the airport have since returned to normal, and authorities praised the bravery of the passengers and crew members. the incident is still under investigation, and uyghurs, who are a distinct turkic muslim group, have been labeled terrorists by chinese authorities following outbreaks of violence in recent years.
664	thirteen juveniles escaped from the woodland hills youth development center in nashville, tennessee, for the third time in less than two months. twelve of the escapees were recaptured, but one 16-year-old with a criminal record remains at large. the escapees include several who were involved in the previous incidents. woodland hills, which houses delinquent male youth between 13 and 19 with at least three felonies, has upgraded security measures since the last incident, installing steel panels and reinforcing the perimeter fence with concrete. however, guards lack weapons or pepper spray, and, due to a court settlement, youth are not allowed to be locked inside their rooms. friday's escape occurred after two inmates overpowered a guard, took his radio and keys, and made their way to the perimeter gate, which they opened by breaking in through the guard house. two staff members were injured during the escape.
665	rose west, a serial killer serving life in hmp low newton prison in durham, is reportedly "fuming" after being banned from using the showers following gym sessions due to a string of thefts. prison bosses enforced the rule earlier this year after items were stolen from the gym facilities. female inmates, including west, have complained about feeling "filthy" after workouts and signed a letter demanding the shower ban be overturned. the prison spokesperson confirmed that prisoners are taken back to their cells after using the gym and there is ample time to wash, but inmates argue that using sinks instead is unsatisfactory. west, who earns £16 a week as a tea lady, is reportedly an "avid" gym user and supports the campaign to restore the shower facilities. there is no specific prison service instruction requiring jails to provide showers in jail gyms, according to a source. rose west was convicted of 10 murders in 1995, including the murder of her eight-year-old daughter, heather, whose body was found under the patio at their former home dubbed the "house of horrors." many of the crimes occurred between 1973 and 1979. the house was demolished following west's conviction, and her husband, fred, committed suicide while on remand accused of 12 murders. west was given a life sentence in 1995, the first woman in the uk to be condemned to spend the rest of her life in prison. however, the european court of human rights declared whole life tariffs illegal in july. it is unclear when west will receive a new minimum term from the high court.
666	the sinai peninsula in egypt, home to bedouin tribes and criminal elements, is becoming increasingly lawless, leading to concerns about drug and arms smuggling, human trafficking, and terrorism. this instability threatens egypt's peace treaty with israel and regional security. human rights abuses, including hostage-taking and torture, against african migrants are rampant in the area. recent attacks on israeli and egyptian forces and civilians have heightened tensions, with egypt calling for an end to the peace treaty. israel has boosted security measures, but a deadly rocket attack could jeopardize the treaty and ignite a regional war. the international community, including the us, should engage egypt and israel in discussions on security and preserving the multinational force and observers' mission. egypt's new government must address corruption, respect international commitments to combat human trafficking, and bolster the peninsula's long-term economic prospects. the obama administration's atrocities prevention board could also focus on highlighting the sinai's human rights abuses. ultimately, all countries in the region have a common interest in preserving peace.
667	hundreds of black lives matter protesters gathered at the mall of america in bloomington, minnesota, on saturday despite the mall's policy against political protests. the demonstrators were met by police who made at least 20 arrests, according to cnn affiliate kare. the mall's management stated that organizers ignored their policy and repeated reminders. the mall is the nation's largest, with over 500 businesses, and over a dozen attractions including an indoor roller coaster and an aquarium. protesters simulated the deaths of black men killed by police and held up "hands up, don't shoot" signs. the mall responded with a video message demanding that the protest dispersed and threatened arrests. stores on one side of the mall were closed. some protesters voluntarily left, while others were arrested, and city prosecutors plan to pursue charges.
668	minister francis maude's plan to remove two-and-a-half privilege days for civil servants faced resistance due to the discovery that one of those days was granted by the queen during her coronation 60 years ago. the cabinet office decided to keep the queen's birthday privilege day instead of making changes, and senior civil servants agreed to forgo one-and-a-half days. tory mp bernard jenkin criticized the privilege days as being unacceptable in the current economic climate, with some viewing it as "cooking the books" to disguise the fact that staff were keeping their extra holidays. the palace declined to discuss any talks about the proposal.
669	the much-criticized budget deal is expected to receive final congressional approval this week, ending the stalemate in washington. house speaker john boehner openly expressed his frustrations with the far-right tea party members, calling them "ridiculous" and "lost all credibility." in response, the republican national committee (rnc) is planning to limit the number of debates and strip delegates from candidates who participate in unofficial gop debates and forums. the tea party's influence on the republican party has been a source of internal conflict, and 60% of americans want a third party. it remains to be seen if the tea party will be reined in or if it will break away and form its own party. the political landscape is changing, with unpopular figures like chris christie and the loss of conservatives in the 2012 election fueling speculation that the group may make a significant decision in the near future.
670	the us nuclear regulatory commission (nrc) is facing challenges in implementing measures to prevent nuclear disasters similar to fukushima, which occurred in japan a year ago. the nrc's proposals have good intentions but their effectiveness will depend on execution and timeliness. the industry is taking steps to address vulnerabilities through the "diverse and flexible coping capability" (flex) program, but it might not adequately protect the public. fukushima revealed that us reactors share similarities with the japanese ones in regards to safety concerns, such as hardened vents that don't work without electric power and lack of instruments to monitor spent fuel pools. the nrc has delayed addressing the most crucial recommendation, which involves clarifying regulations for events beyond design basis. this delay complicates the implementation of other recommendations, such as improving emergency equipment protection and dealing with station blackouts. the industry has already installed over 300 pieces of flex equipment, which could make it hard for the nrc to impose future standards. the union of concerned scientists has suggested strengthening reactor safeguards, but the nrc has dismissed some of their recommendations, including expanding emergency evacuation zones, enhancing potassium iodide distribution, and accelerating spent fuel transfer to dry casks. the nrc's stance may undermine efforts to enhance us reactor safety, particularly during a time when millions of americans live near nuclear power plants.
671	harriet harman, the deputy leader of the labour party, was criticized for requesting that prime minister david cameron inform her each time raf jets took off for bombing operations against islamist militants in iraq during an emergency shadow cabinet meeting before the commons vote. her colleagues and experts regarded her request as "farcical" and "daft," as political authority and military actions are generally handled by the military without frequent political input. harman's concern was for avoiding unintended civilian casualties. meanwhile, a labour peer, lord wood, recommended a "sunset clause" for the military action in iraq to limit its duration, but was reportedly overruled by the party leadership.
672	atletico madrid regained the lead in la liga with a 4-2 win over rayo vallecano, as david villa and diego costa scored for the visitors, while arda turan and joaquin larrivey also found the net. atletico capitalized on rayo's missed opportunities, with jonathan viera missing a penalty. barcelona got back to winning ways with a 3-0 victory over malaga, as gerard pique, pedro, and alexis sanchez scored for the champions. the win saw barcelona regain the top spot in the league, level on points with atletico but with a better goal difference. elsewhere, athletic bilbao beat osasuna 5-1 and almeria rose to 15th place after a 1-0 win over getafe. barcelona president sandro rosell resigned amidst a controversy surrounding the signing of neymar from santos for $78m.
673	in the moscow mayoral elections on september 8, 2013, anti-corruption campaigner alexei navalny unexpectedly received around one-third of the votes in exit polls, significantly higher than anticipated. incumbent mayor and putin ally sergei sobyanin edged closer to victory but failed to reach the 50% threshold for outright victory in the first round. navalny's team claimed that he had, in fact, garnered over 35% of the votes and demanded a run-off election. despite falling short of victory, navalny's strong showing provided significant hope for the opposition, especially given his history of leading protests against election manipulation and corruption within the ruling elite. navalny's performance was described as 'staggering' even by state-funded media. the official count was set to continue the following day.
674	a judge in los angeles warned actress lindsay lohan on wednesday that the only way to avoid jail time on a felony grand theft charge is to be acquitted in a trial. lohan's lawyer previously stated that she would consider a plea deal, but only if it did not involve jail time. the prosecution offered a plea deal during the hearing, but its terms were not disclosed. judge keith schwartz told lohan that if she is convicted, her ability to influence the sentence could be lessened. lohan has appeared in court eight times in the past nine months due to legal issues and rehab stints, and this hearing caused a media frenzy due to her attire. she wore conservative clothes but high-heeled shoes. the prosecution provided lohan and her lawyer with all police reports and video evidence from the jewelry store where the alleged theft occurred. if a plea deal is not reached before march 10, the case will go to another judge for a preliminary hearing and possible trial. the penalty for a felony grand theft conviction is between 16 months and three years in prison, while a misdemeanor conviction would have a potential sentence of one year. the value of the stolen necklace and lohan's criminal record would determine the exact sentencing. lohan is currently on probation for a 2007 drunk driving conviction and was sent to rehab a month ago. her probation officer had threatened to send her to jail for 180 days if she violated the rules before her next court appearance, which has since been canceled, and judge schwartz is now taking over her legal cases.
675	a 66-year-old british man died after being crushed by his own digger while working on his farm in sella, near alicante, spain, on tuesday. the pensioner reportedly fell into a 13ft deep pit and the machine landed on top of him, causing serious head injuries, as well as severe injuries to his hands and legs. he was taken to a nearby hospital but was later declared dead. at the time of the incident, there were around 400,000 british citizens living in spain.
676	according to a new trulia report, owning a home is becoming increasingly challenging for middle-class families. the report defines an affordable city as one where the total monthly mortgage payment, insurance, and property taxes do not exceed 31% of the metro area's median household income. the top two cities where a middle-class income is most likely to find an affordable home are dayton, ohio, and rochester, new york. ohio has the most affordable cities in the top ten, with three cities listed. the majority of the most affordable cities are located around the great lakes, while the least affordable cities tend to be on the coasts, with six of those being in california. trulia economist jed kolko noted that only 59% of all homes for sale are now considered affordable for the middle class, which is a drop of 6 percentage points from last year. kolko also stated that the decline in home affordability is making the dream of homeownership less attainable for many households.
677	kevin richardson, also known as the "lion whisperer," known for his relationships with lions and hyenas over the past 20 years, played a game of football with three real lions on the african plains as a promotion for dutch suit company van gils. the video, which has gone viral with over two million views on youtube alone, demonstrates richardson's skill in evading the wild predators while building a bond with them. he emphasizes the importance of saving lions from habitat destruction, poaching, and hunting, stressing the need to take action against those responsible. richardson has spent his adult life working closely with lions, feeding, sleeping, and caring for them. the video was filmed to raise awareness about the plight of lions and the importance of preserving their habitat.
678	scientists at university college london have discovered that some people have a poor sense of direction due to weaker signals in the brain linked to navigation. specifically, they identified networks of brain cells in the entorhinal region that respond to specific compass points, such as north and south. these cells not only activate when someone is physically facing that direction but also when they think about turning towards it. this research could potentially lead to ways to train the brain to improve sense of direction and help understand the early stages of dementia, which affects the entorhinal region. the nobel prize for medicine 2021 recognized research on the understanding of spatial navigation in the brain.
679	mandla mandela, nelson mandela's grandson and a tribal chieftain, has denied selling exclusive television broadcast rights for his grandfather's funeral to the bbc for £250,000. the accusation was made by mandla's first wife, thando, as part of their divorce proceedings. she claimed the deal was made in 2009, before nelson mandela's recent health issues. mandla has dismissed the claim, stating there is no written agreement. the intense preparation by international news organizations for covering nelson mandela's funeral has caused offense in south africa, with the latest revelation about cameras in mandela's village adding to the backlash. mandla has also faced criticism for exhuming the bodies of nelson mandela's children and breaching a court order to marry his second and third wives while still divorcing his first. nelson mandela, now 93, has a long history of health issues, including prostate cancer, tuberculosis, damage to his eyes, and a recent stomach surgery.
680	a third-grader named ikeoluwa opayemi and her family from milford, connecticut, have filed a lawsuit against the milford public schools, alleging that she was banned from attending meadowside elementary school for 21 days due to unfounded fears of ebola following her return from a family wedding in lagos, nigeria. the lawsuit claims that the school's decision was due to rumors, panic, and the "climate" at the school, while the child had not exhibited any symptoms and had not been diagnosed with ebola. the city of milford also refused the father's request for himself and his daughter to be tested for the virus. the world health organization had declared nigeria ebola-free on october 20, 2014, after 42 days without any new cases reported. another incident involving ebola-related fear occurred at a new york school where two brothers, who had recently returned from senegal, were verbally and physically assaulted by their classmates while being taunted with the word "ebola." new york and new jersey have since implemented mandatory quarantines for individuals who have had contact with ebola patients in west african countries. however, the u.s. centers for disease control and prevention asserts that the risk of contracting ebola outside of close contact with a symptomatic person is minimal.
681	scottish stunt cyclist danny macaskill's latest red bull-sponsored video, "imaginate," showcases his impressive skills in a giant play room filled with oversized props. the video was inspired by macaskill's childhood dreams and took two years to make. the former bike mechanic performs daring stunts on toys that come to life, including a giant rubik's cube, building blocks, and even on top of a red bull formula one racing car and an army tank. macaskill had already created four episodes for the "imaginate" series, but the fifth, filmed at glasgow's old transport museum, has been eagerly anticipated. he was struck down with labyrinthitis in march, which almost halted production, but he made a full recovery and continued filming. macaskill rose to fame with his "inspired bicycles" riding film and has had over 65 million internet views of his three most recent clips. he was nominated for the 2012 national geographic adventurer of the year award and performed stunts for the film "premium rush."
682	the connors family, consisting of william, mary, john, james, and miles, were jailed for forcing vulnerable men into compulsory labor while living a luxurious lifestyle using taxpayer funds.they were convicted of conspiracy to require labor in december 2012. while having millions in assets and seized bank accounts, they claimed £461,363.68 in legal aid from the legal services commission. they spent the money on holidays, high-end vehicles, and properties. the legal aid system, which is funded by taxpayers, is intended to ensure access to justice but has come under criticism due to its costs and availability to the wealthy. the proceeds of crime act hearing to seize the family's assets is expected later this year. justice secretary chris grayling acknowledged concerns over high legal aid costs and plans to address the issue.
683	in baghdad, iraq, at least 155 people were killed and over 500 were wounded in two bombings on august 31, 2014, making it the deadliest attack in the capital in over two years. security camera footage shows the moments leading up to the blasts, which occurred outside the justice ministry and near the governorate building. isis, an umbrella group for al qaeda in iraq, claimed responsibility for the attacks. the iraqi governor of baghdad, salah abdul razzaq, announced the resignations of the interior minister and baghdad commander at a news conference. the attacks raised concerns about security and the national elections scheduled for january 2015. iraqi prime minister nuri al-maliki and u.s. president barack obama condemned the attacks and pledged support for iraq. the august attacks led to increased security measures in baghdad. the last deadlier attack on iraqi civilians occurred in august 2007 in qahtaniya, northern iraq. a draft of an election law was agreed upon by iraqi leaders on august 31, 2014.
684	ann-marie noble, a 31-year-old former raf flyer, was given a terminal cervical cancer diagnosis after being given the all-clear following initial treatment. despite the devastating news, she refuses to give up and has created a bucket list of things she hopes to accomplish before her death. her list includes experiences such as dining at raymond blanc's restaurant, flying in a fast jet, meeting terry wogan for a drink, and attending the last night of the proms. ann-marie, who is currently undergoing chemotherapy, has also started a gofundme page to help raise money for travel insurance to make her bucket list a reality. she urges women to get regular smear tests to reduce their chances of cervical cancer.
685	tiny twins blair and innes, born at 30 weeks and weighing just over 3lbs each, reached out and held hands for the first time in an incubator at edinburgh royal infirmary, a week after being reunited. their parents, laura and craig, were amazed and touched by the moment, which occurred when the twins began breathing on their own in the special care unit. the unlikely occurrence was a result of the mothers' premature labor and the early administration of steroids, which helped the babies develop faster than usual. the expert emeritus psychology professor elvidina adamson-macedo noted that memories and touching are formed prior to birth, indicating that the bond between the twins may have begun earlier.
686	michael gove, the former education secretary, jokingly expressed his preference for his dog, snowy, a bichon frise puppy, to represent him on the world stage instead of ed miliband. yesterday, snowy finished as the runner-up in the annual westminster dog of the year competition. the event was dominated by conservative mps and their dogs, but labour mp rob flello and his german shepherd, diesel, took the top prize. gove was delighted with snowy's second place and said the dog was an indispensable family member. flello was proud of diesel's win, which he believed promoted responsible dog ownership. mps andrew mitchell and nadine dorries also attended the event with their dogs. gove currently serves as the chief whip, and he drew parallels between canine ownership and his political role. the competition, organized by the kennel club and dogs trust, was not apolitical and focused on the dogs' good deeds and devotion to their owners.
687	ukrainian president petro poroshenko has threatened "total war" against russia, claiming that the crisis in ukraine is more critical than the threat from islamic state. poroshenko accused russia of increasing its military presence on the borders and in rebel-held areas, which moscow denies. six ukrainian soldiers and three police officers were killed in the past 24 hours. poroshenko claimed that the latest russian "humanitarian convoy" contained ammunition instead of food and winter clothing. putin was hailed by russian media for his diplomatic skills at the g20 summit, where he was under criticism for his actions in ukraine. putin defended his annexation of crimea, claiming it was similar to what was done in kosovo, and insisting that he did not violate international law. angela merkel vowed that putin wouldn't "prevail" in ukraine. the conflict in eastern ukraine continues to escalate, with buildings being destroyed from shelling in the rebel bastion of donetsk.
688	george osborne, the chancellor of the exchequer, visited a bingo hall in cardiff to promote the reduction of bingo tax in the recent budget. despite his claim to love bingo, osborne required assistance from a player named shirley nixon to mark his card during the visit. he came close to winning £300 in the game, but fell short by a few numbers. the bingo hall was filled with delighted players who were excited to have the chancellor join them. osborne has been making rounds across the country, participating in various activities such as driving a train, pulling a pint, and visiting factories as part of an effort to connect with working-class voters. however, his attempts to blend in and sound relatable have faced criticism for being patronizing and disingenuous. during his visit to marston's brewery in wolverhampton, he was mocked for sipping a pint of beer too soon. in llantrisant, he paid a visit to the royal mint, where he discussed the production of the new 12-sided £1 coin and watched it being made. osborne also promised to boost big industry by reducing energy costs from £7 billion in the annual spending plan. his visits have been met with a mixed response, with some praising his attempts to connect with ordinary people, while others see them as insincere and out-of-touch.
689	roy hodgson, the england soccer team manager, wrote a letter of apology to amazonian officials after criticizing manaus and its climate before the world cup draw. he called the city a "wonderful" location and expressed excitement about visiting, hoping to learn about the culture and meet the people. hodgson and fa officials plan to visit the city in february before the opening match against italy on june 14. he expects several thousand english fans to attend and has praised their behavior at previous tournaments. the governor of amazonas welcomed the letter and looked forward to hosting the team.
690	workers were seen putting up fairy lights and decorations on the 20ft nordman fir christmas tree outside downing street using a cherry-picker. the tree, worth mentioning is the uk's most popular christmas tree, took ten years to grow and was provided by colin griffith, who won grower of the year at the british christmas tree growers association awards. the switch-on ceremony is scheduled for tomorrow, and the runner-up, rob morgan, will provide a smaller tree for the pillared room, and brian taylor will provide the wreath. last year's tree, also a nordman fir, was decorated with led fairy lights, silver and white baubles, topped off with a silver star. nordman firs, which originate from the mountains on either side of the black sea, are favored for their dark green, glossy needles and conical shape, and are known to keep their needles even after drying out. unlike downing street's tree, the 60-70ft tall norwegian spruce sent to trafalgar square every year is selected months or years in advance.
691	the traditional paper resume may become obsolete as more companies utilize online platforms like linkedin, facebook, and social media to evaluate job applicants. facebook is reportedly planning to launch its own jobs board, allowing users to search listings and potentially view their potential employer's impression of them on the site. some experts suggest hiring managers are already using social media profiles, blogs, and web presence to assess candidates beyond the traditional resume. companies in the tech industry are experimenting with alternative methods like web presence and video submissions. while paper resumes are not completely obsolete yet, they may take new forms in the future. some predictions suggest holographic resumes could be the next step.
692	a 23-year-old man, josef moscicki, was convicted of murdering an 83-year-old pensioner, bernard smith, by running him over with his van and dragging him 650ft on christmas day last year. moscicki, who had only regained his driver's license after a previous ban for two drink-driving convictions in 2011, was under the influence of vodka and coke when he struck smith, who was wearing a high-visibility jacket and crossing the road. moscicki denied the murder charge and was found guilty by a 10-2 majority after a five-week trial. smith suffered multiple broken bones and severe head injuries, and moscicki returned to the scene to deliberately drive over him again. moscith's family paid tribute to the "kind and caring" pensioner who lived a quiet life and kept to himself, and expressed their shock and sadness at his violent and untimely death. moscicki was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 21 years.
693	patrick kueng, a swiss skier, defied his past injuries and achieved his dream of winning the world cup downhill race in wengen, switzerland, despite the course being shortened due to high winds. kueng, who had suffered a terrible accident in 2006 that left him in a wheelchair, fought back to continue his skiing career and secured the victory with a time of 1:32.66 seconds, beating hannes reichelt and aksel lund svindal. kueng's win came after american ted ligety's victory in the super-combined event on friday, where he clocked a total of 2:44.74 seconds in the downhill and slalom. ligety, a 2006 olympic gold medallist in the combined, hoped that his win would boost his momentum for the sochi winter olympics, where he aims to secure a spot in the swiss team.
694	in the two-hour downton abbey christmas special, lady rose and aunt cora attend rose's "coming out" at buckingham palace. the episode takes place during the summer season in london and introduces new characters such as martha levinson, harold levinson, lord aysgarth, and his daughter madeleine. the royal scenes were filmed at lancaster house in london and promise a cheerier affair after last year's controversial episode where matthew crawley was killed off. the crawleys find themselves involved in a royal scandal, and cora's mother martha levinson, played by shirley maclaine, and her playboy brother harold, played by paul giamatti, return. eastenders introduces danny dyer as the new landlord of the queen vic, while mrs. brown's boys and coronation street also compete for viewers on christmas day.
695	a lithuanian gang of six individuals was jailed for a combined total of over twenty years for stealing over £1 million worth of lead from 20 churches across three counties in the east midlands, uk, between january and september 2011. the gang, based in lincoln, made almost £70,000 from selling the stolen lead to recycling yards. they were caught when a vehicle carrying stolen lead was stopped on the a46. the gang is believed to be responsible for a number of other raids and left dna evidence and traces of 'smart water' at crime scenes. the cost of repairs caused by the thefts was much greater than the value of the stolen lead, with one million pounds worth of damages reported across the 20 churches, causing extensive infrastructure damage. the gang targeted churches in lincolnshire, leicestershire, and nottinghamshire, with st. nicholas in fulbeck, st. laurence in norwell, and st. james the greater in little dalby being some of the targeted churches. the convictions and arrests marked the biggest success in the fight against heritage crime in britain to date.
696	a 23-year-old mayor, christopher wright, was shot multiple times in the leg during an attempted robbery at his georgia home last night. the suspects also tied up his mother, who suffers minor injuries. wright is currently in stable condition at phoebe putney memorial hospital, where he is awaiting surgery. no suspects have been identified in the case yet. wright was elected as the youngest mayor in georgia in november 2012 and was an assistant manager at johnson & son funeral service and a substitute teacher before taking office. witnesses reports suggest that wright was standing outside his house when he was shot, but this has not been confirmed. the shooting occurred on the 500 block of crawford street in dawson.
697	hamburg midfielder lewis holtby is facing a 10-week absence from football after breaking his collarbone during a friendly match against eintracht frankfurt. the 24-year-old, on loan from premier league side tottenham, fell awkwardly on his shoulder and will undergo surgery on friday. holtby, who joined tottenham from schalke in 2013 but failed to secure a regular spot in the team, will miss some crucial fixtures for hamburg as they strive to avoid relegation from the bundesliga. hamburg coach josef zinnbauer expressed sympathy for holtby, stating that it was "very bitter" for the midfielder and that the club would support him.
698	the los angeles galaxy won the major league soccer final 1-0 against the houston dynamo, potentially in david beckham's last significant game on u.s. soil. the galaxy, who didn't lose at home this year, secured their third mls title, with beckham assisting on the winning goal scored by landon donovan. a global soccer icon, beckham joined mls in 2007 with a $32.5 million contract, aiming to build soccer's standing in the u.s. and the league's profile internationally. beckham's contract is set to expire, and he is considering offers from european clubs, including tottenham hotspur, paris saint-germain, and queens park rangers. beckham also expressed his desire to be involved in the 2012 london olympics in some capacity.
699	an amateur stuntman identified as tobias, aged 20, was killed on sunday after attempting a dangerous stunt involving a playground roundabout and a car. he was tied to the children's ride with duct tape and rope, which was then attached to a bmw. as the car drove away, the roundabout was spun with excessive force, causing tobias to be thrown off. he suffered head injuries and died instantly. witnesses described hearing a scream and called for help, but doctors were unable to save him. tobias was a member of a bavarian group named 'bavarian dumbasses,' known for posting dangerous stunts on youtube and facebook. police have removed the roundabout from the playground, and his father has called for the posting of such content to be banned. the group's prior stunts included jumping off a bridge, dripping candlewax into their mouths, and sticking drawing pins into their backs. the german media suspects the young men were influenced by the us tv show 'jackass.'
700	an 11-year-old boy, samuel epps, from san tan valley, arizona, died by suicide on tuesday night after getting into an argument over chores. he retrieved an off-duty weapon belonging to his father, who is a police supervisor, and shot himself in the master bedroom. after initial medical aid, he was later pronounced dead at maricopa medical center. the sheriff noted that there was no evidence of depression or mental illness, and the family has set up a fundraiser for samuel's funeral, which has raised over $20,000. if you or someone you know needs help, contact the national suicide prevention lifeline at 1-800-273-8255.
701	nissan has announced its goal to have driverless cars on the road by 2020, joining companies like google in the autonomous vehicle race. nissan ceo carlos ghosn stated that the company's history of challenging conventional thinking and bringing innovations to market, such as the mass-market nissan leaf electric vehicle, positions them well for this new technology. testing of the self-driving cars is planned to begin in 2014. google began testing self-driven cars in 2010 but has no current plans to use them commercially. nissan is collaborating with universities such as mit and stanford, among others, on the development of this technology. other automakers, like audi and toyota, are also working on driverless cars.
702	the republican presidential race is currently focused on the supreme court trial of health care reform, high unemployment, and rising gas prices. the candidates are locked in a battle over their policy stances, with mitt romney's past shifting positions being a major point of contention. the establishment gop is hesitant to intervene and unite the party due to the shift in power from established party structures to populist movements and wealthy donors. the candidates are expected to make their own decisions on when to drop out of the race, with the longer the race goes on, the less favorable romney becomes to some candidates. ultimately, the final decision lies with the candidates and their willingness to accept defeat gracefully.
703	fifteen-year-old davion navar henry, who has spent his entire life in foster care, gave a tour of his cramped bedroom at a foster home in st. petersburg, florida, as he continues his search for a permanent family. davion, who is aware that he will age out of the foster care system in under three years, revealed his shared room with bunk beds and expressed his longing for a bed of his own. he recently stood up in a florida church and asked for someone to adopt him, which has garnered nationwide attention and resulted in over 1,000 inquiries from potential adoptive parents across america. davion's moving plea has sparked incredible reactions online, with nearly 6,000 likes on mailonline's facebook page and close to 400,000 people reading his story. the foster home is currently being inundated with calls and has set up a call center to respond to each inquiry. davion's story emerged after he discovered his mother had died in june and found her obituary. he dreams of a family who will love and keep him forever, regardless of their ethnic background. the teenager, who has behavioral problems and struggles with anger, has been living at carlton manor residential center in eckerd and has had numerous foster homes throughout his life. he has lost 40 pounds and is studying hard in 10th grade but has yet to find a family. the heart gallery, an organization that helps children in foster care find parents, is assisting davion in his search for a forever family.
704	nba player ron artest, who gained infamy in 2004 for punching a fan during a brawl, is seeking public redemption by raffling off his nba championship ring for charity. the proceeds, estimated to exceed $1 million, will fund mental health services for underprivileged youths. arrest, who played with the los angeles lakers last season, has credited mental health care with turning his life around after his suspension for 73 games. he wants to destigmatize mental health care by sharing his experience and advocating for on-site counseling in schools. despite publicly thanking a psychiatrist, artest revealed he sees a psychologist. he kicked off an online raffle for his ring on cnn's larry king live, offering all bidders a fair chance instead of selling it to wealthy celebrities. his ring was received in a ceremony on tuesday before the lakers' game against the houston rockets.
705	the oscars honored 10 films with numerous nominations this year, including "the king's speech" with 12 nods, "true grit" with 10, "the social network" with eight, and "inception" with eight. acting nominations went to javier bardem, jeff bridges, jesse eisenberg, colin firth, james franco, annette bening, nicole kidman, jennifer lawrence, natalie portman, michelle williams, amy adams, helena bonham carter, melissa leo, hailee steinfeld, christian bale, john hawkes, jeremy renner, mark ruffalo, and geoffrey rush. "the king's speech" actor geoffrey rush learned of his best supporting actor nomination while performing in a stage play in australia. "inception," "the fighter," "127 hours," and "black swan" received multiple nominations, with the winners to be announced at the live broadcast on february 27.
706	a 1960s concrete house in kensington, london, notorious for its brutalist design, has gone on the market for £8.5 million. despite criticisms of its unsightly appearance, the property includes desirable features such as a swimming pool, sauna, two parking spaces, and a prime location. the house, situated between two parks and boasting elevated views, was given a modern interior makeover by architects sauerbruch hutton. brutalist buildings, known for their cold and inhuman aesthetics, have garnered criticisms from critics like prince charles, but the demand for property in london's affluent borough of kensington and chelsea drives up prices significantly. parking spaces have become highly sought after, with a single space in a car park under the royal albert hall fetching £400,000. the property market in london is expensive, with an average house price of £523,953, compared to £177,766 in the rest of the uk. in kensington and chelsea, the typical property price is £1.28 million.
707	a 46-year-old accountant named tolu kalejaiye was found dead in her £350,000 four-bedroom home in wickford, essex, and her 21-year-old son was arrested on suspicion of murder. neighbors reported seeing police cars and helicopters at the scene, and described the area as chaotic. the cause of death was not confirmed but neighbors claimed she had been stabbed. kalejaiye was described as pleasant by her neighbor and was engaged, having studied accounting and finance at middlesex university. she was originally from abeokuta, nigeria, and had been involved in local campaigns to establish a village green in front of her house. an essex police spokesperson confirmed the death was being treated as suspicious and a 21-year-old man had been arrested.
708	agnetha faltskog, the former abba singer, has made a comeback after four decades in the music industry. she retired from the spotlight in the 1980s but was tempted back by a new set of songs written for her by producer jorgen elofsson. agnetha's new single, "when you really loved someone," was released this week, and her new album, "a," will be out in may. the album includes a duet with gary barlow. agnetha, who was known for her platinum-haired pop persona and glamorous outfits in the 1970s, admitted in an interview that she had to take a break from the spotlight due to personal reasons and her fear of flying. the 62-year-old singer, who was once famously called the "dolly bird" and "the last word in smoky, swedish glam," has a fans base who are eagerly awaiting her return. some seventies stars, like abba and david bowie, are also making comebacks, but the question remains whether they will live up to fans' expectations.
709	pc sales suffered a significant decline of 14% in 2012, the largest drop in history, according to research firm idc. hp experienced the sharpest decline with a 24% drop in sales, followed by dell with an 11% slump and even apple, which saw a 7% fall. the launch of windows 8 failed to reverse the trend, with some analysts suggesting the negative response to the software may have worsened it. ultrabooks, a recent innovation to breathe life into the market, were also poorly received. the success of the ipad and smartphones is believed to be the main reason for the slump, as people prefer portable devices. steve jobs' prediction of a 'post-pc era' is becoming a reality, with 919 million smartphones and 200 million tablets expected to be sold this year, surpassing the number of personal computers sold. microsoft is facing criticism for the confusing windows 8 software, and idc's bob o'donnell has suggested the company needs to make tough decisions if it wants to help revive the pc market. gartner also reported an 11% decline in pc sales, the largest since 2001, and predicted that android will be the main operating system for all computing devices by 2017. marcus jewell of tech company brocade stated that the "days seem to be numbered for the humble pc."
710	cuban-americans, many of whom have strong familial ties to cuba but are removed from the memories of fidel castro's revolution, are questioning the continued us embargo on the country. younger cuban-americans, including those who have lost family members to the regime, are advocating for an end to the embargo and shifting their political allegiances to the democratic party. this generational shift could potentially lead to democrats making inroads with cuban-americans, who have long been a republican demographic. hillary clinton, the clear front-runner for the democratic presidential nomination in 2016, has expressed her support for normalizing relations with cuba. the upcoming florida gubernatorial race will serve as a measure of the gop's grasp on cuban-american voters, as incumbent republican governor rick scott, who supports the embargo, faces a challenge from former republican-turned-democratic governor charlie crist, who has openly called for an end to the embargo. additionally, a growing number of younger latinos, both of cuban and non-cuban descent, are advocating for an end to the embargo. the new york times and a june poll from florida international university have also expressed support for lifting the embargo, and the obama administration has eased some travel restrictions to cuba. however, lifting the embargo requires action from congress, and all seven cuban-american legislators are against doing so. the changing cuban-american community, including a larger number of post-1990 immigrants and attrition among the historicos, may eventually exert enough political pressure to thaw the frozen relationship between the us and cuba.
711	apple introduced two new iphones at its annual event: the premium flagship iphone 5s and the more budget-friendly iphone 5c. the iphone 5c caters to those who have not yet purchased an iphone and offers similar power to the previous flagship, the iphone 5, but at a lower price. it also has a plastic shell. the iphone 5s targets early tech adopters with its faster processing speed, new touch id sensor, and premium materials. although the iphone 5c is more affordable, it is still pricier than some competing models. apple's focus on simplicity, ease of use, and solid design has resulted in two devices that work efficiently, potentially attracting some android and blackberry users, and expanding the iphone's reach to new global markets.
712	a virgin atlantic pilot, mark entwistle, was jailed for 14 years for orchestrating a £30million mortgage fraud scheme. entwistle, along with three accomplices, tricked top lenders into issuing mortgages on other people's houses. instead of using the money for legitimate purposes, entwistle funded his high-rolling lifestyle in las vegas casinos, paid off debts, and purchased a luxury boat. the fraud led to innocent families being evicted from their homes in the home counties. entwistle recruited jonathan gilbert to act as his solicitor, and mortgage brokers nicholas pomroy and matthew robinson to process the fraudulent applications. the four men were jailed for a total of 34 years. entwistle's actions caused significant stress and hardship for some victims, who lost their homes, investments, and jobs. the judge described entwistle as arrogant and greedy, and noted that the fraud was professional and well-orchestrated over a long period.
713	two scientists, rod thomas and roger holmes, have spent nine years in a garden shed resurrecting 'flossie,' a 1962 ict 1301 mainframe computer, believed to be one of the oldest surviving in the world. flossie cost £250,000 in 1962 (equivalent to £4.2 million today) and had 16,000 transistors and 4,000 logic boards. its computing power is equivalent to a digital watch, and the data it holds can fit on less than a third of a cd. flossie was used to produce gce exam results and certificates at london university in the 1960s, and it appeared as a prop in films and tv shows like james bond, dr. who, and blake's 7. its original purpose was to produce exam results in the uk, and 1/3 of a cd holds all the data it currently contains. thomas and holmes plan to recover its software, which will shed light on the birth of the british computer industry, but they face the challenge of finding a new home for it as the farm where it is currently housed is being sold. the 1962 1301 mainframe computer is the only surviving example of second-generation british mainframe still in working order.
714	christmas traditions remain a significant part of many adults' lives, with over a third of adults under 55 continuing to hang stockings for santa and one in six writing letters to him. decorating the tree and seeing christmas lights are the most special moments for many, while fifty percent of cooks follow their mother's christmas recipes and schedule. the national trust is encouraging families to embrace both old and new traditions this holiday season with special events and activities at their venues. the survey revealed the top ten special christmas traditions: decorating the tree, seeing christmas lights, opening stocking presents, visiting a christmas market, eating mom's roast dinner, christmas music, a family game, getting an advent calendar, a boxing day walk, and putting out a stocking.
715	lewis hamilton, a formula one race car driver, has a new tattoo of a giant cross on his back, which is similar to the one he always wears around his neck. he also has other religious tattoos, including an angel on his forearm, a picture of mary and jesus on his upper arm, and musical notes and a heart with a cross on his elbow. hamilton, who is a christian and regular churchgoer, has quoted the inspirational phrase "still i rise" in press conferences and has a tattoo of those words on his back. the phrase is from a poem by maya angelou and was also the title of a posthumous album of rap songs by hamilton's favorite musician, tupac shakur. hamilton believes that his talent and success in racing are god-given, but his father disapproves of his tattoos. he has been collecting tattoos for several years and doesn't need approval from others to be proud of who he is.
716	nick clegg, the deputy prime minister and liberal democrat leader, called for a police inquiry into the cyril smith scandal after admitting there may have been an establishment cover-up. he accused senior politicians, police, and security services of collusion to hide smith's decades-long reign of abuse in care homes. clegg urged the police to investigate if there was a wider paedophile ring involving politicians from all parties, as calls for a full public inquiry were still not met. the labour mp for rochdale, simon danczuk, who has long campaigned on this issue, welcomed the change of heart. however, clegg refused to launch an investigation into what liberal politicians knew and their potential involvement. the police believe smith abused dozens of boys in rochdale and london during the 1960s and 1970s but was never charged, with three investigations failing to lead to prosecution. the director of public prosecutions rejected files three times due to lack of evidence. an explosive book by danczuk reveals smith was protected by local politicians, police, and security services and names other politicians involved in abuse. when the allegations surfaced, clegg dismissed calls for further inquiries, but now calls for a police inquiry to investigate the conspiracy. danczuk urged questioning former liberal leader, lord steel, who had recommended smith for a knighthood in 1988 despite rumors of abuse.
717	the museum of african design (mad) in johannesburg, south africa, was previously an old factory repurposed into a contemporary space for showcasing innovative african design ideas. situated in the vibrant maboneng precinct, which is undergoing urban rejuvenation, the museum opened in october as a cultural hub and platform for african creativity. mad's industrial three-level space, which retains its raw floors, metal bars, and scaffolding ramps, hosted the launch event featuring the southern guild collection and a talk by renowned architect david adjaye, who emphasized the importance of design in shaping community and culture. the museum's inaugural major exhibition, "native nostalgia," explores the idea of nostalgia in african art, particularly concerning dark chapters in history such as apartheid and colonialism, and runs until february 9. upcoming exhibitions include "fashioning africa" from march to may and "design of an african city" from june to august. mad aims to remain contemporary by focusing on the most exciting exhibitions and not acquiring a permanent collection.
718	a walrus, believed to be a young male, was found stranded on the shore of north ronaldsay in the orkney islands, scotland, more than 2,200 miles from its arctic home. the walrus, which appears to be in good health and happy with the attention, was first seen by mark warren, assistant warden of the north ronaldsay bird observatory. experts believe the walrus may have gotten lost or disoriented during its migration. walruses are large marine mammals with long tusks and are found in the arctic ocean and surrounding areas. their populations dropped significantly due to hunting in the 19th and 20th centuries but have rebounded since hunting was outlawed. they are known for their social behavior and play a significant role in the arctic marine ecosystem.
719	max cisotti, a husband and father, shares his unique sanctuary in the form of a dressing room filled with over 60 pairs of shoes. while some men have sheds or hobby rooms, cisotti's obsession is with footwear. he spends £157 on shoes annually, compared to £138 for women in his age group. his large collection, which includes various brands and colors, costs over £10,000. cisotti inherited his love for shoes from his italian father and claims it's essential for men to have appropriate footwear for different occasions. his collection has been a source of many marital disputes, but deep down, his wife is secretly proud of his shoe fetish. cisotti judges men by their footwear and insists that men are increasingly focusing on their appearance. the most expensive pair he owns is £475 crockett and jones lace-up ankle boots, similar to those worn by daniel craig as james bond in skyfall. cisotti enjoys the thrill of shopping for shoes and always shops around lunchtime when his feet are at their smallest. he currently covets a new pair of new balance trainers and ponders over where to place them in his collection. cisotti defends his obsession, acknowledging that it may be considered excessive but arguing that men need appropriate footwear for various occasions.
720	victoria beckham is happily launching her autumn/winter 2013 collection for her brand, victoria, victoria beckham, online. the collection features more masculine and subdued clothes with sharp lines and silhouettes, marking a radical departure from her earlier, more feminine designs. victoria described the victoria, victoria beckham girl as an engaged intellectual with a sense of humor, who marches rather than walks and wears sensible boots and midi-heels. the collection includes drop-waists, and the color palette is more masculine and muted. victoria expressed excitement about the no-fuss and effortlessly cool collection, with textured pieces that look like multiple pieces but are actually one piece for convenient wear. her recent hike in los angeles wearing sandals fueled speculation about a potential end to her love affair with heels.
721	a 27-year-old man identified as timothy seaux went on a nude rampage at the jefferson county hemp expo in oregon, heavily damaging a vehicle with two women inside. witnesses reported that seaux, from grants pass, was behaving aggressively and started fights at the music festival. police arrived on the scene and found seaux nude and combative. four men had to restrain him on the ground, and he continued to struggle and kick even as officers attempted to put him in a squad car. seaux was so out of control that medical crews arrived to sedate him before taking him to three rivers medical center. he was later charged with menacing, criminal mischief, assaulting a public safety officer, and resisting arrest upon his release from the hospital. the three-day music festival at the hemp expo usually features educational activities around hemp and artists.
722	qpr manager harry redknapp is set to add midfielder mark davies to his squad this week, with a season-long loan from bolton wanderers being finalized. redknapp is eager to bolster his team after only training with 15 senior players last week due to loic remy's departure to liverpool. owner tony fernandes prefers younger signings, and davies, 26, fits that profile. bolton agreed to let him go after swansea city failed in a £5million bid last year. redknapp signed rio ferdinand last week on a free transfer, but fernandes does not want an older squad.
723	doctors without borders (msf) has launched a large-scale vaccination campaign in niger, nigeria, and chad to combat a meningitis outbreak that has resulted in over 1,900 deaths and reported cases of over 58,000 since january. this is msf's biggest vaccination campaign to date, with medical teams vaccinating and treating 5.4 million people, and planning to vaccinate another 1.7 million. the disease, which is an infection of the protective membranes around the brain and spinal cord (meninges), is caused by bacteria including neisseria meningitidis, and typically peaks during the dry season, according to the world health organization (who). the current outbreak began around the start of the year and is larger than usual, particularly in nigeria and niger. the who declared the disease as an epidemic in 76 areas in these countries last month. meningitis can cause epidemics because of its potential to spread easily through close contact with infectious secretions and respiratory droplets.
724	in a cnn article, putin's act of chivalry towards chinese first lady peng liyuan at the apec summit in beijing gained widespread attention and controversy. despite significant global issues being discussed, putin's gesture received more media coverage due to china's censorship of the footage and the public's fascination with trivial matters. this phenomenon raises questions about the audience's preference for entertainment over substance, with social media and the 24-hour news cycle exacerbating the issue. previous examples of similar incidents involving world leaders, such as bush vomiting on the japanese pm or ford falling down stairs, have also become popular memes over the years. however, the frequency and sensationalism of these incidents have increased, making world leader gaffes a primary source of clickbait for media consumers, who are encouraged to focus on the trivial rather than meaningful global events.
725	the new york police department (nypd) encouraged social media users to share photos of themselves with officers using the hashtag #mynypd. however, the campaign backfired as twitter users responded with negative posts, sharing images they claimed depicted police brutality and misconduct. the backlash led to similar hashtags like #mylapd, #mycpd, and #myapd trending. despite the negative response, the nypd defended the campaign, stating that it was an effective communication tool and open dialogue for the community. some users also shared positive photos with officers. however, the majority of the responses mocked the nypd and other departments for perceived mistreatment of civilians.
726	erin dimeglio, a 17-year-old florida teenager, made history on friday, september 1, 2012, by becoming the first girl in the state to play football as a quarterback for her high school team, plantation high school. she had been practicing with the boys since may and was able to hold her own during the fourth quarter of their game against seminole ridge high school on august 24. despite the attention and fanfare, dimeglio's priority is her education and is committed to working hard both on the field and in the classroom. though some are concerned for her safety, she has earned the respect of her teammates and coaches and has minimal field time. her parents are proud of her achievement and support her dreams, despite their fears for her safety given her history of injuries from basketball.
727	a 22-month-old boy named levi blu cassin suffered major internal injuries, including a split small intestine, as a result of significant blows to his body, leading to his death. daniëlle cassin, 27, and mark piper, 31, are on trial at birmingham crown court for his murder and child cruelty. levi's mother called for an ambulance after discovering him unresponsive, but he died shortly after arrival at the hospital. prosecutor timothy raggatt qc stated that the child could have been punched or stamped on, and the only two suspects are the parents. the toddler had earlier abdominal injuries that were starting to heal before his death. the trial, which could last up to four weeks, continues.
728	a old west gun battle re-enactor, paul doering, in south dakota was sentenced to seven and a half years in prison for using live rounds instead of blanks during a performance, wounding three onlookers. doering, a six-time convicted felon, told the court he panicked and has since regretted his actions. the dakota wild bunch re-enactors have suspended their shows following the incident. doering faced up to 20 years in prison but struck a plea deal with prosecutors, who dropped the original charge of being a felon in possession of a firearm. victims included carrol knutson, 65, from minnesota, who had a leg bone shattered, and john ellis, 48, an optometrist from pennsylvania, who was hit in the forearm and elbow. jose pruneda, 53, of nebraska, suffered minor injuries. doering served more than five years in minnesota prisons on multiple felony convictions, including two first-degree assaults in the early 1980s. south dakota law prohibits convicted criminals from possessing or having control of a firearm for 15 years.
729	a 51-year-old man named julio resto pleaded not guilty to murdering his wife gloria resto, 42, at waltham district court in boston on wednesday. police assert that resto first attempted to strangle his wife before fatally stabbing her while she was in bed in their waltham apartment on december 30, 2022. after the killing, resto allegedly tried to take his own life by stuffing a towel in the exhaust pipe of his car. the cops reported that he then went to the police headquarters, wielding a knife, and confessed to the crime. gloria resto's body was discovered at their home later, and her two children, including her adult son, were unharmed. her relatives described her as a devoted mother. resto's son stated that his father called him before showing up at the police station and instructed him to take care of the kids.
730	a 59-year-old woman from leicester, karen mccann, was jailed for three years and four months after running a £150,000-a-year cannabis farm from her home despite declaring only £443 in legitimate income between 2008 and april 2023. mccann used the money to pay off her mortgage and went on expensive holidays. during a raid, police found 66 cannabis plants, £18,448 in cash, and a complex hydration system. mccann admitted producing cannabis, abstracting electricity, possessing criminal property, and money laundering. she claimed she had not been claiming benefits and was emotionally manipulated by her former partner, but judge simon hammond believed she entered the operation knowingly. the case comes as leicester saw 47 cannabis factories discovered in a year, and mccann had a previous conviction for allowing her home to be used for cannabis production in 2007. her former partner used her home and bank accounts to run the operation before persuading her to let him install another growing operation. the cannabis produced was much stronger than traditional imports and could cause serious mental health problems.
731	mourad hamyd, an 18-year-old student from charleville-mezieres, has been arrested on suspicion of involvement in the charlie hebdo massacre, but his classmates and neighbors have come forward to defend him, insisting he was in school at the time of the attack. hamyd's sister is married to one of the suspected terrorists, and he is believed to be the getaway driver. despite public records linking him to the family of the suspects, neighbors describe hamyd as a quiet and friendly boy without a history of trouble. numerous classmates have taken to social media to defend him, using the hashtag #mouradhamydinnocent. the school has not yet confirmed whether hamyd was in attendance on the day of the attack. neighbors also suggest he is a "good guy" and a well-liked pupil. however, the family has refused to comment on the situation.
732	chicago is implementing eco-friendly engineering through a project called "green alleys," resurfacing 13,000 alleys with permeable concrete to clean rainwater before it reaches lake michigan. the alleys, which date back to the 1800s and cover about 3,500 acres of impermeable surface, often lack storm sewer connections and contribute to flooding. the city opted for permeable pavement made of concrete, asphalt, or paving stones, allowing water to filter through to the ground and be cleaned by microbes before reaching the groundwater and eventually lake michigan. other eco-friendly features include high-albedo pavement, use of recycled materials, and energy-efficient lighting. so far, 40 alleys have been treated, with 48 more scheduled for this year.
733	the headmaster of eton college, tony little, is calling for the abolition of gcse exams and more freedom for schools in what they teach, suggesting that a more inventive and collaborative approach to education be implemented. he criticizes the traditional exam format and emphasizes the need for students to learn teamwork and collaboration skills, as they will be necessary in the workforce. mr. little suggests a more flexible system with a robust examination at the age of 18, while allowing schools to determine the path to reach that point. eton college primarily uses igcses and cambridge pre-u in the sixth form. the school has already introduced "flipped lessons" in some subjects, where students research and learn material beforehand, and teachers focus on understanding and applying the knowledge. mr. little supports this approach as it provides students with different ways of learning and promotes independent study.
734	a transnational human trafficking ring, which smuggled chinese citizens into the united states and europe, mostly for prostitution, was dismantled with the arrest of 75 individuals in spain and france. the ring, led by two main suspects in europe, was based in china and used forged passports to transport the chinese citizens, charging between $53,000 and $66,000 per person. spanish police arrested 49 suspects in spain, and 24 arrests were made in france. the probe, which began two years ago, uncovered an intricately structured ring that used forged documents and travel enforcers to avoid detection. the investigation, at spain's national court, is ongoing, and all suspects are chinese or from asia. spanish authorities have been active in fighting human trafficking in recent years, particularly those targeting asian citizens with promises of a better life but subjecting them to forced labor or prostitution.
735	alexander rossi is on the fia entry list for this weekend's russian grand prix in place of jules bianchi, who is in critical but stable condition after a horrific crash in japan. marussia is yet to announce their plans for the race, with options including running one car or even withdrawing from the event. rossi, a reserve driver for marussia, is eligible to race based on his superlicense. bianchi was diagnosed with diffuse axonal injury following the crash. nico rosberg, a fellow driver, has expressed his support for bianchi and his family, and the paddock is somber ahead of the race.
736	criminal investigators from the department of justice and the food and drug administration (fda) were at a massachusetts pharmaceutical company, new england compounding center (necc), on tuesday with a search warrant, according to company spokesperson and fda spokeswoman erica jefferson. the ongoing investigation concerns allegations regarding the company, which has been linked to a deadly multistate outbreak of fungal meningitis. fifteen people have died and over 200 cases have been reported across fifteen states. necc has recalled all its products following reports of infections from contaminated steroids produced by the company. patients who received affected products are being alerted to the potential risk of infection, and investigations are ongoing into other potential cases. meningitis is a rare, non-contagious inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, usually caused by bacteria, viruses, or in this case, fungi. symptoms include headache, fever, nausea, stiff neck, confusion, and dizziness, among others. the fda and the centers for disease control and prevention (cdc) are urging caution and further monitoring for those who may have received contaminated drugs. the necc has been accused by massachusetts governor deval patrick and members of congress of misleading regulators and operating outside its license. compounding pharmacies mix medications for specific patients, but in this case, the necc is under investigation for producing and shipping large batches of drugs nationwide.
737	senator jim webb of virginia has written to the obama administration urging them to take steps to safeguard offshore oil platforms from deliberate sabotage, following the bp oil spill in the gulf of mexico. webb, a member of the senate armed services committee and senior senator from virginia, noted that while congress is focusing on regulatory agencies and bp, there is a risk of attacks or sabotage that could cause similar devastation. the senator, who favors oil and gas exploration in virginia waters, also backs the moratorium on deepwater drilling and has asked federal agencies to assess the vulnerability of offshore rigs and make recommendations for safeguards. he also calls for similar standards to those applied to nuclear reactors. webb's request comes as he prepares for a possible rematch in 2012 with republican george allen, who also supports oil and gas exploration off virginia's coast.
738	a father-of-two named robert turner was wrongly arrested for fraud due to a mix-up over his telephone number. after switching to virgin media from bt last year, he began receiving mysterious calls from debt collectors for an unknown business. believing his number had been "recycled" from a previous customer, turner contacted virgin media multiple times to have it changed but was told it could only be done if the company removed the number from their website. turner was arrested at home in front of his eight-year-old daughter, spending nearly three hours in police cells. he was later informed that he would not be facing charges, but expressed anger towards virgin media for the issue. virgin media confirmed that they do recycle phone numbers but only after a certain period of time and stated that turner had not requested a change until several months after signing up. dorset police declined to comment on the case.
739	european new rules on flying hours and rest periods for pilots have been approved despite concerns from british pilots' union balpa, who claim they could force pilots to stay awake for up to 22 hours before landing, increasing the risk of accidents. the rules, which will come into effect from 2015, allow for seven consecutive early flight starts and longer work weeks, reducing the amount of time pilots can spend on standby during flight delays. balpa and uk mps, along with european transport committee, scientists, and the public, have expressed safety concerns, but the regulations were passed with 387 votes to 218 in the european parliament. virgin atlantic has reported an incident of extreme pilot fatigue and balpa's general secretary jim mcauslan criticized the european commission for imposing the cuts to uk flight safety. the caa and the government support the changes, with caa chief executive andrew haines stating that pilot fatigue must be managed practically rather than with strict timetables. philip bennion, liberal democrat transport spokesman, sees this as a sensible outcome.
740	madonna badger, who lost her three children and both parents in a christmas eve house fire two years ago, finally buried their ashes this fall. in an article for vogue magazine, she shares her thoughts about that fateful night and the process of healing. badger describes how she and her family had a picture-perfect holiday with a roaring fire in their renovated home. however, that night, she awoke to smoke and was unable to save her daughters, 9-year-old lily and 7-year-old twins sarah and grace, and her parents. after being released from the hospital and attending their funerals, badger became suicidal and was hospitalized again. with help from a childhood friend, she began the arduous process of therapy and healing. eventually, she traveled to thailand to volunteer at an orphanage and found solace in connecting with the children there. by seeing how joyfully they lived despite their own struggles, badger realized she could not wallow in self-pity and began to find meaning in her loss. the full account can be read in the december issue of vogue magazine.
741	raheem sterling's contract negotiations with liverpool have been delayed due to his agent aidy ward's departure from impact sports management to start his own business. ward also represents west bromwich albion striker saido berahino, and alex oxlade-chamberlain of arsenal may follow. uefa is playing a tactical game in the fifa presidential election by not endorsing a specific candidate, instead allowing michael van praag and prince ali bin al hussein to challenge sepp blatter. london 2012's olympic committee, now known as nocog, is being more accommodating for england rugby 2015's festival of rugby. sky sports news is making changes to their transfer deadline day coverage to avoid fan disturbances and demos. mark pougatch's arrival at itv as their lead football presenter is timely as they seek world cup cricket highlights.
