742	the historic strained relationship between communities of color and the police in the united states has been highlighted once again following the death of michael brown in ferguson, missouri. brown was killed by a police officer in august, and his case remains unresolved. residents plan to march in a "weekend of resistance" to demand the resignation of the local prosecutor. similar cases, such as the shootings of john crawford in beavercreek, ohio, and eric garner in staten island, new york, have brought up questions of racism, profiling, and bias. it is important to seek the truth in each individual circumstance while acknowledging the underlying historical and cultural issues. building trust and communication between police and communities is crucial in addressing these issues and preventing further conflict. at a recent community meeting in georgia, the fear of police among people of color was evident, with concerns about being harmed or wrongfully pulled over. police officers have a difficult job, but their decisions are often met with suspicion and mistrust. to improve relationships, it is essential to start a dialogue, have trained professionals, and work towards understanding and trust. it is important to remember that police officers are human and deserve respect, while recognizing the need for fairness and impartiality in maintaining a safe community. establishing trust is a shared responsibility.
743	kate micucci is best known for her roles on "raising hope" and "scrubs," where she played the ukulele-playing character stephanie gooch, which was specifically written for her. her career was boosted by a youtube video of her song "dear deer." she later formed the comedy singing duo garfunkel & oates with riki lindhome, and their politically charged song "sex with ducks" gained popularity on youtube. their debut album "all over your face" was released in february 2011, and micucci performed a humorous song about napping with a stranger during a meeting with cnn. micucci's acting and music careers were both propelled forward by her youtube presence.
744	brighton & hove albion are expected to dismiss manager sami hyypia imminently following their disappointing start to the season, with just three league wins and a currently bottom-three position in the championship. hyypia, 41, has overseen 25 games, securing six wins, nine draws, and ten losses. former liverpool defender hyypia, who cut a dejected figure following the recent loss to millwall, may be replaced with options including ex-tottenham hotspur manager tim sherwood and tony pulis, but both have reservations about the role. other potential candidates include gianfranco zola, brian mcdermott, and chris hughton. brighton's poor form was highlighted by losses to millwall and derby county, leaving them with 19 points.
745	over the past month, minnesota lawyer jeff anderson has made headlines for filing numerous sexual abuse lawsuits against the catholic church and its leaders, including the vatican itself, on behalf of alleged victims. anderson, who has represented hundreds of abuse victims in the us and won significant settlements, is known for using media attention to bring more cases to light and encouraging other victims to come forward. he has been representing victims since the 1980s and gained prominence during the boston priest abuse scandal in 2002, when he filed the first suit against the vatican. his critics argue that his legal actions are aimed at gaining publicity rather than seeking justice, but anderson remains undeterred and optimistic that external pressure will force change within the church. he recently filed a suit against the vatican on behalf of an alleged wisconsin abuse victim, seeking to open the vatican's files on other abusive priests. despite his critics, anderson's impact on the national conversation around sexual abuse within the catholic church has been significant.
746	a malfunction in facebook's air conditioning system at their data center in prineville, oregon, led to the formation of a rain cloud inside the building in 2019. the energy-efficient cooling system was meant to cool down hot air from the servers using water-based cooling in the air vents. however, the clash of temperatures caused the air to become excessively wet, condense, and form a rain cloud. the incident caused several servers to shut down due to power supply failure and damage. since then, facebook has made improvements to the building management system and now designs their servers with a "rubber raincoat" to protect against condensation. the data center has experienced no further rain cloud incidents.
747	russian president vladimir putin visited crimea on friday for victory day celebrations, marking his first trip to the disputed territory since russia annexed it from ukraine in 2014. putin watched naval displays in sevastopol and paid tribute to its long military record. victor day parades were held in sevastopol and moscow, amid rising tensions in eastern ukraine, where pro-russian separatists are planning a referendum on autonomy. clashes between separatists and ukrainian forces left at least 23 people dead and dozens injured in mariupol. the white house condemned putin's visit to crimea and rejected the planned separatist referendum in eastern ukraine. meanwhile, gunfire and smoke were reported in mariupol as separatists attacked a police station. putin expressed confidence that the people of crimea had made the right decision in returning to russia and urged unity to overcome challenges. ukraine scaled back victory day celebrations in some cities to avoid violence. pro-russian separatists in eastern ukraine pressed ahead with a planned referendum on greater local powers, defying calls to postpone the vote. western powers condemned the referendum and urged dialogue and de-escalation.
748	pope francis' efforts to facilitate talks between presidents barack obama and raul castro of cuba have been met with controversy among some roman catholics, particularly in south florida, where many older catholics view the castro brothers negatively. although many catholics worldwide see francis' role in promoting progress in communist cuba as a positive development, some cuban-americans feel betrayed by their spiritual leader. efrain rivas, a former political prisoner in cuba, expressed his disappointment and indicated that he feels disconnected from the church. miami archbishop thomas wenski acknowledged the concerns of some catholics but emphasized that many exiles welcome the diplomatic breakthrough. cardinal jaime ortiga, a cuban cardinal close to francis, has played a key role in improving ties between the church and the officially atheist state. some older catholics wish the church had taken a harder line, while others see the church's unique position inside cuba as a reason to trust the promises of change made by both obama and castro. while the catholic church remains the dominant religious force in cuba, attendance at mass is low due to decades of official atheism, and its mediation role could be crucial in facilitating trust in the promises of change. historian jesus mendez, a cuban exile who teaches at barry university, believes that most catholics will welcome the pope's intervention as an attempt to increase religious freedom on the island.
749	australian house prices in major capital cities, particularly sydney, have experienced significant growth in the past year, with the average sydney house price reaching $690,000, a 15.4% increase from the previous year. house prices in sydney are more than double those in lower-priced cities like hobart. the increases have been attributed to record-low interest rates, lack of availability, and high demand. some economists predict a drop-off in house price growth in the next financial year due to an expected increase in housing supply and potential affordability concerns. however, others believe the market will continue to see moderate gains. mortgage approvals have also seen a recent decline due to new tougher regulations.
750	canadian actor cory monteith, known for his role in the tv series "glee," was found dead in his hotel room at the fairmont pacific rim in vancouver on july 13, 2013. he had spent the evening out with friends before returning to the hotel alone. monteith had completed a rehab stint for substance addiction in april and appeared happy and healthy in recent months. his girlfriend and co-star lea michele was not with him at the time of his death. the cause of death is unknown, and authorities are conducting an autopsy. monteith had checked into the hotel on july 6 and was due to check out on july 13. he had previously spoken publicly about his battles with addiction. monteith was 31 years old.
751	the town of pahoa in hawaii, known for its lush fields of papaya and anthurium plants, has been devastated by a slow-moving lava flow from kilauea mountain. the eruption began in june and has taken four months to reach the town. residents have been forced to evacuate and several homes have been destroyed. the before-and-after images show the vast swathes of green fields being replaced by molten rock, changing hawaii's landscape. the area was once famous for its vibrant rainforests and nurseries but is now a barren wasteland of grey, hollow structures. the lava tree state park, a key landmark, is an ominous depiction of the destruction caused by molten rock. authorities have warned residents to be prepared for evacuation and have closed the main road through the town due to the threat of the lava cutting off the key access point to the district. the main flow has not advanced for over a month, but officials warn of active breakouts. despite warnings and emergency services, there is little preventative action the government can take in the face of lava.
752	iain duncan smith's officials have criticized a campaign by the charity church action on poverty, which blame the politician's benefit changes for the increasing use of food banks. the charity's billboard advert uses an image similar to the conservative party's famous 1979 election poster, 'labour isn't working,' but instead depicts long lines of people in front of a food bank. the department for work and pensions (dwp) has denied that there is evidence to support the charity's claims, stating that benefits changes, delays, or stoppages are the most common reasons for people seeking food aid. church action on poverty insists that their figures come from the trussell trust, which runs 400 food banks in the uk, and has been accused by iain duncan smith of "scaremongering" and "political messaging." the dwp states that 92% of benefits are processed on time compared to 86% in 2009-10, and claims that its welfare reforms will improve the lives of the poorest families. the charity, which is supported by the church of england and other churches, believes that the rise in food poverty and food bank usage is a national disgrace and a violation of the basic human right to food. the church of england has stated that church action on poverty is an independent organization but does share some personnel. sir tony baldry, a tory mp, recently conducted a survey that found 62% of food bank users did so due to low income, 42% as a result of benefit changes, and 35% due to benefit delays. mark pritchard, a tory mp, has called on the church to focus more on gospel teachings instead of politics. iain duncan smith has refused to meet with chris mould, the chairman of church action on poverty, to discuss the issue.
753	iran strongly condemned the kidnapping of one of its diplomats, heshamollah attarzadeh, in peshawar, pakistan, on thursday, calling it an act of terrorism. attarzadeh, a commercial attache for the iranian consulate, was abducted by at least four gunmen while on his way to work. his bodyguard was killed in the attack. pakistan's foreign minister shah mahmood qureshi also condemned the incident and promised to take necessary measures for attarzadeh's safe recovery. the attack came after an american aid worker, stephen vance, was shot and killed outside the same consulate on wednesday. militants have been active in peshawar, the capital of pakistan's north west frontier province, where the military launched an offensive against extremists in late june. in the past few months, militants have retaliated with several deadly attacks. pakistan's new government has been trying to negotiate a peace deal with militants.
754	a pick-up truck driver, timothy john mcloughlin, 45, was jailed for three years and nine months after killing cyclist graham devlin, 55, in a crash caused by his "fast and mad" driving. mcloughlin, who had sent a text message seconds before the incident, was speeding and tailgating other vehicles when he lost control and hit devlin on a cyclepath in billingham, county durham. witnesses described his driving as reckless, and mcloughlin hit a van and flipped his truck before striking devlin, who was wearing a high-visibility jacket and helmet. mcloughlin, who had been drinking, remained unconscious at the scene and went on holiday before speaking to police. devlin's wife, margaret, described him as a family man who always followed safety rules and was deeply mourned by his loved ones. the family urged drivers to be aware of cyclists and drive responsibly.

notable events and figures that contributed to its growth from a single draper's shop into a high street institution. founded by john lewis in 1864, the company began with humble beginnings as a draper's shop selling silks, laces, and other textiles. following lewis' rejection of a partnership offer from peter robinson, he opened his own store and adopted a low-overhead strategy with cheap inventory and minimal advertising. throughout its history, john lewis has been an integral part of british culture, particularly for the middle classes. notable experiences include the acquisition of waitrose in 1937, which began as a chain of grocery shops, and the connection to various significant historical figures and events. for example, the company sold a silver cross pram, similar to one and dr crippen, whose trial involved textiles from the store. john lewis' expansion efforts were influenced by innovative retailers like harry gordon selfridge, who had revolutionary hiring practices, 756	the house intelligence committee's two-year investigation into the september 11, 2012 attack on the us compound in benghazi, libya, debunked allegations that the obama administration mishandled their response. the report cleared the cia and the military of serious charges, including providing inadequate security and denying available air support. while the diplomatic compound had inadequate security and needed cia assistance, there was no intelligence failure prior to the attack. susan rice's initial assertion that the attack was sparked by a protest over a film was based on intelligence assessed at the time. the report also rejected claims of a cover-up regarding the benghazi base being used to smuggle weapons to syrian rebels. the committee found that the cia agents were tracking local groups smuggling weapons, not collecting them. all government agencies ultimately cooperated with the inquiry, and no cia personnel were intimidated by the administration.
757	parents may worry about their children spending too much time on laptops and smartphones, but data shows that graduates with degrees in computer science from universities like oxford earn the highest salaries, with an average of £43,895 six months after graduation. famous tech entrepreneurs like larry page and mark zuckerberg are also computer science graduates. professor michael wooldridge, head of the computer science department at oxford, believes this success is due to the discipline's focus on mathematical clarity. graduates in arts subjects, such as drama, dance, and cinematics from essex, are the lowest earners. computer science courses are increasingly commanding high salaries, and the data reveals that science and engineering degrees generally lead to higher earnings. graduates' earnings vary significantly depending on the university they attend, with a growing gap between the highest and lowest earners. one in ten graduates had not obtained a job six months after leaving university. oxford, imperial college london, and cambridge are among the top universities for computer science graduates' earnings.
758	delegates from nearly 200 countries have reached a preliminary agreement on a global treaty to combat climate change at the cop20 conference in lima, peru. the draft treaty, which will be finalized next year in paris, outlines differing responsibilities for developed and developing nations in the fight against global warming, with developed countries expected to provide financial assistance to developing countries. the details of these responsibilities are yet to be determined. disagreements over the distribution of costs had caused negotiations to be extended by two days, but several countries pledged contributions to the green climate fund, boosting it to nearly $10.2 billion.
759	the nba's regular season has been cancelled for the first two weeks due to a lack of progress in labor negotiations between players and management, according to nba commissioner david stern. the two sides remain far apart on key issues such as player salaries, revenue sharing, and a stronger salary cap. no further talks are scheduled, and derek fisher, the president of the nba players association, has suggested that the entire season may be in danger. the league's owners initiated a lockout in early july, citing financial losses in the last season, which saw the nba lose up to $300 million and cancel its preseason, resulting in $200 million in revenue loss. the last work stoppage in the nba occurred in 1998.
760	a judge in atlanta, georgia sentenced aimee michael to 36 years in prison for her role in a car crash that killed five people and for attempting to cover it up. her mother, sheila michael, was sentenced to eight years for tampering with evidence and hindering her daughter's apprehension. the incident occurred in april 2009 when aimee michael lost control of her bmw, resulting in a collision that killed robert carter, his wife delisia carter, their infant son ethan carter, kayla lemons, and morgan johnson. the women, both dressed in blue jail jumpsuits, offered tearful apologies in court. however, the victims' families were unimpressed and felt the sentence was too lenient, as aimee michael had shown no remorse and had only been concerned with repairing her car. tracie johnson, mother of the victim morgan johnson, expressed forgiveness towards the michael women and expressed a desire to understand the circumstances of the accident.
761	antonio gleidson rodrigues, a brazilian michael jackson impersonator, spent around £2,000 on cosmetic procedures and used acid to lighten his skin to look like his idol. he had rhinoplasty, hyaluronic acid injections, botox, and surgery to close the gaps in his teeth and tattoo his eyebrows. gleidson, who goes by the stage name "glieidson jackson," began his impersonation when his drama students encouraged him at age 19 and now dedicates himself to perfecting the act. his aunt, maria doriane bastos souza, expresses concerns for his health and obsession with jackson. gleidson was deeply affected by jackson's 2009 death and continues to pay tribute to him through his performances.
762	the new reality show "the baby wait," produced by mtv's teen mom and jersey shore creators, follows adoptive parents during the 30-day waiting period in which birth mothers can legally take their children back. producers aim to educate viewers on the adoption process, and paul siebold, who appears on the show with his partner mark krieger, shares their anxiety as they wait for adoption of their daughter morgan to be finalized. birth mother genavieve diggs also expresses her thoughts of taking her baby back, but ultimately decides to go through with the adoption. the show highlights the uncertainty and emotions faced during the adoption process, which takes place more frequently in california and new york. the series debuts october 30 at 10 p.m. est on logo.
763	london's heathrow airport ceo, colin matthews, has announced that he will forgo his bonus for 2010 due to the chaos caused by heavy snow that left thousands of passengers stranded. matthews refused to comment on the size of his bonus or any secret bonuses based on profits. heathrow, europe's busiest airport, has made progress in clearing the backlog caused by the snow and expects to be fully operational on thursday. other major european airports, such as charles de gaulle in paris and frankfurt, are also slowly recovering from the snow disruptions, although some flight cancellations are still expected. eurostar, a rail operator, has asked travelers not to come to the terminal unless they have a valid ticket and is operating at 80% of normal capacity. speed restrictions have been applied, causing delays. the uk's met office has issued weather warnings for parts of central england on wednesday but does not expect further snow in london.
764	russell peters, a top-earning comic from canada, sells out arenas worldwide despite being an outsider and relatively unknown in tv and movies. he focuses on race and class, drawing from his indian and canadian background. his memoir, "call me russell," chronicles his unlikely comedy career, and he wears a provocative t-shirt during interviews. peters has acted in some projects, but his only notable film is "the legend of awesomest maximus," featuring ian ziering. despite his success, peters is known for his humorous and relatable persona.
765	a brother and sister, allan healy and margaret mitchell, were reunited after being separated for six decades. allan spent years trying to find his sister through various means, including genealogical records and facebook. margaret, who was also using facebook to search for her brother, was helped by a neighbor and found allan's profile through a childhood photograph. upon their reunion, they were overjoyed to discover that their mother, who they both assumed had passed away due to old age, was still alive and suffering from alzheimer's disease. they had a tearful reunion in dundee and visited their mother together, who recognized them and was glad that they were reunited.
766	fifa has fined the ivorian football federation 50,000 swiss francs ($46,800) and limited the attendance of their september world cup qualifier against burkina faso to 20,000 fans, following a stadium crush that resulted in 22 supporter deaths and 130 injuries in march. fifa also donated $96,000 to a fund for the victims' families and mandated traffic and spectator control cordons. severe sanctions could be imposed for future incidents. the ivorian government is also conducting an investigation.
767	a german-made leica illa rangefinder camera used by photographer alfred eisenstaedt to capture the iconic image of a sailor kissing a nurse in times square during v-j day celebrations in 1945 sold for nearly $150,000 at auction. the camera, which was expected to sell for around $30,000, is mounted with a summar 2/5cm lens and viooh viewfinder and has a small dent on the underside. the photograph of the kiss, which also sold for over $30,000, features george mendonsa kissing greta friedman, although this has been a subject of debate, with some women coming forward claiming to be in the photo. eisenstaedt used the camera until his death in 1995 and also took a photo of president bill clinton with it. the leica illa, a successor to the groundbreaking leica i, was widely used during world war ii but largely by the nazis and luftwaffe. leica, founded in 1913, distributed thousands of cameras during the war, although the company also helped jewish employees escape germany through the 'leica freedom train.' the leica i and ii series paved the way for small handheld cameras and were among the first rangefinder cameras, allowing photographers to measure distance for sharp focus.
768	a newborn baby was discovered on a footpath in suburban melbourne, australia, on ruth st in st albans around 3pm on march 6, 2014. an 18-year-old woman was taken into custody for questioning, but no charges have been filed. the baby's body was found 50 meters from the woman's home, concealed under a tree, and near a primary school. the exact circumstances of the death and cause are unknown, with autopsy results pending. police are continuing to investigate and have not identified any other suspects or released further information about the baby's sex or age. neighbors were shocked, and st albans primary school kept children indoors when they were dismissed. additionally, the police spokeswoman stated that the family member who reported the discovery is cooperating with the investigation.
769	james ward came close to cracking the top 100 in the men's singles rankings this year, generating excitement in the uk as a potential second british man to gain direct entry into the grand slams. however, he fell short of the mark. the scarcity of british men in the top 100 is a reflection of the challenges the country has faced in producing top tennis players in recent decades. ward had a strong year, reaching the davis cup quarterfinals and securing a performance of the season nomination with his victory against sam querry. the british team's progress to the quarterfinals was a highlight, but the year also saw disappointments like elena baltacha's retirement and the apparent retirements of promising young players oliver golding and george morgan. the lta is implementing changes to build tennis from the bottom up and help the grassroots flourish, which may sort out who is genuinely committed to becoming a professional player. the focus is shifting from junior performances to preparing players for the professional ranks, with improvements expected at both the grassroots and elite levels. however, there are concerns about the impact of staff cuts on the support system for british tennis players. ward remains the gold standard, but it's uncertain if he can beat the top players like novak djokovic and rafael nadal in a grand slam. overall, there are cautious reasons for optimism about british tennis, with eight men and four women inside the top 300 compared to four men and seven women a year ago.
770	bulgarian politician ahmed dogan, leader of the movement for rights and freedoms (mrf), survived an assassination attempt during a speech at a party conference in sofia when a man with a gun jumped onto the stage and held it to his head. the weapon misfired, allowing dogan to react and knock the gun away. the unidentified suspect was tackled to the ground by security guards and delegates. the man, later identified as eminehmedov, a 25-year-old from burgas, was carrying two knives and was arrested at the scene. dogan represents the liberal mrf, which advocates for the rights of ethnic turks and muslims in bulgaria, and is considered one of the country's most influential political figures. attacks on politicians in bulgaria are rare. two years ago, dogan was acquitted of corruption charges. during the incident, a number of politicians and attendees rushed to help apprehend the suspect. eminehmedov was taken away by police with injuries.
771	rafael nadal played through appendicitis to compete in the shanghai masters, losing to feliciano lopez in straight sets despite a spirited fightback. novak djokovic clinched his 50th win of the season, beating dominic thiem, while roger federer narrowly avoided defeat against leonardo mayer. andy murray and kei nishikori also advanced, while grigor dimitrov was knocked out. nadal will consult with doctors regarding appendix surgery. djokovic is the defending champion and extended his unbeaten run in china to 26 matches.
772	a study conducted by time4sleep.co.uk using an online tool called jar of dreams revealed that residents of leicester, leeds, and norwich reported having the most nightmares, while those in swansea, hull, and nottingham had the most positive dreams. the data was collected from tweets containing dream-related keywords and analyzed for positive and negative words and emoticons. swansea residents reported the highest percentage of positive dreams (50%), followed by hull (47%) and nottingham (39%). the tool identified that 45% of nightmares were reported in leicester, followed by leeds (33%) and norwich (31%). the study included data from 4,730 twitter users in the uk and found that 71% of people reported having good dreams in the past eight days, while 29% had nightmares, and 9% experienced weird dreams. jonathan warren, director at time4sleep, noted that the tool provides valuable insight into the nation's sleep habits, as people spend a third of their lives asleep.
773	a new study reveals that cancer is as old as multi-cellular life on earth and may never be completely eradicated, as it has been discovered in ancient hydra species. scientists in germany and croatia made this finding while searching for the origin of the cancer gene and believe these animals' suffering from tumors will help in the fight against the disease. the invasive nature of cancer cells also predates millions of years. in contrast, the number of deaths from heart disease and stroke is declining in most european countries, and cancer is projected to become the leading cause of death. despite over $500 billion invested in cancer research globally, every second person with the disease still succumbs to it, making it unlikely that the "war on cancer" declared in the 1970s can be won. yet, knowing the disease's origins and behavior provides the best chance to develop effective treatment and prevention strategies. the study was published in nature communications.
774	a 14-year-old boy named liam kenward, who lives in maidstone, kent, has been told by the local council that he cannot fly more than two flags at a time in his back garden due to an anonymous complaint. liam, who has collected over 200 flags over the past 10 years, had been flying five flags at once on two 20ft flagpoles in his secluded garden. the council has now instructed him to only fly one flagpole, which is a maximum of 10ft tall. liam is devastated as this is his passion and he has reduced the height of one of his poles to just fly above the hedge. his mother, tracey, who owns her own gardening business, is also disappointed as liam's hobby keeps him engaged and interested in learning about different countries and their flags. the family plans to apply for planning permission to fly five flags at once. the council stated that planning legislation in england allows for two flags to be flown without planning permission, but if a resident wishes to fly more flags, they must apply for planning permission.
775	shreddies is an underpants company that produces flatulence-absorbing underwear using chemical warfare technology. their range includes briefs, boxers, and shorties for both men and women. the underwear features a special, highly porous carbon cloth back panel that absorbs, traps, and neutralizes flatulence odors. the cloth is reusable and can be washed to be reactivated. shreddies are suitable for those suffering from digestive disorders or those experiencing the after effects of bowel surgery. the underwear has received praise from customers, including chelsea footballer frank lampard and tv presenter christine bleakley, who owns a stake in the company. the underwear has won awards and is particularly useful for individuals with ibs, crohn's disease, dyspepsia, colitis, and food intolerances. shreddies also manufacture underwear for incontinence and those with stomas and colostomy bags. the underwear functions by filtering flatulence through a thin, highly porous carbon cloth. shreddies have been featured on television shows and have received positive reviews from satisfied customers.
776	sir hugh orde, a former chief of police in northern ireland, expressed concern over the conspiracy to hide suspected murderer dale cregan in manchester during his five-week run from authorities. orde drew comparisons with his experience in northern ireland, where communities had protected terrorists and criminals due to a culture of fear that prevented people from reporting information. cregan, wanted for two murders, allegedly had help from the community to avoid detection and may have been hiding in an outhouse at the white hart pub in hyde. police offered a £50,000 reward and conducted numerous armed raids, but cregan was not found until he shot and killed two policewomen in a tragic turn of events. orde believes the community's response to the incident showed that most residents support the police. similar cases of unsolved murders and large rewards in northern ireland have shown that the community's fear and lack of trust in the authorities can hinder investigations. examples of these cases include the murder of joanne mathers in 1986, for which a £20,000 reward was offered but the murderer was never found, and the murder of police constable ronan kerr by dissident republicans in 2011, whose killers have also eluded capture despite a £50,000 reward.

778	a new magazine titled "illegal!" has been launched in london, sold by drug addicts on the streets. the founders argue that everyone has the right to do what they want with their bodies, even if it means engaging in illegal drug use. the sellers pay £1.50 per copy and sell it for £3.50, pocketing the difference to fund their drug habit. the danish founder of the magazine, michael lodberg olsen, aims to provide drug addicts with an alternative to theft and prostitution to generate revenue. the magazine has sold around 15,000 copies in copenhagen and 2,000 copies in london. however, police are criticizing the initiative, arguing that it legitimizes and formalizes fundraising for illegal drug use. the legality of the magazine's sale is questionable, and scotland yard has not yet responded to inquiries about whether selling the magazine constitutes illegal activity. some residents and critics argue that the magazine will only increase drug dependency and contribute to crime.
779	manchester united's goalkeeper david de gea has been the club's most important player since sir alex ferguson retired, and his contract is set to expire at the end of next season. spanish international victor valdes, a three-time champions league winner, has recently joined united as a backup goalkeeper and will challenge de gea for the starting position. valdes has a strong relationship with manager louis van gaal and goalkeeping coach frans hoek, who gave him his debut at barcelona 12 years ago. both de gea and his family are content in manchester and have adjusted to the english lifestyle, but madrid is interested in signing him as a replacement for iker casillas. united's chief executive ed woodward has already spoken with de gea's agent jorge mendes about a new contract, and formal talks are planned. valdes has signed an 18-month contract, and united may be preparing themselves in case de gea's contract negotiations don't go well. valdes will not be in manchester for a watching brief; he will challenge de gea, and van gaal wants it that way. valdes has been looking for accommodation in wilmslow and has joined the enclave of spanish players at the club, including juan mata, ander herrera, and bojan krkic. united may need to offer de gea a record-breaking contract to keep him at the club.
780	house speaker john boehner used an unconventional messenger, taylor swift, to criticize president barack obama's free community college proposal by creating a blog post with swift gifs and arguments opposing the proposal. boehner's office argued that the proposal would result in a large expense, and suggested working together to lower education costs instead. swift was chosen as an effective way to reach younger voters, who are a key demographic in the 2016 elections. other republicans have also used swift to communicate with young voters, including senator joni ernst and senator ted cruz's digital strategist. swift has not strayed far from her squeaky-clean image, making her a safe pick for the gop. the success of the gop's use of swift in reaching young voters remains to be seen.
781	the high speed railway (hs2) preparation bill, which enables the government to buy land for the proposed hs2 railway linking london to the north of england, was approved in a vote in the commons yesterday with a majority of 316. the bill, which passed with 350 votes to 34 against, will now progress to the house of lords for further scrutiny. hs2 was described as an "essential railway" by prime minister david cameron, who urged against building an "old-style rail line" and highlighted the capacity issues on the current west coast mainline. the bill allows for the acquisition of property and compensation for evicted families along the route, which will cost an estimated £50 billion. despite opposition from some conservative mps and threats from labour to withdraw their support, the party ultimately backed the bill, with shadow transport secretary mary creagh acknowledging the need to address capacity problems. scotland was also announced as a potential beneficiary of the high-speed railway, with a study planned to increase its benefits. rebels opposed to the project, including prominent conservative backbenchers nadine dorries and david davis, argue that the funds could be better spent elsewhere.
782	liverpool university is investigating a controversial script for the medical students' society annual play after students wrote a pantomime featuring a rape scene and jokes about sexual assault. the script, titled "smoker," is one of three options and includes a scene where "pussy galore" drugs and rapes "dr no means no," and another where girls do a "gloriously slutty dance." the script, which also makes light of the anti-rape slogan "no means no," has been widely criticized as misogynistic, offensive, and an embarrassment to the university. students and critics have condemned the script, calling it normalized rape culture in universities. the university, the medical students' society, and the students' union have all released statements condemning the content, and the university is investigating the matter.
783	a five-year-old boy in italy has reported his father, arturo verratti, to the police for trying to force him to support juventus football team instead of his preferred choice, milan. verratti's tactics included making his son wear juventus jersey day and night and sing their chants, even going as far as calling in a local priest to perform an exorcism, believing that only satan could have influenced his son to support the rival team. neighbors confirmed hearing the boy loudly sing juventus chants under his father's pressure.
784	three teenage boys, isaac carter, ce-antonyo kennedy, and dominic mcdaniel, ages 17 and 18, have been charged with the first-degree murder of 14-year-old alexis kane in kansas city, missouri. the boys allegedly picked up alexis in a white chrysler at a 7-eleven at around 4am on january 11, 2023. surveillance footage shows the group met a fourth suspect, kennedy, at bay water park shortly before alexis was beaten and shot to death. the motive for the attack is unknown. alexis' body was discovered by a passer-by in the park the following morning, meters away from her middle school. the suspects are currently in police custody, and detectives are working to determine how alexis knew her alleged killers. alexis' family, including her mother lashonda kane and aunt shanaya kane, have praised the police efforts to apprehend the suspects and expressed their grief over the senseless loss of a young life. a vigil was held at the water park where alexis' body was found, and an ad hoc group against crime offered a $1,000 reward for any leads.
785	dior has launched a new foundation, called diorskin star, which is designed to help women look more photogenic in selfies and photographs. the foundation is enriched with titanium and contains "intelligent pigments" that help diffuse natural and artificial light on the skin, while also enhancing radiance and banishing dullness, shine, and wrinkles. scientists worked for two years to develop the formula, which also contains plant-based ingredients that encourage cell renewal and reduce redness. makeup artist carlos ferraz, who has worked with mila kunis and eva mendes, praised the foundation for its good coverage and luminous finish, making it "perfect for bringing a healthy, glowing look to the selfie and social media generation." dior claims the foundation makes the face an "ideal light source," and it is now available with natalie portman as its face.
786	a 105-year-old zen buddhist master, joshu sasaki, who has been living in the us since 1962 and founded rinzai-ji zen center in los angeles and mount baldy zen center in california, has been accused of sexually assaulting and harassing female students during private teaching sessions for over 50 years. the allegations range from non-consensual groping and sexually coercive meetings to affairs and marital interference. despite accusations circulating since the 1970s, no action was taken against sasaki, and those speaking out have often been alienated or excommunicated from the community. in january, the independent witnessing council, senior teachers of sasaki's zen buddhist community, admitted to struggling with his sexual misconduct and began investigating his behavior towards female students. sasaki retired from teaching in january 2022 due to ill health, and some in the community have downplayed the abuse, comparing it to the complexities of marriage. the zen buddhist tradition, which emerged from mahayana buddhism and focuses on the insight to one's true nature, has ignored or hushed up the allegations against sasaki for decades. several victims have spoken out, describing feeling shunned or ignored when bringing up the abuse.
787	leicester city have signed experienced goalkeeper mark schwarzer on a free transfer from chelsea to help them in their fight against relegation. schwarzer's arrival comes as leicester's first-choice goalkeeper, kasper schmeichel, is out with a broken foot, and backup ben hamer has struggled in his absence, allowing seven goals in five games. chelsea's petr cech, also a target for leicester, is expected to stay at stamford bridge, as schwarzer's departure reduces the likelihood of him leaving during this transfer window.
788	in the euro 2016 qualifier between italy and malta, southampton striker graziano pelle scored the only goal for italy in a 1-0 victory, maintaining their perfect record in group h. pelle scored in the 24th minute after a goalmouth scramble caused by pasqual's header. malta captain michael mifsud was controversially sent off in the 27th minute for a foul on alessandro florenzi, despite minimal contact. both teams finished with 10 men, as italy's leonardo bonucci was sent off for a foul on andre schembri in the 73rd minute. italy manager antonio conte was pleased with the win but acknowledged room for improvement. italy currently leads group h with nine points, level with croatia, and faces them in the next qualifier.
789	british researchers have made a significant breakthrough in decoding a key defense mechanism of hard-to-treat bacteria, specifically gram negative bacteria, which have a thick outer layer and are becoming increasingly antibiotic-resistant. this discovery, published in the journal nature, offers the possibility of developing new generation drugs to combat these superbugs, which pose a global health problem and cause hundreds of thousands of deaths annually. the research was conducted using the diamond synchrotron, one of the world's most powerful x-ray machines, and identifies a way to disable the defensive wall of these bacteria, making them vulnerable to treatment. the urgent need for new antibiotics against gram negative bacteria, including many hospital superbugs, has been emphasized by dame sally davies, the chief medical officer, who has warned of an "apocalyptic scenario" where routine operations become deadly due to the loss of power of antibiotics.
790	manchester united's under-18 side secured a last-minute 1-0 victory against derby with an impressive goal by midfielder oliver rathbone. the 18-year-old, who joined united in 2013, controlled a high ball with his second touch and lobbed the ball over the goalkeeper from 40 yards out. the goal was reminiscent of wayne rooney's spectacular long-range effort against west ham in march 2014. rathbone, who is physically behind some of his peers but excels technically, had entered as a substitute and netted a hat-trick against blackburn earlier in the season. rooney, who is a regular for the under-18 side, scored a similar goal to help manchester united win 2-0 against west ham.
791	a wildfire that scorched over 38,000 acres and destroyed 21 homes in southern california was accidentally started by a boy playing with matches, according to the los angeles county sheriff's department. the boy, whose name and age were not released, is currently home with his parents, and the case will be presented to the los angeles county district attorney for possible charges. the buckweed fire, which began on october 21 in the agua dulce community, forced the evacuation of approximately 15,000 people and injured three civilians and two firefighters. as of tuesday, most of the 23 wildfires in southern california were under control, but 14 people had gone on to lose their lives and over 508,000 acres had been burned, destroying around 1,600 homes. authorities have arrested five people in arson probes and governor arnold schwarzenegger urged those responsible to turn themselves in. witnesses have reported sightings of a white ford f-150 pickup with chrome tubular running boards near the origin of the santiago fire in orange county. authorities have asked the public for assistance in locating the vehicle.
792	pope francis has instructed archbishop gerhard ludwig muller, the prefect of the congregation for the doctrine of the faith, to take decisive action against sexual abuse within the catholic church, including offering assistance to victims, carrying out due proceedings against the guilty, and implementing necessary directives. this is the first public statement on the issue from francis since becoming pope. the survivors network of those abused by priests (snap) has called for concrete action rather than words and accused the church of protecting its reputation over vulnerable children. previous pope benedict xvi also called for action against abusers but was criticized for doing too little. over 500 victims of clergy sexual abuse have asked a meeting with francis. the pope has expressed deep sorrow over the scandal during papal visits, but only selected the victims he met. one alleged victim, michael duran, urged francis to make priests and cardinals accountable for their actions and give catholics new hope.
793	david cameron was at chequers preparing for a trip to scotland when he was shocked by the news of douglas carswell's defection to ukip. the conservative mp had been in secret talks with ukip leader nigel farage for over a year, and the defection was meticulously planned with the help of ukip donor stuart wheeler. despite the surprise, cameron and his advisers are to blame for underestimating the threat posed by ukip and carswell's discontent. carswell's decision to resign and fight the by-election as a ukip candidate may encourage other dissident tory mps, and there are concerns about possible defections from nadine dorries, peter bone, and others. carswell, who grew up in kenya and studied history, had been an mp since 2005 and was popular in the party. he had been criticized for expenses and had rebelled against government policy on europe, among other issues. carswell's defection is particularly significant because of his intellectual and thoughtful approach, and his questioning of cameron's ability to wrest powers back from brussels ahead of the 2017 eu referendum. to avoid further defections, cameron must clearly state his support for leaving the eu and do so convincingly. carswell's resignation and switch to ukip have shaken up british politics and raised questions about the future direction of the conservative party.
794	twitter, a social media platform that has gained significant popularity in recent years, is primarily used for "tweeting" short messages of 140 characters or less about one's activities or thoughts. it functions more like a social commons than a full-blown social network and offers simplicity compared to other social networks. here are ten tips for using twitter effectively: 1. be authentic but cautious with what you post as it could remain in the digital universe forever. 2. interact with others by replying to their tweets or directly messaging them. 3. follow celebrities and government officials to stay updated. 4. use desktop applications like twitterrific, tweetdeck, and twhirl for efficient management. 5. find friends through searches on twitter.com by looking up shared interests. 6. engage with government officials and libraries for updates and communication. 7. crowdsource ideas, questions, or help from the community. 8. attend tweetups, or twitter meetups, to engage with other users in person. 9. retweet interesting content to share it with your followers. 10. adhere to netiquette rules and follow established twitter norms. additional tips for using twitter can be shared, and the article could be tweeted to expand its reach.
795	in new delhi, india, 63 people have been charged with murder for their involvement in the beating death of l.k. chaudhary, ceo of an italian car parts manufacturing company, graziano transmissioni. the incident occurred when a mob of fired employees attended a meeting with the company's management over their reinstatement. a violent altercation ensued, resulting in chaudhary's death. labor minister oscar fernandes drew criticism for suggesting chaudhary's death served as a warning to management, but later apologized. the italian embassy stated that the company had faced violent protests for several months. business groups condemned the killing and sought assurance from indian authorities that such incidents would not be tolerated. the indian government promised to bring all culprits to justice and maintain india's investment-friendly reputation.

"hercules" is set to be released on july 25.
797	mel gibson was involved in a car accident on malibu canyon road in los angeles on sunday night. the actor, who is in the midst of a child custody dispute, was unhurt in the incident, according to the california highway patrol (chp). alcohol was not suspected in the crash, which chp concluded was "non-intentional." gibson's publicist denied that paparazzi were a factor in the accident. the actor crashed his 2008 maserati into a rocky hillside for unknown reasons and walked away with no injuries. gibson was arrested for dui four years ago and made anti-semitic remarks during that incident. he was cooperative with investigators after sunday's accident and was later towed away in a friend's car.
798	the article by rebecca english, published in 2013, reports that buckingham palace will display outfits, uniforms, robes, and jewellery worn during queen elizabeth ii's 1953 coronation. the items include the white satin coronation dress, the diamond diadem, and the outfits of prince charles and princess anne. the exhibition will also feature paintings, works of art, and objects used on the day. the queen, as a mother of young children, ensured that her children were involved in the historic event. footage of the queen waving goodbye to her children and their charming invitations will be displayed alongside the outfits. the exhibition will run from july 27 to september 29 as part of the summer opening at buckingham palace.
799	sarah ward, a 29-year-old former care manager, was shocked when she gave birth to four babies within nine months – her son freddie, followed by triplets stanley, daisy, and reggie. the couple, from crayford in south-east london, had assumed it would take longer to conceive after a difficult first pregnancy. they are now raising four babies under the age of one and described the experience as feeling more like running a nursery than a home. the family deals with the challenges of changing 175 nappies and making 80 bottles of milk each week. sarah's second pregnancy came as a surprise, as she had been trying to conceive for over a year and had recently made an appointment with a gp for tests. the circumstances were considered high risk, and she was offered a selective termination, but the couple declined the offer. the triplets were born prematurely, weighing 3lb 12oz, 4lb 7oz, and 3lb 14oz. they spent some time in the hospital before coming home last month. sarah finds joy in the attention the babies receive and is proud of her growing family. however, the families' exhaustion is acknowledged as they navigate the realities of caring for four young children. it's important to note that although breastfeeding does act as a natural contraceptive for some, it requires strict adherence to the feeding schedule for it to be effective. sarah is an exception to the general trend of women in the western world who do not use breastfeeding as their primary method of contraception.
800	a drunk 25-year-old man, approximately 6'2" and 250 pounds, resisted arrest outside a canadian bar in windsor and was tasered by police after refusing to comply with officers' commands. the altercation was caught on camera as the man tried to escape, smoke a cigarette, and resist being handcuffed. officers used a taser after a brief scuffle, and the man was later taken into custody without further incident. witnesses reported that the man had been acting strangely and had attempted to start a fight with a patron. the man, who has a history of violence, is said to be fine. sgt. alan adams confirmed the successful arrest but did not identify the suspect.
801	blyth spartans are expecting to face chelsea in the fa cup third round, according to their manager tom wade. wade claims an old woman correctly predicted their previous results and mentioned chelsea as their next opponent. despite the exciting prospect, blyth will have to play the match at home, as they do not have the option to move it to a larger stadium. the draw will be on monday, live on bbc2 from 7pm.
802	president obama is expected to announce changes to the nsa's controversial surveillance programs that collect data on american phone calls on friday. the programs, which have been a subject of controversy since former nsa contractor edward snowden's leaks in june, have been defended by the administration as crucial for preventing terrorist attacks. however, a recent study by the new america foundation found that traditional investigative methods, rather than bulk surveillance, played the largest role in preventing terrorism-related cases in the us since 9/11. specifically, the analysis of 225 individuals charged with terrorism-related offenses found that the nsa's bulk collection of american telephone metadata under section 215 of the patriot act had a minimal impact, contributing to at most 1.8% of these cases. section 702 of the foreign intelligence surveillance act played a role in 4.4%, and other unidentified authorities played a role in 1.3%. the remainder of the cases' initiation methods were not identified in the study. furthermore, the case of basaaly moalin, a san diego cabdriver who provided funds to al-shabaab, challenges the necessity of the bulk collection program as the government's justification for its expedited investigative capabilities was undercut in this case. the fbi waited two months to begin an investigation and wiretap moalin's phone after using the nsa's database to link a number in somalia to him. the obama administration is facing a choice on how to proceed with the phone data collection program. options include continuing it as is, giving it to a private third party, or mandating that phone companies keep the data. the legal status of the program is uncertain, with some federal judges ruling it unconstitutional and others in favor. the new america foundation recommends abandoning the bulk phone data collection program entirely and returning to the traditional approach of having the government get a court order to access a suspect's phone records.
803	a u.s. army sergeant accused of killing 16 afghan civilians, including children, in march 2012 was given alcohol and steroid-like drugs by special operations troops at a military outpost in afghanistan, according to the defendant's lawyer, john henry browne. the soldier, staff sgt. robert bales, is charged with murder and illicit use of steroids and alcohol. browne stated that special forces were in charge at the time and that bales intends to plead guilty in exchange for the elimination of the death penalty, while arguing for the possibility of parole in a penalty phase hearing. the hearing is scheduled for june 5. browne has previously criticized the military for assigning bales to another combat tour despite evidence of ptsd and a traumatic brain injury, and intends to use combat stress experts at the hearing. the shooting spree strained u.s.-afghan relations and intensified the debate about withdrawing american troops from afghanistan. afghan authorities have called for swift action and justice for the victims.
804	manchester united qualified for the champions league last 16 as group winners despite being held 1-1 at home to valencia. united were on the brink of history by not conceding a goal in all six group games, but valencia scored in the 32nd minute through pablo hernandez to lead. united managed to come back with a goal by anderson in the 63rd minute. glasgow rangers finished third in their group and qualified for the europa league. defending champions inter milan lost 3-0 at werder bremen, and rafael benitez's side missed out on winning the group, allowing tottenham to do so after a thrilling 3-3 draw at fc twente. fc copenhagen became the first danish team to reach the last 16 stage by winning 3-1 against panathinaikos. schalke topped group b in the champions league with a 2-1 win at benfica, while lyon qualified in second place. hapoel tev aviv were eliminated from europe despite conceding a late goal in a 2-2 draw with lyon. barcelona finished top of group d with a 2-0 win over rubin kazan, while the russian side reached the europa league. fc copenhagen's win ensured they qualified for the last 16 regardless of the outcome of their final group game.
805	two toddlers, chloe corona and claire west, had a magical fairy tale photo shoot at home, dressed up as their favorite disney characters. their mothers handmade each costume, set, and prop. the toddlers embraced their roles, with chloe working diligently as snow white and cinderella's step-sister, and claire delighting in being cinderella, aurora, and alice in wonderland. photographer myranda josephson captured the enchanting moments, adding details like fairy dust and peter pan's shadow. the little models had a wonderful experience, even posing with a real-life wolf hired from a tv company. they are already planning another shoot featuring beauty and the beast and the little mermaid.
806	nepal celebrated the 60th anniversary of the first ascent of mount everest by honoring edmund hillary and tensing norgay, the legendary mountaineers who reached the summit on may 29, 1953. thousands of people have scaled the 29,035ft (8,850m) peak since then. during the diamond jubilee celebrations, amelia rose hillary, granddaughter of edmund hillary, and tashi tensing, grandson of tensing norgay, paid homage to their grandfathers by laying garlands on their statues in kathmandu. the event was attended by reinhold messner, the first climber to scale everest without oxygen, and other mountaineers who have summited the mountain. the british-funded expedition led by colonel john hunt changed mountaineering forever and made hilary and norgay into household names. the anniversary celebrations included a horse-drawn chariot parade through kathmandu, a signing of a new book on the expedition in london, and a reception at the royal geographical society attended by the queen and the duke of edinburgh.
807	portugal's ceo of tap air portugal, fernando pinto, has expressed concerns over the uncertainty in europe's economic recovery, highlighting the recent bailout in cyprus as a cause for concern. portugal, one of five countries to receive bailout funds from the troika, is struggling to meet its repayment deadlines and reduce its public deficit. the government has investigated privatizing tap air portugal but failed to secure a buyer last year. europe's airlines face challenges such as regulatory red tape, high tax burdens, and airport capacity constraints, negatively impacting their growth. portugal's unemployment rate remains high at 17.5% and its economy is forecast to contract by 1.9% in 2013. economist jens arnold expresses optimism over portugal's progress with its austerity program but acknowledges ongoing risks of political instability and slow economic growth.
808	a woman was brutally attacked by a mob of at least 30 men in guwahati, india, leaving her helpless and screaming for help. the attack, which was filmed by an off-duty journalist and lasted for 30 minutes, saw the woman being beaten, stripped, and left with signs of severe injury and cigarette burns. the police have arrested six men in connection to the incident but are under pressure to find the remaining seven suspects. the slow police response has caused outrage and calls for action, with posters showing the identities of the accused being put up across the city. the incident highlights india's poor record on women's rights, following a string of horrific attacks against women in the country. the national commission for women has arrived in guwahati to investigate the incident and provide assistance to the victim.
809	reigning miss teen usa, cassidy wolf, shared her harrowing experience of being secretly watched via webcam by a former classmate, jared abrahams, who installed malware on her laptop using the software blackshades. the incident came to light as part of a two-year international operation led by the fbi and police in 19 countries resulting in over 90 arrests for 'creepware' use. wolf was targeted for over a year, during which abrahams demanded better-quality photos and videos, and threatened to make the images public if she didn't comply. the 19-year-old california native felt relieved and traumatized after his arrest but expressed mixed emotions and pity for him. wolf began speaking out about her experience to increase awareness of cybercrime and sextortion among young women, urging them to report incidents and take precautions such as regularly changing passwords and deleting browsing history.
810	a 62-year-old woman, june scott, from chester-le-street, county durham, lost her left eye due to a fungal infection caused by a contact lens she bought from a uk company before traveling to her spanish holiday home in alicante in october 2012. despite attempts to save her vision, including three operations and eight-hour sessions to flush the infection from her body, doctors were forced to remove the eye in a three-and-a-half hour procedure. june spent three weeks in hospital, attached to an intravenous drip, and is now left blind in that eye. she plans to take legal action against the contact lens supplier as she notices a brown stain on the lens and returns them several times, but receives new ones that have the same issue. medics have identified the infection as fusarium.
811	hurricane paloma intensified into a category 3 storm on friday night, battering grand cayman island with strong winds and heavy rain. residents were urged to complete storm preparations as the hurricane was expected to turn northeast and head towards cuba, where a hurricane warning was issued for several provinces. the storm's winds were near 115 mph, and it was forecast to approach cuba as a category 2 storm after weakening late saturday. grand cayman residents were advised to evacuate or seek shelter as the storm was expected to produce rainfall of 5 to 10 inches, with isolated maximum totals of 15 inches possible, and storm-surge flooding of 5 to 7 feet in the cayman islands and 8 to 12 feet near cuba's southern coast. evacuations were underway in some areas, and residents were advised to avoid crossing swollen rivers and stay away from fallen cables. the storm was forecast to pass the us mainland and head into the atlantic.
812	chris soules, also known as the "hot farmer" from iowa on the bachelorette, has been announced as the next bachelor. the decision to cast him took longer than expected, with producers considering various factors and debating different directions. it's unclear if the delay was due to finding 25 women willing to move to iowa or if soules' late fan following impacted the timing. regardless, soules, known for his charm and wealth, is returning to california for another chance at love on the upcoming season of the bachelor.
813	vanessa sky ellis, a 26-year-old barmaid from new york, has an unusual hobby: she spends up to 12 hours a day tracking down and taking selfies with celebrities. vanessa, who inherited this hobby from her late mother, has amassed over 10,000 pictures with famous faces such as lady gaga, matt damon, brad pitt, johnny depp, and katy perry. she scans tv guides and waits outside hotels and morning television studios to meet her beloved stars. some celebrities, like lady gaga and jennifer lopez, are friendly and happy to oblige selfie requests, while others, like bruce willis, never stop for fans. vanessa's all-time favorite celebrity is johnny depp, whom she describes as "the most handsome man ever." while many may find her hobby extreme, vanessa is undeterred and continues to hunt for celebrities every day.
814	the england and wales national probate calendar, published online for the first time by ancestry.co.uk, reveals that karl marx died a poor man with an estate worth 23,000 pounds in 1883, while charles darwin left behind a large estate valued at around 13 million pounds when he died in 1882. the records show that marx's youngest daughter, eleanor, inherited 250 pounds, and ernest shackleton left just 20,000 pounds after losing his fortune in failed schemes. the probate calendar, which records the court's authority to administer deceased persons' estates, shows that the average value of a person's will during the period was 5,363 pounds. notable figures such as john cadbury, who created the cadbury chocolate empire, left 4.2 million pounds when he died in 1889, while charles dickens, author of oliver twist and great expectations, left around 7.1 million pounds when he died in 1870. the database, which includes details about the deceased's social standing and possessions, can be useful to those researching their family history. other famous authors, such as arthur conan doyle and lewis carroll, also left substantial estates when they died.
815	three americans, including jordan matson of wisconsin, are reportedly fighting against the islamic state terror group in northern syria alongside the kurdish people's protection units (ypg). matson is believed to be in the haska province near jazaa, close to the iraqi border, where intense fighting between isis and ypg has been reported. the ypg spokesperson confirmed matson's injury but declined to provide further details. matson's facebook page and a purported photo from a kurdish news agency suggest that he left for syria in september and was previously in the u.s. military. the u.s. military confirmed matson's enlistment but could not speak to his current activities due to privacy concerns. the state department is also aware of the reports but could not comment due to privacy concerns and was unsure if there is a specific law barring americans from joining foreign military organizations.
816	the syrian government and opposition demanded independent investigations from the united nations on wednesday over accusations of using chemical weapons in the civil war, which began in 2011 and has left around 70,000 people dead and displaced over a million others. both sides accused each other of using chemical weapons in the flashpoint provinces of aleppo and damascus, but there is no concrete evidence to support the claims. the united states, through its ambassador to syria, robert ford, expressed skepticism towards the reports and called for careful investigation. the rebels' coalition government also demanded an international investigation. syria, which is not a signatory to the chemical weapons convention, is believed to have a large stockpile of banned chemicals such as sarin, mustard, and vx gases. the use of such weapons poses a direct threat to neighboring israel, which shares a border with syria. investigations are ongoing, and some observers have questioned the authenticity of images and reports of chemical attacks. previous claims of chemical weapons use by the syrian government have been found to be false after extensive investigation.
817	the catholic cardinals in rome voted on friday to begin the secret election, or conclave, for a new pope on tuesday, march 13. only cardinals younger than 80 are eligible to vote. two cardinals, keith o'brien of scotland and julius riyadi darmaatmadja of indonesia, who are eligible to vote but will not attend the conclave, presented their explanations on friday. cardinals have been gathering for meetings, called general congregations, since monday to discuss issues facing the church, including child sex abuse by priests and the vatican leaks scandal. cardinals peter turkson of ghana, timothy dolan of new york, and roger mahony of los angeles are among leading candidates, and have asked for prayers. the vatican is taking measures such as raising the chimney for smoke signals, closing the sistine chapel to tourists, and installing an electronic shield to prevent outside communication. cardinals will draw lots for accommodations at casa santa marta and undergo a series of preparations before the new pope will be able to take residence in the papal apartments.
818	manchester city scouts watched alexandre lacazette during lyon's french cup win against rc lens, where he scored a goal and increased his season tally to 20. city are evaluating potential transfers for their premier league team and new york city fc. alexandre lacazette, denis praet of anderlecht, and julian draxler of schalke have been considered, but the summer transfer window is favored for these deals. aston villa's christian benteke, who is wanted by manchester city, is content to stay at villa park, while city's scott sinclair is in talks with villa and attracted interest from qpr and crystal palace. paul lambert is interested in acquiring adil nabi, a 20-year-old forward from west brom, who is also a target for aston villa. sinclair, 25, has made few appearances for manchester city and hopes to leave the club, and west brom's nabi, who is out of contract in the summer, is a viable option for villa in the transfer market.
819	rare images of the elusive okapi, a shy african animal believed to be mythical due to its reclusiveness, have been released for the first time. the okapi, native to the democratic republic of congo (drc), is a giraffe relative with zebra-like stripes on its rear and stands an average height of 1.6 meters (5 feet, 3 inches). the new pictureswere taken by camera traps in virunga national park, where okapis have been threatened by poaching, deforestation, military camps, and the influx of refugees. the photographs prove the okapi still thrives in the park but its exact population and distribution are uncertain, and the animal remains under threat with okapi meat now regularly sold at nearby beni. the european union-funded conservation project using 18 cameras around the park has also found other species such as shrews, duikers, and gorillas, which numbered 125,000 in a recent discovery in the neighboring republic of congo. the okapi was known to africans for centuries but remained unknown to the western world until the early 1900s when a british explorer discovered its remains.
820	casey stoner won the french motogp race at le mans on sunday, marking his second victory of the season, while championship leader dani pedrosa suffered a broken collarbone in a collision with marco simoncelli. pedrosa, who had won the previous race in portugal after recovering from shoulder surgery, clipped simoncelli's bike while trying to retake second place and was given a ride-through penalty. valiantino rossi finished second, his best finish since joining ducati, but trails jorge lorenzo by 31 points in the overall standings. lorenzo, who led the race, finished fifth to maintain his lead, while randy de puniet, loris capirossi, cal crutchlow, and colin edwards all crashed out. stoner triumphed by more than 14 seconds, continuing his impressive form after winning the opening race of the season. pedrosa, simoncelli, and several others were injured in various crashes during the race.
821	a woman named aileen hedges was caught with 18.8g of amphetamines and cannabis in her fridge, explaining to police that she used the drugs to help her clean faster and then "come down." however, during her trial at maidstone crown court, hedges changed her story and admitted to supplying the drugs. the court also found text messages on her phone indicating she was selling the drugs beyond social use to friends. hedges was sentenced to nine months in jail, suspended for two years, and ordered to take part in a six-month drug rehabilitation course. after her trial, hedges stated she had never taken speed and lied to police out of fear of losing her house and getting another drug charge.
822	the article discusses how families are turning to at-home entertainment to save money during the recession. the moore family in birmingham, alabama, enjoys a mix of traditional games, outdoor activities, and video games. christopher moore, an 8-year-old boy, uses his avatar to protect the world in video games. netflix, a dvd rental service, has seen record growth with its convenience and value, offering over 100,000 titles and the ability to stream 12,000 movies for various price plans. the gaming industry has also boomed, with video games providing more hours of entertainment at a "much sounder investment" than movies or concerts. online gaming is becoming increasingly social, and many families are playing games together. parents can bond with their children by engaging in their games, and there are resources available like the entertainment software rating board for parents to determine what their kids are doing. other cost-effective at-home activities include practicing yoga, with video and dvd sales and subscription services seeing growth. overall, the article highlights the trend of people finding affordable ways to entertain themselves at home during these economic times.
823	an elderly anesthetist, michael cowen, alleged to have fallen asleep during an emergency caesarian section at milton keynes general hospital in the uk, has been allowed to return to work after an investigation found no risk to the patient. the incident occurred towards the end of the surgery when cowen, who qualified as a doctor in 1965 and registered as an anesthetist in 1977, was instructed to adjust the anesthesia but remained asleep. the incident was reported by the surgeon and two midwives, and the patient's partner also witnessed it but did not make a formal complaint. cowen was suspended for nine months on full pay during the investigation and continues to work as a private consultant nearby. the hospital maintains that the patient was not put at risk, while some sources question the safety implications of the incident. the general medical council, which regulates anesthetists, has declined to comment on the case.
824	in boston's ongoing federal trial of reputed mob boss james "whitey" bulger, stephen "the rifleman" flemmi, bulger's longtime associate and crime partner, admitted to witnessing and participating in several murders committed by bulger during his three days on the stand. although flemmi's testimony portrayed him as a loyal henchman following bulger's orders and disposing of bodies, defense attorney hank brennan attempted to shift the image, portraying flemmi as an independent killer. during this confrontation, controversies regarding flemmi's relationship with his common-law stepdaughter, deborah hussey, arose. flemmi admitted to molesting her when she was 17, as well as luring and ultimately murdering her at age 26. he testified that bulger could have prevented her murder by telling him to 'pass,' but instead watched as bulger strangled deborah with his bare hands. after killing her, flemmi removed her teeth and buried her in a basement floor. defense attorney brannan accused flemmi of being her killer and raised concerns regarding flemmi's inconsistent testimony about the location of another victim, debbie davis, who flemmi claimed bulger murdered when she knew the name of an fbi agent who had recruited bulger and flemmi as informants. the question as to why flemmi's parents' home, where several dinner meetings with the rogue fbi agent, john connolly, took place, was not raided became an issue. flemmi called this question 'ridiculous.' while bulger, who faces charges of 19 murders, extortion, and racketeering, was being defended against the accusation that he ordered these murders, flemmi refuted the claim that he was a mere lackey. the trial resumed on wednesday with flemmi still testifying.
825	mark kelly, a retired nasa astronaut and former u.s. navy pilot, shares his personal experience and newfound perspective on gun violence after his wife, gabrielle giffords, was shot in 2011 during a public event in arizona. before this incident, he had not given much thought to guns or gun violence, focusing on his military and space careers. however, the statistics and impact of gun violence in the u.s. shocked him, and he is now advocating for universal background checks to reduce gun-related deaths and murders. he explains that 100 people die every day from guns, and over 80% of gun owners and 92% of u.s. households support background checks for all sales. kelly urges americans to support this cause, emphasizing that it is not a political issue but rather a safety measure that respects second amendment rights.
826	ken to, a 39-year-old artist from california, creates intricately detailed wire bonsai trees by twisting and turning copper wire up to 1,000 times. each tree takes between three and 12 hours to make, and they sell for up to £200. the trees stand as little as one inch tall, with branches as thin as 1/8 of an inch. inspired by real bonsai, but not copying them exactly, to uses different colored copper-plated wires and shapes the foliage with specially filed down pliers. his designs are planted in real bonsai pots or attached to rocks for a more dramatic effect, and he believes that copying trees hinders creativity.
