827	the syrian conflict has forced millions of people to flee their homes, with an estimated 4.25 million people being homeless inside the country. ayesha, a syrian grandmother, is among those displaced after a bomb destroyed her home, killing two of her teenage children. she now lives in an abandoned building site with her remaining children and grandchildren and fears for their safety. zenat, a young mother, also had to flee after her house was bombed, leaving her son with severe burns who lacks access to medical care due to the destruction of syrian hospitals. over 50% of syrian hospitals have been destroyed or are non-operational and many doctors have fled the country. the un security council is trying to ensure aid reaches those in need by calling for cross-border deliveries and humanitarian pauses in fighting. several ngos, including the british-syrian charity hand in hand for syria, are providing medical care within syria despite the dangers. for 2013 alone, aid totaling $1.4 billion is needed to address the growing humanitarian crisis. immediate assistance is required for the millions living in dire conditions. if you wish to help, consider donating to reputable organizations providing aid to syrian refugees.
828	prince harry, who is participating in the "walking with the wounded" expedition to the south pole with 11 other injured servicemen and women, is looking forward to completing the challenge despite the cancellation of the competitive race element due to challenging terrain and exhaustion among the team members. the british, commonwealth, and us teams, who had been racing against each other, have now banded together and are just over three days from their goal. prince harry expressed his admiration for fellow adventurer duncan slater, a double amputee, and his determination in the face of his injuries. the team has been trekking around 9-12 miles a day while pulling 154lb sleds in extreme temperatures and 24-hour sunlight. the event began with temperatures as low as -27°c and the race was suspended due to concerns over competitors' safety. prince harry expressed support for the decision and noted the high spirits among the team members.
829	in the aftermath of deadly soccer riots in port said, egypt, which left 79 people dead and suspended the domestic league, recriminations and accusations are flying. the egyptian football association's leadership was sacked by the prime minister, warranting attention from fifa. security forces at the game have been accused of neglect and massive security breaches, with al-ahly's board member claiming the violence was well-organized. anger and grief have spread among al-ahly's 60 million fans, and some players have considered retiring from the game. eyewitnesses report that police stood idle during the massacre, with some suggesting ultras, or hardcore fans, were not adequately secured due to their role in the revolution. the aging port said stadium, which hosted the fateful match between two of egypt's biggest clubs, has also been criticized for being a death trap. fifa president sepp blatter has expressed sympathy and requested a detailed report on the incident but may be waiting for clearer information on the cause of the tragedy.
830	a 20-year-old university of chicago student, austin hudson-lapore, who had gone missing a week prior was found dead on june 19, 2013, in lake michigan. the body was discovered by a fisherman, eddie hudson, 65, around 9:30 a.m. the family identified austin's body at the cook county medical examiner's office and an autopsy was scheduled for the following day. austin, a biochemistry major, was last seen leaving his apartment to watch the storms on june 12, without taking his cell phone or wallet to keep them dry. he was a former national science bowl contender with a passion for meteorology and was described as happy, upbeat, and outdoorsy by his loved ones. the investigation is ongoing, and the cause of death is unknown. austin's disappearance comes after another university of chicago student, naomi knight, 18, a special needs student suffering from bi-polar disorder, had gone missing on june 17.
831	president obama's second term will prioritize domestic issues over international affairs due to the fiscal cliff crisis. the us falling off the fiscal cliff could negatively impact the world economy, particularly europe, where sovereign debt crises persist. obama will seek compromise with republicans on tax increases and spending cuts to avoid the fiscal cliff, with potential implications for social programs. the global economic outlook will remain uncertain and reliance on emerging markets for growth may increase. renewed efforts to address climate change and trade initiatives are possible, but structural economic challenges persist. the deadlock over fiscal consolidation and addressing healthcare costs and low savings rate may continue to impact equity prices. obama's re-election may boost stocks in healthcare and alternative energy.
832	susan rice, named as president barack obama's third national security adviser, was considered a top contender for the position since his campaign days. having served in various roles during the clinton administration and the obama administration, rice has a strong relationship with the president and is known for her loyalty. despite facing criticism after the benghazi attacks, obama pushed for her appointment as secretary of state and later as his top national security aide. rice's close relationship with the president will give her significant power, both in the u.s. and abroad. however, she will face challenges in managing the sprawling national security council bureaucracy and building relationships with her counterparts at state, defense, and other agencies. rice's previous experience at the un, where she was known for her sharp elbows and contentiousness, must be dialed back for the position. the largest obstacles to her success will be dealing with international conflicts and instability in countries such as iraq, afghanistan, libya, and syria, where the u.s. influence is limited.
833	a 66-year-old man from rowlett, texas identified as hong minh truong has been arrested and charged with sending over 500 hoax letters containing white powder to schools, government offices, and numerous other institutions in the u.s. and abroad since 2008. some of these letters were sent as recently as during the super bowl in new jersey, where they were addressed to hotels in the vicinity. the letters contained terrorism threats, with recipients potentially mistaking the powder for anthrax. truong allegedly sent multiple batches from the dallas area, and in some instances, he threatened to hijack planes and target notable buildings such as the nasa center and the empire state building. investigators traced the letters back to truong based on an ip address connected to him and the distinctive features of the envelopes and handwriting. each incident required costly investigations, and truong is currently being held in custody pending a detention hearing on august 4. if convicted, he could face up to five years in prison and a $250,000 fine.
834	a gang of three men, carlton williams, lee stagg, and michael riddle, from bridgwater, somerset, were jailed for a total of ten years for extorting up to £350,000 from motorists through intimidating clamping activities between 2005 and 2008. the trio, operating under the name a1 clamping services, would have towed cars away and demanded up to £600 for their release. they used a spotter to catch motorists parking on private land, often clamping cars as soon as drivers left them. they falsely claimed council tax benefit, housing benefit, and income support, and did not pay income tax or national insurance. the gang's aggressive behavior caused distress and anxiety among car owners, including one who was in the military and had her car clamped right after returning from iraq. the court heard how the ringleader, carlton williams, had laughed off victims' pleas and threats, and even clamped cars with drivers still inside. one victim, chloe brant, was warned she would be targeted again. the men were sentenced for blackmail, making unwarranted demands with menaces, and benefit fraud, with carlton williams receiving the longest sentence of five-and-a-half years. sergeant paul endicott of avon and somerset constabulary said it took four years to apprehend the gang as there was no defined law to control their activities.
835	a 20-year-old woman named nikki guined shot and killed herself with a gun that was given to her by her boyfriend, dwight buchanan, following a heated argument in their bedroom in monroe, georgia. guined repeatedly asked buchanan, a deputy and us army infantry trainee, for the gun during a drunken row, which he initially refused to give her but eventually did. according to a police report, guined took the gun from buchanan while he had one round chambered. the argument reportedly occurred after guined threatened to leave buchanan earlier in the day, but the pair had reconciled and retreated to the bedroom. the house was found covered in beer cans following the incident, and investigators are now looking into the shooting to determine if it was accidental. buchanan, who had been employed as a jailer for 13 months, has been placed on paid administrative leave and is cooperating with the investigation. the gun involved in the shooting has not been issued to buchanan as jailers are not provided with service weapons.
836	natalya page, a 14-year-old student at kenton academy in newcastle, is being isolated from her classmates after refusing to dye her red hair back to a natural color, which goes against the school's uniform regulations. the school offered to dye her hair in their salon and educate her family about the importance of adhering to the dress code, but her father, fred page, refused and criticized the school for persecuting his daughter over her appearance. other instances of students being punished for deviating from school uniform policies include annalise wilks being sent home from beaumont leys school in leicester for having "too tight" trousers in 2013, chloe hunter being put into isolation at kirkby sports college for wearing coloured stud earrings, and laura entwistle being sent home from swavesey village college for having trousers that were too tight around the ankles in 2012. previously, pupils at impington village college rallyied around chris whitehead, who wore a skirt in protest against the school's rule against boys wearing shorts in warm weather, and gemma dixon refused to send her daughter alisha to st john vianney primary school in hartlepool when it banned her from wearing earrings. in 2013, kenton academy announced plans to issue fixed penalty notices to parents whose children accrued at least 2.5 unauthorised absences.
837	fay calvert shares the story of her health hero, dr. fiona hampton, a doctor who made a significant difference in her life and her son craig's during his battle with cystic fibrosis. dr. hampton went above and beyond her professional role to support fay, ensuring craig spent a memorable christmas at home with his family despite his health challenges. the bond between them grew stronger as dr. hampton was there for fay during every difficult moment, offering comfort and care until craig's passing in 2007. fay expresses her gratitude for dr. hampton's support and loves the memories they shared, which give her strength during her grieving process. dr. hampton is being recognized for her compassionate care and dedication to her patients, even as she approaches retirement.
838	jack wooding, a 29-year-old oxford university graduate and experienced climber, tragically passed away after suffering severe head injuries from a falling accident over 300ft in height in the scottish mountains. he was doing a climb known as aladdin's mirror in the cairngorms near aviemore when the incident occurred. despite being an experienced climber, wooding was not wearing a helmet at the time as he believed the slope was gentle. his family, including his twin george, described him as a fearless and sports-loving individual with many sides, such as his love for extreme sports and his intellectual side. doctors told the family that wooding had suffered "unsurvivable brain injuries" and he died 24 hours later without regaining consciousness. the accident occurred on a slope that had been assessed as safe, but the momentum carried wooding over the edge even with an ice axe; his twin brother described him as a brave man who didn't do things by halves. wooding had recently started work as a legal adviser at the department of transport after several years at herbert smith in london and had also worked at the international institute for strategic studies in the past. he was a member of the alpine club and was described as an aspirant and a lovely bloke by fellow climbers. a report on the accident has been sent to the procurator fiscal and his funeral will be held on january 24th in ashtead.
839	kipchoge keino, a kenyan athlete, surprised the world with his unexpected victories in the 3,000m steeplechase at the 1972 munich olympics. he was the first black african to make a significant impact on international athletics, winning two olympic gold medals and hold records at various distances from the 1,500m to 10,000m. keino first competed at the tokyo olympics in 1964 and struggled, but he broke two world records in 1965 in the 3,000m and 5,000m. keino faced challenges in the high-altitude mexico city games in 1968, but won a gold medal in the 1,500m despite stomach cramps. in 1972, keino shocked the world again by winning the 3,000m steeplechase at the munich olympics, defying expectations with his natural ability and determination. keino is remembered for discovering the latent athletic talent in africa and his remarkable ability to conquer competitors in five distinct events. he retired in 1975 and returned to kenya with his daughter milka olympia chelagat.
840	sir roger moore, the former james bond actor, revealed during a radio interview that he once tried viagra but it did not work for him. moore, who is 86 and has diabetes, mistakenly referred to the blue pills as prescription pills for his condition. he also shared that he had a near-death experience due to low hemoglobin levels and is now taking blood every morning to cope with the illness. in the interview, moore also discussed his past marriages and claimed that two of his former wives, dorothy squires and doorn van steyn, were violent towards him. he disclosed that van steyn, whom he married at age 19, repeatedly punched, scratched, and even threw a teapot at him. squires, whom he married shortly after divorcing van steyn, also attacked him after learning of his infidelity and hit him over the head with a guitar. moore is currently on a uk tour promoting his latest book "last man standing: tales from tinseltown." he served as 007 in seven films between 1973 and 1985 and also appeared in tv series such as "the saint" and "the persuaders!" moore retired from acting in 2009 and divides his time between homes in monaco and switzerland. he is married to kristina 'kiki' tholstrup and has three children.
841	burnley manager sean dyche is relaxed about danny ings' future and insists the england under 21 international will not be sold in the january transfer window. ings, who scored four goals in his first premier league campaign and was the championship player of the year last season, is out of contract in the summer, but dyche is confident he will stay. the club's chairman has also publicly stated that ings is not for sale. with burnley in a financially stable position and no agreement imminent with ings' agent, dyche is focusing on potential additions to the squad rather than cashing in on his top performer.
842	mathieu debuchy, a french defender, revealed he had no second thoughts about leaving newcastle united for arsenal, stating that he had moved to "another world" with the gunners. debuchy joined arsenal in a £12m deal this summer, just 18 months after signing for newcastle from lille for £5m. debuchy, who helped arsenal win the community shield against manchester city last weekend, expressed his excitement about the training facilities and the club's dedication to helping players prepare and win. debuchy made his premier league debut for arsenal at home against crystal palace on saturday.
843	gwyneth montenegro, a melbourne woman raised by devout christians, reveals in her new book that she slept with over 10,000 men and worked as an elite escort for a decade. born into a religious family, montenegro started her career in the sex industry at 21 after being gang-raped and having low self-esteem. she worked all over australia and was flown to exotic destinations. montenegro wrote under a pseudonym, "gwyneth montenegro," and kept her real identity hidden from her parents, who thought she was modeling. she earned thousands per week and spent her money on a new car and luxury clothing to cover up her secret. montenegro describes her experience as a mix of good and bad, with clients including lawyers, politicians, and musicians. she used the name "angelina" in the industry and admits to using drugs like cocaine and speed. in her late twenties, montenegro was involved in a car crash and later confessed to her parents about her secret life. despite facing their disapproval, montenegro's parents remained supportive. after a brief stint as a pilot and then dealing with kidney failure, montenegro retired from the escort industry at 33 and started a course in neuro-linguistic programming with her business partner, roger. now, montenegro is a business entrepreneur, and she wants to destigmatize the escort industry and give a voice to those working in it.
844	jyllands park zoo in denmark is considering euthanizing a healthy seven-year-old giraffe named marius due to space constraints and potential conflicts with a younger male. this decision comes just days after copenhagen zoo caused an uproar by killing an 18-month-old healthy male giraffe named marius, citing his genes being well-represented in a breeding program and the need to make space for a new female. animal rights activists have condemned both decisions and deemed them arbitrary and barbaric, while officials from the two zoos state that this is a common practice in danish zoos. copenhagen zoo has not yet determined whether they will conduct a public dissection of the first marius, while jyllands park zoo has not decided on that matter either. the controversy has sparked international outrage and criticism towards zoos, with some viewing them as profiting institutions that keep animals in captivity for display and disposing of them when deemed unnecessary.
845	the writer identifies as an "impatient optimist" and expresses deep sadness and frustration over the kidnapping of hundreds of schoolgirls by the extremist group boko haram in nigeria. the author condemns the group's justification of the atrocity as consistent with islamic teachings and expresses hope that influential muslim voices will continue to reject such actions. the writer is critical of the nigerian government's inability to locate the girls and the fear and uncertainty endured by their families. the author argues that boko haram's opposition to women's education and empowerment is a major hindrance to a better future for nigeria and its population of 170 million. the article concludes by expressing optimism for the future of women and girls globally and urging support for their education and empowerment as a means of creating a brighter future. the hashtag #bringbackourgirls is used to draw attention to the kidnapping case.
846	jeremy paxman expressed his surprise that the comedy series "blackadder goes forth" is used in schools to teach children about the first world war, as he believes people find it hard to understand the war through a historical perspective rather than through poetry. paxman was speaking at the cheltenham literature festival to promote his book "great britain's great war," where he discussed how the war has been misrepresented in history. paxman, who appeared with a beard that made headlines earlier this year, was also asked about it and mentioned that he hasn't decided whether to keep it. he also revealed that he considered quitting newsnight after the jimmy savile and lord mcalpine scandals, but ultimately stayed due to loyalty.
847	sally ride, the first american woman in space, passed away after a battle with pancreatic cancer at the age of 61. beyond her historic space journey aboard the space shuttle challenger in 1983, ride was an advocate for female advancement in science, technology, and mathematics. she founded sally ride science in 2001 to encourage girls and young students to pursue science. throughout her career, she earned numerous degrees, returned to space on her second mission in 1984, and wrote children's books. ride's passing inspired countless tributes from people around the world, who praised her as a pioneer, role model, and a shining example of ambition and achievement. president barack obama, fellow astronaut buzz aldrin, and actor tom hanks were among the numerous figures paying their respects to ride, whose legacy continues to inspire future generations of women in science.
848	inter milan moved up to second place in the italian serie a with a 1-0 win over cagliari, thanks to a goal from defender andrea ranocchia. inter played without key figures wesley sneijder and lucio, but still managed to secure the three points. ac milan, who were knocked out of the champions league by tottenham, will look to bounce back against chievo. napoli can also surpass inter with a win over catania. inter caught cagliari off-guard with a quick free-kick, and ranocchia's goal was a result of a series of deflections off goran pandev and houssine kharja. cagliari's roberto donadoni suffered another defeat, leaving his team in ninth place. palermo's european qualification hopes were set back by a 1-0 loss to bologna, who played the last half-hour with a man less but still clinched the game's only goal. meanwhile, bologna moved 10 points clear of the relegation zone.
849	the middle east respiratory syndrome (mers) virus, which causes lung infections, coughing, breathing difficulties, and a temperature, along with kidney failure in some cases, has seen an increase in threats but does not yet constitute a global public health emergency according to the world health organization (who). this virus, similar to sars, was first identified in saudi arabia in 2012 and has since infected 496 people, with 126 deaths in the region. there are currently no vaccines or antiviral treatments for mers, which is believed to have originated from camels and has spread to neighboring countries and some regions in europe, the us, philippines, and malaysia. the who's emergency committee concluded that the conditions for a public health emergency of international concern have not yet been met, and virologists emphasize the low odds of infection despite its severity.
850	the ebola virus outbreak has claimed nearly 5,000 lives globally, leading to a summit where us roboticists and government groups will discuss how robots can help curb the disease's spread. in november, experts will share research on robots like 'little moe' that kills germs and 'parcelcopters' that deliver aid. nine potential roles include mortuary robots, detection and disinfection robots, telepresence robots, and humanitarian relief robots. the summit will be co-hosted by texas a&m university, the white house of science and technology policy, worcester polytechnic institute, and the university of california, berkeley. the us army has already tested autonomous military trucks and drones for use in crisis situations. robots are being proposed for various roles, such as mortuary assistance, waste handling, and logistics. examples include drones, autonomous food trucks, and disinfectant robots like 'violet' from the university of pennsylvania medical center. robots could be particularly useful in addressing potential health risks for human workers, as well as improving communication and logistics in affected areas.
851	energy secretary steven chu, a nobel laureate in physics and former director of the lawrence berkeley national lab, is resigning from president barack obama's cabinet. chu, 64, came under fire for his handling of a $528 million federal loan to solar panel manufacturer solyndra, which went bankrupt in 2011, resulting in the loss of 1,100 jobs. however, he will also be remembered for his accomplishments, including helping to plug a massive bp oil spill in the gulf of mexico and boosting renewable energy production. chu announced his resignation in a letter to obama, who praised him for his unique understanding of the challenge of climate change and the opportunities of clean energy. his departure follows those of interior secretary ken salazar, environmental protection agency chief lisa jackson, and jane lubchenco, head of the national oceanic and atmospheric administration. potential successors for chu include former north dakota senator byron dorgan, former michigan governor jennifer granholm, and former washington governor christine gregoire. gregoire, who has worked on nuclear waste issues for decades and was an early supporter of obama, was praised by chu in his resignation letter. chu defended his handling of the solyndra loan in a testy hearing in late 2011 but faced criticism from congressional republicans for missing warning signs and approving a restructuring that put private investors before taxpayers in case of default. the white house has not made any decisions on replacements for the environment and energy jobs and emphasized that obama's priorities will remain unchanged. during his tenure, chu helped move the country toward energy independence and expanded support for bright engineers and entrepreneurs pursuing energy innovations.
852	a dachshund-pit bull mix named rami, with a "pit bull head on a dachshund body," was found wandering and has become a social media sensation after being posted on the moultrie-colquitt county humane society's facebook page. with over 2.4 million hits, rami's energy, sweet demeanor, and difficulty listening have garnered attention, but potential adopters face a rigorous testing process to ensure a suitable home. the humane society hopes rami's fame brings attention to other animals on their page, with the expectation of his adoption by next week.
853	luke shaw had a standout performance for manchester united in their 3-1 victory against leicester city, highlighting his potential to become a united legend and potentially surpassing the achievements of denis irwin, united's second most decorated player and beloved left back. at just 19, shaw has the time to surpass irwin's 529 appearances for the club, but must focus on staying fit and improving defensively. shaw struggled with fitness issues earlier in the season and acknowledges the criticism from louis van gaal, but has since learned from his mistakes. he has shown promise, but needs to work on scoring goals and physically develop to reach irwin's level. despite these areas for improvement, shaw is on the way to becoming a dominant force at left back for united and england.
854	a 900-year-old norse love letter may have been uncovered after a phd student deciphered the jötunvillur code, which dates back to the 9th century and is believed to contain the message "kiss me." the carving, discovered in sigtuna, sweden, was written in cipher runes and is one of around 80 such inscriptions found in northern europe. the jötunvillur code involves replacing the runic character with the last sound of its name, but its ambiguity makes interpretation uncertain, and it may have been used as a teaching tool rather than for secrecy. researchers believe the vikings may have used it to memorize rune names or as a puzzle for others to solve.
855	vogue has released original casting polaroids of three victoria's secret models: doutzen kroes, behati prinsloo, and sigrid agren, taken when they first attempted to appear in the fashion magazine. these images, taken between 2003 and 2007 and showcased on vogue.com, depict each model looking fresh-faced and wearing minimal makeup during their initial photoshoots, wearing plain black tops or t-shirts. doutzen kroes, behati prinsloo, and sigrid agren all walked the victoria's secret runway this year, with kroes making her debut in 2003, prinsloo at 16 in 2003, and agren in 2007 at 16. the polaroids contrast greatly from the models' runway appearances during this year's victoria's secret show, where they wore extravagant underwear and wings. kroes recalled feeling nervous during her first meeting with vogue, while prinsloo was already a successful model when she attended her first casting. agren, the youngest of the three, was shy and happy to be in new york when she first attended her casting for vogue.
856	model yuliana avalos is suing match.com for $1.5 billion, along with thousands of others, accusing the dating site of using their photos without consent in fake profiles. the group, including famous actors, military personnel, and facebook users, claims match.com broke copyright laws and committed fraud. avalos' lawyer used facial recognition software to find over 200 profiles using her picture. match.com, which ranks as the second-largest dating site with 96 million registered users and 1.4 million active profiles, is accused of maintaining a large pool of members by creating fake profiles. the lawsuit seeks $500 million in damages and $1 billion in punitive damages. match.com, launched in 1995 and owned by iac, has not commented on the allegations.
857	a woman whose brother killed their mother and then committed suicide in september 2012 accused mental health doctors of neglect after an inquest revealed that they had diagnosed him as "dangerous and psychotic" but did not make a formal diagnosis or provide additional support. mark tyler, 37, shot and killed maureen tyler, 79, at their home in cray's hill, essex, and took his own life four days later. the coroner recorded a verdict of unlawful killing for maureen tyler and ruled that mark tyler took his own life. tyler's sister, jesse haggar, stated that mark's mental state was more serious than depression and that her mother believed she could cope. the family expressed disappointment in the system's failure to address their concerns about mark's mental health and prevent the tragic event. an investigation is ongoing at south essex partnership university nhs foundation trust.
858	cyprus faces imminent bankruptcy and the closure of its banks, as russia failed to provide a rescue and germany and the european central bank (ecb) demanded steep reforms and the imposition of a tax on bank deposits for a bailout. europe is accused of intentionally destroying the cypriot banking system for their benefit, while the cypriot president chairs crisis talks for a solution. the orthodox church offered assets to help and measures like exchange controls, creating a "bad bank," and nationalizing pension funds are under consideration. the eu leaders faced criticism over their handling of the situation.
859	jen arnold, a reality tv star of "little couple," has revealed that her uterine cancer was caused by a non-viable pregnancy, which has now spread to her lungs. despite her shock and despair, arnold remains hopeful and is undergoing intensive chemotherapy for stage 3 choriocarcinoma. the cancer, which is caused by abnormal cells left behind after a pregnancy, was not responding to treatment due to her dwarfism and small airway, leading to a hysterectomy as a last resort. arnold and her husband, bill klein, have a 3-year-old adopted son, will, and recently brought home their second adopted daughter, zoey, when arnold began experiencing bleeding. the diagnosis came as a surprise, as arnold had a history of fertility issues that were documented on the show. choriocarcinoma is an uncommon but curable form of cancer that typically responds to chemotherapy. however, doctors were uncertain about how much chemotherapy to administer due to arnold's size and limited experience treating the disease in a person with skeletal dysplasia. the couple, who met online and married in 2009, have documented their efforts to start a family on tlc's "little couple" since their wedding.
860	new delhi has banned uber after a woman was allegedly raped by one of its drivers, shiv kumar yadav, who was previously acquitted of rape charges three years ago. uber stated that there are no defined rules in india for background checks for commercial transport licenses and is working with the government to address the issue. the victim managed to note the driver's number and take a photograph of his car. police accused uber of failing to check the driver's criminal record or have a satellite location device in his car. the assault occurred two years after the gang rape of another young woman on a public bus, which led to nationwide protests and stricter laws against rape. india is listed as the fourth most dangerous place for women taking public transportation, with delhi having an average of 40 cases of crimes against women reported daily, including at least four rapes. critics are calling for more conversation and engagement with taxi drivers to address prevalent patriarchal attitudes towards women. uber has recently faced criticism in the us over driver screening and has apologized for comments from an executive regarding journalists. however, the company has continued to raise investment, valuing it at $40 billion.
861	george pataki, the former governor of new york, says the transition from public life to private citizen was not difficult for him, as he refused to let his public title define his personal identity. after leaving office in 2006, pataki went back to normal activities like waiting in line for a hot dog at madison square garden. in contrast, the pope's resignation was a shocking event, as he is the first to resign in nearly 600 years. his deteriorating strength was cited as the reason for his decision. experts emphasize the importance of a clean exit in the corporate world, where stepping down from a leadership role is uncommon, but necessary if the leader can no longer execute the job effectively. effective leadership requires mental sharpness and finely tuned skills. since leaving office, pataki has been practicing law, focusing on energy and environmental issues, spending time at his farm, and occasionally appearing on the political stage. the pope is expected to retire to a monastery for prayer and reflection.
862	"meryl streep had initial reservations about bringing "doubt," a film based on a tony award-winning play, to the big screen due to its minimalist nature and absence of children. however, her awe for the young actors portraying the students in the movie changed her mind. her co-stars, viola davis, amy adams, and philip seymour hoffman, express admiration for streep. davis, whose performance is generating oscar buzz, drew on personal experiences to bring her role as a mother to life. hoffman, who plays the accused priest, downplayed the sexual abuse allegations angle, emphasizing the play's exploration of doubt and passion. adams, who takes a darker turn in this movie, hopes for streep and davis to receive oscar nominations but keeps her expectations in check for herself. the film, set in 1964, examines a nun's suspicion of a priest's relationship with a student and touches upon political themes. director john patrick shanley views "doubt" as an examination of the passionate nature of doubt, challenging the perception of it as weak."
863	basle celebrated their elimination of liverpool from the champions league by mocking the team on social media. fabian frei scored the opening goal, and lazar markovic was sent off for liverpool. brendan rodgers looked dejected as liverpool was knocked out. basle posted an instagram picture showing a battered liverpool player being held up by chelsea and tottenham players, referencing previous wins against these teams. peperami and other accounts also made fun of liverpool and their disappointing season. steven gerrard and raheem sterling looked down after the match, and markovic was shown a red card for aiming a flailing arm at basle's behrang safari.
864	a 2013 article by andrew levy notes that children's use of text speak, which includes abbreviations and acronyms for quick messaging, creates a language barrier between them and older generations. nearly 90% of parents and teachers reported having difficulty understanding texts or emails from children and students. popular terms include "rfd" (after), "omg" (oh my god), and "lol" (laugh out loud). michael gove, the education secretary, plans to encourage a more formal use of english grammar in schools. the survey showed that 25% of primary school children and 93% of secondary school students go to school with a mobile phone, contributing to the spread of text speak in popular culture. the article also reported an incident where prime minister david cameron mistakenly thought the acronym "lol" meant "lots of love," when it actually means "laugh out loud." overall, the article warns that text speak could undermine academic standards and make it challenging for students to understand formal english.
865	on january 13, 2012, in northumberland, uk, concerned residents reported feeling buildings shake and hearing loud rumbling, suspected to be a minor earthquake. however, the british geological survey later revealed that the cause was a "sonic event" from a pair of military jets flying overhead, as evidenced by vapor trails and seismic activity recorded in the area. reports included descriptions of a rumbling sound and whole houses shaking. the police received numerous calls but reported no injuries or damage. the raf confirmed that two jets were in the area at the time, and the vicar of berwick described being shaken by the experience.
866	the obama administration is preparing a comprehensive sanctions package against iran in case diplomatic efforts to curb its nuclear program fail, according to top officials. thetreasury under secretary, stuart levey, who developed some of the existing financial sanctions against iran, addressed a senate banking committee hearing and said the new plan would target iran's vulnerabilities and impose "serious costs" if it thwarts international demands. the united states will avoid actions that harm the iranian people or undermine the opposition. some members of congress are pressing for tougher sanctions against iran following the revelation of a new uranium enrichment facility near qom. the administration's engagement with iran aims to secure international support for sanctions if necessary. an international coalition is crucial in applying pressure on iran, and levey emphasized that financial measures are most effective when imposed as part of a broad-based effort. several lawmakers expressed skepticism about iran's good faith in negotiations and are planning to introduce new legislation imposing financial restrictions, oil and gas sector sanctions, and bans on gasoline exports and iranian goods. the administration will evaluate iran's commitment to the negotiations based on their actions in shipping uranium out of the country and admitting iaea inspectors to the qom facility.
867	serbia's prime minister ivica dacic expressed his certainty that serbia will become the european union's next member, aiming to join the political and economic bloc following slovenia and croatia. serbia's economy, which contracted 1.7% in 2012, has been affected by high unemployment (25%) and an exodus of skilled workers seeking opportunities abroad. eu membership offers access to funding for infrastructure projects and poorer regions, although dacic downplays the financial aid aspect. the process of accession can be slow, with croatia joining only in 2013 after talks started in 2005. serbia also faces challenges, including the unresolved issue of kosovo's independence, which plunged the region into war 20 years ago. resolving political tensions with kosovo is seen as key for attracting foreign investment and boosting the economy.
868	manchester city advanced to the last 16 of the europa league with a 4-0 win over porto on aggregate, following a 2-1 first-leg advantage. in a double boost for manager roberto mancini, carlos tevez apologized for his three-month standoff and withdrew his appeal against a fine, allowing him to focus on playing football again. city fielded a strong team and scored early through sergio agüero, while porto rarely challenged joe hart in goal. the portuguese champions had rolando sent off late in the game, and city sealed their victory with additional goals from david silva and david pizarro. manchester united, also 2-0 up on aggregate against ff ajax, will join city in the next round but will be without wayne rooney for their match.
869	this article discusses the importance of the thyroid gland and its role in regulating various functions in the body. it highlights that up to 27 million americans may have thyroid issues, with hypothyroidism being more common than hyperthyroidism. symptoms of hypothyroidism include sleepiness, fatigue, loss of memory, dry skin, goiter, gradual personality change, weight gain, sensitivity to cold, and hair loss. hypothyroidism is treatable with hormone replacement therapy. hyperthyroidism, less common than hypothyroidism, occurs when the thyroid produces too much hormone, causing symptoms such as irritability, fatigue, weight loss, and tremors. hyperthyroidism can be treated through surgery, anti-thyroid medications, or radioactive iodine. regular thyroid testing is recommended for individuals over 35, and those at higher risk, including pregnant women and those with family history of thyroid problems, need more frequent testing.
870	cnn marks the 20-year anniversary of poland's solidarity movement's election victory over the communist party with a week of programming called "the new poland." this includes live coverage from fionnuala sweeney in cities across poland, such as warsaw, krakow, and gdansk, as well as reports from cnn correspondent frederik pleitgen on the political, cultural, social, and economic changes in poland over the past 20 years. the programming includes special features on gdansk, catholicism in poland, business in poland, and polish cuisine. a documentary, "autumn of change," retrospectively looks at the events leading up to the election, featuring narratives from key players within the solidarity movement, the communist leadership, cnn reporters, and polish civilians. cnn's coverage will also be complemented by an interactive companion site featuring narratives and personal experiences submitted by viewers.
871	the royal veterinary college reported a significant increase, over 80%, in facelift surgeries for bulldogs and pugs in the past four years. this surge is believed to be influenced by their increased popularity among celebrities like jonathan ross, kelly brook, and kelly osborne. these procedures, which can cost up to £2,000, help prevent blindness and airway blockages. senior lecturer dr. gert ter haar and senior vet paul manktelow both confirm the importance of these surgeries for the animals' health and well-being. dr. ter haar performs up to five procedures weekly when medically necessary. the issue stems from the breeding processes that have led to facial muscle shortening, causing eye folds and respiratory issues. although not vanity procedures, they are crucial for certain breeds, such as shar-peis, to maintain optimal health.
872	coleen rooney gave birth to her second son, klay anthony rooney, at liverpool women's hospital on may 20, 2013. she and her husband wayne were excited to welcome their new addition to the family, joining their firstborn son kai. coleen and wayne left the hospital together, with coleen carrying balloons and her louis vuitton suitcase. proud father wayne shared the first family photo on twitter, and coleen also announced the birth on her account. the couple's family and friends, including daniella o'hara, alex gerrard, sheree murphy, and ed sheeran, sent congratulations. coleen and wayne's families visited them at the hospital, and coleen's due date had passed earlier in the week. they announced the baby's gender in december 2012 and revealed they were hoping for a large family. wayne, who faces uncertainty about his future at manchester united and has requested a transfer, is expected to captain england against the republic of ireland in a friendly on may 22, 2013.
873	apple announced that the 25 billionth song was downloaded on itunes on wednesday, making it a major milestone for the tech giant since the launch of the ipod in 2001 and itunes in 2003. the lucky downloader was philip lupke from germany, who will receive a €13,528 itunes gift card. the 25 billionth song was "monkey drums (goksel vancin remix)" by chase buch, a british dj and producer. apple has hit other significant milestones with itunes, including the 25 millionth ("let it snow! let it snow! let it snow!" by frank sinatra), 100 millionth ("somersault (danger mouse remix)" by zero 7), 500 millionth ("mississippi girl" by faith hill), and 1 billionth ("speed of sound" by coldplay) downloads. the 10 billionth download was "guess things happen that way" by johnny cash. itunes has sold over 350 million ipods, is available in 119 countries, and offers over 26 million songs for sale. the 25 billion download figure is roughly equivalent to three-and-a-half songs for every person on earth and surpasses other notable milestones such as "white christmas" by frank sinatra and michael jackson's "thriller." google play store hit 25 billion downloads for android apps in september 2020.
874	a new report reveals that requests by immigration and customs enforcement (ice) for detainers, used to hold individuals in prison prior to deportation proceedings, have declined by nearly 40,000 requests per year since 2012. the biggest reductions occurred in california and texas, where detainer requests decreased by 55% and 28%, respectively. speaker of the house john boehner refused to rule out a government shutdown as a means to block president barack obama's upcoming changes to the immigration system, which could grant residency to up to 5 million undocumented immigrants. obama's plans, expected to be announced as soon as next friday, will expand the deferred action for childhood arrivals program and may also include parents of u.s. citizen children. a government shutdown could not be ruled out by boehner, who aims to stop the president from violating his oath of office and the constitution.
875	in a remarkable match at old trafford, manchester united secured a 3-0 win over liverpool. united's goalkeeper, david de gea, made two crucial saves from mario balotelli while looking in the opposite direction, while brad jones of liverpool was wrong-footed for both united goals. jones did not have a terrible game, but liverpool created the better chances and failed to convert any. liverpool played good football at times, but were plagued by individual mistakes and mistakes in defense. the brazilian midfielder philippe coutinho was criticized for a lack of diligence in tracking wayne rooney, who scored united's second goal. michael carrick was exceptional in defense for united, while liverpool struggled to improve and looked uncertain. steven gerrard, liverpool's captain, looked resigned after the defeat, with his contract issue at anfield adding to the uncertainty surrounding his future with the club.
876	prosecutors in the trial of former new england patriots player aaron hernandez are seeking to prove that he orchestrated the execution-style murder of odin lloyd. along with a missing murder weapon, a crucial piece of evidence is the shoes hernandez is believed to have worn during the crime, which have gone missing. these shoes, identified as nike air jordan xi retro low and creative recreation cesario low top sneakers, have been confirmed to match the prints found at the crime scene. investigators first encountered these shoes during searches of hernandez's home in june 2013, but failed to take them into evidence at the time. now, more than two years later, during trial preparations, investigators are seeking a search warrant to look for the shoes once again. if the jury learns of this missed piece of evidence, they may question the competence of the investigation and the credibility of the case against hernandez.
877	a group of british soldiers from b squadron of the kings royal hussars based in afghanistan created their own version of lmfao's hit song "i'm sexy and i know it," titled "i'm squaddie and i know it." the video, which has received over 1,800 hits on youtube, shows the soldiers lip-syncing and re-creating the scenes from the original music video while wearing makeshift camouflage "speedo" trunks and testicular guard cup protectors. they wiggle through the dance routine topless in the desert heat and recreate famous moves, inspired by the original video in which the band dance through the streets flexing their muscles. the video was filmed at their camp in afghanistan during operation herrick 16, and features bystanders looking shocked and soldiers posing in bras. the kings royal hussars are set to return to the uk on november 10, 2012. the video was directed by lance corporal murphy and corporal cocker of the kings royal hussars.
878	real madrid coach jose mourinho has announced the departures of midfielder guti and legendary forward raul from the spanish giants. guti, who made his first-team debut at the age of nineteen and has won five la liga titles and three champions league titles with real madrid, will join turkish side besiktas. the midfielder, who has been linked with a move to the turkish club for some time, is reportedly considering an offer from besiktas, where former real madrid coach bernd schuster is now in charge. raul, real madrid's all-time leading scorer, is expected to join schalke, according to recent quotes from the german side's manager felix magath. mourinho is also reportedly trying to sign liverpool midfielder steven gerrard and chelsea defender ashley cole, as well as portuguese defender ricardo carvalho, who has expressed his interest in rejoining mourinho at real madrid. mourinho has already brought in angel di maria from benfica and sergio canales from racing santander.
879	cnn recognized ten extraordinary individuals as its 2013 heroes for their efforts to make a positive impact on the world. these heroes include dale beatty, who helps disabled veterans through purple heart homes, georges bwelle, a doctor providing healthcare in the jungles of cameroon, robin emmamons, creating an oasis of fresh produce in a 'food desert' in charlotte, north carolina, danielle gletow, granting wishes for foster kids, tawanda jones using dance to empower camden youth, richard nares helping sick kids get to chemotherapy appointments, kakenya ntaiya opening the first primary school for girls in her native kenya, chad pregracke cleaning up america's rivers, estella pyfrom bringing computers to children in need, and laura stachel, who created a solar-powered suitcase to help ensure safe childbirths in developing countries. each hero was awarded $50,000 and organizational training from the annenberg foundation, and chad pregracke was named cnn hero of the year, receiving an additional $250,000 for his cause. the tribute show, hosted by anderson cooper, featured celebrity presenters and performers, including ne-yo, jim gaffigan, sarah silverman, kelly ripa, michael strahan, jason biggs, alan cumming, josh lucas, mariska hargitay, shay mitchell, allison williams, jeffrey wright, and sara bareilles.
880	donald sterling, the nba's banned and controversial clippers owner, is reportedly battling cancer according to multiple sources. the 80-year-old was diagnosed with prostate cancer several years ago and has been fighting the disease while also taking expensive treatments to keep himself alive. the revelations came on the same day that images of sterling in his underwear were released by a former mistress, alexandra castro. sterling was banned from the nba earlier this week following the release of recordings where he made racist comments to his girlfriend, v. stiviano. nba commissioner adam silver also recommended that the board of governors vote to force sterling to sell the team. sterling has a history of making racist remarks and refusing to pay for medical procedures, as seen when he refused to pay for former clippers assistant coach kim hughes' surgery for cancer. sterling's former friends and family members have spoken out about his naked behavior and abusive tendencies towards his son, scott, who died of a drug overdose last year at the age of 31. since the news of his racist statements broke, sterling has reportedly been holing up in a penthouse away from his malibu mansion for fear of being recorded, but he has also been spotted dining out at a local restaurant. the clippers are reportedly in negotiations for sterling to give an interview to barbara walters, and potential buyers such as david geffen, oprah winfrey, and magic johnson have expressed interest in purchasing the team. other establishments, such as the bunny ranch brothel in nevada, have banned sterling following the scandal.
881	a 200-year-old gold and enamel automaton silkworm, studded with seed pearls, rose diamonds, and rubies, is expected to fetch up to £200,000 at auction by sotheby's on wednesday. known as the 'ethiopian caterpillar,' it was made around 1810 by swiss watchmaker henri maillardet for the chinese imperial court. thehidden clockwork mechanism drives tiny wheels on its underside, mimicking the movement of a real-life caterpillar. the rare automaton is one of only six or seven known to exist, with five held in european collections and one at the patek philippe museum. it was titled 'ethiopian caterpillar' during an exhibition in london in 1811, where it was accompanied by the 'egyptian lizard' and 'siberian mouse.' the automaton is part of sotheby's 'treasures: princely tastes' sale of 49 items, including a pair of louis xvi ivory vases, a medal cabinet made for napoleon, and a rock crystal vessel featuring portraits of pope clement vii and alessandro de medici.
882	gus poyet is optimistic that connor wickham can develop into a full england international after the striker signed a new contract with sunderland, following speculation about a possible summer departure. wickham, 21, joined sunderland from ipswich town in 2013 for £8million but only secured a regular starting place this season, having spent much of last year on loan in the championship. poyet wishes he had spent more time with wickham when he arrived and regrets the big-money transfer may have come too soon in his development. wickham, who has won 17 caps for the england under-21 side, has been praised for his maturity and improvement under poyet's guidance.
883	a video has surfaced showing an iraq war veteran and off-duty cop, neal auricchio jr., being viciously beaten by three philadelphia flyers hockey fans after the winter classic game on monday. auricchio, a new york rangers fan and former marine, went to the hospital with a concussion and injuries to both eyes after the attack outside of geno's steaks in philadelphia. the altercation began when a man in a flyers #28 claude giroux jersey hit auricchio, who was wearing a rangers #24 ryan callahan jersey. auricchio tried to fight back but was quickly overpowered by two other flyers fans. the incident went viral online, leaving auricchio angry and upset. the men involved in the attack are still at large, and police have posted the video on youtube to help identify them. auricchio received a purple heart for his services in iraq, and even returned after being shot in the leg. woodbridge mayor john mccormac condemned the attack, calling it "unacceptable behavior" towards a "good, decent young man who's truly a war hero."
884	three sisters, ohoud al-najar (34), kahlood al-najar (36), and fatima al-najar (31), from the united arab emirates were attacked in a plush london hotel room while they were asleep. the sisters were visiting london for sightseeing and shopping when philip spence (32) entered their rooms at the cumberland hotel with the intent to steal. he was joined by thomas efremi (58), who allegedly conspired in the burglary. the attack began when spence entered kahlood's room, demanding money, and then beat her around 30 times with a hammer, leaving her unconscious. fatima was awakened by her sister's screams and tried to intervene, resulting in her own brutal beating. the third sister, ohoud, was also attacked in her adjoining room and sustained injuries so severe that she had to have a section of her brain removed and could not testify in court. the attack left the sisters with fractured skulls and terrible injuries, while their children looked on in terror. the prosecutor described the incident as a sustained and vicious attack with an intention to kill. spence and efremi were both arrested and charged. the sisters had spent the day before the attack sightseeing at buckingham palace and the london aquarium before retiring to their hotel rooms. they had no previousconnection to the defendants. the trial continues.
885	according to neuroscientist daniel amen, there are scientifically proven differences between male and female brains that explain various behavioral tendencies. women have more brain cells in the pre-frontal cortex, leading to better planning and packing skills, impulse control, and emotional sensitivity. men, on the other hand, have bigger amygdalae, which process fear and anger, making them more swift to anger. additionally, women's brains have more white matter connecting various brain regions, allowing them to multitask and process emotions. females also have a larger amount of grey matter in areas related to empathy, making them more intuitive and sensitive to the emotions of others. however, intuition can be compromised by factors like stress, hormones, and lack of sleep. despite these differences, both sexes are equally intelligent, just using different brain regions to solve problems or achieve goals.
886	a pensioner in nottingham, uk, caught traffic wardens removing snow from double yellow lines to issue parking tickets during a heavy snowfall in 2010. the elderly man, anthony wilkinson, documented the incident with his camera and cctv footage, leading to an 18-month campaign to get the council to admit that the tickets should not have been issued. the council initially denied the wardens' wrongdoing but later confessed that the enforcement was "not fair or accurate" and the fines were cancelled. the incident raised concerns about a potential culture of deceit and disdain for the public among parking industry employees. nottingham city council no longer uses the private firm nsl, which employed the wardens, and now enforces parking regulations with its own staff. the council stated that civilian enforcement officers must be able to see lines and windscreens to issue tickets, but traffic wardens were not given incentives or targets, which is against the law.
887	dr. john g. sperling, the founder of the university of phoenix and the institute for professional development, has passed away at the age of 93 in a san francisco hospital. sperling was a pioneer in making higher education accessible to working adults through his for-profit university, which became one of the largest in the us with over a million students, alumni, faculty, and employees. he served in the us army air corps and worked as a history professor before founding the institute for professional development in 1972 and the university of phoenix in 1978, which was one of the first to develop online degree programs. sperling is survived by his longtime companion, ex-wife, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren.
888	the article reflects on the infamous 1919 world series and the chicago white sox team, who were accused of throwing the series for gamblers. it highlights a news report by james crusinberry from the chicago tribune, published during the series, that hinted at suspicious play by the white sox. despite there being no television, radio, or social media to disseminate information back then, crusinberry's reporting shows that a skilled reporter could still spot and document games being thrown in real-time. this raises the question of whether such an act would be possible in today's heavily scrutinized sports world, given the numerous cameras, media outlets, and technology available to uncover any suspicious activity.
889	boris becker, the former world number 1 tennis player and current coach of novak djokovic, was seen at the us open with a large lump on his left elbow, which appeared to be causing him discomfort. the lump, which was nearly the size of a tennis ball, did not stop becker from practicing or coaching djokovic, who had an impressive win at the tournament. the origin of the lump is unknown, as becker is a right-handed player, leading some to speculate it may not be related to tennis elbow. the condition typically causes pain and inflammation around the elbow from overuse and lasts between six months and two years. becker and his wife were also seen relaxing in queens, new york, enjoying some downtime away from the tennis courts.
890	in the excitement of germany's world cup victory over argentina, several players' wives and girlfriends (wags) joined them on the pitch to celebrate. andре шуррле was emotional, weeping into the arms of his girlfriend montana yorke after scoring the assist for the winning goal. joachim low, the manager, also hugged the players' partners. mats hummels and benedikt howedes shared intimate moments with their girlfriends. sarah brander and mandy capristo watched their boyfriends bastian schweinsteiger and mesut ozil play, while lena gercke, girlfriend of sami khedira, was unable to watch due to her boyfriend's injury. ann-kathrin brommel and yorke waited anxiously for their men, gotze and шуррle, to come on as substitutes before celebrating their victory. the women joined the players in singing 'championes' upon returning to their hotel.
891	britain may experience "brownouts" causing household lights to dim during extreme cold weather this winter due to power shortages, according to the national grid. the gap between electricity demand and supply will be at its lowest level in eight years, with recent coal-fired power station closures for eu carbon targets contributing to the problem. the national grid has emergency plans including paying factories to reduce consumption and bribing energy firms to switch on backup power stations, as well as potential voltage reduction, or brownouts. brownouts can not only dim lights but also interfere with electronic equipment, computers, and electric clocks. the energy crisis has been exacerbated by fires at power stations, as well as defects leading to the shutdown of four nuclear reactors. the government and national grid guarantee no homes will lose power altogether. the calculations of power supply assume the return of currently offline nuclear reactors and wind turbines, and energy analysts warn this may be overly optimistic.
892	xi jinping, born in 1953, is expected to assume various top leadership roles in china, starting with being named general secretary of the communist party during the 18th congress and becoming president in march 2013. xi grew up in privileged circumstances but experienced hardships during the cultural revolution, which influenced his perspective on china and the world. his father, a revolutionary hero, had connections that proved beneficial to xi's career, including a role in establishing china's economic reforms. xi's leadership experience in economically advanced regions has prepared him to promote the development of the private sector and trade. however, his ascension has been marked by speculation regarding his health and factional infighting. xi is considered a nationalist but aims to maintain good relations with the west. the upcoming communist party congress is anticipated to provide insight into china's political direction, and the new leadership, including xi, will face pressure to address widespread corruption.
893	a set of 200-year-old tunnels that were used to hold french prisoners during the napleonic wars in plymouth, devon, have been put up for sale for £19,000. the interlocking subterranean chambers, which were originally a moat, were later bricked over and used as air raid shelters during world war ii. the current owner, the tapper family, purchased the tunnels from the ministry of defense in the 1950s and used them to store fishing equipment. the 60ft tunnels, which have signs warning of their historical significance, have now been entered into online auction by bradley estate agents for use as a '0 bedroom investment property'. the former prison cells are in a restricted area and are likely to be used for storage or personal recreation, such as a workshop. the buyer may also consider a change of use for a commercial venture but residential use is unlikely due to the location and restricted access.
894	a new study reveals that nearly half of today's british children have not used public transport by the age of 11, and over three-quarters have their own mobile phone. the children are described as being "gadget-obsessed" and spending hours in front of screens, with more than one in six spending at least three hours daily on television or computers. social media is a significant part of their lives, with communication with friends more likely to be virtual than face-to-face. the study also found that only about half of boys and less than a third of girls are allowed to make journeys on their own, and around a quarter of parents do not allow any unsupervised time with friends. the findings indicate a shift towards reliance on cars for travel and a growing divide between screen time and physical activity. additionally, the study revealed tensions within families, with frequent battles and disciplinary actions taking place. despite these concerns, previous research suggests that the behavior of 11-year-olds is giving little cause for concern, and many reported being happy with their lives. the study, which tracks 13,000 british children born in 2000, 2001, or 2002, provides a snapshot of changing childhoods.
895	brazil is known for having larger portion sizes, especially when it comes to its barbecue tradition called churrascaria. originated in the southern part of brazil, this tradition involves wranglers bringing various types of meat skewered and grilled to your table. churrascarias offer a wide range of cuts, including picanha, baby beef, alcatra, filet mignon, and lombo (pork loin), each cooked to different levels of doneness. known for high-quality meat and unique flavors, churrascaria's meatapalooza attracts visitors from around the world. among the most popular cuts, picanha is considered the star, with baby beef being a close second. picanha is a premium rump cap cut, juicy and tender, while baby beef comes from younger cows and is more tender and lean. each establishment offers a diverse selection of meats tailored to individual tastes, offering a truly unique and flavorful culinary experience.
896	two rusting vintage cars containing six bodies were discovered in oklahoma's foss lake, reigniting the mystery of three teenagers and three other people who disappeared decades ago. highway patrol officers found a 1969 camaro with the remains of jimmy allen williams, 16, thomas michael rios, 18, and leah gail johnson, 18, inside. in another car, a 1950s chevrolet, were the remains of three people identified as a 69-year-old man from elk city and his two friends, who went missing in the early 1960s. authorities are confident that the remains in the camaro are those of the missing teenagers and are using dna from their families to confirm their identities. the discovery of the cars and bodies came as a shock to investigators who were testing the new sonar detection system in the lake. the investigation is ongoing, with the medical examiner's office expected to use dna to positively identify the remains, providing closure to families who have been waiting for answers for decades.
897	the fukushima daiichi nuclear plant in japan has seen a notable increase in radiation levels in its water storage tanks and pipes. tokyo electric power company (tepco), which is responsible for the clean-up, stated that only one drop of contaminated water escaped, and no significant leak is expected. the highest radiation reading was 1800 millisieverts per hour, but tepco noted that the radiation was mainly beta radiation, which dissipates quickly and can be shielded. tepco will investigate the cause of the issue and take appropriate measures to ensure the safety of workers. the public was reassured that the exposure levels were not dangerous due to the weak nature of beta radiation. tepco is looking for outside help to stabilize fukushima and studies have found minimal health risks from contaminated tuna. japan is also considering freezing the ground to prevent further contamination.
898	philip kettle, a morbidly obese bus inspector from romford, weighed 31st 7lb (457 pounds) at his heaviest due to unhealthy eating habits over two decades. he faced daily embarrassment and health concerns, including a 60-inch waist and high blood pressure, which put his life and his relationship with his grandson at risk. after receiving warnings from doctors and enduring stares from commuters, kettle decided to make a change and join weightwatchers. he replaced daily english breakfasts, carb-loaded sandwiches, and snacks with healthy salads, fruit, and vegetables, while weekly weigh-ins kept him accountable. he also began walking everywhere and no longer uses a car for short journeys. with a new commitment to health, kettle dropped 17st (238 pounds) and now weighs 14st 7lb (197 pounds). his blood pressure is normal again, and he's off medication. kettle is thrilled with his transformation and no longer feels self-conscious. he walks 26 miles for charity and even earns admiring glances from others.
899	john muir's description of rivers as thrilling and vital to our beings contrasts with the current apathy towards them, as we no longer travel or visit them frequently. however, there are still individuals who cherish rivers, valuing adventure and experience over efficiency. through submissions to cnn's change the list project, over 89 people shared their personal stories and photographs of their favorite rivers, including the hudson, yangtze, and kings river. the compilation of these stories aims to save rivers from becoming invisible and at risk, as many have dried up or become polluted, such as the colorado, rio grande, and mississippi. the piece advocates for the importance of sharing and honoring the stories of these precious waterways to raise awareness and prevent further harm.
900	six british servicemen, including four amputees, completed a row across the atlantic ocean from the canary islands to barbados as part of the talisker whisky atlantic challenge, raising £1million for wounded comrades. they endured grueling conditions with no running water, comfortable bed, or toilet for two weeks and developed sores from exposure to sea salt and the tight grip on the oars. the journey was reminiscent of their experiences in iraq and afghanistan, and they took turns sleeping and ate 800-calorie freeze-dried meals. when the boat's desalinator broke, they rationed their snack packs for 14 days and relieved themselves into the sea. after 92 days at sea, they were welcomed by cheering crowds and former servicemen. the crew, composed of amputees and able-bodied crew members, faced challenges related to their injuries, with one member having to learn to walk again and another having to add socks to his prosthetic to keep rowing. queen elizabeth ii sent a message of support.
901	biohackers in california have developed a lab-grown vegan cheese using yeast, vegetable butter, and water. they engineered cheese protein genes based on cow dna and grew them in baker's yeast to create a 'milk' substitute. this milk can be churned traditionally to make real vegan cheese, which is said to be healthier and more sustainable than conventionally produced cheese, as it has no animal products and reduces the carbon footprint. the genetically modified yeast creates cheese protein as it grows, which is then extracted and combined with other main cheese ingredients to create vegan milk. the first steps include taking genetic sequences inspired by cow dna and creating cheese protein genes that function in yeast. next, the startup company muufri plans to produce cow-free milk, utilizing artificial, lactose- and cholesterol-free milk made from scratch, aiming to have the product ready by july 2015. by creating an alternative pathway to cheese, the biohackers believe they are helping the environment and increasing access to delicious and healthy food, while removing ethical concerns associated with using animals for large-scale food production.
902	a 14-year-old british boy named kieran maxwell, who lost his leg to cancer and fell while carrying the olympic torch, is determined to become a paralympian in gymnastics. he is currently halfway to raising £25,000 for a new prosthetic limb to help him pursue his dream of competing in the rio de janeiro 2016 games. kieran, from bishop auckland, county durham, took up acrobatic gymnastics to build strength for carrying the torch and was inspired by the london 2012 paralympians. he underwent chemotherapy and had his left leg amputated below the knee in march 2012 due to a rare and aggressive form of cancer called ewings sarcoma. the uk's biggest lottery jackpot winners, chris and colin weir, bought him a new lighter limb after witnessing his bravery during the torch relay. kieran is now aiming to win the national championships in 2013 and is working on learning more advanced acrobatic moves. his family and supporters, including the weirs, are proud of his determination and resilience.
903	hope solo, goalkeeper for the us women's national soccer team, has been suspended for 30 days following an incident at training camp. the reason for the suspension was not disclosed, but it comes after her husband, jerramy stevens, was arrested for driving under the influence last week. solo was a passenger in the car at the time of the incident and was nearly arrested for disorderly conduct. the suspension means solo, 33, will not participate in upcoming european matches. domestic violence charges against solo from a 2014 incident were dismissed. the us team is preparing for the world cup, which starts in june, and solo's absence may impact their preparations. she will be eligible for reinstatement after the suspension, pending review by us soccer and head coach jill ellis.
904	a father, tariq mushtaq, donated 20% of his liver to his critically ill son, muhammad ali tariq, who was diagnosed with liver disease at nine weeks old. the father's liver will grow with the son and eventually become a replica of the original organ. the transplant, which took place on december 6, 2013, was a success, and both are recovering well. tariq underwent a rigorous two-month process to prepare for the surgery, while his wife was a "brave one" throughout the ordeal. the father and son have formed a unique bond and look forward to enjoying activities they couldn't do before muhammad ali's condition.

breivik, has been criticized for not being formally classified as an extremist right-wing group, limiting the capacity of the police to gather intelligence on its members and activities. the norwegian 906	david cameron, the british prime minister, has ruled out forming a coalition government with the uk independence party (ukip) in the future. with the latest polls suggesting that the conservatives may not gain an outright majority in the commons at the next election, cameron is reportedly considering forming a minority government instead. if the conservatives are the largest party but do not have enough mps for a majority, senior tories believe cameron would prefer this option to a coalitions with the lib dems or ukip. ukip is targeting up to 25 seats in the next election and is offering to support a minority conservative government in exchange for a swift and fair eu membership referendum. however, cameron has dismissed the idea of a coalition or any arrangement with ukip, stating that 'never, ever' would he form a coalition with them.
907	a pair of bigfoot hunters, matthew whitton and rick dyer, claim to have discovered the body of bigfoot, a supposed half-man, half-ape creature, in a wooded area in georgia. the carcass is reportedly over 500 pounds and 7 feet, 7 inches tall. the hunters are not disclosing the location of the discovery to protect the remaining creatures. skepticism has been expressed by scientists, including tom nelson, a university professor specializing in mammalogy. the hunters plan to unveil dna and photo evidence of the discovery in california and have begun dna tests and scientific studies on the body. new species being discovered is acknowledged by scientists, but the idea of a family of 7-foot-tall creatures eluding hunters, hikers, and development for so long in the region is questioned given its proximity to civilization. the creature is described as male, with reddish hair, blackish-gray eyes, human-like feet, hands, and teeth.
908	sambany, a man from madagascar, lived with a massive tumor on his neck for four decades. the tumor, which weighed over a stone and was twice the size of his head, was finally removed in a 12-hour surgery by mercy ships, a charitable organization. sambany, who is around 60 years old, had first noticed the swelling in his 20s, and the size of the tumor caused his head to lean in one direction and put pressure on his heart. after learning that mercy ships had docked a vessel in toamasina, sambany and his grandson walked for three days to reach the crew seeking help. the surgery was a challenging one, as the team had never before dealt with a tumor of that size. sambany expressed his happiness and willingness to undergo the operation despite the risks. following the successful surgery, sambany was delighted to see himself in the mirror and was able to sit up in bed and play cards with his grandson. he will remain on the ship to recover. mercy ships, which operates the africa mercy hospital ship, provides free surgery and medical care to individuals in some of the poorest countries in the world.
