909	the top 10 highest-paid players in this year's world cup, based on weekly wages at club level, have been identified. wayne rooney of manchester united tops the list with an estimated £300,000 weekly wage before tax. lionel messi of barcelona comes in second with £292,000 after tax. cristiano ronaldo of real madrid earns £288,000 after tax. van persie of manchester united and yaya toure of manchester city both earn £230,000 weekly, while sergio aguero of manchester city and luis suarez of liverpool make £220,000 each. david silva of manchester city earns £200,000, eden hazard of chelsea earns £185,000, and fernando torres of chelsea earns £175,000. these players have significant endorsements from major sponsors, including nike, adidas, puma, and pepsi, among others. rooney's huge net worth is estimated to be over £60million, while messi, ronaldo, and van persie have all been named the best footballer in the world multiple times. their immense talent and popularity translate into lucrative contracts and endorsements, making them some of the highest-paid players in the world.
910	lemeul mantey, a papaya farmer in ghana's farming community of nsawam, strives for the best harvest with careful planning and weed control. ghana was once a major exporter of papayas but now focuses on pineapple production. as agricultural labor and input costs rise, agricultural survivors like mantey must adapt smart business practices to sustain their livelihoods. malindube kombase, regional director of mobile business clinic, provides training to help agribusiness entrepreneurs improve their business skills and collaborate with each other to form clubs and share knowledge. this approach could lead to diversification of crops and an overall stronger agricultural sector in ghana. some farmers, such as anthony korkuvi and pig farmer nii daniel, have used the training to gain confidence, expand their operations, and seek external investment. kombase encourages investors to support businesses with solid corporate governance structures, emphasizing the potential benefits for the agricultural industry and food security.
911	robert boscawen, a second world war hero and distinguished parliamentarian, has passed away at the age of 90. boscawen, who represented wells and later somerton and frome in parliament for over 20 years, was awarded the distinguished military cross for his efforts in the battle to relieve arnhem in 1944. he was severely injured by a german shell, leaving him with burns to his face and body. after recovery, he volunteered with the british red cross in hamburg, germany, in the late 1940s. he was eventually elected as an mp in 1970 after two previous unsuccessful attempts in 1964 and 1966. boscawen, the eldest son of lord falmouth, also held notable positions in the royal household and the privy council. born in 1923 and shaped by world war ii, boscawen died peacefully on december 28, 2022, on the isle of wight. tributes have been paid to the respected politician, known as bob to his friends, who leaves three children. a funeral service for boscawen will be held at wells cathedral on january 16, 2023. donations in his memory can be made to the coldstream guards charitable funds in lieu of flowers. in 1944, field marshal bernard montgomery proposed a daring plan to break through german lines at arnhem, in holland, dropping paratroopers miles behind enemy lines to create a path for british armored forces. though the attempt failed to achieve its objective, boscawen, then a tank commander, played a critical role in the effort.
912	jenni reflects on her childhood memories of her mother and grandmother constantly knitting, passing on the trait to her own children until they reached teenage years. now, with adult sons ed and charlie, and without grandchildren, jenni has started knitting for her chihuahuas, butch, madge, and frida. despite chihuahuas not being built for the cold british weather, jenni believes they make adorable companions who don't demand or express disapproval like children. inspired by debbie bliss's dog knitting patterns, jenni rediscovered her love of knitting and created sweaters for each of her pets. the process brought back her skills and brought joy to both jenni and the chihuahuas, as they received compliments from fellow dog walkers.
913	the russian economy is facing severe challenges with the collapse of the ruble and low oil prices, which is causing hardship for its citizens and increasing tension between russia and the west. vladimir putin, russia's president, will likely blame the west for russia's problems and try to bolster support at home by making russians feel besieged. this could result in increased tensions and potentially dangerous conflicts between moscow and western powers. russia's neighbors, such as the baltic states and sweden, are on high alert due to russian military maneuvers and have increased their military readiness. putin is in a corner and may consider starting a new military crisis to deflect attention from economic troubles at home. the russian people are starting to waver in their support for putin, but he has few good choices and this should concern the rest of the world.
914	a high-speed pursuit across south-east queensland and northern new south wales resulted in the arrest of two men, aged 20 and 32, following the theft of three vehicles at gunpoint. the men allegedly fired shots at police after their car was stopped using road spikes near the tugun tunnel on the pacific motorway. a 32-year-old man is accused of shooting at an officer and a passing car, but the gun was knocked out of his hand when his car was struck. both men were charged with multiple offenses including attempt murder, shooting with intent to murder, and discharging a firearm to avoid arrest, among others. the chase began in caboolture, where police attempted to pull over a reportedly stolen car, and the pair allegedly hit an officer with their vehicle and stole two more cars at gunpoint before driving through the streets of queensland and nsw at high speeds. the second vehicle contained a woman and a child who were demanded to be removed before the car was stolen. the 4wd was eventually ditched, and the men stole a third car, a blue mitsubishi lancer, before being arrested in tweed heads. both men have been refused bail and are expected to appear in tweed heads local court on friday. police in both queensland and new south wales expect to lay further charges.
915	ed miliband endured a disastrous day of interviews on "good morning britain" and local radio, during which he was criticized for being out of touch and appearing tired. in his first interview, he struggled to answer a question about how much his family spends on groceries per week, and when pressed further, he gave an incorrect answer. in the second interview, he failed to identify the labour leader of swindon council, adding to his embarrassment. the conservative party seized on these blunders, branding miliband a "champagne socialist" with no understanding of the struggles of ordinary people. miliband's cost-of-living campaign has faced criticism recently, including for a misleading attack ad, and he has been under pressure as polls put the conservatives ahead for the first time in two years. his appearances on television and radio came on the final day of campaigning for european and local council elections.
916	the supreme court declined to hear appeals from families of two elementary school students who claimed their first amendment rights were violated when school officials prohibited them from distributing religious-themed gifts at school events. the students, jonathan morgan and stephanie versher, had handed out decorative pens and tickets to a passion play, respectively, which contained religious messages. a federal appeals court had previously ruled that school officials could not be sued under the "qualified immunity" legal standard, even though their constitutional rights were violated. the litigation continues on other aspects of the cases, which occurred in the plano independent school district in texas nine years ago. the judges noted the difficulty of balancing students' free-speech rights with the establishment clause and the impact on the educational mission of the school. the students' constitutional rights were not shed at the schoolhouse door, but administrators have the authority to restrict activities causing substantial disruption. the high court has previously dealt with church-state disputes by allowing religious displays in public places. the texas-based liberty institute represented the families in their appeals.
917	three women were rescued from a house in london after being held captive for over 30 years. they are among an estimated 5,000 people being held as slaves in the uk, according to andrew wallis, ceo of the charity unseen. victims are forced into domestic servitude or committed crimes, and are often held in fear and abuse by their captors. cases of slavery in the uk, particularly those involving organ harvesting, are increasing. the suspects in the lambeth case are being investigated for immigration offenses as well as slavery. victims often face long-term care and support to recover from their traumatic experiences. criminal gangs profit greatly from human trafficking and slaves have little means of communication or trust in authorities. notable cases of slavery in the uk include the convictions of an irish traveller father and son for forcing men into servitude and the morecambe bay disaster, which exposed the exploitation of illegal immigrant workers for cheap labor and resulted in the deaths of 23 people in 2004.
918	lady carnarvon, the owner of highclere castle where "downton abbey" is filmed, revealed that the christmas day depicted in the itv drama was much calmer than the real-life chaos. she blogged about her staff being given the day off and the resulting mess, including poorly washed plates, incorrectly set tables, and her dogs chewing the tv remote. lady carnarvon criticized her husband's attempt at washing up as "not completely diligent," and guests were also reprimanded for neglecting to prepare the breakfast table properly. her husband denied the criticism in a later interview.
919	nigel farage, the uk independence party (ukip) leader, is facing criticism for his past remarks supporting the privatization of the national health service (nhs) and expressing preference for an insurance-based healthcare system. the footage of his remarks from a 2012 tour was recently obtained by the guardian, which will be damaging to ukip's efforts to reposition itself as a party committed to public opinion regarding the nhs. in a separate development, a ukip governor was forced to resign from a secondary school after the headteacher objected to his political affiliation and concerns over the party's policies on immigrants. farage has not ruled out the possibility of a deal with labour for an in-out eu referendum but indicated he would be reluctant to join a formal coalition. his remarks have drawn responses from both conservative and labour parties, with conservatives warning that a vote for ukip would lead to labour winning the may 2015 election and labour refusing to speculate on any deals.
920	a mentally ill and homeless former marine, jerome murdough, died in an overheated jail cell at rikers island more than two months ago. murdough, 56, suffered from schizophrenia and bipolar disorder and was taken into custody for sleeping in a public housing project during one of the coldest winters in new york city history. he was found unresponsive in his cell, which had overheated to at least 100 degrees due to a malfunctioning damper. the medical examiner is conducting further tests to determine the cause of death. murdough's family described him as a giving and kind person during a modest funeral in queens, where they remembered him as a proud marine and a source of pride. they also called for justice and expressed their pain over his death, emphasizing that they had not seen him for years. officials have disciplined the warden, mechanics supervisor, and correction officer involved, and the department of correction plans to reform the city's jails under its new commissioner. jerome murdough, a native of queens, joined the marine corps right out of high school and served from 1975 to 1978 as a field artillery batteryman. the marine corps did not respond to a request for comment regarding a military funeral for murdough. advocates for the mentally ill criticized the criminal justice system for its handling of people with mental health issues.
921	during the final stages of the tour de france 2012, the wives and girlfriends of bradley wiggins and chris froome engaged in a public spat over froome being ordered to slow down to help wiggins maintain his lead. michelle cound, froome's girlfriend, criticized his treatment on twitter, leading to a back-and-forth with catherine wiggins. peta todd, mark cavendish's partner, also weighed in with a supportive comment about froome. the tension did not appear to affect wiggins, who maintained a two-minute-and-five-second lead going into the final stage and expressed support for froome. wiggins, a three-time olympic gold medalist, had spoken in his autobiography about his troubled relationship with his australian father, also a road racer. wiggins became the first british rider to win the tour de france.
922	energy company british gas, a subsidiary of centrica, announced profit projections of £602 million after gas use soared 19.7% during the cold winter, despite raising prices by 6% in december and millions of families facing soaring energy bills. angry shareholders criticized the 'premiership football'-style pay of ceo sam laidlaw, who earns £36,000 per week after tax and holds additional lucrative roles, at yesterday's annual general meeting. shareholders accused centrica of being one of the 'evil big six' energy firms and demanded an explanation for laidlaw's additional roles and enormous salary. consumers and pensioners also expressed concern over rising energy bills and their impact on affordability and potential health risks. british gas's 16 million customers have seen their tariffs double in the past seven years, with the average dual fuel bill in 2022 being £1,188, which increased by around £70 following the december price hike. the company stated it would use the higher profits to keep prices lower during the rest of the year. centrica faced criticism for not adequately addressing the concerns of customers and for focusing on profits.
923	a terminally-ill young mother, kayleigh duff, who is battling terminal liver cancer, had her dream of having a hen party come true last weekend. her friend sarah holness organized a hen do for her at the popular "only way is essex" hotspot, sugar hut in brentwood, essex. kayleigh, 23, from herne bay, kent, was diagnosed with bowel cancer in june 2012 and underwent surgery. however, the illness spread, and she was told she will never be fully rid of it. despite the diagnosis, kayleigh remains determined to make the most of her remaining time and recently fulfilled her desire of getting married to a male model. she enjoys taking every day as it comes and devoting as much time as possible to her son, kai. the mother-of-one, who had to quit her job as a kitchen assistant, says the chemotherapy makes her worse and has limited mobility. kayleigh's dad, lee, died from the same genetic disorder, familial adenomatous polyposis (fap), at the age of 37. kayleigh's friend sarah organized the hen party, allowing her to enjoy a fun night out with friends at sugar hut.
924	luis enrique's tenure as barcelona's new coach began with a win in the trofeo colombino, with gerard deulofeu impressive in his debut. deulofeu, a 20-year-old masia graduate on loan from everton, started alongside lionel messi and scored the first goal of enrique's reign. he showcased his dribbling skills and ability to unlock defenses, with a low strike setting up joan roman for the winning goal. deulofeu also drew a foul from dimas, resulting in a yellow card. former barcelona defender marc bartra lifted the trophy after the match. joan roman, ibrahim afellay, and alen halilovic were among the standout performers for barcelona in the first half, with halilovic attracting interest from top european clubs. enrique's team played a more fluid style than last season and looked in fine form, with jordi masip having a few shaky moments in goal. ibrahim afellay, despite not having a role to play at barcelona this season, impressed as a second-half substitute. barcelona's all-masia graduate squad defeated recreativo huelva to win the trophy, with enrique making eleven changes at halftime. deulofeu and afellay will hope their performances are a sign of things to come as barcelona aim for silverware under their new coach.
925	the us ambassador to nato, ivo daalder, has stated that the alliance has no plans for military intervention in the syrian crisis, as the violence continues with at least 60 people killed over the weekend and the diplomatic efforts to end the conflict failing. daalder said that no nato member has requested military intervention and that the situation in syria is different than libya, where a military intervention was successful, due to the intermingling of security forces and civilians. on the same day, at least 76 people were reportedly killed, including 40 in the city of hama. the un estimates that at least 9,000 people have been killed since the crisis began in march 2011, while opposition activists put the number at over 11,000. the syrian government reported burying 18 security forces who died in battles against "armed terrorist groups." access to the region is restricted for international media, making it difficult to independently verify the reports. the peace plan brokered by former un secretary-general kofi annan has not stopped the violence.
926	scientists at nasa have released a new detailed map of the earth's surface beneath the ice of antarctica, named bedmap2. the map is an update of the previous bedmap created over a decade ago and contains 25 million more data points, providing insights into the surface and sub-ice features that were previously unseen. the new map is crucial for climate change researchers as antarctica plays a significant role in the global climate system, affecting ocean currents and raising sea levels. with the more accurate map, scientists can better predict how antarctica will react to future climatic conditions as it covers 98% of the continent and contains more than half of the world's fresh water. the ice sheet is not static but constantly flows outwards, and knowing the bedrock depth and ice thickness allows for more accurate simulations of ice movements and predictions for the future. bedmap2 was created using decades of research, data from the british antarctic survey, satellite images, and aircraft flyovers.
927	u.s. defense secretary leon panetta downplayed the impact of a new poll showing that 69% of americans want u.s. troops out of afghanistan, stating that the u.s. government will continue with its strategy in the country to prevent terror groups like the taliban and al-qaeda from regaining power. panetta made these comments during a defense summit in ottawa with canadian and mexican officials, where the three countries pledged to collaborate more on security issues, specifically in the area of countering drug cartels on the continent. mexican military officials presented a sobering assessment of the drug war, emphasizing the need for increased patrols, inspections of shipping containers, and intelligence sharing.
928	a doctoral student, emily brewer, helped deliver a stranger's baby at a bus stop on the university of north carolina at chapel hill campus after the woman's waters broke and went into labor. brewer, who has a two-year-old son, dylan, stayed calm and helped the woman, who spoke no english, by placing her on the bus stop bench, calling 911, and following the dispatcher's instructions to help with the delivery. the mother, aguilar lopez, was taken to the hospital along with her infant daughter, named emily, who was named after brewer by her mother who thought she was an angel. brewer later visited lopez and her newborn in the hospital and was grateful for the experience.
929	russian prime minister vladimir putin criticized the united states at a youth camp, calling them a "parasite" on the world economy and accusing them of living beyond their means. putin also expressed concerns about dollar dominance and the potential threat it poses to financial markets. his comments came as there was speculation that the u.s. could have its aaa credit rating downgraded. putin, who has often criticized u.s. foreign exchange policy, noted that russia holds a significant amount of u.s. bonds and treasuries. tensions between the u.s. and russia soured during putin's previous presidency but have improved since then. putin's attack on the u.s. came as lawmakers there passed an eleventh-hour bill to raise the debt ceiling and avoid a default. despite the passage of the rescue package, there was criticism from both sides of the aisle and fears that america's credit rating could still be downgraded. putin did not specify whether he plans to stand aside for his protege and successor, president dmitry medvedev, in upcoming elections. his popularity remains high, but his united russia party is trying to reverse a slide in popularity before parliamentary and presidential polls. putin's visit to the nashi youth group's summer camp was part of a string of appearances meant to gauge support in the run-up to the elections. young people at the camp, which was created by the kremlin to counter popular dissent, were vocal in their support for putin.
930	john sundahl, a pilot who dated britney spears in 2007 and helped her fight her alcohol addiction, was killed by the taliban in afghanistan last week while flying near kabul. sundahl, 44, met spears at alcoholics anonymous and warned her that her drinking could be fatal. they dated for a brief time but remained friends. according to reports, sundahl was seeing spears again in the summer of 2014. spears is described as being devastated by the news of sundahl's death and has yet to make an official comment. sundahl, who was expatriated to the united states and buried in a buddhist ceremony in los angeles, had been working in afghanistan flying dignitaries in and out of the conflict zone. his brother karl described him as trying to help the country.
931	andrew nisbet, a 31-year-old golf instructor from livermore, california, has been arrested and charged with 65 counts of pedophilia for allegedly sexually abusing at least two boys over a three-year period. the allegations came to light when one of his students reported the abuse in november. nisbet, who also operated the grip junior golf academy, is accused of performing oral sex on his victims in his car and showing them pornography on his phone. he was arrested on the golf course on the day before he was to receive the pga's 2013 junior golf leader award. police believe there may be many more victims and are investigating the possibility that nisbet abused children in other states due to his extensive work with youth golf over the past eight years. nisbet, who was a top-50 us kids golf master teacher in northern california, had previously worked at various golf courses in alabama, michigan, and mississippi. neighbors have reported detectives at his home, which is next to an elementary school. nisbet's wife has not commented on the allegations.
932	the financial conduct authority (fca) is investigating allegations of foreign exchange rate rigging by traders, with claims that bank staff are making trades before processing customer orders and timing them to influence benchmark rates. this comes after the libor rate-fixing scandal, which resulted in heavy fines for barclays and rbs. the £3trillion a day foreign exchange market is not regulated but is supervised by the fca. allegations include traders "front-running" client orders and manipulating wm/reuters foreign exchange rates, affecting the value of funds and financial instruments. a spokesman for the fca confirmed the probe but couldn't comment further. additionally, the energy sector is facing investigations into oil, petrol, and biofuel price manipulation, with bp and royal dutch shell having their offices raided, and questions raised over collusion to boost profits and potentially push household bills higher.
933	russia's football association (fa) is facing financial difficulties and has not been able to pay national team manager fabio capello his salary for the past five months, according to executive committee member sergey stepashin. capello, who signed a contract worth over £7million per year to manage russia until the 2018 world cup, has been a key figure in the team's recent successes, guiding them to their first world cup appearance in 12 years in 2014. however, they had a disappointing campaigns in the 2014 world cup, finishing last in their group. the fa is now searching for "financial benefactors" to cover capello's wages. capello, who has also managed top european clubs such as real madrid, juventus, ac milan and as roma, took over as russia manager in 2012.
934	in the bundesliga, bayern munich overcame borussia dortmund 2-1 at the allianz arena, with marco reus giving dortmund the lead before robert lewandowski and arjen robben turned the game around. dortmund remained third bottom despite a strong performance. in the english premier league, ayoze perez scored the only goal as newcastle united defeated liverpool, while eden hazard's late penalty gave chelsea a 2-1 win over queen's park rangers. real madrid topped la liga after a 4-0 win over granada, with james rodriguez scoring twice. atletico madrid rallied for a 4-2 victory over cordoba, while barcelona were upset by celta vigo. in serie a, juventus stayed three points clear with a 2-0 win over empoli. elsewhere, everton and fulham drew, west brom beat leicester city, and stoke and west ham played out a 2-2 draw. title contenders manchester city face manchester united in the premier league, and real madrid and sevilla both have a chance to take the lead in la liga. messi failed to equal the la liga goalscoring record as barcelona lost to celta vigo.
935	a washington d.c. woman named phoebe connolly was biking in the columbia heights area when she was punched in the face by a group of teenagers playing the "knockout game." she was not seriously injured but said the teens laughed after the attack. authorities are investigating the incident as a simple assault. similar incidents have been reported in new york, new jersey, illinois, and missouri. in new york city, a 78-year-old woman was attacked while pushing her great-granddaughter's stroller and a russian woman was punched on the back of the head. nypd commissioner ray kelly is investigating the recent attacks to determine if there is a trend. other incidents include a photography intern from israel who was punched in the face by a group of teenagers in brooklyn and an orthodox jewish man who was attacked in brooklyn, also in the name of the knockout game. police have not yet seen solid evidence of a trend but continue to investigate.
936	larissa westcott, a 20-year-old college student from windsor, was determined to pursue a career as cabin crew with british airways. she had an interview at the airline's headquarters at heathrow airport, but her dreams were dashed when interviewers learned she had a small tattoo of her star sign, 'aquarius, on her foot. although she believed the tattoo would be covered by the tights in the cabin crew uniform, she was dismissed from the interview after only 20 minutes despite looking the part. westcott believes british airways needs to modernize their standards and was humiliated by the experience. british airways maintains their uniform policy is clearly stated during the application process.
937	french president francois hollande mourned the deaths of five people, including four french soldiers and an afghan interpreter, in a suicide bombing in kapisa province, afghanistan. hollande expressed gratitude to the troops and promised a national tribute and repatriation of the wounded. he also announced the accelerated withdrawal of combat forces, with the first withdrawals starting in july and completion by the end of the year. the taliban claimed responsibility for the bombing, which took place in the nijrab district's pul-i-khwaja bazaar area, where french troops have been operating. hollande recently visited the region and expressed commitment to ensuring the troops' security during the transition. additionally, isaf reported the death of a service member in a roadside bombing in eastern afghanistan, but did not provide further details.
938	stephen strassen, a disabled pizza chef from lincolnshire, is suing his county council for tens of thousands of pounds after his false leg snapped off and became embedded in his stump following a fall into a large pothole. the 52-year-old, who lost his limb in a car crash, was on his way to the corner shop when he tripped into the 2ft deep crater, which had formed after weeks of heavy rain. the impact of the fall was so severe that his stump was split to the bone, requiring surgery to treat the resulting infection. mr. strassen, who has been unable to work and confined to a wheelchair since the accident three months ago, is now suing the council for maintenance negligence, but they have denied the claim. the council spokesperson expressed sympathy for mr. strassen but denied the claim based on standard legal principles. mr. strassen led an active lifestyle before the accident but can no longer wear a prosthetic leg on the wounded limb. he and his wife, who is the family's primary breadwinner, have not received any communication or apology from the council.
939	a russian zenit-3sl rocket, carrying an american communications satellite named intelsat 27, failed 40 seconds after takeoff from the odyssey launch platform in the pacific ocean on friday. the cause of the failure is believed to be an error during the first stage of flight, resulting in the rocket's engines shutting off automatically due to incorrect trajectory. the search is ongoing for the downed rocket, and the company, sea launch, expressed disappointment and offered apologies to intelsat and bssi. this unfortunate event adds to the reputation concerns for russia's space industry, following the recent failure of the meridian satellite launch in 2020.
940	former washington d.c. mayor marion barry's jaguar was impounded after he caused a car accident on saturday due to a "hypoglycemic attack," which left him with more than $2,800 in unpaid traffic fines. the tickets, which date back to 2012, include violations for driving on the wrong side of the road, expired tags, no insurance, failing to show current tags, and running a red light. barry, 78, also has a history of legal issues, including a 1990 arrest for smoking crack cocaine. his son, christopher, was arrested on monday for driving with a revoked license and possession of synthetic marijuana, adding to the family's legal troubles.
941	england is preparing for the second installment of their rbs six nations campaign against italy at twickenham on saturday. after a victorious 21-16 game against wales, england, who have never lost to italy, are aware of the need for patience and focus to secure a win, given their close encounter two years ago. the english team, led by chris robshaw, has had a productive week in training. andy farrell, forwards coach, emphasized on the importance of mental preparation and staying focused during each game, emphasizing that the performance will unfold naturally and it's crucial to influence the game accordingly. farrell also acknowledged that having more "x-factor" players at their disposal doesn't guarantee success and that forwards' contributions are essential to bring out the team's flair. overall, england aims to go into the match with the right mindset and execute their plans effectively.
942	clint dempsey scored the fifth fastest goal in world cup history, just 29 seconds into the usa's opening game against ghana. however, the former fulham and tottenham forward sustained a suspected broken nose from a flying boot by ghana's john boye during the first half. dempsey initially left the pitch to receive treatment but returned with a significantly enlarged nose and tissue stuffed in his nostril. the goal was the only one of the game, marking the usa's first victory over ghana in world cup history. dempsey's goal came after ghana made a mistake in their opening passes, and he picked up the ball following a throw-in and finished with a low left-footed shot. despite the injury, dempsey was able to continue playing. lebron james wished dempsey well after the game, assuring fans that the key usa player would be "fine."
943	dr. phil's syndicated talk show has been renewed for its 15th season through 2016-17, which will cover 77% of the country. the show is broadcasted on 13 cbs-owned stations, including those in major markets like new york, los angeles, and chicago. dr. phil expressed his excitement about the partnership with cbs and mentioned his passion for the work the show is doing. with this renewal, the show is given the endorsement to continue telling compelling stories for years to come. kate winslet is currently in talks for a role in "divergent." the article was originally published on ew.com. free trials of entertainment weekly are also offered.
944	ed vaizey, a culture minister and close ally of prime minister david cameron, has criticized the british government's "presumption in favor of development," stating that it artificially inflates housing demand estimates. vaizey warned of potential overdevelopment in the countryside and thousands of unwanted homes under new planning laws. in a letter to nick boles, the planning minister, vaizey expressed concern that these changes could alienate traditional conservative supporters and cost votes, particularly in oxshire where projected housing needs are up to three times the actual demand. vaizey suggested reviewing the planning methodology to obtain more accurate housing projections and questioned the lack of infrastructure planning by developers. boles defended the push for new housing due to high house prices and affordability issues, but acknowledged some misconceptions in vaizey's arguments, stating that the new assessment of housing need did not automatically invalidate local housing plans and confirmed that building on the green belt should be exceptional. vaizey, who represents the vale of the white horse district, disagreed with the national methodology for estimating housing needs in oxshire, claiming that the estimated 100,000 new homes are unnecessary, and raised concerns about declining services due to delayed infrastructure development. councils, including west oxfordshire, have expressed their disagreement with the official housing projections and may challenge them. prime minister cameron defended the planning changes, emphasizing the increase in housing applications and house building. he also refuted the notion that all councils are blocking housing developments and denied claims of nimbyism.
945	a toy named "start your senses zebra" under the bright starts brand, which is marketed as an educational toy and sold at major retailers including tesco, asda, mothercare, and amazon, has been recalled due to the presence of a cancer-risk dye called 4-aminoazobenzine or aniline yellow. this dye, used in products like computer printers, insecticides, paint, and varnishes, is prohibited in toys meant for babies to chew or have skin contact. the chemical caused a tragedy in 1981 when a criminal gang in spain sold olive oil contaminated with it, sickening 20,000 and killing 400. parents are advised to stop using the toy immediately and destroy it, and retailers have issued recalls. recall uk, a website that tracks product recalls, noted that many recalls have limited success rates and highlighted challenges in tracking the product owners to alert them. the manufacturer, kids ii, an american company, advised parents to contact their uk office for a refund.
946	a couple in rural pennsylvania, andrew and patricia colberg, are being sued by billboard company oliver outdoor advertising over their protests against a brightly lit sign near their home. the couple's complaints have allegedly driven away six advertisers, resulting in a claimed loss of $50,000 for oliver. the colbergs contacted 18 of the billboard company's clients and complained to local officials about the lights affecting their sleep. however, no legislation can help them regarding the existing sign, installed in 2012, as it only regulates future ads. in response, the colbergs plan to counter-sue, requesting removal of the billboard and compensation for legal fees and aggravation. their attorney, gregory swank, believes oliver's case lacks merit and the colbergs have not interfered with their business. oliver's attorney declined comment.
947	miami dolphins guard richie incognito will remain suspended for the rest of the nfl season, including the playoffs, due to a bullying scandal, but he is still eligible for playoff shares according to a person familiar with the situation. incognito, who is in the final year of his contract and was suspended on november 3, has allegedly bullied teammate jonathan martin with racial slurs and threats against his family. coach joe philbin declined to comment, but the team released a statement saying incognito would maintain his suspension during the investigation. incognito filed a grievance to rejoin the team, but later withdrew it. coach philbin has led the dolphins to a 5-2 record since martin left the team and they are two wins away from the playoffs. incognito's teammates, led by quarterback ryan tannehill, have shown resilience in the face of the scandal.
948	jaime lerner, the former mayor of curitiba, brazil, is known for leading an urban revolution in the city, which has been recognized as one of the most innovative in the world. lerner emphasizes the importance of political will, a good strategy, and co-responsibility in transforming cities, giving the example of paying fishermen to clean the bay as a win-win solution. he believes any city, regardless of scale or budget, can improve its quality of life in three years by focusing on key issues such as mobility, sustainability, and social diversity. lerner advocates for a multi-modal transportation system that includes cars, but emphasizes they should not compete for the same space. he attributes the improvement of curitiba's quality of life to its focus on children, starting with teaching them about garbage separation, which led to a high rate of separation in the city since 1989. lerner emphasizes the importance of mixed neighborhoods and views cities as solutions rather than problems. he also advocates for a shift from "ego-architecture" to "eco-architecture" and places a strong emphasis on beauty being a result of a city that is committed to its future and its people.
949	argentine prosecutor alberto nisman, who was found dead in his home on sunday with a gunshot wound to the head, had expressed fears for his safety before his disappearance. damian pachter, a journalist with the english-language buenos aires herald, was the first to report nisman's death and claimed he was followed by unknown people on friday. nisman was scheduled to testify before congress on monday about his allegations that president cristina kirchner and her government shielded iranian officials accused in the 1994 bombing of a jewish community centre in buenos aires, which left 85 people dead. investigators are unsure if nisman's death was a suicide, homicide or an "induced suicide" and have not ruled out the involvement of others. kirchner denied the allegations and claimed that nisman was murdered to implicate her. pachter, who had not expressed his concerns to his employer, left the country on saturday, and calls and emails to him were not returned. kirchner claimed on her facebook page that nisman's death was part of an operation to tarnish her government's reputation and offered no evidence to support her theory. nisman had accused the argentine government of agreeing to swap grain for oil with iran in exchange for the withdrawal of interpol arrest warrants for the suspects in the bombing. the argentine government's rapprochement with iran was opposed by jewish community leaders at the time and criticized as unconstitutional. argentina generally has a free press, but reporting on government officials and corruption remains a risk for journalists.
950	a new video of warren weinstein, a maryland man kidnapped by al-qaeda in pakistan two years ago, has been released, showing him begging for release and expressing his fears of being forgotten. weinstein's family, including his wife and daughters, have revealed their heartbreak and continued efforts to secure his release, but are unsure what to do. the video is the first since two released in september 2012, and shows a visibly aged weinstein, who previously worked as an economic developer. weinstein appeals directly to president obama for help and expresses deep anxiety for his family, who have shared photos and expressed the difficulty of explaining his captivity to young children. the demands for weinstein's release included an end to airstrikes in certain countries and the release of prisoners from guantanamo bay. despite efforts to authenticate the video, it is unclear if the us government will meet the demands for weinstein's release.
951	on monday, october 26, in napa, california, 21-year-old kevin michael hagan was arrested for burglarizing the home of house minority leader nancy pelosi while she was in washington, dc for the presidential election. the break-in occurred on zinfandel lane near st. helena, and pelosi's absence was a fortunate coincidence for the thief, as he also admitted to burglarizing six other homes in the previous week. the burglary was discovered at around 2:50 pm when authorities arrived after an alarm was tripped, revealing smashed glass at the front door and pool house. the suspect was later apprehended and found in possession of a watch taken from pelosi's residence. pelosi, who had been a representative since 1987 and served as speaker of the house from 2007 to 2011, was running for re-election from her heavily democratic san francisco district and was expected to win.
952	a romanian pimp named marcel vasile, 36, was recently jailed for 15 years after being convicted of rape, trafficking, and controlling prostitution, five years after he bought a woman from traffickers and forced her into sex work in the uk. vasile, described as a 'calculating, menacing character' with little regard for women, had previously been on the run from a sex trafficking case in spain. he had bought the victim, a 23-year-old woman, from bogdan and marius nejloveanus, a father-and-son duo also from romania, in early 2008. the nejloveanus had previously trafficked six women to the uk, including the victim, who were forced to work in massage parlors in manchester. vasile raped the victim and made her work in london's massage parlors after she resisted their exploitation. the nejloveanus were jailed in 2011, but vasile remained at large until last year when manchester detectives brought him back from spain using a european arrest warrant. he had previously been convicted of sex trafficking in romania in 1996. the woman had escaped from vasile and returned to romania but was too scared to press charges at the time, allowing him to go free. the manchester police began investigating him in 2008 and were able to identify him using his fingerprints, which led them to his real name from the romanian authorities.
953	portugal has the highest percentage of female millionaires globally at 23.8%, followed by the philippines (21.0%), peru (18.3%), and hong kong (18.0% among the top 10. the netherlands, belgium, and new zealand have the least with 5.9%, 6.0%, and 6.3% respectively. the us, canada, australia, russia, mexico, saudi arabia, and japan have lower percentages. the study reveals gender inequality in wealth distribution, with asia leading the way in gender equality due to its emerging markets. countries like the netherlands, belgium, and new zealand, assumed to have a fairer distribution, surprisingly ranked lower. the uk sits 15th globally and 10th in europe, with 11.4% of female millionaires. the research suggests female entrepreneurs yield more revenue with less investment and urging support for women in business.
954	a senior executive at korean air, cho hyun-ah, has been charged with threatening the plane's safety and other offenses after she demanded the removal of a flight attendant who served her macadamia nuts in a bag instead of on a dish on a december flight from new york to south korea. cho, a senior vice-president at the airline, caused the flight to taxy back to the terminal and delay its departure by 11 minutes. she could face up to 15 years in prison if found guilty of the four charges she faces, including violating aviation security law, obstructing a government investigation, using violence against flight crew, and forcing the flight's purser off the plane. cho's father, the chairman of korean air, called her behavior "foolish" and said she would resign from her executive roles, adding to her humiliation. south korean media criticized cho's actions, and the incident touched a nerve in a country where family-run conglomerates often act above the law.
955	a wildfire in central california, named the hunters fire, has grown to 1,300 acres over two days in fresno's central foothills. firefighters are working to contain it, using both ground and air resources. officials urged some residents east of lake mcclure in mariposa county to evacuate due to the threat of the flames growing larger. the cause of the fire is under investigation, and it has already injured five people, including one inmate firefighter, and destroyed three buildings. in a dry year like this, california has seen 1,700 wildfires, triple the amount from the same time last year. in northern arizona, the slide fire between flagstaff and sedona continued to grow, reaching 32 square miles by tuesday, despite firefighters establishing a containment line. investigators are working to determine the fire's cause, which has received approximately 80 tips, but the investigation could take months. both fires have presented challenges due to the dry conditions and difficult terrain.
956	a new report reveals concerning statistics about the mathematical abilities of student teachers, with nearly half of a class at griffith university in queensland lacking the skills to pass a year 9 naplan test. dr. stephen norton, the lecturer in mathematics, tested all 125 students in the graduate diploma of education program, discovering that over half couldn't answer basic math questions, such as converting distances or currencies, and only 16% could convert temperatures from celsius to fahrenheit. more worryingly, only one in five were able to answer questions involving algebra or proportional reasoning. dr. norton expressed his frustration over the results, noting that his students should have mastered these skills by the end of primary school. the findings have again highlighted the need for an investigation into mathematics education at both the school and university levels.
957	according to recent studies, three times as many children in wales have tried e-cigarettes compared to those who have smoked tobacco. six percent of 1,601 pupils aged 10 and 11 in wales have tried e-cigarettes, whereas only two percent had smoked tobacco. additionally, 14% of children who had tried e-cigarettes admitted they might start smoking compared to only two percent of those who hadn't. concerns have been raised that e-cigarettes could be acting as a 'nicotine gateway' for children, leading them back to more harmful cigarettes. the battery-operated devices, which resemble pens or cigarettes, contain liquid nicotine and are used by an estimated one million britons trying to quit smoking. however, health experts caution that they are not recommended for children or non-smokers due to the lack of sufficient research into their long-term health impacts. health minister for wales, mark drakeford, and penny woods, chief executive of the british lung foundation, have expressed concerns about the potential impact of e-cigarettes on children and the possibility of them re-normalizing smoking.
958	during the 1982 world cup, claudio gentile of italy man-marked diego maradona with fouls, committing 23 against him as italy won 2-1. thirty-two years later, at the 2014 world cup, fernandinho of brazil repeatedly fouled james rodriguez of colombia to disrupt his rhythm, with one foul leaving rodriguez writhing in pain. despite several fouls going unpunished by the referee, some suggest brazil was favored in terms of refereeing decisions.
959	a georgia father, kaveh kamooneh, was arrested and spent 14.5 hours in jail for charging his electric car at a school charging station without permission. he admitted using the station for several weeks while his son attended tennis lessons nearby. the officer discovered the car and wrote in his report that kamooneh was asked if he had sought permission from the school, to which he responded negatively. school officials confirmed that a complaint was made about the vehicle being plugged in. kamooneh was charged with misdemeanor theft and claimed that the officer had taken a confrontational attitude, making an uncooperative atmosphere. experts estimate that the car drew about five cents worth of electricity during the 20-minute charging session. he was released on $150 bail and has vowed to fight the charge in court in february.
960	katy holmes, 33, was caught having sex on the bonnet of a car in a quiet residential street in blackpool with a stranger they had met minutes before. the incident occurred in december 2013 around 9:45 am on hyde road. holmes was spotted by a disgusted mother and her child through the front window of their home. holmes admitted to committing an act outraging public decency and was sentenced to an eight-week prison term suspended for 12 months and given 12 months of supervision. the man involved escaped by scaling a fence when police arrived on the scene.
961	harry redknapp, qpr manager and renowned football personality, has released a new book, "a man walks on to a pitch," where he recounts the intense rivalry between roy keane and patrick vieira during their playing days. in the book, redknapp shares stories of their midfield battles turning into heated disputes, including an encounter between the two at highbury in 2005. keane's demeanor changed drastically when he saw vieira approaching him, as the two had a history of animosity. redknapp discusses their memorable football careers, major honors, and the impact of their games on english football in his new book, available for purchase.
962	an oklahoma teenager, thorsten rushing, and four of his friends have been formally charged with the murder of his father, uwe rushing, 49, and his younger brother, stefan, 13, in an elaborate ruse involving a home invasion. rushing allegedly shot and killed his father and smothered his brother, who was not bleeding out fast enough. initially, rushing told police that two black men forced their way into the home, but later described them as white and hispanic. despite his account of the intruders running through the house while shooting, no items in the home appeared to be disturbed. on january 20, rushing met with ethan alexander thompson and wesley bankston, and they agreed thompson would help remove evidence and bankston would drive. after the shootings, the teens collected evidence in a bag and disposed of it. rushing and his four friends were arrested on january 28, and all have pleaded not guilty. they are being held on bonds of between $2 million and $5 million. police spokesman capt. craig akard stated that the crime scene and the evidence did not align with rushing's story, and no motive has been confirmed, though there was reportedly some turmoil within the family.
963	a lucky boxer named stella was rescued by firefighters in santa monica, california, after being found unconscious in a burning five-story building. she was hidden behind a mattress and suffered from smoke inhalation. firefighters saved her using an oxygen mask, and after 15 minutes, she regained color and began moving. her owners were not home during the fire, and she was taken to an animal hospital to recover. the rescue brought cheers and emotional reactions from the crowd. no other injuries were reported, and the cause of the fire is under investigation.
964	the all blacks arrived in cardiff with a strong message for wales, promising to field their best team after a second-string new zealand line-up narrowly defeated scotland. wales, who haven't beaten the kiwis since 1953, are low on confidence following an uninspiring 17-13 win over fiji. all blacks stars richie mccaw, dan carter, and sonny bill williams received a warm welcome in cardiff, in contrast to fiji's reception. wales' midfield, featuring jamie roberts, is a concern for new zealand coach steve hansen, who noted the team's size and strength. wales, who conceded 22 turnovers against fiji, face the risk of being punished by new zealand's counterattacks. the "black saturday" test has been dubbed a significant challenge for wales, who must improve their accuracy to have a chance of avoiding an embarrassing defeat. wales' return skipper sam warburton and luke charteris believe an unlikely victory is possible if they can retain the ball. liam williams, who was man of the match against fiji, faces competition from leigh halfpenny for the fullback position. hooker richard hibbard may also be benched due to a club-versus-country row. fiji's scrum-half nikola matawalu warned bigger nations not to underestimate them in the world cup pool stages.
965	the long-running astronomy show "the sky at night," presented by sir patrick moore for 56 years on british television, faces the possibility of being canceled by the bbc as early as december. the show, which began before the "space age" and made moore a figurehead for astronomy in the country, has featured many leading astronomers and high-profile guests. moore presented 721 episodes, missing only one due to food poisoning, making it the longest-running program with the same presenter in tv history. ratings hovered around 500,000 in recent years. thousands of fans have expressed their anger and sadness on social media at the potential cancellation of the program, which inspired generations of astronomers. the bbc confirmed discussions are ongoing regarding the show's future.
966	on a friday night in the unincorporated community of isla vista near the university of california, santa barbara (ucsb) and santa barbara city college, a gunman driving a black bmw opened fire, killing seven people and wounding several others. witnesses initially thought they were hearing fireworks or college pranks, but soon realized the seriousness of the situation as they saw the gunman shooting people on the street. isla vista, known for its beachfront beauty and vibrant student population, was turned into a crime scene overnight. this is not the first mass killing in isla vista, as in 2001, david attias, the son of a film director, ran over and killed four people, later being convicted of the murders but declared not guilty by reason of insanity. the community is renowned for its scenic location and student-populated streets, attracting visitors and locals alike. students and witnesses described hearing gunfire and initially thinking it was fireworks. on saturday morning, the community was filled with police tapes, bullet casings, and shattered storefront windows. both colleges offered condolences and counseling services to their students and the community. the identity of the gunman remains unknown.
967	a ship used by shell oil for drilling in the arctic, the noble discoverer, drifted close to an aleutian island after it slipped its mooring in unalaska bay on saturday. the incident raised concerns of a possible grounding near dutch harbor, but there were no reports of injuries, pollution, or significant damage to the ship. the noble discoverer is one of the dozens of vessels sent to the beaufort and chukchi seas to drill exploration wells, which proponents claim could create thousands of jobs but opponents fear could lead to an oil spill and damage the economy and environment. the delay in drilling due to thick ice pack and questions regarding the durability of shell's underwater oil spill containment vessels in severe weather have also caused concerns. the coast guard and shell are planning inspections of the ship to determine the cause of the incident and investigate the containment systems. opponents, including the inuit and environmental groups, call for a review of the federal permits issued to shell for the drilling project.
968	manchester united's legendary no. 7s, including george best, bryan robson, eric cantona, david beckham, cristiano ronaldo, and angel di maria, have been immortalized through unique works of art commissioned by the bleacher report. the artwork celebrates the iconic status of each player, their remarkable goals, and committed performances. george best, the original manchester united no. 7 and football's first celebrity, is depicted in his sixties pomp by artist zoran lucic, showing his impact both on and off the pitch. the series also includes bryan robson, carried shoulder-high by fans after united's 1984 european cup-winners' cup victory over barcelona, and eric cantona, with his infamous "viva houdini" front page, who scored crucial goals and inspired united to multiple titles in the 90s. david beckham's iconic pose with a trophy is replicated in his artwork, representing the team's successful treble triumph in 1999, while cristiano ronaldo's cheeky grin and 'viva ronaldo' chants are captured by dan leydon. angel di maria, the latest addition to the no. 7 lineage, is shown performing his heart celebration as he marks a goal, and a montage by charis tsevis connects all six portraits. these artists celebrate the enduring legacy and world-class talent of manchester united's famous no. 7s.
969	camilla long, a journalist who accused travis deceived, formerly a dj, of groping her during an interview, was confronted by him in a courtroom where he was awaiting sentencing. travis demanded long move from her seat in the public gallery, claiming she was making him uncomfortable. he shouted through the glass partition, urging someone to give her a seat in the press gallery, which was full. long wrote about the alleged incident in a 2012 article. travis was given a suspended sentence for one count of sexual assault but denied being a sexual predator. the single guilty verdict and subsequent trials cost taxpayers around £1 million, with travis also incurring high legal costs.
970	flight lieutenant czeslaw "tony" rogers, a polish war hero who survived a 830-mile trek on foot across the soviet union's frozen wastes to india after being freed from a prison camp, has passed away at the age of 91. rogers later became a decorated raf pilot, flying spitfires and lancaster bombers against targets in germany. he fought against both german and russian forces during world war ii in his native poland before being taken prisoner by the russians and sent to a siberian prison camp. after the soviet union allied with britain and america against germany, rogers was released and joined the raf. he flew over 12,000 hours in various aircraft types including spitfires, lancasters, and meteor jets. before the war, rogers had aspired to become a doctor, but was drawn to a career in flying by a friend. in the 1950s, he moved to singapore and served as the personal pilot to general sir gerald templer, the british high commissioner in malaya during the communist insurgency. rogers received the raf air crew europe star, the defence medal, and the highest polish medal, the virtuti militari. he was a guest of honor at battle of britain memorial dinners and met the duke of kent and the queen. rogers was eventually immobilized by a stroke, and the raf benevolent fund provided him with a mobility scooter, inspiring him to become a supporter of the organization. rogers passed away on january 15 at hyperion nursing home in fairford, gloucestershire.
971	michael detlaff, a 12-year-old boy scout from north carolina, discovered a 5.16-carat "honey brown" diamond at arkansas's crater of diamonds state park on july 31, 2023. the park, which allows visitors to search for diamonds in its 37.5-acre plowed field, has a finders-keepers policy. the diamond, named "god's glory diamond," is worth between $12,000 and $15,000 after being cut and polished. the park, which is the only diamond-producing site in the world open to the public, has seen over 328 diamonds found by visitors this year. the largest diamond found on site was a 40.23-carat white diamond unearthed in 1984 during the park's mining days. visitors can search for diamonds and other minerals, with two diamonds found on average each day. the park also offers campsites and rental equipment, and is open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. with an admission fee of $7 for adults, $4 for children.
972	andrea sneiderman, the widow of a businessman shot and killed outside a suburban preschool in atlanta, georgia, was charged with malice murder, conspiracy, racketeering, perjury, and insurance fraud on august 2, 2012. sneiderman is accused of conspiring with her former boss and lover, hemy neuman, who was convicted of the slaying four months prior. the indictment claims that sneiderman provided neuman with her husband's schedule to enable him to carry out the murder, and that the two intended to enjoy a life together, eliminate neuman's debt problems, and benefit from the sneidermans' assets and insurance policies. sneiderman's attorneys have promised a vigorous defense. neuman, who claimed during his trial that he was motivated by dreams featuring angels and demons, including olivia newton-john and barry white, was arrested in march 2012. sneiderman was taken into custody on august 2 and was being held without bond. the sneiderman family expressed relief at the arrest but called it an important step in pursuit of justice for russell sneiderman.
973	a new study published in the journal plos one has found that men who consume large amounts of ground beef and other red meat, especially if it's grilled or well-done, have a higher risk of developing aggressive forms of prostate cancer. the increased risk can be mainly attributed to the method of cooking and the degree of doneness. men who ate the most ground beef were over twice as likely to develop aggressive prostate cancer as those who did not consume any. heterocyclic amines (hcas) and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (pahs), which form when meat is cooked at high temperatures, are believed to be the carcinogens responsible for this association. the study takes the investigation of the link between meat consumption and prostate cancer a step further by focusing on the cooking methods and degrees of doneness. additionally, consuming fatty lunchmeats and liver was also associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer. poultry, bacon, and low-fat hot dogs and sausages appeared to have little influence on cancer risk. the study's findings support the notion that minimally processed meat may be harmful, and men are encouraged to moderate their intake of highly cooked red meat. however, the study has limitations, and the data on meat consumption relied on the participants' memory, so the findings should be considered with caution.
974	spring city councilman neil sorensen proposed an ordinance encouraging every household in the small utah town of spring city to have a firearm and for teachers to receive gun training. the full city council agreed to debate the bill next month. sorensen believes arming teachers could have prevented some deaths in mass shootings, such as sandy hook, and makes the point that with only a part-time police force, response time can be slow. the measure, which would make guns mandatory in every household and offer concealed firearms training to teachers, has the support of some council members and residents, even though school administrators are against it. opponents argue that more guns in schools would increase danger, while some residents believe it would make the town safer. the idea was inspired by kennesaw, georgia, which passed a similar law in 1982, claiming a decrease in burglaries. however, there is debate over whether having more armed teachers would effectively prevent or mitigate damage in mass shootings. utah law already allows teachers to carry concealed weapons in classrooms, but the district does not encourage it due to potential concerns.
975	public toilet closures in the uk have been a significant issue, with over four in ten public toilets having closed in the past decade. this trend has been widespread across various councils, including glasgow, where only eight remain open. health experts have expressed concern that the inability to use the restroom when needed could increase the risk of heart attacks and strokes, particularly for the elderly and vulnerable populations. councils have made significant budget cuts to public toilet provision, leading to closures in various areas, including lancaster, the lake district, and newcastle. the british toilet association (bta) has been asked to compile an updated toilet map of the uk by disability organizations, and efforts are being made to increase the number of community toilets as a potential solution. age uk's charity director general, michelle mitchell, emphasized the importance of public toilets for older people, stating that the concern extends beyond just financial implications and can have a devastating impact on their quality of life.
976	at least two people have been confirmed dead and 29 were injured when the roof of a mall under construction collapsed in tongaat, north of durban in south africa. builders were working on the three-story site when the second floor gave way, causing large amounts of concrete and metal to fall. rescue teams are using cranes, sniffer dogs, and torches to search for survivors, with around 100 emergency service workers on the scene. up to 50 workers are feared trapped under the rubble, and some were initially reported missing. local authorities had tried to halt construction a month ago due to safety concerns, but it is unclear if the builders had stopped. the identity of the builder is not yet known, and it is not clear what caused the collapse. the accident could have significant ramifications for labor relations and the ruling african national congress in the construction sector ahead of next year's election.
977	an nhs trust, oxleas nhs foundation trust, has admitted responsibility for the death of a young mother, diana mager, who took her own life in a hospital room while suffering from post-natal depression. initial responses from the trust stated that her death could not have been predicted or prevented despite her previous suicide attempts. however, following a legal challenge from her widower, adam mager, the trust admitted that they could have prevented her suicide. diana mager, 33, had been under treatment for severe post-natal depression since november 2011 and had made several suicidal attempts. she was even caught trying to jump from the roof of the tate modern and had smuggled a knife into her room. however, at the time of her death in august 2012, she was being checked by nurses only every 15 minutes despite her medical records stating that she was at very high risk of killing herself. mr. mager's lawyer expressed concern about the trust's initial denial and called for greater transparency and honesty in mental health care in the uk. the trust has since launched an internal investigation, offering condolences to the family and promising to review their internal inquiry for further learning. for confidential support, contact the samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit their website at www.samaritans.org.
978	amnesty international is urging nigeria to arrest sudanese president omar al-bashir if he attends an african union summit there on thursday, as al-bashir is wanted by the international criminal court (icc) on charges of war crimes and crimes against humanity for a five-year campaign of violence in darfur, sudan. nigeria, as a party to the icc treaty, is legally obligated to cooperate with the court and arrest al-bashir should he enter nigerian territory. the icc issued a warrant for al-bashir's arrest in march 2009, and he has traveled to several countries since then without being apprehended. the conflict in darfur has resulted in an estimated 300,000 deaths and the displacement of 2.5 million people. sudan denies the high death toll and has cooperated with arab militias that have carried out violence against civilian populations in darfur. the african union peace and security council summit in abuja is expected to be attended by 18 heads of state, including al-bashir. ex-south african president thabo mbeki is also expected to submit a report on the darfur situation.
979	a dispute has arisen in stratford-upon-avon after the shakespeare birthplace trust converted a historic barn on the property where anne hathaway, shakespeare's wife, spent her childhood into a snack kiosk without obtaining necessary planning permission. the grade i listed thatched barn, which was inside the curtilage of the 12-bedroom cottage built in the early 1460s, was used as a pea shed in the early 1900s before being turned into a cafe in april. however, it was only recently discovered that the shed was considered part of the cottage's site, and therefore subject to the same planning restrictions as grade i listed buildings. the trust has been ordered to apply for retrospective planning permission, which, if refused, may result in the building being transformed back to its original condition. the barn is believed to be the place where shakespeare courted his future wife. the trust had believed they did not need planning permission for the renovations, but new information revealed that the shed was a grade i listed building. the barn is considered part of the historic farmhouse site and was not a tudor building, but was likely erected in the first half of the 20th century. the trust has until november 5 to make a final application for planning permission. if the application is denied, they may be required to restore the building to its original state. the anne hathaway cottage, where she lived as a child, is a significant site in shakespeare's history, with the couple getting married there in 1582, when anne was 26 and pregnant, and shakespeare was just 18. their marriage is believed to have been influenced by the pregnancy and may have been an unhappy one, resulting in three children: susanna, hamnet, and judith. hamnet died at the age of 11, and shakespeare is believed to have been inspired by the loss to write the play hamlet. the couple's grave is located inside holy trinity church in stratford-
980	tokyo's nightlife scene is vibrant and diverse, with many top bars and clubs hidden off the main streets. notable bars include the new york bar at park hyatt tokyo, with its stunning views, live jazz, and "lost in translation" connection. henry good seven in shin-marunouchi building stands out for its unique interior design. kita aoyama salon in yamahazi building is a laid-back, indulgent basement bar. roppongi offers a lively, but sometimes tacky, nightlife scene, while golden gai in shinjuku evokes a bohemiantokyo of the past. new arrivals include le baron de paris in aoyama and womb in shibuya, known for their trendy crowds and impressive sound systems. some popular bars to check out include propaganda in roppongi, an affordable shot bar, and la jetee in kabukicho, a friendly drinking den in shinjuku. overall, tokyo's nightlife offers a variety of experiences for visitors. this summary includes the following key points from the text: * tokyo's nightlife scene is diverse and includes many hidden gems * some of the best bars are tucked away off the main streets * the new york bar at park hyatt tokyo is a must-visit, with live jazz and spectacular views * henry good seven and kita aoyama salon are unique bars with stunning interiors * roppongi offers a lively, but sometimes tacky, nightlife scene * golden gai in shinjuku offers a glimpse into a bygone era of tokyo * new arrivals, like le baron de paris and womb, attract trendy crowds and offer impressive sound systems.
981	stephen hendrie, a 19-year-old left-back for hamilton, is attracting interest from premier league clubs crystal palace and swansea. he has been compared to hull city's andrew robertson, who made a successful £2.8million move from dundee united. scouts from both clubs have watched him in action, including during a behind-closed-doors friendly at west bromwich albion and a victory over st mirren. hendrie has been part of hamilton's first team since 2011 and has also represented scotland at various youth levels, making his u21 debut in september 2017. he is valued at around £2m by hamilton. cardiff city have also scouted him.
982	germany, the tallest country in europe, is home to about one in every five penis enlargement surgeries worldwide. in 2013, out of an estimated 15,414 such procedures, 2,786, or nearly 20%, were carried out in germany. venezuela came in second with 473 surgeries, followed closely by spain with 471 procedures. the german centre for urology and phalloplasty, which performs around 6,000 operations per year, reports that penile enlargement surgery can add between three to six centimeters in length and two to three centimeters in girth, as well as making the glans penis larger. the cost of the procedure, which leaves no visible scar, is high at 9,600 euros (around £7,627). the centre also offers penile implants and reconstructive surgery for congenital curving.
983	ocado, the uk-based online grocery retailer, has signed a 25-year distribution deal with morrisons, making it the backbone for morrisons' online debut. ocado's advanced technology, which includes an automated warehouse filled with robots and conveyor belts, has been compared to amazon's and has attracted interest from global retailers. ocado's ceo, tim steiner, stated that they have held talks with retailers worldwide who are interested in licensing their systems. ocado was founded in 2000 and has been profitable since its establishment. they have been investing heavily in technology and have projects focused on developing advanced robots and machines. the company has been losing money but has been growing, expanding its delivery area to cover over 10 million households by 2005. ocado's business model includes providing intellectual property to others through licensing, joint ventures, or operating systems in new territories.
984	the us air force's secret unmanned x-37b robotic space plane successfully landed at california's vandenberg air force base after 15 months in orbit. the x-37b, also known as otv-2, fired its engine to re-enter the atmosphere and glided down the runway like an ordinary airplane. the x-37b program allows the air force to test new technologies without the same risk commitment as other programs, and it brings a unique capability to space technology development. the vehicle, which resembles a miniature space shuttle, has a wingspan of 4.5m and a length of 8.9m, and is solar-powered. the x-37b is the second of its kind to be sent up by the us air force, and its mission has remained a mystery. some speculation surrounds its potential use for surveillance or defense purposes, but its exact role is not disclosed. the x-37b that landed on saturday was launched in 2011 and spent longer in orbit than initially intended, leading to rumors of spying missions. the next x-37b mission is scheduled for launch this fall.
985	a jewish football coach in frankfurt, alon meyer, was shocked to learn that kreshnik berisha, a former player in his team at makkabi frankfurt, became the first suspected german isis member to stand trial. berisha, a 20-year-old boy born to kosovan parents, had once played alongside jewish teammates but reportedly left germany in 2013 to join isis in syria. berisha's trial is ongoing, and he is expected to receive a sentence of three to four-and-a-half years for being a member of a foreign terrorist organization. he had been studying construction engineering before his radicalization. meyer expressed his disbelief and sadness over berisha's transformation, saying he was a "normal player" and "comfortable" within the jewish sports club. with around 4,500 members, makkabi frankfurt is a central part of the frankfurt community, offering opportunities for people of all backgrounds to join over 30 sports and 23 football teams. despite some community members' concerns, meyer emphasizes the importance of keeping the doors open to everyone.
986	scientists have discovered ancient water, estimated to be up to 2.7 billion years old, trapped deep within the earth's crust in sites around the world. this water, which could amount to around 2.5 million cubic miles (11 cubic million km), is highly salty and rich in minerals due to reactions with the rock. researchers have also found evidence of hydrogen production in these ancient water reservoirs, potentially supporting new forms of life. the water was tasted by professor barbara sherwood lollar, who described it as "terrible" due to its high salt content. these findings expand our understanding of the earth's potentially habitable environments and the origins of the water on our planet.
987	in an exclusive edinburgh suburb, former royal bank of scotland boss fred goodwin has been embroiled in a long-standing dispute with neighbors over a double-layer, 25ft high leylandii hedge. the neighbors, frustrated with the lack of sunlight in their gardens, have taken matters into their own hands and chopped down the nearest layer of hedge. this comes ahead of a new law that empowers councils to make decisions regarding hedge disputes. goodwin purchased the six-bedroom mansion and hedge in 2011 after facing criticism for his role in the bank's massive losses during his tenure, culminating in a multi-billion-pound bailout. despite efforts to reduce the hedge's size, neighbors continue to find it a barrier to light. the high hedges (scotland) act, which grants councils the authority to force hedge owners to cut back hedges that block light, will be enforced starting april 1, 2023. when approached for comment, joyce goodwin (fred's estranged wife, still living in the mansion) responded with 'what hedge?' the high hedges act was proposed in 2012 and passed in 2013.
