1073	real madrid striker karim benzema was caught driving 216 kilometers per hour (about 134 mph) on a madrid highway on february 3, over twice the speed limit, and could face sanctions including losing his driver's license for up to four years and six months in jail, according to a traffic spokeswoman. the incident occurred after real madrid lost to granada in a league match and hours before the team faced barcelona in the copa de rey semifinals. benzema, a french international, allegedly drove an audi, which is an official sponsor of the team, and was clocked by civil guard radar in a 100 kph (62 mph) zone. the spokeswoman said authorities did not immediately pursue benzema due to safety concerns, but later tracked the vehicle to him. there were reports of a second speeding vehicle, but according to the traffic spokeswoman, only benzema's vehicle was identified. real madrid declined to comment on the incident beyond their club policy on traffic violations. benzema made an initial appearance before an investigating magistrate and the sanctions could include additional fines or community service. he did not play in the match against barcelona due to a decision by coach jose mourinho.
1074	roger federer led switzerland to their first davis cup final in 22 years by defeating fabio fognini 6-2, 6-3, 7-6 (4) in the semi-finals, securing a spot against france in the final. the capacity crowd at palexpo arena in geneva supported federer as he dismantled the world number 17 in under two hours. switzerland reached the final after defeats in 1992 against the united states. federer won his fifth singles rubber of the year and was rested for the doubles match, allowing his teammates to take the initial 2-0 lead. however, italy's fognini and simone bolelli won the doubles match, putting pressure on switzerland. federer responded by breaking fognini's serve twice in the first set and clinching it with precision hitting. he took control of the second set by breaking fognini's serve again, reaching the final with a tiebreak victory. france will host the final from november 21-23. federer reflected on the importance of teamwork and shared the victory with his team. despite struggling himself and with tough conditions, federer was determined to make the difference.
1075	a gene linked to the amount of grey matter in the brain and intelligence has been identified by scientists at king's college london. the variant of the gene, nptn, was associated with a thinner cerebral cortex and poorer performance in verbal and non-verbal reasoning tests among nearly 1,600 14-year-olds. previous studies have shown that the cerebral cortex, the outer layer of the brain, plays a critical role in various cognitive functions like memory, attention, language, and consciousness. the researchers studied over 54,000 genetic variants related to brain development and found that the nptn gene, which encodes a protein affecting brain cell communication, had reduced expression in specific parts of the left brain hemisphere in individuals carrying the gene variant. they also observed differences in nptn gene activity in the left and right hemispheres of mice, suggesting that its impaired function in certain regions of the left hemisphere could underlie intellectual differences. the study's findings indicate that the identified genetic variation accounts for only about 0.5% of the total variation in intelligence. the research team hopes that their work may help understand the biological mechanisms behind mental disorders and eventually lead to more effective diagnosis and treatment for conditions such as schizophrenia and autism.
1076	the international monetary fund (imf) has revised down its growth forecasts for the uk economy, predicting a minuscule growth of 0.2% in 2012 and 1.4% in 2013. the imf blames the eurozone crisis for the downgraded forecast, as it expects the eurozone to be in recession this year and the world economy to grow by only 3.5% in 2012, instead of the previous forecast of 3.9%. businesses in the uk are hoping for an impact from the £80bn "funding for lending" scheme, but demand for credit remains low due to europe's crisis. inflation in the uk, which hit a 31-month low in june, is expected to continue to ease. the imf calls on european leaders to follow through on promises made at their summit, including banking and budgetary reforms. the uk government's budget deficit improvement will be slower than expected due to slower growth, and the imf urges advanced non-eurozone economies like britain to respond effectively by pushing ahead with further unconventional measures such as quantitative easing. the eurozone's indecision over ratifying the new €500bn bailout fund adds to the uncertainty, with germany's supreme court yet to rule on its legality, causing weeks of turmoil on financial markets.
1077	amrik gill, a 26-year-old serial fraudster who has been jailed six times for scamming people out of thousands of pounds, described his 18-month sentence as "the best holiday ever" on twitter after his release from prison halfway through. he even thanked taxpayers for funding his imprisonment and commented that the characters allowed in a tweet were "not long enough" compared to his sentence. families against crime criticized gill for his disrespectful comments and called for him to be returned to prison to complete his sentence. the cost of each prisoner in the uk is £34,700 a year. manchester councillor norman lewis and police and crime commissioner for greater manchester tony lloyd also condemned gill's remarks. gill had previously received a suspended sentence for 18 frauds, but was caught scamming again just a month later and was sent to prison for 18 months. when asked about his tweets, gill claimed he was being sarcastic. a prison service spokesperson stated that the prison regime is tougher than it has been in years and plans to remain that way.
1078	the trailer for the upcoming 2015 adaptation of antoine de saint-exupéry's classic novella "the little prince" was recently released, showcasing a modern retelling of the story through the perspective of a young girl. directed by mark osborne, the animated film features jeff bridges as the older gentleman neighbor, who shares his magical experiences of encountering the young prince from his asteroid with the girl. the movie, which also stars rachel mcadams, james franco, marion cotillard, benicio del toro, and mackenzie foy's voice as the young girl, is set to open in the us in 2015. the beloved tale, which was first published in 1943, follows the story of an aviator who crashes in the sahara and meets the young prince full of stories from his far-off asteroid, while teaching valuable lessons about friendship and adulthood.
1079	the v8 car themed hotel in stuttgart, germany, provides a unique lodging experience for car enthusiasts with ten themed rooms, including a car workshop, car wash, and cinema drive-in. rooms range from 135 euros to 466 euros per night and come equipped with genuine car parts and memorabilia, even featuring vintage cars as beds. the hotel was formerly boblingen airport and has a rich history, serving as a docking station for zeppelin flights and a base for me-109 fighter aircraft during world war ii. the remaining terminal building is now shared with the meilenwerk auto museum. the non-themed rooms also feature cars, while some are designed as parks or nature scenes. the hotel has diverse guests, appealing to both car enthusiasts and families, and has attracted celebrity visitors.
1080	tom graham, who has been playing tom archer on radio 4's "the archers" for 17 years, has announced that he has been dropped from the show. fans of the actor, who is known for portraying the character's disastrous decisions, were sad to hear the news. graham's character went into self-imposed exile after shamelessly ditching his fiancée kirsty at the altar. the bbc refused to comment on the reason behind the recasting of the character, which has occurred frequently in the long-running soap since the 1950s.
1081	police are evacuating part of a milwaukee suburb as they search for evidence in connection to the deadly shooting at a sikh temple on sunday, where six people were killed and several others were injured. the investigation is focusing on a home in cudahy, wisconsin, believed to be linked to the unnamed gunman. fbi and local law enforcement arrived at the scene with armed officers, armored trucks, and a bomb disposal unit. residents of two blocks near the house were asked to evacuate, similar to the situation in aurora, colorado, where neighbors were forced out of their homes during the search for the aurora theater shooter's apartment. the shooter, described as a white male in his 30s, is not yet identified, and his motive is not currently known, but the crime is being treated as an act of domestic terrorism based on the shooter's tattoos. police spent hours securing the temple and investigating the scene, while victims' families were desperate for information.
1082	demodex mites are tiny eight-legged organisms related to spiders, residing in human hair follicles. two species, demodex folliculorum and demodex brevis, live on human faces, with the former shallowly in the hair follicle and the latter nestled deeply in the sebum gland. these mites are present in 100% of individuals over 18 years old, according to a study published in plos one. the mites likely spread through unknown methods, possibly breast-feeding or close contact, and likely co-evolved with humans as they migrated around the world over thousands of years. though they may be unsettling, scientists view these mites as harmless companions.
1083	michael gove, the education secretary, was seen having a discussion with armed police about the closure of downing street gates, causing a potential panic at the highest levels of government. contrary to past incidents, such as the plebgate row that led to andrew mitchell's resignation, the conversation between gove and the officers was described as amicable. gove had been helping david cameron prepare for prime minister's questions but was left stranded when the gates were locked down due to the prime minister's departure. gove's car couldn't meet him at the door, prompting him to walk down to speak to the police. despite some animated expressions in the photographs, sources claimed thatgove was the "politest man in politics" and had no cross words with the officers. in contrast, andrew mitchell infamously lost his temper and used foul language when denied access to downing street gates in 2011, an incident that eventually led to his resignation as chief whip.
1084	in beijing, china, at least five to six men armed with knives and cleavers attacked a college dormitory at the hainan institute of science and technology in hainan province, injuring nine students, one seriously. the incident is the latest in a series of knife attacks in china in recent weeks, with the previous attacks targeting kindergarten students and teachers. one student had his hand cut off, while eight others sustained varying injuries. these attacks differ from previous ones due to the victims being college students rather than young children. a man was sentenced to death last week for attacking 29 kindergarten students and three teachers with a knife. another man killed seven kindergarten students and a teacher with a kitchen cleaver before committing suicide. cnn's jo kent and helena hong contributed to this report.
1085	in october 2012, star trek fans jossie and sonnie gustavsson tied the knot in the uk's first-ever klingon wedding during the destination star trek london convention. the groom, originally from sweden, and his bride, who converted to star trek fandom as a child, exchanged vows in full klingon costumes and makeup, with a ceremony faithfully adapted from the tv series. thousands of other fans gathered to witness the unique event, which featured a three-meter klingon god statue as the altar, the traditional klingon wedding march replaced with drums, and a mock battle with a sword presentation by the best man. the pair ended their special day by cutting a giant cake in the shape of the borg cube and receiving blessings for 'yln' (life), 'bathlh' (honour), and 'qapla' (success). jossie and sonnie, who are both care workers, took their first holiday together for the convention. the three-day event, celebrating the 25th anniversary of star trek: the next generation and the first dedicated star trek convention to hit the uk in over a decade, attracted fans from around the world.
1086	christopher columbus, who visited a 5-year-old's class in 2013, is commonly portrayed as having discovered the americas and proven the world was round. however, historians william phillips and leanne howe agree that it's important to tell children the truth about columbus, who didn't actually figure out the earth's shape or discover america first. columbus struggled to get funding for his voyage due to his inaccurate calculations and limited geographical knowledge. moreover, the indigenous peoples of the caribbean had settled societies, contrary to the depiction of primitive populations. columbus did discover new lands and initiated the columbian exchange, leading to significant historical impacts like new trade routes, languages, and cultures. however, it's essential to acknowledge his brutal actions, such as taking slaves and introducing diseases. regardless, columbus' bravery and historical significance make him an important figure despite his mistakes and negative consequences.
1087	four elementary school pupils were tragically stabbed to death by a middle-aged man as they walked to gupu primary school in lingshan county, guangxi province, china, today. this is the latest in a series of knife attacks on schoolchildren in china over the past decade. the unidentified suspect, a 56-year-old man, allegedly attacked the children from a motorcycle, and authorities are currently searching for him. the violent incident resulted in the instant death of three children and the later demise of a fourth in the hospital. china has experienced a surge in such attacks, leading to heightened security measures and occasional policy changes, but these efforts have had limited impact. the government has implemented id and registration requirements for certain knife purchases and increased security around schools. previous attacks, such as one in hubei province last month and in may 2010 in northwest china, have left dozens injured and killed, often carried out by people with no known connection to the schools and suffering from mental health issues or personal grievances. the latest incident has led to additional security measures, including confiscation of knives and self-defense training for schoolchildren.
1088	nine experienced skydivers had a close call during a jump in wisconsin when two light aircraft collided in mid-air on saturday. the incident was caught on camera, showing one plane being sandwiched atop another and subsequently engulfed in flames. all skydivers survived by jumping out seconds after the crash and landing safely on the ground. one pilot sustained minor injuries and was taken to the hospital. the cause of the collision is under investigation by the federal aviation administration.
1089	a police investigation has been launched into the deaths of at least three nhs patients treated by colorectal surgeon sudip sarker at worcester royal hospital and alexandra hospital in redditch. sarker, who had double the death rate of other doctors and a high readmission rate, was allowed to continue operating despite concerns raised about his performance by colleagues in 2012. the investigation began in december 2013 after police received a letter about the deaths of three patients, and the inquest into their deaths has been adjourned. the trust has reviewed the records of all patients undergoing major procedures for bowel cancer and recalled some for checks. sarker remains on his full salary while the general medical council has placed restrictions on his licence to practise surgery. the families of the deceased patients have been informed and some have instructed lawyers to take up their cases. dozens of patients have made complaints and it is feared that the investigation may be widened to include other patient deaths. the trust has reassured patients that action was taken as soon as a potential problem was identified.
1090	this article assesses various diy teeth-whitening treatments and rates them based on their whitening performance and effect on oral health. the products tested include blanx white shock toothpaste, rapid white express max tooth-whitening strips, pearl drops beauty sleep serum, dr. oliver whitening wands, and beverly hills dentist's choice gum and whitening toothpaste, along with arm & hammer advanced white max booster. the blanx white shock toothpaste, priced at £7.49, uses actilux, a self-cleaning ingredient that reacts with light to whiten teeth. however, there is no scientific evidence to confirm its effectiveness. the paste contains fluoride and xylitol, which help prevent tooth decay. the expert opinion is that while actilux may not work as advertised, the toothpaste still has benefits. the rating is 3/10. the rapid white express max tooth-whitening strips, priced at £22.99 for a week's supply, use chlorine dioxide to whiten teeth but can damage enamel and leave teeth sensitive to temperature. the strips also contain citric acid, which can soften enamel. the expert opinion is that the risk of damage and sensitivity makes these a poor choice. the rating is 1/10. the pearl drops beauty sleep serum, priced at £3.49, uses active oxygen to whiten teeth and has calcium and phosphate to help strengthen enamel. however, there's no strong evidence that the liquid calcium helps restore or strengthen teeth. the product also contains sodium fluoride, which is effective against tooth decay. the expert opinion is that the oxygen can whiten teeth and the fluoride can protect against decay, but the strength of these effects may be limited. the rating is 8/10. 
1091	the national crime agency (nca) is launching a new campaign to raise awareness about the importance of installing anti-virus and security software on new devices to protect against cyber attacks. according to the nca, over 10,000 victims of computer viruses were reported in the uk last year, with most incidents being preventable. the campaign, led by the nca's national cyber crime unit (nccu) in partnership with a government campaign, urges internet users to be "cyber streetwise" and encourages steps to improve web security such as installing security software, avoiding opening emails from unknown sources, and taking caution with usb sticks and cds. the nca also highlighted the cost of cybercrime to individuals, not just financially but also personally. the campaign comes amidst a series of high-profile cyber security issues and calls for users to do more to protect data from government snooping and hackers. however, professor ross anderson of cambridge university computer laboratory is critical of the security industry and believes that attempts to regulate the internet are a waste of time and money. anderson's report found that the cost of fighting cybercrime is greater than the cost of the crimes themselves and that the true cost to each citizen is about £1 a year.
1092	alvin e. roth of harvard university and lloyd s. shapley of ucla have been awarded the nobel prize in economics for their contributions to market design and matching theory. shapley used game theory to study matching models, while roth applied these theories to real-world markets such as school choice and organ transplants. their work has influenced software used for kidney donations in the us and school choice models in various cities. both scholars were surprised by the award and expressed their gratitude. the nobel prize in economics was established in 1969, and this year's monetary award was lowered due to financial market turbulence. the european union received the nobel peace prize, surprising some and drawing criticism from demonstrators. chinese writer mo yan, whose work combines fantasy and gritty reality, was this year's nobel prize in literature laureate. this year's nobel prize in economics was chosen from over 300 nominations. last year, thomas j. sargent and christopher a. sims, both americans, won the prize for their research on the relationship between government and economic policy.
1093	one direction, the british boy band, have dethroned daniel radcliffe as the top earner on heat magazine's young rich list for under-30s. the group, consisting of niall horan, louis tomlinson, zayn malik, liam payne, and harry styles, collectively earned £59.33 million, while radcliffe came in second place with £56.19 million. one direction's earnings were attributed to their group efforts, as they are about to release their third album "midnight memories." calvin harris, a dj and music producer, entered the list as a newcomer with £22.2 million in earnings. other stars on the list included robert pattinson, keira knightley, emma watson, adele, rupert grint, cheryl cole, and leona lewis. daniel radcliffe, who previously held the top spot since the list's inception in 2010, was knocked off the first place.
1094	a man named malcolm brenner, now 63, has caused shock on australian radio after revealing he had sexual encounters with a dolphin named dolly during the 1970s at a now-defunct theme park in florida. he also revealed that he attempted to have intercourse with the family dog during his teenage years. the interview on the kiis fm breakfast show with kyle and jackie o sparked controversy, with jackie o labeling brenner's actions as bestiality, illegal, and wrong. despite the backlash, brenner defended his actions and spoke of his deep connection with dolly, claiming it was consensual and transcendental. in a new film, "dolphin love," brenner discusses the details of their year-long relationship, which began when he was trusted to be alone with the dolphins and waited until after nightfall to have sex with dolly. the film, which premiered at the slamdance film festival, has received mixed reviews and raised debates on ethical and legal issues regarding human-animal relationships. other reported incidents of sexual encounters between humans and dolphins include a nasa experiment in the 1960s in which scientist margaret howe lovatt let a dolphin named peter have sex with her, believing it would help the communication between humans and dolphins. dolphins can be dangerous due to their strength and size, and some have been known to target and mount humans, raising concerns about safety and ethics.
1095	two new york city and los angeles law enforcement officers, rex maralit, 44, and wilfredo maralit, 48, are accused of illegally selling high-powered weapons and using their credentials to smuggle guns overseas to the philippines, according to the u.s. attorney's office. between 2009 and march 2013, the brothers allegedly ordered and shipped weapons, including assault rifles, sniper rifles, and pistols, to customers in the philippines through disguised shipments. they bypassed regulations requiring gun dealer licenses and export approval by using their law enforcement knowledge to circumvent the law, the u.s. attorney's office stated. their third brother, ariel maralit, 43, based in the philippines, took orders from customers. both brothers are expected to appear in court on friday.
1096	a conservative mp, mark menzies, resigning from his role as a minister's aide after being accused of asking a brazilian rent boy for sex and drugs. rogério dos santos pinto, a 19-year-old brazilian man, claimed he had sex with menzies multiple times over the past 18 months and was asked to supply him with methedrone, or 'poor man's cocaine.' the rent boy also claimed that he had evidence of their communications and sexual encounters, which included messages and photographs. menzies, who is unaware of the rent boy's immigration status, has yet to address the allegations in detail but issued a statement on saturday saying, " i have decided to resign as a parliamentary private secretary after a series of allegations were made against me. a number of these allegations are not true and i look forward to setting the record straight in due course." no formal allegations have been made to the metropolitan police.
1097	former south african president nelson mandela's health has improved but he remains critically ill, according to president jacob zuma. zuma visited mandela in the hospital to give an update on his condition and reported that mandela responded with a smile during their conversation. mandela, who became an iconic figure in south african politics after ending apartheid with his 1994 electoral victory, turned 95 on july 18, which was declared nelson mandela international day by the un. south africans celebrated by performing community service, and tributes poured in from around the world. mandela spent his birthday in the hospital, where he was admitted on june 8 for a recurring lung infection. he was jailed for 27 years during white minority rule before his release in 1990. mandela's birthday was marked with celebration and charitable initiatives in various cities around the world, including the us.

1099	officer jesse turano and his partner, officer brendan mulderrig, saved a 37-year-old man from jumping off new york city's george washington bridge on tuesday. this was officer turano's 12th rescue in his five-year tenure as a port authority police officer. the officers found an abandoned car and the man standing on the bridge's edge. after hearing the man's suicidal intentions over the phone, turano and mulderrig approached him and managed to pull him back to safety after a tense struggle. turano, a nine-year veteran and former marine, has a history of saving lives at the bridge, preventing a total of 12 suicides since he started working there in 2010. the george washington bridge is the most popular spot in the new york city area for suicide attempts, with around a dozen jumpers and 40 foiled attempts each year.
1100	a 93-year-old woman, jane pickett, from burke, virginia, received her long-overdue high school diploma 75 years after leaving school due to her wedding on the same day as the graduation ceremony. her daughter, sharon mills, arranged for the diploma to be sent by the new york school, and she was surprised with the presentation during her birthday week. this comes after a similar story last year about a 99-year-old woman, audrey crabtree, returning to waterloo east high school in iowa and finally graduating after putting her education aside for family commitments.
1101	the morlock family, including taylor, denham, tanner, and their father, experienced a terrifying moment while driving through heavy rain in southern utah when taylor jokingly wished for their car to be struck by lightning. moments later, their suv's antenna was hit by a bolt, causing the car to instantly become unbearably hot, with sparks flying. the electrical gauges shut off, and three tires were blown out. the family was shaken but uninjured, and found that their dead cellphones and gaming devices were suddenly fully charged again. the experience was both thrilling and terrifying for the morlock boys, who expressed regret for taylor's careless wish and vowed not to repeat it. the family's journey was cut short, and they had to wait for a tow truck.
1102	homeowners may face significant expenses if ash trees on their property are infected with ash dieback disease and need to be safely removed, as it costs between £600 and £1,000 to chop down a sick tree. the failure of the department for environment, food and rural affairs (defra) to provide compensation has raised concerns as there is no incentive for homeowners to report infected trees, potentially aiding the spread of the disease. farmers have received compensation for livestock diseases but not for infected trees, and the horticultural trades association (hta) argues that compensation would make controlling the disease more effective. home insurance does not cover the costs of removing or treating diseased ash trees. homeowners in west yorkshire have been ordered to pay for the destruction of infected saplings, with no compensation offered. a defra spokesman believes resources are best spent on tackling the disease.
1103	a new motorway pub, the first in britain, is set to open later this year at beaconsfield service station on the m40, despite criticisms from road safety and alcohol awareness campaigners. jd wetherspoon, which has been granted a £2 million license, insists that customers will be trusted to make responsible choices about drinking and driving. the proposal has drawn condemnation, with critics warning it sends the wrong message about drinking and driving, as well as increasing the availability of alcohol, particularly for motorway traffic. in 2011, drink-driving resulted in 9,990 casualties and 280 deaths on british roads. wetherspoon plans to open 24 hours a day and serve alcohol from 8am to 1am. the conservative-run south bucks district council insists that no objections were lodged during the consultation period. wetherspoon and extra, its joint venture partner, will invest over £2 million in the project and create 50 jobs. the company's chairman, tim martin, says it is an "exciting new development" and is expected to be the first of many. critics argue that the move is unnecessary, given the availability of alcohol elsewhere, and that it poses a risk to road safety.
1104	tlc's reality show "19 kids and counting" has faced backlash from over 80,000 people who have signed a change.org petition to cancel the show due to the duggar family's reported anti-lgbt stance. michelle duggar recorded a robocall encouraging fayetteville, arkansas residents to vote against an ordinance protecting transgender individuals from discrimination. the petitioners criticized duggar for spreading ignorance and fear-mongering, arguing that transgender people are not predators or rapists. the family is known for their conservative christian beliefs and large family size, and their oldest son works for an organization labeled as a hate group by the southern poverty law center. controversy also arose after the duggars deleted photos of same-sex couples from their official facebook page. a counter petition to support the family had over 6,000 signatures as of friday.
1105	patricia krentcil, also known as 'tan mom,' is making headlines again after giving up her tanning bed addiction. in her place, she now gets botox injections every three months, which have given her a paler look and reportedly improved her sex life. krentcil, from nutley, new jersey, gained notoriety for her excessive tanning habits and even faced child endangerment charges in 2012 when her daughter was found with sunburns, which krentcil claimed came from playing outdoors. she also participated in a celebrity boxing contest but struggled with alcohol abuse and caused turbulence at the event. while krentcil maintained that she won't get addicted to botox, she is also considering other cosmetic procedures, including an eye lift and chest treatment. she has admitted that her tanning addiction was a mistake and has since quit the beds.
1106	a 21-year-old man, shaquille jones, was charged with the murder of medical student paul dewolf and two counts of first-degree home invasion in ann arbor, michigan. jones was wanted in connection to a home invasion in north charleston, south carolina, where a tip led police to his arrest on november 5. a second suspect, joei jordan, was also arrested and charged with receiving and concealing stolen property. the arrests came as the first break in the case in months, as dewolf was found dead from a gunshot wound in his bedroom at a fraternity house on july 24. police increased campus patrols and warned students of a potential killer on the loose. dewolf, an enlisted second lieutenant in the united states air force and studying at the university to complete his surgical training, was a brilliant pianist and french horn player, a certified scuba diver, traveled the world on mission trips, and had competed in marathons. he was the captain of the cross country team at schoolcraft high school and graduated as class valedictorian in 2006. police say dewolf failed to report for a scheduled assignment at the veteran's affairs hospital and was an enthusiastic marathon runner. the university of michigan president, mary sue coleman, described dewolf as the "epitome of everything great in the field of medicine" and extended condolences to his family and colleagues.
1107	police officers in the nypd have criticized protesters outraged over the death of eric garner, a black man who died in a chokehold, claiming that he brought about his own death by resisting arrest and having health issues. union officials and police supporters argue they are being unjustly targeted and feel betrayed by demonstrations and politicians. garner, a heavyset 43-year-old father of six, was killed in july after officers responded to complaints about him selling loose cigarettes. protesters have called for police reform, while officers argue that garner would still be alive if he had obeyed orders. no evidence has emerged suggesting the death was racially motivated, and pantaleo's lawyer claims he did not use a chokehold. over 280 arrests have been made during ongoing protests. some officers feel demoralized and advised to stop making arrests, while others claim politicians should explain why "quality of life" enforcement is necessary. the fatal encounter occurred when garner resisted arrest and refused to be handcuffed, leading to a struggle during which officers, including a white patrolman daniel pantaleo, appeared to use a chokehold. garner repeatedly said "i can't breathe," and later died at the scene. the medical examiner determined that a chokehold contributed to his death, but also noted asthma, obesity, and cardiovascular disease as contributing factors. the grand jury declined to indict pantaleo, citing insufficient evidence. critics argue that the decision not to indict highlights the need for police reform. police unions have defended pantaleo's actions, maintaining that he followed orders and used an authorized takedown move.
1108	an fbi agent, daniel knapp, drowned in puerto rico on thursday while trying to save a struggling swimmer. knapp was off duty at playa escondida in fajardo when he was approached for help. despite being overcome by waves, knapp managed to reach the swimmer, but unfortunately could not be saved himself. knapp, 43, had been with the fbi for six years and was based in san juan. he was an accomplished agent, having received the fbi director's award for outstanding criminal investigation and the attorney general's award for excellence in law enforcement in 2011. the swimmer was rescued by a police boat and knapp is being remembered as a hero who exemplified the ideals of the fbi and possessed genuine wonderful human qualities.
1109	a family from arnold, nottingham, consisting of parents tim and kerry meek, and their daughters amy, 11, and ella, 9, have sold their house and taken their children out of school for a year-long educational road trip across the uk in a caravan. amy and ella will be "road-schooled" by their parents, who are both teachers. instead of classrooms and formal tests, the girls will learn through visits to museums, libraries, and historical sites such as stonehenge, the scilly isles, and hadrian's wall. the family quit their jobs and have budgeted £20,000 for the trip, which will cover up to 20,000 miles. they have already started their journey and visited warwick castle and peterborough. tim meek emphasizes that they are not against schools or teachers but feel that education is becoming too focused on tests and assessments, with less emphasis on enjoyable learning experiences. the girls are looking forward to the trip, although they are missing their friends. home-schooled children, according to mike fortune-wood of home education uk, tend to perform better than state school students due to individualized instruction. nottinghamshire county council has expressed respect for the parents' decision and wishes them success.
1110	three people in the southeastern united states have been diagnosed with necrotizing fasciitis, a rare and aggressive bacterial infection that causes tissue to die, following separate incidents. aimee copeland, a 24-year-old georgia student, lost a leg, a foot, and both hands after getting infected from a cut she received while using a homemade zip-line. bobby vaughn, a 32-year-old landscaper from georgia, contracted the disease after falling out of a tree and getting a cut, and lost two pounds of flesh from his groin and back. lana kuykendall, a 36-year-old mother of twins in south carolina, was infected just hours after giving birth and has undergone seven surgeries to remove infected tissue. all three patients are in critical condition and are being treated at doctors hospital in augusta, georgia, which has one of the most renowned burn clinics in the country. doctors believe they have removed the infected tissue in mr. vaughn's case, while miss copeland and mrs. kuykendall are being treated with antibiotics and surgery. symptoms of necrotizing fasciitis include small red lumps or bruises, rapid spreading of infection, fever, chills, and nausea, and it can lead to organ failure and shock if not treated promptly. the patients' cases are not related, but the unusual outbreak has raised concerns among health officials.
1111	a 15-year-old girl's birthday party at bernard manning's embassy club in manchester turned into chaos when over 250 youths attended, leading to the arrival of police and a helicopter. the club, which had only been expecting 100 guests, was forced to close early due to overcrowding. no arrests were made and no crimes were reported. the mother of the birthday girl was devastated, but praised the way the staff handled the situation. the incident prompted concerns from local councillor pat karney, who is calling for an inquiry into how the party got out of control and led to such a large police response. witnesses described a scene of mayhem with hundreds of young people and multiple police cars in attendance.
1112	a indonesian woman named jamaliah was reunited with her daughter, raudhatul jannah, 10 years after they were separated during the 2004 boxing day tsunami. jannah and her seven-year-old brother were on a piece of floating wood when they were separated from their parents. the family assumed they had died, but in june, jamaliah's brother spotted a girl in a remote town in aceh, indonesia, who looked like jannah and made inquiries. the girl, named weni, had been rescued by a fisherman and raised by his mother. when jamaliah and her husband visited weni, they were certain it was their long-lost daughter. the family was overjoyed and thanked god for bringing them together again. jannah and her brother had been stranded on banyak island, but the whereabouts of her brother were unknown. the family was going to travel to the island to search for him. the tsunami, which was caused by an earthquake off the coast of sumatra, killed 230,000 people in 14 countries, including 170,000 in aceh.
1113	a new at-home whitening product called pearl drops pure white claims to provide results similar to professional whitening treatments for £25, without the need for trays, strips, or salon visits. the three-step kit includes two serums and a toothpaste, and uses the bleaching agent chlorine dioxide, which penetrates the tooth to neutralize stains. the product's consultant, dr. abeer al-adhami, explains that chlorine dioxide works by making stains transparent, resulting in whiter teeth. some users, like marie baron, a manager in the publishing industry, report significant improvements in tooth color after using the product for ten days without increased sensitivity or damage to the enamel. however, dr. uchenna okoye, clinical director of the london smiling dental group, expresses concerns about the potential long-term effects of using the product for an extended period or in high concentrations, as chlorine dioxide is acidic and may damage enamel if left on teeth for too long. the makers of the product insist that the risk is minimal since the chlorine dioxide is only in contact with teeth for 30 seconds, but published data on long-term effects is currently unavailable.
1114	ultravisual is a new app for creating and editing gifs on ios 7 or higher. users can upload or capture videos and divide them into eight-second clips, edit individually, and schedule them to play in order. the app also allows editing media with filters, crops, and scales, and sharing into collaborations. accidentally deleted clips or edits can be recovered by shaking the phone. the app is being compared to instagram for gifs and is developed by ultravisual llc.
1115	a 22-year-old california woman, ravel chanel dixon, was arrested and charged with "accessory after the fact" in the november 30 murder of millionaire investor raveesh kumra. dixon was previously arrested on tuesday for offering sex, drugs, or money to an undercover cop, but later linked to the murder investigation. the victim, kumra, was best known for owning mountain winery in the 1990s. his ex-wife, harinder "rani" kumra, was also home during the attack and was tied up. the police believe the murder was not a random act of violence and have released a sketch of a possible suspect, a tall, skinny man in his early 20s with black hair. dixon's charges carry a "gang-enhancement" charge, but the meaning of that is unclear. her mother and attorney dispute the allegations against her, claiming the charges are out of the blue. kumra's mansion in monte sereno was the first homicide site in mountain view, california, in 40 years. the investigation is ongoing, and dixon's bail was set at $1 million.
1116	tatyana mcfadden, born with spina bifida in st. petersburg, russia, endured a difficult childhood after receiving inadequate medical care. despite never being able to walk, she persevered and became a world-class wheelchair racer. in 1994, she was adopted by deborah mcfadden and moved to the united states, where she thrived and became a 15-time world championship medalist and a ten-time olympic medalist. late last year, mcfadden, known as "beast," decided to try paralympic cross-country skiing to compete in her birth country, russia, and inspire those left behind in the orphanage. mcfadden wants people to know there are no limits to achievement with perseverance, dedication, and courage. her proudest moment was fighting for the right to race alongside able-bodied runners in high school, which led to a new law and a change in the face of athletics. mcfadden is grateful for her family, friends, and coaches, without whom her journey would not have been possible.
1117	in the month of may, netflix and amazon are adding several new titles to their collections. netflix is offering a range of movies including '80s classics like "adventures in babysitting" and "the big chill," james bond and godzilla films, and new releases like "pain and gain" and "star trek into darkness." amazon, with its recent deal with hbo, is bringing shows like "the sopranos," "the wire," and "deadwood" to their platform, as well as new releases and seasons of various shows. other titles to look out for on netflix include "top gear: series 20," "scandal: season 3," and "derek: season 2." amazon is also bringing original movies, documentaries, comedy specials, and miniseries to their platform, such as "game change," "too big to fail," and "angels in america."
1118	in port-au-prince, haiti, french rescuers found a 16-year-old girl alive in the rubble who is believed to have been trapped since the january 12 earthquake. the girl, whose name was not disclosed, was located after locals reported hearing a voice in the debris. she was found dehydrated, weak, and had low blood pressure, leading rescuers to believe she had been trapped since the disaster. the girl, who spoke french, was transported to the french medical ship, sirocco, in a helicopter. rescuers estimated it took them 45 minutes to extract her from the rubble. reports indicate that she had access to water in the bathroom of her house.
1119	a british team drilling to reach a lake buried beneath two miles of antarctic ice for potential discoveries of unique microbial life forms has faced delays due to equipment malfunctions. the team, consisting of 12 scientists from the british antarctic survey (bas), have been working around the clock for two weeks to melt their way to lake ellsworth using a hot-water drill. however, the primary burner of their boiler failed during the first attempt, forcing them to use a secondary burner instead. the secondary burner also malfunctioned on saturday, leaving the team waiting for replacement parts while their borehole and equipment begin to freeze. if the replacement parts also fail, the team will have to manually operate the burner to complete the mission before the hole reseals, a task requiring skill and precision. the £7 million drilling project aims to explore the hidden world of subglacial lakes in antarctica, with lake ellsworth equating in size to the uk's lake windermere. the team is working in extremely cold conditions with temperatures around -25°c and winds of 20 knots, and they may only have one more chance to complete the project.
1120	texas a&m football player thomas johnson, a freshman wide receiver, was found safe on thursday after going missing since monday night. he was last seen leaving his off-campus apartment in college station, texas.his disappearance came after the aggies' surprising win against alabama, where he had three catches. worried family members and fans were praying for his safe return. the circumstances surrounding his disappearance and where he was found were not immediately disclosed.
1121	in buenos aires, argentina, on wednesday, sixteen former military officers received sentences ranging from 18 years to life in prison for their roles in human rights abuses during the country's 1976-1983 dictatorship. marianela galli, who was fourteen months old when her parents and grandmother were kidnapped and killed during this period, finally learned the fate of their killers within the packed courthouse. galli's parents and grandmother were among the approximately 30,000 victims of the "dirty war," an era of kidnapping, torture, and mass murder aimed at silencing dissidents. galli's story is one of thousands of those affected by this devastating period in argentine history. the two-year trial provided closure for families and friends of the victims, many of whom gathered outside the courthouse to watch the judge's sentencing on a big-screen television. notable among those convicted was alfredo astiz, who received a life sentence for his role in the death of argentine writer and journalist rodolfo walsh, among other victims. despite his unrepentant attitude, astiz was sentenced for following orders during his role as a navy spy, deceiving human rights activists and choosing which ones to target for disappearance. the removal of amnesty laws in argentina, led by former presidents nestor and cristina kirchner, has enabled these trials to take place, bolstering support for cristina fernandez, who was re-elected on october 23rd after advocating for these human rights initiatives. galli expressed her gratitude to the kirchners for their efforts, stating, "they are the ones who have made these trials happen, and i am eternally grateful to them for it." after over an hour-long sentencing, thousands outside the courthouse reacted with emotions, hugging, crying, dancing, and singing as galli found closure and a sense of justice finally arrived for her family.
1122	a morrisons supermarket manager in taunton, somerset, apologized after suggesting an 89-year-old poppy seller buy a warmer coat and sell poppies outside due to space constraints. shopper veronica roach argued with the manager and shared the incident on facebook, causing controversy. the royal british legion confirmed collectors preferred outdoor collections due to greater footfall. morrisons apologized, donated to the british legion, and allowed indoor collection space. the aged poppy seller wished to remain anonymous.

1125	in the run-up to christmas, high street chains release their festive sandwiches. this year, i evaluated six options: starbucksturkey & bacon panini, costa cheeseboard with chutney panini, eat's festive full works bloomer, morrisons turkey, bacon and stuffing, pret's christmas lunch, and sainsbury's christmas triple and m&s turkey and pigs in blankets on sage and onion bread. starbucks turkey & bacon panini had a bland taste, with odd aroma, and the fillings did not stand out. costa cheeseboard with chutney panini suffered from unappetizing soggy bread and failed to detectably identify the promised ingredients. eat's festive full works bloomer had a generous filling with distinguishable layers and fresh ingredients except for stale bread. morrisons turkey, bacon and stuffing was a basic sandwich with an unappetizing crumbly turkey filling and greasy, limp bacon. pret's christmas lunch had an unfortunate overwhelming crispy onion flavor and a sweet overall taste. sainsbury's christmas triple failed to impress with its stale prawn mayo, disappointing turkey feast, and sweet caramelized onions. m&s turkey and pigs in blankets on sage and onion bread stood out, as the sage and onion bread nicely incorporated stuffing flavor, and the pigs in blankets and bacon tasted good with cranberry sauce. however, the sandwich could have been fresher overall.

1127	a series of leaked emails reveal asma al-assad, the british-born wife of syrian president bashar al-assad, expressing her support for her husband and his regime. in one email, she referred to herself as the "real dictator" and showed no misgivings about the regime's brutal crackdown on dissenters. she even made light of the situation and joked about being the one in control in her family. the leaked emails contradict her portrayal as an unwitting partner to her husband's violent policies and show her fully behind his decisions. despite the ongoing violence and international criticism, asma al-assad stands by her husband and is reportedly more concerned with getting around international sanctions to shop for jewelry and furniture. meanwhile, in syria, violence and clashes continue with the rebel free syrian army claiming responsibility for attacks against regime forces. russia remains the largest supplier of weapons to syria, despite international embargos and controversy over the violent crackdown.
1128	a millionaire businessman, andy bush, was shot and killed in april at his villa in estepona, spain, allegedly by his ex-girlfriend, mayka kukucova. despite the family's wish to bring his body back to the uk for burial, spanish authorities have denied the request, insisting on keeping the body for post-mortem examinations and potential trials. kukucova, who has since been extradited from slovakia for questioning, claims to have acted in self-defense during an argument with bush and his new girlfriend, maria korotaeva. bush's family, led by his sister rachel bush and his daughter ellie bush, have campaigned for his body to be repatriated, and have gathered over 1,980 signatures in support. the case has been taken up by chris skidmore, mp for bristol west, where bush resided, who is determined to help the family achieve their goal. investigators believe bush was shot with an italian-made .38 special revolver. kukucova is expected to defend herself by claiming self-defense during trials.
1129	an arkansas man identified as abdulhakim m. bledsoe, 23, of little rock, is accused of killing private william long, 23, of conway, and wounding private quinton ezeagwula, 18, of jacksonville, at a military recruiting center in little rock on monday. bledsoe, who reportedly went by several names including carlos bledsoe and abdulhakim mujahid muhammad, told police that "political and religious motives" were behind the shooting. he had recently watched a video "pertaining to subversive activities" that spurred him to commit the act. bledsoe pleaded not guilty at his arraignment tuesday and is being held without bail. he faces one count of capital murder and 16 counts of engaging in a terrorist act. witnesses described a black ford sport utility vehicle leaving the scene of the shooting, and police arrested bledsoe after stopping a vehicle matching that description on interstate 630. three guns were recovered from bledsoe's vehicle: an sks semi-automatic rifle, a .22-caliber rifle, and a .380-caliber automatic pistol. several rounds of ammunition, two homemade silencers, handwritten notes in arabic, cds with handwritten arabic labels, a computer, and cell phones were also seized from his vehicle and apartment. bledsoe had previously been under investigation after visiting yemen and was a recent convert to islam. the soldiers were part of a volunteer recruiting program and were outside the building at the time of the shooting. the recruiting center was closed after the incident and several people left flowers, miniature american flags, and notes of appreciation for the soldiers. private long was pronounced dead at the scene, while private ezeagwula was in stable condition. the shooting occurred around 1:20 p.m. local time. arkansas governor mike beebe released a statement expressing
1130	trayvon martin, a 17-year-old boy, was shot and killed in florida while walking back from buying skittles in february 2012. george zimmerman, a neighborhood watch captain, felt threatened and shot martin, raising questions about florida's "stand your ground" law which allows individuals to use deadly force if they feel reasonably threatened and are in a place they have the right to be. the investigation into martin's death continues, and authorities are considering the applicability of the "stand your ground" law to the case. the law's focus on the subjective understanding of the shooter has led to a significant increase in justifiable homicides in florida since its enactment in 2005. two other cases under litigation in the state also illustrate the law's potential consequences. protesters and media critics have called for accountability from florida legislators who passed the law and former governor jeb bush, who signed it, in the aftermath of martin's death.
1131	david moyes, the former manchester united manager, will not be facing any charges after an investigation into an alleged bar room altercation in clitheroe, lancashire. witnesses reported that moyes, who was sacked by manchester united the previous month, was abused by a group of drunken young men before entering the emporium bar. however, the police stated that there were differing accounts of the incident, and after a thorough investigation, no further action will be taken against anyone involved. moyes was hand-picked by sir alex ferguson as his successor at manchester united, but his tenure was considered a failure by many fans.
1132	carlos arredondo, acknowledged for helping jeff bauman during the boston marathon bombings, settled a police brutality case regarding an incident from 2009. arredondo alleged in a complaint that officers david roberto, franciso rodriguez, bienvendio delacruz, and dana lamb forcibly removed him from his truck during a ted kennedy funeral procession. after a five-hour mediation session, the city and arredondo reached an undisclosed settlement. the incident occurred as arredondo refused to move his vehicle and was parked near a flagpole, decorating it in memory of his son who died in iraq. arredondo shared a commencement speech with bauman last week at fisher college, where they both received honorary degrees.
1133	a former bodyguard, fernando flores, filed a sexual harassment lawsuit against britney spears in september 2011, claiming she made unwanted sexual advances towards him during his employment from february to july 2010. in new court documents, flores made additional allegations against spears, accusing her of having disgusting hygiene habits and using drugs. spears' lawyers have filed a motion to strike these latest claims, stating they are false and meant to prejudice the singer in the eyes of the public and the court. flores is seeking $10 million for psychological damage. initially, flores claimed spears exposed herself, created fantasy personalities, and mistreated her children, but these allegations have been disputed by spears' ex-husband, kevin federline. spears is currently on her femme fatale north american and european tour.
1134	west ham manager sam allardyce stood by his comments about manchester united playing long-ball football after their 1-1 draw, but insists it wasn't an insult. allardyce's statement was misinterpreted and made "tongue in cheek," he said in an article in the evening standard. manchester united manager louis van gaal reacted angrily to the claim, presenting diagrams and statistics to prove otherwise at a press conference. allardyce never meant to offend van gaal and even praised him for changing his team's approach during the match.
1135	a nine-month, £60,000 training program, funded by the british taxpayer, is helping gambian rats in mozambique clear mines and save lives. these rats, known as "herorats," are light enough not to set off mines with their body weight and can search larger areas daily than human mine clearers at a lower cost. trained rats have already found over 2,500 mines and 14,000 pieces of unexploded ordnance in mozambique since the end of its civil war. the rats, which are highly intelligent and have an exceptional sense of smell, have lived up to eight years according to mine clearance charity apopo. this british funding not only saves lives but also frees up fertile land for crop growth and contributes to the economy in mozambique.
1136	a study published in the journal of food and nutrition sciences found that consuming rice as part of meals can contribute to healthier diets for over 14,000 us adults. rice has been shown to increase feelings of fullness, leading to fewer calories consumed, and is naturally low in sodium and saturated fat. eating rice is linked to higher intake of essential nutrients like potassium, magnesium, iron, folate, and fiber, while also consuming fewer saturated fats and added sugars. both enriched white rice and whole grain brown rice promote optimal health as they are nutrient-rich complex carbohydrates, adding essential vitamins and minerals like folate, iron, and zinc to the diet. while brown rice has slightly more dietary fiber, magnesium, and phosphorus, it contains less b vitamins and iron than enriched rice, but both are considered beneficial for a sustainable plant-based diet.
1137	a gunman named steven kazmierczak killed five people and injured 16 others at northern illinois university (niu) on february 14, 2008, in a geology classroom building called cole hall. the state will demolish the site and replace it with a high-tech classroom building named memorial hall. kazmierczak, 27, from champaign, used a shotgun and three handguns hidden in a guitar case and a coat during the rampage. he had stopped taking an antidepressant, prozac, three weeks prior, but there were no known signs of violent tendencies from him. the victims were daniel parmenter, 20, catalina garcia, 20, ryanne mace, 19, julianna gehant, 32, and gayle dubowski, 20.authorities responded within seconds and are investigating if there were any indications of the tragedy that could have been anticipated or prevented. niu has an enrollment of over 25,000 students and covers 755 acres.
1138	in january 2014, just months after the birth of prince george, buckingham palace began selling royal baby souvenirs at half price. the sale included homeware, china, tankards, commemorative books, and other branded items at the queen's gallery gift shop and online store. among the discounted items were a prince george limited edition baby bowl priced at £70 (down from £145), a souvenir album reduced from £9.95 to £4.95, and a baby blue commemorative pillbox now selling for £14.95 (originally £30). other pricy trinkets, like a limited edition loving cup, saw dramatic price cuts as well. sales of related objects, such as prince george's christening shawl and the muslin wrap he was wrapped in, had already gone through the roof, with the small, family-run nottingham-based firm behind the white merino wool christening shawl receiving an influx of orders. the duchess of cambridge, who was cited as one of the most influential figures within the fashion industry, saw anything she wore sell out almost instantly.
1139	melinda bachini, a mother-of-six from billings, montana, was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of bile duct cancer in december 2009, given only months to live after conventional treatments failed. she discovered a clinical trial at the national institutes of health in maryland that involved harvesting and replicating her own immune cells to fight the cancer - the first time this method had been used for epithelial cancers. the treatment, which involves extracting and growing cancer-fighting cd4 t-cells, has shrunk bachini's tumours by a quarter since she began treatment in march 2012. this pioneering method, hailed as a "blueprint for treating cancer," targets specific mutations in the immune system, with recent advances in genetic sequencing making it more feasible for solid tumours. despite facing a tough battle, bachini remains hopeful and determined to be there for her family.
1140	british prime minister david cameron announced that about 75 soldiers will be sent to ukraine to provide tactical intelligence and defensive infantry training to help the country defend against russia. cameron warned of "dreadful consequences" if the west appeased russian president vladimir putin and said his goal was to swallow up territory on ukraine's border. the prime minister also criticized russia's annexation of crimea and its support of ukrainian rebels, insisting it had not been a success for moscow. cameron pledged to use economic might to punish putin and keep up the pressure on him from within the european union. there have been calls for the british government to publicly identify russian officials and associates banned from entering the country for their involvement in serious crimes, but the home office has refused to do so.
1141	a jealous royal mail worker, richard otunga, 37, was sentenced to 22 years in prison for murdering his wife, shamim gabriel, 33, in a "horrifying and savage" attack in their flat in northolt, west london. otunga pleaded guilty to manslaughter but was found guilty of murder following a trial at the old bailey. gabriel's family had previously reported incidents of otunga's jealous behavior, including an instance where he held a knife to her throat. the postmortem revealed gabriel suffered from 32 wounds. despite telling her father that she had minor injuries, otunga later told police that his wife came at him with a knife and he acted in self-defense. the judge described the attack as "unrelenting savagery" and "truly tragic" as the marriage was otherwise loving, but polluted by otunga's possessive and jealous behavior. the victim's father, speaking at the trial, expressed his grief and described his daughter as the center of their family.
1142	an 85-year-old retired royal navy chef, bert lock, was trapped in the sliding doors of a barclays bank in bletchley, buckinghamshire, last week, resulting in a fractured hand. the incident left him in shock, and his walking frame was also damaged. despite the incident, barclays has not apologized and reportedly told his daughters that they would have to sue the bank for any financial assistance. engineers have been working on the doors since the incident, and mr. lock has been left unable to cook for his disabled neighbor due to his injury. the family has been unable to receive satisfactory answers from the bank and is considering legal action. barclays has issued a statement expressing concern and stating that the incident is being investigated.
1143	navy adm. mike mullen, the chairman of the joint chiefs of staff, urged the newest class of officers at the united states military academy at west point to bridge the gap between the military and civilians who may not fully understand the sacrifice of soldiers. mullen, speaking to over 1,000 young officers who grew up with america at war in afghanistan and iraq, expressed concern that the public does not truly comprehend the burdens and prices paid by soldiers. he encouraged officers to make an additional effort to engage with civilians, as the all-volunteer military, numbering 1.4 million members, is a small, insular force. mullen and defense secretary robert gates have previously expressed concern about potential alienation of the military and have called for more dialogue to end the disconnect.
1144	a shopper, kate lancaster, was shocked when she was asked for id to buy a packet of melon and grapes at a self-service checkout in tesco, with a warning stating the product was age-restricted due to potential alcohol fermentation. tesco later clarified that this was a misunderstanding and not company policy, with the employee involved having made a lighthearted comment. lancaster, who works in a library and was stunned by the response, criticized the potential impact on healthy eating recommendations and the feasibility of producing alcohol from the fruit. a study promoting the benefits of eating seven portions of fruit and vegetables daily supports her concerns. tesco has apologized for any confusion and sent a fruit basket to lancaster as a goodwill gesture. the cause of the alarm on the till remains unclear.
1145	u.s. secretary of defense leon panetta warned israel of increasing isolation in the middle east during a press conference before his arrival in israel. he stressed the importance of improving relations with neighboring countries such as turkey and egypt for israel's security, and mentioned tensions between israel and these countries, particularly due to the 2010 mavi marmara incident and egypt's opposition to the peace treaty. panetta highlighted israel's military superiority but questioned whether it is sufficient if the country is diplomatically isolated. he plans to encourage peace negotiations between israel and the palestinians, making it clear that both sides need to engage in direct talks without preconditions. panetta will also discuss iran's nuclear program and the need for a collective approach to handling the issue during his meeting with nato defense ministers in brussels.
1146	andrei schurrle, a german world cup winner and chelsea winger, is being targeted by borussia dortmund as they plan to replace marco reus, who is expected to leave the club next summer due to interest from manchester city and bayern munich. schurrle has fallen out of favor at chelsea under jose mourinho, making only four premier league starts and being criticized by the manager after chelsea's capital one cup win against shrewsbury. schurrle and mohamed salah have disappointed mourinho, according to the chelsea boss. dortmund sees schurrle as a potential replacement for reus, who has been dortmund's talisman but is likely to leave due to financial troubles at the club.
1147	north korea has once again provoked its southern neighbor and the international community with hundreds of shells fired across their western sea border, followings threats to test a nuclear device and missile launches. some experts argue that under kim jong un's rule, pyongyang has shown an increased willingness to raise the stakes, making the current situation more unpredictable than before. the regime has expanded its nuclear facilities and restarted plutonium production. north korea warned foreign companies and tourists to evacuate south korea. the latest exchange of live fire was comparatively mild, according to one expert, but may reflect north korean frustration over military drills and improved relations with south korea and the us. despite the limited information available, the un has released a report detailing allegations of human rights atrocities in the country, including extermination, murder, enslavement, and torture. understanding the inner workings of the regime remains a challenge, but there is more information available than is commonly acknowledged. the key question for policymakers is whether kim jong un has fully grasped the implications and safe limits of brinkmanship.
1148	in saudi arabia, there is growing outrage over the case of a 5-year-old girlnamed lama al-ghamdi, who is believed to have been beaten and tortured to death by her father, fayhan al-ghamdi. lama was hospitalized in march with extensive injuries, including broken ribs, a crushed skull, bruises, and burns, and died in late october. activists accuse fayhan of being an islamist preacher who has been popular for his televised appearances. though attempts to contact fayhan and obtain details about the case have been unsuccessful, the saudi human rights commission has confirmed that he is on trial for crimes leading to lama's death. her mother, syeda mohammed ali, seeks justice for her child and has secured a lawyer to represent her in the case. activists, including aziza al-yousef and manal al-sharif, have called for legislation to better protect women and children from domestic violence and criticized the leniency of the saudi courts towards abusers. lama's mother is urging the king to take notice of the situation and set an example by punishing such brutality.
1149	the black knight transformer, a remote-controlled machine developed by advanced tactics for the u.s. military, was recently seen in action for the first time. the machine is a multicopter that can both fly and drive. it was designed for multi-mission medical and casualty evacuation, allowing for reductions in risks involved with many missions. the black knight is capable of driving like a normal off-road vehicle and flying up to 150mph in the air. the machine's eight rotor blades can be sprung out for takeoff and then folded back in for off-road driving. it was tested by advanced tactics earlier this year and is currently being considered by the u.s. marine corps for unmanned cargo resupply missions. the u.s. military commissioned the creation of the black knight as a way to enter and exit dangerous areas without having to send in soldiers. the multicopter is also being used for autonomous casualty evacuation. in related news, the u.s. army successfully tested a laser weapon capable of shooting down drones and mortar rounds in november. the maveric unmanned aerial vehicles were ordered by the pentagon for reconnaissance missions.
1150	a same-sex marriage bill is expected to pass in tasmania's lower house of parliament, making it the first australian state to legalize same-sex marriage. the ruling labor party and the greens are co-sponsoring the bill, which will deliver a potential economic boost of aus$100 million in gay tourism if it passes. this will come despite opposition from some, including prime minister julia gillard and counterpart tony abbott, who argue marriage is between a man and a woman. if the upper house approves, thousands of same-sex couples in tasmania and other australian states and territories may rush to marry, and it could pave the way for broader change. public support for same-sex marriage in tasmania is significant, with some citing a "convict past" contributing to the shift in public thinking towards acceptance. the federal parliament is also preparing to vote on changes to the marriage act to allow same-sex marriage, but the chance of success is minimal as only the ruling labor party is permitting its members a conscience vote. rodney croome, leader of the gay rights lobby, remains optimistic and expects a significant number of same-sex couples to marry if the bill passes.

1152	jennifer aniston, 45, is against plastic surgery and cosmetic procedures, having been moved by the visible effects on the faces of her celebrity friends. she expressed her concerns to yahoo! beauty, stating that "my heart breaks" when she sees them trying to "stop the clock" and looked older as a result. aniston, who has had nose surgery in the past, noted that fiancé justin theroux would prevent her from undergoing any further cosmetic interventions. her stance may prompt controversy amidst her close circle, including best friend courteney cox, who openly supports laser treatments.
1153	israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu vowed to avenge the deaths of three israeli teenagers killed by "evil men" and promised to show the world israel's strength in response. he compared the teens, who were hitchhiking home from school when they were abducted and later found dead, to those who took their lives, calling them "gifted, pure, honest and decent." the search for the perpetrators has led to hundreds of hamas activists being arrested, institutions closing, and homes being demolished in gaza, along with increased airstrikes. israel has named two men, marwan kawasme and omar abu aysha, as suspects and destroyed their homes. the palestinian authority, headed by mahmoud abbas, has also condemned the kidnappings and killings but is feeling pressure as well, with hamas warning of consequences if israel brings a war on gaza. world leaders, including british prime minister david cameron and u.s. president barack obama, have condemned the attacks and urged israel and the palestinian authority to work together to find the perpetrators and avoid further destabilization. human rights watch urged israel to avoid collective punishment, calling the killings a potential war crime.
1154	two planes came too close to each other during landings at detroit metro airport on friday, and three planes came dangerously close to each other during landings at reagan national airport in washington, d.c., on tuesday. the incidents prompted investigations by the federal aviation administration (faa). in detroit, a delta and a regional jet were approximately two miles apart, but standard separation is three miles. neither plane was at risk of collision. in washington, d.c., three regional jets came close due to a miscommunication between air traffic control facilities, with one plane coming within 800 vertical feet and 0.82 nautical miles of another during landing, and another plane coming within 2.07 nautical miles and 800 vertical feet while taking off. the faa is investigating both incidents and plans to take action.rep. john l. mica, r-florida, called for a thorough review of both incidents. in the past, an air traffic controller at national airport was suspended for falling asleep on the job, but no planes collided.
