1741	in january 2013, the florida fish and wildlife conservation commission held the python challenge, a competition to capture burmese pythons in the everglades. these snakes, which can grow up to 18 feet long and number in the tens of thousands, are a problematic invasive species in the area. despite covering over a million acres during the competition, only 68 pythons were captured by the 1,600 registrants. the main goal of the challenge was to raise awareness about the pythons, which likely came to florida in the 1970s as abandoned pets. there are concerns that the pythons, which have no natural predators, have caused a decline in populations of rabbits, foxes, and other small mammals in the everglades. the us fish and wildlife service has banned the importation of burmese pythons and their eggs. the longest python captured, measuring 14 feet, 3 inches, was found by paul shannon and won him $1,000 in the amateur category. ruben ramirez and brian barrows each won $1,500 for capturing the most pythons in the professional and amateur categories, respectively.
1742	linda barker, a 51-year-old tv presenter and mother of one, confidently shown off her toned abs on national television despite initially bringing comfortable clothes for a diving show. at 5ft 7in and a size 10, barker's figure became the talk of the nation, challenging the misconception that older women should hide their bodies away in shapeless clothes. she credits her newfound confidence and go-get-it attitude as contributing factors to her happiness at age 50. the survey revealed that 50 is the age when most women reported feeling the happiest, as they enjoyed better relationships, more sex, and improved physical activity. despite initial criticisms and taboo surrounding aging, older women today feel more liberated and unwilling to be defined by their age. born in yorkshire, barker studied fine art and met her husband, chris, before starting her television career in the 1990s. her controversial bikini appearance on i'm a celebrity... get me out of here! and her subsequent fitness regime have earned her the title of an ageless generation icon. she maintains her figure through exercising, following a healthy diet, and wearing stylish clothes. her upcoming campaign for lingerie firm playtex is a testament to her determination to look fashionable and confident at any age. barker states that she is motivated to stay in shape to avoid the health problems she has seen her aging parents face. she has no plans for cosmetic surgery but does take steps to care for her skin with expensive anti-aging moisturizers and regular facials.
1743	a new study conducted at the max planck institute for human development in berlin suggests that women who play video games for half an hour a day can improve their map-reading skills. the study, which involved women with no prior gaming experience, found that those who played super mario 64 for two months showed new grey matter growth in brain regions associated with navigation and memory. the findings echo earlier studies showing that london taxi drivers, who must create detailed mental maps of the city to pass requirements, have larger hippocampus sizes. the researchers believe that this study is the first to show structural brain changes from playing a video game, but further research is needed to determine the real-world application and if all video games are equally beneficial.
1744	sophie maxwell, a 12-week-old baby from south tyneside, was born with hypoplastic left heart syndrome, a rare congenital heart condition that left her heart's left ventricle severely underdeveloped. despite this, she has undergone major heart surgery and has been allowed to go home for the first time. sophie faces two more operations and possibly a heart transplant in the future. her mother, kerry anne, 27, was faced with an agonizing decision during pregnancy but decided to go ahead with it. sophie spent the first three weeks of her life on a ventilator and was not able to leave the hospital until she was five weeks old. she may eventually need a heart transplant as her heart will never be fully fixed. most babies with this condition have a reasonable quality of life if treated with successful surgery. hypoplastic left heart syndrome is a condition where the left ventricle of the heart does not develop properly, and most babies appear healthy at birth but become breathless if not treated. it is not curable but most children can live a reasonable life if they have successful surgery. only about 60% of patients survive all three required operations, with a life expectancy in the teens.
1745	protests continued in the chinese city of zengcheng over the weekend, with hundreds or possibly tens of thousands of demonstrators clashing with security forces. the violence erupted after reports of rough handling of a pregnant street vendor by security guards. protests also occurred in other parts of china, including lichuan, where local government officials were under investigation for the death of a corrupt official. inner mongolia saw large protests over the death of a mongolian man hit by a coal truck, and military veterans demonstrated in beijing over unfulfilled job promises. the chinese government has reportedly been cracking down on protests amid growing economic and political tensions.
1746	james mcclean, a wigan athletic footballer born in londonderry, northern ireland, chose not to wear a poppy on his shirt during the team's match against bolton wanderers to commemorate remembrance sunday. mcclean explained in a letter to wigan chairman dave whelan that the poppy holds a different meaning for individuals from northern ireland, particularly those from derry, due to the 1972 bloody sunday massacre. mcclean stated that wearing a poppy would be seen as disrespectful to the innocent people who lost their lives during the troubles. mcclean has been criticized in the past for his stance on the poppy, but he insisted that he's not anti-british, a war monger, or a terrorist. he is a peaceful man who believes everyone should live side by side, and he's proud of where he comes from. wigan manager uwe rosler and his coaching staff observed the minute's silence before the game. mcclean did not wear a poppy during a previous game in 2012, while his then teammate john o'shea wore one.
1747	in a conversation with cnn's anderson cooper, madonna discussed her "art for freedom" movement, expressing her deep passion and responsibility for the project. she voiced concerns about the state of humanity and the collapse of civilization due to a low level of consciousness. madonna believes that art and creativity have the power to transform and inspire, and she laments that some great artists might not have been able to succeed in today's climate, as they would be judged based on their personal lives and perceived as brands. madonna has personal reasons for championing freedom and fighting against oppression, having experienced a lack of popularity and a desire to challenge the system. she has used her celebrity to advocate for causes such as gay rights, malawi poverty, and education for girls.
1748	the author, jack cheng, expresses his acceptance of companies collecting and selling his data for advertising purposes, viewing it as the cost of using social media to stay connected. however, he distinguishes this from government surveillance and considers it a threat to privacy. he argues that privacy is not dead but rather more nuanced and contingent on who we're trying to keep things private from. he also acknowledges the prevalence of online masks and subterfuge, allowing for new forms of privacy. however, he expresses concern about the potential for privacy slipping away in the future and the need to be mindful of it. overall, his opinions represent a nuanced perspective on privacy in the digital age.
1749	jan berenstain, co-creator of the beloved "berenstain bears" children's book series, passed away on february 24, 2023, at the age of 88. jan and her late husband, stan, transitioned from cartoonists to authors in the 1960s, creating the first "berenstain bears" book, "the big honey hunt," in 1962. over the past 50 years, more than 330 books in the series have been published, selling over 260 million copies, making it one of the best-selling children's book series in history. the berenstain bears became a popular animated tv show in 1979, with a daily series beginning on pbs in 2002. after stan's death in 2005, jan and her son, mike, continued writing and illustrating new adventures for the bear family. jan resided in bucks county, pennsylvania.
1750	ana hernandez, a 32-year-old spanish lawyer, was found dead in her home in barbugh, yorkshire, in june 2012, with a large amount of painkillers in her system, exceeding recommended levels over 100 times. an inquest failed to determine the cause of her death, as there was no clear evidence of unlawful killing. hernandez had moved to england to live with her fiancé, darren stott, and was found by friends in the house they shared. testimonies from friends and family suggested that hernandez was a healthy and upbeat person who avoided taking medication, while stott was described as controlling and possibly trying to manipulate her with drugs. an open verdict was recorded by the coroner after investigations deemed it unlikely that stott, who was in london at the time, would be able to interview key witnesses to shed light on the circumstances of her death. the case remains a mystery.
1751	eastenders actor steve mcfadden's ex-girlfriend, dr. rachel sidwell, was arrested on valentine's day after mcfadden accused her of attacking him in his car. mcfadden, who plays hardman phil mitchell in the bbc soap, claimed sidwell, a skin specialist and mother of their two-year-old daughter amelie tinkerbell, scratched him. sidwell, 45, was taken into custody after three met police officers arrived at her £1m home she shares with her husband and children. the pair met on the school run and had a year-long relationship in 2008, during which sidwell left her husband and three children and became pregnant. after spats led to their split in september 2009, sidwell returned to her family home. mcfadden, a veteran actor also with two children from previous relationships, was arrested for harassment weeks later, although the case was dropped.
1752	more than 100 orphaned seal pups have been rescued by rspca workers after being separated from their mothers during the recent floods on the east coast of the uk. the pups, some under three weeks old, are in need of constant care and are expected to require up to five months of rehabilitation. the east winch wildlife centre in norfolk, which is currently housing the pups, has reached full capacity and is appealing for public help as the grey seal pupping season continues. the rspca estimates it costs £22 a week to feed each pup, with the ultimate goal of returning them to the wild. the tide surges took place at the height of the grey seal pupping season, leaving hundreds of seals and pups at risk. while many were able to reach higher ground on the sand dunes, many were not, resulting in the large-scale rescue effort.
1753	iranian officials carried out the executions of 16 people, presumably rebels, in response to the deaths of 14 border guards in clashes near the border with pakistan. the clashes occurred in saravan, a town where various rebel groups and drug smugglers are active. among the groups operating in the area are ethnic baluch armed organizations. the border guards were reportedly ambushed, and sources suggest the attackers came from pakistan. the state-run media described the attackers as 'bandits,' and an official stated an investigation would be conducted regarding allegations of abuse against the daughter of detained opposition leader mir hossein mousavi during her visit to him. no information was provided regarding trials for the hanged men, indicating their execution dates may have been advanced in the wake of the border clashes.
1754	tlc's "my strange addiction" returns tonight with new episodes featuring unusual cases of addiction. one episode follows patrice, a 29-year-old londoner who has been consuming bricks since she was 17, having been inspired by her grandmother. patrice, now firmly addicted, can't go a day without eating brick, even tearing holes in her walls to feed her craving. another episode introduces linda, a 56-year-old woman who has been married to a 70-ton carnival ride named bruce for the past three years, while carolyn, a 29-year-old british woman from liverpool, has spent over $40,000 and fifteen years trying to look like her idol, pamela anderson. carolyn's obsession with anderson has led her to undergo numerous cosmetic procedures and change her name to anderson, living out her fantasy of being the actress in los angeles for an episode.
1755	david cameron, the uk prime minister, has suggested that schoolchildren should be taught using imperial measurements such as pounds, ounces, and yards instead of metric units. in a series of media interviews, he expressed support for same-sex marriage, hailed boris johnson as a "star player," and announced plans to offer extended gp surgeries. cameron also revealed that he has not yet apologized to the queen in person for disclosing her reaction to scotland's referendum on independence. during the interviews, he responded to a question about teaching imperial measurements by stating, "i think i'd still go for pounds and ounces." cameron's conference speech is expected to outline his vision for britain. meanwhile, conservative party memorabilia includes merchandise with political slogans and mocking items targeting the labour party.
1756	newlyweds matt and kelly gamblin were left without a wedding cake after one ate it, presumably a dog, at their reception at skipwith hall in yorkshire. the cake, made by the bride's grandfather, was initially thought to have been damaged during transit, but muddy paw prints and dog hairs on the remaining half revealed the true culprit. the couple were disappointed but not ruining their big day, and are unsure which dog was responsible, but guess it may have come from a nearby field.
1757	michael west, a 71-year-old man from gloucester, confronted his thai wife bangon, 50, at a restaurant where she worked with a knife and meat cleaver, threatening to kill her because he believed she was using him for money. the marriage had been deteriorating for several years, and in 2010, west was cautioned for damaging her clothing. they separated late last year, but she continued to accept gifts and have sex with him. on january 4, 2014, west went to the restaurant where she worked, accused her of being a "walking atm," and threatened her with the knife and meat cleaver. he was jailed for a year and banned from contacting his wife or going to the restaurant. west's lawyer argued that he was a jilted and broken man who struggled to cope with the end of the relationship and had an alcohol problem. the judge acknowledged that west felt he was being used but also recognized his alcohol issue and the potential danger of arming himself with knives while intoxicated.
1758	rory mcilroy leads the open championship with a score of 132 (-8) after a second round of 66, despite a brief interruption by a pheasant on the eighth hole. mcilroy is confident in his abilities to handle any weather conditions and opened up a four-shot lead over the chasing pack. the open organizers implemented the first two-tee start in the tournament's history due to poor weather conditions, with play set to begin at 9am on saturday. mcilroy joked about the unexpected visitor on the eighth green, and managed to regroup and make the birdie putt. torrential rain started to fall just minutes after mcilroy completed his round.
1759	thousands of civilians have been displaced due to military operations against suspected militants in north waziristan, pakistan. over 60,000 people, including children, have fled to safer areas in pakistan and afghanistan. the pakistani authorities are opening school buildings as makeshift shelters. the military operation, which began on sunday, aims to eliminate militants, including the pakistani taliban, from the restive province near the afghan border. seven civilians, including two women, were reportedly killed in the conflict, and there have been reports of high transit fees and a shortage of vehicles for evacuation. the causes of the women's deaths are suspected to be sectarian in nature. a drone strike in north waziristan killed six people, according to reports.
1760	the article expresses the author's outrage and concern over the tragic suicide of 15-year-old phoebe prince, who was relentlessly bullied at her massachusetts school. the author, jodee blanco, shares her own experiences of being bullied for being "different" from fifth grade through high school, and the deep emotional pain it caused. she questions why it takes a tragedy like phoebe's death to bring attention to the issue of bullying, and emphasizes that the suffering of millions of bullied students should not be ignored. blanco urges students, educators, and parents to take action to prevent bullying and include those who are lonely and excluded. she encourages students to be kind, educators to stay vigilant, and parents to find social activities for their bullied children. the article ends with a call to action for individuals to make a difference in the fight against bullying.
1761	a chinese man identified as mr. ho, 50, survived a shocking diy accident where a thick metal bar impaled his head while dismantling a property in leye county, guangxi province. the bar, at least an inch thick, passed through the right side of his forehead, behind his left eye socket, and exited through the lower section of his left cheek, close to his jawline. paramedics were amazed he was conscious and transfered him to a larger hospital for complex emergency surgery. x-rays revealed the bar missed critical areas such as the brain and eyeball by mere inches. meanwhile, in an unrelated incident, a woman in chongqing city, south-west china, was instantaneously killed when her car collided with a motorway crash barrier, decapitating her.
1762	kurdish forces, known as the ypg, have retaken the syrian city of kobani from isis after 112 days of intense fighting, according to multiple sources. the announcement comes a day after iraq's diyala province was declared "liberated" from isis. kobani's deputy foreign minister, idress nassan, expects an official announcement on tuesday and confirmed that the ypg is in control. refugees are expected to return once the area is cleared of booby traps. kobani, strategically located on the border with turkey, was declared autonomous a year ago. in iraq, a large-scale military operation to retake diyala province from isis was successful, with at least 58 people killed and over 300 others wounded. isis had been fighting for kobani to expand its territory in syria and iraq as part of its islamic nation. both kobani and diyala have seen heavy fighting and destruction in the ongoing syrian crisis, with airstrikes by the us-led coalition targeting isis in the region since september.
1763	tiger woods visited royal liverpool golf club on saturday to prepare for next week's open championship. woods, who underwent back surgery in march and missed the cut at the scottish open two weeks ago, will be aiming for his 15th major title at hoylake. nick faldo, three-time open champion and television commentator, expressed excitement to watch woods' performance, believing he will provide compelling viewing regardless of his score. faldo remembered woods' victory at hoylake in 2006 and shared his anticipation for similar tactics this year, given the expected difficult conditions. faldo himself returned to competition this year after a two-year absence but missed the cut at this week's scottish open.
1764	a triplex penthouse under construction atop the 88-storey 50 un plaza in manhattan is set to cost a record-breaking $100 million. the luxury property, designed by norman foster, will feature 14 bedrooms, 13 full bathrooms, a fireplace, and 1,500-square-feet of outdoor space, including an infinity-edge pool. the building, opposite the united nations building and the chrysler building, was purchased for $160 million in 2007 but was stalled during the recession. prices for condos in the building will start at $2.8 million, with the penthouse previously being valued at $55 million before being expanded to a triplex. the developers, zeckendorf development and eyal ofer's global holdings, aim to attract wealthy diplomats and international buyers with the finest architecture and amenities. other expensive properties in the city include the pierre hotel penthouse for $125 million, steven cohen's penthouse for $115 million, and the two penthouses at one57 for $90 million.
1765	a homeless man named billy ray harris, who returned a diamond engagement ring to its owner, sarah darling, in kansas city, missouri, was reunited with his long-lost family during a televised interview on the today.com show. harris was left speechless when his siblings, who live in texas, unexpectedly entered the set. the emotional reunion was made possible after the ring return made headlines around the world, and people donated over $180,000 to help harris buy a house and get a job. his siblings, who had believed harris was dead, were overjoyed to be reunited with him after searching for him online for years. harris, who had not spoken to his sister sarah in decades, was also excited to be back in touch with her. the donations and the family reunion have transformed harris's life, and he expressed his gratitude to everyone who helped him.
1766	the bonnaroo music and arts festival, held in manchester, tennessee, celebrates its tenth anniversary this year. originally founded in a new orleans dive bar, the festival now attracts over 80,000 people and offers a diverse musical lineup that includes indie rock, hip-hop, jazz, and bluegrass. co-founder jonathan mayers believes the festival's success lies in its ability to evolve and maintain relevance, balancing mainstream headliners with lesser-known acts. with activities ranging from yoga classes to a water slide, festivals offer a great value for concert-goers. bonnaroo's unique community atmosphere and ease of access make it a successful and popular event. additionally, partnerships with brands like ben & jerry's have resulted in special offerings, such as the bonnaroo buzz ice cream flavor.mayers emphasizes that music is just the beginning for this "huge, never-ending art project," and the festival continues to explore ways to engage the audience and become a platform for creativity.
1767	a former actress, karen williamson, confessed to a friend ten days after murdering an 86-year-old widow, jean dobson, in 2012. williamson allegedly used a hammer and a glass jug to kill dobson in her london home during gardening work. in her confession to the friend, williamson mentioned three mistakes, which included forgetting her hat and being unsure if she wore gloves during the attack or if there was blood on her gearstick. williamson and dobson had previously argued over £20 for a strimmer, during which dobson grabbed williamson's hat. williamson claimed she lost control and couldn't get dobson off her, resulting in the violent attack. after the murder, williamson tried to dispose of evidence, including the hammer and her clothes, and denied the murder charge in court.
1768	scientists have discovered why most people can detect the distinct aroma of an approaching rainstorm. they found that when a raindrop hits an uneven surface like soil or leaves, it traps bubbles of air that shoot upwards and burst from the top of the water droplet. these tiny bubbles carry aromatic particles of oil and dust from the surface, which can then be carried for miles by gusts of wind ahead of the rainstorm. this explanation was derived from high-speed camera studies of water droplets impacting various surfaces. additionally, scientists have been using high-precision laser profilometry with high-speed photographs to understand what happens to debris when an asteroid impacts the earth, as it's impossible to study real asteroid impacts. they found that the liquid 'debris' created by an asteroid impact spreads out in a similar way as when raindrops hit soft sand. this finding could help explain how some soil-based bacteria spread diseases by being carried in the air. the researchers at mit conducted 600 experiments on 28 different surfaces and found that light showers and moderate rain produce more aerosols than heavy rain or thunderstorms, and the type of soil also influences aerosol release, particularly on clay or sandy soil.
1769	a 200-year-old horse chestnut tree in helmshore, lancashire, which has survived two world wars and rioting luddites, is now facing the threat of being chopped down by property developers taylor wimpey to make way for 74 homes. the tree, which is a popular spot for conker collecting and has been a constant feature of the village, is over 50 feet tall and has a large canopy. locals are determined to save the tree, which is a cherished part of the village history, and have set up a facebook group and petition to lobby the developers. the tree has a prominent place in many old photographs of the village and is currently under a tree preservation order. taylor wimpey initially received planning permission to chop down the tree, but after locals intervened, they have suggested a further independent survey to determine the tree's safety. the tree has a large base with deep decay and numerous open wounds, but remains in bloom and locals are hopeful that it can be treated and saved. the council has contacted the developers to discuss possibilities of saving the tree, and local tory mp jake berry supports their efforts to keep the tree in situ. taylor wimpey claims that an independent tree survey identified the tree as unsafe and have suggested further investigation. the local authority recognizes the importance of the tree to the community and is working with the developers to find a solution.
1770	in a speech in australia, lord neuberger, president of the supreme court of the united kingdom, expressed concerns about the uk's eagerness to follow rulings from the european court of human rights (ecthr) in strasbourg, france. he claimed that uk judges had been too quick to assume that ecthr decisions were binding on them, even when these decisions were inconsistent and made by junior legal officers. neuberger also mentioned the pressure the ecthr is under and the fact that some of its judgments are initially prepared by staffers. he suggested that the traditional common law approach may not be appropriate and that the uk needs to be more prepared to disregard ecthr chamber decisions. neuberger acknowledged that the uk has much to learn from europe but also has much to offer. notable examples of individuals who successfully avoided extradition from the uk using human rights laws are abu hamza and abu qatada.
1771	cristiano ronaldo, after an impressive year with real madrid and a challenging world cup campaign with portugal, is currently enjoying the two-week winter break in la liga. he visited his hometown of funchal in madeira to see a new statue of himself unveiled, and is now relaxing ahead of a return to action against valencia on january 4. ronaldo and other la liga players have christmas day off, with no fixtures scheduled until january 3. following the valencia match, real madrid faces a madrid derby against atletico in the copa del rey last 16 on january 7. three days later, they play espanyol in a home league game. ronaldo hopes to defend his ballon d'or title at the awards ceremony in zurich on january 12, followed by the return leg against atletico at the bernabeu on january 15.
1772	since 2009, police forces in the uk have spent over £646,000 on 1,876 touchscreen tablet computers, primarily ipad models, for use by officers. forces have justified the expenditure as enabling officers to be more mobile and efficient, although some have admitted to use for front-line policing. the most popular devices were ipads, with the latest model being the most frequently purchased, though some forces have also invested in more expensive hardware such as hp toughbooks. while some argue the technology saves money in the long term, others have criticized the high cost and called for value for taxpayer money. forces that have disclosed spending include hertfordshire constabulary, city of london police, durham constabulary, sussex police, staffordshire police, derbyshire constabulary, and merseyside police. hertfordshire constabulary spent the most, at £57,598.
1773	beatrice elan, the grieving mother of 11-year-old anaika st. louis from liancourt, haiti, was overcome with emotions upon seeing her daughter's grave. anaika had been trapped under rubble for 48 hours after a 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck haiti on tuesday. rescue teams were unable to reach them, and neighbors attempted to free her using a hacksaw. cnn correspondent ivan watson and photojournalist dominic swann went to the site to bring anaika water and granola bars. she became known as the "little lawyer" in her family due to her aspiration to study law and her strong will to live. despite injuries, including a crushed leg, and internal bleeding, anaika was freed using a power saw and a generator, but she didn't survive her injuries, passing away shortly after. family and community remembered anaika as a talented singer and a beautiful soul, with a love for the bible and psalm 23. her funeral was held in liancourt on friday night, with anaika being buried wearing a girl scouts uniform and a veil.
1774	fulham's fernando amorebieta is in discussions with granada over a move, despite making just 22 appearances for the english championship club since joining on a free transfer last summer. amorebieta, a venezuelan international defender, is reportedly keen to leave due to wage issues. granada are currently in 15th place in la liga. fulham striker bryan ruiz is also attracting interest, with werder bremen offering £3m for the costa rica international who spent the second half of last season on loan at psv eindhoven. malaga have also shown interest in amorebieta.
1775	chris denning, a former radio 1 dj, admitted to 26 counts of indecent assault and three counts of gross indecency towards 19 boys aged between nine and 16 from 1967 to 1984. denning, who was one of radio 1's founding djs and worked alongside stars like tony blackburn, kenny everett, and terry wogan, pleaded guilty during a hearing at southwark crown court. denning, who suffers from several illnesses and is frail, was arrested last year by scotland yard as part of operation yewtree investigation. he is currently remanded in custody and his trial is scheduled for november 24. denning, who was 15 when he left his london grammar school, started his radio career at radio moscow and went on to work for several radio stations before joining radio 1 in 1967. he also worked for decca records and helped launch the careers of the beatles, the bay city rollers, and gary glitter. he has lived in various places in england and ran his own music and video production business before moving overseas. denning's arrest is the latest in a series of celebrity prosecutions following the jimmy savile paedophile scandal, including rolf harris, max clifford, and dave lee travis, who faces a retrial in september.
1776	a woman was killed and seven people were injured, two of whom were seriously injured and transported to the hospital, after a lightning strike occurred along trail ridge road in rocky mountain national park in colorado. the incident happened on the ute crossing trail, which is located off trail ridge road, the nation's highest continuously paved road. the park did not identify the woman who died or the injured individuals. officials urged visitors to check weather conditions and heed lightning warnings while visiting the popular hiking destination, located northwest of boulder in the rockies and known for its extensive hiking trails and natural beauty.
1777	a photograph of a grizzly bear interacting with a camera in kootenay national park, british columbia, became viral. a new video has emerged showing that the bear approached the camera and pulled the strap, causing it to pivot and startle the bear. wildlife photographer jim lawrence had set up the camera to capture animal life but was surprised when the bear came close instead. the bear studied the camera for a while before tugging on the strap and quickly leaving. lawrence advised other wildlife photographers to carry bear spray, keep a safe distance, and get their pictures before moving along.
1778	frenchman philippe croizon, who lost his lower limbs in a 20,000 volt electric accident in 1994, swam for over seven hours straight across the 12-mile stretch of water between papua new guinea and indonesia using specially-adapted giant flippers. despite facing strong currents, tides, and encountering sharks and jellyfish, croizon completed the first stage of his mission to symbolically link the world's continents. he previously attracted worldwide attention for swimming across the english channel in over 13 hours. croizon, a former electrical engineer, will proceed with the second stage of his round-the-world challenge by attempting to swim from jordan's gulf of aqaba in asia to the egyptian coast in africa next month. the final stages will be across the freezing waters of the bering straits from an island in russia to one in alaska, us.
1779	pakistan's complex tax structure, which involves over 70 unique taxes and 37 government agencies, results in a very low tax payment rate, with only around 0.5% of the population paying taxes. the country's budget deficit stands at $17 billion, and the government is attempting to address this issue by creating a vast biometric database, nadra, to register every potential taxpayer. the authorities aim to start by identifying high net worth individuals and offering them a one-time tax amnesty to enter the tax net permanently. for those who refuse, tough measures such as id card, bank account, and travel restrictions will be implemented. critics argue that the amnesty could be used for money laundering, and some believe it is unfair to those who already pay taxes.
1780	amy childs, a towie star and influencer, has become the new brand ambassador for alexis smith lingerie. the label was founded by designer alexis smith in 2010 to provide fashionable and practical lingerie for petite women with larger busts. amy, a size 32dd, has struggled to find attractive bra options for her size and is thrilled with the new partnership. the spring/summer collection includes a limited edition "pink sugar" set and starts at £15.99 for briefs and £29.99 for bras. amy, known for her body confidence, recently completed the london marathon and feels her best. alexis smith lingerie is available to purchase on www.alexissmith.eu and www.amychildsofficial.co.uk.
1781	matias duarte, google's director of android user experience, spoke at the mobile world congress in barcelona about the future of mobile technology. he believes that mobile phones will recognize faces, hands, and create a more tangible experience for users, making objects feel physical and delightful. google wants users to interact with mobile devices as they would in the real world, using gestures and facial expressions. duarte's team is also developing google glass, a wearable computer scheduled for sale later this year, offering a virtual reality experience. mozilla is also entering the market with a new firefox operating system for mobile devices, backed by 13 wireless service providers.
1782	nearly 800 desperate migrants, including women and children, were crammed into the decaying cargo ship "blue sky m" and abandoned at sea by human traffickers. the syrian passengers paid thousands of pounds for the perilous journey, enduring ten days without food, water or fuel. another ghost ship, "ezadeen," was found with 359 starving and shivering migrants in freezing livestock holds. the smugglers made an estimated £2 million from the migrants before abandoning the ships. these illegal migrations have been fueled by the syrian civil war and are now attracting better-off, more middle-class migrants. last year, nearly 3,500 refugees died trying to cross the mediterranean while another 200,000 were rescued. the migrants will be taken to immigration centers and assessed for asylum.
1783	simon walsh, a former aide to boris johnson, is on trial for possessing extreme pornography, including images of sadomasochistic acts that could cause serious injury. walsh, an oxford-educated barrister, denies the charges and insists that the images were not pornographic but simply a record of his consensual activities. he has been sacked from his role as a mayoral appointee to the london fire authority and has been temporarily unable to work as a barrister since his arrest in april 2021. some of the images found on walsh's hotmail account included violent sex acts and a graphic description of a hanging. walsh denies ever hurting anyone or contacting underage boys. he has also been denied access to his computer files since his arrest. the court has heard that walsh's password for his account was "scat" and that he used it solely for his sex life. the case hinges on whether the images fall under the "extreme pornography" criteria, which include depictions of acts likely to result in serious injury. walsh's solicitor has been given special permission to tweet live updates on the trial.
1784	a designer named christopher shellis from the house of borgeize in birmingham's jewellery quarter has created a £105,000 clutch bag called the du palais clutch bag. the bag is studded with 345 diamonds and embellished with 18ct gold clasps, and took over 100 hours to make. it comes with a 1,000-year guarantee and measures 7 inches by 5 inches, weighing 542g. the design was inspired by the buckingham palace gates and is practical enough to hold a purse, makeup, or phone. earlier this year, shellis created the world's most expensive pair of stilettos, which were encrusted with 1,290 diamonds and cost £200,000. despite shellis' claim, the most expensive handbag in the world is the mouawad 1001 nights diamond purse, which is encrusted with over 4,500 diamonds and costs $3.8 million.
1785	a report commissioned by the education charity the sutton trust reveals that professional parents are using their financial resources to buy homes near over-subscribed schools or even purchasing second homes to gain admission. the survey involved 1,173 parents of five to 16-year-olds and found that a third of professional parents moved to areas with good schools, while one in five moved specifically to a school's catchment area. one in 20 professional parents could afford to buy a second home solely for school admission purposes. parents were also more likely to pay for extra-curricular activities and private tutors. sir peter lampl, chairman of the sutton trust, called for reforms, including random allocation of school places and free transportation for low-income families to access a diverse range of schools. professional parents' practices were criticized, but report co-author professor becky francis noted that working-class parents were also making informed choices. the release of the survey came after criticism of grammar schools for being "stuffed full of middle-class kids" by sir michael wilshaw, the chief inspector of schools.
1786	marnie simpson, known for her bold fashion choices on geordie shore, is challenging the trend with a new modest clothing range in collaboration with online retailer lasula.co.uk. the former miss newcastle aims to prove that young women can dress nicely without being criticized or labeled as provocative. the collection, which includes jumpsuits, jackets, and co-ords, caters to those who want to transition from day to night wear. prices start from £18 and items are available online. marnie's understated style was initially an outsider on the mtv show but she is now using the attention to her advantage, promoting newcastle and offering fans a chance to emulate her look. the 45-piece collection focuses on allowing young women to dress young and fun without being criticized for being cheap or provocative. marnie launched the range in newcastle's royal station hotel in response to backlash over the city's portrayal on the show.
1787	the european space agency's planck space telescope recently released new data providing a sharper image of the early universe, revealing more detailed information about its evolution after the big bang. this cosmic microwave background radiation map, created using data from the 13.8 billion-year-old universe, sheds light on various phenomena previously difficult to explain and ties them together. the observations suggest the universe is around 100 million years older than previously thought, with about 100 millionth of a degree temperature variations. the new data also indicates the presence of more dark matter and less dark energy than previously assumed. scientists plan to conduct further analysis to better understand these findings and the implications they hold for cosmology. the planck telescope, which launched in 2009, helps support various space and ground-based research by providing crucial data on aspects of the universe, such as its expansion history. this marks the third generation of attempts to map the cosmic microwave background, with each successive satellite yielding progressively better results.
1788	a paramedic, mark lakinski, with a 30-year career, abandoned a sick patient who later died in may 2009 by dropping him off at an ambulance station instead of taking him to the hospital before finishing his shift. the patient, who was handed over to co-workers, stopped breathing, had a heart attack, and died upon arrival at university of north tees hospital. lakinski, of billingham, teesside, admitted to the health care professionals council (hcpc) that he failed to transport the patient directly to the hospital and has since voluntarily removed himself from the professional register. he was suspended from the register for a year following the incident but attempted to rebuild his career in the private sector, only to face new allegations. the hcpc found lakinski's actions to be misconduct. lakinski was not present during the latest hearing, but the decision to ban him from working as a paramedic stands. the patient's colleagues raced him to the hospital but he succumbed to a heart attack upon arrival.
1789	trey simms, a 17-year-old student from manassas high school in virginia, was charged with manufacturing and distributing child pornography in january for sending an explicit video of himself to his 15-year-old girlfriend. simms' aunt, stacy bigley, claimed that police had already taken pictures of his genitalia for evidence but now want to force him to become aroused using a drug injection to obtain more evidence. simms' defense attorney, jessica harbeson foster, confirmed that the prosecution intends to go forward with this plan and has obtained a warrant for the hospital procedure. simms, who plays football and has no prior criminal record, could face jail time and a lifetime on a sex offender registry if convicted. foster also expressed concern about why only simms is being charged in the case, which involved both parties exchanging explicit content. the case is next scheduled to be heard in court on july 15th.
1790	violent clashes between riot police and islamist protestors in egypt resulted in thirteen fatalities and over fifty injuries today. the muslim brotherhood renewed calls for support of former president mohamed morsi, leading to clashes in cairo, giza, ismailia, and alexandria. protesters set fire to cars, threw fireworks, and hurled molotov cocktails, while security forces launched water cannons and used teargas. the muslim brotherhood, egypt's most organized political group, has seen supporter numbers dwindle since the military-backed interim government's crackdown. the group has been accused of having ties to terror organizations and labeled as terrorist themselves. a referendum for a new constitution is scheduled for later this month, leading to ongoing protests. in related news, an explosion struck a military and police convoy in the northern sinai peninsula, wounding four soldiers.
1791	todd horsfield, a ten-year-old boy from barnsley, south yorkshire, accidentally hang himself with his dressing gown rope on the same day he was named "star pupil of the day" at darton primary school. the incident occurred when todd returned home from school and was asked to tidy his room. in a bad mood, he went upstairs and swung on the dressing gown cord attached to his cabin bed. his tragic death came after he was discovered by his sister, and despite efforts by his mother to resuscitate him, he couldn't be saved. detective constable darren mcconnell of south yorkshire police attended the inquest and reported no suspicious circumstances, as there was no evidence of third-party involvement, bullying, or suicidal tendencies. todd was remembered as a happy boy who enjoyed his family and school. assistant coroner louise slater recorded a narrative verdict, concluding it was an accident and offering sympathy to the family.
1792	a team of four national trust gardeners, known as "daredevil gardeners," abseil down the 50m high cliff face of st. michael's mount off the coast of cornwall three times a year to weed and tend to the succulent plants growing on the castle's 250ft cliff face. the medieval castle, which dates back to the 12th century, is located on an island 300m from the mainland and requires the use of abseiling to access the nooks and crannies for essential conservation work. the gardeners also carry out planting and pruning in the harsh weather conditions and complete extensive training for safety. the castle, originally a benedictine chapel, is cared for in partnership by the national trust and the st. aubyn family, who have lived there since 1647. st. michael's mount is a historic landmark steeped in legend and folklore, and has appeared in various films, including dracula and never say never again.
1793	professor howard milchberg of the university of maryland believes that using an "air waveguide" could enable long-distance communication and various applications like high-resolution topographic mapping, pollution detection, and even laser weapons, by making air behave like an optical fiber. this is achieved by using short, powerful laser pulses to create filaments, which in turn create a wall of low-density air surrounding a core of higher density air, acting as a guide for light beams. the team successfully transmitted light through an air waveguide created in this manner and recorded a stronger signal compared to an unguided signal. future experiments aim to demonstrate the viability of using air waveguides over longer distances for remote chemical analysis and other applications.
1794	andrew anderson, a 19-year-old employee at a goodwill store in naples, florida, was arrested for giving discounts to customers in need, but the charges were dropped after goodwill determined that his actions were for the benefit of others, not for personal gain. anderson, who believed that some customers were unable to afford full prices, was terminated from his job and initially charged with grand theft for allegedly costing the store an estimated $4,000. however, goodwill is not pursuing criminal charges against him, and anderson's attorney, jerry berry, hopes the charges will be dropped.
1795	benjamin knight, 28, of eaton rapids, michigan, was arrested earlier this month for distributing child pornography involving the most 'gruesome' images of babies and bestiality that police have ever seen. the disturbing content was found on his phone and home computers. a fellow customer at an adult store in battle creek reportedly saw him displaying a child porn video, leading to a search warrant for his home. knight is facing eight counts of distributing child pornography and was held on a $250,000 bond. police believe the abusive material was not produced locally and there's no evidence that he appeared in the videos. knight is not married and has no prior criminal record, facing potential sentencing of up to 15 years in prison if convicted. the investigation continues as police sift through his electronic devices.
1796	sam allardyce, the west ham manager, does not regret cupping his ear to the booing crowd after last season's home win over hull, as he looked to shield his players from their frustration. allardyce revealed that he was more concerned about the impact on the players than himself and felt the criticism came after a difficult season which saw west ham flirt with relegation. west ham, who currently sit eight in the premier league, will hope to end their four-game winless streak in the league against relegation-threatened hull on sunday. andy carroll and enner valencia are set to start up front for the hammers, with carlton cole once again on the bench. west ham's only absentees are diafra sakho, who is out with a back injury, and cheikhou kouyate, who has joined up with senegal for the african nations cup. allardyce criticised the senegal medical staff for mistreating sakho's previous injury.
1797	president obama delivered his first speech from the oval office on the gulf oil spill, calling it the worst environmental disaster in american history. he pledged to fight the spill with all resources, make bp pay for damages, and help the gulf coast recover. the rhetoric of the speech received praise, but the private conversation with bp's ceo on wednesday will be more critical in securing action and compensation for affected parties. the commentary suggests that the president's first oval office speech was symbolic but the real test lies in his ability to make bp pay and help the gulf recover in the upcoming private meeting.
1798	a man identified as paul mountain, 38, of darwen, lancashire, was arrested for burglary after police found him having sex with a teddy bear at the crime scene. the bear's dna matched mountain's, and he confessed to police that he was coming down from using amphetamines and had an overwhelming urge for sexual relief. mountain pleaded guilty to burglarizing a shed with the intent to steal. the shed's owner had discovered the break-in and reported the incident to the police, who later found the teddy bear among the scattered contents outside the shed. mountain is currently on bail and awaiting a pre-sentence report.
1799	google, under increasing scrutiny for privacy concerns, has abandoned a facial recognition project for its google goggles app, according to eric schmidt, the company's executive chairman. the software, which would have allowed users to include headshot photos in a database for recognition by the mobile application, was deemed too risky due to potential backlash. google, which has previously faced criticism for privacy invasions with services like google street view and google buzz, has implemented stricter oversight to address concerns. company lawyers and government-policy specialists are now working more closely with development teams, aiming to avoid overstepping privacy boundaries. schmidt also addressed the ongoing competition in the tech industry, mentioning apple, amazon, facebook, and microsoft (google's biggest competitors) and twitter and paypal as honorary mentions. google wallet, paypal's rival mobile-payments service, is currently facing a lawsuit from the latter. schmidt praised apple for producing "beautiful products," while criticizing facebook for its all-encompassing approach to connecting with friends.
1800	steven democker, a former high-flying stockbroker, has been found guilty of first-degree murder for the 2008 bludgeoning death of his ex-wife, virginia carol kennedy, in prescott, arizona. the jury's verdict came after a two-and-a-half day deliberation. kennedy, an artist, was described as adventurous and humble. her skull was shattered in the attack, and no confession, eyewitnesses, or direct evidence linked democker to the scene. authorsities claimed democker, who had accumulated significant debt despite earning hundreds of thousands of dollars a month, killed kennedy in order to claim her $750,000 life insurance policy. democker, who at the time was paying $6,000 monthly in alimony payments, had borrowed $20,000 a month from his father to cover his expenses. prosecutors argued that democker, who was a financial advisor at ubs financial services, concocted a false narrative about a voice in the camp verde jail and had an anonymous email sent to lawyers claiming drug gang members were responsible for kennedy's death. these allegations resulted in additional convictions for first-degree burglary, three counts of fraudulent schemes and artifices, evidence tampering, and contributing to the delinquency of a minor. demonstrating no emotion, democker sat with his daughters as the guilty verdict was read. he is scheduled to be sentenced on november 13, and the prosecution has not requested the death penalty. he could face life in prison or life in prison with a chance of release after 25 years for the murder charge, as well as additional time for other convictions.
1801	the hoh indian reservation in washington state, home to approximately 300 members, is threatened by increasing flooding due to a combination of factors including global warming, logging upriver, and cyclical weather patterns. the low-lying reservation, which is only one square mile in size and mostly situated in a floodplain, has seen several homes abandoned and existing structures sandbagged to keep away floodwaters. the tribe's history is deeply connected to the river and ocean, and according to legend, the hoh were created by k'wati, the "changer," who taught them to live from fishing. however, the same waters that have sustained the tribe for generations now pose a significant threat to their future. the hoh tribe is currently planning to move most of the reservation to higher ground and is waiting for congress to pass a bill that would place 37 acres of national park land in a trust for the tribe, which would help secure funding for new housing. the tide is turning for the hoh as they aim to secure a stable future, leaving their flood-prone lands behind.
1802	galatasaray have sacked italian coach cesare prandelli after a series of poor results led to their elimination from the champions league. anderlecht defeated galatasaray 2-0 in their penultimate group game, securing their spot in the europa league while leaving galatasaray bottom of the group. prandelli had only managed the club for four months and was previously the italy manager, who also failed to advance beyond the group stage at the world cup. galatasaray stated that they were in talks to hire their former defender and current turkey assistant coach hamza hamzaoglu as prandelli's replacement. in his final game in charge, galatasaray were beaten 2-0 by anderlecht, and selcuk inan was sent off.
1803	redmond o'neal, the son of the late actress farrah fawcett, visited her grave on the anniversary of her death for the first time, accompanied by his father, ryan o'neal, and sister, tatum o'neal. they spoke exclusively to cnn during a gathering at the farrah fawcett foundation, where they expressed their happiness for redmond's recovery from drug rehab. the foundation focuses on funding research and clinical trials for anal cancer and pediatric cancers. farrah fawcett had allowed the world to witness her battle with cancer through a documentary, inspiring others facing similar challenges. redmond hopes to become an example for those struggling with addiction, as his recovery serves as proof that it is possible to overcome hardships. the interview concluded with tears and laughter, highlighting the resilience of the o'neal family.
1804	terry brown, a 33-year-old plasterer from basildon, essex, was falsely accused of rape by lisa-jayne samuels, who made up the allegations to get attention from her mother. the false claims saw brown spend a year on bail, during which time he was hounded out of his home by a vigilante mob. brown and his partner, tracey choularton, were surrounded by a gang, and choularton later suffered a miscarriage. brown was left with puncture wounds and dental injuries after being attacked, and the couple was forced to flee basildon due to the threats and graffiti on their home. samuels was jailed for 20 months for perverting the course of justice, having previously made false rape claims in 2010. the false allegations wasted 80 hours of police time and caused significant emotional and physical harm to brown.
1805	the uk government has announced plans to simplify energy tariffs and automatically move customers onto their supplier's best deals, but the reforms will not take effect until summer 2014. energy firms are expected to be restricted to offering a maximum of four tariffs for gas and four for electricity. critics warn that this could limit consumer choice and potentially eliminate some of the cheapest deals for savvy customers. the prime minister, david cameron, boasted about delivering on his promise to ensure energy customers get the lowest tariff. energy secretary ed davey aims to make the energy market clearer and easier to understand for consumers, allowing them to shop around and save up to £300 annually on their bills. however, some believe this could eliminate competition and ultimately lead to higher prices for consumers in the long run. opponents argue that the government should focus on reducing reliance on volatile global fuel markets to effectively lower energy bills.
1806	a transsexual former inmate of lovelock correctional center in nevada, identified as jazmena jameson, has claimed in a new interview that she had a sexual encounter with o.j. simpson in 2013 while he was serving time for a robbery conviction. jameson, who is hiv positive, described her alleged fling with the 67-year-old former nfl star as a one-night stand that involved oral sex. she shared details of their encounter, including how simpson asked to see her breasts, and how she later performed the act in his cell. there is little data on the risk of hiv transmission during oral sex, but a review published in 2008 concluded that it poses a 'low but non-zero transmission probability.' jameson's allegations emerged this week, along with news that american horror story creator ryan murphy will be producing a tv mini-series on the o.j. simpson trial. simpson, who was acquitted of murdering his former wife and her friend in 1995, is currently serving 33 years in prison with a non-parole period of nine years. he has reportedly been eligible for parole since 2017.
1807	the u.s. capitol was briefly evacuated on saturday afternoon after a small aircraft entered restricted airspace near the building. authorities were unable to contact the pilot, leading to the evacuation order. two f-16 fighter jets intercepted the plane and escorted it to mount airy, north carolina, where the pilot was met by law enforcement. the tsa tweeted that it was a "pilot deviation" and no security issues were reported. the library of congress and supreme court buildings were also evacuated. the incident prompted an "aircon red" alert, and visitors to the capitol were unexpectedly evacuated. this is not the first time such an alert has been issued, with past incidents in 2009 and 2011. in separate news, authorities in georgia reported that an attacker was prepared to inflict mayhem at a courthouse, and a wild car chase ended with a suspect being shot to death near the u.s. capitol. additionally, the president's restricted airspace was violated three times in less than 24 hours.
1808	this article showcases a collection of hauntingly beautiful photographs of abandoned places around the world, including lynch, kentucky, an old coal town built in 1917 for us steel workers which has since dwindled to a population of 747, leaving rusted equipment and abandoned buildings; subic bay in the philippines, a former us military base that was closed in 1992 and now consists of crumbling "quonset huts"; kolmanskop, namibia, an abandoned diamond mining town; and sydney's loftus tram shed, an old tram depot with dilapidated trams and trolley buses. other abandoned sites include an elementary school in simacem, indonesia, where chairs sit on empty tables; teufelsberg in berlin, site of a former us listening station; epecuen, argentina, a town submerged by a lake; and haludovo in croatia, a deserted tourist resort. the article also mentions mount sinabung in indonesia, which has caused the evacuation of over 22,000 people due to eruptions in 2010, leaving behind abandoned homes and buildings. overall, these places, while in various states of disrepair, still possess a certain eerie splendor.
1809	the u.s. house of representatives is set to vote on thursday on holding attorney general eric holder in contempt of congress for withholding documents related to the failed "fast and furious" weapons crackdown. speaker john boehner announced the vote after the white house and justice department rejected the latest offer from congressional investigators to turn over some of the documents. the move could be the first contempt citation of a sitting attorney general. the house rules committee approved the procedure for the debate and vote on wednesday, and some house democrats, including members of the congressional black caucus and other caucuses, plan to boycott the vote. the democrats argue that the contempt power should be used sparingly and that the republican leadership's decision to pursue this action serves political purposes rather than legitimate oversight. the white house and justice department have asserted executive privilege over some of the documents, preventing them from being turned over on grounds they include internal deliberations. the fast and furious investigation started after the death of a u.s. border patrol agent, and democrats argue that republicans are using the issue to discredit holder and the president in an election year. republicans claim that holder and the justice department are concealing details of how the operation was approved and managed. the showdown between republicans and holder dates back to subpoenas issued last year by the house oversight committee, and recent allegations of white house links to the operation have also emerged. the house oversight committee chair, darrell issa, has faced criticism from democrats for conducting an improper investigation of holder and the operation, and some gun rights advocates maintain that the program was a way for the obama administration to push for new gun-control laws. the nra, a major force in washington, has weighed in on the issue, supporting the contempt resolution and warning of electoral consequences for those who vote against it.
1810	in "great canal journeys," an elderly british couple, timothy west and prunella scales, embark on a 50th wedding anniversary trip around the canals of britain in their hired narrowboat. known for their long-standing love of boating and their successful acting careers, they reminisce about their past and encounter various characters along the way. prunella, who has a mild form of alzheimer's, finds joy in the present moment and the simplicity of canal life, while tim expresses concerns about aging and forgetfulness. the series offers a heartfelt and humorous look into their marriage and their appreciation for the peaceful rhythm of canal travels.
1811	in amsterdam's dam square, hundreds of dutch men and women participated in a tomato-throwing event to protest russian sanctions blocking european fresh produce imports. however, the main goal for many was the joy of throwing tomatoes at each other. the chaos consisted of a one-hour food fight where around 1,000 people paid €15 to pelt others with tomatoes. proceeds will support tomato growers affected by the sanctions. the netherlands, one of the world's largest tomato exporters, sold £80 million worth to russia last year. with music playing and a countdown, a shipping container filled with 120,000 unfit-for-human-consumption tomatoes was released into the arena. participants, most wearing white before the fight, enjoyed the tomato war, covered in red goop and described the experience as fun but chaotic. the event resulted in unbridled excitement for the participants, with some even comparing it to an annual tradition.
1812	pamela anderson, the former "baywatch" star, has become a part-owner of the race alliance sports car racing team in the inaugural fia gt series. along with her racing partner markus fux, they had previously competed in the european le mans series in 2012 but failed to continue with downforce1. race alliance aims to make a recognizable name for itself in motorsport and will contest the full fia gt series next year, nurburgring 24 hours, and potential future entries in nascar. the team's drivers include vitantonio liuzzi, a six-year formula one veteran, and mathias lauda, son of triple f1 world champion niki lauda. they will race a ferrari 458 italia in the remaining three races of the 2013 season. sebastian loeb, a nine-time world rally championship winner, leads a competing team, the sebastian loeb racing team.
1813	darfur, a region in western sudan, has a long history of violence and human rights abuses. in october 2022, human rights watch reported that sudanese soldiers raped over 200 women and girls in the town of tabit over a 36-hour period. the soldiers reportedly went house-to-house, leaving men outdoors and targeting women and children. the united nations and african union have a peacekeeping force in darfur but have been prevented from conducting a credible investigation into the incident. the sudanese government denies the allegations, dismissing them as false and contrary to local customs. the united states and the united nations have expressed concerns about the lack of investigation and urged the sudanese government to allow access. darfur has experienced violence since the early 2000s, leading to an estimated 300,000 deaths and 2.7 million injuries. sudanese president omar al-bashir is charged with genocide, war crimes, and crimes against humanity by the international criminal court but has not agreed to stand trial. despite seemingly positive developments like the declaration of independence for south sudan and peace deals between rebel groups and the government, violence and insecurity persist in darfur.
1814	bobby hogg, the last known speaker of the cromarty fisherfolk dialect, a unique scottish language originating from a remote fishing village, has passed away. the dialect, which was distinct from standard english with no "wh" pronunciation and no "h" aspiration, has now become extinct. this is the first extinct dialect in scotland, according to robert millar, a linguistics reader at aberdeen university. the decline of cromarty fisherfolk is symptomatic of a broader trend of language loss, with over 6,000 to 7,000 languages in the world disappearing at a rate of one every two weeks. the loss of languages represents the loss of diversity, stories, and cultural knowledge. the dialect's decline was influenced by the industrialization of fishing practices and the shift towards the dominant english language in scotland. efforts are being made to save other endangered dialects, such as the one in avoch, and to increase literacy in and appreciation for the scots language. the scots language has faced stigma and marginalization, but recent efforts toward its preservation include increased publishing and government support.
1815	louise, the partner of thomas eric duncan, the first person diagnosed with ebola in the united states, expressed her desire for the ordeal to end as she and her family members remain quarantined in an apartment due to potential exposure to the virus. authorities have told them that stepping outside could result in being charged with a crime. the situation has been frustrating for louise, as they have run out of food and experienced power outages due to storms. however, dallas county director of homeland security and emergency management, judge clay jenkins, is working on relocating the quarantined individuals to better living conditions. the apartment was reported to have some hygiene issues, and federal officials have faced criticism for the handling of the quarantine situation, including the continued presence of duncan's sweat-stained sheets and the lack of food for the quarantined individuals. ebola expert dr. sanjay gupta finds it disturbing that the sheets have not been removed, despite the virus's ability to live outside the body and on surfaces. the overall response from health authorities has raised concerns, with some experts calling it "hair-raising."
1816	former manchester city and ac milan soccer player mario balotelli, 23, has admitted on twitter that he is the father of his 18-month-old daughter pia, who was born in december 2012. balotelli had previously denied paternity despite his ex-girlfriend raffaella fico's confirmation.the two engaged in a public and bitter battle in the italian media, with balotelli launching legal action against his parents who were dragged into the dispute. balotelli had refused to see pia before finally agreeing to meet her this weekend when ac milan play in naples. balotelli and fico split in april 2012 after she found out about his infidelities. he is currently in a relationship with model fanny neguesha and has posted pictures of them on twitter. balotelli has been linked with a return to the premier league, with chelsea reportedly interested.
1817	alexis sanchez's excellent performance against hull city led to calls for him to be named premier league player of the year, but such claims are unwarranted as any decent player would look good in arsenal's side. sanchez has been good, but not consistent, and there have been periods where he went missing. he has not significantly improved arsenal over last season, and his teammates have underperformed at times as well. manchester united's david de gea, cesc fabregas, eden hazard, david silva, sergio aguero, and wayne rooney are among the players being considered for the award. however, manchester united's big-money signings have been injured for considerable portions of the season, and radamel falcao's high wages have not translated into results. manchester united's player most likely to win the award is wayne rooney, who has taken on the captaincy roles at both manchester united and england while delivering goals and helping integrate young players into the team amidst the pressure of leading them back into the top four. rooney's leadership has also resulted in a 100% record with england as captain.
1818	the author, ayesha, shares her meticulous packing routine for long-haul trips. she starts by packing everything she may need three days before her travel, then narrows it down to only work essentials. she tests the weight of her suitcase and leaves it for a day before repacking and folding her clothes efficiently. ayesha travels with a few essentials in her hand luggage, including a notebook and pen, a cardigan, a second purse for foreign coins, an ipad, a book, and yellow headphones for entertainment. she learned her lesson about not bringing fruit on planes after being fined for forgetting about an apple in 2006. her travel essentials also include a digital camera for her passion for aviation photography. follow ayesha on twitter at @ayeshacnn.
1819	the supreme court, in a 7-2 decision, upheld kentucky's use of lethal injection as a constitutional means of executing prisoners, ruling that the three-drug cocktail used does not constitute "cruel and unusual punishment." the ruling comes after kentucky inmates ralph baze and clyde bowling jr. challenged the state's procedure, claiming that the first drug, sodium thiopental, wears off too quickly and leaves prisoners awake and feeling pain during the execution. the court ruled that inmates had not proven that the risk of pain from poorly administered procedures, and the lack of adoption of new alternatives, justifies a constitutional challenge. the ruling allows states to resume executions and provides guidance on the constitutionality of lethal injection procedures. the dissenting justices urged states to consider alternatives to minimize the risk of causing severe and unnecessary pain. baze was convicted of killingtwo lawmen in kentucky in 1992, while bowling was sentenced for the1990 murder of a couple and the wounding of their 2-year-old son in louisville. a texas inmate was executed in september, but the supreme court subsequently imposed a de facto moratorium on executions while considering this appeal. the court had spent six months debating the threshold for unconstitutional execution procedures, and both sides were hoping for clear guidelines. different states and judges have applied varying standards for inmates seeking to challenge the method of execution. recent executions in florida and ohio faced significant issues in administering the lethal injection procedures.
1820	a former kentucky official, raymond curtis smith, shot and killed his much younger ex-lover, robin smith, and her father, michael smith, at their home in pineville on august 13, 2013. smith then fled the scene and shot himself dead at his own father's graveside in hammons fork cemetery. the pair had recently ended their relationship, and victims michael dustin smith and michael smith were both shot once in the home. robin smith was critically but stable in the hospital after being shot in the bedroom. smith's troubled term as knox county judge executive included arguments with the county jailer, the closure of the jail, a divorce, bankruptcy fraud charges, and assault charges. smith was sentenced to federal prison for mail fraud in 2008. michael dustin smith was remembered as a loving grandfather and a cheerleader in high school. the deaths stunned friends and relatives, who are now praying for robin's recovery.
1821	the consumer product safety commission (cpsc) is suing the maker of high-powered magnet desk toys, maxfield & oberton, to stop selling their products due to risks of intestinal injuries from swallowing. at least a dozen incidents of ingestion of buckyballs and buckycubes magnets have occurred since 2009, requiring multiple surgeries and prolonged hospitalization. the company, which markets the products to adults, has warning labels and a public awareness campaign about magnet safety. cpsc has received over 200 reports of magnet ingestions since 2008, with over 20 of high-powered magnets. the commission worked with the company on recalls and education, but injuries continued. the agency filed an administrative complaint against maxfield & oberton and several retailers have agreed to stop selling the magnets. the cpsc rarely files such lawsuits and said parents need to be aware of the hazard, as ingestion of two or more magnets can cause infections and require emergency surgery. braylon jordan, whose son swallowed eight magnets, is relieved about the cpsc's action. mattel ceo also mentioned the importance of rigorous standards after a massive toy recall.
1822	a jetblue airways plane en route to palm beach international airport from westchester county airport in new york made an emergency landing at kennedy airport this morning after striking a bird. the airbus a320, carrying 142 passengers, collided with the bird about 25 minutes after takeoff. the pilots declared an emergency and diverted the plane to jfk as a precaution. the incident resulted in no injuries, and the port authority confirmed the report of a bird strike. a bird carcass was found lodged in the plane's nose, and there appeared to be a hole and bird's blood on the aircraft. the faas will investigate the incident, and the bird species was not immediately identified. this emergency landing shares similarities to the "miracle on the hudson" incident in 2009 when a us airways flight struck geese after departing laguardia, and the pilot made a successful emergency landing in the hudson river, with all 155 people on board surviving.
1823	the jamala wildlife lodge at the national zoo and aquarium in canberra, australia, offers a unique luxury accommodation experience where guests can wake up next to lions, eat with lemurs, and even share a bath with bears. the lodge, which opened last week, is spread across three locations in the zoo and includes 18 rooms ranging from giraffe treehouses to jungle bungalows. funds from the lodge will support the zoo's endangered species breeding programs. the facilities offer private views of the animals and include communal areas and private tours of the zoo. the lodge is expected to boost tourism and generate revenue for the family-run zoo, which receives no government funding.
1824	taylor lianne chandler, a 41-year-old woman, has revealed that she had a romantic involvement with 12-years younger swimmer michael phelps, after they matched on tinder. chandler, who was born intersex, claimed that once they met in person, their relationship seemed serious. they had met before when chandler allegedly attended one of phelps' arrests on suspicion of dui in september 2020. according to chandler, they had a fulfilling sex life, but are no longer together. her reasons for the split remain undisclosed, but she insists it's not due to her past or phelps discovering her gender identity. phelps is currently serving a six-month suspension from swimming after the dui incident. chandler has been an advocate for gender rights throughout her life, having undergone corrective surgery in her early twenties and facing various legal issues related to her gender identity throughout her teens and early adulthood.
1825	cleveland police are investigating a racist gesture allegedly made by a middlesbrough fan towards blackburn rovers striker rudy gestede during the championship match at the riverside stadium on november 29, 2022. the incident occurred after gestede scored an injury-time equalizer in a 1-1 draw. the football association (fa) is also investigating the incident, which was reported to referee mark clattenburg in his official report. anyone with information about the suspect is asked to contact cleveland police or crimestoppers anonymously.
