2239	g4s, a security company, has accommodated over 400 asylum seekers in four-star hotels in barnsley, yorks, due to a shortage of beds in specialist hostels. the holiday inn and ramada encore provided luxurious amenities like satellite tv, free broadband, and 24-hour room service. g4s did not inform the police and council about the change as required in their contract. the exact cost is unknown, but a night at the holiday inn is over £100 for bed, breakfast, and dinner. asylum seekers usually stay at angel lodge in wakefield, which has 250 beds. a g4s spokesperson said they did not share the reason for choosing the hotels and that the company absorbed the additional expenses. the home office is aware of the temporary arrangement but has ended it, and they continue to monitor and sustain performance levels while ensuring community cohesion. g4s has faced criticism for its failure to provide enough security staff during the london 2012 olympics and holds the government contract to accommodate asylum seekers.
2240	a small english village, dry doddington, is drawing attention for its leaning church, st. james's, which has a greater tilt than the leaning tower of pisa. the villagers, who are proud of the architectural mystery, hope it will attract tourists. st. james's church dates back to the 12th century with the tower and spire added 200 years later. the tower leans 5.1 degrees to the west compared to pisa's 3.99 degrees and has been a topic of curiosity for locals and drinkers at a nearby pub, who often joke about having too much to drink. the cause of the lean is unknown, with theories including improper foundations or shifting soil. the village has only 220 inhabitants and is mentioned in the domesday book. villagers plan to raise funds for repairs and want experts to verify their findings.
2241	sunderland manager gus poyet has reached an agreement with liverpool to borrow defender sebastián coates on a season-long loan. however, due to premier league regulations, poyet cannot sign two players from the same club on loan and must choose between coates and striker fabio borini. coates, a uruguayan international, has had limited game time at liverpool, starting only six premier league games in three seasons, and manager brendan rodgers is allowing him to leave for first-team experience with liverpool receiving a loan fee. coates made a late appearance as a substitute during uruguay's world cup victory against england and poyet hopes his addition will strengthen sunderland's defense. negotiations for borini's return to sunderland have not progressed thus far.
2242	usain bolt, the jamaican sprint legend who had a quiet 2014 due to injuries, made headlines in times square, new york, as he promoted puma's new ignite running shoes. bolt felt overlooked after american sprinter justin gatlin took advantage of his absence and became the world's top sprinter. despite this, bolt expresses that he welcomes competition and is eager to re-establish himself as the dominant force in the sport. bolt is set to return to jamaica to resume training for the new season, expressing his excitement on social media with the hashtag #foreverfaster.
2243	the video game industry is experiencing a shift in revenue sources, with traditional disc-based games on consoles and pcs expected to decline to $4 (£2) out of every $10 (£6) spent in 2014. online games and mobile gaming are on the rise, accounting for 31% and 28% of revenue, respectively. this trend is due to increased popularity of digital downloads and mobile gaming, which offers cheaper and more accessible options for gamers. console sales, specifically for sony and microsoft, have been strong but weak for nintendo, contributing to an overall decline in sales for the 8th generation of consoles. while spending on disc-based games is anticipated to peak again in 2016, further growth depends on the success of value-oriented plays from android micro-consoles. although some predict the decline of console gaming, analysts believe there will always be a market for dedicated console gamers and that innovation in gaming technology, such as oculus rift vr and android micro-consoles, presents an exciting future for the industry.
2244	holly foster, a 22-year-old from kent, proudly embraces a vintage style reminiscent of the 1950s, as she was recently crowned "miss vintage uk." foster emphasizes the importance of dressing "like a lady and being treated like a lady," as she believes provocative clothing encourages unwanted attention and a lack of respect from men. she encourages young women to wear longer skirts and admonishes contemporary pop stars like miley cyrus for providing a negative influence on body image. foster, who grew up watching old movies and became a fan of the musical "grease," started her vintage transformation at age 17 and has since spent over £2,000 on her collection. although some of her friends and family find her look humorous or peculiar, she has received positive attention from the vintage community and men, who appreciate her classic style. despite her admiration for burlesque performers like dita von teese, she advocates for responsibility in both designing and wearing clothing, believing it should reflect maturity and respect. she also feels dressing for one's unique body shape can help reduce body image issues.
2245	oleg topalov, a man accused of two counts of murder and illegal possession of firearms, escaped from russia's notorious matrosskaya tishina prison in moscow using a spoon and bed sheets. topalov, described as mentally abnormal, carved a hole in the ceiling of his cell and escaped through the ventilation vent. this is the fourth escape from the infamous prison in 20 years and the first in moscow in 12 years. the prison, which opened in 1918, is in need of building maintenance, making it easy for topalov to dig himself out. he jumped from the roof into a neighboring block and then lowered himself to the ground using a rope made from bed sheets. authorities have launched a manhunt and offered a reward for information leading to his capture. topalov had been held at matrosskaya tishina for over a year before his escape.
2246	a massive tornado that hit an oklahoma city suburb on may 20, 2013, left at least 24 people, including two infants, dead and caused an estimated $2 billion in damage. the tornado, which was on the ground for 40 minutes, left a 17-mile-long path of destruction, affecting up to 13,000 homes. many renters, who do not have renters' insurance, will not receive financial assistance. the tornado was an ef5 twister with winds of at least 200 mph, making it the first of its kind in 2013. authorities are working to identify the victims, with 23 having been identified so far, including 10 children. the long-term costs of the tornado include rebuilding or repairing homes, increased home insurance premiums, and other expenses. officials plan to implement stricter building codes to require tornado shelters in new homes. the tornado destroyed entire neighborhoods, leaving residents to salvage what they could and deal with the emotional trauma. damage assessments suggest that the properties within a mile of the tornado's track could cost between $2 billion and $6 billion to replace. rescue workers and emergency services have been working tirelessly to find survivors and handle health care needs.
2247	a drug dealer, leo barnes, accused of murdering two pensioners, cynthia beamond (80) and philip silverstone (67), was found dead in his prison cell at hmp hewell in redditch. he was due to be cross-examined over the killings last friday but was found hanging in his cell yesterday. mrs. beverley hadley, daughter of cynthia beamond, expressed disappointment and sadness that barnes would not face justice for the brutal crimes. the pensioners were found dead in separate incidents in the west midlands and london in june 2014. barnes complained of feeling unwell and was excused from the trial before his death. he had denied two counts of murder and claimed he had witnessed the attacks but did nothing to intervene. the independent prisons and probation ombudsman will conduct an investigation into barnes' death in custody. police have supported the families of the victims and notified barnes' next of kin. barnes' sexual encounters with suspects and the intruders were key parts of his trial evidence.
2248	india, the second-largest producer of cotton and the biggest consumer by china, has imposed a ban on cotton exports, but is now considering lifting the ban due to pressure from farmers and potential cabinet members. india instituted the ban to ensure cotton supplies for domestic textile companies, but the move has led to protests from cotton-producing farmers and concerns from global trading partners, particularly china. the ban has added volatility to the cotton market, which has already experienced sharp price swings in the past two years due to export restrictions and mill defaults. the outcome of the cabinet review is expected to be announced today, and there is a "realistic, high chance" that the ban will be lifted. china, which has bought large amounts of foreign cotton for its government reserve, has lodged a formal protest against india's ban. indian farmers have suffered from lower prices due to higher production this year and need to export to recover losses, while domestic textile companies have struggled to compete with rivals in bangladesh and pakistan due to rising cotton prices in india. the trade regulator's move to lift the ban is expected to push down cotton prices in the country. cotton prices have risen this year due to the ban and peaked at an all-time high of over $2 a pound last year. the article was published by the financial times on march 12, 2012.
2249	in the 24th minute of manchester city vs arsenal, referee mike dean controversially awarded arsenal a penalty after vincent kompany was seen blocking nacho monreal inside the box, despite replay evidence suggesting dean may not have seen the foul. arsenal's santi cazorla scored the resulting penalty, and monreal put in a heroic performance as arsenal went on to win 2-0, leaving city five points behind league leaders chelsea. although some believed kompany made no attempt to play the ball and intentionally blocked monreal, others questioned the validity of the call due to dean's apparent preoccupation with the ball rather than the off-the-ball incident. regardless, sportsmail's graham poll believed it was an "excellent decision" for dean to award the penalty based on kompany's actions, labeling it a foul and unnecessary challenge.
2250	on christmas day 2013, police in melbourne, florida, decided to add some holiday cheer to traffic enforcement by giving out scratch-off lottery tickets to motorists caught breaking the law instead of just issuing warnings or tickets. officers purchased the tickets with their own funds, and by 1 p.m., over 30 tickets were handed out, surprising and delighting drivers. no big winners have been reported yet, but traffic violators received an unexpected treat while the road safety was maintained. the innovative approach aims to improve the public's perception of law enforcement and christmas-time traffic patrols.
2251	the american fitness index, released by the american college of sports medicine, ranked minneapolis-st. paul as the fittest city in america for the third year in a row. factors considered in the ranking include smoking rates, obesity, access to healthcare, parks, recreational facilities, and farmers' markets. minneapolis-st. paul outperformed other cities with a lower incidence of heart disease and diabetes, and higher rates of physical activity, public transit use, and biking and walking to work. oklahoma city took the last place due to high smoking and obesity rates, few parks and recreational areas, and high rates of asthma and diabetes. the top 5 cities were minneapolis-st. paul, washington d.c., portland, oregon, san francisco, and denver. cities can improve their rankings by investing in parks and recreational areas, imposing smoking bans, and promoting active lifestyles.
2252	the author, dean obeidallah, confessed that he had grown complacent with his iphone and even considered switching to other brands. however, the new iphone 5s with its advanced features such as a faster processor, updated camera, and touch id system has rekindled his love for the iphone. he acknowledged the convenience and personal history he has with the device, citing instances where it helped him in various situations. in contrast, he dismissed the blackberry as being inferior to the iphone, expressing his loyalty to the brand despite its flaws.
2253	harold jellicoe percival, a world war ii veteran and last survivor of the dambusters raids, died at the age of 99 with no close family or friends. his funeral was expected to be a small affair in an almost empty chapel, but after a newspaper appeal and an online campaign, hundreds of people came to pay their respects on armistice day. the turnout included current and former military personnel, some on leave from afghanistan, and civilians moved by the veteran's service to his country. the funeral was held in lytham st. anne's, lancashire, with a two-minute silence observed and the dambusters march played as the casket was carried in. speeches emphasized the power of the written word and the common humanity of those in attendance. due to overcrowding, some mourners stood outside in the rain. an attempted disruption by the british national party was unsuccessful. the funeral was a testament to the british public's appreciation for percival's service and was disrupted only by the bnp's attempt to use it for political promotion. elsewhere in britain, various armistice day commemorations took place, with silences observed at memorials and services held in staffordshire, liverpool, belfast, and whitehall.
2254	easyjet, a low-cost airline, is launching its first television advertisements targeting business travelers as part of a £8.5 million campaign called "business sense." the ads, which premiere in the uk, feature a white rabbit with a pocket watch calmly making his way through a chaotic airport to an on-time flight, contrasting the rushed behavior of other passengers. easyjet hopes to attract more business travelers, who currently account for over a fifth of its passengers, with its punctuality, flexible tickets, allocated seats, fast-track boarding, and higher frequencies. the airline is competing with rival ryanair for the lucrative business travel market and plans to spend 20% of its marketing budget on campaigns targeting this audience. the ads will also be featured in print, outdoor, and digital media in france, germany, and portugal. the ads, which will be narrated by actor hugh laurie, will use the "i'm late" song from alice in wonderland to highlight easyjet's on-time performance.
2255	during his final visit to north korea, french photographer eric lafforgue took hidden photographs revealing the extreme poverty and deprivation endured by the north korean people despite the regime's efforts to hide it. lafforgue, who was banned from north korea after saving the images, captured soldiers performing menial tasks, children working, people suffering from malnutrition, and barefoot children. he also took photos of dilapidated buildings, draconian clothing regulations, and signs of poverty in pyongyang that contrasted with the regime's carefully maintained facade. despite being asked to delete the images, lafforgue managed to save them, illustrating the stark reality behind the north korean regime's controlled image.
2256	tory mp robert halfon will address parliament on october 21, 2013, in a debate about the bbc's future. he will argue against the bbc licence fee, which he believes is a "coercive system" and a "medieval anachronism," calling it undemocratic and arguing that fee payers should have more input in programme-making and celebrity pay. the bbc, which receives £3.6 billion annually from the licence fee, faces criticism following scandals such as jimmy savile and large executive payouts. public trust has been eroded, and halfon proposes that licence fee payers should be treated like shareholders, with the ability to vote on the election of the chairman and board, and have a say in programme making and celebrity pay. the bbc's director general, tony hall, may come under fire during the debate as the corporation faces criticism for its monopolistic position, large payouts, and lack of democratic accountability.
2257	thai authorities have been accused of towing rohingya refugees out to sea and abandoning them, according to a cnn investigation. witnesses and tourists have reported seeing refugees being detained on thai beaches and then towed out to sea. one refugee, iqbal hussain, told cnn that his boat with over 190 people aboard was towed out to sea and abandoned, resulting in several hundred deaths. the thai military denies these allegations but has launched an investigation. the rohingya, a persecuted minority in myanmar, have been fleeing their country in rickety boats for years, seeking a better life in thailand. however, many have instead found deprivation and the risk of abandonment far out at sea. the thai government is taking the issue seriously and has called for an emergency meeting to address the situation.
2258	max verstappen, a 16-year-old racing prodigy and the son of former formula one driver jos verstappen, is set to become the youngest driver in formula one history after joining scuderia toro rosso for the 2015 season. verstappen, who turns 17 in september and currently competes in formula 3, expressed his excitement about the opportunity to debut in formula 1, which has been his career goal since he was seven years old. toro rosso team principal franz tost described verstappen as "one of the most skilled young drivers of the new generation" and expressed confidence in his ability to handle the challenge. verstappen offered gratitude to those who have supported him throughout his career, including his father, sponsors, and various racing teams. he promised to give his best in the pinnacle of motorsport, while also expressing hope for the return of the verstappen name to formula 1 and the potential for renewed fan support.
2259	the war crimes trial of ratko mladic, a former bosnian serb commander accused of orchestrating ethnic cleansing during the yugoslav civil war, was suspended on thursday due to the prosecution's failure to disclose all evidence against him. the trial, which began the previous day, focused on the massacre of up to 8,000 muslim men and boys at srebrenica. however, the defense called for a halt after discovering that the prosecution had not shown them all the evidence. the suspension could last for weeks, and lawyers will meet the judge to discuss how to proceed. mladic, who showed no remorse at the trial, is accused of 11 counts of genocide, war crimes, and crimes against humanity. the trial is taking place at the international criminal tribunal for the former yugoslavia in the hague. ratko mladic eluded authorities for nearly 16 years before his capture in 2011. he has defied authorities throughout his trial, showing little remorse and trying to disrupt proceedings. the trial is significant because it marks the latest effort to hold perpetrators of atrocities accountable for their actions, coming after the trial of former liberian president charles taylor in may 2011. mladic is accused of leading bosnian serb forces in the slaughter of nearly 8,000 muslim men and boys in srebrenica in 1995.
2260	emma stephens, 44, sustained severe dental trauma when she slipped and fell out of the bath, resulting in multiple damaged teeth. her partner, karl, acted quickly and put the displaced tooth back in her mouth and kept it in milk before bringing her to the hospital. despite the seriousness of the injury, they were turned away from the local a&e and had to drive to a specialized dental hospital for treatment. the incident left emma in shock and severe pain, and she faced a long recovery process. the lack of clear protocols and specialist training for dentists in handling dental emergencies was highlighted, with many patients experiencing unnecessary pain and embarrassment. a charity, dental trauma uk, is being launched to educate the public on what to do in case of a knocked-out tooth and to ensure dentists have the necessary expertise to treat such cases. the charity's slogan is "pick it, lick it and stick it," and it will provide training and accreditation programs for dentists. emma's quick thinking and her partner's knowledge saved her from losing the tooth permanently or requiring an expensive implant. dental trauma is a common occurrence, with hundreds of thousands of people experiencing chipped, broken or displaced teeth each year. the delayed or inadequate treatment of dental trauma can result in significant dental and financial consequences.
2261	a government report released on wednesday by the privacy and civil liberties oversight board found that the national security agency's (nsa) section 702 program, which collects phone and internet communications of suspected security targets outside the united states, could infringe on the privacy rights of u.s. citizens. the program, which is aimed at non-u.s. persons, still has "value and effectiveness" in protecting national security, but the report noted concerns over the large scope of collection of americans' information, uncertainty about the amount of data being gathered, and the use of "about" collections and queries to search for communications of specific u.s. persons within the information. the report recommended several ways to strengthen privacy protections, including revising targeting criteria, limiting fbi use of section 702 data, and using more advanced filtering technology. despite these concerns, director of national intelligence james clapper praised the report and said they would review the recommendations carefully. however, civil liberties advocates criticized the report for not going far enough in protecting privacy rights. the independent panel began reviewing nsa surveillance last year in response to media reports on nsa programs based on the unauthorized disclosure of classified documents by former nsa contractor edward snowden.
2262	manchester united legend paul scholes believes ravel morrison, a former united youth graduate and midfield prospect, can still turn his career around despite off-field issues threatening his departure from west ham. morrison, who was previously seen as a possible successor to scholes, had a troubled spell at manchester united due to personal issues. he was loaned out to cardiff city this season, but the move was terminated early. morrison has been linked with a move to italian side lazio and scholes expressed hope that he can overcome his challenges and make a successful career in football, given his exceptional skill and vision. the midfielder's career has been marred by controversies, including being sent home from united's tour of the united states for breaching club discipline and being pictured on instagram wearing an arsenal shirt while posing with a ferrari. despite his troubled tenure at west ham, where he spent most of his time on loan in the championship, scholes maintains that morrison's youth and talent offer him a chance at redemption and success.
2263	a historic chandelier at towneley hall in burnley, lancashire was accidentally damaged during routine cleaning by contractors from burnley council, echoing a famous scene from the british television series "only fools and horses." the chandelier, worth thousands of pounds and a prominent centerpiece in the main hall of the 16th century manor house, suffered damage to four crystal arms and was removed for repairs with an estimated cost of £2,960. the incident is similar to an episode of "only fools and horses" where del and rodney were hired to clean chandeliers but accidentally broke one. the council confirmed that the damage was an unfortunate accident and the chandelier would be returned for repair and rewiring as soon as possible. the 16th century towneley hall now serves as an art gallery and museum space and also acts as a wedding venue. the accident drew comparisons to the popular tv episode, but the council stressed that the two situations were not comparable.
2264	lance cpl. joshua bleill, a marine who lost both his legs above the knees in an explosion in iraq in 2006, is making progress in his recovery with the help of groundbreaking prosthetic legs equipped with bluetooth technology. the legs, which have computer chips that send signals to motors in the artificial joints, allowing for coordinated movement, are the first of their kind for double leg amputees. bleill and another veteran, army lt. col. gregory gadson, are currently using the technology and are hoping it will make a significant impact for future amputees. however, the legs do have some limitations, such as reacting only to the user's movements and requiring overnight charging. despite the challenges, bleill remains positive and has plans to give back to his community upon returning to his home state of indiana.
2265	two aid workers, tom little from the united states and karen woo from the united kingdom, were among 10 members of a medical team killed by gunmen in badakhshan, afghanistan, on thursday. the team was returning from nuristan province when they were ambushed and robbed of their belongings before being shot. two other afghans on the team survived. the taliban claimed responsibility for the attack. tom little's wife, libby, described him as deeply committed to the afghan people and having worked in the country for 30 years. karen woo had given up her comfortable life in london to work in afghanistan. both aid workers were aware of the risks they faced but were excited about the medical work they were doing in remote areas. their teams were not carrying bibles, but international assistance mission (iam), the organization they were part of, is a christian group focused on providing services such as medical care and teaching english. two international service members were also killed in a bombing in southern afghanistan, and 16 insurgents and two civilians were killed in separate incidents.
2266	david bowie, a music legend from the 1960s, makes a remarkable comeback with his new album "the next day," reaching number one on the uk album chart, marking his first chart-topper since 1993. the album's success broke previous sales records and surprised fans and the music industry. the exhibition of bowie's outlandish costumes at the victoria and albert museum also sold out, breaking previous records. bowie had shunned the limelight since suffering a heart attack in 2004 and hadn't performed on stage since 2006. his long-time collaborator, tony visconti, produced the album, and it received critical acclaim and topped the digital itunes charts in 40 countries. the question now is whether bowie can repeat this success in the us. in the uk singles chart, justin timberlake remained at number one, and one direction's comic relief single rised to number two.
2267	a study led by dr. sung doo kim from the university of cincinnati found that taking short online breaks during work hours can boost productivity, especially for employees with active jobs. however, if taken in an undisciplined manner, these breaks could lead to cyberloafing and the excessive loss of time and productivity. the study discovered that triggers for online work breaks include a high need for recovery, monotony or boredom, checking on demands at home, and emotional work-related events. the rejuvenating effects of online breaks were more pronounced for jobs that required a good deal of physical activity or a lot of face-to-face interaction, rather than jobs that involved extensive computer time or sitting at a desk for prolonged periods. older workers and those with strict workplace policies against personal use of workplace computers were less likely to take advantage of online breaks. the research suggests that momentary recovery, learning, and satisfaction are the three consequences of these breaks. the study also found that workers reported benefits from going online to balance work and personal responsibilities, such as checking on their children. however, using phones and tablets to access work email outside office hours can significantly increase stress levels.
2268	yasmin nakhuda, the self-proclaimed mother ofmonkey darwin, a japanese snow macaque who gained global attention after escaping from her car in an ikea parking lot and being photographed wearing a shearling jacket, has given up her legal battle to regain ownership of the monkey from story brook farm primate sanctuary. nakhuda received death threats and faced ridicule during the heated custody dispute, which cost her significant legal fees and left her little chance of success. a court ruled in september 2013 that darvin is a wild animal, and once he escaped, nakhuda lost ownership. the sanctuary incurred expenses due to the lawsuit and was able to pay them off with the costs award, while the remainder was split with kevin d. toyne, who worked on the case pro bono. darvin, who was raised in a human home, is slowly learning to be more monkey-like and has groomed one of his neighbors and learned to imitate other monkey's vocalizations. nakhuda will keep the monkey darvin facebook page and expressed "no regrets" about her efforts to regain ownership.
2269	a missing dog named baby, who was wearing a red collar with diamante studs and had a microchip, was found two miles off the coast of florida by fishermen. the dog, who appeared to have been in the sea for up to eight hours, was taken in by a local resident, anthony basile, who nursed her back to health. a microchip scan revealed that baby had been reported missing two years ago, and her owner, charlene knotts, had passed away a couple of months prior. it's unknown how baby ended up in the sea, but it's believed she may have fallen overboard at night. kathy and larry klein, a florida couple, later adopted baby and named her gracie.
2270	the coronation festival, marking the 60th anniversary of queen elizabeth's coronation, will include a four-day event from july 11-14, 2013. a runway show as part of the daytime entertainment program will feature brands with royal warrants, such as hunter wellies, gieves & hawkes, and dege & skinner. brands will showcase their latest collections, including recycled and reinvented pieces using materials from other royal warrant holders, in a series of catwalk shows at buckingham palace. savile row tailors, country wear, fine china, and contemporary london designers are among the participants in the shows. public tickets are available for purchase for £30 per person through the festival's website.
2271	mary berry, a british baking legend and presenter of "the great british bake off," admitted in a 2013 interview that she used to discipline her children, including hitting them with kitchen utensils like a wooden butter pat, when they misbehaved. she stated this during an appearance on piers morgan's "life stories." berry, who has been married to paul for 57 years, revealed that her husband critiqued her cooking and preferred his mother's cakes. she also turned down an invitation to visit the queen at buckingham palace, claiming it was a prank call. in the interview, berry discussed her love for spray tans, onesies, and even went to ibiza at 71. she began her television career after her son william's tragic death in a car accident, and coped by running cookery courses and producing cooking shows from home. berry, who earned a cbe in 2012 for her services to the culinary arts, revealed that the secret to her long marriage is cooking her husband's favorite dishes. she began her culinary career over 50 years ago and has published more than 70 books.
2272	former supermodel janice dickinson accused bill cosby of rape in an interview with entertainment tonight, becoming the latest woman to make such allegations against the comedian. dickinson claimed cosby assaulted her in 1982 after dinner in lake tahoe, giving her a pill and a glass of red wine before she passed out. cosby's attorney called her story a "lie" and said it contradicts her own autobiography and a 2002 interview, where she described refusing to sleep with cosby. rape allegations against cosby have resurfaced in the digital age, with a handful of women accusing him of drugging and raping them since 2005. one of his accusers, barbara bowman, recently came forward with an article in the washington post and interviews with cnn, claiming she was drugged and raped though she never saw drugs. cosby has never been prosecuted for these allegations. in a recent interview with npr, he did not address the claims.
2273	vinicius font, a brazilian beach tennis player, is making waves in the sport previously dominated by italy. starting as a solo practitioner on brazilian beaches in 2008, he put in relentless effort and practice by himself using makeshift targets and trainers. beach tennis combines elements of tennis and volleyball: players serve and volley over a raised net without allowing the ball to hit the ground. font helped brazil win the world title in 2013 and currently ranks as the number one player. he credits his journey to the camaraderie in beach tennis and support from his coaches and team. originally a tennis player, font was introduced to beach tennis when his friend suggested he'd be good at the sport due to his serve-and-volley skills. despite initial struggles, he found success with hard work and dedication. as the sport demands speed and reactions, font admits it can be challenging and requires adjustment in attitude to accept mistakes. he now enjoys the strong bond within the beach tennis community, which stands out to him from his tennis experience. in the process of becoming a top player, font has undergone extensive team support, including coaches, a nutritionist, a physical trainer, and a psychologist, to aid his growth and overcome his tendency to react negatively to mistakes made by his partners.
2274	a new international debate over free speech has emerged following protests in muslim countries over an offensive youtube video about islam, which led to the deaths of over 50 people, including the us ambassador to libya. some arab and muslim leaders are advocating for new international rules limiting free expression to prevent religious insults. this has sparked a call to action for democracy advocates, with many fearing the impact on freedom of speech as a human right and cornerstone of democracy. during the un general assembly, president obama defended free speech, arguing that the strongest weapon against hateful speech is more speech. however, some criticize the us's response to the video as contradictory to its belief in free speech, with some leaders emphasizing the importance of respecting religious sensitivities. the issue comes at a crucial time for new democracies in the middle east, with obama calling for a push for more, not less free speech throughout the world. despite concerns over blasphemy laws in some countries, it is crucial to uphold the international right to free expression for all human beings. to combat offensive representations of their religion, muslims are encouraged to launch educational campaigns instead of resorting to violence or attempts to limit free speech. in the end, the bigots will only lose if free speech prevails.
2275	a tiny 1.5-inch long hermann's tortoise named tank, who is currently residing at paradise wildlife park in hertfordshire, has become a popular attraction due to his miniature size. despite being dwarfed by common household items like a spoon, lip balm, and a computer mouse, tank's energy and charm have captivated visitors. born at the park six months ago, tank will eventually grow to be about 11 inches long, but for now, he lives up to his fearsome name by perching on the head of a lion. hermann's tortoises originate from southern spain and france and typically grow between 6 to 8 inches until they reach full maturity at around six to eight years old.
2276	a father-of-three named jacek korolko was fined £1,300 by bristol city council for playing loud celine dion and eminem songs in his flat, despite his claims that he is the victim of wrongful blame from neighbors. korolko, who lives with his wife and three children, moved into the property 15 months ago and claims his neighbors have shunned him and wrongly accused him of various issues such as noise, dog mess, and litter. he has since become increasingly stressed and has thrown out his stereo, sold his dog, and made his teenage daughter listen to music using headphones. korolko admits to playing music loudly only three times, including on his wife and teenage daughter's birthdays. the problems started as soon as he moved in, with neighbors ignoring him and complaining about his children's noise. despite several warnings and a noise abatement notice, korolko was fined £500 for two breeches of the notice and ordered to pay costs and a victim surcharge. a spokeswoman for the council stated that after several warnings, they served a notice under section 80 of the environmental protection act 1990. korolko cannot afford to pay the charges and had to return to poland to deal with his father's funeral.
2277	a teacher named russell woolwright, 30, from canford school in dorset, is on trial for allegedly inciting a 16-year-old student to perform a lewd act in an alleyway after they had exchanged secret messages following their first encounter outside of school. the student, who cannot be named, reportedly initiated contact with woolwright, and during their liaison, he kissed her and encouraged her to perform the act. the student later told police about the incident due to her feelings of guilt, not wanting to get him into trouble. woolworth denies the allegations and claims that the student embellished her story to avoid blame. the trial continues.
2278	the house of lords incurred a nearly £2 million loss in revenues from its restaurants last year, resulting in an increase in the controversial catering subsidy from £1.85m to £1.95m. the subsidy allows peers to enjoy discounted fine dining, with meals priced significantly lower than in central london. the peers' dining room alone required £886,996 of taxpayers' money. labour mp john mann condemned the house as a "lavish retirement home" and called for its size to be reduced. john o'connell of the taxpayers' alliance urged the halving of the net cost of catering and retail services by 2015/16. the issue is not exclusive to the house of lords, as mps also benefit from taxpayer-subsidized meals. the unpredictable nature of parliamentary sittings and the need to pay staff the london living wage contribute to the high costs. many are critical of the subsidies in the context of austerity britain. in response, a house of lords spokesperson stated that they had reduced the catering subsidy by 27 per cent since 2007 and aimed to halve the net cost by 2015/16. they added that the catering services were necessary for a working parliament and that they paid staff the london living wage. however, the criticism about taxpayer-subsidised meals in the house of commons has reached a boiling point, with demands to end the £7 million yearly subsidy for food and drink.
2279	a lockdown at indiana university-purdue university indianapolis (iupui) was lifted tuesday afternoon, according to the school's twitter account. the lockdown was imposed due to a report of an armed person on campus, and students and staff were instructed to take shelter until an all-clear message was received. the all-clear message came at 4:36 p.m., and the school resumed normal operations. the identity of the person reported to be armed remains unknown, and it is unclear whether a gunman was found. approximately 30,000 students attend the university in indianapolis.
2280	prabhjot singh, a sikh doctor and columbia university professor, was recently attacked by a group of teenagers who fractured his jaw and called him derogatory names. instead of seeking revenge, singh expressed a desire to engage with his attackers and invited them to visit a gurdwara, a sikh place of worship. this forgiving and constructive approach is rooted in sikh teachings and reflects the experiences of sikh advocacy work since 9/11. an incident involving gurpreet singh and thomas brand illustrates this approach in action. thomas, who was filled with anger and fear after 9/11, attacked gurpreet on a train and was arrested and prosecuted for hate crime. however, gurpreet requested that thomas be given community service instead of jail time to combat hate in a post-9/11 world. this alternative approach led to a healing experience for all parties involved and challenged the punitive bent of the criminal justice system.
2281	a study by axa ppp healthcare revealed that one in three brits leave appointments with their gp feeling baffled due to medical jargon. thirty-one percent of participants felt confused, anxious, and uneasy after failing to understand their doctor's explanations. one in ten young adults even believed harmless conditions were terminal. many misunderstood common medical terms, with 55% not knowing what a ganglion is, and 49% mistaking somnambulism for sleepwalking. over 11% were too embarrassed to ask questions, and 10% didn't want to waste their gp's time. health experts warned that this embarrassment factor can lead to misunderstandings and confusion. forty-one percent of respondents didn't understand the term hypertension, despite it being high blood pressure. younger generations were found to be less knowledgeable about medical terms, with 23% of 18-24-year-olds misunderstanding a fracture as a torn muscle and 17% thinking mri stood for multiple radiation investigations. five percent of young adults believed hypertension to be a hyperactive disorder, and 12% thought a diagnosis of sleepwalking was a type of ear infection. overall, good communication between doctors and patients is crucial for understanding medical diagnoses and conditions.
2282	karl rove, a close advisor to president bush for over a decade, announced his resignation from the white house on monday, august 27, 2007. rove's departure came after discussions began last summer and was described as a difficult decision. he plans to write a book and teach politics after leaving. rove's tenure was marked by successful domestic policies but also failure to engineer winning strategies on immigration and midterm elections. he had been subpoenaed to testify in several investigations, including the leak of cia operative valerie plame's identity. his departure came as bush faces low approval ratings, and republican presidential hopefuls work to differentiate themselves from his administration. rove intends to return to washington over the weekend before heading to texas for dove hunting and a beach vacation with family. his role as "the architect" of bush's winning campaigns will be difficult to replace.
2283	two american hikers, josh fattal and shane bauer, have been sentenced to eight years in iran's notoriously harsh evin prison for charges of spying and illegal entry. their friend, sarah shourd, who was freed in september 2010 after 410 days of solitary confinement, described the prison as notorious for its harsh conditions and political prisoners. shourd claimed that she and the men had accidentally crossed the iranian border while hiking, but were arrested and feared for their lives. in evin, they endured physical and psychological abuse, including being denied phone calls and suffering in isolation. american journalist roxana saberi, who also spent time in evin, shared similar experiences, describing feelings of helplessness, denial, and even anger towards god during her ordeal, which lasted for 100 days before her release in may 2009.
2284	lancashire cricket team captain paul horton has been suspended for the first two matches of next year's natwest t20 blast after showing dissent to umpires during the final against birmingham bears. horton, 31, was angry at being given out caught down the leg-side by spinner jeetan patel for one run and was reported by the match officials for his actions during the august 23 clash at edgbaston. the england and wales cricket board's cricket discipline commission (cdc) handed him a two-match ban for a level two breach of the ecb's discipline code, which involves showing serious dissent at an umpire's decision by word or action. horton, who regretfully accepted the punishment, acknowledged the importance of his role model responsibilities as a captain.
2285	nico rosberg and lewis hamilton had a controversial clash during the belgian grand prix, resulting in hamilton's retirement from the race and rosberg finishing second behind daniel ricciardo. rosberg admitted to regret over the incident but refused to apologize, stating it was a racing incident. the collision caused significant damage to both cars, with hamilton claiming rosberg admitted he did it intentionally to prove a point. rosberg was booed on the podium, and both drivers have had multiple incidents this season, including bahrain and spain, where rosberg felt hamilton disregarded racing rules.
2286	grozny, chechnya: a decade of transformation (cnn) - ten years have passed since the author's last visit to chechnya. what he found was astonishing. formerly known for its violence and lawlessness, chechnya was once a war-torn region with a devastated capital, grozny, left in ruins. the impoverished russian army had been locked in a brutal struggle with chechen insurgents, leading to widespread kidnappings for ransom, where body parts were often amputated on camera. today, russian government minders escort foreign journalists through the newly-constructed airport to a peaceful and bustling grozny. in place of the dark streets and gunmen, there are mosques, illuminated parks, and high-rises being built, all without a soldier or gunman in sight. chechnya's second-largest city, gudermes, used to be a place of open jokes about kidnapping and ransom. now, armies of workers, including migrant laborers from asia, are constructing roads and high-rises amidst singing residents. kadyrov, a former rebel fighter, is now the president of the chechen republic and has adopted the habits of a middle eastern despot. despite claims of victory and a purported small insurgent presence, there have been reports of extrajudicial killings and human rights abuses. the price for peace in chechnya remains troubling as instability continues to grow in the neighboring regions of dagestan and ingushetia.
2287	in a speech given in 1961, ronald reagan voiced his concern about medicare pushing the us towards socialism, warning that it could lead to the loss of individual freedom. this fear of federal power, which was also expressed by conservative figures like barry goldwater and newt gingrich, has deep roots in us history, with conservative movements warning against social programs since the new deal era. however, reagan and other conservative presidents ultimately did not fulfill their campaigns promises to reduce government programs, and americans have come to rely on them. conservative activism, fueled by wealthy donors, persists as a way for outsiders to maintain a sense of fervor and opposition to "big government," even if their ideology does not align with their actions once in power. despite the hyperbole and dire predictions, social programs like social security and medicare have not resulted in the loss of individual liberty. on the contrary, these programs have enabled millions of people to avoid poverty and hardship. despite their claims, conservative political figures have not succeeded in significantly reducing the size of the federal government or eliminating entitlement programs once in power. in fact, many republicans have expanded entitlement programs or initiated new ones, such as medicare part d under george w. bush. the american people's preference for government programs often clashes with the conservative "small government" rhetoric. although reagan made no effort to reduce social security benefits during his presidency, the latest incarnation of the grassroots right, the tea party, has achieved a victory of sorts by bringing the country to the brink of a financial crisis – a potential debacle that could prompt americans to reconsider the role and function of the government. ultimately, the struggle to preserve the american constitutional order against perceived enemies persists, with the future of social programs like medicare and medicaid still uncertain. the opinions expressed in this summarization are that of michael kazin.
2288	the author of this week's column expresses concern over beijing's air quality, which is rated "slightly polluted" by the chinese environmental monitoring center but "hazardous" by the u.s. embassy's air-quality monitoring app. the difference in measurements lies in the size of particulate matter being measured: pm10 vs. pm2.5. the chinese monitoring stations measure larger pollutants, while the u.s. embassy device detects tiny particles that cause smog and are considered more harmful. experts blame rapid urbanization and industrialization for the air pollution, with beijing having over 5 million cars and burning 27 million tons of coal in 2010. the costs of worsening air quality are significant, both in terms of individual health concerns and societal costs. china acknowledges the issue and has pledged to address it, with a five-year plan focusing on energy efficiency, renewable energy, and pollution reductions. a green movement is emerging, with "huanbao" (environmental protection) becoming a popular phrase. public interest in environmental monitoring has grown, with the beijing municipal environmental monitoring center now open to the public. some, including real estate tycoon pan shiyi, are pushing for more stringent pm2.5 standards, while china may adopt them gradually. encouraging signs include at least two cities in south china adopting pm2.5 on a trial basis. the author hopes for quicker actions to address the air quality concerns for the sake of current and future generations.
2289	gareth bale's childhood sweetheart emma rhys-jones's father, martin rhys-jones, is currently in a federal prison in the us accused of masterminding a global financial fraud scheme, also known as a "boiler room" scam. rhys-jones, a businessman who separated from his wife in cardiff and moved to barcelona, spain in 2005, is charged with conspiracy to commit wire fraud and money laundering, and could face up to 30 years in prison and a fine of £160,000 if convicted. the scam involved cold-calling people in the uk and canada to sell them worthless shares for high prices, with the sales team falsely claiming that share prices were of much higher value. rhys-jones hired six people to make the fraudulent calls and offered them free rent in barcelona and commission for sales. customers were eventually sent worthless share certificates. more than £3.2million was invested in the scheme before the money was transferred to bank accounts in new york, spain, the uk, and switzerland. rhys-jones used aliases "martin reece" and "john allen" while in barcelona and has not been able to meet his granddaughter, alba violet bale, since she was born last year due to his extradition to the us. bale and emma carried out a long-distance relationship for eight years and have been known to avoid public appearances together. commenting on the case, james spero, special agent in charge of homeland security investigations in buffalo, new york, said: "these criminals demonstrated a callous disregard for the hard-earned money of individuals who thought they were legitimately investing in their futures. they will now have to account for their actions before a court of law.” rhys-jones's mother, grace rhys-jones, has been told not to speak about the case.
2290	binyamin netanyahu's new coalition government is planning to change conscription laws, potentially drafting ultra-orthodox jews into the israeli military as part of efforts to reduce the country's benefits bill. former military chief moshe "bogie" ya'alon, expected to become israel's next defense minister, is leading the push for this controversial move which has sparked protests from the ultra-orthodox community. netanyahu's government is seen as having a better chance than previous administrations to carry out the reform due to the exclusion of the ultra-orthodox shas party and the inclusion of the centrist yesh atid, jewish home, and hatnua parties. ya'alon is also known for his hawkish stance on iran, which aligns with netanyahu's views. if agreed upon, the new rules would end the ultra-orthodox exemption from military service. netanyahu, who previously served as israeli prime minister between 1996 and 1999 and again between 2009 and 2013, could reach an agreement with coalition partners as early as tomorrow.
2291	dentists are urging for a 75% reduction in daily sugar consumption to prevent tooth decay, which affects around a third of uk children and costs between 6-10% of total health expenses. experts at university college london recommend limiting added sugar intake to four teaspoons a day, equivalent to less than half a can of coca-cola or just two digestives. the food industry will likely resist a sugar tax, which some propose to reduce consumption, especially in processed foods and drinks. a study published in the public health nutrition journal argues that only significant cuts in sugar use will effectively combat tooth decay. the paper, co-authored by professor aubrey sheiham and professor philip james, suggests a daily limit of 15g or four teaspoons of sugar. adults currently consume an average of 58g or 14.5 teaspoons of sugar a day, and the world health organization recommends a maximum of 5% of daily calories (25g or six teaspoons). the researchers advocate for very low sugar intakes throughout life to protect teeth, stating previous analyses focusing on children have been misleading. nutritionist katherine jenner supports the study's findings, emphasizing the unnecessary nature of added sugars and their links to dental decay, obesity, and type ii diabetes.
2292	former california governor arnold schwarzenegger's official portrait was hung at the state capitol on friday with a touch-up on the previously painted-over image of his wife, maria shriver. the smudge that once showed her face was smoothed out by austrian artist gottfried helnwein. the portrait, a realist-style painting with a steel frame, now hangs on the third floor of the capitol next to his predecessor, gray davis. the embarrassing revelations of schwarzenegger's affair with his maid and the resulting out-of-wedlock son led to the removal of shriver's image when the portrait was initially unveiled in september. there are concerns about people touching the portrait due to its photograph-like feel, and portraits are deliberately hung high on the wall to prevent damage. children on a capitol tour were the first to recognize the newly hung portrait, identifying it as arnold schwarzenegger's, despite his fame from his acting career.
2293	a 53-year-old cleaner was rescued after falling into a three-metre deep sinkhole while assisting an elderly woman with laundry in springvale, melbourne. the sinkhole, which appeared small at the surface, was revealed to be an old, poorly concealed well. the woman was initially submerged in water but managed to attract neighbors' attention after about 40 minutes. firefighters extracted her within 15 minutes of the call. the cleaner was not injured. engineers were investigating the cause of the sinkhole.
2294	the church of england will no longer resist gay marriage among its congregation, archbishop justin welby stated last night, as the law legalizes same-sex marriage starting tomorrow. divisive attempts by bishops to ban clergy from marrying same-sex partners provoked a backlash, but archbishop welby urges the church to demonstrate love for all human beings. seven clergy couples were planning to marry their partners in defiance, and some clergy intend to bless same-sex marriages. the anglican church is deeply divided on the issue, and welby aims to prevent the disagreement from spreading to the uk through "structured conversations" between opponents and supporters. conservative evangelical congregations threaten to leave the church of england if it compromises its opposition to gay sex by blessing civil partnerships. the reverend andrew cain from north london also plans to marry his partner.
2295	manchester united manager david moyes held talks with juventus's chief transfer negotiator, beppe marotta, about signing midfielders paul pogba and arturo vidal. moyes traveled to italy to watch juventus's game against cagliari and discussed the possibility of bringing either, or both, players to old trafford. however, pogba's departure from united 18 months ago was described as a mistake by zinedine zidane, and juventus is not willing to sell him. moyes also tried to off-load fringe players, but juventus is not interested in nani due to the asking price, and fabio could be headed to cardiff. galatasaray and monaco are interested in signing nemanja vidic on a free transfer in the summer.
2296	angel di maria revealed that cristiano ronaldo advised him to wear the number 7 shirt at manchester united due to its historical significance at the club. di maria, who signed a five-year contract worth £200,000-a-week, was handed the iconic jersey worn by club legends ronaldo, eric cantona, and david beckham. the argentine international expressed his desire to help man united return to the champions league and promised to give his best to win trophies for the club. louis van gaal welcomed di maria as the fourth summer signing, who cost the club £59.7 million plus add-ons. despite the club's early season struggles, with no wins in the premier league and the embarrassing 4-0 loss to league one side mk dons in the capital one cup, van gaal is optimistic about di maria's abilities to improve the squad and instill his playing style. the dutch manager believes di maria, who is versatile and can play in both attack and defense, will be a team player and provide good results for man united.
2297	the maldives government has confirmed a 15-year-old girl was sentenced to 100 lashes and eight months house arrest for engaging in premarital sex. the girl, a reported victim of sexual abuse by her stepfather, was ordered to remain in a children's home with the option to receive the punishment immediately or when she turns 18. the prosecutor's office is restricting information due to laws protecting minors, while amnesty international and human rights watch have called for the girl's charges to be dropped and for the law to be reformed. the maldives, consisting of 1,200 small islands, faces criticism of its legal system following the resignation of its first democratically elected president and criticism from the un special rapporteur on the independence of judges and lawyers. the psychological and physical impacts of the floggings, considered ceremonial by some, are debated, with faiz stating those sentenced are reluctant to speak about the experience due to shame and stigma.
2298	amal alamuddin's extravagant three-day wedding to george clooney solidified her status as a global style icon. the lebanese-born lawyer, who shot to fame after marrying the hollywood heartthrob, flaunted a chic and expensive wardrobe featuring designs by oscar de la renta, dolce & gabbana, prada, stella mccartney, and giambattista valli. her wedding gown, a bespoke oscar de la renta dress adorned with diamantes and pearls, was the highlight, while her pre-wedding outfit consisted of a custom-made red alexander mcqueen gown. the civil ceremony saw her donning a stylish stella mccartney suit and accessories, and her pre-wedding arrival in venice included a monochrome striped dolce & gabbana dress and prada sunglasses. amal's impeccable and designer-heavy wardrobe has captured the attention of fashion enthusiasts worldwide.
2299	gareth bale's tenacity at the back in a 0-0 draw against belgium kept wales at the top of euro 2016 qualifying group b with an undefeated record. coach chris coleman praised bale and his team for their resilience and character, with both teams creating chances but failing to find the back of the net. coleman acknowledged the tough challenge posed by belgium's offensive power and lauded the team's unity and work ethic. bale, who cleared a ball from the line to deny the hosts a late goal, shared coleman's sentiments and appreciated the fans' support. captain ashley williams agreed that the point and clean sheet were crucial for the team's momentum in the group stage.
2300	a shopper fell to his death from a third-floor escalator at the flagship debenhams store in oxford street, central london, in front of hundreds of shocked customers and staff. the man, whose identity has not been released, died at the scene at 6:15 p.m. last night. witnesses reported that decorative boxes for a christmas display were scattered around following the incident, which occurred during the busy holiday shopping period. the met police and london ambulance service attended the scene, but the man could not be saved. a source told mailonline that the man likely jumped to his death, and debenhams confirmed that there were no suspicious circumstances. the store, which has seven floors and covers a large area, was closed immediately following the incident. debenhams is working with the authorities to investigate the cause of the tragedy.
2301	the national trust, a u.k. heritage organization, has expressed concerns over the proliferation of wind farms, which they deem the "most widespread and persistent threat" to the british countryside. national trust chairman sir simon jenkins has spoken out against the government's planning reforms, stating that they could lead to conflict in local communities if not delayed, as wind turbines are intrusive forms of renewable energy and can blight the landscape. the national trust, which opposes wind turbines in the wrong places, cannot afford to buy large areas of land to prevent wind farm construction due to the widespread number of applications. instead, they may consider purchasing easements to prevent wind farms in sensitive landscapes. the charity fears that planning reforms, which encourage development without local plans in place, will result in unwanted speculative development and costly legal battles. the deadline for councils to adopt local plans is fast approaching, and only half have done so. the national trust is urging the government to delay the introduction of the new rules to prevent further conflict over development in the countryside. sir simon has also raised concerns over other threats to the countryside, including the proposed hs2 high-speed rail line and shale gas exploration.
2302	a 23-year-old nurse in mumbai, india, who reported being raped and attempting to be killed by a man on a train, was overflowing with anger and hit the man during her police statement. she had accused the 27-year-old man of trying to rape her while she was traveling to work on the early morning train. he was arrested at the next station, but the nurse went to the police station to report the crime and confronted the man when he was brought in for questioning. while her actions are not condoned, the police reportedly understood her state of mind given the prevalence of violent assaults against women in india. the country has seen a rise in reported rapes and violent attacks against women, leading to increased calls for justice and stricter laws. recently, four men were sentenced to death for the infamous gang rape and murder of jyoti singh on a delhi bus in 2012. the government has taken steps to address the issue but rape remains a common occurrence in india. despite these efforts, many women still fear reporting crimes due to social stigma and police corruption. it is argued that deep-rooted patriarchal attitudes contribute to the persistence of gender-based violence in india.
2303	during the cold war, the united states employed the strategy of nuclear deterrence to prevent nuclear attacks against it by maintaining a strong nuclear force that could retaliate with devastating power against the soviet union. this theory proved successful as the soviet union never attacked the united states or any other nation to obtain nuclear weapons. however, the current administrations' approach towards north korea and iran seems different, with the united states considering military action against these countries, who are attempting to develop nuclear weapons. this shift in strategy may be due to perceived aggressive behavior and religious fanaticism of their leaders, despite the theory of deterrence suggesting that both north korea's kim jong un and iran's supreme leader would be deterred from using nuclear weapons to avoid the destruction of their nations and their people. the high costs and danger of the nuclear arms race during the cold war are also cause for reconsidering the use of nuclear weapons today. instead, diplomacy and peaceful negotiations should be prioritized to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons, potentially leading to a world without nuclear weapons. with north korea, a less confrontational approach, perhaps coupled with deterrence, may bring about a peaceful resolution. with iran, efforts should be made to build trust and find a peaceful resolution through diplomacy, as threatening military action only reinforces iran's suspicions of america's true intentions.
2304	dr. jennifer lickteig, a family practitioner from hiawatha, iowa, earns more than $120,000 a year running an online clothing business on ebay, making her a top-ranking gold powerseller. due to the demands of raising her twin girls and two older sons, she had to take a break from medicine and discovered her entrepreneurial side. with medicine becoming less rewarding due to insurance companies and malpractice lawyers, alternatives like ebay are an increasingly popular trend among doctors. lickteig runs her business from home, managing inventory, packing, and answering consumer questions, balancing her career with part-time medicine and family life. her husband's job as an actuary provides financial security, but she believes in having a backup plan. despite the unusual path, lickteig sees her ebay business as a successful venture that adds excitement and financial security to her life.
2305	a u.s. rc-135 rivet joint spy plane evaded an encounter with russian military jets on july 18, 2014, by entering swedish airspace without permission. the plane was conducting electronic eavesdropping on the russian military when the russians began tracking it with land-based radar and sent a fighter jet to intercept. the incident came just a day after the downing of malaysia airlines flight 17 in eastern ukraine, which heightened tensions between the u.s. and russia. this was at least the second potentially dangerous encounter between a u.s. plane and russian jets in the past few months. in april 2014, a russian su-27 flanker fighter jet buzzed a u.s. rc-135u reconnaissance plane over the sea of okhotsk, coming within 100 feet of its nose. the u.s. state department acknowledged the incident and promised to communicate better with swedish authorities to prevent similar issues in the future. russian officials did not comment on the encounter.
2306	two top iranian opposition leaders, mehdi karroubi and mir hossein moussavi, have urged their supporters to protest on february 11, the anniversary of the 1979 islamic revolution, according to an opposition website, green way. the leaders met on saturday to discuss recent executions and trials of opposition activists and called the widespread arrests, media silence, and forced confessions a violation of islam and iran's constitution. president mahmoud ahmadinejad pledged to deliver a "harsh blow" to "global arrogance" on february 11 through state-run press tv. no details were given about the statement. opposition protests started after the disputed june 12 presidential election, with over 4,000 arrests and at least 37 deaths. recently, two opposition activists, mohammed reza ali zamani and arash rahmanipour, were executed for being enemies of god and plotting against the regime. the government denies accusations of electoral fraud.
2307	a mother-of-four, leighanne rumbelow, 26, was sentenced to eleven months in jail after framing a fellow student, leonard smith, 21, by sending herself abusive and threatening emails using his video game username, 'striker'. the police were called multiple times and mr. smith was arrested and had his home searched twice. rumbelow initially blamed her sister for the emails but later pleaded guilty to perverting the course of justice between april 4 and june 2, 2022. the persistent false allegations against mr. smith resulted in his arrest, seizure of property, and significant use of his time and resources. the investigation wasted police resources, including helicopter searches and dog units, and caused distress and harm to the innocent parties involved.
2308	a 14-year-old girl named izzy dix was found dead at her home in brixham, devon, on tuesday, september 23, 2013. her friends claimed she had been bullied on the social media site ask.fm, which around 60 million users. a poignant youtube video was created by izzy's friends, calling on every student at her school to shut down their ask.fm accounts in her honor. the video accused the site of contributing to izzy's suicide due to cyberbullying motivated by jealousy and her predicted academic success. the friends also urged people to think before they speak and save a life. izzy's death shocked the community, and she was described as a lovely girl with a smile and many friends. the prime minister, david cameron, had already criticized ask.fm for its link to the death of another 14-year-old girl, hannah smith, from leicestershire. izzy's funeral arrangements were being made, and counselling services were offered to her classmates at brixham community college. the police are investigating her death and urged people not to make judgments based on social media sites.
2309	a week before 9-year-old michaela garecht was kidnapped in hayward, california, in 1988, she wrote a poem about people being held captive, her mother sharon murch revealed tuesday. as authorities investigate possible links between michaela's abduction and that of jaycee lee dugard, who was found alive last week after being held captive by phillip garrido for 18 years, murch expressed hope that her daughter might also be safe. a bone fragment found near garrido's property is being analyzed and several missing persons' cases are being investigated in connection to him, including the disappearance of ilene misheloff in 1989 when she was 13. both cases share similarities in the kidnapping method and descriptions of the vehicles involved. witnesses and investigators are looking for information on the descriptions of the cars, and murch revealed that a neighbor had seen a car resembling the one involved in her daughter's kidnapping at the garrido property. michaela and a friend had their scooters stolen while they were at a market, and when michaela went to retrieve it, she was kidnapped. murch has kept her hopes up that her daughter might still be alive and has been writing on michaela's website to keep busy.
2310	sir stuart rose, former head of marks & spencer and a prominent business figure in the uk, has spoken out against the government's decision to scrap the 50p tax rate for high earners. rose expressed his opposition to reducing the tax for the wealthy and even suggested he would be willing to pay more tax to help the country during its financial difficulties. this stance contrasts with former conservative chancellor nigel lawson, who supports axing the levy, and president barack obama's recent proposal for a larger payroll tax cut in the us. billionaire investor warren buffett and several other wealthy european businesspeople, such as luca di montezemolo and liliane bettencourt, have also advocated for the rich to pay more taxes. the treasury is currently reviewing the tax and is expected to make a decision in the 2012 budget. liberal democrats have expressed their opposition to scrapping the tax without excluding those earning less than £10,000.
2311	mexico's interior minister alejandro poire announced on wednesday that saadi gadhafi, a son of the late libyan leader moammar gadhafi, attempted to enter mexico using false documents as part of a secret plot to provide him and his family with false mexican identities and purchase properties as safe houses. four individuals have been arrested in connection to the plot, including a canadian, a dane, and two mexicans. the alleged plot was foiled by mexican intelligence on september 6, and the leaders of the ring were identified as cynthia ann vanier, a canadian, and gabriela davila huerta o cueto, a mexican living in the united states. the suspects face charges of falsifying documents and opening bank accounts under false identities. saadi gadhafi, who currently resides in niger, has denied the allegations through his lawyer. the investigation into the plot was prompted by reports from a canadian newspaper, which claimed that mexican officials approved the plan to move saadi and his family to mexico. however, mexican authorities contradicted this claim. the arrested individuals were identified as daniel bejar hanan, amira sayed nader, moah bejar sayed, and sofia bejar sayed, the aliases the gadhafi family was allegedly set to use to enter mexico. saadi gadhafi had previously offered to negotiate with rebels in libya to end the war, but later changed his mind and fled to niger, along with his father's other son, saif al-islam gadhafi, who is also wanted by the international criminal court for alleged crimes against humanity.

2313	a 41-year-old father-of-three named alan mcwilliams died after playing russian roulette with a friend in johnstone, renfrewshire, on saturday, march 2, 2013. emergency services were called to the scene following reports of a man with a firearm, and mcwilliams was taken to the hospital where he later died. the death is being treated as unexplained, and detectives are carrying out extensive inquiries. neighbors reported that the incident was the talk of the town, with some stating that mcwilliams had been playing the game "for a laugh." mcwilliams' partner and daughters have posted emotional tributes on facebook.
2314	attorney general eric holder announced on monday that he will soon unveil new justice department guidelines to end racial profiling in us police departments. holder held the first of several regional meetings in atlanta, georgia, at ebenezer baptist church where civil rights leader martin luther king jr. once preached. the meetings aim to foster a dialogue between law enforcement and community leaders. holder's announcement came in response to the violent confrontations between protesters and police in ferguson, missouri, following shootings of black teenagers by white officers, and in the wake of president barack obama's request for recommendations to avoid a "militarized culture" in police departments. holder spoke before a passionate crowd that included civil rights activists, who chanted outside the church in support of his efforts to end racial profiling. the justice department is continuing its investigation into the ferguson police department and the deaths of michael brown and other cases of alleged unconstitutional policing practices. holder, who plans to resign soon, has identified civil rights as a top priority during his tenure, and has advocated for reducing harsh sentences for nonviolent drug crimes and alternatives to prison for nonviolent offenders.
2315	saudi arabian princess meshael alayban, 42, was arrested in california on human trafficking charges for allegedly keeping a kenyan woman as a domestic slave for $220 a month. defense lawyers claimed the woman had better living conditions than stated, with access to cellphones, facebook, television, and luxuries like a pool and gym. the princess posted $5.2 million bail and is under court supervision. a kenyan woman, identified as jane doe, escaped and reported her situation, leading to the discovery of four other filipino women in similar circumstances. the alleged victims cannot leave the us without court permission and are being assisted in a shelter. alayban, who is married to the grandson of the king of saudi arabia, has been charged with holding the women against their will against their will and faces up to 12 years in prison if convicted. the saudi arabian consulate posted her bail, and she is currently wearing a gps tracking device. the investigation into the other women's circumstances is ongoing.
2316	zimbabwean president robert mugabe, 90, tripped and fell as he descended a set of steps after giving a speech at harare international airport. the incident has gone viral on the internet with the hashtag #mugabefalls, leading to numerous memes featuring the president in humorous situations, such as part of beyonce's 'single ladies' choreography, surfing, running from security forces, or holding kim kardashian's famous bottom. despite clear evidence of the fall, the zimbabwean government denied that it had occurred, with information minister jonathan moyo insisting that mugabe "managed to break the fall" and citing examples of other leaders who had stumbled, including jesus and george w. bush. the memes also poked fun at mugabe's staff, who allegedly tried to delete images of the fall, and at mugabe himself, who has been accused of using violence to win elections and presiding over the economic decline of zimbabwe.
2317	col. don christensen, the former air force chief prosecutor, claimed that he was "put out to pasture" and given a less meaningful role after he spoke out against top commanders for overturning a high-profile sexual assault conviction. in 2012, christensen, who worked on over 300 sexual assault cases in the air force, successfully convicted lt. col. james wilkerson of aggravated sexual assault. however, three months after the conviction, lt. gen. craig franklin, a base commander, threw out the verdict, prompting christensen to step down and join a victim advocacy group. christensen, who was given a downgraded personnel report before being removed from his position, criticized the military's handling of the case and called it the "final straw" for the military justice system. wilkerson, who protested his innocence, was later reduced to the rank of major and kicked out of the service when officials learned he had fathered a child with another woman while married. in response to the case, senator kirsten gillibrand proposed legislation to create an independent prosecution office in the military and remove commanders from making prosecution decisions. christensen will appear at a capitol hill press conference on tuesday to support the bill.
