2318	harry redknapp and queens park rangers (qpr) are experiencing a difficult season, with 11 defeats in 11 away games in the premier league and an embarrassing loss to league two side burton albion in the capital one cup. the players, including joey barton, have been criticized for their lackluster performances and poor commitment, particularly on the road. incidents from their loss to stoke city, such as karl henry's mistake leading to a goal and joey barton's mishap in defending a free-kick, have highlighted the players' mistakes and inconsistent effort. the fans and chairman tony fernandes, who have previously praised the team's fighting spirit, are disappointed with the results, and redknapp deserves better from his players.
2319	the ftse 100 index in london reached its highest level since the turn of the century on february 11, 2015, closing just 32 points shy of its all-time high during the dotcom boom in 1999. the index, which includes blue-chip companies such as tesco, rolls-royce, vodafone, and barclays, has gained 5% this year, adding £84 billion to investments. economists predict another good year in 2015 due to the uk's fast-growing economy and record-low inflation. low interest rates, falling oil prices, and corporate profit growth have driven the rise in london's stock market, offering respite for pension savers and investors. however, some experts warn of an impending recession and potential devastating effects on shares.
2320	the man in the moon, a popular celestial feature seen from earth, has intrigued humans for centuries with various cultural interpretations. ancient chinese believed it was a goddess, early christians thought it was a banished man, and medieval englishmen considered it the god of drunkards. recent research suggests that the shapes forming the "face" of the man in the moon were not created by asteroid strikes or giant tension cracks, but by magma bubbling up to the moon's surface. the 1,800-mile-wide procellarum basin, which features the "face," was formed by large plumes of molten rock. the circles are likely made up of sharp angles produced by tension cracks in the moon's crust as it cooled, creating a "plumbing system" for magma to surface and fill smaller basins. the latest theory, published in the journal nature, was established through high-definition maps of the moon's surface using nasa data, revealing the angular shapes that cannot be explained by asteroid strikes. however, the mystery of how the magma plume was formed remains unsolved.
2321	a romantic dinner date between clive merrifield and his companion was disrupted by a crying baby at a nearby table in an indian restaurant in islington, north london. the baby's father, billy west, became enraged when merrifield suggested they take the baby outside to quiet it down. west, who arrived with his partner, the baby, and another man, pulled a bottle of wine from merrifield's ice bucket and attacked him, leaving him with a deep gash on his scalp that required 16 stitches and a scar. west was jailed for two years and five months for the "vicious and cowardly" assault. west has previous convictions for assault, spraying someone with cs gas, and aggravated vehicle taking. his defense argued that he was tired, stressed, and had a young child who had not been sleeping.
2322	the u.s. treasury department has issued new regulations that allow same-sex couples married in states recognizing same-sex marriages to file joint federal tax returns. treasury secretary jacob lew stated that the regulations provide clarity and coherent tax filing guidance for all legally married same-sex couples nationwide, allowing them to move freely throughout the country without changes to their federal tax filing status. the rules implement the supreme court's ruling in june, which invalidated a section of the defense of marriage act. previously, gay couples faced unequal taxes and took extreme measures, such as adoption, to protect their loved ones. in pennsylvania, a man and his partner became father and son to avoid high property taxes, while in massachusetts, the city of cambridge paid stipends to offset federal tax disparities. the new regulations provide equal access to tax benefits and protections under federal law for all married americans.
2323	according to a daily mail report, based on interim results from 39 police forces in england and wales, a total of 851 officers failed new mandatory fitness tests, with failure rates ranging from 1% to 8% for men and women. the worst performing forces were suffolk, west midlands, west mercia/warwickshire, and gwent. humberside and northumbria were the only forces with a 100% pass rate for both genders. the new fitness testing, which includes a 15-metre 'bleep' shuttle run, became mandatory under the recommendations of tom winsor, the chief inspector of constabulary. from 2018, the tests were also intended to be made harder based on on-duty challenges but this is under consideration. the metropolitan police, lancashire, gloucestershire, and cumbria have not yet reported their results. assistant chief constable rob price, noted that the majority of officers have passed the test and that forces are sending results to the college of policing on a quarterly basis, with new guidance and supportive measures to be issued later this year.
2324	a newcastle crematorium worker, identified as matthew kay, has been suspended after mocking his job and the dead on his facebook page. he allegedly posted vile comments over a period of three years, including joking about cremating metal joints and decorating crematorium equipment with christmas tinsel. kay described his job as a "full-time cook" and made light of serious situations, such as breaking a rib at a funeral. one post mentioned the council's plan to raise cremation fees, joking about the number being £666. these insensitive comments have led to kay's suspension, and a formal investigation has begun.
2325	inter milan earned a thrilling 5-3 victory over roma at san siro, with samuel eto'o scoring twice and wesley sneijder, thiago motta, and esteban cambiasso also finding the net. roma's nicolas burdisso was sent off for fouling giampaolo pazzini in the area, leading to eto'o's penalty and motta's headed goal. roma fought back with goals from mirko vucinic and simone loria, but cambiasso sealed inter's win late on. milan drew 1-1 with genoa, surrendering a late lead as antonio floro flores equalized. napoli is now second place, just two points behind milan, after beating cesena 2-0, with edinson cavani and jose sosa scoring.
2326	a four-year-old boy named nathan harrison from keighley, west yorkshire, died after accidentally starting a fire in his brother's bedroom while playing hide and seek. he mistook a utility lighter for a toy and ignited it, causing a fire that quickly spread and filled the room with toxic smoke. nathan's mother, jodie collins, discovered the fire and pulled him out, but he died from inhalation injuries at airedale hospital. the lighter's safety feature had been turned on, and the strong bond between nathan and his older brother matthew, who had taken the lighter from the pantry, was mentioned in court. the coroner recorded a narrative verdict and plans to make recommendations to make utility lighters safer for young children.
2327	a tornado struck rice, texas, at 5:30 p.m. on sunday, destroying at least three homes, damaging others, turning over vehicles, and knocking train cars off tracks. the tornado caused extensive damage to rice elementary school, injuring four people with minor injuries. witnesses reported possible tornados in other parts of northeast texas, and at least one home was destroyed in lone oak. joey romero, a second-year medical student, rode out the storm in the freezer of a sonic restaurant in rice, where he helped treat injuries before continuing his journey to houston. the storm caused hail damage and left several hours without power. the tornado caused significant damage in navarro county, and authorities are still assessing the extent of the damage. other parts of northeast texas are also reporting possible tornados.
2328	john lewis, a uk retail chain founded in 1864 by john lewis as a drapers shop in oxford street, london, is celebrating its 150th anniversary. the business model, which prioritizes fair compensation for workers, has thrived despite the recession, making it a favorite among conservative middle britain. the company's unique approach began with spedan lewis, john's son, who took over in 1914 and introduced the "never knowingly undersold" policy in 1925. he also established the "little red book," a constitution for the john lewis partnership that guides managers and staff with rules on worker ownership, courtesy, and integrity. the partnership model, initially inspired by spedan's concern for fairness in business, has resulted in current 91,000 employees sharing in the success of the £4 billion-a-year company through bonuses. additionally, waitrose, a favored supermarket of the middle classes, was acquired in 1937 and also operates under the partnership model.
2329	katie price, a reality star and mother of three, has accused her ex-husband alex reid of stealing her mobile phone after their divorce and reported the incident to police as a potential breach of privacy. this allegation is being investigated under operation tulisa, the met police's investigation into phone hacking. katie and alex, 37, were married from 2010 to 2011, and she recently married her new husband, kieran hayler, with whom she is pregnant with her fourth child. katie's previous marriages and relationships have produced three children, and she has been engaged twice before to men she didn't marry. the met police have confirmed they are looking into the allegations against alex but have made no further comment.
2330	samsung has filed a design patent for wearable computer glasses, called "samsung spectacles," which are tethered to a smartphone via a micro-usb connection. this design aims to address the battery life issue of google glass by drawing power from the phone's battery, potentially resulting in a longer life and lighter device. samsung's spectacles will display alerts for messages and calls, and will also integrate earphones into the frame. the company calls it a "sports glass," and it's not intended to be worn all day. in contrast, google is reportedly developing an internet-enabled watch, codenamed "gem," which could be unveiled soon. google now alerts for directions and text messages are expected to be included in this wearable device, and it may use android software. microsoft is also reportedly preparing to enter the market with a head-mounted display, possibly based on its gaming experience. price point may differentiate these devices from google glass, which is expected to retail for $1,500. samsung has previously launched the galaxy gear smartwatch and is rumored to be working on a second-generation model with a curved oled display.
2331	a woman named magalie bamu and her boyfriend, eric bikubi, were sentenced to life in prison for torturing and killing magalie's teenage brother, kristy bamu, in london in 2010. the 15-year-old suffered over 130 injuries during the four-day attack, which involved various weapons such as broken ceramic floor tiles, pliers, and a pole. the pair accused kristy of witchcraft after he arrived from paris for christmas and beat him mercilessly, while his siblings were forced to pray and fast. kristy eventually drowned in the bath after begging to die. the defendants had pleaded not guilty, but a jury found them guilty of manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility due to their belief in witchcraft. the judge emphasized that no belief in witchcraft can excuse violence against another person or the taking of a human life. the case has called attention to the prevalence of crimes motivated by beliefs in witchcraft, which is believed to be under-reported. detective superintendent terry sharpe warned of the need for more action to tackle such crimes. the issue of witchcraft-related violence in the uk was first highlighted by the case of victoria climbie in 2000.
2332	the facebook page of abigail madison nanny and household staffing inc., a high-end nanny agency in new york, has become a real-life reflection of the 2002 novel "the nanny diaries," revealing extravagant requests from wealthy families seeking household help. the agency posts various job advertisements on their page, detailing demanding requirements such as fluency in multiple languages, home-schooling, and even specific dialects like tagalog. some families ask their nannies to clean, set formal tables, and cook healthy meals. one family even asked for a nanny to work a 50-hour week for just $450 per week. while some offer impressive rewards like annual holidays and high salaries, the expectations don't always match the compensation offered. abigail madison's owner, erin maloney-winder, admitted that some requests were "bizarre," including one for a nanny to be able to take children to playdates and broadway auditions. the averagesalary offered for two children is $800 per week, but some families require additional duties like home-schooling that may not be compensated appropriately. the strict requirements may lead to impressive rewards, including paid vacations, luxurious trips, and large bonuses.
2333	cornelius gurlitt, the recluse son of nazi-era art dealer hildebrand gurlitt, wants the £1 billion worth of art treasures confiscated from his munich apartment returned, despite some pieces being identified as nazi loot taken from jews. gurlitt, 80, claims his father acquired the art legally and sees himself as their rightful owner. he is bitter towards the state, media, and even his deceased sister benita. he has given investigators documents to prove his innocence and is under investigation for tax evasion and misappropriation of assets. the art seizure, which includes works by picasso, matisse, and renoir, among others, has subjected gurlitt to a media firestorm, which he detests. he has received a letter indicating some works will be returned, but he wants the entire collection back. gurlitt believes evil still resides in munich, where the nazi party was founded, and has never been in love with a human being, considering the art his only love. he has experienced many painful goodbyes in his life but finds the sale of the art the most difficult.
2334	in the 2012 wisconsin recall election, republican governor scott walker secured a convincing victory, marking a significant triumph for conservatives aiming to limit public employee unions' bargaining power. the highly contested vote, often described as the second most crucial election of the year, was sparked by walker's budget repair bill that curtailed collective bargaining for most public sector unions and introduced a freedom of choice provision regarding union membership. despite strong protests and opposition, walker's approval ratings improved, and, in the final days before the election, poll results showed him with a solid lead. the struggle between the governor and public sector unions serves as a microcosm of growing resentment against perceived abuses and excessive power within public sector unions, evidenced by similar campaigns in states like new jersey, indiana, and california. in today's economic climate, governors and mayors are working to reduce financial obligations to union pension and health plans amidst mounting bills. however, it is crucial to distinguish between addressing broken aspects of public employee unions and engaging in all-out warfare. collaboration and finding mutually beneficial solutions are essential to ensuring the provision of high-quality public services while maintaining a productive relationship between labor and management.
2335	a 68-year-old man was punched by an unidentified germaphobe in the roosevelt avenue-74th street subway station in jackson heights, queens, on christmas eve, around 6:30 p.m. the suspect became enraged after the elderly man sneezed, causing him to lose balance and fall to the floor with a head injury. witnesses described the suspect as a dark-haired man in his 30s, wearing glasses and a dark beige waist-length coat. the victim was taken to elmhurst hospital for treatment. the nypd is asking anyone with information to call the crime stoppers hotline or visit their website.
2336	an american airlines pilot removed alec baldwin from a flight on tuesday after the actor refused to turn off his cell phone and became argumentative with the crew. baldwin apologized for the incident but blamed a female flight attendant for singling him out while other passengers continued to use their phones. the incident caused a delay and spread widely on social media, with some passengers and others expressing support for baldwin. the airline said baldwin was denied boarding after he slammed the lavatory door and alarmed the cockpit crew when they checked on the situation. baldwin had previously tweeted about playing "words with friends" during the hold at the gate, and later tweeted that he would never fly american airlines again. the company has reached out to baldwin to gather more information about the incident. baldwin eventually continued his journey on a later american airlines flight.
2337	a receptionist identified as vasundhara sharma, 27, attacked an indian doctor, dr. arpit chopra, in his surgery after she claimed he had lied about his intention to marry her. the incident, which occurred in october, was captured on cctv footage, showing sharma slapping and punching dr. chopra, stripping him off his clothes, and leaving him unconscious. despite his employees witnessing the assault, they did not intervene, believing it to be a private matter. the case is being investigated as a sexual harassment and assault incident by the police, with both parties filing complaints. india has laws against promising to marry someone to start a relationship and then reneging on that promise, which can be considered a criminal offense if it leads to involuntary sexual relations. the woman's father has stated that she should be acquitted due to the doctor's deceit, but dr. chopra maintains that the woman was delusional and he had dismissed her when she tried to form a relationship with him. the police have promised a thorough investigation and appropriate action against whoever is found guilty.
2338	necker island, owned by sir richard branson since 1979, is a luxury paradise in the british virgin islands that has played host to numerous a-list celebrities and royalty. the great house on the island was severely damaged by a fire in 2011, but after two years of refurbishment, it's set to reopen for exclusive hire at £40,000 per night. the new structure features a master bedroom with unbelievable views, access to private beaches, a swimming pool, and beach houses. the island can accommodate up to 30 adults, and the exclusive week's rental for six individual bali houses and two tennis courts costs £275,800. the great house was gutted by the fire, which was caused by a lightning strike, and guests such as kate winslet helped rescue sir richard branson's mother. the new house boasts an expansive outdoor terrace, a large dining table for al fresco meals, and a fully-stocked bar. necker island, which has attracted royalty, megastars, and politicians, was named after a 17th-century dutch commander and remains a popular retreat for the wealthy and famous.
2339	on december 14, 2012, at sandy hook elementary school in newtown, connecticut, kindergarten students in janet vollmer's classroom heard gunfire outside their door during a mass shooting that left 20 children and six educators dead. the children, too young to grasp the concept of a mass shooting, were kept calm as they listened to voller read to them, ignoring their questions about the noise. elsewhere in the school, first-grade teacher kaitlin roig herded her students into the bathroom for safety. police later discovered the gunman had committed suicide in the building, leaving behind the bodies of victims. the community was in shock, and parents were reunited with their children at a nearby firehouse. the sandy hook elementary school shooting was the second-deadliest in u.s. history, leaving a sense of vulnerability and sadness in its wake.
2340	chick-fil-a, a fast food chain with over $4 billion in sales and 1,608 locations, has faced criticism for its president dan cathy's comments in support of the "biblical definition of the family unit," which excludes same-sex couples. cathy's remarks drew backlash from consumers, celebrities, and educational institutions, such as northeastern university in boston, which scrapped plans to open a chick-fil-a on campus due to the company's donations to organizations opposing gay marriage. chick-fil-a has a history of donating millions to christian groups with anti-gay agendas and was criticized for sponsoring a relationship seminar in pennsylvania that excluded same-sex couples. while cathy previously stated that the company would not get involved in the political debate on same-sex marriage, he clarified his stance in a recent radio interview, expressing his opposition to gay marriage and invoking god's mercy on the generation that defies his definition of marriage. the controversy has led some to boycott chick-fil-a and shift to alternative sources for chicken sandwiches.
2341	hillary clinton was named the most admired woman in the world for the 13th consecutive year in gallup's annual survey, with president barack obama holding the top spot for men for the seventh year in a row. clinton, a former secretary of state, senator, and first lady, received 12% of mentions, while oprah winfrey followed with 8%, and malala yousafzai, michelle obama, and angelina jolie were also mentioned by several percent. obama has been the most admired man for the past 17 out of 18 years, with only 12 exceptions for u.s. presidents. clinton has held the top spot more than any other woman, including six times more than eleanor roosevelt. other notable mentions for women included elizabeth warren, laura bush, and sarah palin, with 1%, 1%, and 2% mentionings, respectively. bill clinton, pope francis, george w. bush, ben carson, stephen hawking, bill gates, bill o'reilly, netanyahu, and putin were also mentioned as admired men.
2342	a michigan man, alvaro eduardo guzman-telles, 29, faces a federal charge for threatening to kill and behead new york city police officer daniel pantaleo, who gained notoriety for putting eric garner in a chokehold that led to garner's death in july 2014. guzman-telles made the threats in facebook posts in december 2014, which also included calls to "kill all cops on sight, no matter the circumstances." the fbi traced the posts to an address in sterling heights, michigan, and arrested guzman-telles last month on a charge of interstate transmission of threatening communications. pantaleo was not indicted for garner's death by a grand jury in december, sparking protests around the country. guzman-telles' mother was recently questioned by the fbi, and she reportedly urged her son to delete the posts due to their potentially dangerous consequences.
2343	hu jintao, the outgoing leader of china's communist party, is leaving a mixed legacy after a decade in power marked by rapid social and economic changes, but also political turmoil, disasters, and crackdowns. working with premier wen jiabao, hu has solidified china's position as a global power, but faced criticism for the uneven distribution of wealth and lack of progress in narrowing the wealth gap. hu, an engineer with experience in underdeveloped provinces, rose through the communist youth league and assumed the top party post in 2002, espousing policies of balanced, equitable, and sustainable development. under hu, china became the world's second-largest economy and made strides in military and space technology, but faced ethnic unrest and political opposition, which resulted in harsh crackdowns and repression of dissidents. hu advocated a "peaceful rise," but critics say china is far from harmonious, with conflicts and contradictions worsening. hu's attempt to amend the party's constitution to include his scientific development mantra was seen as a sign of power consolidation. however, hu failed to narrow the wealth gap and made little progress in curbing endemic corruption, leading to criticism of his leadership as weak and missed opportunities. the new leadership, with xi jinping expected to take over as general secretary, is facing fractious bargaining among the party elite and external demands for change, which may take time for xi to address.
2344	sen. hillary clinton has stopped telling a story about a pregnant woman from ohio who died after being denied medical care due to concerns over its accuracy. the woman was described as being uninsured and having made minimum wage at a local pizza shop. clinton had heard the story during a campaign visit in late february from a resident of pomeroy, ohio, named bryan holman. the hospital where the woman was treated, o'bleness memorial hospital in athens, ohio, has disputed the account, stating that the woman had insurance and was never denied care. clinton's campaign has acknowledged that while she had no reason to doubt the story when she heard it, they were unable to confirm the details and will no longer be recounting it.
2345	a 19-year-old woman named cheyanne willis from ohio was brutally attacked by a group of six women, including two she knew, at a suburban cincinnati mall on christmas eve. the women allegedly took turns kicking and beating willis, shaving her head, and brutalized her in front of her then-boyfriend, quincy gardner. the attackers posted photographs and videos of the assault on social media to humiliate her. willis suffered from black eyes, multiple concussions, and a slashed tire on her car. her attackers stole her purse with $50 and her cell phone and threatened to kill her if she reported the crime. gardner and another woman, cheyenne fisher, have been charged with robbery in connection to the incident. willis is traumatized and afraid to leave her house due to the attack and the lingering fear for her safety. police are continuing to investigate the case.
2346	a 23-year-old window fitter named david curson, who was described as a "happy-go-lucky" individual, hanged himself months before his wedding due to a supposedly "bad trip" triggered by his recreational use of cocaine, an inquest in bolton heard. although he was an occasional user, mr. curson agreed to stop using the drug at the request of his fiancée, anne-marie johnson. however, he took it again while house-sitting for his mother, leading to a lethally depressive comedown. the coroner, jennifer leeming, recorded a narrative verdict, stating that mr. curson may not have intended to take his own life and noted that the depressive effects of cocaine could be dangerous and inexplicable, even to those who use it occasionally. family and friends, including mr. curson's father and work colleague, expressed their shock and sadness over his tragic and untimely death.
2347	the article discusses the importance of airline branding through plane designs, and how mergers and acquisitions in the industry have led to an increase in planes being repainted with new identities. american airlines and us airways are the latest to merge, forming the largest airline in the world, with up to 73 planes set to be repainted by the end of 2023 to reflect the new branding. the new design will include silver paint with silver stripes on the tail, representing a modern and reflective look, although some critics argue that the old logo, featuring an eagle and double "a," has been radically changed. in recent years, us carriers have consolidated from six to three, with mergers leading to careful branding decisions. for example, united kept its recognized name and continental's logo to bring continuity, while delta absorbed northwest airlines' distinctive globe logo. repainting planes to reflect new branding is a common occurrence in europe, with british midland international and germanwings being recent examples. the process can use large amounts of spray paint, with planes requiring around 750 liters for a single repaint. walsh predicts more consolidation in the industry, which will likely lead to more repainting of planes.
2348	argentinian president cristina kirchner met with pope francis i at the vatican yesterday, requesting his intervention regarding the falkland islands dispute between argentina and britain. the two leaders have a history of disagreements, particularly over socially liberal policies and same-sex marriage. during their three-hour private and informal meeting, kirchner presented the pope with traditional argentine gifts, including a mate gourd and straw for tea. it is unclear how the pope responded to her request. world leaders, including zimbabwe's robert mugabe and us vice president joe biden, are attending pope francis i's installation mass in rome today. mugabe, who is exempted from europe's travel ban, met with the pope yesterday at the vatican hotel. taiwanese president ma ying-jeou also arrived in rome yesterday, expressing hopes for improved relations with the vatican. pope francis i, known for his informal style, made an unconventional call to the vatican receptionist directly, but was initially met with skepticism before being identified as the pope. the installation mass is expected to attract over a million people and will mark the first time the spiritual leader of the orthodox christians, ecumenical patriarch bartholomew i, attends a papal installation since the roman catholic and orthodox churches split a millennium ago.
2349	hull bounced back from four consecutive defeats in super league with a dominating 50-12 victory over the 12-man london broncos, who extended their losing streak to 15 games. teenage winger callum lancaster scored two tries on his second senior appearance, with joe westerman adding a brace. the broncos started strong with an early try by james greenwood from a charging down of a hull clearing kick. hull's gareth ellis levelled the scores, and london's scott moore was sent off for a dangerous tackle on lancaster. the one-sided encounter saw hull outscoring london nine tries to two. the win gave hull a much-needed boost and left london anchored to the bottom of the league table.
2350	a counselor in brooklyn's orthodox jewish community, nechemya weberman, was found guilty on monday of sexually abusing a girl for three years, beginning when she was 12 years old. the victim, now 17, testified at the trial, and weberman faces a possible sentence of 117 years in prison. pearl reich, a victim's advocate, described the verdict as a new era for the jewish religious community and expressed hope that it will encourage other victims to come forward. the victim's case highlighted the insular nature of the satmar hasidic community, where it is rare for respected members to face such allegations in court, and some have used intimidation and pressure to silence accusers. the case came to light last year when four men were arrested for attempting to bribe the victim and her boyfriend to drop the case against weberman, who had a large community support system trying to silence them. sentencing is set for january 9.
2351	the rojhanis, a florida family, stopped paying their mortgage on their 2-year-old home in april due to health concerns caused by chinese-manufactured drywall. they believe the drywall is emitting corrosive gasses that are causing upper respiratory infections, copper wiring failure, and appliance damage. the family, along with homeowners in 13 states, are facing foreclosure or the prospect of paying both their mortgage and rent as they seek relief. the environmental protection agency (epa) has discovered sulfur, strontium, and certain elements found in acrylic paints in the chinese drywall, but has not yet established a definitive link to the reported health issues. homeowners are turning to the government for assistance, with some homeowners receiving temporary reprieves on mortgage payments, but the long-term outcomes are unclear. the center for disease control and prevention, the epa, and the u.s. consumer product safety commission are conducting studies on the health effects of the drywall. several homeowners have already filed lawsuits against their home builders and the chinese manufacturers. the gypsum association estimates that enough chinese drywall was imported during the housing boom to build 30,000 complete homes. florida leads the nation in complaints about the drywall, with other complaints coming from various states. insurance companies are not covering the damages caused by the drywall, adding financial strain to affected families. federal and state representatives are working on legislation to address the issue, including examining the effect of chinese drywall on mortgage foreclosures and studying the availability of property insurance coverage for these homes.
2352	kobe bryant, the los angeles lakers guard and five-time nba champion, likely suffered a torn achilles tendon during a game against the golden state warriors on april 12, 2013. the injury occurred during a normal move toward the hoop, and bryant felt a pop in his left foot before falling to the floor. the lakers are almost certain that bryant will miss the rest of the season due to the injury, which requires months of rehabilitation. bryant, who has played over 38 minutes per game this season and is the fourth-leading scorer in nba history, is disappointed but determined to recover and continue his career. the lakers are currently one game ahead of the utah jazz for the final playoff spot in the western conference with two games remaining, and they may have to do so without bryant if an mri on saturday confirms the diagnosis. bryant, who is making nearly $30.5 million next season in the final year of his contract, has been fiercely competitive and has played through numerous injuries this season. the lakers' offseason is shaping up to be uncertain, with dwight howard's impending free agency still a major concern. bryant is considered one of the greatest competitors in nba history and has been an inspiration to his teammates throughout the season.
2353	the article from cnn discusses the role of born-again and evangelical voters in the upcoming iowa republican caucuses. in the 2008 caucuses, these voters made up a large portion of the republican turnout and helped mike huckabee secure an upset victory. this year, candidates michele bachmann, rick perry, and rick santorum are hoping to replicate huckabee's success. however, the article points out that iowa's republican voters in new hampshire have historically been skeptical of candidates perceived as too religious, as evidenced by huckabee's distant third-place finish in the 2008 new hampshire primary, and pat robertson's fifth-place showing and 9% of the votes in the same primary in 1988. a survey of 64 iowa republican insiders was conducted by cnn, and only 46% believed that if one of the more conservative candidates finished strongly in iowa, they would be able to consolidate the born-again/evangelical vote and become a significant factor in the republican nominating contest. the skepticism was informed by the failures of previous candidates to capitalize on strong iowa showings to win the nomination. the results of the survey suggest that despite the potential influence of born-again and evangelical voters in iowa, the road to the nomination is still uncertain for those candidates.
2354	ali carter, a two-time world championship runner-up and former world no. 2, made a triumphant return to competitive snooker after his lung cancer diagnosis by defeating marco fu 4-1 at the general cup in hong kong. carter, who had previously battled testicular cancer, made breaks of 55 in all three frames he won over fu. despite facing pains in his left arm after chemotherapy treatment that forced him to withdraw from a tournament in sofia, carter had not competed since the world championship. despite the general cup not affecting the rankings, carter could still feature in the uk championship in york next month. carter expressed his delight at the win on twitter.
2355	major richard streatfeild, a british army officer whose emotional dispatches from afghanistan moved millions of radio listeners, has admitted deceiving the public by not highlighting the fatal equipment shortages that led to the deaths and injuries of his troops in helmand province. streatfeild, who resigned from the army in 2012, claims that the ministry of defense (mod) sent his soldiers into battle without adequate protection, including armored vehicles, radios, and bomb detection devices. in an interview with the mail on sunday, he accused the mod of criminal negligence for not providing the necessary equipment. despite his knowledge of these shortages, streatfeild had given a reassuring but misleading account of the provision of equipment on bbc radio 4's today programme in march 2010. five soldiers were killed and 35 wounded, and in some cases, the lack of communication devices resulted in friendly fire incidents. streatfeild was particularly distressed by the death of lance corporal michael pritchard, who was accidentally shot by a british soldier due to a lack of communication equipment. he now regrets not speaking out about the equipment crisis at the time. the mod disputes streatfeild's claims and insists that upgraded equipment was being introduced at the time. streatfeild has written a book, "honourable warriors," detailing his experiences and attacking the mod over equipment failures and tactics used against the taliban.
2356	swedish high street retailer h&m has been announced as the official clothing provider for both the swedish olympic and paralympic teams for the upcoming winter olympics in sochi, russia. the collection, which includes leisure and sportswear, will debut in january 2014. h&m's designs, inspired by swedish heritage, will be modeled by athletes viktoria and joshi helgesson, and david ekholm in the campaign. this is a first for h&m, but not for olympic teams, as some have turned to high street retailers for uniforms in the past. the collection will reflect h&m's innovative and exciting approach to sportswear, with athletes involved in the design process. the partnership marks a significant moment for h&m as a swedish brand and a renowned international name. h&m's rivals, such as team usa with ralph lauren, have faced criticism for sourcing their uniforms overseas. other teams have opted for upmarket brands like hermès and armani for their uniforms. the dutch team stands out with their bright orange kit designed by sportswear giant nike. athletes have expressed their happiness about representing their country in clothing from a swedish brand like h&m.
2357	north korean leader kim jong il's body has been laid in state in a glass coffin at kumsusan memorial palace in pyongyang, surrounded by floral wreaths and covered in a red blanket. the country is in an 11-day period of official mourning, with flags flown at half-mast and crowds gathering at landmarks to mourn kim jong il, who died suddenly on december 17 from a massive heart attack at the age of 69. he ruled north korea for 17 years in a brutal and repressive dictatorship marked by economic mismanagement and human rights abuses, including the deadly famine in the 1990s, imprisonment of political opponents, and lack of access to freedom of the press, the internet, or healthcare. kim jong un, his third son and successor, paid his respects to his father during a solemn ceremony, along with top military and workers' party officials. a state funeral is scheduled for december 28, and kim jong il will be laid to rest in the palace, where his father, kim il sung, is also on display. despite the solemn mood, there are concerns about the transition of power in the nuclear-armed state, with little known about kim jong un and potential power struggles in the regime's highly secretive leadership.
2358	a driver, suspected of being drunk, lost control of his cadillac early wednesday morning in indianapolis and crashed into a house, causing around $175,000 worth of damage. the homeowners' two young daughters and their mother, who were sleeping inside, were miraculously unharmed. the crash occurred in the living room, where the mother had hosted a girl scouts meeting hours earlier. the driver and his passenger were taken to the hospital for checks and alcohol tests. the family is staying with neighbors until they can return to their home, which has been made safe by fire crews.
2359	sonali mukherjee, a promising 17-year-old student in india, had a promising future ahead of her despite her humble background. however, her life took a turning point when three men from her college harassed and attacked her with acid in 2003, leaving her with severe burns to her face and upper chest, and rendering her blind, deaf, and unable to eat, walk, or talk. her father, the sole breadwinner, was devastated but remained resilient and spent all his savings on her treatment. ten years after the attack, with the support of her father, sonali participated in india's popular game show "who wants to be a millionaire?" and won the jackpot of $40,000 to fund her treatment in new delhi. her attackers were freed after just two years in jail, and sonali has yet to receive justice despite her ongoing legal appeals. india recently passed a new law punishing acid attackers with 10 years to life in prison and a fine.
2360	twelve people were killed and dozens were injured during a shooting at a colorado movie theater during a midnight screening of "the dark knight rises" in july 2012. the suspect, james holmes, dressed in tactical gear and armed with an ar-15 rifle, a 12-gauge shotgun, and a .40-caliber pistol, opened fire inside the theater. holmes, who was a doctoral student at the university of colorado denver, faced 166 charges, including murder and weapons offenses. his motive for the crime is not yet clear. he had previously been treated by a university psychiatrist. the hearing beginning this week is expected to provide more details about the case and holmes' potential defense of diminished capacity. holmes' apartment was also found to be booby-trapped with grenades and gasoline. holmes, who had no prior criminal record in colorado, had excelled academically but had a summons for speeding in 2011. the horror unfolded as holmes propped open a rear exit door, gathered weapons, and re-entered the theater, shooting at random. the shooting lasted for around seven minutes before holmes surrendered, and local hospitals were overwhelmed with victims. governor john hickenlooper called it "an act of evil."
2361	a spanish photographer, josé antonio de lamadrid, has taken moving and candid photographs of triplets, alejandro, álvaro, and jaime morillo aguilar, who are all eighteen years old and have autism. over the course of two years, lamadrid followed the brothers, who were diagnosed with the complex neurological disorder at the age of five, due to their difficulties communicating and socializing. despite their challenges, the triplets have a strong brotherly bond, and their parents noted differences in their children when they turned one, as they did not respond to calls or seem interested in common stimuli. the brothers, who attend a local high school and have different levels of learning difficulties, have a routine-driven lifestyle, meticulously documenting their days in diaries, and following the same routines every friday, including going to the library and recreation center. their condition also manifests in various ways, such as fixations on objects, strong memories, and sensitivity to noise. lamadrid, who has personal experience with autism through his nephew, hopes that his photographs will raise awareness and encourage greater support for families dealing with the condition. despite the challenges, the morillo aguilar family remains optimistic and happy, looking forward to the future and the realization of their children's dreams.
2362	a man named daniel gray, visiting his girlfriend kathleen starrie in edmonton, canada, built an igloo using hundreds of frozen milk cartons as bricks. the idea was initiated by kathleen's mother, brigid burton, to keep daniel occupied during his five-week trip. the labor-intensive process took five days to complete and involved freezing the cartons, packing them in snow and water, and meticulously constructing the spherical shape. the igloo became a viral hit on reddit, with over 10,000 views. traditionally used by the inuit people of the arctic region as hunting homes, igloos have gained popularity as unique accommodations in boutique hotels, with resorts in switzerland, andorra, and austria offering igloo villages where guests can stay for up to $299 a night with amenities such as restaurants, ice bars, and hot tubs.
2363	iran has reportedly activated its heavy-water production plant in arak to produce plutonium for a nuclear bomb, despite international inspections being banned from the site for the past 18 months. satellite images revealed clouds of steam emerging from the site, which is heavily guarded and surrounded by military installations. iranian negotiators met with world powers in kazakhstan for the first time in eight months to discuss its nuclear program, with demands for tehran to close the underground fordow facility near qom, which is causing major concerns. despite diplomacy and economic pressure, iran has insisted its nuclear program is peaceful, while the international community believes it is being used to develop weapons. negotiations ended without a fully resolved deal, but technical experts from both sides will meet in istanbul in coming weeks to discuss the latest proposals. there have also been reports of an explosion at iran's fordow nuclear facility, which iran denies. iran began producing 20% uranium at fordow in 2011, which is higher than the 3.5% level needed for nuclear energy, but below the 90% level used in nuclear bombs. several un security council resolutions have ordered iran to suspend all uranium enrichment.
2364	queen elizabeth ii marks her 60-year reign as monarch of the uk with various celebrations, including a flotilla of 1,000 boats on the river thames. her reign is the second-longest at 60 years and 4 months, and she owns the imperial state crown with 2,868 diamonds and wears a st. edward's crown weighing 4.9 lbs at her coronation. the british government provides her and prince philip an annual budget of £32.1 million, and she has made 261 official overseas visits to 116 different countries. there have been 12 prime ministers and 12 us presidents since her reign began, and she is the only british monarch to have celebrated a diamond wedding anniversary and the only person in the uk who can drive without a license or passport.
2365	a man identified as "christian" gained notoriety for taking a dangerous selfie while running from a herd of bulls during the houston bull run in texas. the event, modeled after the famous spanish bull-running spectacle pamplona, drew over 3,000 participants and resulted in one injury to a runner named hugo soto. christian, who is seen in a video huffing and puffing in anticipation and fear before sprinting away from the bulls, became an internet sensation when a spectator captured his selfie and posted it on reddit. the event organizer's goal was to bring the pamplona bull run experience to the united states, but the dangerous stunt resulted in injuries and raised concerns about the safety of the event.
2366	on december 12, 2014, cnn student news covers various topics including a monster storm affecting the west coast of the us and central america, a proposed canal in nicaragua, and the benefits and limitations of a popular power source. the weekly newsquiz includes questions on us troop reductions in a middle eastern country, artificial sweeteners, us unemployment rate, endangered herbivore, thomas edison, the largest museum complex, a storm hitting new york and new england, the line of succession for the us presidency, a storm affecting the sierra nevada mountains, and a planned canal through central america. schools can request to be mentioned on the cnn student news roll call by commenting with their school name, mascot, city, and state.
2367	the democratic republic of congo (drc) announced the beginning of construction for the first phase of the ingas 3 hydroelectric project at the ingas falls on the congo river, with a power output of nearly 4,800 megawatts (mw). when completed, grand inga, a series of five further stages, would have an astonishing capacity of 40,000 mw, making it twice the size of the three gorges dam in china. south africa has agreed to purchase half of the electricity generated. the drc aims to provide renewable energy to more than 500 million people. the congo river, second longest in africa and second in flow worldwide, has largely untapped power potential due to violence and corruption in the country. only two dams, ingas 1 and 2, have been built, primarily for mining companies, and are undergoing renovation. the drc is seeking developers and financing for the project, with several consortia and financial institutions involved. critics argue that the poor will not benefit from the project as most of the electricity will be exported or used by the mining industry. alternative solutions, such as wind, solar, and micro-hydroelectric projects, are suggested for a cheaper and more effective approach to tackling energy poverty in africa.
2368	brandon lewis, the conservative minister for local councils, admitted during a television interview that he had "mixed memory" about what he could recycle at home in his own area, specifically regarding yoghurt pots. the minister, who was a council leader for five years and is responsible for setting recycling rules for english and welsh local authorities, was later corrected by his wife and had to admit his mistake. the mix-up came during a discussion on bbc breakfast about recycling confusion and the need to keep things simple for residents. after the interview, lewis tweeted about waste collection and the importance of clarity, but his own council's rules state that yoghurt pots cannot be recycled. the incident sparked criticism about the complexity of recycling rules and lewis' ability to lead on the issue. he later emphasized the importance of making recycling easy for people and reducing the number of bins to simplify the process.
2369	environment secretary owen paterson described wind farms as "huge unhappiness" and a "complete scam" across the country. his comments come as the government gives local communities more power to block wind turbines in their areas, as part of new planning rules. the new rules require developers to gain local consent before making planning applications and to consider the impact on the environment, countryside, and views. in return, communities can receive up to 20% off their electricity bills if they allow wind farms near their homes. however, paterson acknowledged that many wind farms are deeply unpopular, especially in inland areas. greenpeace criticized paterson's stance on wind farms, accusing him of denying the science of climate change and pushing for shale gas instead, while highlighting the importance of wind power in the uk's energy mix. paterson's appointment as environment secretary last september was controversial due to his past comments about wind farms and alleged climate change denial.
2370	nick clegg, deputy prime minister, suggested stripping wealthy pensioners of universal benefits such as free bus passes and winter fuel allowances due to budget deficit cuts. anyone with assets over £1 million could lose these payments. the proposals are expected to be included in the liberal democrat manifesto in 2015, but some senior lib dems are pushing for implemented sooner. work and pensions secretary iain duncan smith wants an end to universal benefits for the elderly to save £10 billion from the welfare budget. the issue sparked controversy, with some urging action immediately but others warning about the administration costs and potential impact on those in need. lord sugar, a wealthy pensioner, criticized clegg's comments and accused him of being an 'idiot' and a 'twit'. the liberal democrats are also reportedly considering increasing council tax on multi-million pound homes to generate more revenue.
2371	the arrest of sinaloa drug cartel kingpin joaquin "el chapo" guzman has led to speculation about the identity of his successor, with ismael "el mayo" zambada, a close confidant and reported brains behind the operation, identified as the likely candidate. zambada, a 66-year-old rural farmer from the same area of mexico as guzman, is respected by both members and outsiders of the cartel. he is known for preferring to hold back on drug supplies instead of flooding the market and for being less violent than his predecessor. however, the long-term fate of the cartel is unclear, as authorities pursue other top leaders and weaker rivals dream of taking over. the sinaloa cartel, which has evolved into a worldwide organization, is believed to handle 25 to 45 percent of all drugs entering the united states and has revenues around $3 billion a year. the cartel is believed to operate with an extended network of corrupt officials and has grown to be one of the largest in the world since guzman escaped from a mexican prison in 2001. despite the capture of guzman, the drugs will still continue to flow as long as there is demand.
2372	twitter has released its own library of eight retro filters for instagram-like photo editing on its android and iphone apps, aiming to keep users from using instagram or other external editing apps. the filters, which include desaturated, black and white, and high contrast, were designed by photo-editing service aviary, and include auto-adjust and cropping options. twitter senior designer colleen baik emphasized the importance of images on the platform for self-expression. the update comes after twitter and instagram ended their agreement for instagram photos to be displayed directly on twitter. instagram also released an updated app with a new black and white filter and grid overlay, among other features, in direct competition with twitter. the latest versions of twitter for iphone and twitter for android are now available in the respective app stores.
2373	a woman named donna foot claimed she had a 17-year long secret relationship with jimmy savile, beginning in the 1980s, after he flattered her outside bbc studios. she was unaware of his paedophilic tendencies at the time and later felt disgusted and betrayed upon learning of his abuse. savile reportedly called her "do-do," signed memorabilia for her, and arranged for their clandestine meetings. in 1999, foot became pregnant with what she believed was savile's child but chose to have an abortion. they ended their relationship soon after, and foot is now married to a different man and lives in surrey. foot expressed regret for not recognizing savile's manipulative behavior and sympathy for his victims, especially children.
2374	carl djerassi, the inventor of the contraceptive pill, spoke about the upcoming revolutionary changes to reproductive options in the next 50 years. he discussed the possibility of reproduction without sex, such as freezing eggs or sperm in one's twenties and using them in later life for in vitro fertilization (ivf). other potential developments include freezing ovarian tissue or stem cells to create a fresh supply of eggs, or producing eggs from stem cells derived from skin or bone marrow. according to djerassi, these advancements could empower women, especially those with demanding careers, by allowing them to have children later in life. he also highlighted the importance of addressing social and biological barriers, such as lack of affordable childcare and the limitations of menopause, to achieve gender equality in society. djerassi argued that technology could provide more ethical options for same-sex couples, single individuals, and those facing social or religious obstacles to have children of their own.
2375	in irbil, iraq, the question remains who will join the u.s.-led coalition in their air campaign against isis after the uk launched its first airstrikes. turkey has put a motion before its parliament seeking authorization for military action against isis, while australian aircraft have started flying over iraq in support of allied operations. retired u.s. marine general john r. allen, who is coordinating the coalition against isis, says there is an opportunity for broad cooperation despite the struggles to define roles. the u.s. has carried out the busiest day of airstrikes against isis since the campaign began, with 28 total, including two uk strikes. meanwhile, syria is dealing with the aftermath of twin blasts near a school in homs, resulting in the deaths of at least 39 people, including 30 children. the refugee crisis continues to escalate as 150,000 people have fled to turkey in recent days, and isis fighters are advancing on kobani in northern syria. in other news, there were reports of clashes between kurdish fighters and isis near the syrian village of siftak and a motorcycle bombing in a village in northern kirkuk, iraq, resulting in deaths and injuries.
2376	a former sas soldier, identified as "soldier n," who made claims that princess diana was murdered by british special forces, has allegedly fled the country just before he was set to be interviewed by scotland yard. he reportedly told his wife that a member of the royal inner circle instructed the hit because they disapproved of diana's relationship with dodi fayed. soldier n was due to meet with scotland yard's dci phil easton but is believed to have left the country on monday or tuesday. he may have traveled to the united arab emirates while his family remains in hereford. the investigation was reportedly prompted by the wife's allegations that a white car and motorbike were involved in the plot, which enlisted the services of one of soldier n's former sas colleagues. the woman reportedly kept quiet about her husband's theory out of secrecy. the investigation could also uncover recordings of the crash, as it's claimed diana's phone was bugged by gchq. soldier n is also accused of stealing money while serving in iraq and afghanistan. in the past, the uk security industry source claimed that gchq was remotely tape-recording diana and dodi until the moment of the crash in 1997. the sas reportedly developed tactics to thwart ira bombing plots during that time and had the capacity to listen to their conversations. diana, 36, fayed, 42, their driver henri paul, 41, and diana's bodyguard trevor rees-jones were killed in the crash. mohammed al fayed, dodi's father, has long claimed that the deaths were a planned murder by the british establishment and mi6.
2377	the analysis of sickest swine flu patients in australia, canada, mexico, and new zealand reveals that relatively healthy adolescents and young adults are at higher risk of developing severe symptoms and respiratory failure from h1n1 infection. the mortality rate ranges from 14.3% to 41.4%, depending on the country. young patients often require mechanical ventilation and intensive care unit admission within a few days of developing symptoms. the studies also suggest that young, healthy individuals can quickly develop respiratory failure which may not be reversible with mechanical ventilation but are currently not a priority group for h1n1 vaccination. the authors call for increased preparation and investment in antivirals, antibiotics, and mechanical ventilation systems to combat the upcoming flu season. the analysis highlights the importance of h1n1 vaccination for children, stating that it is safe and similar to the regular flu vaccine in terms of safety. the mortality rate of h1n1 is reportedly similar to that of seasonal flu but can result in regrettable deaths due to insufficient planning and preparation.
2378	kitty mansfield, from ramsgate, kent, is the uk's first professional snuggler, offering customers a therapeutic cuddling service for £45 an hour at her seaside home. the non-sexual service, which is the first of its kind in the uk and one of only two in the world, aims to provide human connection and the benefits of oxytocin release. mansfield, who is a former holistic therapist, offers various types of cuddles, including "stereo snuggles" with her second snuggler, natalya. she invites clients to bring their favorite comfort items and insists on underwear at all times. despite the controversy, mansfield believes that people have a natural need for touch and aims to provide a safe, non-judgmental space for those seeking human connection.
2379	the united states is in talks with israel about the early release of convicted spy jonathan pollard as an incentive for israel to make significant concessions in middle east peace negotiations. pollard, who has served nearly three decades in prison, was arrested in 1985 after providing classified documents to israeli handlers. the discussions are far from certain, and no deal is imminent. in return for pollard's release, israel would reportedly have to make significant concessions, including a freeze on settlements and the release of palestinian prisoners. prime minister benjamin netanyahu met with secretary of state john kerry on monday, and the negotiations are continuing. pollard's case has widespread sympathy in israel, but he has consistently faced stiff opposition from the american military and intelligence community, who argue that his release would harm national security.
2380	experts believe that dinosaurs, including pachycephalosaurids or "pachys," breathed through their noses for both smelling their surroundings and cooling their brains. a team of scholars from ohio university employed computational fluid dynamics and 3d modeling to explore how air flowed through the nasal passages of modern-day animals like ostriches and alligators, using these findings to reconstruct the breathing patterns of pachycephalosaurids. the research revealed the presence of nasal turbinates, which are delicate scrolls of bone responsible for filtering and humidifying air, both in the back of the nasal cavity for smelling and the front part for respiration. the discovery of these structures in pachycephalosaurids and their similarities with modern-day animals imply that they may have had a keen sense of smell and efficient cooling mechanisms for their relatively small brains. the scientists are now working on investigating the breathing patterns of other dinosaur species.
2381	a group of caspian terns were hunting for food at el dorado lake in long beach, california, when american photographer andrew lee, 52, of irvine, captured a stunning moment on camera. one tern managed to catch a large carp, but as they both soared through the air, the fish almost escaped from its beak. the carp broke free for a brief moment before being recaptured by the determined bird. lee, who was just 60 meters away, watched as the struggle played out, with the tern having a tough time keeping the heavy fish in the air. the incident was a rare sight, with most people never having seen a flying fish being pursued by a tern before. lee was thrilled to document this unique moment and shares his stunning photograph, showcasing the beauty of nature.
2382	dionne warwick attended michael jackson's memorial service at the staples center in los angeles, where she reflected on his emotional and stylish tribute. warwick and jackson's friendship began when she took her son damon to meet jackson in childhood. damon was working on a song with jackson at the time of his death. michael jackson was not only known for his iconic performances but also for his extraordinary singing abilities. working with jackson was an invaluable experience for many, as he was a brilliant teacher in music production, dance, and singing. warwick believes that jackson's legacy lies in the new insights and perspectives he brought to the world through his remarkable talent.
2383	a new stage show called "nothing to lose" by australian dance company force majeure challenges societal perceptions of what a dancer's body should look like by featuring a cast of plus-size performers. artistic director kate champion was inspired to work with larger-bodied dancers after noticing her attraction to their movements on a dance floor. she partnered with fat activist kelli jean drinkwater to ensure the celebration of bigger bodies was authentic and respectful. the performers, who have endured abuse and discrimination, showcase their movements and defy preconceived notions of what a "dancer's body" is. the premiere of "nothing to lose" at the sydney festival on january 21 marks champion's final show with force majeure. the dancers were photographed in a series of still shots that capture their graceful movements and defy traditional ideas of beauty and physical perfection. the groundswell of body positivity and fat activism in australia, driven in part by social media, has led to a broader acceptance of diverse bodies on stage. recently, whitney way thore's dance videos and the 'fatkini' campaign have garnered attention for promoting body acceptance.
2384	cnn's spanish-language programming block, cnn latino, is expanding to new markets including new york, orlando, tampa, and phoenix. the expansion will serve approximately a quarter of hispanic households in the us, reaching over 1.3 million households in new york alone. cnn latino's programming includes shows from latin american partners, as well as local productions, and is carried on low-power television stations. this expansion sets cnn latino apart from other latino media outlets by providing high-quality diverse content beyond the traditional novela, drama, and game show offerings. the new markets will add to existing affiliates in los angeles, joining competitors such as mundofox and fusion in catering to the growing u.s. hispanic audience, which is projected to represent 30% of the population by 2050. cnn en español continues to produce shows like "sin límites con elizabeth espinosa" and "conclusiones" for the latin market.
2385	scotland's first minister nicola sturgeon declared she will lead any coalition negotiations with labour after the next election, dismissing the idea that alex salmond would control the talks. sturgeon, who is not standing for westminster, claimed scotland's voice would be heard loudly at westminster if the snp makes significant gains, shattering labour's hopes of an overall majority and potentially forcing them into a coalition. she also signaled her willingness to form alliances with other progressive parties like plaid cymru and the greens. the polls suggest the snp will win a majority of seats in scotland, leaving labour with only a few mps. there have been debates about the role of snp mps in voting on laws affecting england, with scottish labour leader jim murphy expressing reservations about backing the abolition of trident in exchange for snp votes.
2386	a car bomb explosion in baghdad's predominantly shiite neighborhood of new baghdad on wednesday night resulted in the deaths of 14 people and injuries to 51 others. several shops and vehicles were damaged in the blast. meanwhile, three mortar rounds landed inside the green zone in central baghdad, causing unclear casualties, but no reported injuries at this time. the green zone is home to iraqi government offices, as well as the us and british embassies.
2387	a 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck off the northeast coast of japan on friday, causing a small tsunami and prompting evacuation warnings. the quake occurred 462 kilometers (287 miles) east-northeast of tokyo at a depth of 36 kilometers (22 miles), according to the us geological survey. the earthquake and resulting tsunami reminded the country of the devastating 9.0-magnitude quake and tsunami in 2011 that killed over 15,000 people and triggered the worst nuclear crisis in a quarter century, including meltdowns at the fukushima daiichi nuclear power plant. no damage was reported at japan's nuclear power facilities following friday's quake, but radiation levels in fish caught near the area remain high, suggesting contamination from the 2011 disaster may still be present in the pacific ocean. only minor injuries were reported after friday's earthquake. miyagi, one of the worst-affected areas in 2011, experienced a one-meter (3-foot) tsunami and four smaller waves. the us and japanese meteorological agencies determined that there was no significant tsunami threat to the pacific from the quake.
2388	former scotland football captain colin hendry, 49, received a harassment warning from police in lancashire after allegedly pestering his ex-girlfriend, sarah kinder. hendry began dating kinder in 2010 after his wife denise diedfollowing botched liposuction surgery in 2009. the warning does not constitute a criminal record but is intended to prevent future distress. hendry is due in court on march 4 for a separate drink-driving charge. he played for manchester city, blackburn rovers, rangers, and captained scotland in the 1998 world cup. since retiring from his football career, hendry has coached and managed teams including blackpool and clyde. he lost his wife denise in 2009 following a hospital infection caused by the botched liposuction from seven years prior. hendry expressed his gratitude to kinder for helping him and his family move forward in a 2010 interview with the scottish express.
2389	a three-month-old boy named blake holman and his parents, ashley groizard and michael holman, have been reported missing in new south wales, australia. last seen near lake macquarie on monday, police are urgently seeking public assistance to locate them due to concerns for the welfare of the child, as his parents have displayed erratic behavior. the family was last seen in a silver holden commodore sedan with registration plates yny-266 and was last spotted traveling towards sydney. anyone with information is asked to contact triple zero (000).
2390	a new study from duke university medical center suggests that silent heart attacks, which are undetected and asymptomatic, may be more common than previously thought. these heart attacks don't always leave a clear signature on an electrocardiogram and can go unnoticed. the study found that 35% of patients suspected of having coronary artery disease had evidence of a heart attack, with non-q-wave silent heart attacks being three times more common than those with q-waves. patients with non-q-wave silent heart attacks had a higher risk of death from any cause and heart-related causes. treatment for someone who has had a silent heart attack is similar to someone who has had a recognized heart attack, and there is a need for more research to establish effective treatment strategies for silent heart attacks. the study highlights the importance of preventing heart disease in high-risk groups, particularly older individuals and those with diabetes.
2391	thirty-one undeveloped rolls of film, taken by an unidentified american soldier during the second world war, have been brought to light after being discovered at an auction in ohio. the films capture quiet moments of soldiers in various locations around the world, including europe. two letters written by the photographer were also found, providing insight into his thoughts and experiences. freelance photographer and old film enthusiast levi bettweiser developed the films in his kitchen darkroom and the results are breathtaking, showcasing soldiers leaving church, milling around a dock, and even a welcome home scene. nothing is known about the soldier except that he was injured and sent home from france. the discovery of these films and letters offers a glimpse into the experiences of soldiers during the war and the human moments that often go overlooked amidst the turmoil.
2392	scott weiner, a new yorker and pizza enthusiast, has set a new guinness world record by amassing over 750 pizza boxes from around the world. weiner, a professional pizza tour guide, has a unique obsession with pizza and has collected boxes from 45 different countries over the past 15 years. his collection includes rare and unusual boxes, some signed by celebrities like tattoo artist ed hardy, and even one that transforms into a toy in brazil. weiner, who eats pizza daily but limits himself to 15 slices a week, stores his collection in his brooklyn apartment and has even written a book about the history of pizza boxes. his achievement has been recognized by guinness world records, and he plans to bring an exhibition of 100 boxes to london this fall.
2393	in phoenix, arizona, the immigration debate was explored from various perspectives. a common fear presented in the debate is the existence of "terror babies," children born to illegal immigrants in the u.s. who, as citizens, could eventually return as terrorists. however, there is no credible evidence supporting this claim. it is an exaggerated fear used by politicians like texas representative debbie riddle and u.s. congressman louie gohmert to fuel their anti-immigration agenda. the fbi, which supposedly provided information on these terror babies, denies the existence of any such plans. the phenomenon in arizona involves justifying the state's strict immigration law not just by scaring people but also through extrememakeovers, such as redefining citizenship and illegal immigrants as future terrorists or drug mules. ultimately, these false narratives are driven by a political motivation rather than truth or reality. the author emphasizes that if supporters of the immigration law truly believe in its merits, they should be able to make their case without fabricating issues, exaggerating risks, or resorting to scare tactics.
2394	in the euro 2016 qualifier between wales and belgium at king baudouin stadium in brussels, a 0-0 draw was celebrated wildly by the welsh fans despite the lack of goals. gareth bale and other players went shirtless and waved flags, while ashley williams and aaron ramsey also removed their jerseys and threw them into the crowd. this unexpected scene was due to wales' unbeaten record in the competition, as they faced their toughest challenge against the fourth-ranked team in the world. the game saw intense attacks from both sides, with belgium having the better chances in the first half. gareth bale came close to scoring with a free-kick, but it was saved by thibaut courtois. in the second half, wales dominated and had the better opportunities, with bale and hal robson-kanu both testing courtois. chris coleman, the wales manager, expressed satisfaction with his team's performance and noted the importance of their unbeaten record. the game ended with both teams sharing the points, with wales staying at the top of group b with 8 points from 4 games. the game saw several incidents, including injuries to joe allen and axel witsel, and a collision between christian benteke and george williams that led to the latter being taken off on a stretcher. the referee, pavel kralovec, issued bookings to several players, including gareth bale and allen. overall, the draw was seen as a courageous performance by wales in the face of strong belgian attacks, with captain ashley williams and james chester playing key roles in the defense.
2395	the unesco's intangible cultural heritage list includes unique traditions from around the world, such as the kirkpinar oil wrestling festival in turkey, spanish human towers called castells, the farmers' dance of china's korean ethnic group, and the whistled language of la gomera island. other off-beat traditions on the list include joking relationships in niger, painting and decorating oxcarts in costa rica, and the mongolian tradition of revering livestock bones and playing knuckle-bone shooting. these traditions are protected by unesco to ensure their preservation and raise awareness of their cultural significance. for example, the kirpinar oil wrestling festival attracts thousands of people each year, while the whistled language of la gomera island allows communication over long distances. other traditions, like joking relationships in niger, promote peace and mutual assistance between communities, and the farmers' dance of china's korean ethnic group pays homage to nature and prayer for a plentiful harvest. the list includes a diverse range of cultural practices, from social practices like joking relationships to artistic practices like human towers and pottery making. these traditions are passed down through generations, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of various communities around the world. the unesco's intangible cultural heritage list currently includes 281 elements, and any un member state can submit a single element for consideration. a panel of experts and an intergovernmental committee then review and approve the nominations.
2396	model sara mckenna and olympic skier bode miller are embroiled in a bitter custody battle over mckenna's newborn son. miller's ex-lover, mckenna, claims he should not be granted custody due to his lifestyle on a yacht and past substance abuse problems. miller filed for joint legal and physical custody just days after his wife, volleyball player morgan beck, suffered a miscarriage. mckenna accused beck of online attacks and threats via twitter, which the nypd is investigating. miller also has a custody battle with the mother of his four-year-old daughter. the dispute has led to vicious exchanges between mckenna and beck, damaging mutual friendships. miller, a five-time olympic medalist, intends to compete in the 2014 winter olympics.
2397	david and victoria beckham, with a combined wealth over £165 million, have opted for a simple christmas meal at the half moon pub in stepney, east london, instead of an extravagant one. the couple and their four children are expected to enjoy turkey and trimmings for £7.99 each, but victoria can choose a lighter option with a 1,224-calorie salmon fillet. the invitation came from david's older sister lynne and her partner kevin briggs. the trend of celebrities dining in british high street chains continues with reports of simon cowell, brad pitt and stevi ritchie also being spotted. wetherspoon spokesperson eddie gershon welcomed their potential visit, assuring excellent food and affordable prices.
