2499	fuller, smith & turner, a 367-year-old british brewery, is facing economic challenges due to high beer duty at home and the european economic crisis. to overcome these issues, the company has shifted its focus to exports, which now account for around 12 million pints per year. the company has adapted its products to suit different markets, such as the us, where tax is per bottle instead of by alcohol level, and scandinavia and italy, which prefer draft beer. to meet international demand, fuller, smith & turner has invested in expanding its facility and implementing automation, enabling it to produce 60,000 kegs per week compared to 3,000 eight years ago. this investment has helped the companynot only to keep up with global demand but also to change the perception of british beer abroad as being warm, weak, and undrinkable.
2500	a man brandishing a meat cleaver grabbed a woman in a chinese street, threatening to cut her throat in a hostage situation that lasted an hour. police attempted to negotiate with him but were unsuccessful, leading them to tackle him to the ground. the woman was freed but afterwards fainted and was taken to the hospital, along with an injured police officer. the motive behind the incident is currently under investigation.
2501	chrissie roberts, now 22, developed a bizarre allergy to fruit and vegetables when she was 15 years old, which forces her to avoid these foods completely. the student, now at university, must take a cocktail of vitamins and be vigilant about cosmetics and fruit-based shampoos due to her condition, known as oral allergy syndrome. this condition, which typically develops in hay fever sufferers, causes allergic reactions in the mouth and throat when consuming certain fresh fruits and vegetables. chrissie's first reaction occurred when she put her face into a melon, leading to a red raw rash and closing of her throat. she now has to avoid many foods and cosmetics and take antihistamines seriously to prevent potentially fatal reactions. her mother and stepfather, both pharmacists, ensure she is equipped with the necessary medication when she goes back to university. chrissie wants to raise awareness about oral allergy syndrome, and a spokesperson from allergy uk advised that those suffering from symptoms be referred to an allergy specialist for proper diagnosis and treatment. avoidance of the offending foods and cooking them to destroy the allergens is essential.
2502	a five-month-old orangutan named kecil, who failed to bond with his birth mother at the toledo zoo, has been sent to the milwaukee county zoo to be raised by a surrogate mother named m.j. kecil's mother, yasmin, showed little interest in caring for him despite efforts made by the zoo to facilitate bonding. milwaukee county zoo is known for successful orangutan births, but kecil was the third baby ape to arrive at the zoo this year, as a female gorilla named kassiu also died shortly after her birth in march. m.j., who previously raised mahal, another orangutan, is considered a proven surrogate mother and has slowly been introduced to kecil. kecil arrived at the milwaukee county zoo in good health and was accompanied by one of his keepers from toledo to assist in the transition. the zoo prioritizes the well-being of kecil, an endangered species, and aims to raise him with another orangutan for companionship.
2503	state officials are investigating the mysterious death of approximately 100,000 fish in sparks marina, nevada over the past month. the die-off is believed to be caused by a sudden, unexplained drop in dissolved oxygen levels, though the cause remains unknown. scientists suggest a cold snap may have caused oxygen-poor waters to rise from the bottom and trigger a "violent turnover," but they are still baffled by the event. sparks marina, which opened in 2000 and stocks close to 1 million fish annually, is a popular recreational area with a walking trail, beaches, and a fishing pier. officials emphasize there is no health or safety threat and are working to determine the underlying cause. no toxicity tests have revealed any problems, and hydrocarbon pollution is not believed to be a factor. the marina typically is stocked with fish in late february or early march, but officials will not be doing so this year until dissolved oxygen levels recover.
2504	a man identified as dicarlo bennett, 28, a baggage handler at los angeles international airport (lax), was arrested and charged with possession of an explosive or destructive device near an aircraft for causing two separate dry ice explosions at the airport. the incidents occurred in an employee-only area on sunday and monday, resulting in the temporary shutdown of terminal 2 on sunday but no injuries were reported in both incidents. the suspect reportedly thought the explosions were "a game" and "a funny kind of joke," but authorities take the matter seriously. the suspect is being held in lieu of $1 million bail and is an employee of servisair, a leading global provider of aviation ground services. servisair is cooperating with authorities and has not made any further comment on the matter. dry ice, which is carbon dioxide in solid form, was used as a refrigerant for meats and ice cream, and the explosions occur when it transforms into vapor. the airport remains safe and secure, authorities say.
2505	wayne rooney of manchester united has scored his 175th goal in the premier league, tying thierry henry for third place on the all-time scoring list. the goal came during a 4-0 win over queens park rangers, with rooney netting in the 44th minute. former newcastle and blackburn striker alan shearer leads the premier league with 260 goals, while rooney, thierry henry, andy cole, frank lampard, robbie fowler, michael owen, les ferdinand, teddy sheringham, and robin van persie complete the top 10 scorers with 187, 171, 162, 150, 149, 147, and 134 goals respectively. rooney achieved this feat in 258 games, while henry scored 175 goals for arsenal over 11 seasons. rooney will need to score 86 more goals to surpass shearer as the all-time leading scorer. rooney's teammate robin van persie and former chelsea midfielder frank lampard are also among the top 10 scorers.
2506	a group of over 80 passengers from the asiana airlines flight 214that crash-landed at san francisco international airport last july, have filed a lawsuit against boeing in an illinois court. the lawsuit alleges that some equipment on the boeing 777 was improperly installed or defective, leading to insufficient warnings for the pilots about low airspeed. three people were killed and over 180 passengers were injured in the incident. the plaintiffs, represented by ribbeck law chartered, seek damages andpartial liability from boeing. boeing was aware of the inadequate low airspeed warning system, according to the lawsuit. the passengers began court proceedings shortly after the crash, filing a petition for boeing to release evidence. boeing declined to comment on the lawsuit. the automated cockpit systems are also being probed in relation to the crash.
2507	a passenger on virgin america flight 404, david martin, recounted his experience of a four-hour tarmac delay at new york's stewart airport, where flight crew were snapping at passengers and supplies were running low. martin attempted to intervene when a flight attendant refused to give a cookie to a distressed passenger, but his concerns were dismissed. severe storms and heavy winds diverted most flights from jfk airport, causing over 100,000 passengers to be stranded. virgin america agreed to improve communication and offer more comforts to passengers in such situations, while acknowledging their lack of compliance with the new tarmac delay rule taking effect april 29. the department of transportation is investigating the incident and considering exemptions for airlines dealing with operational difficulties at jfk airport. martin advocated for fining airlines for delays as a means to prioritize passenger safety and customer service.
2508	two radio telescopes, the arecibo observatory in puerto rico and the green bank telescope (gbt) in west virginia, have provided scientists with unique insights into the moon through bistatic radar observations. radar signals from arecibo reached 33-50 feet below the surface in the sea of serenity, revealing light and dark areas representing changes in the lunar dust and rock composition, as well as lava-like features. additionally, the crater aristillus, approximately 55 kilometers (34 miles) in diameter and 3.5 kilometers (2 miles) deep, was studied, revealing a dark halo caused by pulverized debris beyond its rim. the findings offer valuable information for interpreting the lunar geology and planning future lunar exploration.
2509	two women, alicia davis and charlotte coulson, have been found guilty of murdering michael kerr by slashing his throat and stabbing him multiple times in his car. the women, who claimed they had been raped, were traveling in kerr's car when they attacked him in satmar lane, caple-le-ferne near folkestone. the judge ruled that they had taken "perverse pleasure" in killing kerr, who was jailed for a minimum of 25 years for davis and 20 years for coulson. prior to the attack, kerr had been in contact with the women, with coulson contacting him to arrange a meeting after they tried to sell sexual services to him for alcohol money. the women then killed kerr inside his car and discarded the murder weapon and his mobile phone before walking back to dover and leaving him to die in the country lane. a post-mortem examination found that kerr died from multiple stab wounds to his neck and chest. the family of the victim expressed their grief and relief that the women would be imprisoned for lengthy sentences.
2510	royal mail reported a significant profit increase of £440 million for the year ended march 31, 2013, marking a major boost for the state-owned company ahead of its expected privatization. the surge in profits was attributed to the growth in online shopping, modernization efforts, and the transfer of £37.5 billion in pension liabilities to the government. despite previous losses, ceo moya greene declared a strong performance and the beginning of the company's transformation. the government, led by business secretary vince cable, insisted on privatization to address the "fundamental threat" from email and to modernize the business. unions, however, warned of potential service declines and began balloting workers on the possibility of boycotting rival companies' mail, which could leave 26 million items undelivered daily. royal mail's parcel business accounted for almost half of its £9.3 billion revenues, with improved productivity, modernization, and price increases being key factors in the profit surge. the preferred privatization option is believed to involve public shares sales, with at least 10% reserved for employees.
2511	tina oliver, a 44-year-old hairdresser from harrogate, was inspired to lose weight after seeing a photo of herself at 19 stone and size 26, moments before indulging in a plate of cakes. with a warning from her doctor about the risk of diabetes and poor health, tina turned to ancient egyptian weight loss methods, specifically a technique involving a piece of string called a malory band. tina combined the use of the malory band and the slimming world plan, along with regular gym attendance, and successfully lost eight stone and nine dress sizes. her newfound health and energy have given her the confidence to participate in the great north run, something she never thought possible. tina's transformation saw her go from a borderline diabetic, nearly 19 stone, and a morbidly obese body mass index of 43, to a fitter, happier woman weighing 11 stone and a size 10.
2512	nick clegg, the deputy prime minister of the united kingdom, has appointed elon musk, the billionaire founder of paypal and tesla motors, as his new adviser on electric cars. however, musk's company, tesla motors, has been suffering from negative publicity due to three model s electric cars catching fire in the past five weeks. this has led to a decline in the company's share prices and weak financial results. clegg announced the appointment as part of his call for large fleet companies, taxi firms, and public agencies to adopt ultra-low emission vehicles. while musk will not be paid for his role as an advisor, he is expected to provide expertise on boosting investment in and increasing the adoption of electric vehicles in the uk. the government aims to have all new cars and vans purchased in the uk be effectively zero emission by 2040 and has committed £400 million over the course of this parliament to support the technology.
2513	prince william, an raf search and rescue pilot, will deploy to the falkland islands for a six-week tour of duty in early 2012, marking the 30th anniversary of the conflict between britain and argentina over the islands. the deployment is sensitive as argentina continues to assert its territorial claim and has criticized the decision. william, who will be apart from his wife, catherine, for nearly two months, is said to be looking forward to the posting, which will count towards his promotion to captain. william's deployment is described as routine and will allow him to be back in time for the queen's diamond jubilee celebrations in june. he will be based at raf mount pleasant, which was opened by prince andrew in 1985 during the falklands war. william will have to endure challenging living conditions and will be prepared for plagues of mice and mites in his quarters.
2514	a new survey by gps vehicle tracking supplier ram tracking revealed that jamaica road in south london has the worst traffic jams in britain, with an average speed of just 0.08 miles per hour during the february 2013 rush hour. the next worst roads were b221 bedford road in clapham and greenhill way in harrow, both in london, with speeds of 0.13mph and 0.25mph respectively. the worst road outside london was the a5081 park way in trafford park, manchester, with a speed of 0.69mph. the survey found that all of the 10 worst-moving roads were in greater london. ram tracking's managing director, chris mcclellan, stated that the findings show the significant amount of time business drivers waste during morning rush hour. the top five most congested motorways during morning rush hour were the m6 at ward end, the m62 at hunsworth, the m4 at brentford, the m11 at chigwell, and the m25 at downside, all with speeds under 40mph. ram tracking has created an interactive map to help drivers identify the slowest roads during rush hour.
2515	wu yebin and an wei, an openly gay couple in northern china, strolled through their rural village during a local fair, defying the taboo against homosexuality in the area. they met online and fell in love, but faced initial rejection and attempts at "exorcism" from their families. however, through education and persistence, their families became more accepting. the couple now runs a convenience store near wu's family home in hebei province. as progressive movements in gay rights gain traction in other countries, wu and an have considered formalizing their relationship through marriage. however, progress towards legalizing same-sex marriage in china is slow, with reports of rejections and crackdowns against activists. opposition to same-sex marriage is low on the government's agenda, but the pressure to marry and have children to carry on the family line is strong in chinese culture. some gay men marry women to appease families and maintain their lifestyles, a situation sociologist li yinhe calls a "tragedy." wu and an hope to inspire more closeted gay chinese to come out and live authentic lives. despite facing discrimination, they feel they have made progress in gaining acceptance, even in their own families.
2516	the new report from credit suisse indicates that the average australian takes 97 years to become a millionaire due to high median wealth but low savings rate, many australians will find it difficult to reach millionaire status. australian baby boomers hold the highest average net worth, with an average of $2.2 million per household. finder.com.au's millionaire calculator suggests that an average australian saving $142.50 per week would take 97 years to become a millionaire. potential millionaires are encouraged to invest their money wisely and consider using high-interest savings accounts or adding savings to their home loan. despite the challenges, michelle hutchinson recognizes that many australians are growing wealthier and australia's ranking compared to other nations is strong. in 2011-12, households between 55 and 59 years old had the highest average net worth.
2517	at a twilight ceremony in st symphorien military cemetery in belgium, prince harry paid tribute to the fallen soldiers of the first world war with a moving letter from irish fusilier private michael lennon. dated may 30, 1915, lennon wrote to his brother the day before he was due to land in gallipoli, expressing his hope to survive and to be "bowled out" if it was his fate. lennon was killed in action just over a month later. the ceremony was attended by the duchess of cambridge, prince harry, prime minister david cameron, and representatives from france and germany. historian dan snow read from the letter, and eddie redmayne read from a shropshire lad while british and german choirs sang "they shall not grow old." the ceremony honored the fallen from british, irish, commonwealth, and german forces and commemorated the centenary of the outbreak of the first world war. the great war, which claimed millions of lives, including 750,000 from the british and commonwealth forces, was described as "unlike any other" due to its unspeakable carnage and unbearable loss. at a separate ceremony, the duchess of cornwall attended a candlelit vigil and prayer service at westminster abbey. both ceremonies paid tribute to the many soldiers who sacrificed their lives during the war.
2518	daniel sturridge, liverpool striker, used his trademark dancing celebration after scoring his first goal in the premier league in five months against west ham on saturday. he explained that he started dancing instead of pulling his shirt over his head, his favorite celebration, to avoid yellow card warnings. sturridge admitted that he was devastated by steven gerrard's announcement of leaving liverpool, considering him a legend and one of the greatest english players. despite liverpool's slim chances for silverware this season, sturridge emphasized the importance of focusing on each game and not adding pressure. the bbc match of the day magazine features sturridge on its cover, and the issue goes on sale from february 3.
2519	floyd mayweather, considered the best boxer in the world, has announced that he will be traveling to bolton, england, which is amir khan's hometown, as part of his world tour. the announcement has fueled speculation of a potential match-up between the two boxers. mayweather is scheduled to attend a sportsman's dinner at reebok stadium on june 23, and khan and his management are expected to be present as well. khan and mayweather both won their fights last weekend in las vegas. khan easily defeated luis collazo, while mayweather won against marcos maidana. the possibility of the two facing each other in the ring has fans excited.
2520	a heartbreaking image of a four-year-old syrian boy named marwan, who became separated from his family while fleeing the war-torn country, went viral after being shared by jordan's representative to the united nations high commissioner for refugees (unhcr). marwan was found by un aid workers near the border of jordan and syria and was later reunited with his mother. the boy's photograph, taken by andrew harper, has drawn international attention to the plight of over one million syrian children who have been forced to flee their homes due to the country's devastating civil war. harper, who has been documenting the refugee crisis in recent months, also shared photos of malala yousafzai, the education activist who survived an assassination attempt by the taliban in 2012, visiting the refugees at the zaatari camp in jordan. the camp, which is now jordan's fifth largest city, is home to over 160,000 syrian refugees and has seen an increased rate of arrivals in recent months. the conflict in syria, which began in 2011 during the arab spring, has resulted in the deaths of over 130,000 people and the forced displacement of over 5 million people both inside and outside of the country. jordan, which borders syria, has taken in more refugees than any other country, with over 613,000 refugees residing there at the time of writing.
2521	attorney general eric holder stated that the justice department is contemplating filing a federal lawsuit against arizona's new immigration law due to potential civil rights violations and the possibility of racial profiling. critics argue that the law encourages racial profiling, while supporters claim it's necessary to reduce crime related to illegal immigration. holder emphasized that comprehensive federal immigration reform is the preferred solution to address the issue, as advocated by president obama, who also criticized the arizona law. the reform would prioritize securing the borders, penalizing businesses employing undocumented immigrants, and requiring undocumented immigrants to pay back taxes, learn english, and follow the law before seeking citizenship.
2522	cnn student news from october 16, 2013, reported on diplomatic discussions regarding iran's nuclear program at geneva, switzerland, and the aftermath of a powerful earthquake in the philippines.the program also featured the story of u.s. army capt. william swenson, the newest medal of honor recipient, and asked students about a silent restaurant. key concepts included economic sanctions, the medal of honor, and nonverbal communication. fast facts covered the debate over iran's nuclear program and the effects of the earthquake. discussion questions explored the effectiveness of economic sanctions on iran, the definition of a hero, and the dining experience at a silent restaurant. cnn student news is produced by journalists and educators, aligning with common core, national, and state standards. downloadable maps were available for europe, geneva, switzerland, asia, the philippines, and afghanistan. feedback was encouraged using the provided page.
2523	a man named jason corkovic argued against a hoodie ban imposed on him in court, claiming it would violate his human right to keep his head dry from manchester rain. however, judge roger thomas qc dismissed the argument and suggested corkovic use a furled umbrella or wear a flat cap instead. corkovic, along with his uncle and an accomplice, had been convicted of a failed robbery plot to steal £90,000 from a cash delivery van, and were subject to a serious crime prevention order that bans them from wearing hoods near shops, banks, and cash vans. critics condemned corkovic's lawyer for playing the "human rights card" and called for attention to be focused on the rights of the security van driver instead. corkovic, who has a lengthy criminal history including a violent £275,000 spree for which he was given a 23-year sentence, and his two accomplices were jailed for nine, 18, and 13 years, respectively.
2524	a former contractor for us security services, doug coulter, built a nuclear fusion reactor in the basement of his home in north virginia. once a 'beltway bandit' who produced technology for the intelligence community, coulter now works as a gunsmith and shares technological secrets on his forum. he built the reactor, which he believes has the potential to revolutionize energy production, using parts from other machines. although skeptics question its viability and safety, coulter remains undeterred and continues to share his progress on his forum. the reactor is located in a remote area, and coulter downplays radiation concerns, stating that it's one of the least radiation-prone places on the planet. coulter is also known for sharing information on building guns and making ammunition on his forum.
2525	a police officer in his 30s from the flying squad, a specialized crime investigation unit in the metropolitan police service in london, accidentally shot himself in the leg inside a police building in putney, south west london, around 9am on march 21. no suspicious circumstances were reported and the officer was the only person present at the time. he was taken to a hospital in south london and is in stable condition. the health and safety branch of the metropolitan police is investigating the incident along with the independent police complaints commission. the flying squad investigates commercial armed robberies and serious armed crime. one of their most notable operations was the thwarting of the millennium dome raid, the world's largest attempted diamond robbery, in which nine people were arrested and charged.
2526	in the past year, kate gosselin's public perception has shifted from being seen as a shrewish mother during her marriage to jon, to the sane and stable one after their divorce. with her new reality shows "kate plus 8" and "twist of kate" premiering soon on tlc, fans are eagerly anticipating seeing more of kate's open and emotional personality. in "twist of kate," she uses her experiences to help people going through various challenges by living their lives with them, and fans are intrigued by the concept and curious about what her hair will look like in each episode. kate will also be filmed as a waitress, a garbage collector, and possibly even a circus performer or exotic dancer. the shows offer a break from her usual role as a mother of eight and provide an opportunity for fans to connect with her on a deeper level. the absence of a dating show focus is also appreciated by fans.
2527	youtube has rolled out a new trueview ad format, allowing users to skip ads after five seconds or choose from multiple pre-roll options. this builds on a previous experiment with giving users control over ads. advertisers are reacting positively, praising the cost-effectiveness and targeting capabilities of trueview. gopro's director of online marketing, lee topar, reported a 40% view-through rate and greater control over budgets. trueview is currently limited to managed accounts and isn't widely available on youtube yet. youtube plans to offer more choices and control in advertising.
2528	paris, france's marais district offers various drinking and dining options to kick off an evening. rue vieille du temple hosts bars like pick-clops, la belle hortense, and le petit fer a cheval for aperitifs. moroccan-inspired andy wahloo and la perle attract trendy crowds. the hotel costes on rue st-honore is known for opulence and chilled tunes. buddha bar, with an eastern theme, is another favorite. for late-night drinks, check out rue oberkampf's café charbon, le kitch bar, café mercerie, and chez justine. to dance, head north to pigalle's clubs. this guide offers suggestions for accommodation, sightseeing, dining, and shopping in paris. paris' nightlife remains vibrant and eclectic, with a mix of trendy and relaxed options.
2529	german chancellor angela merkel delivered an unprecedented speech to the knesset in jerusalem, expressing germany's "holocaust shame" and strongly supporting israel's right to exist. she emphasized the importance of combating anti-semitism, racism, and xenophobia, and criticized iran's nuclear ambitions, demanding proof that iran does not seek a nuclear weapon. merkel reiterated her support for the two-state solution to the middle east conflict and condemned rocket attacks into israel while acknowledging the need for painful compromises to achieve peace.
2530	in los angeles, california, anna nicole smith's boyfriend, howard k. stern, and two doctors, dr. khristine eroshevich and dr. sandeep kapoor, entered "not guilty" pleas in court on wednesday to new charges related to smith's death in 2007. the three are charged with an illegal conspiracy to prescribe, administer, and dispense controlled substances to an addict. stern faces 11 felony counts, while the doctors were charged with six each. the charges were revised based on the latest findings from the investigation. affidavits unsealed on tuesday revealed new details about smith's use of drugs leading up to her death. a nanny hired to care for her child stated that she witnessed stern and dr. eroshevich injecting smith with drugs and gave her excessive amounts, sometimes while she was pregnant. doctors gave smith numerous dangerous drugs between 2004 and 2007, including while she was pregnant. according to the affidavits, smith was described as a "drug seeker" and "a personal relationship" between her and the doctors crossed professional boundaries. pharmacists refused to fill prescriptions for large quantities of strong narcotics and sleep aids, leading to conversations about the dangerous dosages being given to smith. the affidavits revealed numerous prescriptions written for smith under several aliases and detailed instances of the doctors using stern as a cover to get the prescriptions filled. seven of the 12 medications found in smith's hotel room at the time of her death were prescribed in stern's name. a preliminary hearing is set for next month in the case.
2531	an 86-year-old truck driver, james mcdonald, hit and killed a 43-year-old college professor, jennifer cook, and injured her mother, barbara cook, as they were crossing a street in syracuse, new york, in march. the elderly driver received a ticket for passing a red light and failure to keep right, but was not charged over the death. police investigated the crash extensively and determined that mcdonald's age and weather conditions were not factors. cook, from rhode island, was visiting her dying father at the time and was survived by her spouse, moira collins, also a professor. the tragic incident shocked and saddened students and staff at rhode island college, where cook had worked since 2004 and inspired and trained hundreds of students who are now teachers. cook received degrees from american university and the university of massachusetts and was the executive director of the rhode island writing project.
2532	a five-year-old girl named charlotte nott from oxford, who lost all four limbs due to meningitis two years ago, received a special christmas present of new prosthetic legs worth £6,000. the anonymous donation enabled charlotte to walk properly for the first time since her operations. in december 2010, charlotte's family was preparing for a holiday when she suddenly developed meningococcal septicaemia, leading to multiple organ failure and the eventual removal of all her limbs. charlotte's mother, jenny daniels, stayed by her bedside during her hospitalization and remembered telling her daughter she was loved during her critical condition. after charlotte's recovery, she learned new ways to cope, drawing with her mouth and crawling to get around. charlotte met ellie challis, another girl who lost her limbs due to meningitis, and was inspired by her. charlotte was fitted with nhs prosthetics but struggled to walk in them. the new top-of-the-line legs were manufactured by dorset orthopaedic, who have also made limbs for heather mills. charlotte's family is now fundraising for new legs as she grows taller.
2533	a violent mugger, sabul miah, who was serving two life sentences for stabbing attacks and robberies against pensioners, has escaped from stanford hill open prison in kent. miah, 40, from poplar, east london, had failed to return after day release on thursday. he was convicted of robbing at least 15 pensioners, injuring some severely, and had a crack and heroin habit. his latest victim, george rowe, a second world war veteran, was robbed and had his throat slashed in a lift in 2002, whichworsened his lung cancer and led to his death. miah's escape marks the second time in six months an inmate has gone missing from the prison (the first being michael wheatley, known as 'skull cracker'). this raises concerns amongst mp philip davies and the centre for crime prevention, who argue dangerous criminals should not be placed in open prisons, where they can easily escape. the ministry of justice has not commented on the similarity between the two incidents.
2534	a british people-trafficker, dwight johnson, was jailed for 10 months after hiding an afghan couple and their four-month-old baby in the boot of his car for five hours while attempting to smuggle them into britain through the channel tunnel. johnson, born in jamaica and residing in london, admitted giving the baby a sedative to silence it during the journey. the family was locked in the boot in paris before johnson was stopped by border police in calais. the court heard that johnson had been paid £2,000 for the illegal crossing and was warned for putting their lives at risk. migrants continue to take increasingly dangerous routes to reach the uk, with recent incidents including being found in cargo of talcum powder, aboard moving ferries, hidden aboard lorries, and even in a cargo of coffins. an estimated 2,500 migrants are currently camped on the northern french coast, hoping to cross the channel.
2535	caroline kennedy, the 55-year-old daughter of the late president john f. kennedy, was appointed as the u.s. ambassador to japan in september 2013, making her way to tokyo in a historic and symbolic journey marked by the late autumn sunshine and onlookers waving both japanese and american flags. the significance of her appointment is rooted in the past, as her father had planned to be the first sitting president to make a state visit to japan. he had fought against japan in world war ii, and the famous encounter between his boat, pt-109, and a japanese destroyer in 1943 is considered one of the most notable small-craft engagements in naval history. as the new ambassador, caroline kennedy pledged to uphold her father's legacy and represent the powerful bonds between the two democratic societies. her appointment, however, has sparked debate regarding her qualifications, with some questioning her lack of professional background in foreign affairs and her inability to speak japanese. concerns have also been raised about her potential conflicts of interest given her significant wealth. the net worth of caroline kennedy is estimated to be as high as $280 million. despite these concerns, she has vowed to work diligently on diplomatic issues such as the trans-pacific partnership, territorial disputes, and military cooperation.
2536	the national library of scotland has made available online over 130 trench maps from the first world war, covering major battlegrounds in france and belgium. these detailed maps reveal the evolving front line, enemy positions, communication trenches, and changes in the landscape. they are crucial sources for studying the battlefields, as accurate locations were essential for artillery planning. trench warfare necessitated more detailed maps than existing medium-scale reconnaissance maps, leading to a large-scale resurvey of the area behind the british front from late 1914, which posed significant challenges due to the dangerous conditions. the maps vary in their focus, highlighting features such as artillery gun emplacements, machine guns, mines, wire entanglements, observation posts, and names given by soldiers to the trenches. they also show nearby landmarks like farms, villages, woods, and more. available maps range from the earliest existing ones, such as the 1915 maps of bas maisnel and neuve chapelle, to later ones from 1918, which show the extensive shifts in the front lines during the war.
2537	in this episode of cnn's "parts unknown" with anthony bourdain, he explores his past in massachusetts. his first stop is provincetown, where he worked in a kitchen for the first time and was introduced to drugs. he then goes to sea with fourth-generation scallop fishermen scott and beau, discussing the unpredictability of their industry and its challenges. next, bourdain learns about the heroin epidemic in franklin county. he speaks to a local detective and concerned citizens about battling addiction. lastly, he visits an eco-conscious local brewery, people's pint, and competes in candlepin bowling against a senior team, the holy rollers.
2538	dr. christopher driskill, a physician in new mexico, has been suspended by the state medical board for allegedly having sex with patients, drinking alcohol on the job, and leaving women to give birth unattended. the report details multiple infractions, including prescriptions written for a girlfriend without proper records and lewd personal notes in medical charts. driskill, who was also the incoming president of the new mexico medical society, was fired from his job at premier health in august and failed to disclose this information to the medical board. the board has ruled that he poses a "clear and immediate danger to the public" and is considering revoking his license. driskill has not yet appealed the suspension and has not responded to requests for comment. he worked at premier health and lea regional medical center in hobbs, new mexico, and had a stash of alcohol in his premier health office.
2539	thirty thousand muslims gathered in srebrenica, bosnia, to bury 520 newly identified victims of europe's worst massacre since world war ii, which occurred in 1995 and claimed the lives of approximately 8,000 muslim men and boys. the victims were separated from women and executed by serb forces, and many of their bodies have yet to be found. the annual mass funeral ceremony is held at the memorial center to honor the victims and remember the tragic event. the most recent burial included victims identified through dna analysis, and so far, 5,325 victims have been laid to rest in this way. the dutch peacekeeping forces present during the siege of srebrenica have been criticized for their failure to protect the town and its inhabitants. radko mladic, the serbian general accused of masterminding the atrocity, is currently on trial for genocide and related charges at the hague tribunal. despite international condemnation, some serbs view mladic as a hero. at the ceremony, holocaust survivor rabbi arthur schneier addressed the mourners, urging the crowd to take action against crimes against humanity and reminding them of the ongoing syrian crisis.
2540	three britons and three italians were among nine people arrested in connection with a record seizure of 1.3 tonnes of cocaine, with a street value of up to £160 million, found on board an air france flight from venezuela to paris. the cargo was hidden in suitcases, which had been registered under false names that did not correspond to passengers on the flight. three police officers in venezuela were also arrested in connection with the bust. the investigation was launched after the drugs were discovered at charles de gaulle airport in paris earlier this month. french interior minister manuel valls called it the biggest cocaine seizure on mainland france. air france has launched an investigation into how the drugs were smuggled on board their plane in caracas. venezuela, along with bolivia and burma, were criticized by the us in a recent report for not making enough effort to tackle global narcotics smuggling. venezuela's president nicolas maduro rejected the criticism as a politically motivated smear campaign and claimed anti-narcotics cooperation had improved since 2005.
2541	gareth southgate, england's under-21 coach, has ruled out calling up players such as jack wilshere, phil jones, alex oxlade-chamberlain, and raheem sterling if england qualifies for the euro 2015 tournament, promising to stick with current players to maintain commitment and continuity. southgate drew comparisons with former under-21 coach stuart pearce's clashes with the fa over player selections and cited spain's success with senior players but emphasized the importance of adaptation and international experience for developing players. with the team already leading group one, england will face lithuania and moldova in their final qualifiers before determining their play-off opponent in october. southgate believes that bringing back seniors, such as christian eriksen, would not bring substantial benefits and emphasizes his role as a reserve team manager for the national squad, preparing players for future senior team involvement.
2542	gedling borough council spent over £200,000 pursuing a £2,000 council tax debt from mentally ill pensioner trevor evans. the local authority was criticized by a judge for their "blinkered and aggressive" attitude, ignoring evans' schizophrenia and dementia, and showing a "lack of understanding." the council will now pay over £270,000 in fees and legal costs. evans, who was made bankrupt in 2004, had previously argued that his mental health issues made it difficult for him to manage his finances. the council admitted they were not aware of his condition at the time and apologized for any distress caused. they have implemented measures to prevent similar instances in the future but expressed concern over potential implications of the judgment. evans' solicitor called out the council's actions as a "worrying attitude" towards vulnerable individuals.
2543	a high court judge, mr justice wilkie, has ordered relaxations on strict curbs placed on a 24-year-old somali man considered a potential suicide bomber and one of the country's most dangerous terror suspects, nicknamed "cf." the judge believes the existing rules, which restrict cf's movements, computer usage, and social interactions under terrorism prevention and investigation measures (tpims), are disproportionate and detrimental to cf's social life, ultimately causing embarrassment and isolation. this ruling deals a significant blow to the government's efforts against terrorism, as security services fear cf may contact other extremists to plot attacks against britain. this could pave the way for similar challenges by other terror suspects and raise concerns about the judiciary diluting measures meant to protect the uk from jihadists. cf, charged last year for repeatedly breaching a ban on visiting the olympic games venue, was denied ownership of an mp3 player and a curfew cut in the ruling. a conservative mp, patrick mercer, voiced his opposition to the relaxation of rules, stating that the man's lack of a social life is less concerning than the prospect of him having the opportunity to carry out a suicide attack.
2544	ruth wilson, who is earning critical acclaim for her role in the raunchy us mini-series "the affair," has joked that filming explicit sex scenes for the show has turned her off sex for life. wilson, 32, plays a married waitress who has an affair with dominic west's character, stealing him away from his wife and four children. she admitted that she is a "british prude" and finds sex scenes "miserable" and "embarrassing." however, she also defended the explicit content in the show, stating that it tells a story and is not just for gratification. west, 45, shared similar concerns about his daughter potentially watching the graphic content. wilson rose to fame with roles in bbc series like "jane eyre," "luther," and "the affair," and expressed relief at not having to be perfectly dressed on set for "the affair."
2545	rahm emanuel, the white house chief of staff, is reportedly considering running for mayor of chicago, and if he does, he may face criticism from immigration reform advocates in the city. emanuel has long been seen as an obstacle to immigration reform due to his support for enforcement-only legislation during his tenure as a congressional democrat. immigration reform supporters, such as rep. luis gutierrez, have criticized emanuel for prioritizing border security over comprehensive reform and accuse him of neglecting the issue since the debate resurfaced in 2005. when emanuel became speaker of the house in 2006, he worked to keep immigration off the agenda due to the division it caused between democratic constituencies, particularly latinos and organized labor. he was also criticized for his handling of the issue during his time as president obama's chief of staff. if emanuel runs for mayor, he may face tough questions about his commitment to immigration reform from voters in chicago's latino community.
2546	a winner of the record-breaking $656 million mega millions jackpot in maryland has come forward to claim their prize anonymously. the ticket, sold at a milford mill 7-eleven store, was claimed at lottery headquarters with the numbers 2-4-23-38-46 and mega ball 23. reports emerged that fast food worker mirlande wilson, who went public about having the winning ticket, was not in possession of it. wilson insists she sent a friend to buy more tickets later that day and the winning one was among them. kansas and illinois also had winning tickets, and the three winners will each receive over $218 million before taxes. wilson's co-workers were skeptical of her story, with one stating she is an attention seeker. wilson had pledged to donate the winnings to rebuild her earthquake-devastated native haiti. wilson's attorney did not comment on the claim, and previous mega millions winners in maryland include ellwood 'bunky' bartlett, who won roughly $27 million in 2007. long lines formed at maryland lottery retailers as the jackpot rose, with many dreaming of their winnings.
2547	united states soccer star landon donovan is set to join english premier league club everton on a loans deal in january, according to the team's official website. donovan, who has earned a record 120 international caps, will lead the us team against england in the world cup finals in south africa next year. the versatile forward, who has previously played in europe with bayer leverkusen and bayern munich, is expected to join compatriot tim howard on merseyside from january 2 if negotiations are successful. everton's ceo robert elstone confirmed that talks are ongoing, and donovan would remain at goodison park until mid-march. donovan, who spent a spell on loan at bayern munich earlier this year, has previous european experience but failed to make an impact at leverkusen. he would join a growing list of american players in the uk, including howard, brad friedel, brad guzan, clint dempsey, eddie johnson, jonathan spector, maurice edu, and damarcus beasley. everton, who are struggling in the bottom half of the premier league, have qualified for the knockout stages of the europa league.
2548	witness b testified at an inquest into the death of mark duggan, who was shot by armed police in august 2011. witness b claimed that he saw duggan clutching a mobile phone in his hand as he collapsed after being shot, which was later confirmed through cctv footage. the shooting sparked riots in london and other parts of britain. witness b had filmed the aftermath of the shooting and gave the footage to the bbc. he admitted reluctance to testify and had moved out of london due to safety concerns. the witness described duggan's body language as "baffled" and "surrendering" when surrounded by armed police. witness b was paid by the bbc for the footage and had initially described duggan's death as an "execution." the interviewer's notes from a meeting with witness b in 2012 were shown to the jury, in which he described the shooting as an "execution." witness b confirmed standing by this description when questioned. the inquest was adjourned to the next day. police had been monitoring duggan in relation to a gang investigation involving firearms and violence.
2549	the commonwealth games in india saw australia continue their dominance with another winning haul on friday, adding four more gold medals to their tally. swimmer alicia coutts and cyclist cameron meyer each claimed their fourth and third titles respectively, bringing australia's overall gold count to 47. india was second with 20 golds, while england had the most overall medals but fewer golds at 76. australia saw success in swimming with leisel jones' breaststroke double and meagen nay's victory in the 200m backstroke. other notable victories included botswana's amantle montsho's historic first gold in the women's 400m, and kenya's nancy langat breaking the women's 1,500m record. india also excelled in wrestling and shooting, with three golds each. in field hockey, south africa and malaysia secured wins, while defending champions australia were held to a draw by south africa. australia and india remained the leaders in their respective pools.
2550	joaquin "el chapo" guzman, one of the world's most notorious drug traffickers and the reported leader of the sinaloa cartel, was arrested in a surprise raid at a seaside hotel-condominium tower in mazatlan, mexico, without a shot being fired. the joint operation between mexican marines and us dea agents had been in the works for several weeks. guzman, known for escaping from prison in a laundry cart in 2001, had been eluding capture for over a dozen years due to his immense power to bribe corrupt officials. his cartel's criminal activity caused the deaths of millions of lives through drug addiction, violence, and corruption. the arrest is a significant blow to the sinaloa cartel and a victory for the us and mexican authorities. guzman is wanted on multiple federal drug trafficking and organized crime charges in the us and had a fortune estimated at over $1 billion.
2551	a jetblue pilot, clayton osbon, who caused panic on a flight in march 2012 by leaving the cockpit screaming about religion and terrorists was found not guilty of interfering with a flight due to insanity. osbon's bizarre behavior during the flight forced an emergency landing, and he was initially charged with interference with a flight crew, facing a possible 20-year prison sentence. however, a psychological examination concluded that he was suffering from a severe mental disease or defect when the incident occurred, and all parties agreed to the report. a federal judge had previously declared osbon fit to stand trial but ordered a mental examination after the examination results were presented. osbon had been a pilot for jetblue for 12 years and had lost his father in a plane crash in 1995. several passengers on the flight have since filed a lawsuit against jetblue for gross negligence, claiming that the airline should have known that osbon was unfit for duty as a pilot. passengers described a disturbed man who began behaving erratically and talking with passengers about terrorism and planes crashing before realizing he had been locked out of the cockpit. after discovering this, osbon lost control and had to be restrained by passengers before the plane could land in amarillo, texas. passengers tackled the captain and held him down until the plane landed. the incident caused fear among passengers and was covered extensively in the media, with videos of osbon's outburst on the plane surfacing online.
2552	an italian appeals court convicted amanda knox and raffaele sollecito of the murder of meredith kercher in november 2007. knox was sentenced to 28 1/2 years in prison for the murder and slander, while sollecito was sentenced to 25 years. the couple, who were exchange students in perugia, italy at the time of the killing, were previously acquitted in 2011, but their acquittals were overturned last year. knox, who is currently residing in seattle, washington, called the verdict a miscarriage of justice and a travesty. a judge has 90 days to write the arguments behind the ruling, and the lawyers have 90 days to appeal. knox's attorney, ted simon, said there will be an appeal, and it's not yet clear if extradition will be a part of the conversation. legal experts agree that it is unlikely that knox will return to italy to serve additional prison time due to double jeopardy laws. kercher, 21, was found partially nude with over 40 stab wounds in the house she shared with knox. the pair have maintained their innocence throughout the case.
2553	"immortals," directed by tarsem singh, is an action spectacle set in ancient greece with gods interfering in human affairs. rising star henry cavill plays theseus, groomed by zeus (john hurt and luke evans) to lead the hellenics against hyperion (mickey rourke), who intends to free the titans and unleash chaos by obtaining the bow of epirus. the gods wear gold outfits and act as the hellenics' backup, but their digital landscape feels inherently artificial and blah. cavill, rourke, and others deliver strong performances, but the movie's visual effects and 3d often seem phony and distract from the story's turgid breast-beating, grisly violence, and numbskull plotting. the film's image-focused director tarsem singh creates breathtaking visuals in some scenes, but the overall result is a visually blah and airless movie that doesn't deliver on its potential.
2554	brittany molina, a 21-year-old student at brigham young university (byu), received an insulting anonymous note on valentine's day, criticizing her dress sense and stating that her outfits negatively affected those around her. the note went viral after she shared a picture and the text on twitter. the incident led to an outpouring of support and unexpected opportunities, including flowers, chocolates, anonymous love notes, and a modelling job offer from utah designers cris & kate's. the designers wanted to turn the situation around and promote a positive message. the incident took place at byu, which is influenced by mormonism, and students must adhere to a strict honor code, including a dress code that prohibits revealing or form-fitting clothing for females. the note's sender criticized molina for not following the dress code. the incident drew significant attention due to the conservative dressing expectations at the university.

2556	for the first time since 1992, undocumented immigrants from mexico accounted for less than half of those apprehended by u.s. customs and border protection (cbp), with more central americans being caught entering the united states illegally. mexicans made up the largest nationality apprehended, but combined numbers of hondurans, el salvadorans, and guatemalans were even larger. cbp reported 486,651 apprehensions in 2014, a 22% increase compared to 2013, with a surge in unaccompanied children and families from central america. president obama's executive actions on immigration, which set priorities for deportation, have led to more success in meeting those priorities and removing or returning undocumented immigrants, with a larger number of central americans being removed or returned than mexicans. this year, 85% of those removed or returned by u.s. immigration and customs enforcement (ice) had criminal records. the changing migration trends reflect the improving economic situation in mexico and worsening security situation in central america. the number of immigrant children in u.s. custody is a major issue, as their fate in the u.s. remains uncertain. the debate over illegal immigration in the u.s. is shifting from a focus on mexico to central america, with 24 states now suing obama over his immigration policies.
2557	in cairo, egypt, islam lotfy, a 35-year-old muslim brotherhood member and human rights lawyer, expresses dissent towards the older leaders of the banned opposition movement, with younger members supporting abdel moneim aboul fotouh for the presidential election. the muslim brotherhood had initially declared their intentions to seek 35% of parliamentary seats but after a successful constitutional referendum, they aim for around 50%. secularists and pro-democracy activists fear a dominance of the muslim brotherhood and the remnants of the ousted regime's national democratic party in the upcoming legislative election. a split within the muslim brotherhood, led by younger members who desire a civil democratic state, has formed a new political party called "egyptian trend." mahmoud morsi, a senior muslim brotherhood leader, emphasizes the group's goal of a civil democratic state with laws based on islamic sharia law, but the u.s. administration recently announced the intention to engage in dialogue. muslim brotherhood members who join competing parties face expulsion. lotfy, as a young muslim brotherhood member and human rights activist, is optimistic about egypt's future, focusing on fulfilling the goals of the revolution such as ending corruption and social injustice.

2559	li shuang, a one-legged man from changchun, north east china, defied expectations after losing two-thirds of his left leg to a cancerous tumor in 2005. he became a local celebrity and a successful painter and decorator by offering to work for free and proving his abilities were equal to able-bodied competitors. after realizing the potential in employing other disabled individuals struggling to find work, li founded a business with a 40-strong team and plans to expand, aiming to change society's perception of disabled individuals and provide opportunities for them.
2560	the latest beauty trend is two-toned eyelashes, also known as "ombre" lashes, inspired by the popular dip-dye hair trend. ombre lashes are made from silk fibers with colored tips that have been pre-dyed in shades such as purple, blue, and green. perfect eyelashes, a salon known for eyelash extensions, offers this service and has seen an increase in demand, with celebrity clients including lucy watson, lily allen, amy willerton, and lauren goodger. the ombre lashes cost £100 and application takes 1.5-2 hours. makeup artist mikey phillips, who works with gemma collins and amy childs, praises the trend as a fun and flirty addition to festival looks, helping to add color without the need for eyeshadow.
2561	michael phelps won his 16th gold medal and first individual gold at the london olympics in the men's 200m individual medley. he broke the record for the most gold medals by a single athlete in olympic history and became the first man to win the same event at three consecutive games. phelps finished 0.04 seconds off his own olympic record, with laszlo cseh taking bronze. ryan lochte, who finished second, had placed third in the 200m backstroke the previous day. rebecca soni broke the women's 200m breaststroke world record to win gold, the first woman under the 2:20 barrier. ranomi kromowidjojo won the women's 100m freestyle for the netherlands, ending american dominance. phelps has two more events before retiring from swimming, including the 100m butterfly final.
2562	a japanese fishing trawler, which was swept away by the tsunami over a year ago off the east coast of japan, has been spotted drifting near the queen charlotte islands in british columbia, canada. the trawler, which is about 120 miles off the coast, is stable and poses no danger, but is considered a navigation hazard. the vessel, which was used for squid fishing, was identified by the japanese coast guard and has been adrift without anyone on board since the tsunami hit on march 11, 2011. canadian agencies are monitoring the ship for potential marine pollution, but have reported no leaks so far.
2563	the census bureau's call to survey all americans every 10 years is met with hesitation among some arab-americans due to worries about how their information may be used. the american mideast leadership network, an organization aimed at advocating for the arab-american community, is working with the census bureau to educate arab-americans about the importance of filling out the form and to dispel their fears. rami nuseir, the president of the organization, emphasized that the information cannot be shared with other government agencies, and encouraged arab-americans to participate to ensure accurate representation in funding and political representation. the census bureau is also conducting outreach efforts in schools, mosques, and neighborhoods, and has hired ahmed shedeed as a partner specialist to work specifically with the arab-american community in new york and new jersey. as of now, the national return rate is behind schedule at 52%, with new york city lagging behind at 37%, and organizations like the census bureau and the american mideast leadership network are urging arab-americans to participate in order to improve resources and representation for their community.
2564	kenya's ngong hills in kenya and paris, france, have been named the most romantic movie locations for international kissing day. the hills are famous for the film "out of africa" starring robert redford, while paris is known for "before sunset" featuring ethan hawke. other top destinations include halona cove in hawaii, rome, italy, the wicklow mountains in ireland, atlanta, georgia (from "gone with the wind"), tokyo, japan ("lost in translation"), and chatsworth house in england ("pride & prejudice"). tourists can visit these places to replicate iconic romantic scenesfrom these movies.
2565	kaiba gionfriddo, a toddler from youngstown, ohio, experienced repeated life-threatening episodes of breathing difficulties starting at six weeks old. doctors believed he had inhaled food or liquid into his lungs, but despite their efforts, he continued to choke and turn blue. after his second hospitalization, doctors discovered kaiba had a rare lung condition called bronchial malacia, and his situation became increasingly dire. in an attempt to save kaiba's life, doctors at the university of michigan took an experimental approach, using a 3d-printed splint made of biological material to carve a path through his blocked airway. the splint was created on a 3d printer using pcl, a malleable material that functions as a biological placeholder, supporting structures while the body heals around it. this procedure represented a breakthrough in regenerative medicine, utilizing patient-specific therapies to harness the body's natural healing abilities. kaiba's splint was a success, and he continues to breathe on his own 15 months after the surgery, with the splint expected to degrade naturally in three years. doctors hope to begin clinical trials on a larger patient population soon.
2566	students in australia, particularly those in new south wales and queensland, are increasingly turning to sugar daddies as a means to alleviate financial stress caused by rising university fees. over 2000 students have joined seeking arrangement, an international sugar daddy site, with a 25% increase in sign-ups in the past year. the university of sydney has the most students (207) on the site, followed by the university of queensland (198) and university of newcastle (171). sugar daddies, mostly professional men, offer financial support ranging from $3000 to $20,000 per month. the average sugar baby is between 19-26 years old, making college students the largest demographic on the site. founder brandon wade promotes this arrangement as a solution to student debt, with thousands of sugar daddies in australia participating. annaliese, a 39-year-old woman from the gold coast, has been in a sugar relationship for nine years. she was drawn to the site seeking greater social connections and noted that the men involved are successful and lonely, desiring friendship as well as companionship.
2567	former prime minister gordon brown is set to address the house of commons for the first time in over a year on january 15, 2013. he will speak about saving two textile factories in fife that employ disabled workers, which are at risk of closing. brown will argue that failure to save these factories would make it unlikely to save other remploy factories around the uk. the government has offered a wage subsidy for interested parties to keep the factories open and has protected the budget for disability employment services. brown has only spoken in the commons three times since leaving downing street in may 2010. the government's priority is to get disabled workers into mainstream employment and has allocated an £8 million package to support the transition.

2570	a coalition row erupted between the liberal democrats and the conservative education secretary, michael gove, over the implementation of a policy to provide free school meals for children under seven. the liberal democrats announced £150 million to expand kitchens and dining halls to accommodate the expected demand, but the department for education claimed there was no overspend in the maintenance budget to fund the work, which the liberal democrats dismissed as "b*****t." deputy prime minister nick clegg and education secretary michael gove had differing views on how the money should be used, with clegg wanting to expand free school meals, and gove wanting to spend the money on more free schools. the policy will benefit 1.8 million children in england, saving parents over £430-a-year. some of the money has come from new funds from the treasury, but there is a disagreement over where the remaining funds will come from within the department for education budget. the liberal democrats accused the department for education of lying and going rogue, while downing street made it clear that it was the education secretary's department that was out of line. the policy has also been criticized for offering free meals to wealthier families, while denying some older children in need. the £600 million-a-year cost of the meals was first announced by clegg in september and will be funded through new money from the treasury. chancellor george osborne will announce how the money has been raised in his autumn statement tomorrow. the policy has been shown to increase attainment and make pupils healthier in pilot studies.
2571	rick perry, the former texas governor, is considering another run for the presidency after recovering from back surgery and engaging with the conservative base once again. his previous bid was hindered by his stance on immigration, but the current crisis at the southern border has put him back in the spotlight. perry recently met with president barack obama to discuss the issue and criticized the administration's handling of it. perry has been advocating for securing the border since 2010 and is disappointed in obama's response. he has been more vocal in his criticism since their meeting, using stronger language to express his disapproval. perry's political advisers believe that the media's attention on the immigration crisis is giving him a larger platform to voice his concerns. perry's previous presidential bid was derailed by his stance on immigration, specifically his support for government-funded tuition for undocumented immigrants. he was heavily criticized by his rivals during debates and eventually dropped out after disappointing showings in the iowa caucuses and new hampshire primary. perry is now focusing on improving his policy knowledge and international travel as he considers another presidential run. immigration is seen as a potential opportunity for him to make a political comeback, but he will need to walk a tight rope and be eloquent in defending his position to sway republican voters.
2572	wasps ceo nick eastwood has encouraged disgruntled fans angry about the £20million move to the ricoh arena in coventry to vent their frustration towards him instead of the players. wasps are set to face bath in the aviva premiership on sunday, marking the first opportunity for fans to publicly protest the decision. the club, which is currently losing £3m annually, had been kept afloat by a £10m injection from owner derek richardson and was one minute away from administration in 2013. fans' main concerns have been the lack of consultation and the relocation being away from wasps' traditional roots in london and the south-east. eastwood attended a fans' forum on thursday, explaining that negotiations were confidential, and that all options for a site in and around the m25 had been exhausted. he acknowledged the emotional attachment of fans to the club and urged them to give logic a chance to prevail as the club strives to avoid going bust in the future. the number of season ticket holders who will make the move to coventry is yet to be determined.
2573	iranian officials, including gen. hossein salami of the revolutionary guard, have announced their intentions to reverse-engineer the us rq-170 sentinel drone that crashed in iranian territory in early december. they claim to be in the final stages of decoding the aircraft's systems and believe they can mass-produce a superior version. iran denied us accusations of involvement in the drone's demise and dismissed the need for foreign assistance in replicating the technology. gen. salami called the capture a victory for iran and a blow to us intelligence capabilities, but us officials maintain that the drone malfunctioned. the european union is unlikely to impose sanctions on iran's oil exports due to the potential harm to the global crude market.
2574	massive numbers of starfish, including the purple sea star and sunflower sea star, are dying along the us west coast, raising concerns for marine ecosystems. scientists have yet to identify the cause of the die-offs, which span from washington state to california. while previous episodes were linked to warmer waters and reduced starfish populations, the 2013 phenomenon affected millions and covered a larger geographic area. theories suggest a possible parasite or pathogen weakening the sea stars' immune systems, making them more susceptible to secondary bacterial infections. additionally, the loss of starfish will have cascading effects on the ecosystem, with potential consequences for mussel populations and the entire food chain. researchers are collecting data, analyzing specimens, and performing genetic sequencing to determine the cause of the die-offs.
2575	an mma fighter named jonathan koppenhaver, who goes by the name "war machine," is currently in jail and facing multiple charges for allegedly beating his ex-girlfriend, porn star christy mack, in august. mack sustained severe injuries, including a blowout fracture to her left eye, a broken nose in two places, smashed teeth, and internal injuries. war machine has returned to social media with a series of bizarre and self-pitying poems, expressing feelings of victimization and longing for pain to be outside of him. mack is recovering from her injuries and continues to post updates on her social media, including progress pictures and her experiences during the recovery process. she has undergone multiple dental visits and has had some movement in her top lip and liver, but still faces several more procedures. war machine is due back in court on october 17. mack posted graphic images of her injuries online after the attack and it led to an arrest warrant and a manhunt for war machine. the police reported that war machine showed up unannounced at mack's house, attacked her and her friend, and took her phone to cancel her plans. he also allegedly threatened to rape mack but could not perform. mack escaped by running naked outside and knocking on neighbors' doors for help. the relationship between mack and war machine was abusive, with previous incidents of beatings and infidelity. war machine made his ufc debut in 2007, had a 14-5 record, and lost his last fight in october 2013.
2576	early voting in the united states is becoming increasingly popular, with as many as 40% of americans expected to vote before the first tuesday in november. this trend is changing the way campaigns are run and the way voters cast their ballots. early voting has been shown to increase voter participation in some areas, but it also comes with increased costs for states, requiring them to staff polling locations and maintain and secure polling machines for longer periods of time. the obama campaign is using early voting to build a grassroots organization and focus resources more efficiently, while some republicans are still relying on large ad buys. early voting has been particularly popular in the west, where complicated ballots have led to long wait times at polling stations. mail ballots, a part of early voting in some states, can increase the chance of ballots not being counted if voters do not follow procedures carefully. in 2008, over 400,000 absentee ballots were discarded due to improper filling out.
2577	a television advertisement for e45 cream, featuring a young woman speaking about her "addiction" to the moisturizer, has received complaints from viewers for trivializing drug abuse. the advert, which has been pulled, uses a thin, pale-looking model, seated in a dark basement and confessing to being hooked on e45. critics and a support group for addicts have accused the campaign of exploiting addiction stereotypes. e45 body lotion is a market leader, and the complainants included viewers on twitter and facebook. the advertising standards authority has received sixty complaints and is investigating. reckitt benckiser, the company that manufactures e45, was not available for comment.
2578	two west virginia police officers were shot and wounded during a traffic stop on interstate 64 on thursday. the officers, from lewisburg, pulled over a reportedly stolen white chevrolet suv with north carolina plates. as they were conducting the stop, a red chevrolet truck pulled alongside them and the driver opened fire, wounding both officers. the drivers of both vehicles then fled. the red truck, allegedly driven by the father, was taken into custody after crashing over an embankment. the other driver, believed to be the son, hid near the interstate and later turned himself in. two "recently deceased bodies" were found in the red truck, and the suspects are expected to be charged with assault and attempted murder. the officers' conditions were not immediately known, but they were taken to greenbrier valley medical center.
2579	the wales vs. england six nations opener is expected to be a tough, fast-paced match at the millennium stadium in cardiff. the midfield will be a focus area, with wales' jamie roberts and jonathan davies looking to gain ground and create gaps in the english defense, while ford and england's centers will need to defend effectively. the scrum could also be decisive as england looks to improve upon their performance in the last match at the stadium. discipline and the kicking game are also crucial factors, with ford and youngs expected to provide variety in england's kicking game and wales' halfpenny known for his goal-kicking prowess. at the breakdown, england will rely on james haskell to provide quick ball and slow down welsh ball, while warrenball's effectiveness will depend on the brute force of roberts and davies. both coaches have a significant edge in experience, and the game could see surprises in attack and defense. the roof of the stadium will remain open, with no major impact on the game expected due to the chilly and dry forecast.
2580	a woman named julie griffiths from newcastle-under-lyme, staffordshire, who was given a five-year asbo (anti-social behavior order) in december 2012 for disturbing residents with her loud arguments and shouting at her husband, has breached the order by continuing the behavior. the latest incidents, which took place between april and august 2013, involved shouting, swearing, and slamming doors, disturbing her neighbors who have been complaining since 1999. she claimed she didn't understand the conditions of the order and escaped a prison sentence with a 12-month conditional discharge and a £85 costs order. council members described her behavior as "dreadful" and vowed to take action to stop it. griffiths has a history of ignoring previous noise abatement orders.
2581	lib dem peer floella benjamin will call for teaching about the dangers of extreme pornography in schools and a default setting where pornography is blocked on electronic devices unless users specifically request access, in a bid to protect young people from the potential harm of explicit material. under current government plans, every household will be asked whether they want online porn blocked. the lib dems will also urge the coalition to work with the software industry to introduce opt-in filters for explicit material on new internet-enabled devices. benjamin expressed concerns about the impact of pornography on young minds and the increasing number of cases of children being exposed to and engaging in inappropriate sexual behavior. education minister liz truss previously suggested that pornography could already be part of sex education in schools. the nspcc has warned of an increase in cases of children sexually assaulting other children.
2582	in an interview with cnn, 70-year-old george clinton, the architect of p-funk, reflects on his long career in music. known for his signature hat, shades, and jeans, clinton greets the interviewer with a warm smile and animated stories. he's still performing and touring, having started in the 1950s. clinton's hoarse voice alarms the interviewer, but transforms when he talks about his greatest hits. he rebranded his bands every decade and credits his success to the numerous bandmates throughout the years. his friends and fans have kept him going, and his music is among the most sampled. clinton fights to protect artists' work from piracy and offers advice for those entering the industry. although he admits to past drug use, he encourages making better decisions and staying focused on music. clinton plans to continue performing and making music for years to come.
2583	marijuana legalization initiatives passed in several states including alaska, oregon, and the district of columbia in november 2014. florida's medical marijuana law failed due to a required 60% voter approval. in 2016, several more states are expected to consider marijuana legalization, including california and massachusetts. a majority of americans now support marijuana legalization, but federal law still prohibits it. marijuana's impact on usage and harms have not been significantly affected by legalization in colorado, where commercialization started in 2009. federal law creates issues for the marijuana industry, such as lack of access to financial institutions and difficulty for medical researchers. the best approach to fully realizing the potential of marijuana legalization is for federal law to remove it from the controlled substances act or reschedule it under the act. medicalization, which would allow doctors to prescribe marijuana under federal law, is a more cautious approach, but also has limitations. the u.s. has outlawed marijuana for 77 years, with negative consequences, and it's hoped that congress will catch up with the changing public sentiment and state laws.
2584	a 22-year-old convicted robber named luke jackel flouted jail rules by updating his facebook status several times while serving his sentence, making posts such as "f*** them police and judge ha" and joking about getting drunk in prison. the posts were made despite access to facebook being a punishable offense. it is believed that jackel may have avoided reprimand due to being released early from prison while the facebook activity was under investigation. jackel was sentenced to two years and nine months in prison for a knifepoint robbery in february 2011, along with his accomplice jake bell. the prison service terminated active prisoner profiles on facebook and confirmed that inmates have no internet access or permission to update their profiles while serving their sentences.
