2667	sportsmail, in partnership with icons.com, is offering one lucky reader the opportunity to win a signed cristiano ronaldo real madrid shirt and a photo of the portuguese star. ronaldo's potential return to manchester united this season, which would see him become the club's all-time top goalscorer, is a scenario that benefits all parties involved, but none have acknowledged its possibility. ronaldo is reportedly unhappy with life at real madrid and is considering quitting the club. he is unhappy with their decision to sell angel di maria to manchester united and feels they should have signed radamel falcao instead. real madrid have had a disappointing start to the season, and president florentino perez is under pressure. united fans still sing ronaldo's name, and he shares an agent with falcao and di maria, whom he would be reunited with if he returned to old trafford. ronaldo has expressed his love for manchester united and has not ruled out a return in the future.
2668	more than 200 school girls have been missing for over 100 days after being kidnapped from their hostels in chibok, nigeria. the agony of the girls' families has resulted in the death of at least 11 parents due to heart attacks, high blood pressure, and other illnesses. the government's inability to secure the girls' release has led to a sense of disbelief and frustration among nigerians, both locally and internationally. years of political infighting between parties and a lack of cooperation between government agencies have emboldened boko haram, which continues to carry out attacks and taunt the country with videos. the government has been criticized for its handling of the situation, including the delay in acknowledging the scale of the problem and meeting with the parents, as well as the apparent lack of support for the girls who have escaped. the international community's involvement in finding the girls has been questioned, as there are no boots on the ground, and protesters have faced harassment from the secret service. despite these challenges, there is hope that the government's meeting with the parents marks a new chapter in efforts to find the girls and restore confidence in the government. citizens continue to protest and call for their safe return.
2669	a 27-year-old graphic designer, lillian lepere, hid under a sink at a printing works during the terrorist attack by the kouachi brothers and communicated vital information to the police through text messages. his boss, michel catalano, had saved his life by pushing him into hiding when the brothers entered the factory. lepere stayed hidden for eight hours, carefully avoiding detection, and provided crucial tactical information to the authorities. he expresses gratitude to his boss and feels solidarity with the victims and their families despite being unable to join the mass marches in paris due to his traumatic experience.
2670	two canadian and australian journalists, amanda lindhout and nigel brenan, along with their somalian translator and driver, were kidnapped in somalia on saturday, according to the national union of somali journalists. the group was on their way back from a refugee camp outside the capital city of mogadishu when they were abducted by militia men. the identities of the kidnappers and whether the journalists are being held for ransom is unknown. somalia has been in a state of chaos since 1991, when the overthrow of dictator mohamed siad barre led to clan infighting and near-anarchy. the current transitional government, with ethiopian forces, is attempting to maintain control in the capital. on friday, the islamic group al shabab took control of the southern port town of kismayo after clashes that left at least 89 people dead and displaced thousands, worsening the ongoing humanitarian crisis caused by years of drought, armed conflicts, and high food and fuel prices.
2671	the chelsea flower show, one of the uk's most prestigious horticultural events, is causing a stir within the gardening community as monty don, who has no formal gardening qualifications, takes over as the bbc's new presenter from alan titchmarsh, who had hosted the event for almost 30 years. titchmarsh, who is an ambassador for the royal horticultural society and holds certificates from horticultural institutions, considers monty to be an amateur. however, monty dismisses the criticism, claiming that the end goal is to create a beautiful garden. monty will be presenting alongside sophie raworth and is thrilled to be a part of the show. despite his long history with chelsea, monty says he wasn't surprised by the bbc's decision to appoint him. monty has been reporting on and writing about chelsea for nearly 30 years and has seen the importance of the show for both the horticultural industry and the public. he acknowledges the concerns about the increasing influence of big money and encourages the support of young gardeners. monty began gardening at a young age and has made it his passion throughout his life. despite facing financial struggles and a stroke in 2008, monty has continued to work hard and expand his garden and tv media presence. he now prioritizes his health and personal relationships while maintaining a successful career. monty's chelsea flower show coverage begins on bbc1 on may 23, 2023.
2672	unilever executive frank braeken acknowledges that western companies have underestimated africa's consumer diversity and are now taking the african consumer seriously. unilever, which has a long history in africa, is now focusing on localizing brands for different sub-regions and understanding the various consumer segments. nielsen identifies seven types of consumers in africa, grouped into three income tiers, and household spending in africa is projected to grow significantly. braeken emphasizes the importance of affordability, expanding market reach, and addressing challenges such as infrastructure, good governance, and local talent to grow businesses in africa.
2673	a visitor from london named paul meehan, 27, was attacked in cardiff, wales, in october 2012, and had to undergo emergency brain surgery after part of his skull was removed due to several skull fractures and an infection. he believes the assault was unprovoked and motivated by his english accent. meehan, who had spent part of his childhood in wales, grew up with a slight welsh accent but picked up a birmingham accent later in life. he was assaulted at a taxi rank after a night out with his fiancée and relatives. the attackers used a belt as a weapon, and meehan spent three weeks in the hospital before returning with severe health complications. south wales police is investigating the incident and has appealed for witnesses or information. meehan is currently unable to work and is undergoing neuro-rehabilitation treatment. the police have stated that cardiff is a cosmopolitan city with a history of welcoming visitors, and there is no official evidence of racial motivation in this case.
2674	the duchess of cambridge, kate middleton, made her first appearance at sandringham for christmas with the royal family. she looked elegant in a maroon outfit and a hat by jane corbett, drawing crowds of well-wishers. the queen, dressed in a lavender coat, also greeted the public and spoke about the importance of families during her christmas message. prince philip was in hospital, and the royal grandchildren visited him, including prince harry who entertained fans with kisses and charitable remarks. other royals, such as the duchess of cornwall, princesses beatrice and eugenie, and zara phillips attended the service in understated ensembles. the queen highlighted the significance of families in her speech, acknowledging the recent weddings and hardships as reminders of their role in bringing people together. prince harry was a popular figure among the crowds, entertaining them with light-hearted comments and gestures. the royal party gathered for christmas lunch and returned to sandringham after their visit to the hospital, with the queen continuing to be updated on philip's condition.
2675	krystal henderson and her step-son, oliver hallam, were disappointed and horrified when they discovered a piece of blue hand roll in one of the chicken pieces they bought from the kfc branch in killingworth, newcastle. while eating their takeaway meal at home, oliver found a hard and inedible piece of 'chicken,' which upon closer inspection was revealed to be a deep-fried piece of blue roll. krystal was shocked and returned to the store, only to be told to contact customer support. she was left traumatized by the experience and both she and oliver have vowed never to eat kfc again. an investigation conducted by kfc found that the blue roll most likely originated from a hygiene roll used in the restaurant and fell into the breading lug unseen by the cook. the franchise operating the kfc branch in killingworth apologized to krystal and refunded her money, promising to retrain their staff on food preparation procedures to prevent a similar incident from happening again.
2676	findmypast.co.uk has recently digitized over 450,000 service records of the royal flying corps and royal air force, providing insight into the diverse makeup of britain's heroic air force during world war one. these records, which include previously unseen airmen's records, shed light on the history of the royal air force from its inception in 1899 to its role in world war two. they contain detailed information about the men's peacetime and military careers, as well as their physical descriptions, religious denominations, and family statuses. the records reveal how men of all backgrounds and nationalities served side by side, with over 58 different nationalities represented. among them are the first indian aviator, hardutt singh malik, who survived the war despite being wounded, and working-class airmen like arthur ernest newland and john cowell, who went on to become celebrated flying aces. the records also include personnel from various professions, such as actors, comedians, and a music hall artiste.
2677	a boeing 767-300 american airlines plane with about 200 people on board safely landed at rio de janeiro's galeao-antonio carlos jobim international airport but suffered from all four tyres on the right main landing gear bursting upon touching down. the plane taxied to the terminal, leaving a trail of smoke and surface damage as the tyres disintegrated. the incident was captured on video by a helicopter pilot and has received over 30,000 hits on youtube. the flight, aa251, had just completed a 10-hour journey from dallas/fort worth international airport in texas. the onward flight to john f. kennedy international airport was cancelled, and the plane was still on the ground in rio de janeiro the following day. american airlines has not yet commented on the incident.
2678	manny pacquiao and amir khan met at the fitzroy lodge boxing club in london to discuss potential alternative opponents for floyd mayweather's next megafight. pacquiao, a filipino legend, and khan, a british fighter, are friends and former sparring partners. they declined to spar during their reunion but discussed the possibility of fighting each other at wembley stadium or abu dhabi, in case mayweather does not choose them to face him in las vegas later this year. both pacquiao and khan have set deadlines for mayweather to make a decision, but if he fails to do so, they are prepared to move on and face each other instead. pacquiao defeated chris algieri in his last fight, while khan won the wbc silver welterweight title by beating devon alexander. mayweather, the pound-for-pound king, recently defeated marcos maidana.
2679	bo guagua, the 24-year-old son of a powerful chinese family, gained a reputation as a playboy while studying at oxford university. he was known for hosting lavish parties and enjoying a luxurious lifestyle, cashing in on his family's wealth. however, his performance at oxford fell short of expectations and he faced disciplinary action. chinese officials intervened to prevent his tutors from disciplining him, citing the importance of education in china and the embarrassment it would cause his father and grandfather. bo guagua was suspended for a year and graduated with a 2:1 degree. his families' association with british businessman neil heywood ended tragically when heywood was found dead in a hotel room in chongqing in november 2011. heywood's wife, wang lulu, spoke of her sadness over his death for the first time, revealing their close relationship. chinese authorities named bo guagua's mother, gu kailai, as a suspect in heywood's murder. bo guagua is now in hiding in the united states, having graduated from harvard university's kennedy school of government. his parents, who were both high-ranking communist party officials, faced suspension and disgrace following the scandal.
2680	protests and violence continue over an anti-islam film produced in the united states, with demonstrations occurring in 11 countries and the indian-controlled region of kashmir. the film, which mocks islam's prophet mohammed, has led to the deaths of u.s. diplomats and security personnel in libya and the storming of u.s. embassies in egypt, tunisia, and yemen, among others. the u.s. department of homeland security and fbi have warned that the risk of violence could increase both at home and abroad as the film gains more attention. the film's producer, whose identity is unclear, has been identified as an israeli by some but denied by the israeli government. secretary of state hillary clinton has condemned the film, but protests and condemnations have not stopped the unrest. in libya, militias are reportedly running the show in the aftermath of the attack on the u.s. consulate in benghazi, and u.s. forces are on their way to secure u.s. facilities. protests continue in various parts of the middle east and north africa, and many question the motivations behind the production of the film. u.s. officials are seeking justice for the killing of u.s. ambassador chris stevens and three other american personnel in libya, and u.s. warships and marines have been deployed to aid in the investigation and security efforts. the violence and protests have raised questions about free speech versus hate speech and the role of religion in politics.
2681	in the final super league match for both bradford bulls and london broncos before their relegation to the championship, luke gale scored four tries as bradford won an exciting match 46-36. the game saw a total of 14 tries, with gale scoring twice in each half. london made two changes to their line-up, giving a debut to full-back alex walker, while bradford made five, including debutant emmerson whittel. london scored the first try through a matt cook effort, but bradford quickly took a commanding 12-point lead. london fought back to lead 24-16 at halftime, but bradford came back to level the score. the final three minutes saw gale and manase manuokafoa score for bradford to secure the victory. the game provided a strange atmosphere with both teams already preparing for life in the championship.
2682	the golf industry has embraced robotic technology for testing and manufacturing golf equipment, with companies like golf laboratories inc. leading the way. the founder, gene parente, started his company in 1990 and revolutionized the industry with robotic testing mechanisms that can simulate any golf swing. parente is now developing a fully robotic golf player named "golf laboratories computer controlled robot" as his next innovation. previous attempts at robotic golf include the iron byron, which relied on air pressure and pneumatics for club-head speed, but could only swing in one way. another application of golf robotics is the use of robots for mowing grass on golf courses by companies like precise path inc., which uses robots to consistently cut greens and fairways. the advancements in robotics and consumer electronics may make personal caddies and coaching robots a future possibility, but for now, parente's robot golfer is the most ambitious endeavor in the field.
2683	levante forward david barral played through pain after receiving a tackle with stud marks on his leg during a 2-1 loss to espanyol. he was later accused of feigning injury by referee carlos del cerro grande, but barral provided photographic evidence to support his claim. barral, who previously played for real madrid, suffered the injury in the first half but completed the full 90 minutes. despite taking the lead through jose luis morales, levante conceded two goals to espanyol and dropped to fifth place in the table. morales scored in the 12th minute, but felipe caciedo and sergio garcia netted for espanyol in the second half. barral also had an ice pack on his ankle, but it's unclear if both injuries occurred during the match.
2684	the new england brewing company in connecticut has apologized for naming one of its beers "gandhi-bot pale ale" and featuring a robot image of mahatma gandhi on the can. consumers in india were offended by the brewery's portrayal of the teetotal indian leader as a robot and claimed it was an "illegal insult." following a legal complaint in hyderabad, india, the brewery issued an apology on facebook, stating that their intent was to pay homage to gandhi, not offend anyone. despite the backlash, the brewery has no plans to withdraw the beer, which is not sold internationally. some indians support the drink and appreciate the company's craft. the case is expected to be heard in court on monday, and a petitioner in india contends that the use of gandhi's image on the alcohol cans is condemnable and punishable under indian laws. "gandhi-bot" is described as an intensely hopped double india pale ale.
2685	the port of dover was closed overnight for a terror attack simulation exercise involving mock explosions, gunfire, and a mock battle between fake terrorists and police. the port was closed from midnight to 5am as part of a series of pre-planned exercises to ensure the port is prepared for various emergency situations. kent police and the port of dover conducted the exercise, and ambulances were on standby. the port, which is one of the world's busiest, is a strategic priority to keep safe and secure for the millions of people who travel or work there. the exercise comes amidst an influx of migrants trying to reach dover from calais, with 7,500 stopped and 30,000 expected to be found hidden in vehicles by year's end. police would not confirm whether the exercise was related to the migrant crisis, and armed gangs fight for control of vantage points in calais. the port of dover urged reassurance that there is no cause for alarm, and such exercises are crucial in preparing for any eventuality.
2686	in f. scott fitzgerald's novel "the great gatsby," the character jay gatsby is described as having an extraordinary gift for hope and a romantic readiness that is deeply moving and ineffable. the novel has been unsuccessfully adapted into films multiple times due to its poetic language and resonant imagery, which some argue are merely cloaking devices for a thin and lurid storyline. baz luhrmann's latest adaptation, with leonardo dicaprio as gatsby, has received mixed reviews, with some critics hailing it as a faithful and entertaining adaptation, while others deem it a failure or a miscalculated attempt. luhrmann's version is characterized by its opulence, theatricality, and anachronistic musical background, but it is also seen as touching the emotional spirit of the novel. critics argue that the shallowness of the glamorous characters in the novel reflects the transient aspirations of american society and allows the reader to project their own desires and apprehensions. despite debates about the novel's substance and the feasibility of adaptation, its enduring popularity and influence remain undeniable.
2687	andre johnson, also known as rapper christ bearer, spoke to e! news about the incident in april where he severed his penis and jumped from a building in north hollywood while under the influence of drugs. johnson claimed that he acted intentionally as a means to rid himself of his sexual desires and become a god. doctors were unable to reattach his penis and he had been seeing a psychologist since being discharged from the hospital. johnson had previously remained silent about the incident due to negative perceptions about his mental state. johnson was previously affiliated with the wu-tang clan. doctors deemed him okay and johnson expressed gratitude for surviving the incident. photos of celebrity substance abuse confessions were included in the article.
2688	at least 17,000 people have been displaced and there were reported deaths following violent protests in northern nigeria after the announcement of goodluck jonathan as the winner of the presidential elections. incumbent president jonathan called for unity and appealed for peace amidst allegations of rigging in the election. tensions were heightened in the mainly muslim northern cities, with riots breaking out in several areas. the government deployed the military to restore order, but strict curfews were also enforced. the election, which was concluded on april 26 after being staggered over three weeks, was considered an improvement from the 2007 vote despite violence and organizational failures. the election results have been condemned for irregularities, including underage voting, intimidation, and cases of thumbprints placed on ballots. the opposition party, led by muhammadu buhari, issued a statement denouncing the burning of worship places and urged for the situation to not be turned into an ethnic, religious, or regional issue. the british foreign secretary, william hague, hailed the election as a significant step forward for nigeria, but there were concerns about the election management and authenticity of the results. the independent national electoral commission was criticized for its management of the collation process, which raised doubts about the accuracy of some of the figures.
2689	baron hill of oareford, the british eu commissioner, has been appointed as the eu's financial services commissioner, securing a victory for prime minister david cameron after fears of a junior role for him. jean-claude juncker announced the new portfolio, which includes key powers to protect the city of london from brussels regulations and the introduction of new regulation for european banks. the appointment is seen as a significant win for the uk as britain will have a major influence on financial services issues within the eu, and cameron hailed it as "great news" for the country. however, ukip leader nigel farage criticized the appointment, stating that lord hill would be acting in the interests of the eu rather than the uk.
2690	a north carolina woman named dorothy davidson, who has lateral sclerosis and requires a walker to move around, was unable to get up after falling in her bathroom and couldn't reach her phone. her trained golden retriever mix, named spirit, came to her rescue by activating a 911 phone specifically for assistance dogs. spirit was raised and trained by the non-profit organization dogs for life, which provides assistance dogs and pet therapy. the organization trains dogs of all breeds to help their disabled owners, including responding to emergencies, alerting owners to sounds, and providing emotional support. dorothy davidson has had spirit since she was a puppy and credits her with being her hero. the organization trains dogs to perform various tasks, such as keeping people at a distance for owners with ptsd or picking up items for those with physical disabilities. dorothy davidson considers spirit an essential companion in her life.
2691	the soza family, which includes two teenage children, cesia and ronald jr., both legal residents, experienced a tragic separation when their undocumented immigrant father, ronald soza, was taken into custody by u.s. immigration and customs enforcement (ice) and subsequently deported to nicaragua. the children came home from school one day to find an empty house and later contacted their father, who assured them everything would be okay. however, they have not seen their parents since september and are now living with a family friend, nora sandigo, in miami. soza, an immigrant from nicaragua, had previously been allowed to return home under certain conditions but reportedly violated these by missing appointments with immigration authorities. the siblings' emotional well-being has been affected, and they have had to adapt to new schools and a foster situation. experts warn that the trauma experienced by these children, who are part of the estimated 5,100 u.s. children who have lost parents to deportation, can have long-term psychological effects, including depression, conduct disorders, and a diminishing sense of future opportunities. family separations like this, often referred to as "mixed-status families," can also impact the nation as a whole, as some students may struggle to focus at school and some children may get lost in the child welfare system. the obama administration's pledge to prioritize deportation of undocumented immigrants with criminal records and strong ties to the u.s. has been criticized for not preventing family separations like the sozas'. some lawmakers believe bipartisan immigration reform legislation passed by the senate in 2012 could help address this issue by providing a path to citizenship, securing the border, and reforming the visa system. it remains to be seen how the situation will unfold, but the soza children continue to remain hopeful that they will be reunited with their parents.
2692	a singaporean photographer named aram pan visited north korea's masikryong ski resort, built as a tourism project to attract foreign visitors, but found it almost empty with no skiing in sight despite having 110 kilometers of slopes and modern facilities such as a hotel, spa, and restaurants. the resort, which was built in 10 months and cost an estimated $35 million, also includes a karaoke and dance room, a gym, and a ski shop. the ski lifts were bought from china after a deal with a swiss manufacturer was blocked due to trade sanctions. the resort had a few locals working on upgrades before the winter season and some tourists, including a western tourist on a private tour that aram pan encountered. aram stayed in a third-class room, tried out the facilities, and had the whole place to himself. the military played a significant role in the project, and hundreds of snow cannons from sweden are used to keep the resort looking its best during winter.
2693	neymar is a concern for brazil's quarter-final against colombia due to a thigh injury, which left him overwhelmed during their tense last-16 win over chile. luiz felipe scolari voiced his frustration over the treatment neymar received and compared it to an incident involving cristiano ronaldo in his previous coaching tenure. brazil had a challenging time progressing past chile and only made it through via a penalty shootout, with goalkeeper julio cesar saving two penalties. the team's performance in the game did not meet the high expectations of the brazilian public, making the psychological and emotional pressure on the team even more significant. despite the challenges, cesar remained optimistic about brazil's chances in the upcoming matches, expressing his desire to see brazil celebrate a victory.
2694	fox news anchor sabrina rodriguez, who is facing grand theft charges for allegedly helping her fiancé, nicholas gray, steal designer goods worth $2,500 from a sacramento store in 2013, has resigned from her job and split up with him. gray, who has a criminal record, is currently in jail for arson, battery, and drug possession charges. rodriguez's attorney, mark reichel, stated that she would defend her reputation in court and announced her resignation on her facebook page on tuesday, focusing on clearing her name. the news anchor was unaware of gray's past criminal history when they met. she was recognized by store employees from her news broadcasts and detained but not arrested at the scene. text messages discovered during gray's arrest implicated rodriguez in the theft. rodriguez will be arraigned on august 29.
2695	a couple, who crashed a pennsylvania wedding reception three months ago, have come forward to apologize after being identified by the newlyweds. krista lamkin and andrew reilly, who were married in january, spotted the unwelcome guests, a man in a button-down shirt and tie, and a woman in a little black dress, sitting at a table with family members during the reception. the couple made no effort to hide and were even seen dancing and posing for photos. the newlyweds were upset as the crashers had marred their wedding video and photos, and they started an internet appeal to find them. the crashers, who were staying at the valley forge casino and radisson hotel nearby, confessed to gatecrashing and apologized to the couple. they offered to buy a belated wedding gift, but the bride refused. the incident serves as a reminder to be aware of who is at your wedding reception, and the crashers' attire helped them blend in with the guests.
2696	joao miranda, atletico madrid's brazilian center-back, has revealed that he is in negotiations with clubs in the spanish la liga and the english premier league to leave atletico. miranda was a crucial defender for atletico last season, forming a solid partnership with diego godin and helping the team keep the tightest defense in spain. atletico signed him from sao paulo in 2011 and inserted a 30 million euro buy-out clause in his latest contract renewal to ward off interest from rival clubs. miranda has admitted that he is unhappy about being left out of luiz felipe scolari's world cup squad and has announced that his international career with brazil is over. manchester united's incoming manager louis van gaal is known to be an admirer of miranda. miranda did not reveal which clubs in the premier league are chasing his signature, but he has been linked with manchester united in the past. miranda has insinuated that the buy-out clause may not be a stumbling block to interested clubs.
2697	dutch midfielder leroy fer has completed a £7million move from championship side norwich to qpr, signing a three-year contract. the 24-year-old spent only one season at carrow road after joining from eredivisie side fc twente. fer, who helped holland reach the world cup semi-finals, expressed his excitement about staying in england and playing in the premier league. qpr manager harry redknapp called fer an "outstanding midfield player" and "a massive boost" for his team, who suffered a 1-0 defeat in their season opener against hull. fer is qpr's fifth summer signing, following jordan mutch, rio ferdinand, mauricio isla, and steven caulker. fer aims to help qpr stay in the premier league.
2698	a 15-year-old boy who raped and beat up a 14-year-old girl after being influenced by hardcore pornography was sentenced to three years in juvenile detention at teesside crown court. the attack occurred in april 2022, and the girl's father renewed calls for restrictions on internet porn following the incident. the boy, who came from a stable background, had been secretly watching sadistic pornography for hours every day without his family's knowledge. the attack took place at a house in hartlepool, where the two boys locked the victim in a room and bound, gagged, and threatened her with knives. the younger boy was also sentenced to four years for his role in the crime. the older boy's father runs a small business, and the girl's father expressed concern about the accessibility of pornography to children and called for restrictions. pressure groups, including the nspcc and mediawatch-uk, have supported the daily mail's campaign to block online porn. the judge described the attack as "heinous" and criticized the older boy for his willing participation in the crime. the girl's father stated that the attack would affect her for the rest of her life. the nspcc reported a surge in calls from young people exposed to hardcore pornography and young girls who felt coerced into replicating videos. mediawatch-uk director vivienne pattison suggested blocking pornography for everyone unless they opted-in. the older attacker had spent days trawling through internet porn sites in the months prior to the attack.
2699	the nobel peace prize for 2021 was awarded to three women: ellen johnson sirleaf and leymah gbowee of liberia, and tawakkul karman of yemen. the nobel peace prize, introduced at the beginning of the 20th century, honors individuals and organizations that work for peace, justice, and political and financial stability. the nominations come from lawmakers, university professors, previous nobel laureates, and members of the nobel committee. the nobel committee, composed of five norwegians chosen by norway's parliament, selects the winner from a record 241 candidates. the prize consists of a medal, a personal diploma, and a cash prize of 10 million swedish kronor ($1.4 million). alfred nobel, a swedish scientist, invented dynamite and founded the prize. since 1901, 91 nobel peace prizes have been awarded to 122 laureates, with 62 of those being single laureates and 28 shared between two. notable recent winners include chinese dissident liu xiaobo, barack obama, and martti ahtisaari. liu xiaobo won in 2010 but could not attend due to being imprisoned for "inciting subversion of state power." barack obama was awarded in 2009 for his efforts to strengthen diplomacy and cooperation between peoples. martti ahtisaari received the prize in 2008 for his work in resolving international conflicts.
2700	representative tom lantos accused yahoo of providing false information to congress regarding the case of chinese journalist shi tao. yahoo officials are set to testify before a house committee on november 6 about the company's role in shi's 10-year prison sentence on "trumped-up charges" of providing state secrets to foreign entities. a chinese government document obtained by the dui hua foundation suggests that yahoo was aware of the nature of the investigation, and republican representative chris smith urged us companies to not cooperate with chinese authorities. yahoo maintains that its representatives have been truthful with congress. shi, a pro-democracy activist, had posted information about a government crackdown on media and democracy activists on an overseas website before his arrest in 2005. he accused the police of using improper procedures in the investigation and has filed a lawsuit against yahoo in us federal court. the company is also working on a global code of conduct for operating in countries, including china.
2701	fifa has opened disciplinary proceedings against west ham united for potentially fielding senegal striker diafra sakho in their fa cup win against bristol city, despite him being called up for international duty during the africa cup of nations. sakho, who scored the winning goal, claimed he had a back injury and couldn't fly, but senegal alleges that west ham knew he was available. if found guilty, west ham could be expelled from the fa cup, face a player ban for sakho, or receive a fine. the co-owner, david sullivan, insists sakho was unable to fly due to his back injury and the team is confident they will be cleared in any fifa hearing. manager sam allardyce also supports sakho and assures no rules were broken.
2702	howard stern, a radio host on sirius xm, jokingly mentioned on his show that he intends to take over the tonight show following the public criticism towards matt lauer and ann curry's departure. bob greenblatt, nbc's entertainment chairman, reportedly suggested the idea to stern. however, insiders deny any negotiations, and jay leno continues to dominate the 11:30 pm time slot during sweeps. meanwhile, hbo canceled the show "enlightened." stern has a history of criticizing jay leno and claimed in 2011 that leno wanted to reduce staff but didn't want to come off as a bad guy, allowing nbc to take the hit instead.
2703	the history of men's underwear dates back nearly 7,000 years with the use of leather loincloths. over the centuries, underwear evolved into various forms, including codpieces and tight-fitting breeches. in the early 20th century, men mainly wore tight, knee-length flannel drawers and undershirts. the introduction of boxers and briefs came with innovations such as the elastic waistband and the y-front fly. the fashion trend toward designer underwear in the 1970s and 80s, with brands like calvin klein, saw a rise in flashy and humorous designs. former federal reserve chairman alan greenspan identified men's underwear sales as an indicator of the economy's health, with men tends to cut discretionary purchases, such as new underwear, during economic downturns.
2704	a arab immigration officer, identified as "mr. w," was sacked from his job at gatwick airport in 2010 after his security clearance was revoked over alleged links to islamic terrorism. mr. w, a naturalized british citizen and assistant immigration officer, had his clearance removed a month after returning from a year-long sabbatical in his native yemen. colleagues became suspicious of him due to his excessive use of the al jazeera news website.the hearing at the central london employment tribunal was held under controversial 'closed material procedures,' which allow cases to be heard in private to protect sensitive intelligence. mr. w was not allowed to attend the hearing, nor was his legal team or the press. he is suing the home office for discrimination and unfair dismissal, claiming it was because of his race and religion that he was suspected of associating with terrorists. the home office denies the allegations and maintains that mr. w was identified as an associate of a network of suspected islamist extremists. mr. w's last job was with the home office, which he joined in 1999, the same year he was granted british citizenship. he had previously routinely checked classified information and occasionally top-secret data in his role as an assistant immigration officer. mr. w told the tribunal that he had never been interviewed by the police or asked to assist any investigations. the tribunal has concluded the hearing and reserved judgment until a later date.
2705	a miami man, pedro bravo, was convicted of first-degree murder on friday for strangling university of florida student christian aguilar in a fit of jealousy over a woman. the jury also convicted bravo of six other counts related to aguilar's death. the victim's family watched in silence as bravo was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole. bravo had dated the victim's former girlfriend, erika friman, while in high school, but when she began dating aguilar, bravo became obsessed and researched ways to drug and dispose of bodies. on september 20, 2019, the two men spent hours together, and bravo killed aguilar in his suv in a walmart parking lot. the victim's family expressed their grief and relief, with the mother, claudia aguilar, stating that bravo made "the most terrible decision for me and my family." the gainesville police department released a statement expressing relief that justice had been served.
2706	betty, a three-year-old maltese dog, is considered the most pampered pooch in britain. her owner, hayley dexter, and her family from essex have spent a substantial £30,000 on betty since they got her as a puppy. betty enjoys a lavish lifestyle, with her own bedroom, custom-made furniture, diamond collar, crystal fork, and an extensive wardrobe of dog outfits. the family feeds her by hand using a swarovski crystal-encrusted fork and takes her everywhere, including her daughter's school prom. hayley started a five-star luxury kennels business, essex pooch palace, inspired by betty's spoiled behavior and love for pampering. the business, which also offers grooming, spa services, boarding, and dog walking, has many clients who want to pamper their own pets.
2707	a study published in the american journal of epidemiology suggests that following the paleo or caveman diet, which consists of unprocessed foods like fruit, vegetables, nuts, and lean meat, could reduce the risk of bowel cancer by up to 51% for men and 29% for women. the diet, which has gained popularity as a fashionable way to lose weight, has been shown to lower the risk of developing colorectal adenomas, a benign tumor that is a precursor to the disease. the study involved 2,301 men and women, and the results showed that those with the most paleolithic diet regimes had a lower risk of developing colorectal adenomas compared to those with a more modern diet. however, nutritionists advise that it's not possible for people to live like cavemen in the 21st century and suggest weaving those good messages into our lifestyles by buying fresh, unprocessed food and cooking it from scratch for most meals. the paleo diet shares similarities with the atkins diet but differs in that it encourages a wide range of fresh fruit and vegetables, while the atkins diet is known for its strict approach to reducing carbohydrates and includes processed meat and dairy products.
2708	teodoro nguema obiang mangue, the malibu-based son of equatorial guinea's president, has agreed to surrender more than $30 million worth of his assets as part of a settlement with the u.s. government. the assets include a mansion in california, a ferrari, and michael jackson memorabilia, except for the singer's famous crystal-encrusted "bad tour" glove, a jacket from the "thriller" tour, and a $38.5 million gulfstream jet. he will pay an additional $1 million to cover the value of the memorabilia elsewhere, and any attempt to bring the items back into the u.s. will result in their seizure. mangue, who reportedly paid $482,000 for the glove in the late 1980s, had amassed his wealth through extortion, embezzlement, and corruption, according to u.s. authorities. the settlement includes the selling of the assets to benefit the people of equatorial guinea and paying the u.s. government $10.3 million. despite recent oil and gas wealth, equatorial guinea remains a relatively impoverished country, and most of its residents live below the poverty line. u.s. authorities have accused mangue and other officials of plundering their country's coffers in the economic boom years. the equatorial guinea embassy and teodoro nguema obiang mangue could not be reached for comment.
2709	dutch mps are calling for an investigation into allegations that young men under the age of 21 were castrated by the roman catholic church in the 1950s to rid them of homosexuality or as punishment for reporting clergy abuse. one identified victim, henk heithuis, was castrated after reporting monks for abusing him in a catholic boarding home. the dutch newspaper nrc handelsblad revealed the case, and sources claim surgical removal of testicles was a treatment for homosexuality and a punishment for accusers. the dutch prime minister at the time, vic marijnen, who was also vice-chairman of the dutch catholic child protection agency, is accused of having links to the case. several hundred catholic clergy and church employees were identified as abusers in a government inquiry, but there is evidence that government inspectors were aware of the castrations and did not involve parents or report the incidents. the investigation received reports of henk heithuis' castration but did not pursue it further. mps are demanding an independent parliamentary investigation to uncover the extent of the scandal, the number of cases, who was involved, and why the government did not act.
2710	the article argues against the practice of colorblindness in the workplace, particularly when dealing with performance issues for minority employees. according to research, avoiding race can create more problems than it solves, as minorities are often more skeptical of those who fail to acknowledge race. pretending not to notice race can prevent constructive feedback and make it harder for employees to improve. skilled managers should instead create a cohesive team climate where race can be acknowledged and discussed, allowing employees to be more open and effective in their group discussions and teamwork. the article emphasizes that recognizing the differences among team members, including race, is not about overvaluing these differences but rather acknowledging their existence and allowing for productive discussion.
2711	a 26-year-old man, identified as joshua steven durcho, was arraigned on five counts of first-degree murder for the january strangling deaths of his girlfriend, summer rust, 25, and her four small children in oklahoma. durcho reportedly confessed to choking rust but claimed her children were elsewhere. all five bodies were found in rust's apartment in el reno, oklahoma. durcho is believed to have killed rust in retaliation for her threatening to call the police on him due to his two outstanding bench warrants. he had previously served time in prison for unlawful possession of marijuana and vowed never to return. prosecutors intend to seek the death penalty due to the severe pain and anguish each victim endured while being strangled, and evidence suggests durcho sexually abused the two 7-year-old girls around the time they died. in tuesday's arraignment, durcho's not-guilty pleas were entered on his behalf. according to an affidavit, durcho confessed to an acquaintance that he had killed rust at her apartment and had left oklahoma, and was later arrested in hamilton county, texas. durcho has been appointed public defenders and waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
2712	ed miliband will try to mend his relationship with union leaders during a speech at the tuc conference in bournemouth on tuesday. he will defend unions against criticisms from prime minister david cameron and the conservative party, rejecting margaret thatcher's description of them as the "enemy within." miliband plans to launch a strong defense of trade unionism and will announce reforms to make party membership opt-in for union members instead of opt-out, potentially reducing the number of union members contributing to labour funds. critics argue that labour may face losses if membership does not increase by 300,000 as expected. union leaders and left-wing campaign groups have announced plans for a national day of strikes and civil disobedience on bonfire night in opposition to the government's austerity measures. miliband's speech comes after union leaders voiced their disapproval of his planned reforms, with unite's general secretary len mccluskey emphasizing the positive role unions have played in society. tuc conference merchandise, including mugs that celebrate the death of margaret thatcher, has met with condemnation from conservative mps.
2713	a leader of the st. paul's cathedral anti-capitalist camp, tammy samede, almost refused to fight eviction attempts due to fellow protesters getting drunk and abusing each other, causing fear among women and desecrating the cathedral with graffiti and urination/defecation. samede voiced her concerns at a meeting days before her court appearance, while another protester, michael hayton, suggested police should have taken tougher action to protect them from abuse and violence. the camp had experienced over 70 arrests in two months, and fellow defendant george barda suggested the experiences were a form of poetic justice. the hearing continues.
2714	three major incidents involving southeast asian airlines in 2014, including the disappearance of malaysia airlines flight mh370 and the shooting down of flight mh17, have raised concerns about the safety of regional carriers, particularly malaysian ones. however, airasia, which is not a malaysian airline but is majority-owned by indonesian interests, has built a strong reputation for affordable and safe flying, having transported over 200 million passengers with no planes lost until the recent disappearance of flight qz8501. airasia's formidable ceo, tony fernandes, has been praised for his handling of the crisis. although there is no pan-asian low-cost competitor on the same scale as airasia, the way the airline manages the crisis will be crucial in determining its future. the fact that air transport is experiencing phenomenal growth in asia, with the region poised to become the world's largest and most dynamic aviation market, suggests that recent incidents should not be used to make sweeping generalizations about the safety of airlines in the region.
2715	cristiano ronaldo insists on his fitness to lead portugal against germany in the world cup, with the team being 25-1 outsiders to win. ronaldo, also known as "rocket ronnie," has been a standout player at real madrid and was named after us president ronald reagan. the quarterfinals are coming up, and portugal's carlos queiroz is expected to leave his position as iran's coach after the tournament due to financial reasons. iran has a 19-year-old prospect named sardar azmoun, who is being compared to lionel messi, and nigeria's emmanuel emenike is seen as a dark horse for the golden boot with six goals in the tournament, especially if he gets an early goal against iran. ghana is known for its azonto dance celebrations and will sing and dance if they score against the usa. germany is playing in their 100th world cup match and has the most appearances and wins at the tournament. england needs to draw against uruguay and win against costa rica to make the last 16 after losing to italy. africans teams, including ghana, are making history with their strong presence in the tournament, with the dream of winning the trophy still elusive. african football has come a long way since zaire, the first african team to compete, experienced humiliation in the 1974 world cup.
2716	a seven-year-old tomcat named baz, who has a distinctive black patch of fur under his nose resembling adolf hitler's mustache, was brutally attacked and left for dead in gloucestershire, england, due to his unfortunate likeness. the cat, who is timid and gentle, sustained severe injuries to his left eye and was found dumped in a bin by cruel youths. owner kirsty sparrow was worried when baz didn't return home after a weekend outside and rushed him to the vet for emergency treatment, where his left eye was removed due to the damage. baz, who has been named a "hitler cat" since birth, has recovered and is happy to go outside, despite the tragedy. the cat's owner received donations from people all over the country to help cover the £600 cost of his treatment. sparrow expressed her disbelief over the attack and said she didn't know why anyone would harm an animal because of its appearance.
2717	a sweet shop owner in oldham, mohammed akram, was fined £4,000 for eight food safety offenses after hygiene inspectors found the shop engulfed with flies and filled with dirty pans caked in grease. the premises had a food preparation area full of flies, and there was no soap or hand-drying facilities at the kitchen sink. the shop, aysha sweet centre, specializes in asian sweets such as barfi, jalebi, and halwa, but failed to implement required food safety procedures. akram apologized and assured that hygiene standards have improved since the visit. the court also ordered him to pay £1,575 costs to the council. oldham council emphasized the importance of food hygiene practices and the consequences for those who disregard them.
2718	a mother of five-month-old harper was stabbed five times in the stomach by her cage fighter ex-boyfriend, nicholas leaning, during an attempted murder and child destruction attack seven months into her pregnancy. leaning, who was wearing his cage fighter mask during the assault, was jailed for 19 years for the crime. oliver described how she begged him not to harm their unborn child but was met with continued violence. she was taken to the hospital where surgeons delivered her baby by cesarean section six weeks early, and the baby survived due to being in the breech position and oliver's pregnancy fat protecting her from the full force of the knife. leaning was cleared of attempted murder but convicted of wounding with intent and attempted child destruction. he had been cheating on oliver with his ex-girlfriend, lindsay coombs, and when she told him she was pregnant, he pressured her to get an abortion. when she refused, he feared being exposed as a cheat and launched the attack. oliver is left dealing with the aftermath of the assault and the emotional trauma, dreading the day she must tell her daughter about her father's violent past.
2719	turkish prime minister recep tayyip erdogan hailed the passage of constitutional amendments in a referendum as a "milestone for democracy," with over 58% of voters approving the measures. the reforms include changes to the judiciary, collective bargaining for public sector workers, and affirmative action measures for women, among other things. critics argue the amendments will give erdogan too much power and further undermine secular foundations, while supporters say they will bring greater freedom and democracy. the referendum came amidst a power struggle between erdogan's ruling justice and development party and secularist opposition, with tensions escalating over the past few years. the main kurdish political party called for a boycott of the vote and clashes between kurdish activists and police occurred in istanbul. the constitutional court has also blocked some of the akp's legislation due to secular concerns.
2720	three individuals, including an adult and two minors, have been indicted in israel for the revenge killing of 16-year-old palestinian teen, mohammed abu khdeir, in jerusalem in july. prosecutors allege they abducted, beat, and burned him due to his ethnicity, following the deaths of three israeli teens whose bodies were found in the west bank in late june. abu khdeir's death led to widespread protests and clashes between israelis and palestinians, resulting in additional alleged police brutality towards a cousin of the victim. suspects include a 29-year-old man from the settlement of adam, and two 16-year-olds from jerusalem and beit shemesh. the defendants are also accused of attempting to commit crimes against arabs, including trying to kidnap a 7-year-old and burning cars, motivated by revenge. this case followed the july conflict between israel and hamas in gaza, in which over 230 palestinians and one israeli were killed.
2721	a conservative health minister, dan poulter, suggested that hospitals should adopt the bargain-hunting approach of the tv show "bargain hunt" to save money and provide better value for the nhs. hospitals pay vastly different prices for similar goods and services, and poulter plans to require them to publish these costs to enable comparisons. he aims to save £1.5 billion annually, using the example of rubber gloves, where the nhs spends £10.5 million and could potentially cut the cost in half. the saving could fund more hip replacements or cataract operations. poulter intends to appoint a new nhs procurement champion with private sector expertise to drive down costs. he stressed the need for hospitals to manage resources effectively to improve patient care with the additional funding.
2722	a jack russell terrier named gypsy survived after falling down an embankment and clinging to a tiny ledge for four hours near a railway line in hampshire, england. the ledge, created by recent flooding, prevented her from being hit by trains. it took four hours for anyone to hear her barking for help, and firemen eventually rescued her using a rope system. gypsy fell from the embankment after someone deliberately opened the garden door while her owner was at work. the distraught owner, jane alywiye, was relieved that gypsy was unhurt and angry about the incident. firemen saved the dog from the ledge, and hampshire fire and rescue service commented on the successful rescue.
2723	luis suarez's four-month ban from football for biting giorgio chiellini during the world cup was upheld by the court of arbitration for sport (cas) in lausanne. however, suarez will be officially unveiled at barcelona on monday and will train with the team on friday. the ban on all football-related activities, including training, has been removed, allowing suarez to participate in non-competitive games and promotional activities. suarez will serve the suspension in competitive matches, including those for barcelona and uruguay. he cannot play for barcelona until october 26, and for uruguay in their next eight competitive fixtures. cas ruled that the ban on all soccer activities was excessive and only the ban on competitive matches would apply. suarez was banned from football activity on july 1 for biting chiellini during a world cup match against italy on june 24. suarez joined barcelona for £75 million following the ban, but has been unable to be officially unveiled or train with the team. the incident is the third time suarez has been banned for biting and the second time for racially abusing a player.
2724	a studio photographer, bradley lever, attempted to capture a toddler named josh holford destroying his first birthday cake in a cake smash session. however, josh showed no interest in getting messy and spent over an hour crawling around instead, resulting in some hilarious moments. the persistent photographer eventually managed to get some nice shots, turning the session into a funny time-lapse video that is now going viral. despite the challenges, bradley charged between £95 to £250 for the shoot, depending on the package, and had the idea of cake smash photography after seeing messy babies in the us. josh was his most trying client yet, but bradley found the experience enjoyable and said he would happily do it again.
2725	belgian police have warned british border officials against stopping illegal migrants using the "lille loophole" to travel to london via eurostar trains. this involves buying a ticket from brussels to lille and then remaining on the train as it continues tolondon, where border checks are minimal. figures from the uk border agency suggest the use of this loophole has increased significantly in recent months, with around 240 migrants detected in the last five months of 2011 compared to 80 in the first six months. british officials have been threatened with arrest if they try to stop suspected migrants with tickets to lille, as it breaches the schengen agreement on free movement within the european union. the uk government is negotiating with other european countries to resolve the issue. in 2010, just 14 migrants were caught using this route, but the true number is likely to be much higher as only those detected are recorded. concerns have been raised that the loophole could also be exploited by terrorists and people traffickers.
2726	an 18-year-old man named rhyan wilson died after being stabbed in a fight outside the ivory sports bar and nightclub in urmston, greater manchester, in the early hours of this morning. a 25-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder. another 18-year-old was stabbed in the neck and leg during the same fight and is in stable condition. a large area was cordoned off and a murder investigation is underway. the incident occurred following a verbal altercation outside the bar and involved people who knew each other. witnesses are being urged to come forward and a memorial is being planned at golden hill park in urmston. rhyan, a former wellacre academy school pupil, is remembered on social media by friends and family. the second teenager is also recovering in hospital.
2727	protesters have returned to cairo's tahrir square six months after the revolution that ousted president hosni mubarak. mubarak faces possible death sentence and remains hospitalized. the economy and tourism industry are still struggling, and the coalition that formed during the protests has splintered over different visions for a post-mubarak future. the revolution has fundamentally changed egypt and given millions of voiceless people a voice, but it remains a work in progress. the military, which handed power to a council of generals, remains the final authority and is facing renewed protests for not addressing demands for reform and elections. the division among egyptians over the priorities of the revolution - elections or constitutional reforms - has led to debates and a realization that revolutions are messy. the most likely outcome is that the military will keep some control over international affairs, defense policy, and economic interests in a new government. the focus is also on the upcoming parliamentary elections as a way to clarify the political landscape and establish which factions have the support and capability to push the transition forward. some egyptians are critical of the direction the revolution has taken and are calling for more time for secular political parties to organize. the legacy of mubarak and other former regime figures also remains a contentious issue, with debates over accountability and justice.
2728	the family of nazi war criminal erich priebke, who died in italy at the age of 100 while serving a life term for the 1944 massacre of 335 civilians at the ardeatine caves outside rome, stated that they do not know where his body is after the funeral was disrupted by protests. italian authorities have refused to disclose information about the whereabouts of the casket, which was reportedly taken to a military base following the incident. priebke's lawyer, paolo giachini, expressed concern over the disappearance of the casket and called for clarity. the incident sparked outrage from italy's jewish community due to priebke's refusal to repent for his actions during the war, and he denied the existence of gas chambers in nazi death camps in his final statement. the italian government is reportedly considering contacts with germany regarding the possible burial of priebke's remains in his native land. the funeral was organized by the catholic society of st. piusdespite local opposition, resulting in clashes between the far-right supporters and anti-fascist protesters. the residents of albano laziale, where the funeral was to take place, fear the town may become a symbol or pilgrimage site for neo-nazis if priebke is buried there. priebke had previously escaped justice and lived in argentina for decades until he was extradited to italy in 1998. the controversy over priebke's last burial place has raged for days due to concerns that the grave could become a site of pilgrimage for his neo-nazi fanbase. both his birth town in germany and his adopted homeland of argentina have made it clear that his remains are not welcome in their respective countries. the jewish community in rome has threatened renewed protests if priebke is permitted a tomb in the italian capital, stating that it would be like killing the victims a second time.
2729	a college student named zach tennen, 19, was the victim of an alleged hate crime at a party near michigan state university (msu) campus. he was reportedly beaten unconscious and had his mouth stapled while his attackers made anti-semitic taunts, identifying themselves as members of the ku klux klan and raising nazi salutes. the east lansing police department is investigating the assault, but has not yet classified it as a hate crime. the potential suspect has been identified, and around 20 people at the party reportedly watched the attack but didn't intervene. tennen has a broken jaw and underwent surgery to have it wired shut. his family contacted the anti-defamation league, which is supporting the investigation and urging the police to treat it as a possible hate crime. tennen, a journalism student at msu, said he had only consumed a small amount of alcohol before the attack, and the hospital where he was initially taken did not contact the police. msu's student affairs and services have offered support to the student, and all inquiries about the police investigation should be directed to the east lansing police department.
2730	rome, italy's capital city, is considering establishing an official red light district in the eur business district to reduce the visibility of prostitution and mitigate trafficking. the mayor, ignazio marino, supports the proposal, which will designate a specific area for prostitution and provide services for sex workers. prostitution is legal in italy but has long been an issue for residents, particularly in the eur district where current prostitution occurs on over 20 streets. women selling sex will work in a safer environment, and clients risk fines for engaging in the trade outside the designated area. critics, including some church figures, have condemned the proposal as shameful or as creating 'prostitution ghettos,' but supporters argue it will help shield children and families from the sex trade. the pope, who has called trafficking a 'shameful plague,' has urged governments to act decisively to combat the issue. the plan includes provisions for psychological support and health care for sex workers. if successful, up to three red light zones may be established within the district. approximately nine million italian men have used a prostitute in their lifetime according to a survey.
2731	sayreville high school football team's homecoming game was canceled after seven players were arrested and charged for sexually assaulting younger teammates in the locker room. the alleged assaults, which some have called "pervasive hazing," involved older players pinning down and sexually abusing younger players in the dark, and occurred multiple times between september 19 and 29, affecting four victims. dozens of other players reportedly witnessed the assaults and did nothing. the superintendent acted swiftly, canceling the rest of the season due to "harassment, intimidation and bullying." some parents have protested the decision, downplaying the severity of the situation and expressing concern for scholarship opportunities, while others call for the firing of the entire coaching staff and cancellation of the next season to send a message of zero tolerance for such behavior. the truth behind the incidents will be uncovered through individual questioning of players, and it's likely that the abusive locker room culture has been ongoing for some time.
2732	wayne rooney, england's captain, is aiming to break several historic records in english football. he will become the youngest player to reach 100 england caps on november 15 and plans to surpass david beckham's record of 115 caps and peter shilton's all-time record of 125. rooney, who is 29, is also closing in on bobby moore's record as the youngest player to reach a century of caps and sir bobby charlton's goalscoring records for england and manchester united. rooney currently has 98 caps, 42 international goals, and is close to overtaking denis law and charlton as united's all-time record goalscorer. he is in good spirits and plans to continue playing for england for several more years.
2733	a 13-year-old girl named katrina maetzold from milaca, mn, tragically died when the van she was riding in, driven by her brother tristan, was struck by a semitractor-trailer during the morning school commute. katrina, who was sitting behind the driver's seat without wearing a seat belt, was ejected from the vehicle and died at the scene. tristan suffered a broken leg, and younger siblings patience and devon sustained injuries, including a fractured skull for devon, but both survived. the semitruck driver did not sustain any injuries and was not charged. katrina was an aspiring artist and writer, and flowers, a cross, and signs were left at the accident site as a roadside tribute. her father, larry maetzold, shared stories of her artistic talent and creativity. tristan, who had just received his driver's license, often drove his siblings to school. the family is devastated by the loss and seeking support as they cope with the aftermath of the accident.
2734	the iconic hoverboard from "back to the future ii" has become a reality in the form of the drift, a new fitness gadget by quirky specializing in inventions. while not truly hovering, the drift uses an adjustable ball-and-pendulum balancing mechanism to simulate a variety of action sports and improve balance, core strength, and burn calories. it has been popular in america and is now available in the uk for £149.99. personal trainer andrew flint suggests integrating it into a fitness program as an add-on, stating that while it may enhance core stability and balance, it is not a standalone workout.
2735	a three-year-old boy named ernie djedje from sheffield, who had up to 100 seizures a day due to a severe form of childhood epilepsy called west syndrome, underwent pioneering surgery to disconnect half of his brain and has been seizure-free for six months. ernie, who was diagnosed with west syndrome at six weeks old, had seizures that affected his development, causing him to forget skills he had learned.his parents, kelly and franck, described him as being like a nine-month-old baby before the operation, as his development was affected. ernie's condition could not be controlled with medication, so doctors operated on him in june 2013 to disconnect the two hemispheres of his brain in a bid to stop his seizures. since then, he has made improvements in his development and is learning new things. the surgery, called a hemispherectomy, involved disconnecting the outer layer of one half of his brain from the other half to prevent the spread of electrical seizures. ernie's parents are grateful for the surgeons who performed the procedure and are looking forward to life without the constant fear of seizures.
2736	west ham co-owners david sullivan and david gold express optimism that the team can become a major force in european football, aiming to win the premier league and champions league within the next five years. after impressive performances under sam allardyce this season, they cite atletico madrid's achievements as inspiration. they lie seventh in the table, four points behind manchester united in fourth, with a target to finish in the champions league spots and win the fa cup. sullivan and gold believe west ham's fanbase and move to the olympic stadium will support this endeavor. they describe their tenure as a roller-coaster ride, but express confidence in the team's future growth.
2737	in a hearing before the house intelligence committee, nsa director gen. keith alexander denied allegations that us intelligence agencies monitored tens of millions of phone calls in france and spain during late 2012. he attributed the claims to misinterpreted documents leaked by edward snowden and asserted that it was actually the french and spanish intelligence services that collected and shared the data. sen. dianne feinstein also defended the us intelligence operations and called for a review of all us spying programs. protesters disrupted the hearing, but were escorted out. european newspapers had previously published allegations of nsa surveillance in these countries, but alexander insisted that the documents in question did not represent us collection of data on european citizens. clapper acknowledged the need for transparency in intelligence gathering, but stressed the importance of foreign intelligence collection for national security. the wall street journal later reported that french and spanish intelligence had indeed shared data with the nsa.
2738	cuba has announced that its citizens will be allowed to stay in hotels previously reserved for foreigners as part of a series of reforms to lift bans on goods and services. this decision comes after the government lifted a ban on cubans owning cell phones last week. although these changes are largely symbolic for most cubans due to high costs, they represent the first tangible reforms under new president raúl castro, who took over from his brother fidel in february. the government also recently approved the sale of computers, microwaves, and dvd players to cubans. the relaxation of these restrictions follows decades of criticism, particularly since the fall of the soviet union in 1991, which left cuba without crucial subsidies and dependent on tourism as its primary source of revenue. at least 10 new hotels will be built in havana between 2008 and 2010. the united states has long sought to isolate cuba's communist government and restricts american travel to the island nation.
2739	a spanish matador, rafael cerro, suffered a goring incident in his backside during a bullfight at the las ventas bullring in madrid, just weeks after returning from a career-threatening injury. he had only recently come back to the sport after a 20cm gash to his stomach in another bullfight, where he was gored in his scrotum and needed surgery. despite his past injuries, cerro was confident about his latest performance but was gored again after being thrown into the air by a bull. another matador, sebastian ritter, also faced injuries during the same event as he was gored twice in the back of his leg, forcing him to leave the ring. in france, the annual running of the bulls event in saint-sever took place, and one runner was gored in the leg after being cornered by a bull. bullfighting and running of the bulls are traditional practices in spain and france, respectively, with the bullfighting season running from march to october. in the case of saint-sever's event, it started in 2003 and covers a distance of 850 meters through the city. while some participants wore traditional white outfits, others opted for bright colors. despite the risks, many continue to participate in these events.
2740	the boarding house where lee harvey oswald stayed before assassinating president john f. kennedy in 1963 is up for sale for $500,000. oswald's room at 1026 north beckley in dallas remains unchanged since his stay, except for a change of sheets. the owner, patricia hall, whose grandmother ran the boarding house, hopes the property will be turned into a museum or a bed and breakfast. oswald rented the 5-by-14 room for three weeks while working at the texas school book depository and paid $8 per week. hall, who was 11 at the time, remembers oswald as an ordinary man. after the assassination, gladys johnson, oswald's landlady, scrubbed his name from the records and destroyed the sign-in sheets out of fear and embarrassment. the family allowed oliver stone to film scenes for his 1991 movie, jfk, in the house. since 2009, hall has opened the doors of the house to the public. recently, oswald's ex-wife, marina oswald porter, is selling his wedding ring at auction to break ties with the past. kennedy's 50th assassination anniversary has been commemorated with various events, including a city of dallas commemoration in dealey plaza.
2741	house republicans plan to vote next week on legislation to eliminate protections for immigrants brought illegally to the u.s. as kids, going beyond initial plans that only targeted executive actions by president barack obama. the bill also aims to shut down a 2012 program and undo directives limiting deportations of people with no significant criminal record. speaker john boehner has unified the gop caucus behind the proposal, but it lacks support from moderates and faces uncertain outcomes in the senate and potential presidential veto. republicans argue for addressing immigration as a whole, while democrats fear it could alienate latino voters in the 2016 election.
2742	a 24-year-old woman, kimberly bradbury, from ilkeston, derbyshire, died after falling ill following a river cruise and a night out with friends. police are investigating whether she had taken the ecstasy-style drug 'dr death' or 'pma' (para-methoxyamphetamine), which is believed to have been linked to at least 11 deaths in the uk. the group had initially gone to a house in ilkeston where kimberly began convulsing and was later pronounced dead in hospital. a 27-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of supplying class a drugs in connection with her death. kimberly had sailed down the river trent on a cruise and had paid for an all-inclusive barbeque and drinks package, along with entry to a nightclub in nottingham. a post-mortem examination is being carried out to determine the cause of her death. pma is sold as a love heart-shaped tablet, often stamped with an 'm' or a mcdonald's-style 'm', and can be up to five times stronger than ecstasy, causing a dangerous rise in body temperature and heart rate. it has also been linked to deaths in canada, norway, and denmark. a spokesman for derbyshire police urged anyone who saw kimberly before her death to come forward with information.
2743	in this article published in 2013 by sam adams, photographer jason hawkes shares his aerial view of orlando's popular theme parks, including seaworld, universal studios, and disney land. the photos showcase the excitement and colors of various attractions, such as leaping killer whales, the vibrant seuss landing, twisting water slides, and thrilling rides. the images give a unique perspective on the parks, providing a bird's eye view of holidaymakers enjoying the attractions and soaking up the sun. some shots show familiar attractions in unexpected ways, like snow-covered rooftops in the wizarding world of harry potter and a giant cobweb of water slides at wet 'n wild. the article mentions that millions of tourists visit the parks annually, and these photos offer a fresh perspective even for regular visitors.
2744	a california man named james lee dimaggio is accused of kidnapping 16-year-old hannah anderson after torturing and killing her mother, christina anderson, and her brother, ethan anderson, in their home. the bodies were discovered on august 4, 2013, during a response to a house fire, and an amber alert was issued the next day for hannah and ethan. investigators believe dimaggio set the house on fire and tortured and killed his best friend's wife and their eight-year-old son, as well as the family dog. warrants released on august 6, 2013, reveal that dimaggio had been in communication with hannah through phone calls and social media, and he may have discussed kidnapping her. on august 10, 2013, dimaggio was shot and killed by an fbi tactical agent during a confrontation in idaho, ending a manhunt that began in california. hannah was rescued safely and neither she nor dimaggio are believed to have been harmed during the confrontation. hannah's mother and brother's autopsy results, including cause of death, have not been officially released, but they were shot at least five times each. warrants were also sought to place tracking devices on various electronic devices belonging to both hannah and dimaggio.
