2745	a former us diplomat, paul bremer, was hit with shoes during a speech at the palace of westminster in london last week, in a repeat of an attack on george w. bush during his visit to iraq in 2008. bremer, who was the us envoy to iraq and in charge of rebuilding the country after the war, ducked as a protester hurled two shoes at him while accusing the us of "f***ing up" iraq and declaring he had a "message from saddam hussein" to deliver. bremer, who has previously faced assassination attempts in iraq, took the incident in stride and joked about the protester's aim. the man was removed from the room, and bremer resumed his speech about defending freedom and democracy in the 21st century. bush was also the victim of a similar attack during his visit to baghdad in 2008. bremer signed one of the shoes thrown at him, and in a statement, he expressed gratitude for living in a country where free speech is respected and recalled the sacrifices made by british and american soldiers to bring the same right to iraqis.
2746	the memorial plaque commemorating two children, tim parry (12) and johnathan ball (3), who were killed by the ira in the 1993 warrington bombings has been stolen by scrap metal thieves. the father of tim parry, colin parry, expressed his disgust and disappointment at the heartless crime, as the plaque could have been sold for as little as £30. this is the latest in a series of abhorrent thefts of memorials, war memorials, and other valuable metals, amounting to £800 million annually. warrington bombings consisted of two attacks in february and march 1993, causing numerous injuries and deaths. the bronze plaque was placed alongside a water feature designed by local schoolchildren in 1996, and colin parry, who received an obe for peace campaigning, feels upset and disgusted by the callous thieves. the stolen plaque reads, "the central water feature is in part a memorial to two local children who died following the terrorist bomb explosion in bridge street in 1993. young people helped the artist with the design work." warrington mps helen jones, labour, and david mowat, conservative, have condemned the theft, and local residents have expressed their disappointment and anger. police are urging scrap metal dealers with information to contact them.
2747	nicole scherzinger and suki waterhouse, known for their toned physiques, follow the viking method, a fitness program inspired by the training regimens and lifestyle of the icelandic people. founded by svava sigbertsdottir from iceland, the method emphasizes intense workouts, both indoors and outdoors, and includes interval training techniques like kickboxing, crawling, and leap frogs. the program is designed to burn fat, increase performance, agility, power, and speed to create a long, lean athletic physique. svava offers an online nine-week intense training program for £200 and an online training portal for £120 a month. the diet aspect focuses on drinking water, healthy protein, good fats, fiber, and fresh vegetables and fruit to help balance hormones and activate fat-burning hormones. nicole and suki are among svava's clients, with nicole having trained with her three to four times a week while filming for x factor.
2748	a man identified as andrew hughes, 24, from falkirk, scotland, kept around 220 rats in cruel and cramped conditions in a wooden rabbit hutch designed for only 32 rodents. the rats were forced to live on top of each other with little light or ventilation, leading to disease and overcrowding. some pregnant females were not separated from other rats, resulting in their young being consumed by other rats and their mothers. the rspca was called in october 2021 when rats swarmed the village of standburn, eventually tracing them back to hughes' shed. the hutch was reportedly infested with faeces and inadequate, leading to the escape of the rats. hughes pleaded guilty to neglecting the animals and using unsuitable accommodations but was only ordered to complete 200 hours of community service. animal welfare officials criticized the court's decision for not banning hughes from owning animals indefinitely. the rats were reportedly bred for sale to snake owners with no interest from hughes in animal welfare.
2749	kathleen price, the girlfriend of murdered vampire gigolo shane chartres-abbott, expressed her lack of trust in the justice system after three men, including mark adrian perry, warren shea, and evangelos goussis, were acquitted in the victorian supreme court for his murder. price recounted the horrific moment chartres-abbott was shot outside their home during his trial in 2003, where he was accused of brutal rape and mutilation of a client. the murder remains a mystery despite a decade-long police investigation, leaving price feeling disillusioned with the legal system, as she believes a key witness in the case was not trustworthy. the trio was released to cheers from their supporters, with perry enjoying his first taste of freedom since 2013 and shea grinning after facing bail since 2013. goussis avoided a third murder conviction. the prosecutor urged the jury to see past the suspects' lack of morals and consider the logical sequence of events, but the jury found them not guilty. the men's acquittal leaves a tarnished reputation for both the victim and the key witness.
2750	in the 2013 sunday times rich list, russian billionaire alisher usmanov, who was born in uzbekistan and is worth £13.3 billion, has been named as britain's richest person. usmanov, 59, owns almost one-third of arsenal football club and is also the owner of a £48 million mansion in london, as well as a former surrey home of oil baron j. paul getty. len blavatnik, who is russian-born and is worth £11 billion, is the second-richest person on the list and the highest riser in wealth terms. the list is dominated by foreign billionaires, with only one british-born person, the duke of westminster, ranked eighth on the list with a fortune of £7.8 billion. overall, the 1,000 richest people in britain have a combined wealth of almost £450 billion, up nearly eight percent on last year. the number of billionaires in the uk has increased tenfold since the first sunday times rich list was published in 1989. the list includes household names such as actors daniel craig and sacha baron cohen, who both appear for the first time, as well as financial expert martin lewis and entrepreneurs like virgin boss richard branson and mashable founder pete cashmore.
2751	daniel agger's future at liverpool is uncertain after the signing of dejan lovren from southampton. brondby and barcelona are interested in signing the danish central defender, who grew up at brondby, with their major shareholder expressing intent to bring him back to the club. barcelona have also been linked with agger, but a deal might depend on their evaluation of the situation. liverpool's glen johnson, whose contract expires next year, could also be on his way out as he may slip down the pecking order with new signings javier manquillo and alberto moreno. agger has been linked with moves to denmark or spain.
2752	shola ameobi, a nigerian international and former newcastle united striker, has signed a one-year contract with second-division turkish club gaziantep buyuksehir belediyespor. ameobi, 32, was a free agent after leaving newcastle, where he made 312 appearances and scored 53 goals during a 14-year career, which was often disrupted by injuries. he scored crucial goals for newcastle in the champions league against barcelona and bayer leverkusen. ameobi's best premier league season saw him score nine goals. he helped newcastle win promotion from the championship in 2010 with 11 goals in 21 appearances but became a fringe player afterward. gaziantep, managed by suat kaya, finished 14th in the tff first league last season. the club aims to build a strong team and has added ameobi to their roster for the upcoming season.
2753	in this story, the author describes their experience testing an electronic "sobriety tag" or transdermal alcohol monitoring device at a london pub. the tag, which is worn around the ankle, is designed to detect alcohol consumption and transmit the results to a central computer. the author, who is not an offender, intentionally breaks the device by drinking beer rapidly to test its limits. the technology works by taking a sample of sweat every half hour and measuring the alcohol content using a fuel cell. the bracelet sends the data to a home computer, which is then downloaded twice a day and transmitted to probation services. thousands of drunken offenders in england and wales may be required to wear these tags under new tory plans as part of "sobriety orders" instead of prison for certain drink-related offenses. the tags were first introduced in the united states in 2007 and have been successful in reducing incidents of drink-driving and jail population. the author, initially skeptical of the device, reflects that it saves taxpayers' money, keeps offenders out of jail, and makes high streets more pleasant.
2754	u.s. news & world report has released its annual hospital rankings for 2014, with mayo clinic in rochester, minnesota, topping the honor roll list. the report focuses on medical centers excelling in treating life-threatening or rare conditions, considering patient survival rates, adequate nursing staff, reputation among specialist physicians, and patient safety, which has more emphasis this year. mayo clinic, massachusetts general hospital, johns hopkins hospital, and cleveland clinic are the top overall hospitals. memorial sloan kettering cancer center, university of texas md anderson cancer center, and mayo clinic rank highest in cancer care, while cleveland clinic, mayo clinic, and new york-presbyterian university hospital lead in cardiology and heart surgery. u.s. news provides comprehensive hospital data, with all rankings available online. for less critical conditions, u.s. news recommends considering the best regional hospitals instead. patients should be aware of potential risks, as an estimated 400,000 deaths occur annually from medical errors in hospitals.
2755	constipation affects a significant number of adults and children, with one expert suggesting that hot beverages may help alleviate symptoms. hot drinks, such as coffee, tea, or even a cup of hot water, can stimulate the bowel and widen blood vessels, aiding digestion. this simple intervention can be effective for constipated individuals, according to a study, and can help improve quality of life and reduce healthcare costs. in addition, physical activity and perineum massage have also been found to be effective in treating constipation. the world gastroenterology organization defines constipation as passing fewer than three bowel movements a week, feeling that a quarter of stools are hard, or experiencing a sense of incomplete evacuation in more than a quarter of movements. most cases of constipation can be treated with diet and lifestyle changes, but certain medications, anxiety, or depression can also be contributing factors.
2756	google, the tech giant, announced a $11.5 million donation to several coalitions working to combat modern-day slavery, making it the largest corporate grant dedicated to the cause. google chose organizations with proven records in combating slavery, including the international justice mission, polaris project, and slavery footprint. the funds will be used to rescue enslaved people, push for better infrastructure and resources for anti-slavery enforcement agencies, raise awareness, and help draft anti-slavery legislation. the international justice mission will lead the u.s. efforts, focusing on improving legislation to protect vulnerable individuals and increasing accountability and transparency in u.s. supply chains. google also plans to launch initiatives to engage ordinary americans in the fight to abolish modern-day slavery through education and advocacy tools. the grant is part of google.org's $40 million in end-of-year giving, bringing its charitable donations to over $100 million in 2011.
2757	the tea industry in the us is experienceing significant growth, with sales increasing 58% from $2.4 billion in 2007 to $3.8 billion in 2013. tea is now the fourth fastest growing beverage category, surpassing a growth rate of 1.9% for coffee over the past decade. retailers, including starbucks and mcdonald's, are expanding their tea offerings to capitalize on the trend, with starbucks recently purchasing tea chain teavana for $620 million and planning to grow it to 1,000 stores. fast food chains are also introducing new iced teas to cater to consumer demand, which has seen a 7.7% increase in sweet tea flavors in 2012 compared to 2010. despite its growth, the tea industry still trails behind coffee, which generated $9.6 billion in wholesale revenue in 2012.
2758	liverpool manager brendan rodgers expressed shock over his team's 3-3 draw with crystal palace and has watched the game three times. the reds were leading 3-0 but allowed palace to stage an incredible comeback. rodgers praised his team's performance this season, despite their title hopes being dashed due to manchester city's two-point lead and superior goal difference. rodgers and his players remain in high spirits and will fight for second place against newcastle, knowing a win might not be enough to take the title. during training, rodgers was seen laughing and joking with raheem sterling and steven gerrard. the team has had a successful season with impressive displays, including a 3-2 victory over city and a thrilling 3-3 draw at palace. rodgers believes a few additions in the summer could help liverpool challenge for the title again.
2759	in eastern afghanistan, a suicide bombing killed four nato service members, identified as czech nationals, and 12 others, including two afghan police officers and 10 civilians, some of whom were children, according to reports. the blast occurred when the soldiers were patrolling in bagram, and the taliban claimed responsibility. additionally, two coalition members were wounded by an afghan police officer in an unrelated incident in afghanistan.
2760	a sydney man, gary kurzer, is suing the australian tax office (ato) for $5.8 million after a seven-year battle over an audit that he claims destroyed his life. mr. kurzer, 62, from bondi, says he lost his business, defaulted on his mortgage, suffered mental health issues, and split from his partner due to the dispute. the controversy began in december 2007 when the ato claimed he and his former partner owed $200,000 in gst and taxes on a $667,000 profit from selling two rental properties in terrigal. mr. kurzer maintained they had actually lost money on the sale. following various appeals and administrative hearings, the ato revised the bill down to just over $8,000. however, the ato then pursued mr. kurzer for additional amounts totaling up to $230,000. mr. kurzer is now suing the tax office for misfeasance and plans to represent himself in the nsw federal court on september 22. the ato has defended itself in the legal proceedings, stating that it does not owe mr. kurzer a duty of care. the case comes amid criticism of the ato's handling of taxpayer disputes, with a report from the inspector-general of taxation revealing that around one-third of the $4.25 billion in penalties imposed by the ato in the past three years were considered unfair and have since been reduced. despite a settlement offer from the ato, mr. kurzer has rejected it, stating that he wishes to take a stand against their "incompetence and bullying." he currently finds himself retirement age and destitute as a result of the ordeal. an ato spokesperson would not comment on the case due to it being before the court.
2761	the world's largest passenger jetliner, the a380 superjumbo manufactured by airbus, has experienced new cracks in its wings, making it a total of four planes affected. airbus maintains that the aircraft are still safe to fly and that these cracks do not affect the operation of the plane. the european aviation safety authority (easa) will issue a bulletin mandating precautionary checks. the cracks were discovered during routine inspections and were found in an l-shaped bracket inside the wings. the a380, with a capacity of 525 seats and a range of up to 9,600 miles, has faced several setbacks since its first delivery in 2007, including engine failures and difficulties due to its massive size. the latest problems are similar to the earlier set of cracks discovered in late january. airbus builds the wings in broughton, north wales, and filton, near bristol, while the rolls-royce trent 900 engines are manufactured in derby. approximately 20,000 british workers depend on the production of the a380.
2762	gia allemand, a bachelor contestant from season 14, is currently in critical condition in university hospital in new orleans following an unexpected serious medical event. she is on life support, and her boyfriend, nba basketball player ryan anderson, is by her side. the details of the medical emergency are unknown, but it was confirmed not to be an adverse reaction. gia, a model and actress, went on to find love with anderson after the bachelor and had previously lost out on the final spot to vienna girardi. she joined the cast of bachelor pad in 2010 but left early in the third episode. gia's representative is asking for privacy during this difficult time, and many of her friends and fans are praying for her recovery, including her ex-boyfriend and bachelor star, jake pavelka.
2763	a 25-year-old surfer named jeff horton from hawaii survived a shark attack by punching the shark in the eye after spotting it under his board in the water. the tiger shark, estimated to be 12 feet long, had missed biting horton's leg initially. he managed to punch it several times before it released him, enabling him to swim back to shore. horton only suffered minor scratches, but the shark left damage on his surfboard. the incident occurred off pila'a beach in kilauea, kauai, where there have been no reported shark attacks this year. horton, a former boxer, said he will continue surfing but won't use the damaged board again. tiger sharks are known for their size and indiscriminate feeding behavior, and they have had no other recorded attacks around kauai this year.
2764	king juan carlos i of spain announced his retirement and handed over the throne to his son, crown prince felipe, in a televised address on monday. the 76-year-old monarch, who has ruled for nearly four decades, cited it being "time to hand over to a new generation" as the reason for his abdication. several monarchs, including queen beatrix of the netherlands and king albert ii of belgium, have also stepped down in recent years. queen beatrix, who ruled for over three decades, assured her people that her retirement did not mean leaving them, as it is a tradition in the netherlands to go out while still in power. belgian king albert ii retired due to concerns about his age and ability to carry out his duties at the age of 79. pope benedict xvi became the first pope in nearly 600 years to resign from the papacy due to his advanced age in 2013. royal commentator and historian richard fitzwilliams described these abdications as "a move to go out while still on top" and not controversial. in qatar, sheikh hamad bin khalifa al thani became the first emir in modern history to willingly cede power to his son, sheikh tamim bin hamad al-thani, in 2013. there is some speculation that a british royal may eventually retire, but it is not a traditional practice in the united kingdom. queen elizabeth ii believes the job of monarchy was given to her by god and cannot be taken away. the last time a british monarch abdicated was in 1936 when king edward viii renounced the throne to marry american divorcee wallis simpson, which caused a huge scandal and negatively impacted the legacy of the monarchy.
2765	north korea's state media accused american journalists laura ling and euna lee of entering the country illegally to record material for a "smear campaign" against north korea. they were sentenced to 12 years of hard labor after a closed-door trial. the journalists, who work for current tv, were arrested in march while reporting on the border between north korea and china. their families urged pyongyang for compassion and clemency, while the us and south korea expressed concern and called for their immediate release. the women have reportedly suffered medical and family hardships during their detention. the united states has no diplomatic relations with north korea, and sweden represents us interests there. no observers were allowed at the trial and the ambassador was only allowed to visit the journalists three times.
2766	a federal judge in the united states has ordered odyssey marine exploration to return $500 million worth of spanish coins it recovered from a shipwreck off the coast of portugal in 2007 to the spanish government within a week. spain claims the cargo, which consists of over 594,000 gold and silver coins, belongs to them based on the ship being a spanish warship sunk in battle. odyssey marine had argued that the wreck was not positively identified as the nuestra senora de las mercedes and that the cargo was from a commercial trade trip. the company spent $2.6 million on salvaging, transporting, storing, and conserving the treasure. the coins are now classified as national heritage by the spanish government and will be displayed in spanish museums. the ruling ends a five-year legal battle and marks a victory for spain in protecting its cultural heritage.
2767	james mcarthur, a central midfielder for crystal palace, received backlash on twitter after complaining about a £38 parking fine. despite earning £40,000 weekly, fans mocked his tight-fistedness and compared it to five minutes of his wages. previously, jamie o'hara, a wolves player, faced similar outrage in 2012 for lamenting his life as a millionaire footballer, longing for the days when he earned just £100 weekly. fans accused him of being out of touch with the struggles of ordinary people, despite the challenges of taxes and mortgages.
2768	rio de janeiro officials are distributing 3 million free condoms during carnival to prevent the spread of hiv and other sexually transmitted diseases. the initiative targets gay men aged 19-24, who are less sensitive to the risks due to a lack of witnessing the impact of the aids epidemic on idols, according to health minister alexandre padilha. along with condoms, officials will give away 330,000 paper fans with std prevention slogans, 55,000 party bags for carrying condoms, and over 160,000 informational pamphlets. similar programs will be in place in sao paulo, salvador, and florianopolis, with testing tents for hiv and hepatitis also available. despite awareness of condoms, 40% of young people in brazil do not use them consistently.
2769	unilever has recalled four batches of lipton milk tea sold in hong kong and macau due to the detection of melamine. the announcement came after british confectioner cadbury recalled all of its chinese-made candy products. over 53,000 children in china have been sickened and four have died due to melamine-contaminated milk. authorities have arrested 40 people in connection with the scandal, including two brothers who could face the death penalty. investigators suspect people watered down milk and added melamine to pass quality checks. melamine can lead to kidney stones, urinary tract ulcers, and eye and skin irritation, among other health issues. american companies king car food industrial company and guanshengyuan have also recalled products containing melamine. the us food and drug administration (fda) advises against consuming certain imported milk tea, coffee and candy. the melamine scandal began earlier this month with contaminated infant formula. chinese authorities have implicated 22 dairy companies in the scandal.
2770	a woman named gemma sheridan from widnes, cheshire, unintentionally became the center of an internet sensation after her name was used in a hoax story about surviving on a deserted island for seven years. the story went viral with claims that she made a giant sos sign on the beach, which was spotted by a 'kid from minnesota on google earth.' however, sheridan revealed that the story was a prank played by her friends to mock her simple lifestyle. she cannot kill a goat or even a spider, and she feels bad for disappointing those who believed the hoax. the story, which was posted on news-hound.org, also contained stolen survival experiences and a doctored image from an amnesty international report on violence in kyrgyzstan. in reality, sheridan has no sailing experience and no plans to recreate her fictional adventure.

2772	leonie blackwell, a 50-year-old australian woman, suffered from human seminal plasma hypersensitivity, an allergic reaction to semen that caused burning, swelling, and pain during sexual intercourse. she discovered her condition at the age of 23 and endured five years of medical consultations before receiving a diagnosis. her illness forced her to end her marriage due to the emotional and physical toll it took on both her and her husband. now, leonie is sharing her story with the aim of raising awareness and offering support to those experiencing similar challenges. she has written a book called "making sense of the insensible: the ten injustices of our life lessons" to help others deal positively with life's hardships. after years of suffering, leonie found relief through reishi mushroom extract, which has since helped her recover completely from her condition. she has been working as a naturopath for 20 years, helping others through her work. the condition affects approximately 12% of women and can present symptoms such as itching, redness, swelling, blistering, pain, hives, bronchial constriction, and, in severe cases, anaphylaxis.
2773	mike tyson, the former world heavyweight champion, was unable to bring himself to cuddle a koala named tracy during a visit to brisbane, australia, due to fear of being scratched or bitten. tyson, who once owned three tigers, cited concerns about the animal's claws and bacteria as reasons for his decision. known for his fierce fighting style in the ring, tyson expressed his message of hope and perseverance during his speaking tour in australia, urging people to not give up despite adversity. tyson's own struggles include being knocked out by buster douglas in 1990, jail time for rape, and financial troubles. his controversial past includes biting evander holyfield's ear during a fight in 1997. despite controversy surrounding his visa, tyson maintains that he has changed and grown since his boxing days.
2774	the uk is facing a potential electricity crisis this winter due to power station closures and a low electricity supply, leading to the introduction of emergency measures. businesses may be compensated to undergo energy rationing and shut down for up to four hours a day, while some closed power stations may be asked to resume operations. the measures, which include bringing back retired power plants and compensating businesses for shutting down, will add only £1 to household bills but could cost tens of millions to implement. the last time the uk faced a severe energy crisis was during the three-day week under prime minister edward heath in the 1970s. the measures are seen as unprecedented and uncertain in cost. demand for energy is expected to increase as the economy recovers.
2775	esa has released stunning images and a video of lightning captured by dutch astronaut andré kuipers while on the international space station (iss) 255 miles above earth. the images, taken in 2012, show a lightning-filled cloud that makes earth look like a toy, with the lights illuminating the swirling motion of the storm. kuipers used a nightpod camera to take the images, which automatically matches the station's movement to reduce blur. the latest pictures come after italian astronaut samantha cristoforetti captured images of tropical cyclone bansi in the indian ocean, showing the calm eye of the storm illuminated by lightning and surrounded by swirling clouds. the storm formed in the southwestern indian ocean on january 11, 2023, and reached category 4 strength before weakening on january 19. cristoforetti's images also revealed a green line of airglow above earth, with part of a russian spacecraft in the frame. both kuipers and cristoforetti used specialized cameras to take the images, which accentuate the contrast and highlight atmospheric phenomena visible from space.
2776	in a case before inner london crown court, symieon robinson-pierre is on trial for owning a pitbull that caused severe injuries to five police officers during a half-hour attack in march 2023. witnesses testified that robinson-pierre and a friend stood by and did nothing while the officers were savagely attacked, urging them to simply knock on the door instead. the powerful dog, which weighed 29kg, mauled the officers, inflicting severe hand, arm, and leg wounds. amateur footage showed police clambering onto walls to escape the crazed animal. despite requests to call the dog off, robinson-pierre allegedly ignored them and went back into the house. the pitbull was eventually killed with four shots from a shotgun to end the attack. the dog attacked officers in the front garden or on the street while they attempted to help their colleagues. robinson-pierre denies four counts of being the owner of a dog that caused injury while it was dangerously out of control in a public place. the trial continues, and officers from the armed police unit were eventually required to kill the dog due to its continued aggression towards the officers.
2777	in the past month, at least 29 tibetans have set themselves on fire in protest against chinese rule in tibet. these individuals have resorted to this drastic measure due to the lack of political and legal avenues for expressing their grievances. the chinese government's response has been to intensify their crackdown, including using collective punishment against communities where protests have taken place, disappearing suspects, and torturing those in detention. thousands of tibetans, including children and the elderly, have engaged in peaceful protests, resulting in shootings, arrests, and disappearances. human rights monitors, foreign journalists, and international diplomats are severely restricted in their ability to access tibet and report on the situation. china has not responded to negotiations and continues to suppress information about the situation. the tibetans' calls for freedom have gone largely unheard by the international community, with many countries turning a blind eye. the us has taken some steps to address the issue, but more action is needed.
2778	katie couric, a tv host and veteran journalist, was surprised by her boyfriend john molner's proposal during a walk on the beach over labor day weekend. the engagement came after two years of dating and following couric's widowhood in 1998. her cushion-cut diamond engagement ring was debuted at the u.s. open matches on september 5, 2013. couric, 56, described the proposal as stealthy and was initially unaware that molner, 50, was planning to propose. they met in early 2012 and went public with their relationship in april of that year. molner, head of mergers and acquisitions at investment firm brown brothers harriman, will become a step-father to couric's two daughters from her first marriage. the happy couple made the engagement public on september 3, 2013, and couric's talk show katie returns for a second season on september 9, 2013.

2780	petra kvitova defeated eugenie bouchard 6-3, 6-0 in the women's wimbledon final 2014, marking the fastest women's wimbledon final in 31 years at just 55 minutes. fans and spectators were left disappointed with the lack of competitiveness in the match, as kvitova dominated with her superior hitting skills. bouchard received a standing ovation despite her defeat, acknowledging kvitova's fantastic play over the past two weeks. the match, lasting only 55 minutes, was over before the presentation ceremony could begin due to the closing of the roof. the men's final between roger federer and novak djokovic was set to follow the women's final, with both players having already completed practice sessions. bouchard and kvitova had once been close friends, but they have had an acrimonious falling out. the royal box was crowded with guests including former tennis champions,england footballer frank lampard, actress keira knightley, and sports minister helen grant.

2782	edinburgh zoo's female giant panda, tian tian, is no longer believed to be pregnant after experts reviewed her behavior and hormone results. the zoo had hoped tian tian might give birth to a cub, boosting crowds and panda numbers. however, it is concluded that she carried a fetus to late term but lost it. tian tian has returned to normal eating and behavior patterns, and her enclosure will remain closed until the end of the week. the royal zoological society of scotland expressed sadness over the loss, which is common for giant pandas. on a positive note, twin giant panda cubs were born at zoo atlanta in the united states in august, conceived through artificial insemination, bringing enthusiasm for panda conservationists and fans.

2788	anders behring breivik, who confessed to killing 77 people in norway last summer, provided chilling details of his gun rampage at his trial on friday. breivik spoke without emotion as he described shooting injured teenagers and driving people into the sea to drown. some survivors and family members of victims wept during the trial. breivik is on trial for voluntary homicide and terror charges related to the july 22 attacks, during which he carried out a bombing in oslo and attacked a youth camp on utoya island. he identified himself as an ultranationalist and claimed he was fighting multiculturalism in norway. breivik claimed to have learned from al-qaeda and be inspired by the oklahoma city and world trade center bombings. he said one person knew about his plans but did not reveal who it was. breivik recounted his arrival on utoya island, where he posed as a police officer before beginning his shooting spree. he described a scene of chaos and randomly targeted young people, sparing one girl and boy he believed were under age. he claimed police did not want him to surrender, so he continued shooting until he was wounded. during the trial, breivik spoke of his motivations and influences, which included online al-qaeda magazines, documentaries on conflicts in iraq and afghanistan, and a period of extensive playing of the video games "modern warfare 2" and "world of warcraft." the trial is expected to last up to 10 weeks. breivik earlier testified that he had hoped to target a journalists' conference and decapitate former prime minister gro harlem brundtland with a knife or bayonet. he planned to film the murder and upload it to the internet. the trial is a high-profile event in norway, with most of the victim's relatives asking that breivik's remarks not be televised. the presiding judge rejected breivik's argument that this was
2789	two rare watercolor paintings created by art director jack martin smith to plan the filming of "the wizard of oz" have surfaced for sale, 75 years after the movie's release. once owned by metro-goldwyn-mayer, the paintings, priced at over $6,500 each, depict scenes of dorothy on the yellow brick road and dorothy with the scarecrow. smith produced these artworks as quick guides for the film crew to visualize characters, costumes, and sets before filming. the paintings are expected to generate significant interest at the heritage auctions in beverly hills on august 23. smith went on to become a renowned art director in hollywood, and after the filming ended, the studio sold the paintings. they turned up at an estate sale in the late 1980s and have been preserved ever since. the beloved "wizard of oz," based on l. frank baum's book, was initially a commercial failure but gained popularity through television reruns.
2790	cnn is proposing a mission to revive the use of the facebook poke feature, which started as a meaningless action but has since been perceived as a bizarre and sometimes creepy tool. in a survey, 55% of respondents expressed disdain for it, but 59% admitted to having used it. the poke has been linked to increased trust and friendship via oxytocin release, and can be used to reconnect with old friends or flirt subtly. despite its sexual connotations, some suggest using alternative methods like throwing a sheep on someone's profile as a more appealing form of flirtation. the authors encourage a poke war to bring back the trend.
2791	designer charanjeet kondal used face morphing technology to create an image predicting the appearance of the royal baby by combining the features of prince william and kate middleton. south africa-based genetic counselor suretha erasamus and graphic artist theuns kruger also revealed their predictions, imagining the baby as a toddler with possible blonde hair and blue eyes, or a teenager with darker features resembling kate. us forensic artist joe mullins also created an image based on recent pictures of the duke and duchess, believing the future monarch to be "adorable" with a strong nose and olive skin like kate, but not likely to have fair skin, blonde hair, and blue eyes like princess diana. jenny chen, a harvard-mit graduate student, consulted by nickolay lamm and graphic designer nikolett meresz, predicted the child will inherit blue eyes and a strong nose from the royal parents. the duke and duchess of cambridge are expecting their baby this week.
2792	a 39-year-old mother, jo thomson, from margate, had an extreme allergic reaction after using the schwarzkopf live color xxl home dye kit in the shade 'cosmic blue'. within minutes of application, her scalp began to burn, and she developed boils all over her body and swelled up to twice its normal size. she was initially diagnosed with a mild allergic reaction and sent home with antibiotics but her condition worsened, leading to her losing her sight, fearing for her life, and being hospitalized for an operation to save her sight, as well as a brain scan and lumbar puncture. her skin has largely healed, but she is now color-blind, scarred, and suffers from anxiety and agoraphobia that makes her unable to leave her house. schwarzkopf urges thomson to contact the firm, prioritizing the safety and compatibility of their cosmetic products.
2793	binky felstead, a star of the uk reality tv show "made in chelsea," attended a bootcamp in ibiza to shed excess pounds before the new season. in one week, she lost a stone by following a strict diet and exercise regimen, which included waking up at 6am for workouts and consuming fewer than 1,000 calories per day. binky, who had gained weight from her past relationships and late-night partying, revealed that her ex-boyfriend had called her a "big whale." she now aims to reach a size 8 and is currently dating a new man, who encourages her to eat larger portions. binky previously consumed large amounts of carbs and took diet pills like forza raspberry ketones to curb cravings. she now avoids kebabs and goes out only once a week. the new season of "made in chelsea" aired on monday, and binky facilitated a conversation between former lovers spencer and lucy.
2794	alfred liggins, ceo of radio one inc. and chairman of tv one llc, notes the diversity among african-american and urban consumers in the us, which includes economic, social, technological, and philosophical differences. a recent study commissioned by radio one revealed that preferences among black americans on how they identify themselves and priorities vary greatly, with 42% preferring to be called black while 44% choose african-american. issues concerning the economy, health care, education, and social issues are now more important than past racial injustice for younger black populations. politicians seeking to reach black america should recognize this diversity and the importance of trust in the community, particularly towards black media, and engage with them through digital platforms and social networking sites.
2795	matthew schrier, a 35-year-old american photographer, was held captive by syrian rebels with al-qaeda links for seven months after being accused of working for the cia. schrier, from syosset, new york, was captured by jabhat al-nusra near aleppo last december during his first trip to a war zone. he was subjected to torture including beatings with a metal cable and electrical shocks, as well as having his bank accounts raided and his family contacted pretending to be him. schrier escaped from a gap in a basement window on july 29. he was held in several different locations, including with a fellow american captive, and was often moved alongside syrians accused of fighting for the government. he was beaten, electrocuted, and coerced into confessing to espionage on film. despite his torture and the frustrations, schrier said there were moments of solace, such as being treated well by his captors upon first arriving at one compound, and being released when they looked at his photographs. schrier's capture and detention highlights the risks facing foreigners, particularly freelance journalists, reporting from syria. it is one of over 15 cases of westerners, mostly journalists, being abducted or disappearing in syria this year.
2796	frans de waal, a primatologist and director of emory university's living links center, believes that morality is not uniquely human and has biological roots. he explores this idea in his book "the bonobo and the atheist." de waal argues that morality is older than religion, and while religion may have played a role in reinforcing moral behaviors, it did not create them. he emphasizes that humans have inherent good qualities, such as empathy and a sense of fairness, which are essential for group survival. empathy is believed to have originated with maternal care, as mammals are sensitive to the emotions of their offspring. primates, like humans, exhibit different cultural behaviors but share common primate psychology that provides the foundation for their moral systems. de waal asserts that the tendency towards moral solutions arises from emotions and feelings rather than logic and reasoning. animals' behaviors offer insights into the origins of human morality but do not provide specific lessons for living a good life.
2797	a mi6 spy, gareth williams, whose body was found in a padlocked holdall in his bath in 2010, had expressed his desire to leave mi6 due to dissatisfaction with the office culture and work politics, according to his family. the 31-year-old, who was a scrupulous risk assessor and a meticulous genius, had applied to return to gchq and had a passion for the arts, sport, and fashion. his body was discovered a week before he was due to leave, and he had failed to attend a meeting at mi6, but no one investigated his absence. his family is seeking answers as to why the alarm was not raised. the inquest, which began on april 23, 2012, heard that no third-party fingerprints or dna were found in his home, fueling speculation about the mysterious circumstances of his death. the inquest is expected to last eight days. the family has also expressed suspicion that a third party may have been present when williams died or broke into his home to destroy evidence. the inquest continues. williams, a mathematics prodigy and code expert, had joined the computer science department at the university of bangor at age 16, was a successful cyclist and fell runner, and had a £20,000 collection of women's designer clothing in his wardrobe. he was caught on cctv in holland park just over a week before his death.
2798	cnn.com has featured vice, an independent media company based in brooklyn, new york, for their unique transparent approach to journalism. at the 2010 special operations forces exhibition (sofex) in jordan, vice journalists attended and reported on the sale of weapons and military equipment by american companies to various nations. the atmosphere was described as insidious but open, with representatives from countries spending millions on heavy munitions. concerns were raised about potential foreign aid funding these transactions and the possibility of payola, with high-ranking soldiers retiring to work for arms companies. the overall theme of the conference was described as blatantly corrupt and absurd.
2799	a recycling bin outside a papa john's restaurant in edinburgh became a "dough monster" after the pizza parlour disposed of a large amount of raw dough. the overflowing bin was captured in a photo and shared on twitter, with some users digitally altering the image. papa john's blamed an inexperienced employee for the incident and implemented procedures to prevent it from happening again. the dough was cleaned up and removed by the restaurant owner and the council. the bin is designed for domestic use and food waste is supposed to be wrapped before being discarded.
2800	a 2009 cable sent by secretary of state hillary clinton to american un missions and embassies worldwide instructed diplomats to collect intelligence, including personal information such as names, addresses, frequent flyer numbers, and biometric data of diplomats. the document, classified as "secret/no foreign," was signed "clinton" and sent to 33 embassies and un mission offices. however, a state department spokesman denied the diplomats were acting as intelligence assets and downplayed the significance of the cable, stating diplomats collect information for policy-making purposes.
2801	a 76-year-old woman named patricia goodband was found dead in a 12ft deep manhole in her buckinghamshire garden. she had been friends with christopher symons for over three decades and had left her two properties and £230,000 in her will to him. the two ran a haulage business together, and symons had once owned the house where goodband lived. in december 2007, symons allegedly attacked goodband, leading to her writing about it in her diary. however, she continued to speak with him afterward, leading the prosecution to believe there was an unusual relationship between them. on december 22, 2012, goodband's body was buried in the manhole, hidden beneath soil, stones, and bags of rubbish. symons is accused of murdering goodband and trying to cover up the crime by making it appear as if she had gone to yorkshire to see her daughter. he is also accused of sending text messages from her phone to confuse investigators. co-defendants jennifer creasey and kathleen adams deny perverting the course of justice. symons denies a single charge of murder, and the trial continues.
2802	according to a report by consumer watchdog which?, couples planning weddings face being charged significantly more for venue hire, photography, and dj services compared to other events. researchers posing as engaged couples and family organizers contacted various businesses in edinburgh, london, and manchester and found that some companies offered higher prices for weddings. for instance, one venue was prepared to charge four times as much for a wedding, while a photographer quoted a lower price for a family reunion yet refused to lower the wedding price. all four djs contacted charged more for wedding bookings, while venue pricing was more inconsistent. the researchers suggested that couples shop around for the best deals and negotiate prices to avoid overpaying, which is a common issue as the average spent on a venue is £2,164, photography £876, and entertainment £682. a survey of 1,000 couples who got married in the past five years revealed that 24% of them felt overcharged by wedding suppliers, with some incurring debt of up to £3,000, and 52% feeling wedding costs had become uncontrollable.
2803	bill clinton, now a doting grandfather, has gushed about his four-month-old granddaughter, charlotte clinton-mezvinsky, calling her "the best thing since sliced bread" during an interview on late night with seth meyers. he joked about not being disciplined by his daughter and impressed by young parents' rules on child-rearing. the clintons, who have long expressed their desire for a grandchild, live near their daughter chelsea and her family in a $10 million apartment in new york city's flatiron district, where charlotte has been growing up. the 5,000-square-foot apartment has four bedrooms, six and a half bathrooms, a home office, and den, with ample natural light and a terrace for the family. bill and hillary have adjusted to their grandparenting roles, remembering they're not raising charlotte but rather appearing when invited and following instructions.
2804	thieves armed with power saws have stolen at least four petroglyphs, some 2 feet wide, from volcanic cliffs in california's sierra nevada, which have been sacred to american indians for thousands of years. the drawings, estimated to be worth only $500 to $1,500 on the illegal art market but priceless to the community, depict images of hunters, animals, and geometric designs. visitors discovered the theft on october 31 and reported it to the bureau of land management (blm). authorities believe the thieves used ladders, electric generators, and power saws to remove the carvings. over 3,500 years old and listed on the national register of historic places, the site is frequented by american indians for education and spiritual connections. the blm is offering a $1,000 reward for information leading to arrests and is urging increased surveillance at the site. damaging or removing petroglyphs can result in a first-time felony conviction, carrying a one-year prison sentence and a $20,000 fine.
2805	haley joel osment, known for his role in the film "the sixth sense," attended the toronto international film festival to promote his new horror movie "tusk," which kicked off the event. the film also stars justin long, johnny depp, and genesis rodriguez and is the first part of kevin smith's "true north trilogy." osment was recently photographed with a mustache and slicked-back hair for his role as canadian fascist leader adrien arcand in the second installment, "yoga hosers." also starring in the film are depp and his daughter, lily-rose depp, as well as smith's daughter, harley quinn smith. the film follows two 15-year-old yoga enthusiasts who team up with depp's character to battle ancient evil. "yoga hosers" is smith's response to fans asking for a comic book movie and is set for release in june.
2806	emil zatopek, a czech athlete, is considered one of the greatest athletes in track and field history. at the 1952 helsinki olympics, he won gold medals in the 5,000 meters, 10,000 meters, and the marathon, making him the only athlete to win the triple in a single olympics. running his first marathon, zatopek set a winning time of 2 hours, 23 minutes, and 2 seconds, breaking three world records in just over a week. his achievements were remarkable, especially considering the training methods of the time and the close proximity of the events. zatopek died in 2000 but is still remembered for his hard training and dedication to the sport. he is survived by his wife, dana zatopkova, who also won a gold medal in the javelin at the helsinki games. the pair is known as the "golden couple" of athletics and had met before any of their awards. zatopek's legacy is celebrated through various initiatives, such as "zatopek's golden week." known for his unique training style, zatopek's life and career have inspired generations of athletes.
2807	a former suffolk policeman, michael upson, 52, could face jail time after being caught with over 600 wild bird eggs and detailed diaries revealing him raiding nests from 1991 to 2001, when it became illegal. officers discovered the eggs, hidden in containers in his attic and airing cupboard, along with false index cards and diaries detailing the thefts. upson admitted possession of 584 wild eggs and 65 schedule one rare bird eggs. diaries indicated that he took over 900 eggs during the period and stole from various species' habitats such as dunwich and westleton heath, lowe stuart pier, north wales, and the new forest. upson collected during a time of marital problems and depression and faced sentencing but was given an adjournment to consider a community order. possible jail time for the ex-policeman for his decades-old egg collection.
2808	the duchess of cambridge, also known as kate middleton, has been named the most stylish woman of 2014 in a poll of 2,000 britons. she beat victoria beckham and cheryl fernandez-versini (cheryl cole) into second and third place, respectively. the duchess is known for her classy and elegant wardrobe, with many of her outfits selling out after public appearances. highlights of her fashion choices this year include a white zimmerman dress in sydney and a dramatic diane von furstenberg number for the royal variety performance. victoria beckham, who is rarely seen looking less than immaculate, came in second place, while katie price was named the least stylish woman due to her garish dress sense. other runners up for the most stylish women included emma watson, angelina jolie, katherine jenkins, and keira knightley. the least stylish women were led by katie price, kim kardashian, and lady gaga.
2809	michelle mone, the entrepreneur behind the ultimo bra brand, is launching a new range of creams called "boobs minus" aimed at helping women reduce the size of their breasts. the cream, which costs £39.50 and contains ingredients like wild indigo and golden chamomile, aims to tone and firm breasts without the need for surgery. the average breast size in the uk has been increasing, with more women opting for reductions in the past few years. the product is set to launch in boots and also includes a "boobs plus" cream to enhance bust size and a "blt" product for the bottom, legs, and tummy. despite her recent personal struggles, including a high-profile divorce, mone remains optimistic about the product and claims it has already resulted in a cup size decrease for some users.
2810	an explosive device was intercepted in flagstaff, arizona, addressed to sheriff joe arpaio of maricopa county. the device was detected during routine mail screening, and a bomb squad team safely neutralized it. authorities are investigating the incident, and initial reports suggest the package may have been damaged in transit and leaked gunpowder. arpaio received numerous threats due to his line of work and controversial immigration policies. he is currently under investigation for mishandling sex-crime cases and has faced criticism for racially profiling latinos and large legal settlements over jail conditions. a recall campaign against him began earlier this year.
2811	scientists have not yet directly observed dark matter, which is believed to make up over 80% of the universe, but a recent discovery of unusual photon emissions from the perseus galaxy cluster and the andromeda galaxy by researchers from leiden university in the netherlands may be a sign of this elusive substance. the emissions could not be explained by known forms of matter and their distribution within the galaxies matches what scientists expect for dark matter, concentrated in the centers and weaker on the edges. the discovery, which may open up new avenues in particle physics and astronomy, will be published in physical review letters.
2812	everton manager roberto martinez acknowledges that romelu lukaku, who has scored only twice since joining everton from chelsea on a permanent deal, cannot be given a rest due to the team's lack of striking options. with arouna kone still recovering from a serious knee injury and samuel eto'o as the primary backup, naismith playing better in a deeper role, and lukaku's involvement in the world cup taking a toll, martinez has had little choice but to keep the club-record signing playing. despite lukaku's poor form and defensive lapses, which have left everton in 17th place in the table, martinez does not plan to reassess the team's season projections. he believes that lukaku needs to continue playing to regain fitness and form.
2813	an 87-year-old woman named muriel thatcher from wolverhampton, england, has visited dudley zoo more than 2,000 times since her first visit in 1937 at the age of 10. she fell in love with the zoo and went as often as she could, even scraping together money as a teenager. muriel has become a beloved visitor and vip at the zoo. as a token of appreciation, she was given a life membership and a bench next to the monkey enclosure. muriel has always been passionate about animals and even adopted 23 of them. during world war ii, she continued to visit the zoo despite the challenges. muriel has fond memories of visiting the zoo during the summer of 1969. she knows all the staff well and enjoys holding smaller animals. the zoo's ceo commented on muriel's loyalty and knowledge of the zoo. muriel stated that she cannot imagine her life without the zoo, as the staff are like family and it's her most magical place.
2814	a 23-year-old man was shot in the back during a drive-by shooting in front of shocked lunchtime shoppers in islington, north london. the incident occurred near the junction of essex road and cross street, and the area was cordoned off and heavily policed. the victim was conscious but suffered "life changing injuries" and was taken to the hospital, while no arrests have been made and the weapon has not been recovered. the incident came just four days after a teenager had his hand almost severed in a machete attack outside a restaurant nearby.
2815	john david baker, a 29-year-old british citizen residing in florida, has been sentenced to 25 years in prison for soliciting child pornography online using a fake persona. baker, who worked as an actor and talent judge, engaged in sexually explicit conversations with minor children he met during auditions. he admitted to trading sexual photographs and even pretended to be a 15-year-old girl to persuade two children to send explicit content. the discovery of chat logs on his computer, along with his confession, led to his arrest in september 2012. baker will also serve a 15-year term of supervised release and register as a sex offender upon completion of his prison sentence.
2816	jennifer marino petitgout, the wife of former new york giants player luke petitgout, has filed for divorce following two alleged assaults by her husband. the most recent incident occurred at a manhattan lounge on june 5, where luke allegedly attacked his wife and another man. he was arrested on misdemeanor assault charges but jenny previously dropped the charges. a year ago, luke was also charged with misdemeanor assault after attacking jenny during their wedding anniversary celebration. jenny has filed for divorce in new jersey and is seeking a permanent restraining order. the couple have three young daughters and live in woodcliff lake, nj. jenny's lawyer, nicole noonan, is prioritizing her client's safety and that of her children. luke reportedly believes the situation will resolve itself and reconcile, but jenny is determined to move on for the sake of her children.
2817	saroo brierley, an indian man who was lost and adoptive australian, recounts in his new book, "a long way home," how he got lost on a train at age four and reunited with his birth mother 25 years later. growing up poor in rural india, saroo often traveled on trains to beg for food with his older brother. in 1982, he accidentally boarded a train that took him a thousand miles away from his hometown in madhya pradesh to calcutta. unable to communicate or remember where he came from, saroo survived on the streets until he was rescued by an orphanage and later adopted by an australian family. despite forgetting the name of his hometown, he never gave up hope of finding his roots. using google earth, saroo identified his home town, ganesh talai, and traveled there in 2012. although he initially found it empty, he was eventually reunited with his mother, fatima. the reunion, which made headlines worldwide, is detailed in his new book.
2818	warren ross, 31, was sentenced to 40 years in jail for brutally murdering his two-year-old stepdaughter tanilla warrick-deaves in 2011. the little girl was subjected to severe corporal punishment, including being forced to run laps, hit with various implements, and thrown under a cold shower, due to her tardiness with toilet training. her mother, donna deaves, watched as ross inflicted the fatal injuries. ross had been in a relationship with tanilla's mother for about two months when he began hurting her. tanilla's father, adrian warrick, was in court and expressed his devastation over her death. ross reportedly showed no remorse and was not handed a life sentence. the murder was ruled not to be premeditated, but the judge expressed that no person with humanity could fail to be moved by it. ross has reportedly been targeted in jail due to his cowardly crime. tanilla's mother was also found guilty of manslaughter and sentenced to at least nine years in jail. the case shocked the australian community due to the horrific details of tanilla's tragic death.
2819	crystal palace, sunderland, and aston villa are interested in signing marseille midfielder morgan amalfitano, who impressed on loan at west brom last season, for £2.5m. palace manager tony pulis watched several players, including cesc fabregas and iker casillas, at the world cup but it's unlikely his transfer budget will allow him to sign many of spain's squad members. amalfitano has also drawn interest from other clubs. palace goalkeeper julian speroni has signed a new 12-month contract to stay at the club, putting an end to speculation about his future after his previous deal expired at the end of the month.
2820	the head of the national institute for health and care excellence (nice), professor david haslam, has urged british patients to adopt more assertive attitudes towards their doctors in order to receive the drugs they are entitled to, citing a "disastrous postcode lottery" of care in the nhs. he made this statement after observing more demanding behavior from american patients during his tenure as a doctor near a u.s. air force base in cambridgeshire. haslam urged patients to see themselves as equal partners with doctors and to take a more active role in understanding their conditions and treatments, emphasizing their legal right to approved nice-approved drugs. he emphasized that patients should not be confrontational but should speak up if they believe they are missing out on crucial treatments. the nhs is currently experiencing a significant disparity in prescription rates for conditions such as kidney cancer and motor neurone disease, according to a recent report. haslam believes that patients play a crucial role in improving the future of the health service and their own health by educating themselves about their treatments.
2821	detective chief inspector heather eastwood, who is married to the former chief constable of cleveland police, sean price, resigned from her post after being arrested on suspicion of being drunk and disorderly in 2011. the incident was referred to the independent police complaints commission (ipcc) last year, but due to her resignation, the misconduct hearing was cancelled, and she will not face any further disciplinary action. in 2011, price was also arrested and later dismissed from his job after being found guilty of gross misconduct for asking a colleague to inquire about a job for the police authority chairman's daughter and lying about it. price had been suspended from his £191,905 job on full pay since his arrest and had planned to appeal against his dismissal and a separate claim of sexual discrimination. however, he reached a settlement with the force over disputed wages during his suspension, and as a result, he dropped the challenges, avoiding a further inquiry into the claims against him. eastwood's resignation comes after the dismissal of cleveland's former deputy chief constable, derek bonnard, for gross misconduct on six counts. bonnard denied any wrongdoing but dropped his appeal and settlement with the force over disputed wages during his suspension.
2822	former fulham midfielder pajtim kasami scored the only goal as olympiacos surprised juventus with a 1-0 victory in the champions league, leaving both teams tied for first place in group a. in group c, bayer leverkusen defeated zenit st. petersburg 2-0 with goals from giulio donati and kyriakos papadopoulos, while monaco drew 0-0 with benfica and took over second place. leverkusen, monaco, and zenit are closely matched, separated by just two points at the midway point.
2823	cheryl cole's controversial orange and purple outfit at the x factor in 2011 started a new fashion trend, which has been adopted by celebrities like nicole scherzinger, kim kardashian, jessica alba, and rihanna. the trend will gain more popularity next year as all london olympics volunteers will wear regal purple and poppy red jackets. the uniforms, designed by a london olympics and adidas team, are a throwback to historic british sporting events and are also modern and sustainable. games makers will receive a full kitbag including a jacket, polo shirt, trousers, trainers, socks, cap, bag, water bottle, and umbrella. technical officials will have formal or casual uniforms depending on their sport, and sustainable materials have been used in the uniform production. volunteers started receiving their uniforms from april 2012.
2824	tens of thousands of commuters faced severe delays or cancellations on the east coast mainline connecting london and edinburgh on december 17, 2012, due to damaged power lines near hitchin. the electric power lines were mysteriously damaged, causing at least 14 "droppers" and contact wires to be broken and damaging passing trains. east coast suspended all trains between london king's cross and peterborough, urging passengers to spend the night in the capital if possible. services were affected on various rail companies, including first capital connect, grand central, and first hull trains. motorists also faced delays due to roadworks on major routes with 98 miles remaining in place for safety reasons. rail chiefs described the issue as a major and massive problem, advising commuters to seek accommodation in london and work through the night to restore services. the repair work was ongoing and expected to continue beyond the holiday period.
2825	three american crew members died and one was injured when a zimbabwean cargo plane crashed during takeoff at shanghai's pudong international airport. the plane, which was bound for harare, zimbabwe, caught fire and four other people on board were seriously injured. the cause of the crash is unknown, and the us national transportation safety board is sending a team to investigate. earlier reports from china's xinhua news agency suggested the plane was bound for kyrgyzstan.
2826	the united states is urging north korea to release an american citizen, aijalon mahli gomes, after reports that he attempted suicide in a north korean prison. swedish diplomats met with gomes, who is serving an eight-year sentence for crossing the north korean border, and his condition remains private. the state department urged north korea to release him on humanitarian grounds. north korean state-run media reported that gomes attempted suicide due to guilt and disappointment over the u.s. government's lack of action for his release. the american was arrested in january and sentenced to eight years of hard labor in april for unspecified "hostile acts." south korean media previously reported that gomes was an english language teacher with strong christian convictions and had taken part in anti-north korean protests in the south. previously, two american journalists, laura ling and euna lee, were released in august after former u.s. president bill clinton intervened on their behalf. another american, robert park, a korean-american christian evangelist, was arrested after entering north korea on christmas day and released in february after expressing regret over his actions.
2827	owen cheshire, a 21-year-old from southampton with an iq of 132 and a large nose that affected his self-confidence, underwent a nose job before graduating to enhance his appearance and boost his confidence in the job market. he had long felt self-conscious about his nose and struggled with low self-esteem, which even led to bullying in his teenage years. despite passing his exams and earning a place in college and university, cheshire's confidence issues hindered his social interactions. he felt that in the competitive job market, his self-doubt would prevent him from being considered for the few available positions. therefore, he researched surgeons and had the procedure done, investing £4,000 in what he saw as an improvement in himself. the results exceeded his expectations, and his newfound confidence led him to enjoy posing for graduation photos and eventually securing a job soon after the surgery. cheshire believes that appearing more attractive has given him a better standing in the job market and feels that his chances are as good as anyone else's. he encourages others who feel the same way about their appearance to consider cosmetic surgery as an investment in themselves.
2828	crystal mangum, a north carolina woman who gained national attention in 2006 when she accused three duke university student-athletes of rape, is now accused of murder. mangum, 32, is charged with murdering her boyfriend, reginald daye, on april 3, and is also facing two felony charges of larceny. prosecutors reassessed the charges against mangum after daye's death. she was previously charged with assault with a deadly weapon with intent to kill in the same incident, and was placed in jail without bond. mangum gained notoriety in 2006 when she claimed she was sexually assaulted by members of the duke lacrosse team during a party. the charges were eventually dropped due to lack of credible evidence. mangum has a history of legal trouble, including an attempted murder charge in 2010 and a child abuse conviction in 2011. in the 2010 case, she accused her boyfriend of attacking her and set fire to his clothes while her children were present.
2829	the virginia supreme court has dismissed a multi-million dollar negligence lawsuit filed by the families of two victims of the 2007 virginia tech mass shooting. the families had argued that the state and university officials should have warned students about potential criminal acts by gunman seung-hui cho after the initial shooting in a dormitory. however, the court ruled that there was no duty for the commonwealth to warn students about third-party criminal actions, as cho was the sole responsible party for the tragedy. the court determined that officials had no reason to believe the shooter had not left the area before the mass shooting in norris hall. the families had been awarded $4 million each, but this was later reduced to $100,000 per family. the ruling was welcomed by virginia attorney general ken cuccinelli, who is the republican nominee for governor, and by virginia tech officials. under state law, there is generally no legal duty to warn or protect from the criminal acts of a third party unless a special relationship exists between the parties. school officials expressed satisfaction with the court's decision, acknowledging the pain and loss experienced by the families but emphasizing that cho's actions were the cause.
2830	a high court judge has ordered scotland yard to reveal the identities of two undercover police officers, jim boyling and bob lambert, who had children with women they deceived while infiltrating environmentalist groups in the 1980s and 1990s. the women are suing for emotional trauma and deceit, claiming they were tricked into forming relationships with the officers who used fake identities. boyling and lambert, however, claim they were genuinely in love. the metropolitan police were initially using their 'neither confirm nor deny' (ncnd) policy to prevent the disclosure of the officers' identities, but the judge issued an ultimatum which forced the met to disclose the names in order to defend against the claims. the met confirmed the identities of the officers in court papers earlier this week. the women's lawyers described the ruling as a "devastating blow" for the met, who had been on notice of the case for three and a half years and refused to engage in meaningful discussions with the claimants.
2831	a nine-year-old girl named yasmin vickery was thrown off a white-knuckle fairground ride named "twister" at hollowell steam rally and heavy horse show in northampton, uk, and smashed into a metal safety barrier. the girl, who was treated for a suspected broken neck but only sustained severe bruising, was riding the ride with her cousin when the safety bar came up, and she was flung out at 50mph. the incident was captured on mobile phone footage, and the ride came to a halt after the emergency button was pressed. yasmin's mother, kim, described the moment as every mother's worst nightmare, and she is now calling for safety checks on the ride. yasmin is still bed-bound and vomiting due to the impact on her kidneys. the incident is currently under investigation by police and the health and safety executive.
2832	the supreme court heard arguments in the case of town of greece v. galloway, which challenges a new york town's practice of opening board meetings with short prayers. justice elena kagan expressed concerns about the court's involvement in such cases, stating that it often makes the problem of church-state relations worse. the court has a history of making unpredictable and unprincipled decisions regarding church-state relations, religious liberty, and the role of faith in public life. some justices suggested that volunteer-led, nonsectarian prayers at town board meetings might be a sensible policy. the court's decision in this case may not provide a clear solution to the complexities of church-state relations but could avoid making things worse. the author emphasizes that our country is a multireligious society and has tried to respect religious faith and protect religious liberty, with a tradition of public acknowledgments of religion not inconsistent with separating church and state.
2833	marius kloppers was born in south africa in 1962 and holds degrees in chemical engineering and materials science. he started his career in petrochemicals and materials research in south africa and later obtained an mba from insead in france. kloppers joined the billiton group in 1993, initially working on building the aluminum business and holding various operating and functional positions. before the merger of bhp and billiton, he served as ceo of samancor manganese and group executive of billiton plc in charge of coal and manganese businesses. during the merger, he played a central role as chief marketing officer and chief commercial officer before being appointed as group president of non-ferrous materials and executive director of bhp billiton limited and bhp billiton plc in 2006. in 2007, he became group executive and ceo of non-ferrous, and has been ceo of bhp billiton since 2007. kloppers now lives in melbourne, australia, with his wife and three children.
2834	five-year-old jake frood from leeds, who has juvenile arthritis and an immune disorder, has become one of the youngest karate black belts in the world. he started practicing martial arts at the age of three after being inspired by "the karate kid" film. despite his health challenges, which include frequent illnesses and joint stiffness, jake completed a demanding challenge to earn his black belt. his mother, kerry frood, believes that martial arts have helped jake overcome his health issues and given him the determination to keep going. jake's mother also mentioned that he has had several illnesses and operations but was always eager to return to training. juvenile arthritis causes joints to become swollen, painful, and stiff before a child turns 16, and treatments include steroids, painkillers, and anti-inflammatory medications. jake, who is only 3ft tall, plans to open his own martial arts school when he grows up.
2835	former da mike nifong was sentenced to one day in jail and held in criminal contempt of court for withholding dna evidence from defense attorneys in the duke lacrosse team rape case. the evidence potentially could have cleared three lacrosse players of sexual assault charges months earlier. nifong was accused of omitting key dna test results from a lab report and colluding with the lab director to produce an incomplete report. he was also accused of misrepresenting the completion of the report in court. the defense team did not learn of the test results until october 2006. nifong testified he had agreed with the lab director not to include the players' dna profiles in the report due to privacy concerns. former district attorney ron stephens testified on nifong's behalf, claiming he always trusted his word. nifong was disbarred by the north carolina state bar in june for violating numerous ethics offenses related to the case. the accusations against the players led to the cancellation of the duke lacrosse team's season and cost coach mike pressler his job, and heightened racial tensions in durham. the three players were initially charged with kidnapping and sexual offense, but all charges were dropped in april 2006 when ag roy cooper determined the case was due to nifong's "rush to accuse."
2836	nine new enormous bronze bells, each named after saints and prominent catholic figures, have arrived at notre dame cathedral in paris to replace the old discordant ones. they will be on display until february 25 and will be hoisted to the iconic twin towers for the first time on march 23. eight bells were cast in a foundry in normandy, france, while the ninth one, named marie, was cast in the netherlands. these bells, along with the oldest surviving bell named emmanuel, will restore the ten-bell harmony originally intended for notre dame's bell towers. the €2 million bell-casting project was funded through donations. the new bells have passed by major landmarks in paris, including the eiffel tower and notre dame's former archbishop, jean-marie lustiger, was honored with a bell named after him. the arrival of the bells marks a historical moment as no such event has occurred since the 18th century, and it will ensure the endurance of the cathedral's sound for centuries to come.
2837	fulham manager felix magath has surprised his players by calling them back for extra training after their relegation from the premier league. magath, who has been pushing his team hard throughout the season, has informed the squad that they will be training until at least the end of the week. fulham's owner, shahid khan, has pledged to invest heavily in the club to help them bounce back to the premier league at the earliest opportunity. lewis holtby, who joined fulham on loan from tottenham earlier in the season, believes that the club's young players can provide the foundation for future success. despite the disappointment of relegation, holtby expressed his love for the club and his desire to give his all for the fans.
