2838	brazil's men's football team advanced to the olympic gold medal match with a 3-0 semifinal win over south korea at the london olympics. striker leandro damiao scored a brace, while defensive midfielder romulo also found the back of the net. mexico secured their spot in the final with a 3-1 victory over japan. in the first half, romulo gave brazil the lead, while damiao sealed the win with two goals. mexico came from behind to defeat japan, with marco fabian and oribe peralta scoring for mexico, and javier cortes adding a late goal. south korea were upset about a penalty call not given against brazil, and japan could not recover from going down early.
2839	the heard app is a new iphone application that records audio on a five-minute loop, allowing users to save and preserve audio they want to keep up to 30 seconds or five minutes after it was originally recorded. despite its practicality, some are skeptical about the app's potential privacy concerns, as it constantly records audio and runs in the background with a red banner notification. the five-minute recording loop sets the app apart from the iphone's native audio recorder, allowing users to save only important clips instead of long recordings. the app costs $1.99 for the full version and has received mixed reactions, with some worrying about the app's legality and potential for misuse in situations where recording people without consent is illegal.
2840	ukrainian authorities have announced the dismantling of an armed group planning to attack the kiev-based government in the eastern city of luhansk. fifteen people were detained and about 300 guns, a grenade launcher, and other weapons were seized. the security service alleges the group was planning an attack on april 10. luhansk, a city with a substantial russian minority near the border with russia, is considered a potential target for russian forces seeking to establish a land bridge to crimea. tensions between ukraine and russia have escalated since ukraine's pro-moscow president was ousted, leading to crimea's annexation by russia and the deployment of tens of thousands of russian troops near ukraine's border. the international community has responded with economic and diplomatic sanctions against russia. us defense secretary chuck hagel warned that "the world will respond" to russia's actions.
2841	the supreme court's decision to reject all pending same-sex marriage cases has brought marriage equality to five new states, but the author expresses concern that the court passed on its core constitutional responsibility to do justice. the court has been criticized for not issuing sweeping rulings on controversial issues in the past, instead allowing laws to stand or be challenged in lower courts. the author argues that the justices' decision to delay action on same-sex marriage is politically motivated, as they are avoiding dealing with an emotionally charged and human issue. the author emphasizes that justices have a duty to do what's right and that the delay in addressing this fundamental constitutional right is creating chaos and hardships for many americans.
2842	sulaiman abu ghait, a 47-year-old core member of al qaeda, travelled to turkey on a forged passport in february 2023, allegedly intending to return to his native kuwait. he was a key spokesperson for al qaeda and was present during osama bin laden's final stand at tora bora in 2001. abu ghait, who is married to one of bin laden's daughters, had been living in loose house arrest in iran since the al qaeda leadership was scattered after 9/11. he was previously stripped of his kuwaiti citizenship. in february 2023, he checked into an upscale hotel in ankara, turkey, but was eventually detained at the us's request due to concerns of provoking a backlash from al qaeda sympathizers. turkey tried to return him to kuwait, but the attempt was rejected, and iran refused to take him back. after several weeks in limbo, he was deported to kuwait, but along the way was handed over to us custody and taken to new york. abu ghait is believed to have been close to al qaeda decision-making following the 9/11 attacks, as evidenced by his appearances in detainee testimony and videos. he developed a reputation as a militant preacher in kuwait in the 1990s, leading to his arrest and eventual recruitment to al qaeda.
2843	alan crickmore, a coroner in gloucestershire, england, was charged with multiple counts of fraud and theft totaling over £2m in march 2013. the solicitors regulation authority had previously closed down his law firm due to alleged irregularities in december 2010.crickmore, who had been an upstanding member of the community for 30 years, had been the coroner for gloucester since 1990 and took on the role of coroner for the cotswolds in 2005. he was also a director of a local catholic independent school, st. edward's.crimes alleged against crickmore include 12 counts of theft and eight counts of fraud. he is set to appear before magistrates in cheltenham on april 9th. crickmore was declared bankrupt and suspended from practising as a solicitor. all his active case files were handed over to other firms. after his arrest, inquests have been conducted by his deputy and two assistants. crickmore became the first coroner to cover the whole of gloucestershire. he was pictured with other legal professionals earlier in his career.
2844	a man named william harrington, 56, bought a used reclining leather armchair from ebay two years ago, which turned out to be from a batch of toxic sofas sold by argos and other companies. the chair was treated with a toxic substance called di-methyl fumarate to prevent mold, but it caused harrington to develop painful sores and an itchy rash all over his body. he was poisoned for two years without knowing the cause, and his skin condition left him embarrassed and unable to go swimming or let customers see his arms and legs. the sofa, which cost £80, was withdrawn from shops after complaints of allergic reactions, but the ebay seller failed to warn harrington of its hazardous nature. harrington's gp had never seen such a rash before, and he was diagnosed with toxic substance exposure. the toxic substance is so potent that those who come into contact with it should wear protective clothing and glasses. argos is now investigating the case and has urged harrington to provide information about the seller so that they can cross-reference it with their records and pursue the investigation further. the toxic sofas, which retailed between £600 and £850, were treated with the toxic substance to prevent mold, but they have caused severe skin reactions in some people. harrington's skin condition is improving now that he has removed the chair from his house.
2845	the boston marathon bombing suspect, dzhokhar tsarnaev, is set to face trial in november 2014, despite objections from his attorneys who requested more time to build a defense. the trial date is earlier than requested by tsarnaev's team, and they argued for more time to examine evidence at the fbi lab and compile information on tsarnaev's family history. the accused, who is currently in custody and faces 30 federal counts including one involving a weapon of mass destruction, could face the death penalty if convicted of the attack which killed three people and injured over 260 others. the hearing was attended by victim marc fucarile who lost his right leg in the bombing and urged the trial to start as soon as possible. the defense complained of slow evidence turnover and the vast amount of work needed to prepare a case. the judge ordered prosecutors to provide the defense with a list of items in the fbi lab by the end of the week and scheduled another court hearing for june 18.
2846	the taliban accused the united states of killing and torturing tens of thousands of afghans in a defiant statement marking the 10th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks, claiming it was used as a pretext for violence against muslims. the statement criticized the war in afghanistan, which has resulted in the loss of nearly 2,700 lives across the coalition, including over 1,700 americans. the taliban, an islamic fundamentalist group mostly composed of afghans from the pashtun ethnic group, have led the insurgency against nato-led forces since their ousting from power in 2001. they previously harbored al-qaeda leader osama bin laden who was suspected of orchestrating the 9/11 attacks. the taliban came to power in afghanistan in the 1990s and provided bin laden with a safe haven from 1996 until his departure in 2001. the un reported that 1,462 civilians had been killed in the first six months of 2021, with 80% of the deaths caused by anti-government insurgents. air strikes caused the most civilian deaths at the hands of international forces, while insurgent attacks, primarily from homemade explosives and suicide attacks, resulted in the majority of civilian fatalities.
2847	a 19-year-old college student, kayla a. bonkowski, who was charged with felony poisoning last november for allegedly spiking her roommate's iced tea with bleach, has been arrested again for making contact with her alleged victim, emily joseph, at a bar in michigan. bonkowski had her $20,000 bail revoked for violating two conditions of her bond - not making any contact with joseph and not entering a drinking establishment. prosecutors claimed bonkowski was at the wayside central bar, staring at her alleged victim, leading to joseph feeling uncomfortable. the incident occurred at their apartment in union township near central michigan university. joseph was hospitalized after drinking the poisoned tea but was later released. bonkowski reportedly admitted to police that she put bleach in the drink due to joseph being "mean." she faces up to 15 years in prison if convicted.
2848	wimbledon tennis final tickets have seen a significant price increase following andy murray's victory at the queen's club last weekend. the highest recorded price for a pair of prime centre court seats is £13,500, while seats further back cost £6,971. due to high demand, loyal fans are willing to pay these exorbitant prices in hopes of seeing murray in the final. andy murray, the british number one and second-ranked player in the world, has been working on his back injury with pilates, a yoga-based discipline that has shown to improve flexibility, strength, and endurance. fans can still attend wimbledon without breaking the bank by purchasing outer-court tickets available at the turnstiles for £12, or £15 for centre court. however, these tickets come with long queues. murray described missing the french open due to his back injury as "really hard," and admitted he has yet to watch his losing match against roger federer in last year's wimbledon final. murray's running partner and fellow tennis player laura robson revealed that she copes with losses by watching sad movies, while praising murray as an "incredible player" and a "funny guy who doesn't take himself too seriously off the court." murray is working hard to prepare for wimbledon this summer despite being short on match practice.
2849	microsoft has reversed its decision to restrict used games on the xbox one console after facing criticism from gamers. the company will no longer implement digital rights management (drm) restrictions and will allow consumers to lend, share, rent, and trade disc-based games as they do with the xbox 360. xbox one games can be played offline, and there will be no regional restrictions or 24-hour connection requirements. microsoft initially planned to offer discounts when trading-in download-only games, but that feature has been scrapped with the reversal of used game policies. microsoft's xbox one goes on sale in november, priced at £429, and features improved voice recognition, gesture controls, and multi-tasking capabilities. after backlash from consumers, sony confirmed that the ps4 will have no restrictions on used game discs.
2850	ronell wilson, a convicted cop killer who fathered a child with a former prison guard, is facing the death penalty again after an appeals court overturned his initial death sentence in 2011. the justice department is pursuing the case despite the high cost to taxpayers. wilson is accused of killing undercover police officers james nemorin and rodney andrews during a drug bust in 2003. at least $1.6 million in taxpayer money has been spent on his defense. the penalty phase of his trial began last week, and jurors have heard evidence about the circumstances of the crime and wilson's past. wilson's lawyers are arguing that he is mentally disabled and should not face the death penalty. it is unclear how much the ongoing proceedings will ultimately cost. critics question the wisdom of continuing the case, given the challenges and expenses associated with securing a federal death sentence in new york. wilson's lawyers have had him examined by several experts in an effort to have him declared ineligible for the death penalty due to mental disability. jury selection took five weeks, and the penalty phase is projected to take at least a month. michael palladino, president of the detectives endowment association, supports the pursuit of the death penalty, citing the egregious nature of the crime and the victims' families' right to justice. the outcome of the trial is expected to be important for both wilson and the justice system.
2851	barcelona is making the most of the off-season by transforming a part of its famous nou camp stadium into a pitch-side restaurant. open to visitors on the stadium tour and those looking for a meal, the camp nou lounge offers a gourmet menu with drink tastings, including five dishes, two desserts, and seven different types of beer. barcelona, despite ending the season without any trophies, remains a popular european soccer team, and this new attraction is expected to draw in fans. the restaurant, open until mid-august, features poses of xavi, edgar ié, gerard piqué, sergi samper, andres iniesta, neymar, lionel messi, jean marie dongou tsafack, and sergio busquets in the new team kit.
2852	in san angelo, texas, the prosecution rested their case in the sexual assault trial of warren jeffs, the leader of the fundamentalist church of jesus christ of latter-day saints, after playing an audiotape allegedly documenting the assault of a 12-year-old girl. the recording contained praying at the beginning and end, with a man identified as jeffs addressing the victim by name. jurors listened intently and reacted emotionally to the recording, with some covering their mouths and wiping tears from their eyes. the tape was seized from jeffs' car during his arrest in 2006. jeffs is charged with two counts of sexual assault on a child and one count of bigamy in connection to a 2008 raid on a ranch where his church operated in eldorado, texas. he is expected to be tried on the bigamy charge later. during tuesday's trial, jurors heard audio recordings of jeffs instructing a 14-year-old victim and his wives on how to sexually please him, which jeffs repeatedly objected to on religious grounds. the judge overruled him, stating that there could be "no claim of privilege, regardless of the religion, with respect to communications directly relevant to sexual assault of a child." prosecutors presented three witnesses on tuesday and are expected to call more during the trial, which started last week and is believed to last two to three weeks. jeffs, who began representing himself on thursday, has made frequent objections on religious grounds throughout the trial. he was on the fbi's 10 most wanted list when he was arrested in 2006 and was previously convicted of being an accomplice to rape in utah but had his convictions overturned on appeal. the texas legal proceedings were set off after about 400 children were taken from the sect's yearning for zion ranch in 2008 due to allegations of sexual abuse but most were returned to their families after the texas supreme court ruled that the
2853	a new prostate cancer drug, cabazitaxel, which can extend the life of men with advanced prostate cancer by an average of three months, has been rejected for use on the nhs in england and wales due to cost concerns. the national institute for health and clinical excellence (nice) stated that the drug, made by sanofi, is not cost-effective despite being fast-tracked in the us as a last chance treatment for prostate cancer sufferers. men in england will have to apply to the cancer drugs fund to access the drug, while those in wales do not have a similar fund. nice admits that the drug works but says it is not value for money due to its side effects and high cost of around £22,000 for a one-off treatment. men whose cancer has progressed despite current treatments have limited options, and cabazitaxel is one of only two licensed drugs available in the uk that offers hope for extra time. nice's decision means that some men may not be able to access the drug in time for it to benefit them, leading to a potential postcode lottery. the independent committee appraising the drug concluded that it would not provide enough health benefit to justify its cost. nhs bodies can make funding decisions locally until nice issues final guidance, and those currently taking the drug can continue treatment. sanofi is disappointed with nice's decision and believes the drug offers significant clinical benefit to meet the needs within the nhs. approximately 35,000 men in the uk are diagnosed with prostate cancer each year, with around 10,000 having locally advanced disease who might be eligible for the drug.
2854	president obama will travel to italy, russia, and ghana this summer. he will attend the g8 summit in l'aquila, italy, from july 8-10, followed by a two-day visit to ghana on july 10-11. in ghana, obama will meet with president john atta mills and discuss various bilateral and regional issues, emphasizing the importance of good governance and civil society. obama will also deliver a speech on u.s.-muslim relations in egypt on june 4. he will visit moscow from july 6-8 at the invitation of russian leader dmitry medvedev. the g8 includes canada, france, germany, italy, japan, russia, england, and the united states.
2855	thibaut pinot, the youngest rider in the tour de france at 22 years old, claimed the eighth stage win for team fdj.fr, holding off a chase from overall leader bradley wiggins and his team sky teammates. wiggins maintained his 10-second lead, with cadel evans finishing second and unable to make up any ground. the stage included a crash that injured spain's olympic road race champion samuel sanchez, who may not compete in the london olympics. pinot credits teammate jeremy roy for helping him during the race. wiggins faced pressure from evans, vincenzo nibali, and others, but survived to maintain his lead, with a chance to build on it in monday's individual time trial. wiggins downplayed the importance of the time trials, stating that the overall win comes down to having strong legs throughout the race.
2856	photographer pete oxford from torquay, devon, was left humiliated when a capuchin monkey pickpocketed him at a market in puerto misahualli, ecuador's amazon rainforest. capuchins, known for their intelligence and mischievous behavior, can be intimidating with their ferocious teeth. one capuchin stole a ball from a group of children playing football to show off their skills, and another monkey climbed on a parked car and gazed at its reflection. oxford found the monkeys' antics to be hilarious despite their thieving ways, and he cherished the photos he took of their unexpected foraging behavior. capuchins are clever and underrated, and their unexpected actions continue to amuse and surprise observers.
2857	hundreds of people are feared dead following landslides in afghanistan's remote, mountainous badakhshan province. a landslide struck the district of argo, where around 300 homes were located, during a wedding ceremony, according to reports. close to 600 people from a nearby village came to help but were also buried when a second landslide occurred. the provincial governor estimated 2,700 people may have died, although the un reported 350 verified deaths and warned the toll could rise. the un spokesman suggested about 700 families lived in the affected area, which was difficult to access due to its remote location and challenging terrain. search and rescue efforts were underway, but conditions were difficult due to deep rubble and the possibility of further landslides. the us has offered assistance in the wake of the disaster. badakhshan is a sparsely populated region, primarily inhabited by a tajik population, with a history of minimal taliban control.
2858	in a major breakthrough, researchers have announced that a hiv vaccine has showed modest but significant results in the world's largest clinical trial ever, involving over 16,000 participants in thailand. those who received a combination of six vaccines over six months were 31% less likely to contract hiv than those on a placebo. this is the first time a hiv vaccine has shown any efficacy since the virus causing aids was discovered in 1986. the study was funded by the nih and the u.s. army, with the military involved due to the risk to service members and the national security threat from hiv. the combination of vaccines targeted strains circulating in thailand, but more research is needed before a safe and effective preventive hiv vaccine can be developed. over 33 million people were living with hiv at the end of 2007, with 2.7 million new infections and nearly 2 million deaths that year, mostly in sub-saharan africa.
2859	a former beauty queen, jamie hilton, who won the title of mrs. idaho in 2009, underwent a life-saving procedure after a near-fatal fishing accident. in june, during a salmon fishing trip with her husband and brother-in-law, hilton lost her footing and fell on a boulder, hitting her head. her family discovered her unconscious, without a pulse, and not breathing. doctors removed a quarter of her skull and kept it in her stomach for six weeks to allow her brain swelling to subside. the procedure, called a hemicraniectomy, enables the skull to be implanted into the abdomen, making it sterile and nourished. after 42 days, hilton's skull was successfully reattached to her head in an operation. grateful for her survival, hilton has returned home and is considered a "walking miracle." she blogged about her progress and expressed her gratitude for the support of her family and well-wishers. the mother-of-three has returned to work and is attempting to clear a large medical bill for her surgery.
2860	the skirball cultural center in los angeles is currently hosting an exhibit celebrating the origins of american superheroes during the great depression and early years of world war ii. many of these iconic characters, including superman, batman, and captain america, were created by primarily jewish artists as a form of escapist entertainment during difficult times. the exhibit features rare original artwork and comics, and includes contributions from comic book pioneer jerry robinson, who created batman's arch-enemy, the joker. the exhibit explores how these costumed heroes came to symbolize the hopes of a nation in crisis and how their villains changed with the times. with the recent success of comic book-based films and the growing popularity of comic books, it appears that superheroes continue to inspire and capture the public's imagination. the exhibit runs through august 14, 2011.
2861	fred talbot, a former television weatherman, is on trial for allegedly coercing schoolboys into participating in a naked "orgy" on a canal boat during a school trip in the 1970s. the witness, who was around 14 at the time, testified that talbot and two adult friends were in charge and took explicit photographs as they watched. one of the boys was then forced to share talbot's bed, and the teacher sexually assaulted him. the alleged incident went on for up to two hours, and talbot told the boy to keep it a secret. the witness had previously complained to police in 1992 but the investigation was closed due to a lack of evidence. talbot denies the allegations and is currently on trial at manchester minshull street crown court.
2862	the tour de france cycling race has seen a tech-infused addition this year with nike's chalkbot - a robot that writes inspirational messages on the race course using water-soluble paint. competitors and cancer survivors receive messages of support from around the world, which are then displayed as large yellow letters for the riders to read during the race. nike ceo derek kent emphasized the long-standing tradition of chalk messages at the tour de france, and how this digital take on it allows global participation. the chalkbot, which looks like a tractor, takes input from text messages and twitter posts, and uses 48 nozzles to write approximately 200 messages per day. the messages are temporary and wash off quickly. the chalkbot campaign ties in with nike's livestrong foundation, which is devoted to cancer research. people can send messages to the chalkbot via twitter or text. the chalkbot costs less than developing a television commercial, but the exact cost was not disclosed. the robot has faced some opposition in certain towns, but has been received positively by most sections of the race course. nathan martin, ceo of mobile software company deeplocal, noted that this trend is part of the shift towards real-world manifestations of online art to make a bigger impact.
2863	nasa released man-made clouds of trimethyl aluminum and lithium vapor into the ionosphere, 60 miles above the earth, as part of the equatorial vortex experiment (evex) in the marshall islands on tuesday. the ionosphere is a crucial layer of charged particles that serves as the medium for high-frequency radio waves, such as gps signals, to travel. by studying the behavior of these clouds, scientists aim to understand and predict electrical storms in the ionosphere that can disrupt satellite communication and gps signals. the ionosphere can be calm or turbulent, and evex will measure events in two separate regions of the equatorial ionosphere to gain insights into their impact on the ionosphere's behavior. preliminary reports indicate that both rockets released their payloads successfully, and all instruments functioned as planned, which could lead to improving space weather forecasts.
2864	a donkey named ant at the sussex horse rescue trust in uckfield, sussex, was spray painted black and white to look like a zebra by unknown vandals. the 30-year-old donkey, who was left confused and irritated by the paint, has since recovered after being cleaned up. another donkey, pedro, had an obscene image painted on him. the incident is being investigated by police, and the rspca has condemned the acts as abusive and not amusing. in 2009, palestinian zoo workers painted two donkeys to look like zebras due to import restrictions.
2865	a previously missing watercolor study by paul cezanne for his masterwork "the card players" has been discovered in the collection of texas medical expert and art collector dr. heinz f. eichenwald. the immaculately preserved work, one of the preparatory sketches for cezanne's five painting series, was last seen in public in 1953 and was presumed lost. the watercolor, expected to sell for over $15 million, will be featured at christie's in new york on may 1. scholars have identified the figure in the image as paulin paulet, a gardener on cezanne's family estate. the study was originally bought by eichenwald's parents and was owned by the late collector, who also trained as a pediatrician and became a renowned specialist, before his death last september at the age of 85. the "card player" series, one of the most influential of the modern era, will be the star lot of a sale of impressionist and modern art at christie's in new york on may 1, 2012. cezanne, a childhood friend of the novelist emile zola and a contemporary of manet, monet, renoir, and degas, is known for his post-impressionist works and his influence on the development of cubism.
2866	george osborne, the uk chancellor, announced the cancellation of a planned 3p rise in fuel duty following pressure from motoring groups, industry leaders, and even some tory mps. the freeze, which will save an average family £76 a year, comes after osborne had previously staged four major budget u-turns on pasties, caravans, charities, and church works. the decision was met with delight from campaigners and motoring groups, butshadow chancellor ed balls labeled it the "fastest u-turn in history." osborne admitted the £550 million in lost revenue would be made up for by departmental spending cuts, stating that fuel is now 10p a litre cheaper than under labour's plans. the decision was reportedly discussed with the coalition's all-powerful "quad" members over a month ago but was only officially announced yesterday. petrol prices have fallen slightly in the past year, but they remain high relative to the cost of oil. the rac foundation and the cbi welcomed the move, with the cbi stating it would be beneficial for families and businesses. conservative mp robert halfon, who had led a campaign for a fuel duty freeze, also welcomed the decision. some tory mps are reportedly angry about having to defend a position their leaders were planning to abandon.
2867	former surrey police chief inspector tanya brookes, 46, convicted of making £11,000 worth of fraud by dishonestly claiming refunds or forging vouchers for discounted items, has been released from prison just four months into her two-and-a-half-year sentence. brookes, who targeted stores like the white company, utilized her police uniform and id as a ploy, and also gained a £6,000 discount for a family holiday by falsely claiming to be a counter-terrorism officer. she served less than a quarter of her time in jail and even kept her generous pension, sparking outrage from surrey police and crime commissioner kevin hurley. judge andrew barnett called her actions a 'disgrace' during her may sentencing.
2868	for centuries, alchemists have sought the philosopher's stone to achieve immortality, but professor shin kubota of kyoto university in japan believes the answer may lie in the sea, specifically with the scarlet jellyfish. kubota, who has studied jellyfish since 1979, observes that they have the ability to rejuvenate when injured. when an adult scarlet jellyfish, or medusa, is damaged, it transforms into a polyp on the ocean floor and regenerates into a new medusa, allowing it to move between adult and infant states every two months. kubota has successfully rejuvenated one jellyfish 12 times in the lab, and he believes the secret to rejuvenation may have applications for human beings, as genetically, jellyfish and humans are not dissimilar. the professor's research has gained international attention, and viewers can learn more about his work and japan's "immortal" jellyfish in the video.
2869	meredith kercher, a british student who was brutally murdered in italy in 2007, has been largely overlooked in the public discourse surrounding the trial, appeal, and retrial of her alleged killers, amanda knox and raffaele sollecito. despite their acquittal in 2011 being overturned in 2013, the pair were convicted again in the retrial held in florence, leaving kercher's family still seeking answers about what happened that fateful night. in a show of determination to keep her memory alive, friends and family of kercher have shared stories of her life, her passions, and her love for travel and study, emphasizing the importance of remembering her for the person she was, not just for the tragic ending to her story.
2870	stephen fry, an actor and presenter, has revealed in his upcoming autobiography "more fool me" that he spent a significant amount of time and money on cocaine use in the past. he has been open about his struggles with mental health issues, including depression and bipolar disorder, and has previously disclosed attempting suicide in 2012. in the book, fry has been candid about his cocaine use, acknowledging the foolishness of his actions. he has a history of bipolar disorder, which is characterized by episodes of mania and depression. the illustration that accompanies the article is a picture of stephen fry from last year. the interview was published in the sunday times anticipating the release of his new book in a few days. fry is well-known for his honesty and openness, and in his previous autobiographies, he has written about his life experiences. he is also the president of mental health charity mind and has spoken publicly about his own struggles with mental health to raise awareness and reduce the stigma associated with it. in the interview withrichard herring for the leicester square theatre podcast, fry discussed his suicide attempt and decided to go public with it to help others dealing with similar issues. he takes medication to manage his bipolar disorder and acknowledged that when unmedicated, he can have manic episodes lasting several weeks, making it difficult for those around him to deal with. fry is a well-known figure in british media, hosting the panel show qi, among other roles. about one in every 100 people are diagnosed with bipolar disorder, and between 25 and 56 percent of sufferers make at least one suicide attempt.
2871	barack obama's high school grades have come under scrutiny after a report suggested he was among a group of low-performing transfer students at columbia university in the early 1980s. the report obtained by breitbart news indicates that obama's average combined score on the scholastic aptitude test (sat) was 1,100, while george w. bush, who is often criticized for his intellectual abilities, scored 1,206 on the same test. although obama went on to earn a prestigious law degree at harvard and teach there, the possibility of having lower high school grades than bush could diminish his image as an intellectual heavyweight. in his autobiography, obama described himself as an indifferent student during his time at occidental college and a "bum" who was notorious for partying. the admission rate for transfer students to columbia in 1981 was significantly lower than in earlier years, possibly due to the college's increased requirement for core curriculum courses and limited financial aid for transfers.
2872	a 31-year-old woman named cher from glasgow underwent painful laser surgery to remove a large skull and angel wings tattoo from her stomach that she had gotten in her twenties, feeling pressured to conform to the stereotypical image of the gay community. regretting her decision a decade later, she shares her story on channel 4's bodyshockers. cher explains that she believed she had to look more masculine by getting the "manly" tattoo to fit in, but now realizes she can be true to herself and no longer feels the need to conform. the surgical removal process was agonizing and will require multiple sessions, but cher hopes others will learn from her experience and think before getting tattoos.
2873	the cnn article emphasizes the historic significance of north korea's cyberattack on sony pictures, which was not just an amusing pop culture event with embarrassing leaks. it was a deliberate assault on american soil, costing millions in direct and reputational damages, as well as threatening physical attacks against moviegoers and theaters. criticisms against movie theaters and the movie industry for not standing up to threats miss the core reality that private companies cannot fight sovereign nations. the us government failed to act effectively for 24 days, leading to a major defeat in cyberwarfare. the attack is a form of warfare instead of intellectual property theft. the us needs to take decisive steps, including going on the offensive against north korea, developing immediate response capabilities, and improving defensive and offensive cybercapabilities. failure to act promptly and effectively could lead to more cyberattacks on american interests and even lives. the article concludes with a call to action, urging readers to join a facebook discussion on the issue.
2874	arsenal's new signing danny welbeck is set to make his debut against manchester city in one of the biggest games of the season, joining former teammate bacary sagna who returns to the emirates stadium. manchester city's frank lampard is also expected to make his debut for his new team. arsene wenger expressed regret over losing sagna and acknowledged the challenges of early kick-offs last season, but insists the losses were due to poor performances and not the timings. city manager manuel pellegrini dismissed the idea that they pursued welbeck instead of him due to financial fair play regulations, and highlighted the importance of having good players regardless of nationality. the game marks the start of important weeks for both teams as they prepare for champions league fixtures against borussia dortmund and bayern munich, respectively.
2875	a new study shows that the life expectancy gap between britain's richest and poorest areas has grown to as much as 13 years. the average life expectancy at birth in the uk is now 82.3 for women and 78.2 for men, but there are significant variations across the country. life expectancy in the south-east is the highest, while the north-west has the lowest. london, in particular, has seen a considerable increase in life expectancy, which is attributed to its affluence and the attraction of healthy and employed individuals. kensington and chelsea have the longest life expectancy, with males expected to live up to 85.1 and females up to 89.8. in contrast, life expectancy in central glasgow is the lowest, with males expected to live 71.6 years and females 78 years. the health gap is due to socio-economic status, health behavior, environmental conditions, and the availability of local services and resources. a tuc general secretary warned that the government's plan to force people to retire later should send a stark warning, as people in deprived areas can expect a decade-shorter retirement and slower life expectancy growth.
2876	twenty-three-year-old rhonda kristen casto's death during a hike in oregon's eagle creek trail, which was ruled an accidental fall six years ago, has been reclassified as a homicide. casto's then-boyfriend, stephen wagner nichols, 40, has been arrested and charged with her murder at san francisco international airport. the arrest came from a secret indictment filed by the grand jury last april. casto, a portland mother, left behind a young daughter, and the circumstances surrounding her death were not clear at the time, only that she fell from a narrow and steep trail that was slippery due to sleet and hail. casto's case was one of four hiking fatalities in the columbia river gorge in 2009. if convicted, nichols could face 25 years to life in prison. details of his whereabouts and activities at the airport at the time of his arrest have not been disclosed.
2877	louis van gaal, the coach of the dutch national team, has expressed concern over the potential impact of extreme heat on both his team and mexico during their world cup last-16 match on sunday. the temperature is expected to reach 35 degrees in fortaleza, and van gaal has warned that dehydration could lead to hallucinations for players if they are not allowed to take water on the field. he also criticized fifa for not allowing both teams to train at the same venue, and urged fifa to ensure that water is readily available during the game for players to prevent dehydration. van gaal's team has trained extensively to prepare for the challenging weather conditions, and both teams will be affected by the high humidity.
2878	katherine jenkins, a welsh classical singer who has performed for the queen, has been seeing adam bidwell, a close friend of prince harry, since they met through mutual friends in london. jenkins, who split from tv presenter gethin jones in 2012, described herself as "beyond broken-hearted" at the time, but is now moving on with the rugby-playing sales manager for financial firm investec. bidwell, 37, is known to be a favored member of prince harry's entourage and was photographed with him in a jacuzzi during his wild trip to las vegas last year. jenkins and bidwell share a love of rugby, food, travel, and music. the relationship is said to be new and the singer is taking it slowly.
2879	vince flynn, bestselling author of political thriller novels featuring counterterrorism operative mitch rapp, died on wednesday at the age of 47 after a long battle with prostate cancer. flynn, who was medically disqualified from becoming a marine corps aviator, wrote his first novel, "term limits," while working as a bartender, and it was originally self-published before gaining popularity. all 14 of his novels, which warned presciently about the rise of islamic radical fundamentalism and terrorism, appeared on the new york times bestseller list. cbs films bought the rights to the mitch rapp character, and flynn had a unique background as a dyslexic writer influenced by ernest hemingway, robert ludlum, tom clancy, j.r.r. tolkien, gore vidal, and john irving. he is survived by his wife and three children.
2880	hundreds of palestinians have been evacuated from their homes in the gaza strip due to heavy flooding caused by rain and drainage issues. the water levels rose by up to 10 feet, forcing nearly 80 families to flee to a nearby un refugee shelter. children and elderly people helped clear the muddy water from the roads using small buckets and horses and carriages were used to transport personal belongings and family members. false accusations spread that israel had intentionally caused the flooding by opening dams, but israel denied this claim. in an unrelated incident, the israeli power company cut electricity in nablus and jenin for owing a large debt. palestinians were forced to cope with the flooding, which is thought to be three feet deep in places, and damage caused by the 2010 and 2013 floods, as well as the aftermath of the 50-day war between israeli and hamas militants. the un reported that over 100,000 palestinians are still homeless and unrwa cannot afford to repair the damaged homes due to lack of funding.
2881	tawny blazejowksi, a 41-year-old woman from st. augustine, florida, is facing a lengthy prison sentence for her obsessive campaign of terror against her ex-boyfriend, joe good, after their relationship ended. blazejowksi launched a series of lies and false accusations against good, leading to his arrest three times and his termination from his job at an insurance company where he had worked for over 24 years. she falsely accused him of domestic abuse, targeted his friends, colleagues, and neighbors with harassing phone calls and anonymous reports of criminal activity, and even sent pornographic photos of good to his employer. despite his attempts to clear his name, investigators and lawyers initially doubted his story. blazejowksi was eventually sentenced to nine years in prison last friday after being charged with three counts of threats for extortion, four counts of aggravated stalking, and one count of false report of abuse against 16 people, ranging from florida to chicago to california. she had documented her crimes in several notebooks, which led to her arrest in 2012. her actions left a lasting impact on good's life, leading to a criminal record despite his innocence.
2882	sir ian botham, a former english cricket player and current sky sports pundit, once discussed with sir richard branson the idea of keeping the ashes urn with the winning team. however, considering the fragility of the original artefact, botham now believes it should remain at lord's. england's team director, andy flower, promised renewed intensity for the sydney test after four losses, but the squad failed to practice net sessions, instead opting for a fielding drill. new managing director paul downton missed an opportunity to assess training intensity after being absent from the scg on wednesday. alastair cook, england's captain, was lauded for his sportsmanship at a reception for both teams at kirribilli house. despite tensions between the teams following england's losses, there was an unexpected friendly atmosphere due to the presence of families and the relationship between darren lehmann and colin graves.
2883	abu ghraib prison in baghdad, iraq, notorious for torture and abuse under saddam hussein and american troops, has reopened under iraqi government control. the ministry of justice has launched a pr campaign, showcasing the revamped prison with improved facilities like water fountains, gardens, and a gym. once holding tens of thousands of prisoners under saddam, abu ghraib gained international infamy when photos surfaced in 2004 of detainees being tortured and abused by us troops. seven soldiers were disciplined, and brig. gen. janis karpinski was demoted. the us denied it was policy to torture, and turned the facility over to the iraqis. human rights organizations claim abuse and torture still occur in iraq's detention facilities, casting doubt on the government's efforts to change the prison's reputation.
2884	a dangerous new "legal high" drug, methoxetamine (mxe or mexxy), is linked to two deaths in leicestershire, uk, and is set to be banned in the near future due to its potentially harmful effects. the powder, available on the internet, is promoted as a safe alternative to ketamine but has no proven safety record. the home office is considering a temporary ban, and experts estimate that over 40 new legal highs appeared in the uk last year, with methoxetamine being the latest addition. despite its legal status, these drugs carry risks of psychosis, liver damage, and even death, and users often pay premium prices for them. the number of legal highs on sale has increased significantly since 2008, with some, like mephedrone (mephedrone or meow meow), already being banned.
2885	jose mourinho has expressed his intention to make significant changes to the chelsea squad, particularly in the attack, as he believes some players lack the required personality to perform in challenging matches against teams like stoke, west bromwich albion, and crystal palace. mourinho's top target is reportedly diego costa of atletico madrid, and existing strikers such as fernando torres, samuel eto'o, demba ba, and ashley cole may be shown the door if they do not meet the manager's expectations. chelsea have struggled to score goals against lesser teams this season and have dropped points to west brom twice. mourinho has written off the barclays premier league title but expects chelsea to give a strong performance against psg in the champions league. ramires will return from suspension for the match, but nemanja matic and mohamed salah remain ineligible. injuries will keep john mikel obi and samuel eto'o out of the squad. chelsea are open to offers for players like david luiz, who mourinho prefers to replace, and fernando torres, whose wages could be a stumbling block for potential suitors.
2886	austin haley, a five-year-old boy who was accidentally shot and killed by a police officer intending to shoot a snake in noble, oklahoma, in 2007, now has the shooter's record expunged. paul bradley rogers, one of the officers involved in the incident, pleaded guilty to second-degree manslaughter and served two and a half years in prison. however, his record has recently been expunged, leaving austin's family horrified. the other officer, robert shawn richardson, also received a five-year deferred sentence. the cleveland county da, greg mashburn, stated that if rogers met all the requirements of his deferred sentence, the case could be updated to say "pled not guilty, case dismissed." austin's father fears rogers may be able to get back into law enforcement and carry a gun again.
2887	two imprisoned men, gary smith and lee newell, both serving life sentences for earlier murders, have been found guilty of the murder of subhan anwar at hmp long lartin in south worcestershire. anwar, a child killer from huddersfield, was serving a life sentence for the murder of his partner's two-year-old daughter, sanam navsarka, in 2009. smith and newell strangled anwar with a pair of tracksuit bottoms on long lartin's delta wing on february 14, 2021. the men, who showed no emotion during their trial, were accused of taking items from anwar's cell following the killing. anwar, 24, had received compensation for a previous assault and had been serving a minimum sentence of 23 years for the brutal murder of his daughter. sanam navsarka had suffered 107 injuries during a month of abuse, including being hit with metal poles and having all four limbs broken, before she died from her injuries when fat deposits from her broken bones entered her bloodstream. anwar met navsarka at the shop where he worked in huddersfield and left his pregnant wife to move in with her soon after. the couple lied to investigators about sanam's death, claiming she had drowned in the bath. anwar was convicted and sentenced to a minimum of 23 years in prison, while navsarka was found guilty of manslaughter and sentenced to nine years. the jurors took around three-and-a-half hours to come to their unanimous decision to convict smith and newell of anwar's murder. following their conviction, the defendants are expected to be sentenced next week.
2888	ten military police officers in brazil are under investigation for the alleged torture, killing, and concealment of a 47-year-old brick layer, amarildo de souza, in july 2014. the incident reportedly involved members of brazil's pacifying police unit, established to quell crime before major international events such as the 2014 world cup and 2016 olympic games. souza was taken to police headquarters in rio de janeiro, but there's no evidence he was ever released. prosecutors believe souza was killed and his body hidden, with two security cameras allegedly turned off or burned. prosecutor homero de freitas intends to file a complaint against all ten accused officers, including a unit commander. the pacifying police unit, created to combat drug trafficking in the rio de janeiro slums, has grown in importance with brazil's international focus.
2889	photographer stephen wilkes is known for his unique and mesmerizing images that capture the transition of iconic cityscapes from day to night in a single composite picture. his collection, entitled "day to night," includes 15 images of famous locations such as times square, central park, the western wall, and the capitol, shot across an entire day and merged to create one seamless image. wilkes spends up to 15 hours shooting and up to 1500 photos to capture the changing light and city atmosphere, and each piece takes around one month to edit. he first came up with the idea of shooting multiple images across a landscape for baz luhrmann's "romeo and juliet" cast picture in 1996 but started using this technique to show the passing of time with the high line in new york in 2009. the collection aims to show the beauty of history, architecture, and the human narrative in cities. some of the notable images include new york's crowded times square transforming into a peaceful night scene, central park's quiet contrast during day and night, and the western wall's significance to jerusalem. wilkes plans to continue expanding his collection with works from cities like chicago, london, and paris.
2890	secretary of state john kerry concluded his middle east trip by announcing that countries both in and outside the region are prepared to provide military assistance against isis, including potential airstrikes. kerry's attempts to build an international coalition have faced criticism, but he admitted on cbs's "face the nation" that airstrikes alone will not defeat isis. the white house strategy includes training and equipping syrian rebel forces, who can count on coalition airpower to support their efforts. republican senator lindsey graham criticized the administration for not committing more troops to the fight, stating that an army is needed to defeat isis and that president obama needs to "rise to the occasion" before it's too late. kerry also sought egypt's support for the coalition effort during his visit. additionally, the article mentions the concern over the increasing number of foreign fighters joining isis ranks.
2891	a four-year-old girl named abbi bennett from bournville, birmingham, has a rare genetic condition called ullrich congenital muscular dystrophy (ucmd), which affects one in a million babies. the condition makes her frail and prone to falling, even with the slightest touch or gust of wind. abbi was diagnosed at the age of two, and it causes muscle weakness, bendiness in the joints, curvature of the spine, and respiratory weakness. abbi's parents, sarah and gary, noticed her differences soon after birth due to her inability to crawl and walk normally. they went to doctors for two years before receiving a diagnosis. abbi can currently walk about 10 meters, but she will eventually become wheelchair-bound as her condition worsens. there is no cure for ucmd, but a clinical trial is ongoing to investigate the disease. sarah and gary have started a charity committee on facebook called abbi’s campaign - 1 in a million to raise awareness and funds for the muscular dystrophy campaign.
2892	raheem sterling's contract negotiations at liverpool have been ongoing for months despite the club offering him a "wonderful deal," according to manager brendan rodgers. the england international has yet to agree to terms, but both rodgers and journalist sami mokbel believe he is likely to sign a new contract due to his enjoyment of playing for liverpool and being a key first-team member. contract negotiations for top players are extensive, and liverpool has put together a substantial offer for sterling, which includes significant wage increases. however, his advisors are seeking the best possible deal, leading to a deadlock. liverpool fans are getting frustrated with the drawn-out negotiations, but rodgers and sterling are the ones focused on resolving the issue. if negotiations fall through, there are several high-profile european clubs that would be interested in signing him, including real madrid, bayern munich, and paris saint-germain. manchester city and chelsea have also taken note of the contract impasse. ultimately, it remains uncertain if or when sterling will make a move, as there are still several months of the season left, and neither he nor liverpool appear eager to part ways.
2893	tegan hancox, a 4-year-old girl from coventry, tragically passed away by hanging herself with a hello kitty bag strap while sleepwalking, an inquest heard. tegan had a history of sleepwalking, inherited possibly from her biological father. on the night of december 15, 2011, tegan's stepfather put her and her younger sister to bed, and they were checked on around 8:00 p.m. however, tegan was found hanging from the top bunk bed at around 7:00 a.m. by her older sister. the bag, which was on the floor the previous night, had been pulled up to the bunk, and there were no signs of foul play or struggle. consultant pediatrician dr. peter sidebotham confirmed the cause of death as hanging and added that sleepwalking could have contributed to the tragic accident. tegan's mother, becky hancox, is now campaigning for changes to be made to the design of children's cabin beds and sew-it-yourself bags to ensure their safety. tegan's family and friends plan to organize events to raise money for her headstone and a family holiday.
2894	a young black man named darrien hunt, who was shot dead by police at a mall in saratoga springs, utah, was remembered at his funeral by 200 friends and family members. hunt, who was carrying a samurai-type sword, was shot after police say he lunged at them.his mother, susana hunt, believes race played a role in her son's death, as the incident occurred just one month after the shooting of unarmed teenager michael brown in ferguson, missouri. at the funeral, family friend andrew scivally described hunt as a gentle arts lover who was trying to become a responsible adult and was participating in an all-night team running race. the shooting has sparked debate and intense emotions, with many questioning whether a young white man carrying a sword would have been perceived as threatening in the same way. the details of the shooting and its circumstances were not mentioned during the funeral, and the investigation is ongoing. hunt's parents did not speak at the service, but his father, curtis hunt, sang a tearful rendition of the song 'my soul hungered.' the incident has raised concerns about appropriate police tactics and the role of race in law enforcement.
2895	wilson raj perumal, a infamous match-fixer from singapore, rose to notoriety by manipulating around 80-100 football matches throughout his career. with ease, he approached officials and referees, boasting of "no barriers" and "no policing whatsoever." perumal's criminal endeavors expanded with the rise of the internet, allowing him to target vulnerable countries and build relationships with football associations. in his first interview, he admitted to fixing matches at the olympics, the world cup qualifiers, and various other international tournaments. despite serving jail times in singapore and finland for football-related offenses, perumal continues to deny any remorse and even released an autobiography, "kelong kings," in 2021. interpol considers perumal part of the world's most notorious match-fixing syndicate, and he claims to have made around $5 million from his illicit activities. however, he lost all of his earnings on gambling. former fifa match-fixing investigator terry steans has praised perumal for providing valuable information to combat match-fixing, but remains concerned about the prevalence and devastating impact on sports' integrity. fifa continues to invest in combatting match-fixing but perumal believes they should allocate more resources to this issue. match-fixing continues to pose a significant threat to the world of sports.
2896	in this cnn article, british writer jonathan lynn recalls his first encounter with margaret thatcher after the success of their bbc comedy series "yes, minister." the show, which aired during thatcher's premiership, depicted the inner workings of the british government and quickly became a hit among politicians and the public. thatcher herself reportedly enjoyed the program and praised it for its accuracy. the unexpected success of the show put lynn and his co-writer, antony jay, in the spotlight, and they were even invited to a party at 10 downing street. however, things took a turn when thatcher's press secretary, bernard ingham, wrote a sketch for her to perform with the actors, which was widely criticized. despite the controversy, the actors received honors for their work on the show. lynn's anecdote offers an interesting insight into thatcher's personality and the role of humor in politics.
2897	real madrid confirmed the signing of portuguese defender fabio coentrao from benfica on a six-year deal, making him the fifth new addition to the team during the off-season. coentrao, who previously played in spain with real zaragoza, expressed his excitement about joining the nine-time european champions and working with head coach jose mourinho. manchester city completed two signings in one week, adding montenegrin defender stefan savic from partizan belgrade on a four-year contract and left-back gael clichy from arsenal. inter milan agreed to pay $17m for 90% of ricardo alvarez's contract from velez sarsfield. scottish champions rangers signed juana manuel ortiz, a former atletico madrid winger, on a three-year deal.
2898	a german shepherd named sam, who was discovered as a stray and had severe arthritis in both elbow joints, was given a second chance at life after a kindness-hearted charity worker paid £11,000 for his surgeries. sam, who is now recovery, has been nicknamed "robo hobo" due to his mechanical joints. the charity, southern counties german shepherd rescue, is run by volunteers who are committed to providing necessary care and treatment for their dogs before considering euthanasia.
2899	us president barack obama is considering airstrikes and humanitarian airdrops to save thousands of iraqi shiite turkmen in amerli, who are at risk of slaughter by the islamic state (isis) fighters. isis has besieged the town since mid-june, and the residents are without power, food, water, and medical services, facing harsh living conditions and the threat of a possible imminent massacre. the united nations estimates that of the besieged population, roughly 10,000 are women and children. america conducted airstrikes near irbil on wednesday, destroying a number of vehicles and a building. isis has committed war crimes and atrocities in their fight in syria, including public executions, torture, and forced child recruitment, among other atrocities. the syrian government has also been accused of using chemical weapons against civilians in april. the us and iraqi officials discussed defense cooperation and regional security issues during general lloyd austin's meeting with top iraqi leaders in baghdad and irbil.
2900	significant progress was reportedly made in geneva towards a nuclear agreement with iran during negotiations that concluded on november 10, and talks are set to resume on november 20. u.s. secretary of state john kerry has spent more time engaging with iranian officials than any other high-level interaction in decades, despite concerns from regional allies and some u.s. legislators. if an agreement can be reached, it would potentially cap iran's nuclear capacity and open it up to un inspections in exchange for limited sanctions relief. remaining disagreements include the status of the arak heavy-water reactor and uranium enrichment processes that could be used to produce nuclear weapons. the administration is pushing for a deal as part of its middle eastern strategy amid growing international conviction that the window of opportunity for a two-state solution in israel and palestine may be closing. obama's increased focus on foreign policy in his second term reflects both the desire to build a legacy and the challenges of achieving domestic policy success and dealing with domestic scandals.
2901	a father in phoenix, arizona, identified as corey mccarthy, has been charged with child abuse after throwing his two-year-old daughter, mia, into a swimming pool as a form of discipline. shocking surveillance footage shows mccarthy taunting his daughter before throwing her into the water. mia was rescued by a woman before she could sink. mccarthy told police hedid it because she had previously dropped a five-week-old puppy in the pool and it died, but authorities deemed the action unreasonable and filed two counts of child abuse. family members reported that mccarthy is in the prison infirmary after being beaten up in jail. the baby's mother, samantha, was visibly upset, stating that mccarthy's actions went beyond a poor decision or mistake, and endangered their child. police emphasized that discipline in arizona must be reasonable and not carried out in anger.
2902	jenson button of mclaren has been given a five-place grid penalty for the japanese grand prix due to a transmission issue that required a new gearbox to be installed in his mp4-27 car. team colleague lewis hamilton also faced a similar issue, but he didn't finish the singapore grand prix, thereby avoiding a penalty. formula one regulations state that a driver must use the same gearbox for five successive races. button, who has won two races this season, will be replaced by sergio perez at mclaren next year as hamilton joins mercedes. six-time world champion fernando alonso leads the championship standings, 29 points ahead of sebastian vettel. button hopes to repeat his victory at last year's suzuka race when the japanese grand prix begins on sunday.
2903	a nurse, gloria dwomoh, from london was sentenced to three years in jail for force-feeding her 10-month-old daughter diamond to death in 2010. dwomoh, who was obsessed with her daughter's weight, used a small milk jug to pour baby rice, african corn porridge, and chicken soup into diamond's mouth, causing food to get into her lungs and develop pneumonia, leading to her death. despite knowing the dangers of this feeding method and warnings from social services, dwomoh continued the practice. at her trial, she insisted the method was common in her home country, ghana, but was found guilty of causing or allowing the child's death. her husband was cleared in the case, which was the first of its kind in the uk. the judge criticized dwomoh for her "determined obsession" and noted that as a trained nurse, she should have known about the importance of the recipient staying in control of their intake.
2904	a lufthansa plane en route to aberdeen from frankfurt was forced to turn back after one of its engines failed mid-air, affecting 89 passengers. the incident occurred over amsterdam shortly after takeoff, with shocked passengers initially believing the plane had hit turbulence. the pilot made an announcement in german before repeating it in english to confirm engine problems. the engine was restarted, but the flight landed back at frankfurt for maintenance checks. passengers were reportedly seen crying upon landing. lufthansa confirmed the engine of the boeing 737-500, number two, inadvertently shut down. flights lh972 and lh973 were canceled as a result, and a larger boeing 737-300 aircraft accommodated passengers on flights to and from aberdeen on monday.
2905	rafael nadal overcame an early scare against martin klizan in the first round of wimbledon, avenging his first ever opening-round exit at a grand slam in 2013. nadal, the second seed and current french open champion, dropped the first set but rallied to win in straight sets. he will face lukas rosol in the second round, who previously eliminated him at the same stage in 2012. roger federer began his campaign with a comfortable straight-sets victory over paolo lorenzi, while stan wawrinka, jo-wilfried tsonga, and kei nishikori also advanced. marion bartoli's younger sister, sabine lisicki, also made it to the second round, defeating julian glushko easily. maria sharapova and serena williams cruised into the second round with straight-sets victories. nadal and federer are two of the six grand slam champions still in contention.
2906	callum lancaster scored a hat-trick of tries on his home debut for hull in their super league loss to warrington wolves. the young winger has now scored eight tries in just four appearances. hull opened the scoring with a penalty from jordan abdull, but warrington took the lead with tries from stefan ratchford and ryan atkins, as well as a number of penalties from chris bridge. despite losing scrum-half richard horne early in the game, hull struggled to contain warrington, who have not lost at the kc stadium since 2007 and maintained their surge up the table with an eighth successive win.
2907	john tull, a father-of-three and survivor of new york's first reported bubonic plague case in over a century, has died at the age of 65 in santa fe, new mexico. the plague, which was diagnosed in 2002, was not connected to his recent death, according to his wife lucinda marker. tull and marker contracted the disease during their vacation in new york, where they experienced flu-like symptoms including fever and swollen lymph nodes. tull's case was severe and he went into a coma, leading to the amputation of both of his feet. the rare cancer diagnosed last month was the cause of his death. the plague outbreak, following the 9/11 terror attacks, caused widespread fear and speculation of bioterrorist activity. both tull and marker were extensively questioned by health officials. the couple had initially contracted the disease in santa fe, where it is endemic, and researchers believe their case helped to understand why the plague persists in the area. despite suffering from the disease and the subsequent amputations, tull maintained a cheerful attitude and was writing a book about their experiences with his wife at the time of his death. tull is survived by three children from two previous marriages. the bubonic plague, caused by the bacteria yersinia pestis, has seen an increase in recorded cases in affluent communities where ground squirrels and woodrats inhabit. the disease, known for its historic association with the medieval period, can cause symptoms such as fever, muscle cramps, and lymph node swelling. without treatment, the plague can kill around two-thirds of infected humans within four days. approximately 11 cases of plague are reported in the us annually, with the majority occurring in new mexico. the most recent major outbreak was in surat, india in 1994, resulting in 52 deaths.
2908	during the "100 deadliest days" between memorial day and labor day, nearly 1,000 people were killed in crashes involving teen drivers in 2012, with over 550 of those fatalities being teens themselves, according to the national highway traffic safety administration. the primary reasons for the increase include teens driving more for recreational purposes and having more passengers in the car. passengers increase the risk of a fatal crash by at least 44%, as they serve as a constant distraction. parents are advised to be aware of state regulations limiting the number of passengers for new drivers and consider the risks associated with night driving. the national safety council recommends parents to drive with their teens to help them get accustomed to having passengers and to discuss the risks and ways to minimize them. other safety tips include teaching teens about the dangers of distracted driving, urging them to avoid night driving, and setting parental controls on their phones.
2909	a survey conducted by recruitment firm robert half found that over half of bosses are less likely to consider applicants who have held multiple jobs within a decade, with 36% admitting they are "very likely" to view such individuals as having a lack of commitment or staying power. the ideal tenure in a job from an employer's perspective is not explicitly stated, but mr. sheridan of robert half suggests that showing progression through promotion and additional responsibilities within a reasonable timeframe is important.
2910	obstetric fistula is a physical injury primarily affecting women in cultures that value their status based on their ability to provide multiple children. it occurs when a woman experiences obstructed labor for several days, leading to tissue death and the creation of a hole, or fistula, between her vagina and bladder or rectum. this condition results in the perpetual leakage of urine and sometimes feces, causing shame and rejection from families and communities. many women with fistulas are unaware of the condition or its treatability due to lack of access to healthcare and communication. in africa, with high rates of pregnancy complications and childbirth-related deaths, an estimated 2 million women have untreated obstetric fistulas. efforts to provide education and awareness, as well as fundraising for fistula repair surgeries, are underway globally, including through the annual international day to end obstetric fistula.
2911	the midterm elections have marked the unofficial start of the 2012 republican presidential race. several potential contenders, including haley barbour, mitt romney, tim pawlenty, and newt gingrich, have been criss-crossing the country to support gop candidates and raise funds. for those considering a run for the white house, the midterms served as a prelude to the upcoming elections, allowing them to build support and demonstrate their commitment to the party. some less established candidates may launch exploratory committees shortly after the midterms, while more prominent ones will likely wait until early next year to make their decisions. the impact of the tea party movement on the republican nomination process is also expected to be felt immediately, with hard-charging tea party candidates having successfully unseated establishment republicans in the primaries and general elections. this may have changed the way the republicans choose their nominee. the race for the republican presidential nomination will see an increase in polling and campaign activity, despite the consensus that it's too soon to start speculating about the 2012 race in earnest after the midterms.
2912	swansea city is set to open contract talks with ki sung-yueng as his current deal expires next season and there is growing interest from aston villa and sunderland.the south korean midfielder, who joined swansea from celtic in 2012 for £5.5 million, has had a mixed spell at the liberty stadium. he impressed during his first season but was later sent out on loan to sunderland, where he excelled. his strong performance at the world cup has increased demand for his services, but swansea manager garry monk wants to keep him. swansea chairman huw jenkins stated earlier this month that they were looking to tie ki up on a long-term contract. ki is currently preparing for the new season with swansea, but pablo hernandez's move to al arabi in qatar has been delayed due to ongoing fee negotiations.
2913	bolton wanderers have issued a statement denying allegations of fraud and perjury made against chairman phil gartside in a private prosecution brought by football agent tony mcgill. the case, which is due to be heard at newcastle magistrates court, relates to the 2007 transfer of gavin mccann from aston villa to bolton, which mcgill alleges he was unfairly excluded from. the club and its officers were cleared of wrongdoing in a prior civil case, and the judge refused mcgill permission to appeal. mcgill has renewed his application to appeal but is not pursuing it against the club or its officers. the club has previously applied to strike out mcgill's claims and was successful in having some dismissed. the remainder of his claims were dismissed in their entirety in a trial in manchester in 2014, and the club is now seeking to recover costs. the club believes the allegations are malicious and vexatious and will defend accordingly.
2914	russian politician alexei pushkov, a member of the russian parliament's foreign affairs committee, mocked the washington navy yard shooting just hours after it happened by using derisive comments about "american exceptionalism." the comments came as the death toll was still rising, and pushkov's previous criticisms of america, including during the edward snowden debacle, were cited as context for his actions. pushkov has a history of making politically divisive comments on the international stage, and his choice of timing and words drew heavy criticism. the shooting resulted in the deaths of 12 people.
2915	actress amanda bynes, a former child star known for her roles in "all that," "what i like about you," and "hairspray," has been making headlines due to a series of bizarre social media posts about her father and her mental state. the 28-year-old performer has faced several legal issues in recent years, including a dui, hit-and-run charges, and a psychiatric hold. bynes first rose to fame as a popular cast member on nickelodeon's "all that" and later starred in movies such as "big fat liar" and "what a girl wants." in 2012, she announced she was retiring from acting and reportedly struggled with erratic behavior, including arrests for dui and hit-and-run, and claims of mental illness. despite these challenges, she has remained in the public eye and has been supported by longtime friend nick cannon. more recently, bynes has been posting controversial tweets and selfies on social media, and has been arrested for dui and suspected shoplifting, leading to concerns about her well-being.
2916	samantha cameron, the prime minister's wife and mother of three, traveled to lebanon on her first solo foreign trip to meet families affected by the crisis in syria. she listened to mothers share heart-wrenching stories of grief and loss, including a girl who witnessed her uncle's murder and helped bring his body indoors, and a mother whose baby was killed by a sniper in front of her other children. the prime minister's wife visited a refugee settlement near the syria border with justin forsyth, ceo of save the children, and spoke out about the horrifying impact of the violence on innocent children. over three million people have fled their homes in syria, and without immediate help, save the children fears for the future of an entire generation. the prince of wales has also made significant donations to the syrian arab red crescent and the british red cross syria crisis appeal.
2917	chinese doctors have diagnosed a 16-year-old boy named lei chung with a new mental illness called porn traumatic stress disorder (ptsd). lei claimed that he was exposed to pornography starting at the age of five, leading to years of distress and negative impacts on his life. his academic performance suffered, and he was unable to find employment due to the constant intrusion of pornographic images in his mind. the situation at home worsened when he asked his father not to watch such material, leading to physical abuse. lei's despair resulted in him attempting suicide. doctors, including dr. yi tu, have confirmed that the boy's exposure to pornographic films at a young age is to blame for his mental health issues. they are raising awareness about the damaging effects of children being exposed to pornography and urging parents to take measures to prevent it.
2918	in a cnn interview, donald sterling, the owner of the los angeles clippers, criticized magic johnson for not doing enough for minorities and being a bad role model due to his hiv-positive status. johnson, who was dragged into the controversy due to sterling's comments about his girlfriend's instagram picture with the basketball legend, responded by saying he's praying for sterling and hopes the nba will quickly force him out. johnson also defended his charity work and expressed disappointment in sterling's lack of knowledge about hiv and aids. sterling had previously apologized for his racist remarks but then attacked johnson during the interview. the nba commissioner offered an apology for johnson being dragged into the situation and reiterated the league's intention to remove sterling from ownership as soon as possible. johnson had initially said he would never attend another clippers game while sterling was owner but later changed his mind and attended a playoff game to support the team and the commissioner's decision.
2919	dubai police have announced the acquisition of a new £170,000 mclaren mp4-12c supercar for their fleet, bringing the total number of high-end patrol vehicles to six, including a lamborghini, aston martin, bentley, ferrari, and chevrolet. the supercars are a part of a government initiative to reduce crime in the city, which has a high rate of traffic incidents resulting in approximately one death every 26 hours. the latest addition, a mclaren with a twin-turbocharged 3.8-litre engine, can reach 207mph and is the first mclaren built since the discontinuation of the f1 in 1998. officers must complete a driving course to operate the vehicles, and some motorists have even asked to be arrested to experience a ride in the exotic patrol cars.
