2920	roma soccer coach luciano spalletti has resigned from his position following the team's poor start to the serie a season, with claudio ranieri taking over as his replacement. spalletti's resignation came after roma's 3-1 home defeat by juventus, and he met with club president rosella sensi to confirm his departure. ranieri, who began his playing career at roma in 1973, has signed a two-year contract and expressed his excitement about returning to the club. spalletti joined roma in 2005 and led the team to two italian cup victories and fierce competition against italian champions inter milan, but last season's sixth-place finish was their worst during his tenure. the club sold midfielder alberto aquilani to liverpool and signed defenders nicolas burdisso from inter milan and marco motta from udinese. roma will compete in europa league's group e alongside fulham, basle, and cska sofia.
2921	archbishop of canterbury justin welby's rediscovery of his christian faith was triggered by the suicide of a teenage boy during his gap year in kenya in 1974, according to a new biography. welby, who was an 18-year-old teaching volunteer at the time, described himself as agnostic before the traumatic incident, but later re-committed himself to christianity. in a letter to his friend, phil kelly, he mentioned feeling much better and having a growing feeling to write to his father about their relationship. the suicide occurred in kiburu, kenya, and welby and kelly had to cut down the teenager's body from a tree. the biography, "justin welby: risk-taker and reconciler," also covers welby's early life and his first year in office, featuring interviews with his friends and family. the book reveals that welby's mother sold a diamond ring to fund his gap year trip to africa. before his religious studies, welby had been a senior oil executive. he suffered the tragic death of his seven-month-old daughter in a car accident in france in 1983, and resigned from the corporate world six years later. the biography, published on june 26, costs £18.99. the author, dr. andrew atherstone, wonders if there is a connection between welby's experience with the suicide and his subsequent re-commitment to christianity.
2922	a brown bear, resembling paddington bear with its size and curiosity, attempted to break into a rural russian railway station. the animal, believed to be from tarbinskaya, krasnoyarsk region, was likely drawn by the smell of food. images show the bear lunging at the windows, trying to claw its way in, despite the windows being protected by metal bars. the bear gave up and left as the sun was setting. russian locals have reported increasing encounters with the bears due to food shortages, with some tourists feeding them. vladimir kozhechkin, a specialist, explained that most bears keep their distance from people but are coming closer due to food scarcity. the first paddington bear story recounts how the bear was found in london's paddington station with a note asking for someone to look after him.
2923	vodafone and other major mobile networks have raised monthly charges on supposedly fixed-price contracts, leading to an estimated £90 million in extra income for the industry, according to a report by sean poulter, consumer affairs editor. ofcom plans to introduce an escape clause that would allow customers to cancel contracts without penalty when face with unexpected increases. new customers would also be given clearer warnings about potential price rises. the changes are expected to come into effect in september, but the networks may resist by increasing monthly charges for new contracts. a 'fixed means fixed' campaign by consumer group which? collected over 38,000 signatures, calling for an outlaw of price rises on supposedly fixed-price deals. ofcom is currently consulting on the proposed rules, and the networks maintain that their terms and conditions are clear to customers.
2924	clive palmer, the mining magnate and politician, donated $26 million of his own money to his palmer united party (pup) in the last financial year, with the majority coming from his mining company mineralogy, nickel and cobalt refinery queensland nickel, palmer leisure australia, and palmer coolum resort. palmer also made a personal donation of over $100,000. the revelation came days after tasmanian senator jacqui lambie resigned from the party, accusing palmer of trying to infiltrate and destroy new political movements. she formally resigned on monday and plans to serve as an independent senator. palmer accused lambie of establishing the australian defence veterans party and causing trouble in pup. the party is still awaiting legal documentation and a declaration of further $6 million in donations under investigation by police. lambie called on prime minister tony abbott to admit he was wrong on adf member payments and believes australians will forgive him. palmer insists lambie will not achieve much as a senator. the pair have not spoken since a row about remembrance day.
2925	steve smith scored his fourth century in the ongoing series against india, equaling the records of don bradman and jacques kallis. smith's score of 117 in the fourth test in sydney put australia in a commanding position to win the series 3-0, with australia declaring at 572 for 7, and india at 71 for 1. new zealand won their series against sri lanka 2-0, with kane williamson scoring 242 and bj watling 142 in a record-breaking sixth-wicket stand of 365. new zealand went on to bowl out sri lanka for 196. england lions and a gauteng invitational xi ended their match in a draw, with jonathan trott scoring an unbeaten 79 for england. despite england declaring with a large lead, they could not force a win, with gauteng finishing at 120 for 8.
2926	syrian government officials will attend the "geneva ii" international conference aimed at ending the violence in syria, according to state-run syrian arab news agency (sana). presidential adviser bouthaina shaaban said the government will attend without preconditions and criticized the opposition coalition as a front for saudi intelligence. the conference, which will not occur before december, aims to implement the peace plan endorsed at geneva i in 2012 and may include representatives from the united nations, russia, and the united states. syrian president bashar al-assad's attendance is not a requirement for the talks. numerous rebel groups have rejected participating, and some demand his removal from power. russia invited opposition leaders to moscow for informal contacts ahead of the conference. meanwhile, a bomb exploded at syria's railway headquarters in damascus, killing at least eight people and wounding others. the conflict in syria, which began in march 2011, has resulted in the death of over 100,000 people, according to un estimates.
2927	john mcafee, the anti-virus software tycoon, arrived in miami on thursday after evading belizean authorities who want to question him about the murder of his neighbor. mcafee, who was characterized as sharply dressed and chatty, made no attempts to hide from the media and even posed for pictures with tourists and signed autographs. he was deported from guatemala after sneaking in illegally from belize and has no money or home in the u.s. he plans to stay in miami until his girlfriend and another woman join him. mcafee has not been charged with a crime and denies any involvement in the murder, claiming authorities in belize extorted money from him and killed his dogs. he admitted to faking a heart attack in guatemala to buy time for his lawyer to file motions preventing his return to belize. mcafee's girlfriend was not with him when he arrived in the u.s. and belizean authorities want to question him about the death of a u.s. expatriate who lived near him on an island off belize's coast. u.s. officials said there was no active arrest warrant for mcafee and he was welcomed warmly by the captain of the plane.
2928	the boy scouts of america (bsa) voted to allow openly gay scouts but not gay leaders in a contentious compromise, with 61% of the national council members approving the proposal. this policy change, set to take effect in january 2014, marks an end to the ban on gay scouts but keeps the ban on gay adult leaders. the decision has stirred mixed reactions, with many conservative organizations expressing their disappointment and threatening to withdraw support and funding. the bsa initiated a widespread survey among members to gather opinions on the membership policy and reported that 61% supported the exclusion of gays. the debate over this issue may continue, as liberal scout leaders and gay-rights groups advocate for the inclusion of gay adults. the change could potentially impact the scouts financially, as some conservative donors might cease their contributions. the bsa has approximately 2.6 million traditional youth members and 1 million adult leaders. there are over 100,000 scouting units in the united states, and 70% of them are chartered by religious institutions, some of which support the ban on gays. the bsa's decision to permit openly gay scouts marks a significant shift in the organization's stance on the issue.
2929	ondrej duda, a legia warsaw midfielder, has criticized celtic, stating that st. patrick's athletic gave his team a tougher test in their recent champions league match. legia warsaw leads 4-1 after the first leg of their playoff round against celtic, with ivica vrdoljak missing two penalties for the polish side. duda is already looking ahead to the potential next opponent, bate borisov, but acknowledges the challenges of playing in edinburgh without the home-field advantage, given that parkhead is being used for the commonwealth games opening ceremony. celtic captain scott brown has insisted that the team will be motivated by the polemic celebrations of legia warsaw players despite the embarrassing loss in the first leg. legia manager henning berg defended the celebrations and acknowledged the importance of the second leg, with nothing yet decided in the tie. efe ambrose was sent off in the match, and both teams prepare for the second leg, with celtic expecting a strong opposition and legia looking to continue their form.
2930	three women, amanda berry (27), georgina dejesus (23), and michelle knight (32), were rescued from a house in cleveland, ohio on monday after berry called out for help. berry had been missing since 2003 when she was 16, dejesus since 2004 when she was 14, and little is known about knight's disappearance in 2002 when she was 21. the women were seen in the hospital's emergency room on monday and released on tuesday. berry's phone call to her grandmother, fern gentry, confirmed her identity, and she was reunited with her family. dejesus's family was also elated to see her safe and well. little information has been reported about knight's condition or her whereabouts before the discovery. the three women spent roughly a decade in captivity in the same house.
2931	michael phelps, a record-breaking olympic swimmer, was suspended from competitive swimming for three months and lost his sponsorship deal with kellogg co. after a photo of him smoking from a bong was published. usa swimming outlined that no anti-doping rules were violated but suspended him to send a strong message due to his disappointment as a role model. kellogg ended its contract with phelps, stating his behavior was inconsistent with the company's image. phelps apologized for his "regrettable behavior" and took responsibility for his actions, which also included a 2004 dui arrest.
2932	a painting by dutch artist vincent van gogh, previously believed to be a forgery, has been authenticated by the van gogh museum in amsterdam. the painting, titled "sunset at montmajour," is the first full-size van gogh canvas discovered in 85 years. van gogh, who took his own life at the age of 37 in 1890, left a legacy of over 800 canvases, 1,000 drawings, and watercolors. despite his struggles with depression, mental health issues, and financial hardships, van gogh's art has endured, and his brilliance has proven to be immortal. art, in any form, is like sending messages out in bottles, and the artists who create them leave a lasting impact on the world. even as they pass on, their work continues to inspire and inform generations to come. van gogh's "sunset at montmajour" will continue to be studied and discussed for centuries, and his artistic choices will continue to reveal insights into the man he was. phil everly spoke about feeling solid and outlasted by an antebellum house he had renovated, but it is ultimately his music that will endure and outlast both him and the house.
2933	a pastor, bishop bobby davis, confessed to his parishioners at the miracle faith world outreach church in bridgeport, connecticut, about having an affair with someone "long ago." after seeking forgiveness from the congregation, davis, 72, collapsed and died from a suspected heart attack, according to witnesses. the cause of death is still being determined by the medical examiner, and a detective has been assigned to investigate the case. davis set up the church with his wife, christine, in 1967, and they have six children and eight grandchildren together. davis, a certified marriage and family therapist, served as the pastor since its inception. the congregation responded mostly with love and forgiveness after his confession.
2934	prime minister david cameron visited st. george's park on may 29, 2014, to wish england's soccer team and manager roy hodgson good luck before their final warm-up match against peru at wembley. cameron chatted with hodgson, captain steven gerrard, and frank lampard during training and watched shooting practice with wayne rooney, adam lallana, and jordan henderson. he also met representatives from the charity tickets for troops and answered questions from children on the indoor pitch. cameron expressed his favorite players and world cup predictions before the team departed for their final preparations in miami before the world cup start on june 14 against italy.
2935	a jury ordered robin thicke and pharrell williams to pay $7.4 million in damages and profits for allegedly copying marvin gaye's 1977 hit "got to give it up" in their song "blurred lines." this case brought music copyright into the spotlight, but it's not the first time similar allegations have emerged. recently, tom petty and jeff lynne were given songwriting credits for sam smith's hit "stay with me" after the team noticed similarities to their 1989 song "i won't back down." however, those involved in producing "stay with me" claimed they were unfamiliar with the older tune. music infringement is a complex issue, with plaintiffs required to prove both substantial similarity between songs and that the defendant had access to the original work. in the digital age, access is easier to prove than before, but the line between inspiration and plagiarism remains blurred. musical appreciation is subjective, making music comparison a challenging and often debated topic. cases of alleged song theft have economic implications, as copyright protection rewards creators withlimited monopolies and can lead to major damages if disputes are not resolved amicably. in the sam smith-tom petty case, the parties settled the matter without involving lawyers, which could impact the legal industry.
2936	gareth southgate, thecurrent england u21 manager, will not be celebrating an anniversary on october 20, 2009, as it marks the day he was sacked by middlesbrough. the memory of that experience still affects him, despite recognizing that it ultimately helped his career development. southgate was let go after middlesbrough's 2-0 win over derby, and when he entered the boardroom to face the look of disappointment on steve gibson's face, he knew his time with the club had come to an end. after the shock of being sacked, southgate had a difficult time adjusting. he tried to stay busy by working out and attending local coffee mornings but struggled to find employment. eventually, he realized that the only way to get back into football was through education. he began working for itv, which gave him access to various football matches and opportunities for further study. southgate eventually received a call from sir trevor brooking to join england’s u21 squad, which marked the start of his successful tenure in england football. throughout his career, southgate has learned the value of leadership, management and empathy towards his players. he acknowledges that losing a job, no matter the circumstance, is a difficult experience. however, he has used this hardship to strengthen himself and develop his coaching abilities, leading to his current role and positive impact on the u21 team. as england prepares for the euro championship play-off with croatia, southgate remains focused on helping his team progress, regardless of the outcome.
2937	three unclaimed suitcases filled with 1.3 tons of cocaine, worth approximately $270 million, were discovered on an air france flight from caracas, venezuela to paris on september 11. french authorities took several people into custody, and venezuela detained three members of its national guard in connection with the incident. spanish police also reported finding cocaine hidden in a british woman's breast implants during a separate investigation. the origins of the guardsmen's alleged involvement remains unclear. both french and venezuelan authorities are investigating the drug trafficking cases, emphasizing the need for international cooperation in combating traffickers.
2938	xherdan shaqiri, nicknamed the "alpine messi," is a swiss soccer player who has expressed his desire to leave bayern munich due to limited playing time. he has been angling for a move, possibly to the premier league and liverpool, due to his dissatisfaction with being an understudy to arjen robben and franck ribery. in the ongoing world cup, switzerland faces argentina, and shaqiri is eager to display his skills against messi. argentina's defensive frailties, particularly their lack of pace among defenders, make them vulnerable to shaqiri's speed. the swiss team has qualified for the knockout phase and will face argentina in the last-16 match. messi is crucial to argentina's team, and there is uncertainty about their approach to the game, as they may switch to a more defensive formation to offer their back four more protection. sabella, the argentine manager, has not decided on his starting line-up yet and is keeping it secret.
2939	in the sky sports victory shield match between wales and england, liam angel scored the winning goal for wales in a scrappy contest at bangor city. the goal came during a goalmouth scramble after england keeper taye ashby-hammond failed to clear danger from a corner. wales controlled possession, but england struggled to find a way back into the game due to gale-force winds and heavy rain. england's dujon sterling had the best chance for england, but his free-kick went over the bar. wales' ben woodburn hit the target but was ruled offside. england had a let-off before half-time when their keeper parried the ball to keanan bennetts, who shot wide from close range. england brought on mackenzie heaney, sadou diallo, and okera simmonds in search of an equalizer but failed to score. wales' steves cooper celebrated his winning start as england coach. conditions worsened in the second half, making it difficult for both teams to gain a foothold. england now faces northern ireland in dungannon and scotland at huish park.
2940	paul gascoigne, the troubled former england footballer, was seen cleaning the windows of his top-floor apartment in bournemouth while balancing on a ledge, an onlooker reported. gascoigne, 46, who recently pleaded guilty to assaulting a security guard at a railway station, has been recovering at the flat after a series of alcohol-related incidents. the onlooker noted that gascoigne looked much leaner and healthier than in the past, suggesting he has been making progress during his rehabilitation for alcohol addiction. gascoigne has a history of alcoholism and was fined £1,000 in july for assault and drunk and disorderly charges following an incident at a railway station in hertfordshire.
2941	jason collins, the first openly gay player in america's major sports leagues, met with the family of matthew shepard, a gay college student who was murdered in wyoming in 1998, before the brooklyn nets game against the denver nuggets on thursday. collins, who has worn shepard's number 98 in his honor since his college days, spoke with shepard's parents, dennis and judy, during the game. shepard was attacked near laramie, wyoming, in 1998, tied to a fence, and left to die. he died six days later in a colorado hospital. the murder horrified the nation, and shepard's mother, judy, has become a vocal advocate for lgbt rights in the years following her son's death. collinals said it was an "honor and pleasure" to meet the shepards and hoped it would inspire others to move forward. collings wore number 98 for the boston celtics and the washington wizards before coming out last spring, and the jersey has been a big seller on nbastore.com. collings was a free agent when he came out last season, but the nets signed him in april. he played 12 minutes against the los angeles lakers and seven minutes against the portland trail blazers in his two games with the team. collings expressed no concern about how he might be received in more conservative cities and only focused on conducting himself professionally on and off the court. nuggets coach brian shaw called collins a pioneer for coming out.
2942	a six-story townhouse in manhattan, new york, with six bedrooms, seven bathrooms, a lap pool, a three-car garage, and various luxurious amenities has been listed for sale for $48 million. the property, previously owned by financier mark zittman and his wife noelle, is currently the most expensive townhouse listing downtown. it features an impressive 65 feet width, an art studio, two laundry rooms, an elevator, and a housekeeper's suite. the townhouse includes a heated swimming pool, gym, and powder room on the sixth floor, as well as a media room, playroom, and a master bedroom suite. the mansion was purchased by the zittmans for $24.065 million in 2010 and is now on the market due to rising interest in the area. although it has large windows, security systems, and ample parking space, residents may need to share views with other buildings or give up some privacy. the property is described as a one-of-a-kind property of rare distinction and is currently being sold by leonard steinberg of urban compass and darren sukenik of douglas elliman real estate.
2943	toni mchugh, the mistress of convicted wife-killer gerard baden-clay, revealed in an interview with women's weekly that she had hoped for a future with him and his family, including his wife allison, before the murder. mchugh, who began an affair with baden-clay in 2008 and continued until his arrest in 2012, expressed remorse towards allison's children and apologized for her involvement in the case. baden-clay was found guilty of killing and disposing of allison's body under the kholo creek bridge in brisbane. mchugh described her relationship with baden-clay as loving and thought he was the only man she had ever seen him with besides his wife. however, she became furious when she discovered he had been having affairs with other women. mchugh claimed that baden-clay had deceived her about his infidelities and admitted to having sexual encounters with other women to ensure the authenticity of their relationship. she stated that she didn't intend to harm allison and was devastated when she first learned of her disappearance. baden-clay attempted to hide his role in allison's murder by pretending to search for her and tampered with evidence by disguising her fingerprints found on his face with a razor blade.
2944	olympic and commonwealth gold medalist greg rutherford won the european long jump championship title with a leap of 8.29m in zurich. two years after his london triumph, rutherford overcame injury and secured another gold medal, silencing critics who suggested he was a fluke. pregnant girlfriend susie verrill is due in the same week, and rutherford is also the british record holder for long jump after jumping 8.51m in april. britain had an impressive final day at the european championships with gold medals for mo farah in the 5000m and adam gemili in the 4x100m relay. jj jegede and chris tomlinson finished 9th and 11th in the long jump final, respectively. rutherford came to fame in 2012 when he won gold in the long jump at the london olympics.
2945	researchers at the university of bonn have discovered a new signalling pathway, involving the molecule adenosine and its receptor a2a, that can turn white fat cells into brown ones, which convert excess energy into heat instead of creating flab. previous research showed that white fat cells are responsible for muffin tops and overall flab, while brown fat cells help burn excess energy. the team, led by professor alexander pfeifer, found that brown fat cells respond to adenosine by activating fat burning. by transferring the a2a receptor gene from brown fat cells to white fat cells in mice, they were able to initiate the "browning" process and energy burning in white fat cells. the mice lost weight as a result, leading the researchers to suggest that adenosine-a2a signalling plays a critical role in brown fat activation and can potentially be used as a new approach to treating obesity. however, further investigation and clinical application are still needed.
2946	wigan athletic suffered a 1-0 loss to sheffield wednesday at the dw stadium, with grant holt's suspected cruciate knee ligament injury taking center stage. the 33-year-old striker, who was hoping to help wigan's faltering attack, was loaned to huddersfield but sustained the injury in a game against rotherham on boxing day. he is now expected to be out for 9-12 months, leaving wigan manager malky mackay mourning the loss of a key player. the latics ended 2014 in the bottom three of the sky bet championship after their third straight home loss. sheffield wednesday's adrew nuhiu scored the winning goal for the owls.
2947	ed balls's proposal to reinstate the 50p top tax rate to fund labour's policies has been met with skepticism from tax experts and business leaders. the institute for fiscal studies said it would raise "little revenue" and make only a "marginal contribution" to reducing the budget deficit. clothing tycoon richard caring accused balls of extreme socialist nonsense, and warned it would be impossible for labour to secure future funding from wealthy individuals. the number of business leaders opposing the plan now stands at 31, including london's tech city chairman jo shields. boris johnson called on the chancellor to cut the top tax rate to 40p to boost the economy, while david cameron insisted his decision to lower it to 45p was the best for the country. ed miliband defended the plans as fair, but shadow business secretary chuka umunna clarified that it would only be a temporary measure.
2948	matthew and liz deane experienced persistent toilet paper throwing at their utah home in oakley, causing frustration and vulnerability. when teens were caught, the deane family asked them to donate the rolls instead of pressing charges. with the campaign spreading on social media, they have received over 1,000 rolls, all of which will be donated to the kamas food bank.
2949	cleethorpes pier in lincolnshire, england is up for sale for £400,000, offering new owners a business opportunity with its nightclub, 600-seat theater, cafe, and bar. the 335ft victorian pier, which opened in 1873, has gone through numerous redevelopments since world war i, including housing bingo and wrestling. the most recent owner, bryn ilsley, spent £200,000 on improvements but is selling to invest elsewhere. the historic pier, which boasts original cast iron pillars and solid oak floors, has been closed since earlier this month. it is located on the humber estuary, with views of shipping traffic and fortifications, and will be auctioned off by swindells auctioneers on february 2. the pier's future is uncertain, but the national piers society is optimistic that someone will buy and revive it.
2950	thusha kamaleswaran, a seven-year-old girl from london who was paralyzed by a stray bullet during a gang war in 2011, has defied doctors' predictions and started to stand again. thusha, who was dancing and skipping before the shooting, was never told about her paralysis by her parents to keep her hope alive. she appeared on itv's daybreak and expressed her desire to walk properly, dance, and play basketball with her friends. thusha's family was initially told that she would not survive and that if she did, she would be permanently paralyzed. however, she made remarkable progress at stoke mandeville hospital, where she underwent intensive physiotherapy to learn to walk again. thusha's determination and positive attitude have astonished doctors, who now believe she will walk again. she was shot in her uncle's shop in stockwell, south london, during gang crossfire, and three men have since been jailed for the shooting. thusha was kept alive on a life support machine for a week after the incident and had a 50-50 chance of survival.
2951	a seattle woman, julia stafford, survived a grizzly bear attack in alaska while working for a canadian mining company. she and a male colleague were collecting rock samples when the bear appeared with two cubs. they tried to escape, but the bear knocked them over and dragged stafford about 20 feet. she played dead and was released unharmed when the bear left. the incident occurred two days after a hiker was killed by a grizzly bear in denali national park, making it the first fatal bear mauling in the park's history. stafford sustained minor injuries, including cuts to her hand and scratch marks on her back, and will require surgery for a broken bone. the male colleague was unharmed.
2952	david cay johnston, a pulitzer prize-winning financial journalist and lecturer, was forced to retract his first column for reuters due to a significant error in a tax story about news corp. johnston claimed news corp received a $4.8 billion tax refund for the past four years, but he later admitted the error was the result of misunderstanding the company's reporting of negative and positive numbers in its annual reports since 2007. he expressed his regret and will do his best to correct any secondary reports based on his initial column. johnston has had a successful 45-year journalism career, including teaching at syracuse university college of law, and stated that this was the first time he had to write a retraction. he acknowledged that news corp does indeed make use of tax deferrals and has numerous subsidiaries in tax havens.
2953	the indianapolis colts, led by hall of fame quarterback peyton manning, had a culture of winning with multiple pro bowl players and 12-win seasons. however, when manning's neck injuries prevented him from playing during the 2011 season, the team struggled and finished the year with a 0-16 record. the colts' offense was built around manning, and without him, they were unable to compete. the team's best players, including reggie wayne, dallas clark, dwight freeney, and robert mathis, relied heavily on manning's leadership and playmaking abilities. the colts entered the season believing that manning would return within the first month, but he had to undergo a third neck surgery. in his absence, the team struggled, and there was speculation about whether manning would return or retire. the team is now in a unique situation, as they may have the opportunity to draft stanford quarterback andrew luck with the first pick in the draft. however, they also face the challenge of deciding whether to pay manning his $28 million option bonus and potentially keeping him for another year or letting him leave as a free agent. either option comes with significant financial and logistical challenges. the colts, who have a two-game lead in the race for the first pick, are facing the reality of a major roster overhaul and the end of the manning era.
2954	the aa is investigating reports of contaminated diesel fuel causing cars to become sluggish and lose power after filling up, particularly in the north east of england. a woman from ripon, north yorkshire, experienced this issue after filling up at a morrison's supermarket, but the supermarket was unaware of any related complaints. in 2007, a similar problem occurred due to a contaminated batch of fuel, causing widespread damage and compensation claims for affected drivers in the south east and east anglia. the source of the contamination was traced to a storage depot in thurrock, essex. the aa advises drivers to keep their receipts for potential reimbursement or compensation and to clean out affected fuel tanks and filters.
2955	igor zaripov, a circus performer also known as "mouth of steel," holds three world records for teeth-related stunts. he can pull a 12,360kg double-decker bus, pull a car 100ft in 15.7 seconds, and suspend himself by the teeth for 2 minutes and 32 seconds. zaripov, who is russian and works for cirque du soleil, believes speaking russian before performing makes his jaws stronger. he comes from a long line of circus performers dating back to 1893 and has developed his own fitness program, czar fitness, to help others boost their bodies and minds.
2956	former haitian dictator jean-claude "baby doc" duvalier, who returned to haiti after 25 years of exile in france, was questioned by a judge and had charges filed against him on tuesday. the specific charges were not immediately clear. duvalier is accused of pillaging the country, siphoning money from the treasury into his family's pockets during his rule from 1981 to 1986. thousands were killed and tortured, and hundreds of thousands of haitians fled into exile during his presidency. duvalier's presidency followed his father, francois "papa doc" duvalier, who ruled from 1957 to 1971. human rights groups have called for justice for atrocities committed during his rule. it is unclear why duvalier decided to return to haiti, but his presence added to the political turmoil sparked by a controversial presidential election. international monitors charged fraud in the election, and preliminary results placed former first lady mirlande manigat in a runoff with jude celestin, but a subsequent review put celestin in third place. duvalier held a cancelled news conference on monday and was taken into custody on tuesday, but it is unclear how long he plans to stay. the united nations and the u.s. have called for a peaceful resolution to the tensions and for accountability.
2957	a senior british diplomat, nicholas sutcliffe, and his daughter-in-law, kuntal patel, were the subjects of counter-terrorism raids over the weekend. sutcliffe's son, james, was arrested at their home in leafy streatham hill under counter-terrorism legislation, but was later released on bail with no further action taken against him. the family believes the raid may have been a mistake based on incorrect information. at another location in east london, patel's house was also raided, and her arrest is believed to be linked to the sutcliffe case. both individuals were arrested on suspicion of offenses under the anti-terrorism, crime and security act 2001. the met police have stated that public safety is a priority and there is no risk to the public in the immediate area. the family of sutcliffe, a first secretary to the foreign office, claimed that police messed up after a tip-off. dozens of officers spent four days searching the sutcliffe home and neighboring property for suspected chemical weapons.
2958	chelsea are set to appeal the red card shown to nemanja matic during their 1-1 draw with burnley on saturday. matic was sent off for pushing burnley's ashley barnes after a dangerous foul, which manager jose mourinho described as "criminal" and potentially career ending. the serbian midfielder could miss the capital one cup final against tottenham if the appeal is unsuccessful. mourinho criticized the referee for not punishing barnes for a horrid tackle earlier in the match, and matic's reaction earned him a straight red card. the appeal will be heard by a three-person disciplinary commission ahead of the final, and mourinho appeared on sky sports' "goals on sunday" to discuss his views on the incident. he argued that barnes' tackle could have ended matic's career and denounced it as criminal.
2959	a study conducted by psychologists and neuroscientists at the university of edinburgh found that taking breaks and resting after learning new information significantly improves long-term memory retention in elderly individuals, with implications for people of all ages. previous research has also shown that brief wakeful rests between learning and recalling information enhance memory. the neural processes that occur during rest are critical for memory consolidation and can happen automatically during idle time, as shown in studies on rats and humans. sleep is also crucial for memory consolidation, especially for procedural memory. in today's information-overloaded world, scheduling in rest periods may be essential for effective learning.
2960	the new iphone 5s from apple features a fingerprint sensor in its home button for added security. users must register their fingerprint with the device to unlock it. while some view this as an additional safeguard against hackers and thieves, concerns have been raised regarding privacy and potential hacking. experts believe that while there is a risk, it is unlikely that hackers will be able to bypass the fingerprint sensor easily, as it requires the specific tip print to unlock the phone. however, the use of fingerprints as a means of approval for purchases from itunes or the app store has raised concerns, as it may involve sending authentication tokens to apple servers. privacy concerns also exist regarding the potential for apple or its partners to misuse or leak users' fingerprint data, but apple has stated that the information will be securely encrypted and stored inside the phone's processor chip.
2961	west yorkshire police are investigating claims that on-duty officers visited late pedophile jimmy savile's weekly 'breakfast clubs' at his penthouse flat in leeds. the police had previously stated they had no information regarding officers attending savile's flat while off-duty. however, further inquiries are being made to better understand the relationship between the police and savile. the so-called 'friday morning club' reportedly involved serving and retired officers, as well as other guests. savile's friend and regular guest, howard silverman, described the club as a place where they put the world to rights and had a good laugh. the investigation is unrelated to the metropolitan police's operation yewtree investigation into savile's sexual abuse allegations and a separate ipcc probe into an unnamed officer's involvement in a 2009 surrey police inquiry on savile's behalf.
2962	kenya's government has agreed with the international criminal court (icc) to set up a local tribunal by july 2010 to prosecute those responsible for the post-election violence that erupted in december 2007, leaving nearly 1,500 people dead and hundreds of thousands displaced. the government reached this agreement to avoid having the icc take over the case. the delegation, led by kenya's attorney general, signed an agreement with the icc's chief prosecutor, luis moreno-ocampo, committing to providing a report on the current status of investigations and prosecutions. the icc will then carry out "preliminary examinations" of the case. former un secretary-general kofi annan had previously promised to submit a list of suspects to the icc if the kenyan government failed to establish a tribunal. the un had conducted an investigation, which called for the resignation of top kenyan officials and widespread reforms to end police unlawful killings and create an independent civilian police oversight body. the kenyan government expressed displeasure with the report, stating it infringed on the country's sovereignty. analysts express concerns about the potential for violence during the upcoming 2012 elections if significant reforms are not implemented.
2963	blackpool international airport, which opened in 1909 and is the uk's first aviation site, closed its doors on october 1, 2022, after years of financial difficulties. the last commercial flight departed for the isle of man at 5 pm, and the airport officially closed an hour later. the airport, which had 118 staff members and served 235,000 passengers in 2021, had faced losses of around £2m per year since being bought by balfour beatty in 2008. with a rich history, the airport had welcomed numerous celebrities and even royalty in its prime. notable moments included the arrival of popular singer rod stewart for a performance and a visit from britain's most famous female aviator, amy johnson, who flew from the airport to raf kidlington in 1941 on her final flight. nevertheless, the airport has had to close due to financial hardships, leaving many staff members out of work. the site will still operate flights to the irish sea gas rigs, but as a passenger airport, it has ceased to exist. blackpool council criticized balfour beatty for not doing enough to save the airport and is working on regeneration plans to create new opportunities for employment. the unite union is also in talks with management to find a way for independent aviation businesses and tenants to continue operating at the site.
2964	in the 2015 oscars, the red carpet saw a shift towards elegance, with actresses opting for sleek and glamorous looks. key trends included nude dresses, quiffed hairstyles, and masculine tailoring. nude dresses in various shades of blush and peach were a hit with stars like jennifer aniston, gwyneth paltrow, viola davis, and oprah winfrey. waist-slimming illusion panels and belts were also popular. many celebrities brought family members for moral support, such as patricia arquette with her sister rosanna, idris elba with his daughter isan, and laura dern with her father bruce dern. scandinavian-style embroidery was another trend, seen on emily mortimer, kelly osborne, and liberty ross. statement lips in bold reds and plums were a favored choice for lips. sheer or black lace gowns were another key trend, and stars opted for chic accessories. naomi watts and leslie mann switched to tailored suits for the after parties. old hollywood glamour was revived through intricate embellishments, as seen on emma stone and lupita nyong'o. quiffs, a hairstyle typically associated with the fonz, surprisingly made an appearance with scarlett johansson, rita ora, and cate blanchett.
2965	adrian durham expresses his disappointment in rio ferdinand's lack of leadership for manchester united this season despite his excellent football skills. ferdinand has been tweeting about trivial matters instead of being a role model for the team. ferguson once criticized ferdinand for prioritizing non-football activities over his career. ferdinand's partnership with nemanja vidic was one of the best center back pairings in the premier league. however, his leadership off the field has been lacking, and his absence on the field is not missed. newcastle united is missing its opportunity to build a successful team around yohan cabaye, who is expected to leave for psg. chelsea may regret selling juan mata to manchester united as they may not win any titles this season. there's a need for platforms like twitter to take a stronger stance against abusive comments and threats towards individuals, especially in football debates.
2966	arjen robben admitted diving in an attempt to win a penalty during holland's 2-1 victory over mexico in the world cup last-16 match. robben was tripped by mexico skipper rafael marquez in the 93rd minute, resulting in a controversial penalty that secured holland's progression to the quarter-finals. however, robben had also attempted to deceive the referee with two earlier penalty appeals, which were both denied before klaas-jan huntelaar scored the equalizer. mexico coach miguelle herrera was outraged and labeled robben a cheat. the referee, pedro proenca, faced criticism for his decision-making throughout the game, with mexico's coach and players expressing their dissatisfaction at full time. robben apologized for his actions and expressed his pride in the team's performance, while huntelaar celebrated the winning goal.
2967	in los angeles, former manager sam lutfi is suing britney spears' parents for defamation and breach of contract. lutfi claims spears' mother, lynne spears, portrayed him as a "predator" and "svengali" in her book, which he argues damaged his reputation. he testified in court that he had arranged for drug-detection dogs to search spears' home in 2007 and found a baggie of white powder, which they disposed of. lutfi denied giving spears drugs and testified he urged her to reconcile with her parents. he befriended spears in 2007 when she was dealing with personal and professional issues and became her manager. their management agreement was confirmed by text messages, and lutfi also managed the paparazzi surrounding spears, setting rules for them to maintain her privacy. the judge ruled against using spears' medical records in the trial. lutfi, who also co-manages courtney love and consults for his mother's gas station chain, is seeking millions in damages. spears herself is not testifying in the trial.
2968	santi cazorla, an arsenal midfielder, has praised chelsea's eden hazard and suggested that the belgian winger has the potential to become one of the best players in the world, even comparing him to lionel messi and cristiano ronaldo. hazard, who has scored six goals for chelsea this season and has been a crucial player for jose mourinho's side, was named by cazorla as the player he would start with due to his "spectacular" abilities and unique style of play. mourinho, however, has stated that chelsea's priority is not remaining undefeated, but rather winning trophies and taking risks to achieve victories. cazorla's endorsement adds to the growing recognition of hazard's talent, and the 24-year-old will be aiming to add to his goal tally when chelsea takes on tottenham on wednesday night.
2969	a couple, clayton john fischer (24) and hollie may fischer (21), from knoxville, iowa, have been charged with neglect and child endangerment after their four-month-old son was brought to the hospital with multiple traumatic injuries, including 14 fractured ribs, a dislocated hip, a fractured wrist, and a fractured femur. the parents' story did not align with the baby's injuries, leading to an investigation by authorities. the couple turned themselves in on monday after an arrest warrant was issued, and their son is no longer in their care. the pair married in april 2012 and welcomed their first child in march this year, and clayton had previously been arrested for public intoxication in january 2013.
2970	a rough sleeper in his 30s died after being impaled on railings outside david cameron's parish church, st mary abbots, in kensington. paramedics could not revive the man, and firefighters were called to free him from the scene. the death is currently unexplained but not suspicious, according to scotland yard. witnesses reported seeing police and emergency vehicles at the church, which is where the camerons worship and where their children were baptized and attend school. it is believed the man may have been trying to get into or out of the locked church gardens when the tragedy occurred. the church, which has an enviable reputation and mainly caters to families of professionals, has a memorial dedicated to former prime minister david cameron's late son ivan inside.
2971	hugh jackman, 44, remained unfazed and went about his business in new york city a day after a stalker threw a razor filled with her pubic hair at him during a workout session at his gym. the woman, identified as kathleen thurston, 47, was arrested and charged with stalking. this wasn't the first time jackman encountered thurston, who had previously approached his daughter's school and his home. despite being shaken, jackman expressed concern for his family's safety and hoped the woman receives help. jackman is currently preparing for his next role as wolverine in james mangold's "the wolverine" and bryan singer's "x-men: days of future past."
2972	john zadrozny, a former science teacher at a girls high school in thailand, stood out from the norm by encouraging and contributing to his students' doodles on exam papers. he announced that if students left a doodle, he would return the favor with one of his own using his signature red pen, but only after they completed the work first. zadrozny's unique approach quickly won over his students and gained him a following when he started posting his doodles on tumblr, receiving hundreds of thousands of hits. the fun and interactive doodles helped establish discipline while also allowing for greater connection between zadrozny and his students. despite leaving teaching to pursue a career in malaria research, zadrozny still misses the joy of interacting with his students through doodling.
2973	toulon secured a dominating 23-13 win over ulster in the european champions cup, with tries from bryan habana and delon armitage, and significant contributions from steffon armitage and juan smith. ulster's bid for the last eight is looking uncertain after the defeat. in the opening minutes, leigh halfpenny missed a wind-assisted penalty for toulon, but landed one seven minutes later. ulster scored their first points through paddy jackson's penalty, but the french side responded with tries from habana on the stroke of half-time and armitage in the second half, both converted by halfpenny. ulster pressured toulon towards the end of the game, but error-prone play led to armitage intercepting a pass and scoring a decisive try. craig gilroy scored a consolation try for ulster, but it was not enough to close the gap significantly. toulon played with a strong team, with influential performances from steffon armitage, juan smith, and matt giteau (before his injury). the first half included multiple scoring opportunities missed by both teams, as well as penalties and illegal tackles. ulster faced challenges due to injuries, including those to chris henry and rob herring, which impacted their performance.
2974	pepsico has ended its business relationship with rapper lil wayne due to his offensive reference to emmett till, a revered civil rights icon, in his song "karate chop" by future. till, a 14-year-old african american boy who was tragically killed in mississippi in 1955 after being accused of whistling at a white woman, became a symbol of racial injustice. his brutal killing and mutilated body, which was identified through a monogrammed ring, shocked the nation. lil wayne's offensive line in the song did not align with mountain dew's brand values, resulting in the terminated partnership. the rapper's publicist, sarah cunningham, confirmed the separation, stating that it was due to creative differences. reverend al sharpton set up a meeting between pepsico officials and members of the till family to discuss the situation, viewing it as an opportunity to educate lil wayne, corporations, and the public about the significance of emmett till and the need for sensitivity in our culture. the till family could not be reached for comment.
2975	edgar froese, the founder of the groundbreaking german electronic rock band tangerine dream in 1967, passed away unexpectedly at the age of 70 on tuesday, december 7, 2021, in vienna due to the effects of a pulmonary embolism. born on d-day, june 6, 1944, in the east prussian town of tilsit (now sovetsk), froese was the only constant member of tangerine dream and had previously studied art and sculpture in berlin, where the band was formed. the band went on to release over 100 albums and soundtracks, and produced music for hollywood hits like tom cruise's "risky business" and the video game "grand theft auto v". tangerine dream's distinctive sound, which shares similarities with pink floyd, is credited with influencing the later emergence of trance, ambient, and electronica. froese was married to artist monique froese from 1974 until her death in 2000, and their son was a member of tangerine dream from 1990 to 2006. froese held a philosophical view that "there is no death, there is just a change of our cosmic address."
2976	four unsuspecting individuals were subjected to an elaborate prank in which they were asked to cover up a violent crime and hide evidence for a loved one. using actors posing as police, hidden cameras, and secret microphones, the friends were told their friend was in trouble and needed their help. they willingly hid bundles of cash and incriminating evidence, but when the police arrived, all lied about their whereabouts of the friend. two were taken away for questioning, while the others tried to escape. the truth was revealed when they were met by the pranksters. the experiment was conducted to promote the new drama series "how to get away with murder." a recent survey revealed that one-third of britons would be willing to do jail time for a loved one and over half would lie to the police. the survey showed that people are most likely to break the law for their children, followed by their partner and parents. men were more likely than women to protect their spouse. behavioural psychologist emma kenny explained that humans have a strong instinct to protect loved ones from danger, but the lines between right and wrong are becoming blurred in today's society.
2977	video footage from the 2012 costa concordia disaster allegedly showscaptain francesco schettino calmly waiting for a lifeboat while hundreds of passengers were still trapped on board. this contradicts schettino's claims that he fell into the raft amid chaotic scenes. prosecutors are using the video as evidence against him at his manslaughter trial for 32 deaths caused by the shipwreck. the footage shows schettino looking relaxed near a lifeboat, while he previously claimed he had tripped and stumbled into it. however, the appearance in the footage has not been independently verified, and schettino faces accusations of fatally delaying the evacuation and abandoning his ship. he defends his decision to delay the evacuation, believing it would have caused panic among passengers. the costa concordia, a 115,000-tonne cruise liner, hit rocks near the italian island of giglio and claimed 32 lives. schettino denies radioing for tow boats out of financial concerns, insisting he put human lives before cost. he began giving evidence at his trial in 2013, denying responsibility for recklessly steering the ship close to the island and blaming his subordinates for the deadly course. prosecutors seek a 20-year prison sentence for schettino. a key part of his defense will be the failure of back-up generators causing the total loss of power, which he cannot be held responsible for.
2978	the first editions of the brothers grimm fairy tales, released in 1812, contained darker versions of children's stories than what is commonly known today. in these original tales, rapunzel became pregnant after having a "merry time" with her prince, and her stepsisters tried to cut off parts of their feet to fit into cinderella's slipper. hansel and gretel's biological mother abandoned them in the forest, and snow white's real mother ordered the huntsman to kill her and bring back her lungs and liver as proof. the grimm brothers changed the stories in later editions due to societal influences, such as motherhood and stepsister jealousy during the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. jack zipes, a professor emeritus of german and comparative literature, translated and published the complete first edition of the grimm tales last month, maintaining that changes made to the tales in later editions did not diminish their worth and that they originated from various sources. zipes' book offers insight into how the collection has evolved over time, with around 50 tales being either deleted or heavily revised by the seventh edition in 1857.
2979	a female american tourist was injured in a bombing at the five-star traders hotel in central rangoon, burma, on october 14, 2013. the bomb, which was attached to a clock in the bathroom, went off just before midnight, wounding the woman in her thigh and hand. her husband and their two young children, who were in the main room at the time, miraculously escaped injury. the explosion was powerful enough to damage the room and send debris into the hallway. three men, including the last person to stay in the room, have been detained in connection with the bombing. other explosions have occurred in different parts of the country, resulting in several deaths and injuries. government officials believe that groups opposed to democratic reforms may be behind the attacks, as myanmar prepares to host the association of southeast asian nations (asean) summit and a regional sports event. the hotel is part of the shangri-la group and is popular with foreign tourists and business people. the u.s. embassy is providing consular assistance to the injured american woman. police are urging the public to be vigilant for suspicious packages in market places, bus stops, and railway stations.
2980	mayor futoshi toba of rikuzentakata in japan's iwate prefecture lost his wife in last year's tsunami but as a single father of two and the city's leader, he doesn't have time to grieve. toba's daily routine includes driving his sons to schools untouched by the disaster, while avoiding his old house where his wife perished. as mayor, toba is overwhelmed by the task of rebuilding downtown rikuzentakata, with damage estimated at $1.6 billion. he has laid out an eight-year reconstruction plan and urges residents, including nurse fumiko suzuki, who lost her home and relatives, to stay. suzuki, who has continued to work in a temporary hospital, shares toba's sentiment, saying "one year isn't enough to heal." toba puts his job as mayor before being a father, finding solace in his work.
2981	the size of economy seats on airplanes is becoming a significant issue with the increasing number of overweight and obese adults in the uk, which is now approximately 64%. the average economy class seat is around 17 inches wide, but it can be too narrow for larger passengers, causing discomfort for neighboring passengers. george hobica, founder of airfarewatchdog.com, proposes a solution by suggesting airlines install one or two rows of wider economy seats, with around eight inches more width, to accommodate larger passengers. hobica argues that this would be fairer than requiring passengers to purchase an additional seat or refusing boarding. there have been various proposals and controversies in the past regarding reducing seat sizes or introducing a "fat tax" for obese passengers. a survey by skyscanner showed that 48% of respondents were in favor of overweight passengers paying extra to board their flights.
2982	icelandic women's rights activist hildur lilliendahl viggósdóttir was banned from facebook for 30 days after reposting a death threat directed at her on her own wall. the threat was originally made by a facebook user named stefán heiðar erlingsson in response to viggósdóttir's album "men who hate women," which features screenshots of sexist comments. erlingsson's threat was set to be publicly visible, but facebook considered viggósdóttir's reposting a violation of their terms, which prohibit users from taking screenshots and reposting other users' content without permission. the ban has sparked outrage in iceland, with many expressing shock that facebook allows users to post death threats but denies victims the right to repost them. facebook defended their actions, stating that their rules are in place to prevent bullies from using screenshots to bypass privacy settings. a petition against the rule has gained nearly 1,500 signatures.
2983	brendan rodgers believes raheem sterling will continue his impressive progress and become a fear factor for opposing teams this season. the 19-year-old liverpool winger, who has been tipped for the pfa young player of the year award, thrived under rodgers' guidance last season and impressed during pre-season. sterling's maturity and confidence have grown, making teams wary of him, with rodgers likening him to lionel messi in terms of his ability to create goals. liverpool's adam lallana is also making progress in his recovery from a knee ligament injury and could return to action at the start of next month.
2984	the rosetta comet, officially named 67p/churyumov-gerasimenko, has been observed in various shades of grey since its discovery, but its true color remained a mystery. the max planck institute in germany has now released the first color image of the comet, revealing it to be a dark grey shade, similar to previous images but with no visible ice on the surface. the image was created by combining red, blue, and green wavelengths from rosetta's main camera (osiris) and is similar to how colors are combined on computer and tv monitors. rosetta, which carried the philae lander, launched into space in 2004 and took over ten years to chase down the comet before entering its orbit in 2014. despite the successful landing of philae on the comet, the harpoons designed to attach the lander failed, causing it to bounce before settling on the surface. it was later discovered that the water on the comet is different from earth's water, suggesting that water on our planet may have originated from an asteroid rather than a comet. the osiris camera has several color filters, but single-filter images are usually used for scientific purposes. according to the principal investigator of the osiris instrument, dr. holger sierks, it took a long time to obtain a meaningful color image due to the need for precise image alignment.
2985	madeleine shaw, best friend and health guru of millie mackintosh, suggests incorporating a daily green juice into one's diet for various health benefits, including energy boost, workout fuel, and improved sleep. madeleine, a nutritionist, emphasizes the importance of freshly made juice and warns against relying on shop-bought juices due to their long shelf life and nutrient loss. she shares seven juice recipes for achieving optimum health, including a classic cleanse, glowing greens, pre-workout, 4pm pick-me-up, stir & purr sleep tonic, watermelon cooler, and hangover helper juices. each juice contains specific ingredients for their respective benefits.
2986	amanda berry, who went missing in 2003 when she was 14, made an emotional 911 call after escaping from a house where she had been held captive for a decade along with gina dejesus and michelle knight. in the call, berry told the operator that she had been kidnapped and was free, pleading for immediate assistance. she gave her address as 2207 seymour and identified her captor as ariel castro, a 52-year-old hispanic man. the dispatcher sent the police to the scene, and berry's escape led to the discovery of dejesus and knight, who had also been held captive. castro and his two brothers were later arrested in connection with the kidnappings.
2987	angel di maria and his family, including wife jorgelina cardoso and one-year-old daughter mia, were victims of a terrifying burglary at their cheshire home on saturday night as the manchester united forward was watching tv with them. the intruders used metal poles to attempt to break in through patio doors, with di maria and his family quickly evacuated by bodyguards. di maria and his teammates checked into the lowry hotel in manchester ahead of united's fa cup replay against cambridge united on tuesday, with the family believed to be 'very shaken up' by the incident. united have provided the star with round-the-clock security following the break-in. di maria, who joined united from real madrid in 2014, has made 14 appearances for the club and scored three goals. the argentine international, who began his career at rosario central, played for benfica and real madrid before arriving at old trafford, has also made 57 appearances for the argentine national team and scored 11 goals. di maria's team-mate luke shaw says united have made winning the fa cup a priority in order to end the year with silverware.
2988	a 30-year-old man named "bobo" sent a viral breakup text to his two-month girlfriend from sydney, listing six reasons why they should end their relationship. reasons included her rudeness towards his cat and her frequent use of foul language. the woman, who remains unidentified, found the message laughable and had already moved on. they met at a pub and the woman thought bobo was a decent guy, but when she received the text before a friend's wedding, she sent it to a friend who shared it on social media. the woman, who is allergic to cats, also expressed her dislike for them and vowed to never date someone with a pet cat again.
2989	a new study reveals that the ideal body weight and size for women in the uk is unusually small, with over 90% of respondents, both male and female, regarding weights over 10 stone (140 lbs) and sizes above 14 as undesirable. davina mccall, the duchess of cambridge, and holly willoughby were voted as having the most desired celebrity bodies, while men prefer toned arms, broad shoulders, masculine features, apert bottoms, and non-receding hairlines. the study also found that while 46% of the population intends to diet as part of their new year's resolutions, only a small number will participate in "dry january" and give up alcohol. the survey suggests men are more accepting of larger body sizes than women, but the emphasis on a healthy weight should shift away from the number on the scales towards a focus on overall well-being.
2990	the article discusses the increasing demand for services at maryhouse, a daytime homeless shelter in sacramento, california. connie frank, the executive director, connects homeless women with social services, including the women, infants, and children (wic) program, which provides food and essentials for children and pregnant or postpartum women. last year, 1,250 children and their families sought help from maryhouse, a 29% increase. this demand comes as the house of representatives plans to cut wic by 10% as part of the 2011 federal budget. despite objections from democrats and wic advocates, republicans have passed further budget cuts to programs such as planned parenthood, arts programs, and heating subsidies for low-income households. the obama administration has threatened to veto any spending bill that cuts essential services. if wic is cut, it will be the first time the program has been reduced solely for ideological reasons. the program ran a surplus in 2011, and the unused funds could be used to partially fill any potential reduction. the commitment to keep the program funded remains strong, but the future of this bipartisan support is uncertain.
2991	elba island in italy celebrated the 200th anniversary of napoleon bonaparte's arrival on sunday with reenactments and festivities. napoleon, who was exiled to elba following his forced abdication in 1814, is fondly remembered by locals for his positive impact on the island. major attractions on elba include two of his former residences, villa dei mulini and villa napoléonica di san martino, now museums. annual reenactments for the bicentennial include an exhibition of napoleon's large field tent, the napoleon's regatta yacht race, and a walking festival. elba is a popular vacation destination, and budget accommodations like albergo ape elbana, which once welcomed napoleon's guests, are of interest to tourists.
2992	saif al-islam gaddafi, son of former libyan dictator muammar gaddafi, has had his thumb and forefinger amputated while in solitary confinement without legal counsel, facing corruption and war crimes charges. human rights groups have raised concerns over his treatment. gaddafi's death has spurred demands for an international criminal court inquiry from his daughter aisha, who alleges he was murdered and his body was disrespected against islamic law. saif's trials could begin in january, but his access to family and lawyers is limited. foreign secretary william hague has voiced support for an international trial for gaddafi, and the libyan government is expected to cooperate with the international criminal court.
2993	shana dowdeswell, a 23-year-old broadway actress, died five days after a late-night drinking session at the basement bar in new york city. her mother, laurie smith, has criticized the bar for serving her daughter excessive alcohol and claims she confronted staff about her intoxicated state. shana, who had acted since the age of eight and was described as having a "bright spirit," had been a regular at the bar. her blood alcohol content was reportedly 0.39 at the time of her death, five times the legal limit for driving. the medical examiner ruled her death as due to natural causes caused by acute and chronic alcoholism. the bar manager denies serving shana too much alcohol. her mother now calls for stricter regulations on bars serving drunk patrons and plans to launch a campaign group, "mothers against overdrinking."
2994	the ringling bros. and barnum & bailey circus in atlanta, georgia, hosted a "blind-touch tour" for visually impaired pre-school children. the event allowed the children to experience the circus up close, including interacting with performers and trying out props. among the children was three-year-old eli hummer, who played a harmonica with an asian elephant and tried on clown noses. other activities included touching circus costumes, playing with large umbrellas, and sitting on an oversized motorcycle. the children were prepared for the experience in the classroom, where they tried on clown shoes and costumes and listened to elephant sounds. teachers believed that, as most early learning comes through vision, engaging the children's other senses would help them understand the world around them. the children were excited to participate in this unique experience designed specifically for them.
2995	the nfl draft took place amidst ongoing labor disputes between the league and the players, with fans expressing their eagerness for football's return. the nfl announced the resumption of offseason activities after two court losses, but significant hurdles remain before a full agreement is reached. the case is now heading to the eighth circuit court of appeals, with a ruling expected to take at least two months. the owners were critical of the players' lawsuit in a wall street journal letter, but the players have the upper hand in this legal battle. if a stay isn't granted, the nfl would need to establish interim rules and could begin signing players as early as monday. newly drafted players, such as auburn quarterback cam newton, will have to wait and see when they can start their nfl careers. fans should start worrying if the labor issues drag into late august, with the possibility of missed games. the best-case scenario is for both sides to return to negotiations and make real concessions. the dispute began when the owners opted out of the collective bargaining agreement and asked players to give back $1 billion.
2996	an elderly new jersey resident, drew kanevsky, received a miniature personal drone for christmas and attempting to use it resulted in an unintentional collision with his own face, causing amusement among his family. personal drones were a popular gift this holiday season, but many users have struggled to fly them successfully, resulting in incidents such as drones getting stuck in trees, lost, broken, or causing injuries. the federal aviation administration reported an increase in drone-related incidents in 2014, with the trend expected to continue.
2997	a celebrity finance expert and multi-millionaire named greg secker, who is the founder of 'learn to trade' and a prized finalist in several awards, was caught by police performing a sex act while driving his £300,000 lamborghini aventador. secker, who was described as a 'master trader, entrepreneur, philanthropist, and international speaker' on his website, pleaded guilty to driving without due care and attention. the charge of drink-driving against him was dropped due to insufficient evidence, as his urine alcohol level was 148 milligrams, over the legal limit. secker, a father-of-three from oxshott, accepted his behavior as "extremely foolish," and was fined £1,000 with costs, a victim surcharge, and five penalty points. secker, who has always loved speed and was a young rally car driver, became a multi-millionaire by his twenties and is known for his success in business and high-profile associates.
2998	oregon governor john kitzhaber announced on friday that his fiancée, cylvia hayes, will have no role in his administration for the remainder of his fourth term due to concerns over her consulting work. hayes, who has been involved in kitzhaber's previous administration and advocated for environmental and clean energy policies, has faced scrutiny since it was discovered that she may not have properly reported income from consulting organizations. kitzhaber and hayes file taxes separately, and the governor refused to discuss her tax returns. hayes traveled to sweden and later to berlin for work-related meetings funded by an organization promoting the use of happiness to evaluate economies and public policies. the oregon government ethics commission opened a preliminary investigation into hayes' consulting work following three complaints. kitzhaber previously defended her work and their efforts to separate her private consulting from public duties, but has now decided to remove her from any role in the administration. the controversy comes as kitzhaber faces an ambitious legislative agenda on education and climate change. hayes has been under scrutiny for her consulting work and past personal life, including an illegal marriage in the 1990s and undisclosed income.
2999	deputy children's commissioner sue berelowitz has raised concerns that opening family courts to public scrutiny could cause children to take their own lives due to the potential exposure of their names and troubled lives. in a controversial speech against transparency, berelowitz, who has worked with distressed children throughout her career, shared her belief that it is only a matter of time before a child's death results from this "deeply misguided" motion. the comments were met with astonishment from campaigners for open justice, with some questioning her reasoning. sir roderick newton, a high court judge, argued for openness and scrutiny, stating that family courts should be transparent to ensure accountability and maintain public trust. despite a history of controversial comments, berelowitz has warned the children's commissioner of an upcoming protest to the un children's rights committee regarding closed family courts, and this issue has sparked an ongoing dispute among judges, lawyers, and social workers. however, campaigners for transparency emphasize they do not seek to identify children within family proceedings, which remains contempt of court.
3000	the iphone 6 has been named the fastest smartphone on the market according to tests conducted by which? magazine using geekbench 3 software. the iphone 6 and iphone 6 plus, both with dual-core 1.4ghz a8 processors, outperformed competitors such as samsung galaxy s5, htc one, and lg g3, with single cores scoring 1,467 and 1,437 respectively, and multi-core scores of 2,929 and 2,775. last year, the iphone 5s was the fastest with a multi-core speed of 3,971, highlighting the rapid advancements in mobile technology. upcoming releases like the samsung galaxy note 4 and sony experia z3 are expected to challenge apple's lead, as both feature quad-core processors. the tests focused solely on processing speed and did not evaluate the quality of cameras or screens.
